name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: Good location in the middle of the city. Catch a taxi right out front no waiting.  Three computers and tv to use in the lounge area. Free wifi and breakfast from 7 am to 1 pm.  Each dorm has a bathroom with shower plus an extra bathroom next door. Daily activities and a rooftop social area. Laundry facilities and storage area. Lots of space for eating and fridges to use. Staff friendly and informative. Phones available. Key card gives you 24 hrs access and staff is there 7 am to 12 am(midnight).

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: Secure, good staff, good atmosphere, lovely view of CN tower from a roof terrace, nightly events, cheap laundry, late checkout and breakfast runs until 1pm, also very clean. Only negatives are lack of large lockers, and given the high price no oven, no bins in the room except the bathroom, no mats on the floor in the ensuite and all communal areas including the kitchen shut at midnight, minor things but worth mentioning given it's expensive

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext:
Clean, very friendly staff and free activities every evening. 
Additionally, the hostel is in a good location.

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: This is the first and only time I stay at a hostel in Canada so I can't comment if Planet Traveler lives to the expectation of "Best Hostel in Canada".  I have stayed at hostels in Europe and Asia and I could easily recall some better hostel experience.   Being spontaneous is one of the beauty of staying at a hostel.  I could get my needs met without the help from a staff at most hostels I have stayed at but not this one.

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: Planet Traveller provided everything a tourist could want; a great location, a safe and comfortable home, and an opportunity to meet like-minded adventurers. The staff were brilliant from the get-go and we were given a very thorough tour of the building as well as plenty of advice on the staffs' favourite pubs and attractions. The hostel hosts little activities each night which is a great way to meet other guests! The only downside is the noise of the doors and building. Ear plugs are necessary.

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: Perhaps one of the best hostels in the world.

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: Very nice hostel with ample security and amenities. The only thing I didn't care for was one person in the staff was standoffish and rude. Other than that this place is awesome.

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: Thanks for everything!

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: The atmosphere was great! Nice place to meet fellow travelers, activities at night are really nice and the staff is super friendly! Nice cooking facilities plus they let your bring your own alcohol which is also really nice, bathrooms are always clean and so are the rooms, plus they have AC! The only little downside is the beds are a bit squeaky but other than that an amazing place!! Would go back anytime

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: The best place in Toroto.

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: Loved this place. Very clean, staff helpful and accommodating. Breakfast in the morning is great. Smaller kitchen but okay. Rooftop is great but can get crowded. Right in Kensington market, another hostel is next door that looks very run down. Rooms are a bit tiny but have separate locker area and bathroom which is nice. Only weird thing was the AC in my room, not sure if they had central air but we had a big unit just sitting ontop of stacked chairs? Was just odd.

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: Great hostel with lots of cool places in the area. Staff is very friendly and hosts events. Rooftop has beautiful views of the city. Very clean and well equipped

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: Absolutely amazing. Lived staying there. Shame that I had to bounce earlier than expected

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: Fantastic hostel with a great atmosphere. Also in a perfect location in Toronto. Will definitely recommend this to my fellow travelers.

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: Incredible hostel.

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: I had so much fun! thanks for the wonderful stay Planet Traveler!

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: Great hostel. Nice location, nice common area including a rooftop with a view of the skyline, great staff. :)

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext:
Great great place
Very clean
Nice people
Awsome rooftop with Downtown view
Nice events every days...
Definitely worth it

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: Really nice hostel with great staff. The only minus - rooms are quite small and crowded. But with good weather and few luggage no problem

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: There wasn't a moment of quiet, the bunk beds were too close, uncomfortable & creaky, the naked (lower half) homeless guy in the parking area, the staff who enjoyed making beds constantly, randomly deactivated key card, the expensive rate for a hostel, deactivated entry card etc. Other hostel patrons were bothered & couldn't sleep so periodic complaints at night. Pretty sure there are many fake ratings for this hostel done by bots or something. Awful, total waste of money, very disrespectful!

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: Best hostel in Canada with the best staff.

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: Perfect rooftop, staff very polite and nice, rooms clean but beds kind of noisy, great location!

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: The staff there are fantastic. Shout out to Alex and Augustine. It is safe. There are three locks to go through to get to your dorm. It is clean. I've seen the employees cleaning. Location was perfect right by China Town where there is many vendors and men dressed as dragons. The hostel has activities going on within. They have a beautiful rooftop overlooking Toronto. Everything was wonderful. Great job Planet Taveler!

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: Hostel is nice but the rooms are so small

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: Lovely stay and a great environment, conveniently located

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: Das beste Hostel, in dem ich jemals Ã¼bernachtet habe - sehr sauber, moderne BÃ¤der, top Lage, eine traumhafte Dachterrasse, sehr gutes FrÃ¼hstÃ¼ck und super Mitarbeit!! Ich wÃ¼rde hier jederzeit wieder Ã¼bernachten!!

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: a bit too cold in the room sometimes because the air conditioner is running permanently, and if you stop it, it turns itself on after a while

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: Best hostel I've ever stayed at !! Staff extremely welcoming. Felt secure at all times. Amazing roof top with skyline view and very social. Would 100% recommend.

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext:
Brilliant hostel, good location, good staff, friendly and sociable atmosphere, parking, organised trips and pub crawls etc, would highly recommend.

Only downside they only allow minimum 2 nights stay, would have liked to have stayed again the night before my flight home.

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: Good option for a private room, although it is quite noisy even past 23 hrs.

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: I would come back

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: Everything was 10/10! The location is perfect, we could walk everywhere, the rooftop patio had an amazing view and the place was spotless. The staff were all nice and super helpful and having free breakfast until 1pm us so rare at a hostel, it was such a treat!

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: Great hostel. Nice staff and atmosphere. They always have something going on like karaoke, movie night and trivia... I just thought that the subway station was a little bit far (15 min walk). Other than that... awesome.

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: The staff was super duper friendly and accommodating during my stay!  they answered all my questions and they provided breakfast daily and internet access.  Their rooftop is also very lovely and they always had fun activities lined for each day!

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext:
Perfect for solo travellers! 
Staff are so helpful and always available for questions, facilities are great, kitchen and laundry available, hostel hosts something every night so easy to meet people, breakfast included, rooms have good storage and lockers, bathrooms clean, linen clean, perfect location for food joints and easy transport everywhere!

Only downsides were the beds were quite squeaky and it gets very warm even with aircon, but this wouldnt stop me booking there again!

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: This is a really well run hostel. The only downside is that the rooms are really small but everything else is incredible. The closest hostel experience to a hotel that I've had. Great activities, beautiful rooftop, excellent breakfast situation and all the staff and lovely and really professional. 100% recommend. :-)

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: Fantastic hostel and staff are great

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext:
The good: 
-location
-vibe/the other travellers it attracts 
-the breakfast 
-the cleanliness
-the staff 

The meh: 
-hard pillows 
-my room had no air con, just two fans, so it was rather hot 
-having a working bar would be helpful as the liquor stores close so early 

Overall: 
Really lovey hostel, would definitely recommend to others

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: I would certainly recommend the Planet Traveller Hostel in Calgary. The staff were friendly & helpful, the free breakfast had everything you would want - cereals, fruit, breads, the facilities were very clean and location was very central. There was a good buzz around the place with the roof top area and events put on each evening. I felt safe & comfortable staying there which is all you can ask for when visiting a new city for the first time. Thumbs up from me for Toronto & the Planet Traveller

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: My 1st time doing anything like this. Hostel staff were very friendly and helpful. The hostel was already very clean and had brilliant facilities, there was always something to do in the evenings, from bar crawls to a film night in the rooftop! Would definitely recommend!!!

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: Excellent hostel in an ideal location for Kensington Market, Chinatown and within easy access to the rest of Toronto's best bits. Really great facilities, including the balcony bar, free breakfasts and affordable private rooms.

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: Overall I really enjoyed this place! Very clean and well kept. Evening activities posted on each floor, and announced when you're checking in as well. Breakfast spread is just bagels, bananas and cereal, so plan accordingly if you want a more hearty meal. Would definitely recommend! They book up fast though, so book early!

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: Unfortunately my room was a bit dirty and the personal space is a bit limited. The staff is great though and the rooftop offers a great view over downtown.

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: Great attention of the staff, incredible rooftop, very neat and clean, located near cool bars to go and have something to drink, cool activities that promotes the interaction between people.

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext:
I have only good stuff to tell you, from the great staff, the awesome rooftop, and also all the organized fun (a HIIT-workout at a hostel is the best idea ever!).
Visit, enjoy.

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: In a great location close to Kensington with cool bars and shops! Don't lose your key card because front desk closes around midnight! Breakfast is served 'til 1pm so really handy if you're a late riser! The area is safe, hip, and easily accessible! They have a nice rooftop deck with views of the city and a great place to socialize with other travelers!

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: Solid hostel. Beds were loud but other than that really no issues. The patio is amazing and you have everything you need. Would stay again.

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: Had a great stay; the staff is helpful and friendly, breakfast is until one pm, with plenty of options and the rooms and especially the bathrooms are modern and clean.

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: Literally the best hostel I have stayed in, on my whole trip around the world! Everything about hostels that is annoying they have flipped it and made it great! I would highly recommend to anyone!

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: Awesome place to stay. Everyone is extremely polite and friendly and all the facilities are great. Best place to meet travellers

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: One of the best hostels i've stayed in world wide. Not the cheapest but 10/10 in every other department so I suppose you get what you pay for! Alex who works at reception is top bloke!

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: Had a fab stay at Planet Traveller. Really friendly staff and guests. Worth the higher price as breakfast is extensive and facilities are great/hostel is extremely clean! Thank you for such a great stay!

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: Hostelworld needs another category for evaluating hostels: Environmental Sustainability.  Planet Traveler Hostel is the most "Green" of any of the lodgings with electricity I've ever stayed in. I've stayed in Eco-lodgings in several developing countries (e.g., Nicaragua, Ecuador, So. Africa) that had no access to electricity from the grid), but very pleasant. This hostel is a terrific way to enjoy reducing your carbon footprint as a traveler.  Then try to green up your way of life at home.

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: This hostel was all around great! I highly recommend staying here, as it was very clean and the staff was very friendly.  The breakfast has so many choices and is around until 1 pm.  Also, the rooftop is a great place to hang and enjoy the view. Stay here!!!

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext:
Amazing hostel, breakfast til 1pm, activities on the rooftop every evening (great views from up there!) 
I met loads of like-minded people - breakfast area is perfect place to get chatting and making new friends! The hostel helped us organise a day trip to Niagara Falls and recommended how to get to Toronto islands - just ask! Appreciated the plug and light on the actual bed and air con in the room.
Do not hestitiate, definitely book to stay here if you are visiting Toronto!

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: Its definitely worth the price!

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext:
I really enjoyed my stay at planet traveller! It's really easy to make new friends as a solo traveller with the evening entertainment and the communal areas.

The room itself was very clean, the staff are really friendly and helpful and the location is amazing! 

Other hostels I've stayed in in a Canada has nothing on planet traveller and I can't wait to go back!

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: The planet traveller hostel was great! The atmosphere is great and the staff are always happy to have a chat or help you organise plans for your holiday. The Niagara Falls trip they offer is amazing value for money and comes highly recommended. The area is very walkable and there are public transport options if you prefer. A fantastic stay!

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext:
Great hostel!  Maybe rooms are a bit small for 6 beds and maybe breakfast could be improved a bit but this is just to be picky ðŸ˜€ 
Recommended !

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: I had a fantastic time!!

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: Great hostel manned by helpful and attentive staff. Good location close to Kensington market and the tram line. The dorm I stayed at was a little cramped but very clean and with comfortable beds. What's great about this hostel is that they have events on every night at the hostel rooftop so is great for solo travellers. The only small gripe I had is that all communal areas closed at midnight sharp so you were forced to the dorms after this time. Overall,an excellent hostel though and recommended

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: Had a wonderful stay at this hostel. The staff were super friendly and always happy to help, the place was kept very clean and there was a very welcoming, safe atmosphere. Location couldn't be better, right near Kensington market which is perfect for food and bars and also not too far to walk to other areas of the city. Would highly recommend this hostel to anyone staying for a short or long period.

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: Best hostel in Toronto

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: Great facilities and fun vibe (the nightly organized events helped to meet other guests). It's right around the corner from Kensington market and an easy walk to the waterfront, and the staff were really helpful with tips on what to see! Would definitely stay here again if back in Toronto.

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: This hostel was amazing the view from the rooftop, alot of things to see close by. Had a great time.

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: Visited Toronto for Canada Day weekend and was happy to find availability at Planet Traveler since I'd read a lot of favorable reviews about it beforehand. The view from the rooftop is amazing, everything is clean, staff are friendly and location is quite central to downtown. Also the other travelers were quite sociable, so that was a plus for me since I was traveling solo. I would definitely stay here again if I returned to TO

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: It was fantastic place to stay ,it was in the center Toronto able to get to anywhere by public transport or walking. The staff where really informative and helped you out for sites to see , along with with places to eat ,buy food and buy alcohol. They supplied lockers for putting any important stuff away , the WiFi was also really fast. The evening events was extremely fun and brought a lot of the guest together along having a fantastic roof top access and fantastic view of the city.

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: this place is tops in my book. first off, staff was great, super cool folks. second, BREAKFAST TILL 1PM!!!!! third is a super cool roof top bar with perfect view of the city. its a great view during the day, and whole different view at night. The hostel dose super cool events, like roof top movie night, triva, and even a BBQ with great food. i've been to alot of hostels and this one makes it to the top 3 list no doubt. Facilities are amazing. oh did i mention free pop corn?

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: I had a really good time! While it did seem a bit expensive, it was well worth it in terms of the facilities, breakfast 'till 1pm, staff, location, and activities! Would definitely stay there again!

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext:
If you love food, it's a great location right next to Kensington Market. It's also close to a tram stop that will quickly shuttle you to downtown. 
They had activities going on every day which was great with the BBQ on Saturday being the highlight. There was nothing organized for Canada Day which was a missed opportunity but the hostel has a great social vibe anyway that we made the best of it. 
Rooms are cleaned daily and towels are included which is always a nice bonus. Rooftop patio wasbest

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: That view!! What an amazing place! The location is just perfect, really close to cool bars and hip restaurants. The staff is super helpful and lively! The free bbq on saturday was superb! It was a great place to meet all kinds of travellers, enjoy the rooftop and then head out for some drinks and clubbin. Would definitely come back!

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext:
I stayed in a private room, sharing bathroom with other 2 rooms. Room and bathroom were clean. 
Wi-fi didn't work in my bedroom. I had to stay in the lobby to connect to the internet. Also, the door to access the private area of my room was broken.
They provide some food and you should prepare your own breakfast sharing the kitchen with other customers. Not so practical. 
Location is good, near Spadina Street, getting easy to access public transportation. At night the street had some noise.

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext:
This Hostel is very close to Kensington Market, which has so many breweries, restaurants and coffee shops to go to. Staff is very friendly, breakfast hours are from 7am to 1pm which I thought it was great! There is a nice rooftop open from 7am to 12am with a great view of the CN Tower.  
The rooms are very clean, a little narrow but they are fine.

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: Great hostel, with friendly staff in a nice neighborhood. They organized plenty of activitÃ©, and have a rooftop with an amazing view over the city. Also the beds are clean and comfortable

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: Great hostel, perfect vibe for anyone. More tuned towards Solo travellers which is great. Rooftop bar is a plus.

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: Absolutely great place. The staff was very nice, the location was great and everything was super clean. Fast internet, nice facilities and free breakfast. Definitely would stay here again in Toronto.

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: Beyond anything we expected. The staff were extremely helpful and provided us with anything we needed. As young parents we were a little skeptical bringing kids to a Hostel, however, both staff and fellow travelors were polite and understanding. Can warmly recommend this Hostel to anyone seeking a place to stay in downtown toronto, even families with kids.

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: The location is great, easy to walk to main attractions or get public transport. The staff were wonderful and very helpful. The only real downside was it was very hard to meet other backpackers to do stuff with, as a lot of the people staying there were actually living and working in a Toronto on working visas so weren't interested in doing tourist stuff.  The hostel has great activities every night, my favourite being a fitness class on the rooftop, this was easy to motivate myself to exercise!

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: The staff are excellent, this is one of the friendliest places I've ever stayed at. Breakfast is good and included in the price and is available all morning. Very clean, comfortable beds and good security. It's located close to Chinatown and there are streetcar stops close by so it's easy to get to different places in Toronto and out to the airport. I would stay there again.

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: Wonderful experience! The staff is amazing!!!

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: Very good hostel. Great staff. Highly recommend!

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: Good location in downtown. Rooms and bathrooms small, not a lot of space. Clean and modern. Air con does not work properly. Staff friendly/helpful when approached, but not particularly knowledgeable of local night out spots/restaurants. Amazing breakfast, good WiFi, good views from rooftop- overall would recommend.

name: Planet Traveler Hostel
reviewtext: Had a super positive experience - would definitely stay here again next time I'm in Toronto. The facilities were great and both the guests and staff were genuinely friendly and welcoming.

name: HI Toronto
reviewtext: It was perfect for what I needed.

name: HI Toronto
reviewtext: I arrived past my check in time but the stuff was pretty great and was on call 24/7 the place was very clean and quiet, the room was bit small for me (as a big guy...) and the bed was a bit shaky but overall I had a good stay.

name: HI Toronto
reviewtext: The location right in the heart of downtown makes the upstairs patio the perfect place to do work. Surprisingly over two days I only saw one other person out there in what was a nearly full hostel. The showers were clean and it was great that past guests left so many toiletries. The safe in my bed was great to lock up my valuables and passport. Our tour guide to the Toronto Islands was awesome. The basement bars entertainment was too loud to talk to other guests both nights i stayed

name: HI Toronto
reviewtext: This felt like more of a halfway house then a backpackers hostel.

name: HI Toronto
reviewtext: Staff are helpful. Dorm room is cramped. Kitchen is nice. Downstairs restaurant is a lovely area. Security is good. An okay place but for the price it could really do better.

name: HI Toronto
reviewtext: Great atmosphere. Met so many people doing the free activities. Good bar, with a great happy hour and the most helpful, friendly staff I've come across! I heard some rooms could do with an upgrade and there aren't lockers for bags but a safe for your valuables. But overall a good hostel for a solo traveller.

name: HI Toronto
reviewtext: The location, staff, atmosphere and general facilities were all great, and the breakfast was amazing! If I had to fault it, I would just say that the 8 bed mixed dorm was beyond cramped. I got hit by the door when I was looking through my suitcase a couple times, so people with a lot of luggage - beware!

name: HI Toronto
reviewtext: Good place to stay, close to everything and very helpful staff. Things happening and the bar downstairs is good

name: HI Toronto
reviewtext: Great hostel with perfect location, good for solo travelers as there is also space for socializing. Each bed has a safe, where you can put your things, that was very useful. Also breakfast were really nice. I really enjoyed staying there and when I am back in Toronto, I will stay again! Thanks

name: HI Toronto
reviewtext:
Great hostel in the heart of Toronto, close to everything you could want and with its own little pub in the basement. 
The team is super nice and activities (largely free) are organized every day. I had a great time and met many great people from around the world.
Would definitely stay again

name: HI Toronto
reviewtext: This is a fantastic place to stay. Very secure and safe to stay. Slept in a 10 bed all male room. Lights were off by 11:30pm and people not talking much. Had a bar underneath the hostel that had live music that night I stayed. The staff was friendly and helpful.

name: HI Toronto
reviewtext:
Good location not far away from the financial district and the Distillery district. 
We enjoyed our stay and the really good breakfast.

name: HI Toronto
reviewtext: Great Hostel , friendly staff , close to center and railway station . Awesome breakfast and coffe . Great place to stay !

name: HI Toronto
reviewtext: I really enjoyed my stay there, the breakfast was wonderful and it was near all the things i wanted to go to, like the hockey hall of fame.

name: HI Toronto
reviewtext: Not bad, but don't expect too much going on. A lot of crackheads around the building too.

name: HI Toronto
reviewtext: Stayed in 2x HI's in canada, one dorm felt like a hospital ward, this one themeless but equally miserable. The price paid and the state of the rooms just doesn't match up. Hostel has its own underground bar, who's smoking area appears to be outside right under the window of every front facing room. Didn't get to sleep until about 4am when that noise died down. Very expensive for what it is.

name: HI Toronto
reviewtext: I didn't stay for long at this hostel, but the cleanliness it's not their strongest point, especially the bathrooms, the breakfast is ok. The bar at night has a nice vibe to it and it was the part that I enjoyed the most, got to meet some great people. As for the staff in the reception, they are pleasant, but don't get involved much with the guest. The dorms are cluttered and have no lockers and had to leave my things on the floor, but they do have a safe to keep the most important documents.

name: HI Toronto
reviewtext:
had clean/new amenities. 
however the room felt like a hallway with a couple of beds lined along the wall! honestly don't know how everyone would've gotten out in an evacuation.

name: HI Toronto
reviewtext:
The hotel is good. However, there were no common areas in order to share with people rather that the cavern (where you had to pay for everything you consumed) or the reception that wasn't a really nice place to chill (only to wait for check in or wait for you flight or something after cheack out) . 
We had trouble for getting in at night, a long wait followed by I'd verification that was a real hassle at 3am...

name: HI Toronto
reviewtext: This is definitely a decent option in Toronto but not the most comfortable. The room I was in was tiny and felt cramped and gross with no air circulation. The bathroom was so tiny that it was almost like an airplane bathroom but with a shower crammed in. That being said, it was pretty clean and the employees were kind. It's in a great location in Toronto and included a free breakfast, nicer than many other hostels would.

name: HI Toronto
reviewtext:
Everything was good, but I found that the cleaning staff was cleaning the bathrooms forstcrhibg in the morning, when guests were trying to shower and get ready. 

Might be better to do the rounds later in the morning/early afternoon when most are out

name: HI Toronto
reviewtext: Great location!

name: HI Toronto
reviewtext:
Solid hostel!

Best one we stayed in in Toronto.
There was an electric storm and their WiFi was out for the whole time we were there, which sucked but it wasn't their fault. Could have gotten it fixed faster when most travellers depend on it to plan/get around.

Nice clean rooms. 
HOT AS HELL IN SUMMER. One air con unit at the one end of the room. But it's right next to someone's bed. So they kept turning it off in the night and everyone else started melting. 

Helpful staff. Nice breakfast. ðŸ’ƒ

name: HI Toronto
reviewtext: I booked this hostel due to the location. It's easily accessible to many different form to transportation to get to where ever. Staff are super nice and helpful.The bar area in the basement is pretty cool.Some floors/room have updated facilities. All beds have a small safe (similar to hotel rooms) but not all have lockers (my second room did not from what I could tell).  But 10/10 would stay again.

name: HI Toronto
reviewtext: The dorm room was super tight. Barely any space for storing luggage. The common areas were ok, definitely more comfortable than the room itself. Location was good. Breakfast was fine. Hostel over all was a little expensive for something that was that basic. No frills at all.

name: HI Toronto
reviewtext: Excellent place of stay and very friendly staff I must say

name: HI Toronto
reviewtext: Laundry is $9 CAD! Other than that it's fantastic. Go to the crepes spot and have a TFC. Amazing! Right next to St Lawrence, and a easy ride to Kensington. HI is always a good idea.

name: HI Toronto
reviewtext: The place is great!Right downtown.Only negative is the bar downstairs.Toronto Argos game was on tv. I asked the bartender twice  to switch on the game even though the place was empty  but he didnt care otherb than that good place

name: HI Toronto
reviewtext: It was very clean and the location was very good. The only thing that bothered me was the bathroom. You have a shared bathroom for every room which is great. But it is tiny. You have no space to hang or even put your stuff. There wasn't even a toilet seat cover where I could have put my stuff on. When the bathroom is that small you need some hooks or shelves or even just a shower caddie to put things.

name: HI Toronto
reviewtext:
Overall it was a decent hostel facility wise , staff were friendly it's in the city , you get a safe , a power point and a light on your bed . 
My rooms air con didn't work so it was very hot and stuffy in there , the bathroom door was very difficult to open and close which caused a very loud noise so sleeping was an issue . Atmosphere was non existent as of every HI I've stayed at , so it is tough as a solo traveler to have fun.

name: HI Toronto
reviewtext:
Close to different eatry and easy to locate when arriving to Toronto.
The room felt cramped with 2 bunk beds, and it gets hot even with the AC on.
I would recommend if just staying for a couple days, no longer than that.

name: HI Toronto
reviewtext: I really do not recommend the bed on the top of a bunk bed because it gets too hot to sleep at night

name: HI Toronto
reviewtext: The location is great. I had a private room. It was small but clean and fully functioning.

name: HI Toronto
reviewtext: Hi Toronto is a great location that is close walking distance to everything. The meal ticket system is awesome, allowing you to use it for breakfast, lunch or dinner ( the wraps are really yummy). The staff are super friendly and helpful. The room was great the only thing we needed was a better blind as we got the morning sun.

name: HI Toronto
reviewtext: One of the best free breakfasts ever! There's a menu to choose from and you can get a Backpacker which is beans, potatoes, toast, scrambled eggs, bacon and fresh fruit. Kitchen isn't bad and it's close to a supermarket so you can cook your own dinners. The bathrooms sometimes run out of soap or hand paper towels. Trivia night is pretty good with free beer if you win. It's close to the Eaton centre, distillery district and st Lawrence's market. There are daily deals for cheap drinks at the bar.

name: HI Toronto
reviewtext: Just ok hostel. I booked this hostel for my last night in Toronto after driving through Canada, and I was glad it was just one night. The bathrooms were not clean, and my 12-bed dorm was crowded, the room was very narrow (kinda like a corridor). The staff was very friendly and the bar in the basement is cool. The location is ok, but it's also next to a shelter, so there were a few strange people around the hostel. Overall, I would not recommend it.

name: College Backpackers
reviewtext: Great location. Not a great hostel

name: College Backpackers
reviewtext: There was no sense of community in the hostel and it wasn't that great to stay in in general with one common area which was small. However the location was great!

name: College Backpackers
reviewtext: The staff said that they could put my heavy luggage in the storage place and did not. The reception is an unsafe place to put it.

name: College Backpackers
reviewtext: Dirty and not the most friendly staff

name: College Backpackers
reviewtext: I was visiting Toronto for the Labor Day weekend and found this the only decently priced accommodation  in the city. I was a little skeptical at first about this place reading the previous reviews But, it could not be further from the truth. The staff were good and helped me drop my bags at the reception since I reached before the 2pm checkin time.  The rooms and bathrooms were quite and cleaned regularly. The USP is the location, which is in the centre of Kensington Market.

name: College Backpackers
reviewtext: Overall cleanliness is lacking. Needs a good painting all over, hallways could use more lighting, stairwells need to be cleaned

name: College Backpackers
reviewtext:
One of the worst hostels that I have ever been.
Dirty, really dirty, unfriendly staff, terrible beds, poor breakfast

name: College Backpackers
reviewtext: Reading the reviews about this hostel before i arrived made me super nervous but it was really good. I had no issues with staff or cleanliness and the location is seriously amazing. The wifi is a little hit and miss but i was on the top floor at the end of the hall so it kinda makes sense. The lack of an elevator is also a little annoying but its only four floors so not the end of the world

name: College Backpackers
reviewtext: Really really dirty bathrooms.

name: College Backpackers
reviewtext: Location was pretty great if you're into vegan food or like to party. The rooms were basic and plug sockets were quite sparse. Staff were pretty friendly offered to move some of our group, so we were all in one room together. The showers were decent but the motion sensor for the light was by the door, so if you take longer than 5 minute showers you had to do a mad naked dash to activate it before someone came in. Pretty loud area but you get what you pay for.

name: College Backpackers
reviewtext: Love the Kensington location! Easy to walk or catch transport to anywhere in the city. Staff were friendly and genuine

name: College Backpackers
reviewtext:
Location is the only thing good about this hostel. It has no atmosphere and everyone is very silo, the staff couldn't give recommendations to anything in the area and there were no events planned on behalf of travellers to meet other people in the hostel. 
Wouldn't recommend staying here

name: College Backpackers
reviewtext: The only good thing about this place was the location in that it was a close walk to downtown Toronto. Overall the whole building was gross, overpriced, and the staff was rather rude. I obviously don't expect resort staff but for $120 for a private room I at least hoped for a clean room.

name: College Backpackers
reviewtext: Pretty good spot, near pubs and bars. Nice if you want to go out and meet people. ;)

name: College Backpackers
reviewtext:
Of all the rentals and hostels I have stayed in, this has been by far the worst experience I have ever had. 
First of all, website charged 48$ CAD that was meant to be deposit fee for me and 2 friends 2 night stay (it was supposed to cover the fees for taxes for our hostel stay). When we got to college backpackers, I was told that I had no deposit fee, instead I paid 48$ CAD commission fee to hostel world, whom they claim to have no affiliation with. I ended paying for taxes on top of rental

name: College Backpackers
reviewtext:
Cheap place so cheap experience. 
Many bars in the street, yes, but especially a club below the windows playing music loud & late. It's ok if you know about it and make the choice to go anyway but no ones mentioned it!
Also, the cleanliness could be better: the carpet is gross, the doors are ALL slapping all the time when it's just a screw to turn a bit to arrange that, there is nothing to dry your hands in the toilets!! And don't forget your own padlock for your locker because no provided.

name: College Backpackers
reviewtext: WiFi was AMAZING

name: College Backpackers
reviewtext: The neighborhood was really noisy, I was in a first floor heading the street and I couldn't sleep well. Breakfast is nothing special. There is no laundry available and reception starts at 9 am so  if you leave early in the morning you should talk to them the day before. I think it was expensive for the services I got

name: College Backpackers
reviewtext: I was unsure going into this because of the bad reviews but it was great! I felt very safe in the area and in the hostel itself. The place was as clean as you would expect. I wore sandals in the shower and wouldn't recommend walking around the place barefoot but this is a hostel, not a 5 star hotel. For the price paid, it's a great deal. Everything works, the employees were nice and helpful, and everyone I came into contact with was great! I would recommend this hostel to anyone traveling!

name: College Backpackers
reviewtext:
The front desk works only from 9am to 11pm. Even with a card to access the building the security is zero. 
They do not control how many people per room or if the guys are sleeping together.
For men, there is only one restroom in each floor with one toilet so image the place, it was always dirty, gross, and smelling bad. No paper towel. 
The place to shower was the same, only two showers, dirty and smelling really really bad.    
Bad place, bad choice. Worst place ever!

name: College Backpackers
reviewtext: Its ok, nice city place, funny people, not always nice stuff,

name: College Backpackers
reviewtext: what can I say? this hostel made me want to walk around wearing surgical gloves brandishing a container of hand sanitizer, everything was sticky & felt dirty. overall the place was dingy, hall carpet needs to be removed & destroyed, the timer light in the bathrooms should be longer to prevent being plunged into pitch darkness mid-shower. beds were uncomfortable, the staff indifferent to guests. I was offered no apology or refund for a faulty smoke alarm that beeped from 5 am Would I return NO!

name: College Backpackers
reviewtext: The location and staff are amazing, the problem is that the hostel is not very clean and I had two nights where we had problems figuring out what beds were open because they don't clean the old beds and check the rooms before new people stay at the hostel. Also there was so much old junk under the bed it was terrifying. The staff were very nice and helpful though which was nice.

name: College Backpackers
reviewtext: Really clean and close to the city. WiFi was very disappointing in the room. Rarely worked. Breakfast was nice but finished early and were kicked out at 10am even if we were still eating. Overall a good hostel. Value for money

name: College Backpackers
reviewtext: College Backpackers was the first hostel I have ever stayed it. It was a unique but amazing experience. The location was a huge plus and made my time in Toronto extremely enjoyable. I am sure that when it comes to your roommates it is the luck of the draw, but the people I shared the room with were awesome, super nice and respectful. I would definitely come back to College Backpackers next time I visit Toronto and recommend it to my friends.

name: College Backpackers
reviewtext: Rather grimey and the smell of the common area and kitchen was not fresh at all.

name: College Backpackers
reviewtext:
On a busy street with bars and a shelter for homeless so at night music keeps you up and in early morning the people from the shelter yell at the top of their lungs... 
Breakfast is great vegan friendly, don't expect much it's a hostel! 
Showers stinks not as clean as they appear.

name: College Backpackers
reviewtext: We were very disappointed with this hostel! On our second night in Toronto we arrived back to the hostel just after 12am and realised the electric in our room was not working. Reception was closed so we rang a phone number that was stuck up on the window. When we rang this number the woman said reception is closed and if we rang before 12 someone could have helped but now we are just going to have to wait until the morning! I felt this was ridiculous as we paid for a hostel with electricity.

name: College Backpackers
reviewtext: My friend and I stayed here for 10 days and had a great time! The location is really nice, and the people we met there were amazing! Definitely recommend!

name: College Backpackers
reviewtext:
My room was amazing. All females and everyone was so lovely and friendly.
The staff were helpful despite the lack of help prior to arrival, I found that once on site it was a lot easier to discuss everything.

name: College Backpackers
reviewtext: Good for the price.

name: College Backpackers
reviewtext:
I'm waiting for the custumer around one hourbecause he discuss and joking with his collegue. 
We cqn't accept that. 
The price is expensive for the night in hostel with a share romme when we don't have an intmity

name: College Backpackers
reviewtext: a very okay place to stay. i saw a lot of reviews before about cleanliness but the floor we stayed on wasn't bad. our room was clean, the bathrooms were cleaned daily, the showers were spotless every time we used them. i think the issue others were running into was that the other guests were cleaning up after themselves. this is just my perception. the location is great, there's a marketplace right out side called Kensington. A lot of vegetarian eats and bars/breweries right on augusta avenue.

name: College Backpackers
reviewtext:
Guys, this hostel is falling apart. I know we are all travellers and sometimes we just compromise with whatever. Let me be honest and say that this is one of the most bizarre hostels I have stayed at. The corridors never get vacuumed and there is an odd smell throughout the various floors.  No one checks to see if there is toilet paper in the toilets. The fridge seems to never get cleaned out.

The only good thing about this place is the location.

name: All Days Hostel
reviewtext: Really clean and friendly staff would defiantly return

name: All Days Hostel
reviewtext: Unfortunately the facility does not accept Mastercard so I was obliged to pay in cash.

name: All Days Hostel
reviewtext: Not a usual hostel. Great place to get sleep, and it's secure and I thought the staff were nice. But apart from that, there isn't any way to meet anyone and if you're like me, looking to meet people you won't want to come here. I only met one guy after a week, the rest were older people, even families staying there. Which you wouldn't get at any other hostel. It's more of a self catered hotel. They give a different story of why they 'can't accept card' to pay to every person.

name: All Days Hostel
reviewtext: For sleeping it is good, but for meeting other people or gain travel experience you should search another accommodation

name: All Days Hostel
reviewtext: Stayed in a 3 person (2 double beds) room for three nights and the room was really good. Nothing to complain about. The location is good with subway stations nearby. All in all good value for money.

name: All Days Hostel
reviewtext: Great hostel, great facilities, amazing staff ........ Recommended

name: All Days Hostel
reviewtext: I really enjoyed this hostel. Clean, secure with good lockers, comfortable beds. Feels more like a guesthouse, which was nice. Nice patio, close to amenities.

name: All Days Hostel
reviewtext: Doesn't feel like a hostel - but okay to stay at.

name: All Days Hostel
reviewtext: Clean hostel located in  good area not far from 2 subway stations with easy access to lots of facilities including a small mall across the road. Opportunity to sign up to tours incl niagara falls. sockets in the dorm limited and location of beds did not accomodate adaptors. When beds were moved slightly so I could charge , it was promptly moved back, in one case damaging the plug. Staff were not always available, especially when booking activities and atmosphere was not always that welcoming.

name: All Days Hostel
reviewtext:
Security was great into the building. 
Cleaner didn't empty bins for the 6 nights and my room smelt from day one but didnt have a clear window to vent out. One bathroom between 4 rooms was an issue in the morning and noise level from other floors could be heard clearly. Staff weren't very friendly or approachable which impacted on the atmosphere. Location is ok convenient to shops but a fair walk to downtown.

name: All Days Hostel
reviewtext: I was very very pleased with the facility! The staff was nice and helpful! Even upgraded my room for me! They were attentive and very friendly! Made my stay in Toronto very enjoyable! Plus to be downtown among everything for the price I paid... It was the best!!

name: All Days Hostel
reviewtext: Reserved 2 rooms. One booked room not available 1st night. Put in lower priced room 1st night with no refund of difference. 2nd room not ready when checked in, had to wait. Bedding could use update. Staff great and helpful.  Easy access to subway, fast food and grocery. Other guests noisy in shared areas way after 11/12 pm.  Location is a little out of the way but Price for rooms economical in a very expensive city and staff were always on hand. Weekly parking was also a good deal.ðŸ˜Š

name: All Days Hostel
reviewtext:
I came back in my last night here to all of my belongings stuffed into a cupboard all scrunched up by staff.

Only one kitchen space for cooking which becomes a problem when lots of people want to cook. The staff are not friendly at all. There isn't a nice aura about the place at all and it's far away from anything interesting in Toronto. 

The rooms are extremely cramped and people actually living at the hostel (not staying for a week or two) get priority for space over other people.

name: All Days Hostel
reviewtext: Very clean and comfortable, highly rcrecommended.

name: All Days Hostel
reviewtext: The rooms looked nothing

name: All Days Hostel
reviewtext: Nice place but no parking. You have to park in side street.

name: All Days Hostel
reviewtext: Our room was in the kitchen and it can be very noisy if some visitors don't care about yelling in the early morning while making coffee. Beside that, great area, quiet but close to the action. Don't be shy to walk aroud the block, there's some nice cafÃ©s and a grocery. The room was a bit expensive but what ain't in Toronto, seriously? Good to know: you have to pay with the card of the person who booked the room.

name: All Days Hostel
reviewtext: It was worth paying another $20 per night to upgraded to a room with it's own bathroom.  It was more like a hotel room.  I didn't use the kitchen facilities so I can't comment on that.  The location was fine but I chose to go up town 2 blocks to take the subway from a better area.  The reception man was very helpful & friendly.  The room was clean.  People from the Hostel sat outside my bedroom window and were noisy till late.  Nearby shopping was great. Generally I'd recommend it to others.

name: The Clarence Park
reviewtext:
Good location, friendly and helpful staff.
Towels and bedding had a very unpleasant smell like being washed not appropriate.
Window to the street could not be closed: air conditioning in slot.
Room rate might be appropriate for Toronto (good location) but not for room facilities.

name: The Clarence Park
reviewtext: Big problem od BEDBUGS in the bed. The room and bathroom were clean butno eindow, only a door that open into the emergency staircases. A lot of pigeons nest above the AC unit, itself on top of this door and make an infernal raucous all day and night. Add to that a booming ventilation noise and you understand that there is no much sleep you can get. Also the door is an emergency  type and I had security concern as none of the doors lock from the inside.

name: The Clarence Park
reviewtext: The hostel ia nice but there was a situation that didn't pleased me: I've booked a female dorm and on the first night there was a GUY in the room. When we went to complain, the receptionist said it was a mistake because his name sounded female. Mistakes happen, but what upset me is that we've asked to AT LEAST pay the price for the mixed dorm for that nigh and she said she couldn't give us a "discount" and that the manager would write us. Never heard from him. I found the situation very unfair.

name: The Clarence Park
reviewtext: Overall I had a great experience. Location is excellent, clean and friendly staff. The only downside for me was that I book a private room with a private bathroom and the room they gave me did not have any windows. I felt like in a cage, without knowing if it was hot or cold, sunny or rainy.

name: The Clarence Park
reviewtext: First time staying in a hostel and it was great! I was only there for a short while, but it was perfect for what I needed. Location is probably the best part, but the staff was also very friendly and the place felt clean and safe.

name: The Clarence Park
reviewtext: Super Close to public transport and CN tower/entertainment district. Lovely staff :)

name: The Clarence Park
reviewtext: Bed was comfortable that would have boosted it a bit if that was an option. Good location, facilities OK. Bathroom a bit grubby and only 1 toilet for over 6 people. Security nearly nil. Only main problem I had was that I was not told how to get into the main building in the morning for check-out. It was about 8am and I needed to drop off my keys and pick up my food. Luckily another guest walked past and let me in. If that hadn't happened though I don't know what I would have done.

name: The Clarence Park
reviewtext: I stayed in a mixed room and it was okay. Every bed had privacy curtains which was an amazing idea. The staff was alsÃ³ very nice, and the location was the best. I walk Ã©s everywhere and everything was from a walking distance from here.

name: The Clarence Park
reviewtext: This location is one of the best. The overall facilities could use some work, water pressure sucked and there was no chair or small desk in dorms so you had to be on the bunk all the time. It didn't matter much for me to be honest because I was here to sleep, shower and head out. If you are careless like me- it would be the best bang for the buck.

name: The Clarence Park
reviewtext: Very old building from the 1800s, so don't expect anything that will excite you. They really need an elevator because the stairs are narrow and uncomfortable to walk up three flights each time. Also, they should improve their AC system. However, the shower water pressure was nice, and overall was clean.

name: The Clarence Park
reviewtext: If you need a cheap/easy place to stay, this is an option. The staff was friendly and provided me with a towel, pillow, sheet, and duvet. The dorm beds are assigned; bed 6 in room 14's "privacy curtain" included the in-room security lockers that everyone used, so it wasn't actually "private". Space livable but not clean; there were cobwebs and water damage over the bed, grime/mildew on the shower light. Staff cleaned spaces regularly. The front door (10 Clarence Sq) was never locked at night.

name: The Clarence Park
reviewtext: Great location, lovely staff!

name: The Clarence Park
reviewtext: Loved it. Great location, close to everything. Wonderful stuff and Debra, such a wonderful manager. I would definitely go back. I had the best time there.

name: The Clarence Park
reviewtext: We had a fantastic time in Ontario & Clarence Park was a major reason. The location is ideal and in easy walking distance from Chinatown, King Street, etc., near subways and opposite a scenic grassy park. We really enjoyed the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. The kitchen facilities made it easy to prepare all our meals with fresh healthy food from conveniently located shops, etc. Finally, the multilingual guests added to our enjoyment of this harmoniously diverse multicultural city.

name: The Clarence Park
reviewtext: I was extremely satisfied with my stay in the single-bed room. The staff who attended me was friendly and answered questions I had about the services provided and the area. Located in a convenient location from public transport, attentive staff, the single bedroom provided comfortable conditions during the summer heat.

name: The Clarence Park
reviewtext:
We have to climb three floors with heavy luggage,no lift! 
Kitchen quite dirty, many flies, inadequate cooking facilities.

name: The Clarence Park
reviewtext: Really good hostel. The best that I have stayed in, it really was the perfect location. The rooms were clean and then beds were very comfortable. The kitchen area was really big so enough for everyone to cook food whenever they wanted to. Would definitely come back to this hostel.

name: The Clarence Park
reviewtext: The worst thing about this hostel is the security. The doors are not secured and it is easy for people who do not stay in the hostel to enter the rooms. There are no plugs at every bed (top bunk has no access). Wifi spotty. Staff are nice, but the desk is not open 24h. Would not recommend, did not feel safe staying there and was glad when the stay was over.

name: The Clarence Park
reviewtext: Bit messy, with old linen/bunk bags laying around. Scratch marks on bathroom walls, tiles in bathroom need TLC scrub. Each bunk should have a small lamp, and shelving for small personal items. Very good overall!

name: The Clarence Park
reviewtext:
Great location, really convenient to visit Downtown Toronto. 
But some dorms aren't super clean, maybe because of some people staying long in it.

name: The Clarence Park
reviewtext:
In my opinion the staff is awesome. super friendly and always really helpful. Unfortunately the water pressure sucked and a regular shower of 5-10 min turned easily into 20-30 min.
But otherwise, the rooms are super clean and comfy!

name: The Clarence Park
reviewtext:
The hostel itself is fine. I'm not expecting anything flash but the pictures are definitely misleading to what this hostel actually looks like..
My room was very dark and gloomy and the bathroom looked like it hasn't had a good clean in a while. The plumbing was out as the sink would fill up with water while you where brushing your teeth 
Overall it was a great location but I did expect better after looking at pics on your website

name: The Clarence Park
reviewtext:
Excellent hostel, shame it has been fully booked for most of the summer.
Very clean, lounge is great, the place in general looks great and is cheaper than the very basic other options in downtown.

name: The Clarence Park
reviewtext: I agree with previous reviews that the location was fab - but the hostel itself was really disappointing.  Our family room was fairly tight on space and had no windows and a loud, constantly dripping air conditioning unit with no remote control to adjust the temperature of other settings.  The decor was very tired and the bedroom and bathroom very grubby.  There was no duvet cover on my son's bed and we were told this was not provided - just a sheet to use between him and the duvet instead.

name: The Clarence Park
reviewtext: I stayed in a Superior 6-bed dorm, and the room certainly felt "superior". Although it was a 6-bed dorm, it was actually one 4-bed room (which I stayed in) and another 2 beds in a different room behind a curtain. Basically a full apartment for 6 people. Curtains on the bed were nice, although beds were a bit on the uncomfortable side (nothing shocking for a hostel). Location is the best of anywhere in Toronto - can walk to most places downtown in less than 20 minute.

name: The Clarence Park
reviewtext: Decent place to stay if you want something cheap. Staff are friendly enough and helpful. The dorms themselves are quite small and seemed to fit as many beds in as possible. The dorm i stayed in have 7 beds (even though my booking stayed 6). Due to so many beds and small room, it looks even more cramped with people belongings everywhere. The air conditioner was leaking and was loud. The bathroom was clean, the shower didn't work but it was there. Overall okay stay.

name: The Clarence Park
reviewtext: Great location. Really nice lounge area. Curtains on bunks add a level of privacy you don't get everywhere! Would definitely recommend .

name: The Clarence Park
reviewtext: Clean, good location, friendly staff!

name: The Clarence Park
reviewtext: Very central location. Facilities were decent but no complimentary breakfast, which was okay but the cafe they mentioned in the description is not open anymore I believe. It seems that where the cafe used to be is now an evening bistro, but it doesn't open until late afternoon. Otherwise I loved the size of the bunks and I would absolutely stay again.

name: The Clarence Park
reviewtext: This hostel has a lot of potential but unfortunately it just was lacking in a fun atmosphere and could use some work in cleanliness.

name: The Clarence Park
reviewtext: Really good location for the price. The room was a decent size and the bathroom was relatively new. You had to go and ask for new clean towels which was tricky as the reception was closed before 9 and after 9 so the hours we were in to swap towels did not coincide. Free tea and coffee and kitchen was more than well equipped if you wanted to use it.

name: The Clarence Park
reviewtext:
We were 7 in the dorm.
Happy to have bed curtains !
But is was very correct in general. People was nice, there are rooftops on each houses
There is a parking so it's very convenient

name: The Clarence Park
reviewtext: Great hostel in downtown Toronto. Rooms were nice and comfortable, toilets were fairly clean, staff was friendly and helpful. Overall, great stay and would stay here again.

name: The Clarence Park
reviewtext: Great location, very friendly staff, unfortunately no window in our room but otherwise really great.

name: The Clarence Park
reviewtext: There is no place to lock your luggage, so the rooms are messy. Your bedsheets come in a bag which had a blood stain in it. A water bottle from previous guest was left on my bed. The key to my room did not work and was the only one, almost locked out at 2am as nobody would wake up. Reception closes at 9pm. The only bathroom between all rooms is filthy and shower head does not work. The shower tap had human feces on it and I had to have a shower from a tap. Hostel staff were pretty cool though.

name: The Clarence Park
reviewtext:
Fine over all. Good location. That's the main highlight.

The room was pretty messy with other people's stuff being left out when the people have been gone. 

Sketchy private curtains put up. Some beds with none. 

And I'm pretty sure a random guy snuck in one night and slept on an empty bed. He had no belongings and slept fully clothed.

name: The Clarence Park
reviewtext: I can understand this is a cheap way to have a stay downtown Toronto. I am willing to stay in a small room with few accomodations. But the bath was filled with mildew on the wall, the seams were all wrotten, the bath did not look clean, the matresses had no cover and only a top sheet for protection. Outside the hostel where the parking is, it was really messy, junk all over the place. I'd rather pay a couple bucks more for something clean.

name: The Clarence Park
reviewtext:
+ Great location, good facilities and big comfy bed. Free all day Coffee.
- A/C in dorm loud (ear plugs), no breakfast included and whilst the kitchen is good, distinct shortage of cups and some cooking equipment.

name: The Clarence Park
reviewtext: The front door did not have a lock on it.

name: The Clarence Park
reviewtext: Stayed here just for two nights in a mixed dormitory. It was nice having a shared bathroom in the room and the curtains around each bed gave you that extra bit of privacy. The kitchen was well equipped and nice to eat in, and there was lots of space to store your food. I found it a bit unsociable as the main common room was just like a living room with people watching the football so there was no opportunity to meet people, or I wasn't told of any social activities available.

name: The Clarence Park
reviewtext: The hostel and room itself was modern, spacious and had a nice vibe. Unfortunately, Check-in was delayed, the WiFi didn't work in my building, the bathroom was dated and the shower head wasn't working making it hard to bath during my stay. I really would rated as great location except for those little issues

name: The Clarence Park
reviewtext: Clarence Park is a nice hostel that is convenient in location to everything in Toronto! It has a great homey feel that you will most likely not get anywhere else in Toronto! The staff and residents were extremely friendly and always felt approachable. A couple small issues, such as the AC not working half the time and was not fixed when asked multiple times, bathroom not being attached to inside of the room, and a few other minor issues. Overall a great stay and we would love to come back again

name: The Clarence Park
reviewtext: Rooms were clean for an average hostel. Bedding was thrown in a bag I'm glad I brought my own blanket, the pillow was flat. The AC did not work well but we requested a fan that the stuff brought in for us. Overall the hostel is located perfectly in downtown Toronto. You can see the CN tower from the park. I would stay here again if I get the chance to visit Toronto again.

name: The Clarence Park
reviewtext:
Great location!
If you don't do a shared room, you will probably get a room/bathroom outside of the main backpackers. We found it super safe and fine.
Rooms were small but can't say we were in them a lot. 
AC needed some TLC.
Super close to the city and you have parking out the back for $10 which was handy.
Only one washing machine/dryer so make sure you pre book!!!!!

name: The Clarence Park
reviewtext: Friendly staff and they all work very hard.

name: The Clarence Park
reviewtext:
There was nothing necessarily wrong with this hostel but there were quite a few things not right either. The air conditioning wasn't big enough to reach the whole room so it was very hot. My bed was the only one without a curtain so with others coming and going there was little privacy. My reading light didn't work. The kitchen seemed to either be closed every time I wanted to use it (eg evening) or not enough room. The reception and
kitchen are in a different building to most rooms.

name: The Clarence Park
reviewtext:
We stayed here throughout a heat period in Toronto and the AC was broken... We booked into a 6 bed dorm. But on top of the broken AC there was a 7th bed inside the room. That didn't make the air better. Maybe we had just bad luck with messy room mates, because the cleaning ladys came in in the morning, but before that thr room/washroom was not very clean.

Fortunately we had to leave early, after one night already, but that brings me to the positive part: the staff is super friendly and helpful!

name: The Clarence Park
reviewtext: Really great location, felt like the entire city was within walking distance. However, definitely some complaints about the place. When I got there, the sheets weren't ready for me and I had to fetch them from the laundry. The toilet for 10 of us ran out of toilet paper that night and there wasn't a replacement roll nor a staff member available to give us one.  My second night was incredibly hot and the AC broke, and again there was no staff to help fix it. Room was over an expensive bar.

name: The Clarence Park
reviewtext: It's great if you just want somewhere to sleep. It's not a hostel that has regular activities or super friendly staff. Not somewhere I would recommend if you want to meet people or party.

name: The Clarence Park
reviewtext: You find few washrooms

name: Two Peas Pod Hostel
reviewtext: Place was amazing, so much to do in the hostel alone

name: Two Peas Pod Hostel
reviewtext: This is a great hostel. I loved its quirky style, its a quiet place with great and halpful staff. The food in the cafe down stairs is delicious and its in a great location to walk around the city or catch the tram/bus. My only down side was walking down the stairs to use the bathroom but they were always so clean ( i saw staff cleaning them at various times throughout the day ) which you dont always get at hostels.

name: Two Peas Pod Hostel
reviewtext: Probably one of the more comfortable hostels I have stayed at. Great central location and the beds are private and comfortable.

name: Two Peas Pod Hostel
reviewtext: Awesome place, but has some weird things. You can accidentally get locked in the Kitchen. The toilets can't flush more than once every 5 minutes. Rooms don't have doors, only curtains. Those are minor things and the pros here more than make up for them.

name: Two Peas Pod Hostel
reviewtext: Located in Chinatown, so there are restaurants and stores around, but it's more than 25 minutes walking to downtown, although there's a streetcar close. Staff is nice, but seems like they are understaffed and there's no 24 hour reception. The size of the pod rooms is really small; it's uncomfortable to move around with your things. The showers are really nice and spacious, though. But rooms are in one floor, bathrooms in another, reception in another, common areas in another; lots of stairs.

name: Two Peas Pod Hostel
reviewtext: A good hostel in general. But no doors for the rooms and just restrooms in the cellar. Nevertheless, I would recommend it. And it is very close to Kensington Market.

name: Two Peas Pod Hostel
reviewtext: This place was wonderful. The staff was very friendly and helpful! First time in Toronto/Canada and they were able to guide me in the right direction.

name: Two Peas Pod Hostel
reviewtext: I had a great stay at Two Peas Hostel. Facilities were excellent: great bed, good locker, very nice common are on the roof top and very clean bathrooms! Staff was very friendly too! Location is good, but in a weird neighborhood (few homeless people around).

name: Two Peas Pod Hostel
reviewtext: Really nice staff and good atmosphere!

name: Two Peas Pod Hostel
reviewtext: This hostel was amazing! Super friendly staff, very clean modern and cleaverly designed. The pods had easy curtains to create a private space with a TV, private light and earphones for each pod. There is a secure area to store your bag and THE MOST INCREDIBLE SHOWERS (hot, powerful with hundereds of options eg body spray, waterfall, normal, shower head). Each shower was private with a changing area attached in the down stairs communal washrooms. Hairdryers available etc. Overall it was perfect

name: Two Peas Pod Hostel
reviewtext: Amazing service.

name: Two Peas Pod Hostel
reviewtext: Staff were absolutely brilliant and facilities amazing. Definitely stay again!

name: Two Peas Pod Hostel
reviewtext: Excellent location in Chinatown.  Staff lovely - very friendly and helpful.  The bathroom, while clean, was located in the lower level (2 flights downstairs from the sleeping area) and was mixed gender.  A bit noisy, so ear plugs a must!

name: Two Peas Pod Hostel
reviewtext: Absolutely great find. It's a new hostel, but it is run real well. The location is great for people looking to explore the city and there are a ton of good bars in the area. Very good value.

name: Two Peas Pod Hostel
reviewtext: awesome, brand new hostel. I loved the whole pod concept, it gives you privacy in a shared room.

name: Two Peas Pod Hostel
reviewtext: I really liked Two Peas, it was nice and friendly and the facilities were really nice. The location was good, not perfect, but still very convenient. Overall a really good stay.

name: Two Peas Pod Hostel
reviewtext: It's in china town, no organised functions and the atmosphere is pretty average. Facilities are great.

name: Two Peas Pod Hostel
reviewtext: For my first time in Toronto, staying here was a brilliant choice. Location is perfect, right on Spadina Ave. The hostel was super clean and there was a great atmosphere. The location of the bathroom was a minor issue and the lack of kitchen facilities was also a little peculiar. However, you're on the doorstop of some great restaurants. The roof patio was very chilled out. However, the best aspect was the staff who were all friendly and helpful. A very enjoyable stay and would def. recommend.

name: Two Peas Pod Hostel
reviewtext: This is a great hostel. It's in a good location right next to Kensington Market. The staff are really friendly and helpful, always happy to chat or give advice. Perfect place to be based while exploring Toronto!

name: Two Peas Pod Hostel
reviewtext: Two peas is located in the middle of China Town, great location and near a traincar line!  Super convenient.  The staff were really helpful and nice!  The pods themselves were comfortable, tho im fairly small 5'2, they felt big enough.  Bathrooms were sort of far away-two floors from where i was staying.  Kitchen had no ventilation so could be insanely hot during the day.  It was an overall good experience!  Would book again!

name: Two Peas Pod Hostel
reviewtext: The place is really, really good. From the moment I entered, I was received with the utmost attention and care. Everything is clean, hallways and pods. Pods are also very comfortable inside, a little small in terms of room size, but having that privacy of a pod was reassuring for me. They have lockers as well under the pods to store the bags and things you want to leave behind. Bathrooms are also clean and the rooftop has a beautiful view as well as a lovely vibe. In summary, well worth it!

name: Two Peas Pod Hostel
reviewtext:
The concept is good - but there are a few teething issues that ought to be resolved; a curtain is all the seperates your room from the corridor where the main lobby is - very noisy and not very private. 

The doors all creak very loudly - again with just a curtain, very annoying. there is also no kitchen area for guests to use (didn't bother me as i never use them, but might be worth noting for others) 

The beds were super comfy and having your own TV was great 
STAFF INCREDIBLE!

name: Two Peas Pod Hostel
reviewtext: Cool new hostel where the staff are trying to think of everything to make your experience the best it could be. The rooftop, the beds with curtains, tvs and charging facilities are well thought out. The storage under the bed is a little tight but overall it's fantastic.

name: Two Peas Pod Hostel
reviewtext: Staff was great. Super friendly and knowledgeable about the area. Everything was clean and well maintained. Bedding was good quality. Shower was state of the art! The privacy of the pods was a nice touch. I would add garbage cans to each room and a small fridge in the breakfast room but besides that it was stellar!!!

name: Two Peas Pod Hostel
reviewtext: Great stay. Friendly and helpful staff

name: The Parkdale Hostellerie
reviewtext: An amazing place to stay. Very sociable. Feels like living in a giant shared apartment. Rooms don't have locks on them however there is a front door code. There's a nice homely vibe. The staff are also very helpful and accommodating. Close to the waterfront but a bit away from downtown Toronto. The area that it's in is very trendy. Great place.

name: The Parkdale Hostellerie
reviewtext: This was my first time staying at a hostel and it made me really want do it again. I stayed in the 10-bed room & it was much more comfortable than I expected. The staff were super friendly & helpful. The other guests were extremely friendly & respectful to me and my belongings. I was apprehensive about my stuff all out in the open unsecured because they did not have large lockers available but it did not end up being a problem at all. Overall it was a nice experience and I would stay here again.

name: The Parkdale Hostellerie
reviewtext: We could not find the hostel without asking the staff in a shop close by because there is not any sign. In the hostel we were asked to take off our shoes which was ridiculous considering how dirty every piece of the floor was. Our room was not ready as we arrived. We did not get a blanket and in addition there was no light and no curtain. Our window was directed towards a busy street so it was kinda loud and very bright in our room. We could not find the staff when we needed them.

name: The Parkdale Hostellerie
reviewtext: when I arrived the hostel was overbooked so I had to sleep on a cot bed in the 10 bed room I'd booked. They did give me a discount but the cot was in a terrible location - right next to the patio door which was really noisy and there was absolutely no privacy (even less than I'd expect in a 10 bed room). The vibes were good though and they let me store my luggage all day which was super helpful. I'd stay here again but in one of the smaller apartments.

name: The Parkdale Hostellerie
reviewtext: First of all - they need a sign outside the hostel! It's impossible to find, especially if you're arriving at night! They don't have free toast and cereal, even though it says so in their description. The bathroom was dirty, the staff didn't know anything about the area, and we found a chocolate milk in the fridge that was two weeks past its expiration date. It's pretty far away from everything and the vibe was just not very good....

name: The Parkdale Hostellerie
reviewtext: Easy booking. Welcome tour was handled swiftly and thoroughly. Clean and in a cool part of town. 20 min tram to the city. Well worth the very low price.

name: The Parkdale Hostellerie
reviewtext: The hostel is in a great location, the staff is nice and very helpful, the bathrooms were always clean, and wifi actually worked. This hostel provides great value considering it's about half the price of the other hostels in the downtown area. Keep in mind this is not a party hostel, it had a social vibe but never got rowdy. It's also very simple to get to from the airport, takes like 40 mins and 3 dollars; the taxi driver at the airport wanted 60 dollars.

name: The Parkdale Hostellerie
reviewtext: Once you arrive everyone is asked to take off shoes, I figured out later this is because they don't clean and so it reduces possible dirt on the floors. Showers weren't cleaned at all over my stay. I asked if there was a cleaner and was told they clean if they have a chance. This raises alarm bells for me as hostels need to be kept clean every day. No signs outside so confusing to find. Entry hall and stairs has filthy carpet. I won't be staying there again and I recommend staying elsewhere

name: The Parkdale Hostellerie
reviewtext:
The room was not clean when I arrive, there were old q-tips and other stuff on the floor. Toilet paper was missing in one of the bathroom. I had a sheet for the bed and a towel.
The hostel is far from the city center, but the streetcar is easy to use so it takes about 30 min to reach downtown.  The shared kitchen was equipped with a lot of utensils and stuff to cook (vinegar, sauces, etc). Overall, it was correct for only one night.

name: The Parkdale Hostellerie
reviewtext: I was only here for one night, yet it was one of the worst hostels I have experienced. No directions to the hostel and therefore ended up waking the streets alone in the dark. No signage at the door so even more difficult to find. Booked a 4 bed female dorm but they'd overbooked so was given a 10 bed, considering I'd booked a while ago I was very disappointed. The room was unbearably hot, loud streets below therefore difficult to sleep. The staff were useless not knowing where anything was.

name: The Parkdale Hostellerie
reviewtext:
Location and staff were good but the hostel itself was hard to find, especially on a dark late evening, there is no indication that the buzzer you are trying is for the right building.  Staff also took a while to answer the door, this isn't good for security either. 

Facilities were good but there was no air conditioning in the rooms and the showers were not at all clean.

name: The Parkdale Hostellerie
reviewtext: This  hotel is not in downtown , which I didn't mind it  because I came back  to the airport next day ! . The stafff is friendly. I did check in 11 ish and  I didn't have problem at all .  About security , they didn't gave any keys  and the room is unlocked . For one night  , was ok ,  because I went to bed and next day I left .  I like  it cause is like an apartment  and you can feel more like. Home also because it has a share kitchen .

name: The Parkdale Hostellerie
reviewtext:
The best hostel I've ever stayed at,  Leanne is such a sweet person, she made our stay so pleasent, one night they were completely booked and she gave me and my mate her room. Defo recommend, she provided such useful advice, a top notch person. DONT MISS OUT !!!

Anand

name: The Parkdale Hostellerie
reviewtext:
My bed never cleaned for 2 nights.
The rest of them was okay.

name: The Parkdale Hostellerie
reviewtext: This hostel could definitely use a deep clean, especially the floors and showers. The private room was a good size but there was no AC and probably 30degrees in that room. However, it was fine for our one night stay in Toronto, and relatively close to the CNE and Budweiser stage.

name: The Parkdale Hostellerie
