reviewtext: We loved this hostel. We've stayed in over 50 hostels all over the world and we'd never seen one with plush duvets! They provide good-quality facilities. No breakfast but the kitchen is well-equipped and there are supermarkets nearby. They have wifi networks for each dorm. To improve: They should hire cleaning staff to tidy up every morning because our bathroom wasn't always clean (but not disgusting) and the different apartments are separated, so atmosphere wasn't great to meet people.

name: The Parkdale Hostellerie
reviewtext: I booked last minute! I was so happy to find this place in an incredible location, a short distance to downtown, but still in a vibrant area for an awesome price! It is super homey and all of the staff go out of their way to make your stay as pleasant and comfortable as possible!! 10/10 will definitely stay here every time I am going through Toronto and would recommend if you are looking for a chill, homey place, in a great location, tons of amenities, staff who care, at an incredible price :)

name: The Parkdale Hostellerie
reviewtext: The hostel had no lockers when I stayed, however on my last night these were being installed. It is quite far out from the centre, though the street cars are easy to use! On the first night there were 2 mice spotted in the reception area beside the kitchen although they were not spotted again on my 4 night stay. Overall it was a very good and clean hostel and I would stay here again!

name: The Parkdale Hostellerie
reviewtext: Nice place to stay for a few nights. Rooms have a lot of space but no lockers. Cool area with many restaurants and bars around. The hostel is fairly new and a lot of effort has been put into it. Bathrooms do need more cleaning though.

name: The Parkdale Hostellerie
reviewtext: I rated the property in comparison to other hostels I stayed at this summer. It is an old building with outdated technology. There was NO air-conditioning until recently and EXTREMELY bad Internet connection. There should be no excuse for having no A/C and Internet. The lighting is uncomfortable for me. However, I do like the fact that they are the only pet friendly hostel available and my Service Dog had a great time there. I wish people could stay longer than 14 days.

name: The Parkdale Hostellerie
reviewtext: We had a private double room which was great, as the door was lockable and the room was lovely. However the shared dorms don't have lockers, so if you are thinking about sharing a room make sure you bring valuables that you can carry with you. The cleanliness was ok. Not great - but if you don't have high expectations, it's a fine place! The staff is grand - not very chatty and when asked if they had a city map or where to buy a SIM card I was left stranded. So just be prepared :)

name: The Parkdale Hostellerie
reviewtext: Overall, a nice place. The staff and guests were friendly and helpful. Tram and bus stops close by, with a few bixi stations nearby. The area could be a bit sketchy, particularly at night, but overall a good place. Lots of shops, cafes, and restaurants on the main road, and supermarket two tram stops away.

name: The Parkdale Hostellerie
reviewtext: The Hostel was nice. I've read reviews about how the doors was hard to hard so I made sure to keep a look out. The place and people are overall friendly and chill. There are no keys or locks beside the front door security door, so be sure to keep an eye on your stuff. Also, they have a 'take your shoes off at the door policy' And a fan and power strip on every bed so that was good.

name: The Parkdale Hostellerie
reviewtext: Our room was switched, my issue with that was we were in a room with more people and when we asked to talk to the manager, we walked in on her talking poorly and being extremely unprofessional behind our backs stating that if we didn't like the place we "can just leave". Next none of the doors locked and there were no security boxes. Bathroom floors were constantly wet and I didn't see them be cleaned once in the four days I was there. Passive aggressive staff. Had to ask to replace our towels.

name: The Parkdale Hostellerie
reviewtext:
The location is great! It's easy to access to downtown and there are many nice restaurants, bars and coffee shops around there.
The room which has 8 beds was also better than I expected. The bed and sheets are clean and enough comfortable and roommates were nice.
The staffs are also nice and friendly! One of them helped carrying my luggages to 3rd floor.
I was just worried about my luggages because there aren't any lockers or safes. At least there is lock at the entrance but only that.

name: The Parkdale Hostellerie
reviewtext: 30-40 minutes walk from the financial district, less by bike or streetcar. You may have to wait a bit when you check in, not always there is someone at the front desk. No lockers, no washing machine.

name: The Parkdale Hostellerie
reviewtext: I emailed the park dale hostelerie before arriving, to adjust my reservation. I was responded to, saying that it would be no problem, and that they'd take care of the change, and see me upon my arrival. Once I got there, on the new date(1 day later than my original reservation FYI) I was informed that because I was a "no show" the night before, that my reserved bed in the 4 person dorm was given away. afyer Showing her the email, I was offered a 10% discount to stay in an 8 person room. Not cool

name: The Parkdale Hostellerie
reviewtext: Bed I was on was not properly assembled and was very noisy.  The showers very dirty and not being allowed to wear shoes in the dirty building wasn't enjoyable.

name: The Parkdale Hostellerie
reviewtext: quite dirty, no safe storage for baggage, hard to find since there is not even a sign outside. Staff are friendly and facilities ok.

name: The Parkdale Hostellerie
reviewtext: I only stayed one night and found it was overall pretty good! The only downside was there was no security lockers but otherwise everything was good, plenty of showers and toilets etc

name: The Parkdale Hostellerie
reviewtext: Good hostel. I would stay again. I liked the staff and the vibe of the hostel. There were no lockers for your stuff and dropping off my luggage on the first day took a few calls/door bells rings. However, the staff was really nice once I checked-in. Hostel has everything you need.

name: The Parkdale Hostellerie
reviewtext: Staff were absolutely lovely and extremely helpful. The place was generally unclean though, and lights didn't work in the bedrooms so was always dark. Location was great and good value for money altogether.

name: The Parkdale Hostellerie
reviewtext: Staff were great! Very relaxed atmosphere. Great location! The level of cleanliness in comparison to most hostels was average but not too bad at all.

name: The Parkdale Hostellerie
reviewtext:
Security:  No ability to lock-up valuables.
Location:  Direct access to two main transit routes, with a short walk to regional train service.
Staff:  Friendly
Atmosphere:  No air conditioning.  Poor air circulation.  "Mixed Dorm" was 100% male.
Cleanliness:  Could be better.
Value For Money:  Pretty cheap, relatively speaking.
Facilities:  Fast Wi-Fi.

name: The Parkdale Hostellerie
reviewtext: A very good choice if you are traveling on a tight budget. The beds were surprisingly comfortable, if a little on the short side (beware if you measure more than 5'7"). The showers and washrooms were clean, the kitchen area less so but clearly because some of the tenants just didn't care enough to clean after themselves. Only little hickup; I have colored hair so I brought my own old towel to not ruin the hostel's; well it disapeared from where it was drying... None of my food disapeared though.

name: The Parkdale Hostellerie
reviewtext: Very confusing to find the hostel as there was no sign outside and no one answered the phone.

name: The Parkdale Hostellerie
reviewtext: This hostel is still in its renovation stage, unfortunately it is situated in a rough part of Queen Street Street. The facilities are ok but they could move the compost bin in the Kitchen as this accumulated many flies. The staffs were friendly however they need to keep their guests informed when the door codes change as we got locked out for 30 minutes!!  Also note, we were quite surprised at the fact that there is minimal security, i.e no locks on doors & no lockers.

name: The Parkdale Hostellerie
reviewtext: Unfriendly staff. Never book this unless there is an app alyose and this is the only place standing.

name: The Parkdale Hostellerie
reviewtext: When I stayed there, there was no AC and they hadn't finished the bathrooms yet. The girl who gave me a tour said herself that it looks grimy but only because the guy who put in the floors put them in wrong. It's clean, it just looks dirty. Nevertheless, there were a ton of showers available and the common areas were spacey and the folks who already stayed there were pretty nice. It'll be a great place to stay once renovations are finished!

name: The Parkdale Hostellerie
reviewtext: Facilities were as good as can be expected. No lockers available when I stayed and room rarely had the door shut/locked.  Staff seemed to be hard to track down at times - location was perfect though - would stay again :-)

name: The Only Backpacker's Inn
reviewtext: Great place

name: The Only Backpacker's Inn
reviewtext:
The place is very nice and have a very cool vibe.. the staff where very friendly and the rooms where clean.
The only problem I had was the location and the bar down stairs can get pretty noisy if you planning on sleeping early

name: The Only Backpacker's Inn
reviewtext: Having a subway station right behind the hostel is perfect for commuting downtown but the parking situation if you bring a car requires you to park in a lot where you have to pay for the day at 7am or download an app set up payment and pay ahead. I had great roomates but the hostel does not put on any events during the day and at night. The doors for all the dorms are loud af closing so in the morning you will get an early wake up

name: The Only Backpacker's Inn
reviewtext: Nice hostel right next to the Subway station. They let me stay in the TV room after check out which was nice. Staff is friendly and helpful.

name: The Only Backpacker's Inn
reviewtext: The hostel is slightly out the way which was kind of annoying but it had a really great atmosphere at night and great breakfast. The room was slightly cramped in the 8 bed mixed dorm and it was quite loud due to music from the bar downstairs. So overall an alright experience.

name: The Only Backpacker's Inn
reviewtext: I was staying at the Only Backpacker's Inn for 3 nights. It has a cafÃ© and a bar below also managed by them and both are quite nice. I stayed at a 4 bed mixed dorm and was lucky that I could choose to be in the bottom bunk because the top bunk doesn't have a railing. The room itself had an okay cleanliness, for some reason it smelled in the hostel itself of eucalyptus or sth. similar. The bathroom's cleanliness was okay. I'd recommend  for a short stay.

name: The Only Backpacker's Inn
reviewtext: Internet cuts out every few seconds. Showers and washrooms are terribly small and dirty. Rooms have very few outlets. Lots of rules that the staff don't follow but enforce.

name: The Only Backpacker's Inn
reviewtext: No outside alcohol. No smoking cannabis. No food allowed in rooms, roommates ate in there beds anyway. No blinds on windows? No air conditioning in rooms. Crappy location.

name: The Only Backpacker's Inn
reviewtext: Love my stay here. Although not in downtown, its location makes it very accessible due to the Subway and Bus terminal literally behind the hostel (

name: The Only Backpacker's Inn
reviewtext: Hostel is nice enough, a bit cramped in an 8 bed. Had an awful nights sleep but that's not the hostels fault (snoring dorm-mates). Top bunks don't have a Rail along the side so if you're a restless sleeper be careful. Really liked the area and the bar downstairs seemed cool and always busy.

name: The Only Backpacker's Inn
reviewtext: A very very nice and charming hostel with a cute cafe and proper bar downstairs. The staff was excelent and also the location, altough not in downtown, is in a really nice colourfull Toronto neighbourhood right next to Greek town and just 10m away from Subway that takes you to center of Toronto in no time! Would totally recommend!

name: The Only Backpacker's Inn
reviewtext: chill vibe. Hostel is right in Greektown, so not very touristy but still fun to explore. The bar downstairs is happening every night. A little tricky to find the front desk because it is also the cafe.

name: The Only Backpacker's Inn
reviewtext: This is a very cool hostel! Loved the common rooms (living room, patio, kitchen are all perfect) and the affordable downstairs bar and coffee shop. Everything is beautifully artistic decorated and the staff is very friendly. It was easy to meet others. The downside is no outside alcohol in the building (because of the bar) and noisy screetchy bunks in the 8 bed dorm, along with some snoring men that made it hard to sleep - ear plugs did help :) all in all we really loved this awesome hostel!

name: The Only Backpacker's Inn
reviewtext: They are okay. The only problem I encounter is that when my Service Dog came to stay with me, one of the staff member said I got to leave in the middle of the night. Then, she failed to contact her boss. So, I said let me stay only for a few more hours and I will check out. I also asked all my roommates if they were okay with the dog and they were. So, they let me stay. People just got to know that Service Dog is not a pet and is allowed to accompany their handlers where other people can't go.

name: The Only Backpacker's Inn
reviewtext:
Nice hostel with great staff. Bar and cafe attached. decent sized rooms, plenty of showers, with a large kitchen and big basement lounge.
No alcohol unless bought from bar.

name: The Only Backpacker's Inn
reviewtext: Had some trouble finding out where to check in but everything else is smooth. There's a cafe and bar downstairs mostly with older clientele

name: The Only Backpacker's Inn
reviewtext: Overall a good experience. Would recommend.

name: The Only Backpacker's Inn
reviewtext:
Located in a nice part of town outside the centre of the city but with a train station right next door allowing you to get to the centre in minutes. Also surrounded by bars and restaurants.
The staff were also really friendly and helpful at giving advice for the rest of my trip.
Will definately be first choice of places to stay when I come back.

name: The Only Backpacker's Inn
reviewtext: One of the best hostels stays I've ever had, and I've stayed at a lot in Toronto.

name: The Only Backpacker's Inn
reviewtext: I spent two nights here and it wasn't bad, but it has a couple things that are keeping it from being great, the bedrooms and beds are not nice(although pretty comfy). The biggest complaint is the roofs in each bedroom have a square where the light comes in throug and makes it hard to sleep during day times or morning times, as well as the bathrooms aren't the best but aren't bad. The bar was alright, and the outside and lounge areas where pretty cool. Also right next to the metro.

name: The Only Backpacker's Inn
reviewtext: We wouldn't come back here. It could be an amazing hostel with their delicious breakfast, common areas and great staff, but they let locals live in the dorms. We stayed in an 8-bed dorm and 5 of those beds were taken by long-term residents. It was horrible. The bedroom always stank, it was disgusting. The "residents" weren't tidy and they looked at us as if we were trespassing! Same thing happened during breakfast and in the kitchen. It was extremely unwelcoming and uncomfortable.

name: The Only Backpacker's Inn
reviewtext:
Good place with a bar and cafe downstair.  The greek street nearby is very vonvenient.  
The staff kindly helped me check in in the midnight because my flight was delayed for 4 hours.
It is a bit far from the downtown and famous sightseeing spots, but it didn't matter to me because I love to use public transportation. 
I will definitely come back here for next Toronto!

name: The Only Backpacker's Inn
reviewtext:
- The staff is very chill, friendly, and helpful
-Dormrooms were comfortable and I loved that they had fruit for breakfast
- The cafe and beer bar was very convenient and nice to hang out

name: The Only Backpacker's Inn
reviewtext:
The hostel just isn't very clean at all, bathrooms were pretty disgusting. 
Outside of the rooms it was absolutely boiling in all the bathrooms and public areas. Rooms had small AC units which at least cut through the stuffiness a bit. 
I was on the top bunk and didn't feel safe at all. They are very rickety and old with no side rail. 
The cafe, bar and patio areas are all very nice places to chill but the hostel itself wasn't amazing.

name: The Only Backpacker's Inn
reviewtext: Good hostel right next to the subway! There is a beer bar downstairs which was good. Breakfast was pretty decent for a hostel!  It was good, it just lacks atmosphere! The rest is all ok.

name: Rex Hotel
reviewtext: great place!

name: Rex Hotel
reviewtext: This is more of a cheap hotel than a hostel but it was really good. Great location on Queen Street and with its own jazz bar playing every day.

name: Hostel Toronto
reviewtext:
It's kind of in the dodgy area of town (but if you're like me and don't mind that, it's totally fine, I'd just rather warn you!) It feels mega safe as they lock the doors and looks very welcoming!
The only thing for me was that there wasn't a locker in my room but otherwise, standard beds, great kitchen and bathroom facilities.

name: Hostel Toronto
reviewtext: In spite of the fact that i did not sleep a single night in the hostel, excellent stay! Staff was very welcoming! Until they decided to call the cops on me :(

name: Hostel Toronto
reviewtext: The rooms were very clean however the bathrooms weren't super clean and could have been checked more, especially the toilet paper.

name: Hostel Toronto
reviewtext: The hostel is clean and nice enough, the staff were helpful but the area is a bit dodgy. I avoided walking around by myself in the evening.

name: Hostel Toronto
reviewtext: Staff were fantastic. Location was walkable to downtown. No lockers which was a bit of a bummer and our dorm ensuite shower flooded- though it was nicely renovated. Some mirrors in the rooms would be handy! Otherwise I thought it was clean and the air conditioning was a nice touch.

name: Hostel Toronto
reviewtext: Good all round hostel. Friendly staff in a good location.

name: Hostel Toronto
reviewtext: I enjoyed my stay at Hostel Toronto. Easily accessible by the public transport. Staff were very friendly and very helpful. Only downside was the room I was in had no lockers - not even little ones to put valuables in. Luckily nothing happened but having the option would be nice.

name: Hostel Toronto
reviewtext:
An ok hostel. The immediate area is nice but I wouldn't walk three blocks in any direction at night alone as it is near some public housing developments and I was harassed by people there. The hostel itself is clean and the facilities are good, no stove though so note this if you plan to cook yourself. The rooms lock with a keycard but front door doesn't lock and people can just walk in which is concerning considering the location. 
Best advise is stay here with a friend.

name: Hostel Toronto
reviewtext: It was alright for the money spent, good atmosphere and decently clean. Though security is not the best. I was told upon arrival that past 11 the front door would be locked and to get it open we would have to ring the bell and the superintendent would be there to open it. However after a night out I arrived back at the hostel at 3am to find that the front door was open and the superintendent was asleep with his door closed. The rest of the staff I interacted with were pleasant.

name: Hostel Toronto
reviewtext: My sisters and I stayed here for 2 nights. Our 6 person room was pretty hot even though we had the air conditioning cranked. Staff was nice. I played drums at the open mic night on Sunday which was fun! Didn't cook anything but there was an area to do so. Bathroom was small but we didn't have any trouble sharing. Overall a good experience.

name: West Queen West Hotel
reviewtext: The bathrooms were a mess, and the shower almost impossible to use. Very, very basic accommodation.

name: West Queen West Hotel
reviewtext:
I had read previous reviews and knew that this place is nothing flash. All I wanted was a decent night's sleep. But that wasn't happening with a rave going on downstairs until 4am. And it really does stink of old cigarettes. 
The girl working behind the desk the next morning was lovely though and did her best to keep guests happy.

name: Alexandra Hotel
reviewtext:
Its like living in  crappy apartment.  Its small, dirty, old and rundown.  But you have the basics like a bed and hot water. 
Here's a list of cons to elaborate:
1) Pipes are old
2) Bathtub clogged.  Water wouldn't drain making shower impossible without flooding.
3) Bathtub filthy making bath very inadvisable.  
4) Sheets and towels had holes from being worn out and old.
5) Staff wasn't really friendly and didn't really clean my room. 
6) AC had no remote, I had to climb table to reach.

name: Alexandra Hotel
reviewtext: The 'hotel' lived up to our low expectations. You can only expect so much when you are paying so little to stay somewhere. With that being said, we found a bug in one of our beds!!! We brought it down to the front desk to notify them. All they did was release it outside and said 'I'm sorry'. They did nothing to compensate us in any way. Also, he did not record this at all. How is the room supposed to be cleaned/searched for more bugs if the receptionist didn't do anything? We won't ever be back.

name: Arty Paris Porte de Versailles by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Staff were very friendly. No air con in our dorm so it was very warm at night. Beds were comfy but the blanket was not clean. Close to metro and tram stops as well as good restaurants and bakery!

name: Arty Paris Porte de Versailles by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: We really loved it. The neighbourhood is amazing if you are wanting to be in a non-tourist area and mix with the citizens of Paris. The elevator is small, but what can you do. We would and will stay at this amazing hostel the next time we are passing thru.

name: Arty Paris Porte de Versailles by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
It was a good place to stay if you don't mind walking or taking bus or train, because everything was minimum of 35-40 minutes distance.
People that work there was super nice and helpful.

name: Arty Paris Porte de Versailles by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: nice stay. staff very helpful. shld try corner bakery near ibis.

name: Arty Paris Porte de Versailles by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
The room was very small. No space to put my bags without disturbing other people.
The bathroom was so small you can't put your clothes on, and it was dirty.
We had 2 beds at the top and there were no plugs, only one for the beds below.
There was a lot of noise outside at night.

name: Arty Paris Porte de Versailles by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Was a great place with lovely receptionists. The breakfast was a good quick way to get the day started. Unfortunately they close off the kitchen until 1pm to encourage you to buy their breakfast. The beds were comfortable but the lockers were tight and very noisy. We had a tiny bathroom with a blocked drain and the light stopped working which was unfortunate, but they were quick to get onto it a transfer all of us to a nice spatious room with a large bathroom

name: Arty Paris Porte de Versailles by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
Great experience! Staff were very friendly and helpful. We had a private double room which was clean, comfortable and nicely decorated. Bathroom was small but clean and everything worked fine.

The breakfast is convenient and at 6 euros per person is better value than going to a local cafÃ©.

The communal areas seemed comfortable and well equipped with games and instruments.

Would recommend if you don't mind being a bit out of the centre (but with good transport links).

name: Arty Paris Porte de Versailles by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Only issue was the incredibly small elevator and narrow staircase. I'm claustrophobic so it was a problem for me. Everything else was great.

name: Arty Paris Porte de Versailles by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Need some space in the toilet

name: Arty Paris Porte de Versailles by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Good hostel. The staff talks in various languages. French, English, Spanish , Italian. This was great. The facilities are great, everything is clean.

name: Arty Paris Porte de Versailles by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Nice place but not much happening in the area...

name: Arty Paris Porte de Versailles by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Nice hostal although a bit far from the city centre and all the tourist attractions. Not that much of a party atmosphere but you can definitely meet some nice people there. We shared a room with 2 more people and noticed our shower was clogged so they upgraded us to a private room with a shower which was great. Only downside is no air conditioning but you can manage without it.

name: Arty Paris Porte de Versailles by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: We loved this hostel and I would definelty reccomend staying here. It's in a safe neighborhood with a metro very close and lots of good restaurants nearby. The staff was incredibly helpful and friendly.

name: Arty Paris Porte de Versailles by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
The Hostel is close to a really nice park and a lot of cute cafe's are around. It was clean, but the bathroom was tiny and had no window. When it's hot outside the room is also really hot by night. 
It's a nice not overpriced hostel. It is worth the money.

name: Arty Paris Porte de Versailles by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: The location was not very central but is near tram, train and bus stops, its also good to note that the kitchen is only open for dinner as they want you to buy their breakfast option. We payed for a 4 share dorm and were upgraded to a 2 bed 'hotel room' which was nice and the staff were lovely.

name: Arty Paris Porte de Versailles by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Bell'ostello. Ottima posto per trascorrere qualche giorno a parigi. Non molto in centro ma vicino a supermarket, panetteria tipica francese, ristorante, fast food e linea metro M12 a 15 minuti di distanza. Un ringraziamento speciale a Monia, membro dello staff che ti fa sentire come se fossi a casa (parla italiano).

name: Arty Paris Porte de Versailles by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Clean rooms, bathrooms and kitchen, there's a supermarket close by and friendly staff who were very helpful. I enjoyed my stay here!

name: Arty Paris Porte de Versailles by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Not a bad stay. The rooms are very cramped and the bathrooms are tiny.  But it's manageable and clean. I would consider returning and recommend to others

name: Arty Paris Porte de Versailles by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: The staff were lovely and the location was great! However, the four share bedroom I was in was very hot, the ensuite was extremely small, the floors needed a sweep, and there was mould on the walls.

name: Arty Paris Porte de Versailles by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: I was only here for one night - but overall a good hostel to stay in. Met some nice people, but the common area seemed small. Small but clean bathroom. Lots of electrical plug ins. Staff for both my check in and out were friendly.

name: Arty Paris Porte de Versailles by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Nice place, very clean and friendly. Excellent vibe. Felt very comfortable here.

name: Arty Paris Porte de Versailles by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: I stayed in a four bed private, the room was really small with no AC and no available fan, so the room was really hot (even with the window opened). The hostel is about a 30 minute bus/metro ride from the top attractions (this is pretty common in Paris). The hostel was pretty clean and the staff was super nice. The kitchen was my favorite part as it was really big and had plenty of seating. This is a child friendly hostel, so the vive was very positive and secure, which I liked.

name: Arty Paris Porte de Versailles by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: The staff is very nice and helpful. They answer all my questions nicely. Location is ok with public transport. The kitchen is spacious and I cook most of the time. Recommended.

name: Arty Paris Porte de Versailles by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: It was okay. Staff was useless and seemed really confused about any question asked (not due to language barrier as i speak french). Shower and bathroom in the dorm is really great. Super clean. Zero atmosphere. I would not recommend if youre travelling alone.

name: Arty Paris Porte de Versailles by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
Security: lockers didn't work properly. 

Staffs: weren't that nice. 

Pros: cheap, the atmosphere

Cons: location, you cannot use kitchen in the morning

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Wifi was pretty much non existent, second time staying here. Big fan 10/10 if they get Wifi fixed

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Never stayed in a hostel before was very clean and secure staff were very helpful with information and storing bags after check out would recommend this hostel

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Stayed for 4 nights and overall was good. Plus sides are the friendly staff, cleanliness & the ensuite and balcony in a 4 bedroom. I didn't mind the location too much (not the trendiest area), but easy to get to other areas. Downside is the atmosphere of the hostel is lacking, not much of social opportunities to meet new people, but that was fine considering my itinerary for Paris. Also, the beds were creaky and facilities look outdated, it could do a makeover, but all in all a good stay.

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Location: great and seemed safe (close to Gare du Nord for arrivals, ~10 min from Sacre-Coeur, and ~2 min from metro so it's easy to get around). Security: okay (rooms have key card, but lockers are too small for bags (maybe laptop?)). Atmosphere: okay (depends on you) - no events/parties, pretty quiet, but I was able to meet roommates. Room had a weird smell at first but went away. Ensuite was clean. I don't know about the common bathroom. Expensive, but that's just Paris - so overall worth it

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Staff wasn't very friendly at my arrival.

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
Location and security was good. 

However, the room was tiny and we were on top of each other with our luggage.

There was a person in our dorm who's snoring defied humanistic bounds. Not the hostel's fault but when asked if they would swap the room for this, they refused so I decided to move that day.

Pretty mediocre stay.

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
1. Location is not the best. Decent only.
2. To access their lift, you need to climb 8-10 stairs both up and down to get to your room. With heavy suitcases, it was a problem!
3. The rooms are very small, the bathroom is not built for ease of use.. the tissues are strangely placed on your back side, so you would have to turn almost 180 degrees to use them. Bathing area is very small is size. Pot flush is not as effective!
4. Bed bugs!! I got lot of red rash the next day.

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Thank you for your hospitality! All in all, we were happy with our stay. There is only one thing we noticed: There could be more stowage space in the bathroom, e.g. rods for towels, shelving etc.

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Great hostel that I'd stay at again. The front desk staff was very friendly, the room was clean and felt safe (there was a small locker in the room for valuables if you brought a lock), and the location was excellent (walking distance to the Moulin Rouge...that I felt safe enough to walk to at 10:30pm by myself...and a 5 minutes walk to the Gare du Nord station that had excellent connections to the metro lines to tourist attractions).

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Nice facilities (shower, bathroom). The room (4bed dorm) was a bit small. Location is close to sacre coeur and about 8-9 mins walk from big train/metro station.

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Nice place but the bunkbeds were squeaky. The room got a bit stuffy even when the ventilation was on.

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Very conveniently located. Nicely run place!

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: It was nice stay at vintage, location is alright, closer enough to get to the main train station; bed is clean, bathroom is clean. Had everything we need, so all HAPPY!

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
Easily the worst hostel I've stayed at for my entire two month trip. But you can't beat the value for Paris.

Not the most social vibe, but I met some people in my dorm.

Things are clean enough, but the place is showing its age.

They don't provide hand soap in the bathrooms which is a first.

One big plus is that my room had a balcony, but not all rooms have one.

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: It smells on the way down, otherwise it's fine. Just stayed one night.

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
Whilst the hostel is in a handy location, it's a good price and it's clean enough- the staff are all absolutely useless. Even emailing ahead of time and getting confirmation on the easy request, wasn't clear for them.. took 2 days and 5 staff members to get anywhere.  No one seems to have any idea what's going on

Even when we asked for simple things like "where is the nearest market?" It was all a bit confusing and difficult for the staff.. i suggest you just Google it,  rather than asking!!

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: The worst staff ever since the check in, when they said I had no reservation. Not just that, my bed sheets were not  clean.

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Overall good, but breakfast and other extra services were a bit expensive. The first night the room was overbooked (5 people in a 4 bed room) and the receptionist seemed to be overwhelmed by even the most simple tasks. On later days the other receptionists were nicer and more competent.

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Overall, the hostel was ok. They have these cages below the bed that you can lock but don't put anything valuable as people can still reach in - I had some money stolen out of my bag. The guy that checked me in was nice but the rest of the staff didn't seem that friendly and one even checked someone into my bed. The location is near the train station which is good but a bit far away from the main tourist attractions and will take some time on the metro to get places. Not much of a social vibe.

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Me and my friend's experience at this hostel was utterly terrible. I lost my backpack that contained important documents and belongings here. We told some of the staff and was met with poor attitude and hostility. They acted as if we intentionally left our belongings, blaming us. I acknowledge that the hostel is not responsible for the loss of personal property,but the way that they spoke to me was unprofessional. They forgot to give me a dryer token, and I had to take a train with wet clothes.

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Its okay for late one night stay. Small cramped room dirty not equipped.

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: The staff at reception were always very friendly and helpful, My stay was very comfortable, working air-con, hot/cold shower available, balcony, and felt the security was reassuring. Location is great too, short walk to the Metro, and could get anywhere from there. Lots of good places for food and shopping within walking distance of the hostel also. I would stay here again :)

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: The beds were too creaky so if anyone moved in the top or bottom, it made a lot of noise. I'm sure that all 4 of us in the room woke up several times throughout the night.  The street beside our room was also very loud even with the window closed. Location is good but bed frames need some change.

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Very secure hostel, don't be put off by the area near the train station, that's just what major train stations are like. Very secure hostel, good facilities, right near Montmartre and Sacre-cÅ“ur. The atmosphere in the hostel is mixed, can be very social. The Spanish lady on reception was incredibly lovely and so friendly. Rooms are a bit small but that's Paris for you. Air conditioning in the rooms helped so much with this heat.

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Excellent staff, have a great stay in Paris.

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: I wish I could rate higher on the staff rating. The people here are amazing and you will never have a better and more friendly group at a hostel.

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Great hostel, very good wifi, staff is very kind, a lot of facilities and very clean. The location if you are just walking is kinda difficult for visiting monuments, museums and clubs, but if you are by bike or car, not a problem. The good thing about location is that you have a lot of places near to eat and for a very small price. Supermarkets and pharmacies are close too

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: We stayed two nights here in a mixed 4 bed room which was rather small but had a balcony which was nice to sit out on. The staff were all really friendly and gave good advice as to how we could get to places and where to eat etc. The kitchen wasn't great as it was quite small and the storage and facilities were limited. The location is good for the metro and a short walk to the Gare du Nord so that was really good. Dodgy area at night so wouldn't go alone but other than that good hostel!

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Awesome hostel! I love that there was a gym, it's super close to the train station, and the staff are all really friendly! My only suggestion would be to offer slightly more space to store food since there were often things falling out of the fridge every time you opened it.

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: This is a great hostel for Paris - the bathrooms are large, beds comfy and the staff is very friendly. However, I find it completley unreasonable that you aren't allowed to use the kitchen between 7am and 12pm. Their breakfast option is an absolute waste of money (it's what I'd expect of a free breakfast, nothing more) so it's dissaponting that they don't give people the option to ever grab some basic items from the fridge that they've purchased from the supermarket. They need to reconsider this

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Very good location but didn't have a very social or meet you people vibe except for who you met in your rooms. Luckily I met some amazing people and had a fun experience in the city

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Traveled solo and stayed in a 4-bed female dorm. The hostel was pretty quiet, which may or may not be a good thing depending on your preferences. Beds were comfy/clean, but squeaky. Bathroom was bigger than I expected, and, aside from some mildew in between shower tiles, pretty clean too. Staff wasn't overly friendly, but they were far from rude and were helpful if you had questions. Liked the location best: quiet area, plenty of things to do nearby and short walk/metro ride to busier areas.

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Fairly small rooms

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: I would recomment Vintage. I stayed in a 4 bed female dorm and was quite pleased. If you know your way around the metro, the location is fabulous as you are surrounded by metro stations and even Gare Du Nord. There were large lockers available (bring your own padlock) as well as smaller pay-per-use lockers. The aircon was definitely a plus during my stay. If you're looking for a party hostel, this isn't it but the people are very nice. Overall, had a great stay.

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: This hostel is very clean and has great facilities! It is a bit far from tourist things if you're a walker like me but it is conveniently near the train station so if you don't want to walk you could use the metro.

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Really great time staff were great, and great showers, and Clean

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
It's a good hostel! Everything is clean, the staff is amazing. 
It's a little hard to find, or at least it was hard for me. 
But it's really close to the metro station

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Good location for a good price! They offered everything I needed. Near the metro and Gare Du Nord so it was perfect for my time there.

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Vintage was a great hostel! They came in to clean the room everyday and there were many metros within a short walking distance. The staff was very helpful with directions to anywhere, including Disney and the airport. The AC in the room worked great. The only thing that was an inconvenience was the kitchen being closed until noon. Other than that, my stay there was fantastic!

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: I only had a quick night here but the staff were very friendly, the facilities and beds great (even a small gym downstairs), and even though it's not the best part of Paris I had a train the next morning which left from right up the street. Overall solid stay

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Good place to stay near Sacre Coer on a budget. Everything was smooth and easy.

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: ac!! nice !! private shower !  !!

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Nice place but not much socializing. No lockers in my room, which is always a bit odd. First hostel I've been to with a little gym, so that's a plus.

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Not a party hostel but plenty of friends to be made.

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Location is fantastic, AC is cold and a private bathroom for the room. What more can you ask for. It was amazing.

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: This hostel was great and exceeded my expectations! It was a quick 10 min walk from the Gare Du Nord and the staff were very welcoming. I was in a 4 bedroom female dorm with an ensuite. Perfect size and the ensuite was clean - just didn't have any soap to wash your hands or hand towels to dry. The atmosphere was very quiet while I was there may have just been the time I was there. Supermarkets and Metros super close. Would definitely recommend and stay again! Thanks :)

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: I was only one night in Paris. It slipped by too quickly. The hostel was perfect. The staff were kind and helpful. I left quickly in the morning to catch my plane. The hostel was super clean. What you see is what you get. Excellent faculties. The photographs on hostel world are acurate. Would love to stay here again for a few more days. Great hostel.

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
Great, hostel did everything I needed it to. However, lockers are quite small, about 1-2 sq foot, enough for some items, not your luggage.
When I strolled immediately to the west/south-west of the hostel, the area  was lovely, not too busy, lots of boulangeries and fruit stalls, mini markets etc. I'd stay here again!

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: If you're visiting London you have to stay here! The staff is incredibly nice and the hostel offers a lot of free events to get to know other people and the location better. You are within walking distance to so many sites and public transportation. The free breakfast is great and having a bar right there is so convenient. They had fans to cool the rooms down and the room was so clean. Such a great value for your money. I will definitely stay here again when I come back to London.

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Rooms were a bit small, and annoying you can't use the kitchen between 7 and 12 because cleaning and breakfast!

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: This is a great hostel. The dorm rooms are a bit small, but everything else is great. The staff are so nice and helpful. I lost track of my friend on a bar crawl and the staff let me use the phone and helped me sort it out. Thanks again.

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Stayed one night. Staff super nice but no free breakfast. Room was a little dirty and the inside looks very old. Overall pretty good stay

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Loved the fact it had air con here. Rooms were clean and staff mostly helpful and friendly. Not the easiest place to meet new people if you're a solo traveller though. Overall though not a bad hostel.

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: This is a greatly locate hostel in Paris with lovely and helpful staff.

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: The place was easy to find you had to ring a bell to get in so unwanted guest out were kept out I had a room with a queen bed which was comfortable but my only draw back was the shower door opening which only 10 - 12 inches wide luckily I'm not a big person, any large person good luck  in getting in the shower. There was a kitchen that can be used for preparing meals, a closet that was controlled by staff that could store your luggage which I utilized on my last day since check out time is 11am.

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Such an amazing stay! I met a lot of very cool people from all over the world and the staff was so approachable and fun to talk to! I specifically choose this place because of the air conditioning and it made all the difference in the summer. A lot of restaurants didn't even have AC and the heat can drain your energy pretty fast so it was nice to come back to this hostel. Very clean, and the location is near Montmarte, Gare Du Nord and 2 metro stations!

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
The staff were not overly friendly. 
It wasn't very clean. 
The location - well it was close to Sacre Coeur and Gare du Nord so if that works for you it's good. 
It didn't feel like the safest street. 
There was never any free coffee... which is disappointing.

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Close to Gare du nord making it easy to get everywhere. Place is clean and very nice. Air con in the rooms was great!

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: This was my second stay at the hostel, but not my last one. It is a typical hostel for Paris, located in a former hotel. It is for sure less cramped than some other Parisian hostels I've stayed at. The location for me is perfect, halfway between Gare du Nord and SacrÃ©-Coeur, in a quiet safe street and next to a small supermarket. When you stay a bit longer, bring your sports gear since they have a small gym in the basement.

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Great place to stay, close to the metro and easy to get to all the great places in Paris! Only thing is you can't use the kitchen between 8am and 12 which is a little annoying if you're on a budget or have to cook your own food! The staff are lovely and it's a nice chill place to stay (and the rooms have aircon, and there's a free gym too!).

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: I stayed for two nights in this hostel, very good! everything very clean, friendly reception and most importantly has air conditioning is July and is absurdly warm, I will be back!

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Satisfied. Location is especially good since it is very close to a station.

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: super clean and simple! just what you need. its right next to gare du nord, which can be a little dodgy, but if you walk the other direction then the neighbourhood is very cute and charming! there's laundry, ironing, and even a gym! lots of metro stations nearby. good if you're looking for no fluff.

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Good simple hostel, the rooms are pretty small but some have balconies which is nice. The part of Paris is a bit more sketch, but not to bad and convenient access to metro.

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: A good place to stay in Paris

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: I stayed here for 2 nights actually, with a gap in between - I decided to extend my trip to stay for the world cup final and chose to return here because it was a fantastic experience. The staff are wonderful people, it wasn't too pricey, it felt very safe and the lobby is a fine place to hang out, I was hoping to make friends here and I definitely succeeded credit partially due to the social atmosphere left out. Would return definitely.

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Easy to get to hostel, close to some local sites including the Moulin Rouge, staff very friendly, rooms basic but clean. Only annoying thing is you can't use the kitchen in the morning as they supply a breakfast deal.

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: This place has A/C!  That was my biggest concern but luckily it was nice and cold in the room.  Staff was friendly, location was great, price was good.  Overall a great place to stay for a couple nights in Paris!

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: This was my first hostel experience, and it was amazing! It's such an affordable option considering its proximity to the metro station and which arrondissements it is near. The only down side to my experience was that I booked an airport transfer through them, which they instructed that I needed to wait in the lobby for the driver to come get me. A driver did come in and the concierge motioned for me to go with him, but it was not for the correct company and I had to pay an extra 47 Euros.

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Great place to stay , close to everything , nice staff . Recommended 100%

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Pretty nice place. Helps being close to the train staion

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: One of the best hostels that I have stayed so far :)

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Highly recommend it. Its definitely ear-marked for me everytime I come to Paris. Safe, clean and central. And very friendly hosts. Couldn't ask for more :)

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Amazing staff, super friendly and accommodating! Wish I could stay longer!

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: My second time here and always enjoy it. Close to the metroand Garre Noord, friendly, kitchen facilities and storage. Plus they arranged tours etc. Nice neighborhood with pubs, a local shop for cheaper groceries next door.

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: It's pleasant to stay at hip hop hostel. Will recommend friends

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Great hostel. It had AC, rooms were very charming and spotless, the common area was great- they had a tv so you could watch the games. Martin was the heart and soul of the hostel and made my stay really great. Cons for me were that it's not central and its in a sketchy neighborhood so make sure not to walk back at night, take an uber instead. And they claim to have wifi but they don't. For my entire stay I had to use a computer downstairs to look up some places to see for the next days.

name: Vintage Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Great place. Love the location. Affordable. Well maintained. For Paris, it's great.

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: This hostel canceled on us 3 days prior to our booking, leaving us stranded with no refund

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Probably not a hostel I'd like to go back to. The rooms were small and weirdly organised I was on the top bunk with the main room light right next to my face. It had only one shower and toilet for each level. The toilet on our level didn't have a sink to wash your hands. I found some of that staff lil bit rude and like to ignore you.

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: The bathroom isnot clean, the speeds of internet is really poor

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Hostel was not in the best area. I did not feel safe walking around at night. There was no organized events in order to meet other travellers other than the ones in your room. So overall wouldn't recommend it for solo travellers. There was a puddle of water in our bathroom that never seemes to go away.

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: It is a good hostel, good location, close to metro but with some weird people outside the hostel, good wifi, pretty good kitchen but definetly not large, nice rooms and bathrooms, staff was nice but a bit distant and didn't know a lot of english, overall I would recommend it and would stay again :)

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Would DEFINITELY stay here again....and probably will. I'm not through with Paris!

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Very poor and would not recommend,  had to share a toilet and shower with far too many people, the staff when checking in were not friendly and actually quite rude. Traffic from the street below was very loud and I found it difficult to sleep.

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Fantastic!!! The location, the place, the roomates.

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: 4 bed dorm was nice, the bunks were comfy but a bit old so they squeaked every time you moved. Ensuite was super handy but the bathtub shower is a bit outdated. Thankfully they had an elevator to use with my big suitcase, and there was luggage storing facilities, also had a kitchen but took so long to boil water (over 30mins). Super close to the main train station, around the corner was the Sacre-coeur, down the street from Moulin Rouge and across the road from a metro station. Overall fab

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
Adorei. Pude usar a cozinha e fiz amigos.
Apenas uma recepcionista, na tarde/ noite do dia 03/09 nÃ£o ajudou com minha duvida sobre tomadas e adaptadores.
Faltam tomadas no quarto para celulares e cÃ¢meras.
Faltam copos na cozinha

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Unfortunately the staff let this place down. I found them rude and unhelpful. The actual hostel/hotel is lovely & clean and in a good location. But if you want advice about the local area and are hoping for recommendations from the staff I would probably book somewhere else.

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
Really enjoyed our stay in this hostel! Location was amazing, metro was a 2 min walk away and could easily walk to most monuments. The staff were lovely and helpful with all of our needs. Only thing i would say, is it is quite loud at night as people use the kitchen and we could hear them even though we were on the 3rd floor. 
Thanks very much for our stay!

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: The staff is extremely helpful and friendly. The place is very clean and the location is great as well. I would highly recommend. Enjoy!

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Amazing hostel!

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Located next to Sacre CÅ“ur. My 6 bed room was split in three rooms with two beds. Would recommend!

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Very clean, very nice single rooms, felt like a hotel. Enjoyed my stay.  Staff was very helpful.

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Pretty good, shower head was broken and we had a very strange man in our room. Long story short he was removed and the customer service was very good.

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: This is our second stay at Le Regent Montmartre. We love it there. Great location (the Anvers stop on the 2 train is right across the street). Amazing staff. Wonderful facilities. When we are in Paris, we are staying at Le Regent.

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Friendly staff. Awesome location; just one station away from Gare Du Nord station. Good facilities too, except that the ironing board was broken during my stay, and they didn't have an extra one that I could use

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Good place to stay, very central and the staff were very helpful

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: staff was incredibly helpful, kind, and considerate. after missing on non-refundable first night due to some travel complications (an armed robbery on the train), the staff said they would have to run it by the manager and couldn't make any promises but if we let them make a photocopy of the police report we might be able to get a refund the next morning from the manager, which we did.

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Loved it here! We got the private 3 bedroom and it was awesome. So clean and we loved the private bathroom. The location is so cool surrounded by Vintage and really cool bars and restaurants! The staff was really nice and friendly too, and we recommend the airport transfer it was so much nicer than taking public transportation.

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
We had a great stay at the hostel. 
Pros: 
- it's super close to a metro station, so transport is easy
- there's a few good supermarkets near by
- the famous church sacre-cours is only 5 minutes away
- the rooms a nice
Cons:
- there's only 3 bathroom in the whole hostel, and the hostel is 5 floors, so you should book an ensuite unless you want to wait in line
- there's no hand wash in the bathroom so you have to go back to your room to wash your hands and grabbing a lot of dirty handles

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Location was unsafe. Even the taxi driver told us to not go out at night in that area and to becareful. Close to train station but other than that, horrible location. All else was great!

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: For where it is situated in Paris, the price was extremely reasonable. I paid around Â£350 pounds for 7 nights, which allowed me to see and experience the whole city without breaking the bank. The furnishings are very modern and all the facilities accessible. The streets outside are often dinful until the small hours of the morning but this can only be anticipated from where the establishment is placed. I would recommend Le Regent to all types and all ages of traveller.

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Very helpful arranging an emergency dental appointment . They were sympathetic about my mislaid case. Highly recommended

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Booked this hostel pretty much based on the glowing reviews boasting beautiful hotel-like rooms and the 20 or so pictures on here mimicking these statements. Unfortunately for us I'm pretty sure we were given the worst room in the building. Don't book a 3 bed private room, just don't. Our room looked straight out of a horror movie. I strongly believe something or someone may have died on the carpet and they never cleaned it. Not cool guys

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: We stayed in this hostel for 3 nights and we really enjoyed it. It's very close to the Sacre Couer, 20 minute walk from Gard du Nord station, was easily accessible to transport and had lots of little restaurants and shops around. Felt it was quite pricey but given that it was Paris and it was a great location, it was worth it. Would definitely recommend if you're going for a city break.

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: The cleaner stole 20 euros from me and the showers are tiny.

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Great private room, fully facilitated with a lovely balcony. However the overall location of the hostel was seemingly dodgy. Loud music played often and it seemed unsafe walking to the hostel at night. Great staff and close by to a metro station.

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Great location close to metro station, ground floor entry, an elevator, reasonable value, and fairly quiet considering it is on a main road.  Not really a party hostel.

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: It's a nice hostel but more suited for families and couples as there's no real way to meet people, apart from those who are in your room. The cooking facilities were pretty good but the bathrooms are pretty small and the area it is in is pretty dodgy. I wouldn't recommend it for people travelling alone.

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: The location of the hostel is great! RIGHT next to Sacre CÅ“ur, and just a train ride away from all the best Paris has to offer. The staff was friendly and multilingual, and the rooms were great. Only critique is the breakfast is a bit expensive for what is offered, but overall I would recommend Le Regent.

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: The location is great!! Very, very central. However, they do not have anything to eat inside the hostel--nothing at all so that's a downside. Also, they keep the coffee machine supplies under lock and key and you need to pay at the reception and then follow the person around for sugar, milk etc. So that got a little hectic. But their central location made the trip fun because the metro station is just across the street. Also, it was our luck we met Hugues as the receptionist!

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Not ideal if there's a heatwave as there are no fans or air conditioning in the rooms so you have to leave the windows open. Unfortunately, this means lots and lots of traffic noise if you're on the main road side despite the fantastic view of the Basilica. Great location to stay at and very close to the Metro station and the train station.

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Sono stata 4 notti in una camera tripla privata, ottimo rapporto qualitÃƒÂ  prezzo, ritornerei sicuramente. Unica pecca l'odore di chiuso nella camera quando rientravamo la sera. Ma nel complesso un'ottima esperienza, staff in particolare gentilissimo e sempre disponibile anche prima del soggiorno via email.

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: This was my third say at Le Regent. Over the past 5 years, it has transformed from a perfectly adequate basic hostel to a modern, almost luxurious hotel. Prices are still good (for Paris!) and the location is excellent, adjacent to Anvers Metro and an easy walk from Gare Du Nord. Surrounded by patisseries, boulangeries and restaurants, it is the ideal base in Paris.

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Really enjoyed my stay and helpful staff..only complaint is kitchen area , fridge and food storage too small for no of guests. Kind regards,Leon

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Bedbug hell, really hot rooms and my room key card was not working anymore, when I came back in the evening. Aside from that it was ok.

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: The location is all this place has going for it. Rude staff, and very little security. They close the door at night but you don't actually use your key to get in, it's unlocked. Lost my key and the front desk gave me a new one without asking who I was, I could've said any room and they would've made a new key. Room was dirty, tons of stuff left from people who stayed months ago. Washroom was always dirty. Kitchen was tiny and breakfast completely overpriced.

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: The location is good but the street itself is a bit sketchy at night. The rooms are very clean and nice though there is no air-conditioning. Staff are very nice and there is good wifi, kitchen, laundry and everything needed. Overall a good place to stay for people with relatively low budget.

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
I was given a mixed dorm, even though I had booked an all female dorm. I was directed to a room, where no one was in. I took a shower, walking out of the shower with only a towel to a room with a man! The first reply, when I addressed this topic from the employee was "This is not my responsibility." I only got to switch the room, when another employee came to the check-in counter. 

I had booked by paying extra to have the opportunity to get the money back, when cancelling. Nevertheless, I did n

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Room could do with a fan or something as the room became very hot

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: The staff were not helpful and quite rude. We asked them to call us a taxi to take us to the next hotel and they refused and told us to walk, we had to practically beg them to call for us as the wheel on my suitcase was broken and made it hard for me to carry 18 minutes through the city. Made the stay less enjoyable

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: This place was perfect for my first couple of days in Paris. Wonderful view, very central, I was in the heart of france. Only one tiny locker for valuables, and I had to leave my luggage out in the dorms as there was no place to secure it safely.

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Clean and comfortable beds. Very helpful staff. Would definitely recommend staying again.

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: The private room was NOT at all worth the price. I wish that I had booked a shared room.

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Best hostel ever!! Recommend to everyone!!

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Wish there was air conditioning or at least a fan!

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: I had a wonderful stay! I was in a gorgeous room facing the Sacre Coer, the rooms were tidy and the bathroom was decent. All staff were very friendly and helpful. Best location to stay, as you are right next to the metro line, a 10 minute walk from Gare du Nord, and 5 minutes from the Sacre Coer and Montmartre. Highly recommend staying here! Will be back.

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: I was a bit worried considering how expensive this hostel well compared to others I went to but it was definitely not a bad deal. Paris is expensive in general (especially in summer) and the location, room and facilities were really good. I got a room with a view out to the Scare Coeur (4 bedroom female) which was stunning! Only negative - either had to be hot and queit at night or open the window and get all the noises from the street below us. Lovely clean bathroom as well :)

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Wonderful location and lovely views of Sacre Coeur right from my room! The staff was friendly and helpful. Plenty of storage locker space (for small bags or valuables - not giant ones to fit full luggage) right in the room! The common areas are nice and everything seemed reasonably clean and well maintained. It would have been nice for the hostel to include a small floor towel to put in front of the shower in the room, as some hostels do. Overall, I would stay again!

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Very good. The rooms are very noisey and hot but the staff gave us a fan when this was mentioned to them

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: There is no social vibe to this hostel at all, but aside from that, staff are great and help you with what you need. It is located down the road from some nice Cafes and night clubs and is right next to the subway.

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
Staff was extremely polite and very accommodating, all front desk staff were awesome all the way up to the manager.

The rooms were exceptional, some of the best in my experiences in hostels.

Not many facilities aside from the usual stuff. Not too much information about night life but that was okay.

Very clean, secure, just super super hot. Wished there was some AC or even a fan in the rooms.

Location is pretty far from the bigger attractions but Montmartre is very close by.

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Location was okay. Close enough to the train to get to major monuments. The rooms and bathrooms were filthy, and extremely hot. No fan was available. Most of the staff was very friendly and helpful, however there was one staff member in particular that was so rude it was making most of my stay uncomfortable. I was unable to get a clean towel or toilet paper for the room one day. She stated she would check on it, but never did any thing to help. Terrible experience overall

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: pros: laundry facilities! luggage storage! free internet access. cons: door is left open during the day, room was not cleaned for a whole day. my roommates told me there we're bed bugs in their room but i checked mine and didn't see any. bathroom has mold and ran out of TP. shower overflowed. location is not in the best part of paris but the metro is 2 steps away from the hostel so it's easy to leave.  review is high because out of the 4 nights i stayed, i had roommates 2 nights. quiet place

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: The room was definitely not what was pictured on the website

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: We stayed in a 4 person private room. The room was cosy. However, there was a musty smell and very stuffy. No good ventilation, would need a fan for summer months. The location is not ideal as we were robbed one metro station from the hostel.

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: I really felt unsafe in the area! It's an ok hostel but isn't central. Rooms are super super small. The general common areas are good and clean.

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: stayed here as a solo female and was my first time in a hostel. Apart from being quite antisocial, I can't really fault it. Would recommend to stay here with a friend. Also was very handy having a kitchen.

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Beautiful room, helpful staff and good location.

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Location is okay, staying in here means you are on the door step of Moulin Rouge and a 10 minute walk away from Sacre Coeur, however, the road its situated on isn't the nicest. Although, the facilities are great and the staff where always ready to help. This hostel is also sandwiched in between two metro stations, it was a great option for us as we where inter railing, so we arrived and departed from Gare du Nord, which is only a 10 minute walk away if you don't want to brave the metro.

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Rooms were filthy and there was a lot of noise all night long, wouldn't recommed for its price

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Overall a decent place to stay. It's relatively close to one of the large train stations and there's plenty going on in the area. Prices may seem a bit high, but it is Paris after all. Only complaint, which is a big one, is that I got eaten to death by bed bugs after only 1 night.

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
The rooms were nice but the beds had no sheets, and the lights in my room did not work.

Staff was poor. One lady who worked there was nice, but another receptionist was unnecessarily rude. I asked him to fix the lights, and I got told half an hour later that they were fixed when they weren't at all. When I complained about this, the receptionist did not care.

Kitchen is okay and has a TV, but you aren't allowed the change the channel or turn it up.

Stayed for a night. Wished I didn't.

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Loved our stay if we ever came back to paris would definitely come back!! Cannot praise enough.

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Enjoyed my stay!

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: The room was tiny, and with no AC (this was our fault for not noticing it), however no view and no breeze from the window as our view was blocked so it was really a rough stay overall for us. However, it is an OK hostel if you are on budget.

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Staff are very friendly and helpful. Everything was very clean, room, bathroom etc. Would stay again and highly recommend to anyone!!

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Me Regent Montmarte was fabulous. The staff was extremely helpful and the location perfect.  We hapoened to be there during the above 90 degree temp days and the only suggestion I would make is to have fans for the guests.  Other than that,  it was perfect and you can't go wrong staying here.

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Had stayed here before had a great time., place has recently been upgrade nicely.  Lobby and all common Reas are more expansive. Pirice seem to have gone up but hey its July imn Paris. Over all highly recomended , the staff is wonderfull , friendly , hard working and give their best. Was pleasantly suprised that they remembered me from a visit 2 years ago.

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: This was my first hostel experience and overall good. It's not a party hostel but still met some very nice people. It was clean and the bed was decent. It is a far walk from the main attractions such as the Eiffel Tower and the Louvre but very close to SacrÃ© Coeur and Moulin Rouge. Montmartre is a great area to explore!

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
LeRegent is a perfect taste of Paris ! It's located in such a great area, literally a 3 minute walk to the gorgeous Sacre-Couer and there's a train station right out the front that gives you access to all of the great things Paris has to offer!
The staff were friendly and helpful whenever we needed them.
We stayed in the twin private room and it was great! Very clean, had everything we needed and even a gorgeous little balcony to enjoy the sunset! Would highly recommend this hostel !

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Nice, young crowd staying there, but the common room was fairly average and was tough to meet people unless you were sharing a room. Other than that no problem, close to the night life and nice and clean.

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
Bunks were infested with bed bugs. Disgusting. Staff were nice but I'd prefer not to have bugs crawling over me at night. Staff said they treated the area but the next person who used the bed got bites as well. Not good enough.

I was transferred to another room for one night but I still feel disturbed from the experience.

Bathrooms also had mould on the sealing and joints.

The front door was left open.

I would not recommend this hostel, which is a shame because the staff were friendly.

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Positives: Great location, great staff (especially Hugues, who went above and beyond to help us figure out how to get to Beauvais Airport at 4am), and a clean room. There is laundry. Negatives: The shared bathrooms facilities on our floor were GROSS. The toilet was always a disaster, and the shower had black mold and looked like it was never cleaned. Our room also faced the airshaft, which was a nightmare, as you can hear every word of every other person in the place until very, very late.

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Great hostel!

name: Le Regent Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Ive stayed here twice. It's always been good. I think this is a great place to stay for quicker trips to Paris as it's close to the airport tram. Not much of a social atmosphere but well connected to the city

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: F**king amazing hostel

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Very nice place and beautiful atmosphere in the pub.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Great overall experience! Will need to take public transportation to get anywhere but it is near to mutliple train stations. Privacy curtains are so nice and something every hostel should have!

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Very annoying check in process. The lockers are for hire and only take Euro coins so you have to trek around looking for an ATM in order to take out euro just to pay a 5 euro locker fee. The towels have to be rented which is really annoying considering how pricey a stay is to begin with and then they make you pay an 8 euro deposit for the towel and return that money to you in cash even though you pay on card. 8 euros not needed if you are leaving the country

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Overall it was a good experience, the hostel is on a canal which is super cute and a quick walk to the park or the subway to get into the main city attractions. The rooms and bathroom were clean, and it's nice that there's a restaurant and bar that get pretty busy at night so it's a good place to grab a drink or food and meet people. We didn't realize that the free breakfast that's advertised is only free if you order directly through their site, so be aware of that.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext:
Pros:
- On the canal
- Short wall to public transportation
- Some good food around
- Curtains for privacy in shared rooms
- Lockers under bed
