- Shuttle to Versailles from hostel
- Free breakfast if you book through the website (not Hostelworld)
- Descent beds
- Fun environment, nice people

Cons:
- Only one outlet in shared women's bathroom, which is also used for hand dryer
- Lockers are really cages, so someone could pull small objects through
- Showers auto shut off every 10 seconds

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: The hostel and attached bar and restaurant are great. Facilities clean and the beds are very nice. Lockers could have been a little bigger. The only down side is the hostel is a little way out from the centre but also very near 2 metro stations, which makes getting to everywhere very easy. The only negative of my stay was one night the bar was closed but a group of us still managed to have a great  night in the surrounding area.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext:
The tap didn't work, the swipe card for the room only worked about 20% of the time, and the lockers were locked shut. 

Having stayed here three months ago at the beginning of my trip I was in the same room. I reported all of these issues at this time, and nothing had been rectified.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Nice space to sit and have breakfast on the canal. Room door was broken therefore locked in/ out of the room and the tap only ran hot. I reported the issue to staff who reassured me that maintenance would fix it right away. The issue was not resolved during my stay. On the night prior to departure, a fellow traveller enlightened me that they raised the same issue to staff three months prior. Clearly the hostel do not take these issues seriously.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: No coments

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: As far as hostels go, it's pretty good. As a solo traveler I did the walking tour and met a bunch of people through that and had a great time. The bar downstairs gets bumping but you can't hear it upstairs in the room at all really. Also it is literally on the canal which is cool. Only issue is that it's not super close to anything but the metro. Didn't hinder me at all but I didn't stay out super late either so if you're out partying it could be hard to get back.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Good atmosphere and friendly staff. Overall nice stay but the curtains on the bed were broken and toilets were not clean. Charged a fee for luggage storage in lockers.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: The restrooms needs to be remodeled, very old and unappealing

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: The hostel is right on the river with beautiful view from the rooms. The staff is mighty cooperative. Very lively bar and sitting area. Not very impressed with the cleanliness. There was a pungent smell in the hallway of our floor and in our room as well.Location is a bit ok. Nearest metro station is 600m from hostel. Locker charge is 4 Euro for a day which is insane. The lift tooks ages to come. You can climb the stairs twice and lift would still not have arrived.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Staff seemed to get very overwhelmed at the front desk, and when ordering food they basically didn't even know their own menu. Location was okay, but at night it was super loud with people still drinking/partying outside until dawn. No kitchen, only a microwave, which was only sometimes there. Rooms/bathrooms were good. Atmosphere overall was good as well

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: It was great until I woke up and found a bed bug in my bed. I squashed it right away and it was definitely a bed bug because blood came out :( I got three itchy bed bug bites and told reception. They put me in another room and gave me my money back after I had to ask for a refund for that night. The atmosphere downstairs is fun and I met a lot of cool people but won't be returning.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Sketchy location at night. Staff not very helpful at building community for solo travelers, party environment but just cheap beer in the downstairs lobby, loud, expensive for value. Clean bathrooms. But not good if you're looking to make real connections

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext:
The good part was that the staff were very friendly and that the food in the kitchen was good. They had a great food selection.
The hostel was in a rather sketchy area of town. I did not feel comfortable walking back in the dark as I usually did at the other hostels. 
The bathrooms stank of sewer and the room smelled musty and stank of dirty feet even with windows open. 
It seemed that someone else had slept in my bed since it had lady been changed,  since there was dirt and hair on the sheet .

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Good breakfast, decent enough staff. Were upgraded to private for free, which made the experience more decent. The rooms and showers are meh, more like a camp than a hostel. The bararea looked cool and the voulenteers were nice enough. Okay stay, but would not necessarily stay again!

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: It's an okay place to stay it has all the facilities you need and the beds are okay.  The curtains provide a little bit of privacy which is always good. A bit far away from a lot of things so you must be organised before doing your day trips as it can be a little out of the way.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext:
Really good location, in front of the canal, rooms and bathrooms clean, friendly staff, downstairs bar and club, good vibe, sometime too loud but it's ok, great atmosphere, cheap morning market every Thursday next to,
One thing Hostel's foods and beds are quite expensive.
Beside that everything its fine

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Very clean! I loved the curtains on the beds for privacy. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. Short walk from several different metros. My only complaint was the laundry facility was broken and the free breakfast is misadvertized.. apparently you don't get it if you book through Hostelworld website. Overall, very clean and nice!

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Absolutely amazing experience. Met so many people. You are in very good hands with Beatrice. She is a master planner, coordinator, wing woman, party animal with an infectious smile that will connect you with amazing people from all over the world. Love this hostel, made so many friends. Will be back.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Nice staffs , but had problem with the key  twice and the elevatorðŸ˜« but all in all it was a nice & clean place, I  also liked the curtain in the bed gave me some privacy.  Price & location  is good. Would recommend this place definitely. If  I am in Paris I will stay in this place again.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Such a nice hostel. By the canal, great atmosphere downstairs where the bar/restaurant is. Very very clean, lovely toilets and bathrooms, and big lockers for each bed. Really worth the money, and it's location is only a short metro ride away from the centre. Would definitely come again!

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Great location on the Canal. Great Views. The neighborhood is walkable and the train is minutes away.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Had a great time at this hostel! Beautiful location and the facilities are great. Would recommend to others!

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext:
Convenient 3 day stay. Friendly and helpful reception. The restaurant food is great and so is the bar. 
Wifi is reliable. Highly recommended if you looking for low budget accommodation.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Great hostel! The bar makes it super easy to meet people if you are traveling solo. Good location, about 8 minute walk from the main metros to get to the inner city. My group went to the larger sister-hostel one night for live music (the bar there is much bigger/louder).

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: I had a few problems checking in to this hostel as the staff swapped our booking with someone else's. It ended up taking a couple hours to sort and at this point it was already really late. The location is also not great, it's quite far from the city and not in a very nice neighbourhood. The facilities and the rooms themselves were ok.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: I was a bit surprised that in order to store your luggage you need to pay for a locker and have coins. You also have to carry your bag downstairs. The staff did not prewarn me about this before going to the storage room. However, a staff member also ended up helping me with this as I didn't have enough coins. If you are short haha then it can be a disadvantage as well. I was also surprised that my private room did not have an ensuite. However, overal, this was still a good place to stay.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Awesome atmosphere but it is a little out of the way from the rest of the sites (if you're a tourist).

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Quite far from the city center, but it's very near from the nearest metro station, and one thing to note, they don't have kitchen. But one of the cheapest hostel in paris, and they offered a breakfast! ðŸ˜Š

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Had a lot of fun here! Downstairs bar/restaurant and common areas are good for meeting people! Close to the metro station, definitely a good value stay

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: The hostel felt dirtier than other hostels I have been in, but it was okay. The beds were clean. The luggage room was questionable and you had to pay for a locker. Breakfast isn't free. If you need WiFi you'll have to go downstairs or hope it works in your room. 10 euro deposit for a towel. Overall, it was good for the price. There was good opportunities to meet people downstairs if your into that. I would maybe stay here again, but I would probably try other hostels first.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: They messed up our booking but sorted it out for us. Staff were really friendly and accommodating. A bit far from the city but generally a good hostel.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext:
The hallway on the second floor smelled very weird sometimes. 
Also, if you don't already, it would be nice if all door handles get sanitized since a lot of people use them. 
The breakfast bread was really hard to chew and I wish breakfast can go on until 11am, since sometimes people are really tired from staying out late the night before. 
Other than that, I had a really nice stay, I would recommend it.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Hostel was a bit far from main city but well connected by metro. Station wss just 5 min walking from hostel.they had lockers in the basement where you could keep your luggage before check-in.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: it was good...and showers were clean...and it is at a very good location...

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Great hostel, nice clean private (curtain on beds) dorms. Close to a few of the main metro lines.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Great value for money.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Being located next to a canal makes it one of the most beautiful hostels I've been. Great price, comfy private beds, 3 minutes walk to line 2 and 7 stations, would definitely stay here again!

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Needs a kitchen!

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Great location on the canal. Grab a beer at the hostel and walk out to sit by it. A heap of awesome Paris pubs very close by and 2 train lines within walking distance.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Great price, fun atmosphere, felt safe

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Gets marked down for no kitchen and trying to gouge people for water. Otherwise fine.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: A good well rounded hostel that has all the facilities needed.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Nice enough, all the beds have curtains which is a nice change. However every night it is really noisy due to the bar downstairs, traffic etc. Was a bit far out from the centre of the city however easy enough to get the underground into it. Supermarket down the road is really handy.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Overall the staff was great, any issues they had they tried to solve almost Instantly. The cleaning of the hostel was overall fine however we saw a cockroach in the lounge, meaning that the place might have a pest problem. The locker to store the luggage in the room was already broken, and their trip reservation system was not working during my stay. Hopefully they can fix these things for future hostel customers.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Great staff and people

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: I had an amazing time here! The staff was super friendly and very helpful! The area is beautiful with a ton of great places to eat or take just sit and read a book. It was very close to the metro and the breakfast was very good for only 4â‚¬! The have something be standing security all day which makes you feel extra safe too! The only issue I ran into was the hairdryer near my bathroom didn't work and it was a little hot at night, but I still cannot wait to come back!

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Great hostel, only two things wrong with it... a little far out of the city centre but metro is easy to use. The second thing is the shower turns off every 15 seconds this is a big inconvenience especially when trying to was hair. Other then that it's an amazing hostel. Friendly staff and the bar attached has great food.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: I wasn't very impressed but I guess you get what you pay for. The staff was helpful but I found the other guests to be inconsiderate about noise and lights, that's not totally the hostel's fault though. The facilities were somewhat clean but the bed wasn't very comfortable. The food at the bar was an attempt at American and I wish they would try to offer more authentic cuisine. The location wasn't central at all, it was a 15 minute train ride to the center of Paris which I wasn't expecting.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: I was extremely disappointed that both myself and my friend had items taken from us while we were staying at this hostel. Both things which would seemingly be of no value to anyone else but ourselves, (a pair of glasses and a card holder containing just a railcard). Both instances of theft happened whilst we were in the hostel, which is upsetting for both of us. We looked everywhere for both items but neither were found. I am upset our holiday ended this way.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: The place has its own bar and the atmosphere is nice. It looks like a party hostel where you can easily meet travelers and have fun, but not the kind where you have to be afraid of people ending up overly drunk in your bed. I stayed a couple days only and chose to just rest and see the city, managing to do so without any trouble. Very well organized and clean.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext:
+ super friendly staff
+ clean rooms
+ Location (not too busy but everything reachable within a reasonable time)

- some stuff could be fixed (e.g. outlets, shower doors don't close)
- 2 â‚¬ for a towel
- rent for bag storage 

I enjoyed it! Would recommend it if you want to see the sights of Paris - can't say much about the party (stayed there on a Sunday) but it seems like it could get crazy there.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: I was discouraged by the bathroom facilities in this particular hostel. I was even more surprised that the other St. Christopher's The Village in London had a better atmosphere and cared more about cleanliness. The showers, if i can even call them that were atrocious. I did not feel comfortable.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: The location in the city isn't great, as no major attractions are really walkable, but that's kind of how it goes in Paris since its so big, though the canal area is very nice in itself. The bar was alright, though the layout left a bit to be desired as far as socializing goes due it being set up more like a restaurant with tables sectioned off from eachother. Overall not my favourite hostel, but definitely not a bad one. I wouldn't discourage anyone from staying here.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext:
Arrived at the time I said on the booking. Reception person came and quickly gave me the key with a bare minimum explanation of how it works.
Immediately after disappeared, no time for questions or anything.

Bunk bed had lights and electricity socket but were not working.
Bunk bed construction was a bit poor and on the edge of falling apart.

Went for a shower, and out of the blue a cleaning person comes and start spraying detergent and cleaning products all around me without warning

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Great location, clean bathrooms, good value breakfast (4 euros for continental style). Definitely a bit of a party hostel if that's what you're looking for.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: The bathrooms were disgusting and there were various stains on my sheets and the curtains were broken. If you just need a place to sleep for cheap this is your place, it's pretty close to a metro and in a decent location near Le Canal St Martin.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Nice hostel

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Great spot for price. Excellent location

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Pictures were not representative of the rooms. Door to the balcony had to be open at all times because of the heat and since it was close to the camel, bugs were attracted to the light. I was bit multiple times every night. Linens had stains on the sheets and pillow. The bathroom felt and looked dirty. Not the best experience.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Had a great time at the Hostel and this is due to the people I met. My only bad experience in the hostel is to do with the elevator, it is extremely slow and needs to be fixed, immediately. The food was drinks were good and the staff were extremely helpful. I believe the hostel could do more to bring the guests together, such as games night or even pub crawls, as there were some people who could mingle due to their shy personalities or based on everything surrounding around drinking.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext:
I thoroughly enjoyed my stay in this hostel!!
Although my flight was rescheduled for the next day and lost out on a day in Paris..I could easily get the room I had booked. The reception is very helpful and friendly!!

Made some great friends while doing the first solo backpacking trip and felt very comfy and safe!

I'd want to stay again!

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext:
Hostel is far from all main attractions, but 5min walking to the metro 
has a good vibe, there's a bar downstairs.
But there r no facilities at all
NO FRIDGE OVEN OR COOKER
Some staff r really nice, others no that much
I add one extra night 
had to change my room, 
It was like 4pm afternoon I was lying in bed, and one girl (staff) long blonde hair, I think she is from the Netherlands open my curtain, WOKE ME UP in a such rude way asking CAN I CHECK UR CARD?
Wouldn't stay here again

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Content with my stay here, however would look for another place if I were to be in Paris again. Toilets and bathrooms are cleaned often which is a good sign. Some staff members do not know much of the area so it's hard to get recommendations/tips from them. Location is pretty far out from the main sights in Paris. Generally have to take a 30 minute journey to get in to the city centre.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Is just an average hostel. Besides the fact that it has view to the canal the hostel itself doesn't has or offer anything that u can say : that is a cool hostel. Party hostel? No.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Great place to stay. Very hot during the summer days as they have no ventilation. Friendly staff. Well equipped kitchen.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: This place has an amazing atmosphere! There's a bar at the bottom floor that's open to the public and it would go late into the night so there were so many opportunities to meet the other hostelers. They also provide curtains for your bed which is a nice extra measure of privacy that I didn't experience in other hostels. Their luggage storage was also super nice because they held individual lockers, while other places I've seen have just been locked storage rooms where you have access to others.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Very nice hostel. Very comfortable and good facilities  and close to metro station. Only thing was  the bed made my skin itch. Don't think they changed the sheet at all while I was there. That was annoying. But overall great place. Would stay again.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: This hostel has more of a college party vibe to it, which can be fun for meeting people if beer pong is your thing etc., but I wasn't really stoked on the no food inside/no kitchen to cook (obviously want you to spend money on their menu, which is expensive).  And my particular room situation.  I was located on the 6th floor in a not-so-obvious room that you have to take a weird route to get to.  No staff mentioned special directions upon booking, and I was not the only one who mentioned this.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext:
The cons: internet was really bad and no kitchen area. The breakfast is fine if it's free but what's meant to be hot is cold or warm and what should be cold is room temperature. There really isn't much to do in The area of this hostel in terms of night life. 
The pros: there's a bakery not too far go there for breakfast. To the left of the hostel of you walk all the way to the end of the street you'll find cheap French restaurants, subway McDonald's and stuff. Love the privacy curtain by the bed

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext:
Great hostel! 
3 minute walk to the nearest train station, huge lockable drawer under beds, comfortable beds and clean bathrooms.
Would stay again.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext:
Really enjoyed my stay here - it lives up to what I expected.
Transport links were good, and the surrounding neighbourhood was picturesque.
Everyone - staff and guests - was very relaxed and staying was a stress free experience. There is a lot of space for socialising inside and outside of the hostel.
They offer a convenient breakfast for 4 euros -included if you book directly (much to my chagrin).
If I was to stay in a hostel in Paris, I'd definitely consider staying again!

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Just the best place.  Open area for social made making friends easy!

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Nice bar to have available. The staff were cool and security was good which was nice since the location wasn't great (rough area). Actual dorm rooms were ok, each bed had a privacy curtain so you could have your own space if needed.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Arrived on an early plane and had to pay 4 euros (5 euro for a large locker) for luggage storage before check in and another 4 euros on checkout because I had a night bus, expensive if you are on a budget. Also no fridge or kitchen. They do organise free drinks and meet up at night but I was out sightseeing. Lovely room. Hostel is far from main attractions like the effiel tower but the canal is beautiful In summer and walking the streets is a great way to see

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: The staff and general atmosphere of the hostel were good but the facilities could have been better, the locker system is difficult to use and expensive, the lift didn't work and the rooms were incredibly hot at night. We were only here for one night but I probably wouldn't rush to stay again.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: location was fine - easy to get to several metro stations and very near a gorgeous park. The bathrooms had a definite smell to them (probably from being damp so much) but were fairly clean.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Without AC, Summers are hot. Sleeping will be difficult. No fans too

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: This place is right by a canal which makes morning breakfast (4Euros) one of the best. Coffee could use some help but, overall this place has friendly staff. Downside: the showers are button press and you mind find one or two spiders at times. One recommendation, the chill out section in the hostel should be open 24/7 as people need to use their laptops and it would be best to allow people there than have them on their laptops in their dorms. An issue with reservation was resolved quickly.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext:
No kitchen, bed lamp didnt work, generally busy place so everything feels well used. Mostly functional so fine place to stay. Does feel very conveyor belt-esq which is fine but lacks character. Lots of english signs so could be in any place. 

Good location 2/3 tram stops near by. Canal fairly pretty at night, but like everywhere in paris still smells of piss with public urinals. 

Hostel gave me free breakfast which was plentiful, although ran out of eggs on 2nd day.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Best spot for a hostel in Paris, more real neighborhood near the canal. Loved it

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Really great hostel!! Right next to the metro so you can reach Paris city centre easily. The staff were all very friendly and we felt very safe for the whole of our trip!

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Decent hostel, cheap and good atmosphere. It's far from the city centre but there's a metro stop close by. It feels a like a factory due to the massive size and number of rooms. The security is lacking, there's a cage you can lock under the beds but they can be easily accessed even when locked. Showers weren't working on our floor and we weren't shown any others which was very irritating. Ended up using the disabled ones.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: First time in Paris and this was the perfect place to stay! I got to meet so many different people and the atmosphere was great! The discount on food and free drinks at five made my stay that much cooler. The metro was in perfect walking distance and I felt safe in the neighborhood, please stay here the next time you come to Paris!!!

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: I had an amazing experience at st Christopher's inn canal. The staff were friendly and helpful, the other guests were very friendly and welcoming, and the ammenities and location were great! It is a bit of a party hostel so if you like a more quiet atmosphere I wouldn't recommend it, but I'm not a big party animal and I still enjoyed my time and went to my dorm when I wasn't interested in the party. Thank you St Christopher's inn for making my first stay in Paris a great one!

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: The St. Christopher's Inn Canal is a great place to stay if you're looking for a fun and lively time. The staff is diverse and friendly so they're great to talk to and befriend. Whether it be the lovely Iris at the reception who can advise on cool places to visit or the beautiful Anne at the bar, it's an awesome vibe overall! The location is also quite nice since it's directly on the canal for any sunrise fanatics and proximate to the metro for easy transport. No AC in rooms tho which is rough.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: In a 6 bed dorm and the beds down one side had 2 power outlets and a light, the other side didn't have any of the above. Only a PowerPoint on the bottom of the wall. The room didn't have aircon so it was quite stuffy in the hot weather and smelt like damp towels. Hostel bar and food was good and the metro is close and easy to navigate to the sights.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Big compliments to the staff who were gracious to refund our booking when our plans changed. We only stayed one night. The hostel is ok if you want to come to Paris and party with other travelers. Its a layout for the masses, and I guess if you get drunk enough you can start connecting with other travelers. If you want something more personal, this likely will not be the hostel for you.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: This is a party hostel. People are at the bar until 1 - 2am. Good place to meet people. If you want quiet this is not the hostel for you. My luggage cage was broken so I couldn't lock my things in my hostel room but the staff gave me free storage in the paid lockers in the basement. The broken locker never got fixed but it wasn't too inconvenient. The paid lockers are also pretty cheap if you want to lock your belongings up more securely.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Amazing stay at this hostel! Made some great friends and loved the overall vibe. Location, facilities and staff were all great

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: They tried to charge you for EVERYTHING(lockers 10 euros, NO PLACE TO LEAVE BAGS TILL CHECK IN FOR FREE, scale). The bathrooms were NOT clean at all. They didnt have KITCHEN either other common spaces. The dorms were good. Far away from downtown (4km. The staff that cleaned the bathroom shouted at me in FRENCH like for ten minutes( i never understood why). However the recepcionist was nice when telling her what happenned. It disappointed me, the experience was really lower than what I expected.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: I only stayed here for one night and i have no complaints! Lockers in rooms but you need your own padlock. Key cards to enter rooms and hostel floors. The hostel is above a busy pub but you can't hear it from the rooms! Overall very good value for the price - only thing, if you book through their website you get free breakfast, otherwise nada. About a 5 minute walk from the metro making the central city easily accessible.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Great stay. Only issue is they do not have a kitchen for you to make/store your own meals. Also don't do their 20 Euro trip to Versailles. It saves maybe 30 minutes in travel time. You can get round trip Train tickets for 7.50 Euro.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Great location near several metro stations, very secure and fun, super helpful staff and good beds. Good bang for your buck!

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: the workers are very friendly and they reaaly help you in your stay Thanks â¤ï¸

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: We had a quick stay here (only 2 nights), but we had a pretty good time. The bar/club was a lot of fun! Staff wasn't extremely helpful when recommending places to eat (other than their restaurant downstairs). Food/drink was a bit pricey in comparison to other hostels I've stayed at. Security was really great. Bathrooms smelled like a sewer. Overall a good stay, but probably wouldn't go out of my way to stay again.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext:
HOT TIP: book through the website for free breakfast your whole stay, otherwise you only get 1 free breakfast if booking elsewhere
Amazing hostel!
Pros-
Privacy with bed curtains
Clean sheets
Spacious shower with good pressure
Breakfast in the morning is gr8
Staff were informative and lovely
Cons-
Had vomit in the sink in the room for the few days I was there, kept forgetting to tell reception but odd that it wasn't cleaned by the cleaner within 3 days
No other faults. 

Recommend/10

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: The bathrooms here smelt revolting like something was rotting in the drains and had a window that could only open a few centimetres to air it out. There was also no airconditioning and rooms had the same windows that only open a few centimetres so in summer heat, this place was a bit of a nightmare to get any sleep because it was so hot. Staff were nice, location and everything fine.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext:
Overall stay at this Hostel was great. 
Made and kept in touch with a few new friends.
The location is a tad bit further north of the City, but the hostel is about a 8 min walk to the Metro.

The down stairs restaurant bar lobby area is always bumpin'. Lots of action and great place to mingle. St Christopher's is located in a cute neighborhood. Plenty of restaurants and pubs to check out. 

Great hospitality from the staff they were able to accommodate whatever I needed.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: A great way to meet new people especially if you're an independent traveler! Located a little far from the city center but the location is quiet, clean, close to metro lines and offers a nice and relaxing atmosphere by the canal if you just want to sit and enjoy your evening (or you could join the the rest of the crowd at the hostel and have a wild evening)! The staff were very friendly and the hostel was clean! Highly recommended!!!

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: An incredibly nice hostel. Easy to get to and also quite inexpensive. Very friendly staff. The only con was a long elevator queue xoxo

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext:
Great atmosphere - what i would call a party hostel, but had no trouble either sleeping at night.
Bar specials are great and people are sociable.
Staff was friendly, and the rooms and bathrooms were cleaned regularly. Only downside : it was very hot those days, and there is no AC in the hostel, nor can we open completely the windows... therefore it was really hot in the room. 
Also felt very secure. Plugs next to each bed were a plus. Overall, I would recommend, and would definitely stay again!

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext:
It was a great experience  with this nice hostel I stayed in room #604
I met new nice and kind guys and girls.
The room could be better if there is A/C. The toilet  inside the room must have a window or fan.
The staff very nice, respectful and helpful as well. There was a girl called Robin in the reception on last Sunday  when I checked out she was really great and I asked her to help me to find the way becaus I needed to get the train to Lyon and she just did all needed with big smile 
Thanks.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: My stay was quite nice, the location is amazing and with the bar and restaurant in the bottom, the space was always full of energy. A fun stay overall.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Nice and helpful staff, good atmosphere - there is a nice bar where you can get to know people and have a drink. Even though is kind of far from the center, there are different metro lines nearby, which is really practical.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Great Hostel in terms of rooms and bathrooms were very clean and tidy and the staff were great. The bar there was also really good to meet people.Only thing was location is quite far out the way so you will need to master the metro system!

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: I stayed here when it was very warm in Paris so it was harder to sleep without air conditioning. My room was right outside toward restaurants so loud at night but besides that - hostel vibe was great! Friendly staff and great bar.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Wonderful friendly staff that were very helpful... a really interesting area as well with a wonderful quay and canal area that was very beautiful. Thank you.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Hostel seemed cleaner than most and more spacious than most. Really nice location by the canal, and staff was very friendly. I waited an extra couple minutes on the line to check-in and got a free breakfast the next day.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext:
Rude cleaning staff kicked us out of our room just as we checked in at 4pm and made us wait in the hallway until they had mopped the room 
Location is pretty far away from the main drag 
Wouldn't go back to be honest

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Nice hostel but if you are into big ones. There's many people around all the time, so I experienced to get lines to talk to the reception almost each time. Also didn't quite like the fact that the common area is a restaurant/bar and that you actually have to pay to leave your luggage on the lockers - no free storage. But, the rooms were nice, big and clean, and the staff was kind! It's a bit far but a nice area just in the corner of St Martin Canal.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Overall I would definetly stay here again no questions asked. The only down side to this place is the rooms are hot as f**k

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext:
Good location.
On the pictures I saw a curtain for every beds. Finally my bed was without curtain and really close to the other people... 
NO KITCHEN ! It's the first time I went to an hostel without kitchen ! I wanted to cook and I had to buy some food everyday...
The curtain of the shower was so dirty. A girl in my room asked few times to clean it but they did nothing. Finally she had a fight with the manager about it and she left the hostel. The manager didn't say hello and wasn't friendly.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext:
They imply you get free breakfast but it's deceptive and you don't. Staff wasn't very knowledgeable about area. The toilets and showers are in a shared room making it incredibly humid and uncomfortable to use the toilet. 

Quite far from anything you'll want to see in Paris

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: EVERYTHING & I MEAN EVERYTHING IN THIS HOSTEL WAS GREAT!!! it was my first time doing something like this and i loved it, the people you meet here are all supper friendly, i would only suggest better ac for hot times here and that would be it. i got to experience great memories and will choose this hostel anytime i'm in paris!

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Noisy outside

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Room was not cleaned over my three day stay. Did not have any option for a locker. No cooling facilities

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: The location is on the canal which is nice, it's right next to district 19. A friend and I got chased from the time we got off of the metro at CrimÃ©e to the hostel. We got chased by 9 guys. They were running at us yelling I want to f**k you come here b**ch. When the manager overheard the next morning she blew it off as they were flirting. I had 4 other women tell me that they had a time they felt unsafe as well. There is a security guard posted there 24/7 because they need one In that area.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext:
Would definitely recommend, Staff are really helpful can go extra step to help you out.
Place is neat and clean.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Good hostel but no fans or air conditioning... wouldn't stay here again in summer

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Atmosphere downstairs was similar to a frat party. Windows barely opened; so there was zero air flow for a room of 10 people. Showers were dirty; there was even a piece of ceiling hanging down into one stall obstructing the shower and two of the shower doors did not shut properly. Breakfast was okay, as long as you arrived early enough to snag a tray and cereal.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: It's very nice for the price. Rooms are clean and so are the showers! Outlets and reliable WiFi. There are storage lockers for the day to put belongings and it's 5â‚¬ per day which was nice Bc I wanted to explore the city more before my 10PM train and wanted to check out in the morning. For me I just needed a place to put my head and shower after a day of exploring but overall very nice.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: I was supposed to stay in a 6 bed dorm. However, upon my arrival I was informed that I had been moved to a 10-bed dorm without any prior notice. Since it was a Friday night I did not have much choice. The staff offered free breakfasts for the remainder of my stay but that's not the point.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: The location of the hostel isn't great, but still very good accessible by metro. It is a party hostel, so plenty to do at night. Sadly I was super tired, so I slept kinda early. I had no issues with noise whatsoever, so that's perfect. The breakfast was good, but nothing special. Prices fluctuate a lot between nights, that why I stayed at another place the day after.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: this hostel is AWESOME. i was in a 12 dorm but the beds had curtains! super comfy. big space to store your things. bathroom floors are kind of gross and the water shuts off after 30 seconds. hallways smelled from the handicap bathrooms. they have a huge party atmosphere so going down to belushi's was fun. cool bartenders. don't get the nachos they're not worth it. it was fun to sit down at the canal and people watch :) it's close to the metro too.  i would stay again in a heart beat

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: This hostel was a great portal into the rest of Paris. They are conveniently located next to 2 metro stops, allowing for easy access to the rest of the city. The building also has plenty of facilities, including laundry, lockers, a continental breakfast every morning, and more. If you stay there when visiting Paris for the first time, I recommend the free walking tour!

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Great area being right next to vondelpark where we enjoyed some lakeside snacks, drinks and weed brownies, close enough to walk into the city center. Very nice and helpful staff.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Amazing staff, definitely will make friends and have a great time. Worth the price and near the metro.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext:
Big hostel with 5 floors, each floor about 11 rooms. 1 shared bathroom each floor. Bring your own towel. 
Nice location next to the river.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext:
No kitchen to cook your own food.  They expect you to buy their restaurant food everyday.  Breakfast starts too late at 7:30am . By this time most people that are doing something are gone. 

I never saw security walking any floors.  They stayed near bar / reception area all the time. 

No one cleaned the floors of dorms. I stayed 4 days.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext:
Loved staying here! I thought before coming it seemed a bit far from central Paris but with 2 metro stations (CrimÃ©e & Laumire) so close by it's so easy to get to all of the tourist spots. 
The room situation (12 bed mixed) was perfect to get to know people. There was a great atmosphere in the restaurant & it was the perfect opportunity to get to meet people from all over the globe. 
I went as a solo traveller for the first time, looking forward to returning some time!

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext:
Great hostel, very friendly and helpful staff, clean bathrooms and rooms. It's a bit far from the sights by foot, but you can take the metro which is pretty close. 

Suggestion for the administration: Install air conditioner or ventilators in rooms as it gets way too hot during summers, and the windows can barely be opened.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: The staff were really friendly and helpful, lockers secure under each bed. Bathroom were clean and there's deals at the bar for food and drinks when you stay in the hostel. Close to a few metro stations so pretty easy to get around. When you're upstairs you can't hear anyone from the bar. Overall had a great stay.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Great hostel. I just wish that I could have stayed longer!

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext:
Great location. Was here for a day or two and it was great for getting around to sights etc. 

There is a bar downstairs, and that can get noisy if you're fussy, but it wasn't an issue for me.

Staff were friendly, atmosphere was busy. Great to meet people.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Love this hostel and the staff! Florine and Lautaro enjoy your drinks. Xoxo flikker oooooop

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Good hostel with good vibes

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: the price is good and its localization is not bed, but my room was smelling bad (I think mostly because of other people) and there was people having sex/sleeping together in the bed next to mine. I liked the washrooms.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: This was a cool hostel in a hip part of Paris. Staff was super friendly and overall the facilities were clean and modern. There is a bar downstairs so this is a good hostel if you are solo traveling and looking to meet friends.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Pretty good, was on the second floor and rooms were super loud on Friday and Saturday because of the club. It was also really hot in the room. One of the showers didn't close, other than that pretty nice. Good location. 40 mins from the Eiffel Tower, 20 to the louvre.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: The location is a bit far (20-30 minute tube ride to everything) but the hostel was wonderful! A perfect place for a solo traveller if you want to meet new people!

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Highly recommend this place! Most places are pretty expensive in Europe but you really get your money's worth here. Made some real good friends and great times. Good vibes.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Good hostel

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Great atmosphere for meeting others, nice people, nice staff, cool bar underneath. I was in the female dorms on the first floor and everyone was considerate of others. It was furthest from the elevator on the floor so the least noisy at night. The room needs AC or fans, everything else was perfect. Close to multiple metro lines and buses, very short ride out of the city and not at all inconvenient - nice neighborhood too.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: I love this place. Had the best time staying here and I got to meet new friends.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Cleans and secure

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: If it has a kitchen, would be much better

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Amazing time, I'm a solo traveller and found a great group of people here every night downstairs in the bar area. Location/scenery is awesome and wifi seems to work all throughout the building. Loved it here, you'll see me back again!!

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Staff lovely, very welcoming! Easy to get to the Paris nord and attractions via the metro, which is very easy to use. Good discounts on bar attached to hostel

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: AMAZING if you're solo traveller. GREAT atmosphere

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: It's a massive party hostel. Not my thing!! I wanted sleep but it was incredibly noisy the entire time I was there for 4 nights... and the noise last until the middle of the night.. beds are comfy for a hostel but omg the noise!!!

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Location is too far from the city and sketchy. There is a bar located at the ground floor and it is open to public. You don't know if you are meeting travelers or weirdos. They don't have any meeting events. There was a guy running and screaming in the hallway until 4 am one day. Nobody stopped him. No ac in the rooms. It was crazy hot and couldn't sleep. Go somewhere else. Don't waste your money and time!

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Overall this was a really good place to stay! It was really noisy during my one night stay, but that's because the French soccer team had just won a game?? The hostel was clean, the little interaction I had with staff was friendly, and the atmosphere was festive and good for meeting new people.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Great hostel, staff are all really helpful and lovely.  Met some nice people as I was a sooo traveller, was a little hard to met anyone to start as mostly groups.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Pillow smelled like vomit which was kinda sketch

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext:
I had such an amazing time during my stay here! The staff where so welcoming and friendly from the moment you checked in till calling you taxis at checkout. 
The free apres drinks is a great way for solo travellers to meet people and break the ice. 
Location wise their hostel is ideal, walking distance to all metro stations. 
There is a bar downstairs however it was not noisy whilst you where up in the room. 
Would definitely stay here again next time I'm in Paris!

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Paris is expensive so I know accommodations can be limited based on budget; however, I had a miserable time here. I was on the first floor in a 12-bed female dorm. There was no A/C but we also could not open the windows because of the noise on the street. One of the two communal bathrooms was closed on our floor. (Your key card only allows you onto your floor) When I went to use the shower in the later morning, the maid cleaning shouted at me for wearing shoes inside the shower.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext:
No aircon in the rooms, so have to keep the windows open & being on a Main Street, it's very busy & noisy. 
Not sure what happened but the floor we were on smelt like a public toilet. You couldn't stand in the hallway for too long. 
No aircon in the main areas either so eating breakfast was extremely hot.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: This is a brilliant hostel, super sociable and no matter when you stay, there are always things going on at the bar etc. Very international hostel and the atmosphere is brilliant, especially at night when people chill outside the hostel and next to the canal. The facilities are great; spacious rooms, lockers underneath the beds and secure lockers for use on day of arrival/departure when you are not checked in. Would definitely recommend this hostel and the location is great, 5 mins to metro.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: It's a very 'commercial' hostel. Feels like a hotel, I prefer the smaller hostels, especially for solo travel. Location is ok, it's close to a nice canal where people will picnic and have drinks at night which was nice. The bar is good for meeting people at night.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: It is unacceptable not to have aircon/fan in a room especially when it's summer .... I did not sleep very much in my 3 nights there due to the over baring heat in the room . When complained about it was a nothing we can do about it response. I also got asked how my stay was when I responded in regards to heat she said it's not usually this hot ... regardless you should have a facilities for all possible occasions eg. Heat wave..

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Totally a party atmosphere, if that's what your looking for then this is the place for you, if your looking to talk to people a little more and take it chill maybe not so much. Overall it was a decent stay.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Location isn't the best. Its quite far out from all the main attractions in Paris. The hostel rooms are big and clean and very private. The staff are amazing and are always there to help. :)

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Nice place to stay in Paris! It's not really a walkable distance from the major sights, but it's very close to two metro lines, and the Paris metro system is great. The rooms are spacious and have under-bed lockers big enough for your whole bag (bring a padlock though because I had a small suitcase lock that wasn't big enough to fit around it). The bar downstairs has reasonably-priced food, and you get an extra discount on it as a hostel guest. The outlets and curtains at each bed are nice too.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Nice hostel. Gare du nord is a better one. We  stayed at both. Nothing really to complain about was a nice stay.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Fantastic time. Belushis bar is the cheapest way to watch the World Cup and drink and meet people. The staff are great and helpful with everything.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Pretty good stay. I didn't go to the bar at all, but there were some lovely people in my room.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: loved it!

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Good hostel, if a bit far out from the centre of Paris. Metro stops are not too far out though. Belushi's bar offers a pretty good time downstairs, with decent prices. Comfortable and secure dorm rooms.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Loved the curtains!

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Great place!

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Hostel is a good price for Paris, the rooms are a very good size with plenty of free space and the curtains add privacy. The location is a little out of the way but there are several metro stops a 5 minute walk away. The place is LOUD. It is difficult to meet people if on your own and note no kitchen. The cleaning staff are RUDE and will kick you out of the bathroom yelling to clean it.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Great place to meet other travellers

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext:
This hostel has it all for the young and mature traveller. Being somewhat older than most I was made to feel so welcome and included. Staff & guests were super friendly. Apart from my only little criticism being not enough bathrooms, I'd recommend this particular hostel a place to go. Stay here and you'll not
 regret it. Have Fun Y'all.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: I just didn't vibe with this place at all. I slept better on the airplane than I did here. The room was way too hot. It has a huge party atmosphere, and no place to lounge. The location was far from Eiffel, the louvre, so you can't really walk anywhere, and it's up a hill.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Okay this is the big hangout place, lots of people, and lots of stuff happening, especially since I was around during the world cup. The bar downstairs is busy most nights. The atmosphere is for partying, which can be fun, but can also be a little much sometimes. Lots of different tours to go on and hangout spaces. Staff at desk are helpful. Biggest problem is no AC in rooms and not even fans. It was scorching in Paris, around 90F/33C, and it was exhausting to not be able to cool down.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Only stayed one night. Easy enough to get the metro to the centre because it wasn't the greatest location. Pretty expensive but I guess that's Paris. Comfortable beds and clean beds and bathrooms.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: The location here was great and it worked well as a bed for the night for me but I probably won't stay here again. It wasn't a terrible stay it just wasn't the right place for me. It seemed very party orientated which I think attracted people who were less inclined to be considerate about noise late at night. Also my entire floor smelt musty and the paint had peeled to leave the ceiling exposed and mouldy in the bathrooms. It wasn't unbearable just not what I'd look for again in future.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Big hectic hostel with loads of people partying! My room was surprisingly quiet, and the bed was very comfortable and private. Bathrooms could be nicer. Only there for a night but I'd go back. Great for football games!

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext:
The hostel was good enough 
As it was my first stay in a hostel it was great 
The area around the hostel is totally safe 
I recommend this hostel for solo travelers (male or female) don't worry just go there and have fun

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: I've stayed at St Christopher's Gare du Nord and enjoyed it, but wanted to check out the Canal so chose this location and transparently, I was only there for a night so my perspective is limited. Overall, it seemed like they were short staffed (despite the friendly attention from the girl with curly hair at the front desk) so it felt a little desolate and lacking the great ambiance from the Gare du Nord location. Bathrooms were standard, my room unfortunately didn't have AC but maybe others do..

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Cleanliness of the entire place could be better. Staff will have to learn a bit more in dealing with Asian customers who are trying some facilities for the first time.. such as coin operated washing / drying machines. Breakfast spread could have been better.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Fun, great location, and lots of social areas. Explore up and down the canal, rent a boat, and make friends!

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: It was a beautiful location, but not very close to the center of town. I found this difficult because I had the hardest time navigating the metro system in France. There is a cool bar downstairs and a good free breakfast in the morning! My room did not have enough lockers for the number of beds.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: We've stayed at a lot of st Christopher's hostels and this one is definitely one of our favourites! Great atmosphere, super close to the metros and has curtains on the beds which is always great!

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Prepare yourself for some steps!! Very high ceilings and thus many many steps if your room is on the top floor. But other than that is was quite nice.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Pretty good hostel. Great social area with a bar downstairs to meet people, helpful receptionists, and great location (close to metro stops to the big sights). Only complaint is it was very hot during the night and woke up sweating.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Besides the room getting super hot at night because the windows wouldn't open up enough and our door not working properly, this is a great hostel. Super helpful and friendly staff. Very busy bar/restaurant. Located in northern Paris but the neighborhood was safe and right on the canal which was beautiful at night. Very close to the metro and bus stops making getting around very easy. Comfortable beds and big luggage lockers which was nice.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: This hostel was easy to find (short walk from the metro) and had a great location along the river seine. At night, many people hangout near the river and it was an awesome atmosphere. The restaurant in the hostel is also a great area to meet locals who frequent the area and watch sporting events. The beds are a great size (I am six feet tall and I had no problems with length) and the area was very cleanly. The price was a bit expensive in my opinion, but the cheapest I could find in Paris.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Nice place to stay for backpackers

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: The area is not the best at night but it's a great hostel ! Would do it again for sure.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Peaceful place for stay guyðŸ™‚

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: No atmosphere

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext:
Upon arrival i was informed that my booking which id made 4 months earlier wasnt processed correctly, which meant they didnt have my reservation & they were completely booked out. staff went above & beyond while sorting this out for me & were very apologetic. 
Staff were helpful in booking tours, taxi's & general direction.
Clean rooms, comfy beds, privacy curtain & excellent facilities! 
A bit out of the city, but close to the metro! One of the best hostels ive stayed in, would stay again!!

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Overpriced for what it is. A good place to stay if you want to enjoy the world cup matches as downstairs is a bar. No kitchen is a pain however.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: We stayed in a 12 bed mixed dorm which we were worried about but we barely noticed it! Everyone was friendly and there wasn't any responsibility to talk to someone if you didn't want to. The bar downstairs was amazing, really good food and drinks which if you stay at the hostel you get discounts on. It was close to train stations which meant it didn't take long to get to the touristy places. I would definitely recommend this hostel and the chain in general to others.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Absolutely wonderful, I'm a woman traveling by herself and I was in a mixed dorm and even then I felt comfortable! I highly recommend. Great food, great beds, everything was above and beyond.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Awesome location by the canal, looked very trendy with locals and away from the traditional tourist traffic. I was there during the World Cup and everyone was out watching and drinking. The hostel itself is clean and the room was spacious. The bar downstairs was pretty lively. Only downside was some of the one-off prices were kind of high (5 EUR for coffee, 4 EUR to store luggage that's normally free??) but I was late checking out and they didn't try to fine me so that was nice.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Had a great experience, I had a bag stolen while in Paris and the people at the hostel were very helpful and I owe them a lot. The bar down stairs was very good with cheap drinks and plenty of young people socializing which is what a youth hostel should be. I love saint Christopher's

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Made a lot of memories and friends at this hostel. Everyone was super nice and there's a restaurant in the hostel that has decent food that you get at a discount. The club isn't that bad either, a few locals come to hang out. Overall the experience was good, minus the showers. They were kind of grimy and need to be remodeled. Those damn 5 second release buttons (the water turns of automatically after 8-15 seconds, yes I counted) need to be done away with.

name: St Christopher's Inn Canal
reviewtext: Overall! A great place to stay at, with just some minor issues of cleanliness

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: Easy acess to trains, neighborhood a bit run down but safe and ok stay overall. Bunks with privacy curtain and own light and plug- very convenient. People always seem to be cleaning the bathroom which is good. This hostel seems to be used by lots of French customers, rather than foreign. Very cozy , chilled environment.   basic breakfast Â£3.

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: I highly recommend. Safe and clean. Short distance to the metro. Great food too!

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: The hostel is ideally located near Belleville metro station with Jim Morrison's grace located nearby I'm Pere Lachaise. Staff at the hostel were friendly and able to offer advice if required. The room was clean with a separate shared female bathroom on the floor. It was always quiet and very clean too. The bunk has a curtain surrounding for privacy. The only fault I have is the top bunks near the window are super high and there isn't much to hold onto when getting in/out. Great hostel overall!

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: Showers were clean and private, so were bunks, which was nice. Staff was friendly and the rooftop deck was nice to be able to sit and have a drink. Belleville is an interesting neighborhood but the hostel is a stone's throw away from the Metro, which was great. Overall, this was a pretty great "posh-tel"!

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext:
This is one of the worst hostels i have stayed at. The location is absolutely terrible. As a solo female i felt extremely unsafe in the neighborhood and was constantly harassed when walking down the streets. It is  also very far from the main sites.
The bathrooms constantly smelt and would be out of order. Bedrooms are cramped and tiny and my bed had bed bugs. 
The hostel was filled with locals and i found it difficult to meet other travellers. Would not reccomend.

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: Great hostel, location is a tad annoying but hey managable as the metro is hella cheap! Rooms are comfortable and beds are cosy

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext:
Good beds and very clean, but more of a hotel feeling instead of a hostel feeling. 

Staff ended breakfast at exactly 11 even if it was 11:02 and they still had croissants leftover. 

A little outside of the town, but easy to get around with the metro (download the metro app, it is very helpful).

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: I really loved this place, everything you could ask for in a hostel. Clean, hip location, and a wonderful friendly atmosphere. Rooms were great with large lockers and the most comfortable beds. Bed curtains allowed me to keep my privacy which I loved. Bathrooms were clean and almost always empty which was fantastic.

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext:
Very clean place. Cleaning ladies came in between 7:30-8am to clean the bathrooms for our floor and stop by the rooms to sweep and clear the trash. Two toilets and showers on our floor for each gender. A little difficult to climb up the stairs if you have the top bunk. Enough outlets, lockers, and cubbies for your things. Privacy curtains were very helpful, but has a inch or so gap between bed and curtains.


If you arrive early, you can store your things in their secured lockers downstairs.

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: Great hostel in a good location between two Metro stations, really nice room with lockers. Only criticism is that the floor of the bathroom was near impossible to keep dry. That's probably the only criticism I can give.

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: This was a nice hostel with really fabulous amenities and nicely located near the metro and Vietnamese food. However I did have some problems with it - first off, there were no social activities or encouragement for travelers to get to know one another, the food is ridiculously expensive - one muffin was 4.5 EUROS. I don't think I've ever paid that much for a muffin. And I found the staff slightly cold and indifferent. That being said, overall, I had a nice stay.

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext:
Nice staff, good rooms.

A kitchen would be nice, as there aren't many places to get a healthy feed around the neighbourhood.

Would recommend.

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: Security hear was okay with lockers, although the location wasn't great. Yes it was near the metro, but the neighborhood itself felt more like Algeria or Tunisia vs. Paris. Maybe a good place to try some north African food though. My main gripe was the staff, who seemed more concerned about maintaining a cool hipster nonchalance and tending the bar rather than checking people in and taking care of the guests. Also tried to trick me into buying breakfast that cost extra. Bathroom reeked of feces

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: Clean and safe place and a very friendly staff. The hostel is a 1 minute walk from the metro, which is very convenienT and the beds are comfy. The rooftop terrace is also amazing. However, I noticed a few downsides). First, since the hostel is also a bar, it does not have a kitchen for us to cook our own stuff. I do not cook very much so that wasn't a problem, but I see why it could be for some people. Also, My bed was so high, I was afraid of falling everytime I got off of it. Good place overal

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: Nice room on the rooftop with a view of scare Coeur! I found it was very expensive but it's Paris after all. The location itself was not the best (Belleville) but it was 5 minutes away from the Metro which I took everyday to get to the 1-7 arrondissements. The rooftop unfortunately closes at 10 pm so that sucks. Clean room and nice bar downstairs. I just wish they would be more mindful of creepy drunk men from off the street coming into the bar. :)

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: It's probably better value than most other hostels considering it's Paris but I agree with some of the reviews I read. There are a couple of staff members that are very friendly while others are just v difficult to speak to or ask questions. There is no communal kitchen and everything they offer, food wise, is quite expensive. Close to metro. It's clean but all the shower curtains suffer from a ton of mold, thus the poop smell.

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: Nice big beds with curtains. Reception/bar area nice for reading, working, drinking or whatever you feel like. Nice bathrooms, great showers. The area was local and a bit dodgy perhaps? But close to the metro. Staff was sweet and helpful.

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: One of my favorite hostels. I stayed here earlier in the summer and came back again for a few more days in Paris. It's a little bit outside the city center but I was grateful for that as it gave me a chance to explore another part of Paris. Plus it's right by the metro or a 30 minute walk to Notre Dame. This hostel is so clean and the staff is incredibly friendly, and the bar downstairs is a great place to meet people. Only thing missing is laundry.

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: Easy access to the train station. Good atmosphere. Storage space for bags. Clean toilets. However the rooms are slightly crowded. The location a little sketchy and no kitchen facilities. Overall probably worth it despite this

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: great place in paris

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: Really clean and modern rooms. The atmosphere in the common area/bar was lacking.

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: Our favorite hostel and this is big because we have been traveling for 6 months. Wonderful room, good space, and amazing bathroom. Very clean!

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: Very professional and clean hostel. The toilets sometimes had a weird smell but it didnt bother that much. Only real con is that they don't do any real activities so you can meet other travelers.

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: Very nice and clean rooms with a lot of privacy as the bunk beds all have curtains and their own lights. Bar has a good atmosphere and the WiFi works perfectly. Location wise, this hostel is very close to the metro, however the surrounding area isn't very nice at night, especially for young women.

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext:
Staff were helpful and approachable. Location isn't great but there was a metro station close by.
Rooms are small, the lobby and rooftop are nice.

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: I'm not sure why i booked this hostel but it's really far away from everything and the rooms are the smallest I've seen so far.

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: Thanks for having us :)

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: Great hostel - clean bathrooms, A/C, good breakfast.

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext:
Clean and cheap place. Has a very modern fill and everything fills new and fresh.

Downside is the area. It does fill horrible and a slightly rough area. The tube is near though which is convenient.

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: Great place, great staff!

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: Our stay at Les Piaules was very pleasant! The rooms were clean and the beds were comfy, and the aircon was very effective. The showers were nice and the staff were very helpful with anything we needed. There is a great pizza place right across the road as well!! Most definitely would stay here again!

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: In Paris, safety is a major issue and I had no concerns here and in the neighborhood other than they should be locking the front door in evenings. Close to main metros. Would stay again

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext:
Amazing hostel! Beds super comfy, air con was a huge plus! And loved the privacy of the bed curtain. All facilities are clean and new (showers are GREAT- good pressure and lots of room for your stuff) 
 The location is a bit random but you can get anywhere with a nearby train station.

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: While slightly expensive, the facility is equipped with everything that you will need. It has the perfect accomodations as far as hostel goes

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: Overall the hostel was great. Great customer service(10/10), security, decent location, clean(bathroom might smell a bit weird. The only problem I had was I got bedbug bites(staying in a 4 mix dorm) but they gave me a new room and the problem was solved. I'm not sure if the bedbugs were from the hostel or from other people but nonetheless I had a great time here and met new friends. Would recommend!

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: Great place. Rooms are good, although there is only bed-side power plug that is also used for the reading light. The shared bathroom on the floor was very good with one toilet, two showers and three sinks with soap dispensers. All of these were clean and with a good water-flow. The hostel tries to create a good mood with a free mini beer and the rooftop, which kinda works, but some of the staff were still learning, so they weren't very talkative. They were still friendly and helpful though.

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: Rooms and lobby area were some of the nicest I've seen. One complaint though: every morning the cleaning staff would come in around 10 or 11 am and start vacuuming, slamming drawers, and speaking to each other really loudly, waking up a lot of us who were still sleeping.  Only hostel I've been at where that has happened.

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: Night staff was rude but I might be to if I was dealing with drunk teenagers everyday. Not to much social atmosphere compared to other hostels but there is some if you are able to work for it. Very clean. Nicest hostel beds. Good views from rooftop.

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: I really liked this hostel! The staff was helpful and everything was really clean! The best part though is definitely the terrace on the roof! It's a great place to hang out and meet other people from the hostel and it has an amazing view of the city. The neighborhood is less touristic than other parts of Paris which I enjoyed. It is a ways away from the major things in the city, but the metro is really close and extremely easy to use!

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: I didn't actually stay here. Although my reservation was made months in advance, there had been a water leak in the room I had reserved. The staff worked quickly to book me a premium room at Generator-Paris. However, their staff gave excellent service through the process and I was very impressed.

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: Overall great place, and the AC was amazing with the heat wave! Our AC broke and the staff was trying to get someone to fix it, but were having trouble getting someone there. They moved our room and were really accommodating! Bathroom ventilation was minimal, so it was really hot when people were showering. Elevator a huge plus, especially since there are so many stairs everywhere else! Laundry facilities would be great, but would definitely stay again!

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: best hostel we have stayed in

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: It's a very good and clean hostel, a bit far from everything, but close to the metro. The only problem was the bed, the area for the feet was overlapping with the other beds, instead of having a normal height it was half the height there. I move a lot while sleeping, so I kicked it and woke up several times.

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: Stayed at a few other hostels in Paris but nothing like this one. Great staff, Atmosphere, and location.

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext:
The good: Clean facilities and comfortable rooms. Great coffee shop downstairs, often frequented by locals.
The bad: Boring hostel with virtually no social events available.

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: Good wifi that works in the rooms. Unique neighborhood with lots of restaurants and metro stops close. The food they serve is ok, I would recommend eating somewhere else. They have AC, which is great in the hot summer months.

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: There was no air conditioning so it felt like I was in a sauna and I was so suffocated in the top bunk 6 bed room. The beds were so uncomfortable. It was dirty and felt like there were bed bugs. I could not get any sleep. Seedy and really run down building so the lifts didn't work. Did not feel safe outside this building. I booked 3 nights but could only handle 1 night because it was the worst hostel ever. Don't know how the ratings are so high. Although the location was central.

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: I arrived early before my check in and they had lockers where you could put your stuff so I could go exploring right away! There is a metro station right next to the hostel which makes it pretty easy to get around Paris, but if you want to walk places it isn't very close. My room was cozy and clean and I slept like a baby every night! Met cool people, and my friends loved the rooftop terrace as well! Breakfast was a bit overpriced but it's also Paris! Overall I had a great stay!!

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: Les Paiutes was a great hostel for our stay. The dorm rooms were great because they had the curtains, lights, and plugs in your bunk. The lockers were also very big which was great.

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: A lack of washing machine facilities and the women's third floor bathroom leaked. Otherwise a decent hostel with access to centre of Paris vis the metro and beautiful view of the city from the rooftop. Incredible air conditioning !!

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: Great place all round except my friend got bed bugs.

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext:
The hostel is just a 3 minute walk from the Courronnes metro station, so the location is quite nice. There are lockers for each bed in the dorms to keep your stuff safe. 
The atmosphere is great, the only downside was the hostel was a little too pricey considering it's not very close to the city center.

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext:
Great rooftop space, clean bathrooms, comfortable beds.  Good location right beside the Metro.

Would definitely recommend it to others!

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: Really nice vibe, staff were lovely. Rooftop view at night is amazing. Glad I booked there.

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: Very helpful staff and great, clean rooms.  Met a lot of nice people there.  The location isn't the best if you're looking for food or to go out, but has two stations near it to make it easier to get to those places.  Bring a padlock if you're worried about safety.

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: Loved the design of this place- very cool, modern and clean. AC and lockers in the room were great, and the beds were super comfortable. But the atmosphere left a lot to be desired. There was really no sense of community, and the staff in particular were not very friendly or helpful (at least to me), seeming annoyed any time I asked for a recommendation. As a solo female traveler, I also didn't feel super safe in the area, so wound up cutting my stay a night short.

name: Les Piaules
