reviewtext: The rooms were quite nice. I really appreciated the curtains, individual plugs, and lamps in each bunk. It didn't get too hot despite it being July as well. The roof top deck was also awesome to have. Would recommend staying here.

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: Nice hostel.   You're better off not going with their 3 Euro breakfast.    It's just a small croissant with coffee.    You get a lot more going to any patisserie.  The wifi works great through out the property.    2 Metro lines 2 blocks away.    It's about a 25 minute walk to Notre Dame but Paris is a walking paradise.

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: I only stayed here one night on a weekday, but overall the hostel seemed great! The main hang out area has a bar and a few games, and people were mostly chilling on their phones or laptops. There is secure locker storage if you arrive before checkin. My room was literally on the rooftop, which has an amazing view over the city including Montmarte and the Eiffel Tower. 4 person dorm was clean and quiet, ensuite bathroom was nearly spotless, ac was great, and bed was comfy. Great neighborhood too.

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: Got upgraded to 4 bed room everything was pretty good at what was advertised

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext:
Good value.
Rooms are very tight!
The 8 bed dorm was Packed. Your feet tucked under the bed above you. 
But all the facilities were clean and beds comfortable.  The lounge downstairs offered a good atmosphere and had free cold water available 24hours . Wifi is strong. 
Over all good for the price in Paris.

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: Les Piaules is a great hostel! Really enjoyed the stay. Make sure you get up to the rooftop for a great view while you're there. :)

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: Easy to get to from the metro. Staff were helpful. Rooms seemed very secure! Beds were comfortable with privacy curtain. Beautiful rooftop lookout! Easy to meet a lot of people in the common pub area! Neighbourhood is a bit dodgy. Didn't really walk around to much myself at night. Like anywhere else, just practice good awareness and you should be fine!

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: The staff at this hostel is incredibly rude. There was one man in particular working at the reception desk that I witnessed speak to people in a horrible, unnecessarily mean tone on multiple occasions. I don't expect exemplary customer service when I stay at hostels but I do expect a degree of kindness. The neighborhood of Belleville was really nice and the rooftop bar is a plus but I wouldn't recommend this hostel to other travelers.

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: Nice place, good location and atmosphere, enjoyed the view from the rooftop terrace.

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: Awesome hostel to start my Europe trip! Cleanest hostel I've ever seen and the privacy curtains on the beds made you feel like you were in a private room. Air conditioning was great too! The rooftop was a great social place to meet people (but only in the evening as it's too hot during the day). It's not in the nicest area of town so I didn't walk around alone at night but it's really close to the metro that makes it super easy to get to where you need to go.

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext:
*Slightly* out of the way, and I wish they had laundry facilities.

Otherwise great!
Clean, comfortable (A/C is a huge plus in the summer), fairly modern. Definitely a good vibe. Nice roomy lockers. They also have a shuttle service and a free walking tour, and the staff are very helpful and friendly in general.

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: Things I liked: helpful guy at the front who answered all of my questions, free lockers, restaurant across the street called triplettas, weekend market, the room and bathroom were clean, free breakfast, free wifi. Things I did not like: not all of the staff was nice, the bathroom is not in the room, the showers were very slippery, no full length mirrors any where, it is FAR from the main sights, not the best area to be in at night. Overall it was good but my biggest complaint would be the area.

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: Staff was not very welcoming and seemed to have an attitude. Rooms were really small but very clean and it was nice having curtains on the beds. The highest bunk was three beds tall without a railing, so felt a little unsafe climbing up there. Location is pretty far away from central Paris.

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: I had the worst time of all my journey at this place. The location is terrible, you don't feel safe walking on your own nearby after 9 pm on summer, which is the least thing you want when you travel alone. And the security inside the hostel is even worse. Someone tried to break my padlock in my room. The answer they gave me at the reception when I told them was: "Yes man, I heard. Bad luck". I couldn't believe it. I had to struggle to get my money back, which I finally couldn't. DON'T GO THERE

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: I really liked this hostel I thought the roof top was cool.  The curtains on the bed provided great privacy. I wish the room or bathroom had a long length mirror.

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: Really nice clean and safe hostel. Good location and lovely roof terrace.

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: Very nice clean and safe, one of if not the best in Paris, would recommend!!

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: The hostel is very modern with great amenities. There's a bar in the lobby, but it's more frequented by locals than hostel guests, so it was a bit difficult to meet people. Some had issues with the location, but it is literally one block from the metro, so it was super easy to get around. It might not be the ideal hostel if you're looking to meet people, but it's nonetheless a really great place to stay.

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: The hostel was great! I didn't mind the 3 minute walk to the metro. The beds had curtains which was great for privacy. The room did get pretty hot at night though (it was July). The bar at the entrance is great to have a drink or a snack at and there is a great atmosphere when everyone is hanging out at the end of the day. For the price this is a great option for exploring Paris!

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: This hostel was very comfortable and clean. Would recommend for sure. Only downside is the area it's located in. Rather far from city centre and if you're a female traveling alone be prepared to get VERY stared at on the streets around the hostel.

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: I had the best stay here. It felt more like a hotel than a hostel. I wish I could have stayed longer. The rooms were great and the atmosphere was amazing. I would most definitely recommend staying here.

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: We booked a private room on the roof top. The room was really nice. Big bathroom, great view and well laid out.  Price wise it was as much as a cheaper hotel so we expected the same service. Staff not particularly helpful. I've stayed in many hostels where the staff can't do enough to help. One night I tried to buy water and was ignored while the staff had a chat so I left. Breakfast was also over priced and poor quality. We ate across the road for the same price for much better quality.

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: It was Ok. I didnt really liked bellevile, but youve got the metro a few blocks from the hostel, so u can get anyware. Another thing i didnt enjoy is the bar. Its crowded of pepople that works on his laptop all day long there, and is quite difficult to get a proper seat because of them. All in all, good.

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: Getting around Paris requires getting on the metro, and the hostel makes this easy with its proximity to the metro. The staff is amazingly helpful and friendly. The general atmosphere of the people staying here is very friendly, which is great when traveling solo. The facilities are new/updated and the beds are super comfortable. Would definitely stay here again.

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: Beds are super comfy, I loved the privacy curtains. Rooms are small but manageable. Lockers for bags under the beds were useful and made me feel secure. Bathrooms were clean and nice to use. Staff were friendly and helpful. The â‚¬3 breaky was great value. Two main downsides were the location and no kitchen (would have liked a fridge to sore food).

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext:
Pros:Metro System 5 mins away.Coin laundry, cafes and grocery stores near by. Pull curtains on beds for privacy with a power outlet and light. Storage that's lockable(bring a lock). A cafe/Bar inside the facility. They sell reasonable attraction tickets. Should you go to Disney absolutely by the hostel ticket or it's 20-30â‚¬ more at gate. 
Cons: most of the staff is completely rude and unattentive to customers, I was EXTREMELY annoyed by several of them. Bathrooms stink but are clean, go figure.

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: Very clean, very safe and good sized rooms

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: General overview is a good place ... staff some of them not as friendly as others , location was okey.

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: Not the best area but near metro. The facilities were clean and well kept. The staff were adequate but were not at helpful as at other hostels. The staff at other hostels are more willing to offer assistance and recommendations when asked. The atmosphere is the most disappointing. The breakfast and bar options/offerings were poor. They organised no events at the hostel. At least when I was there, it appeared this hostel housed more French than English speakers. Not great to meet other travellers

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext:
Pros: Felt safe clean& secure, we loved the privacy curtains for the sake of our sleep and others. The immediate area seems a little sketchy but as we explored, we found hidden gems. The market on Friday morning was very affordable (and delicious). 
Cons: Most people seemed to be on their phones and there was very little social atmosphere, the exception being the  roof terrace ( which had stunning views of the Eiffel Tower and the sacrÃ© cÅ“ur) which even then was a little divided.

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: One of the best hostels I've ever stayed in. Comfy beds, power showers with lots of shelves and hooks for your things, hair dryer, elevator, rooftop with amazing views, close to metro, and a shuttle to airport (if pre-arranged and it's half the cost of a taxi). It's placed in a vibrant and colourful neighbourhood great for people watching and there's markets on a Friday. I found the people staying here to be friendly and relaxed and the staff were really helpful. Definitely recommend.

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: Very cool hostel, with some really great facilities! Rooftop is awesome, and they have good food. The food is pretty pricy for what you're getting, but having the option in house is always nice. All that being said, there is a guy that works behind the bar is is very rude. All of the guests agreed about this. Other staff is nice, but not very helpful. I would definitely stay here again, but don't expect too much from the staff.

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: Great area, great personal. Definitely will be back here!

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: Great value for money, very clean and nice. Staff aren't the friendliest and the location is far from the touristy stuff; however, it is near the subway which can take you anywhere.

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: Great hostel, loved the pod style beds. Bathrooms were very clean and so were the beds and rooms. Staff were friendly. The location wasn't the best, quite far out from the main city area where all the attractions were. I also didn't feel the safest walking alone in the area.

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: This hostel was just incredible. Just two blocks away from the 11 train, you can get just about anywhere in Paris in 20 minutes. The staff was great, and they were always helpful for when I needed a towel or soap and directions. The room I stayed in was just amazing. It was super tiny, which forced small talk and smiles to be shared from all of us staying in the room. The bed had a curtain, which was amazing to have (I haven't seen this at any other hostel) and I had a breath taking view.

name: Les Piaules
reviewtext: Good stay here, rooms are cool n clean, beds comfy and private! Only two gripes I had was that there was no kitchen to make anything to eat! And Paris is expensive to eat out all the time! I was in room 101 right next to the bathroom and the door to it makes a really loud bang every time someone goes in and out, bit annoying when trying to sleep.

name: Plug Inn Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Sweet place. Good location. Private room with bath and shower was dope. For a first timer it was super nice.

name: Plug Inn Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
This hostel worth the value of it its also clean and have friendly staff but it have alot of disadvantages
1. There is no lockers in the rooms but there is safe spot for items.

2. Location is far from center you need 30 min atleast to arrive to center.

3. Elevator is really small.

4. There is no atmosphere in the hostel, there is no night activities or events, not recommended at all for solo travellers

name: Plug Inn Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Great location, very close to the train, cafes and places to eat. Private rooms are small but sufficient for a great stay in Paris. No reason to need a huge room if you are out enjoying this city. Clean and great staff. Would certainly go back.

name: Plug Inn Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: This place was amazing. I had my bank cards stolen on my first night in Paris (not in the hostel!) and the staff was very helpful and supportive. Even with my cards being stolen they made sure I was still able to have a great trip. Thank you Plug Inn Hostel!!

name: Plug Inn Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Room so small

name: Plug Inn Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Perfect location, room was nice and clean and compact. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Given we were in the heart of Paris and in a private room (with our own bathroom), I thought the price was good. Breakfast was pretty basic, but that seems standard for hostels these days. The close proximity to M2 Blanche metro station was a bonus! So easy to get to CDG :-)

name: Plug Inn Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Great hostel, great location! The staff was so friendly and helpful and it was very easy getting to all the main attractions with a just a quick walk to the Blanche or Abysse metro station. Rooms were a bit small, but not unusual for Europe and the breakfast could have have been something more then croissant and baguette (maybe fruit). Overall, great experience and I would definitely go back!

name: Plug Inn Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Good little place to stay if you just want somewhere to rest your head... Nice rooms nice staff nice location just no social vibe there but no complaints

name: Plug Inn Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Staff was great. Breakfast was minimal room was very tiny and the fan did not keep it cool.

name: Plug Inn Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: The included breakfast was a highlight as well as the friendly staff. However, we paid for a private room and weren't completely satisfied. You are most certainly paying for the location at this hostel and breakfast. There was no security for luggage left during drop off except exceptionally small lockers for passport and ipads, etc. The rooms were tidy, but the pillows were simply covered with the bed sheet and had no separate pillow case. The bunk beds were very wobbly.

name: Plug Inn Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
Very clean, excellent location. We had a private room and there was a nice fan on it so we stayed fresh even though outside was hot. 
The staff was very nice except for one lady who answered the phone when I called prior arrival and she hanged up as I couldn't speak french. The rest of them spoke English and Spanish so very easy to communicate.

name: Plug Inn Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Perfect location! It's walking distant to the Moulin Rouge!

name: Plug Inn Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: This hostel is pretty good if you have your expectations set correctly. It is a budget hostel in a trendy Parisian neighborhood. So, the rooms are small (as most rooms are in Paris), the breakfast is limited (but it is perfectly fine for the price you're paying), and the hostel doesn't have extra amenities. However, the wifi signal is reliable. The hostel is within 3 minutes walking distance to two metro stations that can get you to most of the sites in the city. And Montmartre is very fun!

name: Plug Inn Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Hostel is at very good location. Staff are friendly and helpful. There are lockers to keep valuable things and also bags can be locked in rooms. you can find the smallest lift in which only 2 people can fit in. There is no bar at hostel to come back and relax. Rooms are VFM and breakfast is decent with slightly less varities

name: Plug Inn Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Only for one night but staff was fantastic and made my short stay fantastic.

name: Plug Inn Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: David was really welcoming and a godsend after the trip we had just had. While we weren't able to check in right away (we got there early) we were able to shower and chill out in the patio. We were able to lock our important items up and leave our bags under watch while we went and got some food, also recommended by David. He was lovely. Really great service. The room was clean and accommodated our needs for one night. Water pressure in the shower was wonderful! We would definitely stay again!

name: Plug Inn Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Great location in Montmartre. Not the cleanest but rooms had a bathroom each which was very nice.

name: Plug Inn Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Great location and amenities. I felt like I made friends with the staff. There isn't a ticket system when you leave your luggage like other hostels. There are small lockers for valuables; but, when your a bit slow like me, you might not think to unpack your luggage to put valuables in the lockers. Consequently my laptop was stolen. A little extra security might go a long way. The staff was very kind and helpful in directing me to the police so I could get everything sorted.

name: Plug Inn Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Super clean and in a great location, decent free breakfast. Other guests were friendly, but it wasn't very social, and the stairs were noisy at night. The on-suite bathroom was really nice, and made it feel more like a hotel room. Use of the kitchen was appreciated too.

name: Plug Inn Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Accommodations are small, but par for the neighborhood, considering the size of Paris buildings. Breakfast is just what you need before a day of sightseeing and every room is cleaned regularly. Staff is helpful to those who need directions or shuttle services.

name: Plug Inn Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: I was in a three bed female dorm. The bathroom was too small, it was very difficult to do anything in there and the room was very hot. There was a fan but it was on a timer so as soon as it went off the room got hot again. The lift is comically small as well. It hardly fit two people. Not very close to the centre of Paris but the neighbourhood is cool with nice restaurants etc. Ok for a couple of nights but I don't think I'd go back.

name: Plug Inn Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: It was a nice clean hostel, only a short walk from the Moulin Rouge and Sacre Coeur. At night it changes alot, Pigalle's Red Light District is interesting to say the least, we were offered the best pussy in Paris on multiple occasions. The other main sights in Paris were only accessible by metro unless you want to walk for a long time. Overall, a good hostel with a questionable location.

name: Plug Inn Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Good accommodation for Paris - lovely location in Montmartre, pretty clean, mostly cheerful staff. No real common area or social vibe though, so would not recommend for solo travellers hoping to meet people

name: Plug Inn Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: We had a wonderful stay at the Plug Inn hostel in Paris.  The staff and security were awesome!

name: Plug Inn Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Staff were very friendly. The whole place was kept clean and tidy and the kitchen was well equipped. We found that Montmartre both had a lot to offer in itself and acted as a great base for exploring Paris. Our room was made pretty uncomfortable by the fact that the fan was broken, however, making it almost impossible to sleep because of the heat. Also a disadvantage was the lack of communal space, but overall a good, fairly cheap hostel.

name: Plug Inn Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: This was a great hostel for what we paid for. Staff was kind, breakfast was good and it was a good place for a group that was not fluent in french!

name: Plug Inn Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: I stayed here assuming there were comunal areas or more to do in Montmartre. Up the hill there's bougie wine bars and overpriced shops, down the hill strip clubs and sex shops. A man followed me for 6 blocks soliciting sex, unsafe. 1st day in my (tiny) dorm a girl was switched to my room because a guy in hers was masturbating in front of her. 0 space= 0 privacy. Booked 4 nights and left day 2 due to bedbug infestation. They gave me a partial refund. Breakfast sucks but staff is cool. Overpriced.

name: Plug Inn Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Plug Inn was a wonderful place to stay. It was very clean, and there was breakfast every morning. There was no AC, but the fan helped. There are 3 train stations close by, and the beautiful Sacre Coeur and Montmarte areas were all in walking distance. A short train ride to many other sightseeing places. The shower and elevator were very small, and to get there is a lot of uphill walking.

name: Plug Inn Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: A good hostel. Nice breakfast. Rooms were small and no air conditioning in my room, but I think this is normal for Paris. Easy to find near a lot of things. Staff was friendly. Clean linens and towels.

name: Plug Inn Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Staff were very pleasant and helpful, but the first day we walked in our bathroom was flooded with wet toilet paper everywhere which they did clean up. We also stayed for 5 nights and not once did they change our sheets or give us new towels. They also offer a "free breakfast" which is a croissant & small baguette so if you expect real food just skip it. Was worth the money however & would come back again if I was on a budget.

name: Plug Inn Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Lots of stairs, but loved it.

name: Plug Inn Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: When I first arrived to place, it had weird smell throughout the building. The places should rated lowered. When i initially pick the room and i certain expectation of the room. Thea picture online was different from in person. The picture angle as if you expected that size. To have tellpeople living basically our suits case could over the room. The towels were not properply cleaned. In the shower it had water coming. And it was cause weird smell throughoutthe bathroom. The location of place ðŸ˜€

name: Plug Inn Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Great stay and front desk was always very helpful. Somtimes at the end of the day the front desk area smelled funny, but I was more than happy with my stay

name: Plug Inn Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Loved being in Montmartre. Really friendly staff, nice to come back to after a lot of rude service out in Paris ;) the breakfast could include something other than bread, but it was delicious nonetheless. Not much of a common area just FYI! Nice having a private bathroom for each room. Beds weren't super comfy but they were alright!

name: Plug Inn Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: This hostel is very easy to find from Blanche metro station and in a gorgeous area of Montmartre, Paris- only a short walk to the SacrÃ©-Coeur and also the beautiful Le Mur des je t'aime! The staff were very friendly and helpful and the breakfast was simple but nice! The only thing is the rooms (higher up in the builder) get very hot at night!

name: Plug Inn Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: This hostel has the most amazing location if you want to experience Paris and Montmarte in the best way possible. The room was beautiful and very clean. It also had the most amazing view! Staff was very helpful and nice. Will definitely stay here again. Highly recommend this hostel!

name: Plug Inn Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Was really nice hostel perfect location really easy to get anywhere from there metro just down the road, only problem we had was that we booked a twin room which we booked for three nights on the second day well we were out they went into our room moved all our stuff around to add an extra bed thought this was very strange as they could of just waited until the next day when we were going to check out but other than that really good :)

name: Plug Inn Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: This was our first stay at a hostel and we were pleasantly surprised.  The staff was very friendly and helpful; our room (a private double) was cute, clean and comfortable; and the location is great!  It's in a lively area so street noise can be an issue but it's nothing that a pair of earplugs won't resolve.  The fan provided in our room was appreciated since there is no air conditioning and we were there in July.  We would definitely return.

name: Plug Inn Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: It was a fine hostel nothing too special. I guess I didn't realize that each room has their own bathroom which I didn't have a problem with but I could see how it would be an issue. It was super easy to get into the city with the train from here but it did take about 25 minutes.

name: Plug Inn Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
You might think that having a bathroom in your room is a great idea... well is not! Amazing how many guests want to take a shower at 2 am in the morning. 
Staff was friendly and well informed. If you want to explore the city this is a good place, but if you're looking to make friends or hangout in the hostel I wouldn't recommend it then.

name: Plug Inn Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Staff was very friendly and attentive Everyone was kind, respectful and nice. The lockers were great they even held my luggage until check in I highly recommend them.

name: Plug Inn Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: The hostel was in a great location and it was quite clean. The only issue I had was that I was on the top floor and it was really hot. Even in the middle of the night, I struggled to stay cool enough to stay asleep.

name: Plug Inn Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: If you ever go to Paris do not book this hostel, it's not worth your money. The rooms are super small, the shower and the bathroom can barely fit one person. Otherwise, you have to go to the basement. Everything is super old, the elevator, the items on the kitchen, etc. I had a backache every. single. night. because the beds were so uncomfortable and noisy. Only good thing I can say is, great location.

name: Plug Inn Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
We enjoyed our stay at Plug Inn. Location is perfect with very easy access to the Metro. We stayed in a private 4 person room. It was clean and ensuite bathroom was clean. Staff were friendly.
The only problem we had was our room was on the ground floor right on the street. Because it was so hot we had to leave the window open at night and between people coming out to smoke outside our window & busy traffic on the street it did make it hard to sleep but it wouldn't put us off staying again!!!

name: Plug Inn Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Workers were very helpful and funny! The bathrooms are beyond tiny.. but everything was great!

name: Plug Inn Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Great being close to the city, nice and quiet hostel if that is what your seeking. Brekky was good but the the room gets cramped in the morning. Wifi was excellent and the staff were very friendly.

name: Plug Inn Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Far away from main tourist attractions. Room was tiny and hot. Breakfast was corn flakes, orange juice and a croissant. Just not as impressive as the reviews made it appear. Would not recommend

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Good location for being near to Gare de Nord.  Staff was helpful with my heavy bag.  Wish the elevator went to the basement for getting my luggage down there.  Good value.  Nice and clean.  Someone had used the towel on my bed, but that's not your fault.   Plugs are located too far away for the fans to reach anywhere.  It was quite warm. would I recommend or do it again?  yes! Thank you!

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Their towel shipment didn't arrive the day I stayed there. They said my towel would come eventually but I never received a towel. I asked if I could purchase one, to which the front desk clerk shrugged and said I could try to buy one at Gar du Nord. I said forget it and that I would drip dry. When the receptionist the next day asked how my stay was I mentioned the towel thing and she offered her apologies and then gave me 2 free breakfast vouchers. I was checking out that day so I did not use it

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: There were several things that could have been better about the St Christopher.  The location is terrible, in particular at night.  One block in the wrong direction, a young group of girls could find themselves in trouble.  We had a room with an ensuite...but the shower was extremely small (shower turns off every time you turn and bump with your hip) and there were no towels even though we were promised we would receive them throughout the night.  I could go on but I'm out of characters.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Great backpacker very close to Gare du Nord! Very convenient for the location, but it is not the best area of Paris. Great atmosphere with parties in the night and great facilities. The breakfast for 4 euros is a great deal! The security lockers should be for free...

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: We have veey bad experiance staying at this place...First night the bed bugs bite us all over our bodies, when we told on reseptio they asked to show the bites and just said "sorry"...Also they have a club inside of the hostel and loud music was untill 4 am everyday...No AC, the staff is rude..Stay away feom this place, I still have problems with the bed bugs, hope I wont bring them home...

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext:
Adorei o Lugar, gente Bonita, animada.. Conheci muita gente, fiz amigos!
Tudo preparado para viajantes. Tomadas, lockerts, cama, tudo muito organizado.
Amei.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Location seemed unsafe. Bathroom was ridiculously small.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: What a great hostel, staff were wonderful, food was super. Especially the spicy chicken wings.  Rooms and bathrooms were clean.  Well done!

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Very affordable and excellent location for siteseeing close to metro station. Hostel is clean, safe and offers many activities. Staff is friendly and helpful. Noise levels on occasion can get loud.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext:
I found the hostel to be pretty nice! They had a lot of activities going on at the bar and had sight seeing activities like walking tours, shuttle buses and other things for a small price.
They were pretty clean in general. I never felt unsafe in the hostel although it is in a bit of rougher neighborhood. I still think the location was great though since it was within a few minutes walk from Gard du Nord and Gard de l'Est.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Very modern hostel with great amenities. There were outlets in each bed and bathrooms were kept very clean. The location was okay, close to Gare du Nord train station which is as nice, but we had to walk a ways or take train to get to good restaurants or any sightseeing. Bar and restaurant were good and the rooms were quiet, actually got a good night sleep in a hostel.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: This place was pretty cool. Good security. A lot of the other reviews say this is in a sketchy area, and admittedly had me scared. But once we got there, it was totally fine. There's lots of people around, restaurants open and what not. Anyone who says this area is dangerous must not be in cities often. Just be smart and watch your bag so pickpockets don't take advantage of you, just like everywhere else in Europe. Even as a woman, never did I feel like I was in danger.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Beatrice is f**king amazing, Best part about the stay was wine and cheese night

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Cozy beds and storage available in rooms. Bring your own lock though. I enjoyed that there were charging stations and overhead lights in my bunk. I would totally stay at this hostel again.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: My stay at st Christopher's wasn't really anything special. However the  location is good and staff are lovely. The bathroom floors are always yet from the adjoining showers. Someone threw up in my room and it took two of us going to the front desk two separate times to finally get it cleaned. Super close to train station and subway stops which is nice too. It's a huge hostel with a lot of big groups so not sure I would've met anyone if not for my lovely roommates

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Good stay, easy location to a main train/metro station. Could easily meet people with the bar downstairs.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: This hostel was very large with a lot of accessible amenities. Towels were provided and the bunks has curtains which was nice. The biggest downfall was the location as the area felt a little dangerous. Within walking distance to the train station.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext:
Good hostel. Probably better than most in Paris. Friendly staff especially Liam (front desk guy) and Beatrix (free mojito class!)

Good vibes

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: I love this brand because it's reliable and affordable. Clean, comfortable facilities. Love the privacy curtains and 2 personal electric plugs. Free towel, bed was made when I got there. The neighbourhood was a bit sketchy but trains were super close. Fun party atmosphere, though I could hear the music pumping every night until late (even on the week days) but I slept through it. The building itself was SUPER secure and safe. Didn't like the janitors that barged in constantly without knocking.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Stayed for 2 nights - unfortunately my bed had a horrible smell of body odour that was so bad it made my clothes smell. I let the staff know and they were super accommodating and moved me for the next night, no questions asked. The room was also over the bar and on the Saturday night was loud with club music well past 2-3am. Hostel itself was fairly clean and secure, staff friendly. Area surrounding the hostel was sketchy at night and you do need to take the metro to all attractions.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Very nice place with big rooms and air conditioning

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext:
Great experience, the staff was amazing, helped me whenever I needed. The room was clean and organized, just the common bathroom could be a little cleaner. The bar adjacent to the Hostel is a positive extra, with good food and ok prices (just for food, alcohol was a little bit pricey on my opinion).
Just two negative things I would like to point: the towel was not included and I had to buy a padlock to secure my stuff on the proper place. In those two thing I spent 8â‚¬ that I didn't expected.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Great place to stay especially if you're young and want to make new friends from around the world as almost everyone is very sociable. Best time to stay is on the weekend as the Bar/Club Belushi's downstairs has a great atmosphere and good music on Friday and Saturday night so no real need to go to a club elsewhere and drinks are2for1 for people staying at the hostel and the staff and bartenders are very all very nice. The Metro is very close and so is the eurostar so commuting is easy as well.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: The hostel is really close to the main station but quite far from the main attractions in Paris (Eiffel Tower, Champs Eleyss, etc.). Check-in was smooth. Rooms are clean and neat but extremely small. We took the twin sharing room and had no moving space. Toilets were as compact as an aeroplane. There was a small table fan for ventilations and windows don't open beyond 3 inches which made the room quite stuffy on summery afternoons. Belushi's downstairs was fab for both food & drinks!

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: The hostel is nice and very close to the station. The bathroom was clean and the bed was very comfortable. The only thing is that some people from my room were really noisy like listening to music without headphones in the late evening and packing their stuff at 4:30 in the morning. Though I know the staff hasn't a lot of control on that kind of behavior.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: they have plenty of security so I felt safe once I was inside the hostel, the area however is very scetchy late at night. The rooms were clean so no problem there. My biggest issues are that the storage space for your stuff is under the beds so if you have a lot of stuff or big items they won't fit and the showers and bathroom have to be shared by the whole floor

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Nice and clean hostel with curtains on the beds for privacy plus your own PowerPoint, light and USB ports and a locker under the bed. The only issue was the room smelt like cigarette smoke possibly due to the smoking room in the club downstairs. The hostel is a little far out of the city but still a good place to stay. Only a 30-40 min walk to the Louvre museum and a 20 min train ride to the Eiffel Tower. Overall a pleasant experience.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: The hostel itself is great, the staff are helpful and the bar is fantastic to meet people. The only downside is how sketchy the neighbourhood is, I saw several people get robbed while walking from the train station to the hostel. So if you're a solo traveller like me just be careful with your things while you're walking around, especially at night! But I will say once you're in the hostel it's completely safe, they have security at the entrance always! Would definitely stay again.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Great hostel! Was a little disappointed when we checked out and wanted to store our bags that we had to pay and also that the staff did not tell us we needed coins to use the lockers. (it was our last day in europe so had tried to get rid of our euros!)

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: It was a great night, the light music didn't disturb me, and I would recomend it to everone.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Overall this hostel was very good. A very large hostel with a party atmosphere with organised events every night. Easy to meet people and socialise within the hostel. The area does feel quite dodgy as it's right near the train station so I didn't feel comfortable going out after dark by myself, but it's alright if you're with other people. The staff were really friendly and were happy to answer my questions. The dorm was very nice but the bathrooms smelt quite bad even after they were cleaned.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Great hostel, conveniently located near the train station. Nice, sociable atmosphere. It gets quite loud - music from the bar can be heard on the fourth floor during the night. Showers didn't drain well, but bathrooms were pretty clean. As with much of Paris, I wouldn't wander around this area alone late in the evening/night. Large groups of men seem to hang around outside the train station at all hours, so watch your valuables/stay aware.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Very helpful staff. Fun and exciting atmosphere. Something going on always.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: We really enjoyed our time at St. Christopher's! The area around the hostel does not feel very safe so having a security guard around in front of the hostel was mind easing. Our room was very spacious so that was great as well. The front desk also gave us free breakfast which is worth the price. Only complaint was that there was not two showers for a while floor. Had to wait to shower.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext:
The room, location and staff were all lovely, however the room had a very strong smell, which did not fade over our stay. 
Unfortunately the smell was very unpleasant and so slightly tainted our stay. Otherwise the bar below and the rest of the hostel was fab.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Good beds with curtains for privacy. Good atmosphere downstairs in the bar and easy to meet new people!

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Nice place but noisy outside, bring earplugs! The staff and friendly and helpful.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext:
The neighbourhood is really dodgy, but the security is really good. Very close to a train station. Atmosphere was good, not too many people at night.Possible because I was there during the week. Maybe partying is better on weekends.
Good food. Clean enough toilets/bathrooms. Beds comfortable and private.
Kinda far from city seeing (20min~), but train is very easily accessible.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Clean and tidy, but felt a little sterile which is often the case with large hostels. Staff were helpful and friendly but did come into the room late at night when we were getting to sleep as there was a bed mix up, surely something that could have waited until the morning, just take the free bed. Close to the gare du nord but felt a little unsafe in that part of town.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: The location of this hostel was great for my boyfriend and I as we had two early morning trains during our stay. The train station is only a 3-5 minute walk away. Our 4 bed mixed dorm was clean, and the beds comfortable. I love the pod type styled beds! The only downsides of this hostel are that it's located in a sketchy area as other reviews had stated and the club is quite loud. The ear plugs provided were definitely necessary. All and all this place was a great choice for our stay in Paris!

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Lovely hostel, with bar attached. Clean and friendly.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Great hostel with a dope atmosphere. Hostel workers are really accommodating and let me check in a few hours earlier so I could sleep since I wasn't feeling well. Would 100% come back here again!

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Thia place is easily accessible from Gare du Nord, so it is a good option if you are coming to Paris by train. However the area is not close to city centre so you have to take public transport to get anywhere. The room was clean, a ovÃ© your bed you have few inputs and a light and of course ceilings on the bed for privacy. You can lock your bag in the lockers room, but its not always working properly.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Accommodations were good, food and drinks were okay. Location is convenient to train lines but that's about it. Wasn't crazy about the idea of anyone can come into the bar area, you got your "locals" that would linger in daily trying to take you out, which was sketchy to me. Breakfast is only included if you book directly through their website, not Hostleworlds. Having the curtain privacy on the bunks and towels provided were definitely pluses. Bathroom smelt like a porta potty on the regular :(

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Good hostel, super near gare du nord train station. The food was good and handy to have the 25% discount for all food but one of the bartenders was a bit creepy being way too forward and overly friendly towards my friend and it made us uncomfortable when we where sitting in the bar area

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Great hostel right next door to Gare du Nord station makes the hostel super easy to access. The metro is easy to use and your outside the Eiffel Tower or Notre Dame in no time. The free walking tour was amazing and I met lots of awesome people also staying at the hostel on the tour. We ended up all hanging out for the rest of our stays. The curtains on the beds are great and the lockers are massive. The 8 bed girl dorm was well sized with plenty of space. Great hostel and I would recommend :)

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Such a great place to stay, the staff were so helpful, the facilities were so good, I particularly liked the curtains over the beds for added privacy. But the atmosphere there was great! The location is perfect too, walking distance to places like Sacre Coeur, and close to public transport!

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext:
Beds were standard, I like the addition of a curtain and individual plug sockets so you have some privacy. 
The toilets/showers were clean however there was such a bad smell coming from them (potentially sewage) that I tried not to use them at all costs- it smelt like a zoo. 
The staff were great and willing to help. 
Book through them though to get your free breakfast! 
Other people in the room were friendly or kept to themselves allowing me to have an easy stay.
Would recommend

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Best ever hostel. Value for money, just 20 euros per bed in 10 bed mixed dorm.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext:
Dorms are really spacious and clean, breakfast is good and people at the reception where really kind. Location was convinient for me, specially since I had to take a train early morning. 
Really good value for money, I would stay there again and recommend it to others.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Nice enough, bed was comfortable. Everything was clean, the cleaner was really rude, came in mid shower and was a man in the ladies bathroom and kicked me out at 8am. Love the bar, but it's a bit pricey for a backpackers bar.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: It was a good hostel. Wish the lounge area was bigger. Also wish they had actual lockers in the rooms. The cages under the bed were not big enough.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext:
-Room was too hot, no air con. Only had a broken fan. 
-Housekeeping did not enter our room once this meant, no clean towels, full bin, no tea etc. 
- Paid for a private room, room was tiny and bathroom is basically a portaloo.
- No kitchen in the hostel? Pretty below average breakfast options. 
When checking out, mentioned the housekeeping issue with a staff member and she said there was nothing she could do, maybe a refund for the housekeeping charge? Or at least vouchers for food?

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: The location is awesome. Only issue is there are few restrooms on each floor. Apart from that really good. Rooms are juge compared to other jostels I stayed.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Had a nice stay here, the staff were helpful and the breakfast was such a good start to the day. Rooms were decent and bathrooms were always clean and didn't ever have to wait to use stuff! Only small issue was I thought the bar closed too early! But their restaurant and bar gave a nice discount to guests which was super helpful and made it easy to have a nice meal on a budget

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Loved it! And we had a kettle which was really nice to have with hot chocolate

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Quite a modern, clean, safe hostel with a party vibe. A little out of the way to some of the main sights, but public transport is cheap and easy to use- all part of the adventure! Given the demographic of people staying in hostels, you would have thought the food was cheaper, but it is Paris I guess. Oh yeah, bring a lock or you can buy one to keep for â‚¬4 at reception- the cages to keep luggage safe under the beds don't have locks..

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Had a pleasant stay! Rooms were clean. The location was central! Easily accessible. Walking distance to all the places of interest. I just thought washrooms were too small. Rest had a good stay. Recommend for a budget trip and if you are looking out for a place with great ambience and atmosphere

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: An all-round great experience. I met some really great travelers while at the bar on the main floor. The staff is great, the facilities were clean, and the free walking tour was great. If i ever go back to Paris, I'll probably stay again!

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Outside it is a little sketchy, just in the central of Paris but right when you get inside the hostel you feel safe. Also the breakfast is a steal!! Really good experience and would definitely stay there again and recommend to a friend. For what you pay for this is a top of the line hostel.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: I definitely recommend this hostel! It is very convenient for public transportation and the hostel its self is very cute. I slept in a dorm and each bed had a curtin an electric outlet and a little light. I didn't spend a lot of time in the hostel but it was exactly what I needed a nice clean and space place to sleep and keep my stuff.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: S**t place to stay. S**t area. S**t facilities. Massive hostel. Bar pumps music till 3AM which is not bad if your a partyer but even so shouldn't the rooms be sound proof. Worst bit by far is just the location. Not safe and this is highlighted by the amount of security guards in front of the hostel

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Stayed here after a train into Paris to catch a flight the next day. Agree with other reviewers who say that the area around gets quite seedy at night: Paris just ain't what it used to be! The club music could be heard from my 5th floor room but was manageable. USB charger port button wouldn't stay in the on position (confirming another reviewer who said the same), so make sure to bring an adapter. If you need a cheap overnight stay before a flight, this will do, just be careful when walking in.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext:
The hostel is clean with nice facility. 
But
1. The neighborhoods are creepy at night and not suitable for solo female travellers. When I walked to the minimart(less than 100 meters from the hostel), one guy tried to touch me. 
2. Staff are friendly but the reception is always busy. Everytime, i have to wait around 5-15  mins just to ask something and it's very annoying
3.If you love the party you gonna love this hostel, but if you are hard to get sleep you might hate the noise from the club

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: The area was a little sketchy at night but 3 min walk to the train. It does have a bit of a party hostel vibe with the bar downstairs, but overall super clean and great place to stay

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Bring your own locker, if not you have to buy it for 4 euros. There will be no shampoo, soap, toothbrush like in a hotel. You have to pay for it. So keep it in your mind. Overall I loved this hostel. Great atmosphere, great staffs, great breakfast!

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: The events making crepes as well as sangria with Beatrice were quite a highlight of my stay. Hostel was well kept and clean and was a fun stay, quite a wild hostel.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: A nice hostel. Fun atmosphere in the bar area, and the hostel stayers get a 25% discount. Staff were very nice and helpful. No kitchen, but the rest of the facilities were great. Curtain on the bed was good and every bed has power outlets next to them. Mostly clean everywhere. Location was in a sort of dodgy area, but very close to the train station which was helpful.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Conveniently located next to Gare du Nord. The neighbourhood isn't great but it's conveniently located to Montmartre and the centre. Food in the restaurant was good and bathrooms and beds were clean and private.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Good hostel, walking tour was great! Always good to do. Didn't have long there so not got much to say. Ok if you don't mind lots of noise as the bar downstairs is loud for ages but then again there is a bar downstairs.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: I had an amazing time here! Extremely social environment; perfect place to meet other travelers! Awesome party vibe! Beatriz the adorable lady that host the daily event is amazing! She makes sure everyone has a great time!

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Barry the bartender is an absolute legend. Bit of a scary part of town, but so easy to access the Metro. Very good value for Paris

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: The location is so convenient by the train station, but I absolutely hate the Gare du Nord area of Paris. I always feel so incredibly unsafe walking around, even though the hostel has great security. The facilities at this hostel are top notch, everything is clean and I absolutely loved the curtains around the bunks, such a nice extra touch for a hostel. However they really aren't kidding that there is a club downstairs and the music is pumping all night, but I'm old. Earplugs are included.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext:
I look for a few things when  I book a hostel.

-Central
- Individual PowerPoints 
-closed shower screen 
- cleanliness


This hostel had all those and is within walking distance from some  of  the best parts of Paris. My advice would be to the bakery nearby named Du Pain et Des IdÃ©es, the locals told me to go there and it did not disappoint

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: This is your typical big hostel, this place is enormous, however, it still got everything right. It's a great place to stay if you have an early morning flight or train at Gare du Nord/ l'Est.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Amazing party hostel. The bar is unreal with crazy bartenders. So much fun. Kind of in a rough area and a bit outside the city centre, but right next to a central metro station. Love that the beds all have privacy curtains

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Nice stay. Had everything you needed and Belushis is really nice. Had an interesting experience as people across the ball from us were have a domestic fight, i went and got security who kinda didnt seem to care and just left them. Someone else came back and sorted it out though. Close to train station

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Right near the train station, really good party hostel.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Great hostel, close to the metro and clean facilities

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Payed extra for a private 2 bed room and the bathroom was smaller than a cruiseship bathroom. It also smelled like mold.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Kitchen/ place to put food was awful but good hostel to stay in

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: It's basically a club with a hostel, the neighborhood is the worst, half an hour away from everything and very shady. Loud music everyday, expensive beer.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Stayed for one night. Great location for early train. 10 bed dorm was surprisingly spacious. Lockers under beds were good. Bathrooms were clean. Not really much of a communal space. Only a microwave and fridge provided as kitchen facilities. Fine for 1 night stay.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Convenient location next to the train station, and the staff were extremely kind and helpful. The rooms are clean and comfortable, and the hostel has a nice atmosphere. It would have been nice if there was a kitchen available to guests (eating out in Paris every day gets quite expensive). I also didn't always feel safe entering/leaving the hostel, as one of the hostel security guards had a tendency to catcall female guests and make comments that made me extremely uncomfortable.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: really nice rooms, bar is nice and they have good deals on food and drinks for guests. breakfast is great! but you must book with them direct to get it for free, which was very unclear. only downfall to this hostel is that the area surrounding is not the best or cleanest. but overall good stay

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Great Mojito night with (I've forgotten her name, from Argentina). Really friendly staff

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Very close to the subway station so you can go all over Paris pretty quickly. Belushi's and a hangout room offer plenty of chances to meet other travelers. The dorm rooms are very nice and are spacious. Bathrooms are also pretty nice and very clean.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: The staff was very unorganized, but the price and location we're well worth the stay! I highly recommend it!

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: It was great ,friendly  staff and mont of all very clean they even give you a towel

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Great bar for socialising, I met heaps of new people. It was clean, comfortable, and had these great little curtains for privacy on the bed. Although there's no decent common areas, or a kitchen.Some people felt the neighbourhood was dodgy, however I felt safe.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: First of all I can usually handle anything... but this stay was certainly not good value for the money spent.  Stayed there twice three weeks apart and the second visit was a big let down.  Washrooms were unkept even after telling the front staff about the concern.  Basically a puppy mill.   Large hostel.  No air conditioning or air not working.   Only positive is the location and even that is in a suspect part of the city.    Certainly low on my list of hostel experiences....

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Overall an excellent hostel to stay at. Location was terrible though, pretty far from all the sights. Unless you count that it's near two major train stations, there wasn't much else about the location (and certainly didn't feel very safe in the neighborhood after hours). Staff was amazing though, truly the most professional and courteous hostel staff I've ever worked with. The bedrooms are nice as well. Excellent choice on a budget. I'd give it 4/5!

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: It is a nice place to stay if you want to party at Paris since it has a bar just right on their first level! It is also considerably close to other places since the Gare du Nord station is just across the street.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext:
Was nice meeting the people in my dorm. Went out for dinner with a couple of them and the day day one of the girls and I went out to see the city together.

But this place is /loud/ on a Friday night. Even with earplugs in, I couldn't fall asleep till past 3am. I knew it was a a party hostel but didn't know how much so.

Also somepeople puked in the elevator and stairway - smelled real bad. The stairway puke wasn't cleaned up all night and was still there in the morning.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Everything was great except our bed was completely cracked in half with a big dip. We didn't bother to mention it though so can't say if they would fix it/ move us. Probably shouldn't have a broken bed though they would have known. Everything else was fab and the bar downstairs is great for meeting people and great food

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Good place, location and facilities. But a lot of drunk people making a lot of noise in the middle of night.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: By far the worst hostel I have ever stayed at and that was a combination of staff service, hostel facilities & hostel location. Would strongly recommend booking another hostel as there are plenty others in the same price range that will offer more!

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Standard. Super standard. McDonald's standard. Good to sleep and shower, but nothing magical. Good if you want easy access around the city (Gare du Nord), but will forget about the hostel as soon as you leave it!

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Private room was amazing, like 2.5 or 3 star hotel. Great value

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Wow, we may be biased because we are young and enjoyed the party atmosphere but it was like an American college dorm but with people from all over the world. They have fun, free activities each night planned by the wonderful Beatriz such as wine and cheese and how to make crepes! Great way to meet people! Also, best bartenders (Angelo, phillip and Carlos) are super friendly & eager to help you find the best drink and deal! great deals for food and drinks if you are staying there, so amazing.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext:
Pros:
- The hostel is very well located.
- Good sized rooms.
- Good breakfast (not included in room price if you book on HW)
- Decent priced for Paris.

Can not think of a big con right now. I would stay there again.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: My only complaint would be breakfast. I went at 915am and there was no cheese left, no bread left, no cups, no eggs. And when I asked the girl she said that was it for the day. If breakfast isn't goin got stay stocked guests should not be charged the full amount.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Great hostel. Belushis bar downstairs is always a good time, loud, however bunk beds have privacy curtains and ear plugs are provided. Super close to Garu de Nord station, so great when coming on the Eurostar or for the metro.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext:
Pros:
-Great staff
-Sliding lock basket under bed, that's nice
-Outlets and lights on bed, with privacy curtain
-Sink in each room for brushing teeth
-Roomy beds, pretty comfy, free earplug
-Hallways are decorated with travel info
-Breakfast area/Belushki Bar is quite festive

Cons:
-No AC
-4th floor women showers is not as hot as 1st floor room
-Changing rooms because of extending stay is a real pain 
-Charge extra money for storing luggage, or towel, or hair blowdryer

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: This is one of best hostels I have ever stayed in! The showers are pretty good, the beds have curtains and under the bed lockers. There are also luggage lockers that you can rent in the basement. There is a bar attatched which doubles as the breakfast area. (Warning: it gets loud at night.) You can only go upstairs if you have your key, so security is incredible. The location is not the best, but it is right next to the train station, so getting into the city center was relatively easy!

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext:
Pros: clean dorm rooms, lockers under bed, key card acess to building/floor/room and security out front of building. Privacy curtains on bed with power outlets. Lots of good and cheap food options in the area.  Right next to Gare Du Nord metro station.

Cons: helpful but cold staff, no real common room for hanging out, no kitchen, not a great area in terms of security but (see above), washrooms were kinda of gross much of the time even though they are cleaned regularly. Showers sucked.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Good hostel. The showers were lame though because you had to keep pressing the water on. The security was good but the guy below me took both the lockersðŸ˜• I would stay there again though. You also get really good deals for the restaurant below & they have a long happy hour with good deals

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: There's not really a kitchen area so you won't be able to cook and there isn't even a place to get water except the one sink in the bedroom. The area is also pretty sketchy--fine for during the day but I made the mistake of walking home late at night and would recommend others don't. Other than that, nice hostel. Good place to meet lots of people.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: The bar downstairs is lit! Made it really easy to meet other travellers. Staff was nice. Lockers don't stay propped up when you open them, which was the only thing I didn't enjoy. Overall great hostel

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Spent a week in this location as a solo traveller and enjoyed my stay quite bit.  It is a really big hostel and has a bit of a corporate feel that land the family vibe of smaller hostels. All the amenities are here, including good, reasonably-priced meals. The location is sketchy and far from city-centre without metro. Towel, laundry drinks at bar not cheap. Rooms are nice, clean, and with curtains. The other location might be better for solo travellers since ppl just tended to just pass through

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Fundamental need from a hostel is a good night's sleep. Our room was so  hot that it was just awful... on a very mild night! No aircon and one fan between 6 awkwardly spaced beds. My bed was right beside the door so every entry and exit through the night was a blaze of light and noise. Then they charge for very low grade towels and bag storage. Location isn't that great... dodgy area and easier to transfer to a metro than find your way out of Gare du Nord. Overall, there's gotta be better.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: It was alright. I would suggest updating their rooms and bathrooms a bit.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Location was close to the train station, but further from the typical sights people want to see. Also it is not located in a very nice neighborhood if arriving later in the day. Bar down stairs was alright and breakfast was alright as well. Beds were comfortable, have a privacy curtain on them.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext:
I was only there for a night but it was fine. The staff, atmosphere, and location were great. I would've enjoyed the trip more had I been the party type. I don't party so I didn't like the noise from the bar below.

Pros: location, staff, value for money, security, comfort.

Cons: noise from bar below, you had to continuously press the shower button because it had a 10 second timer, and the laundry system is complicated. 

Overall, I'd go again.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext:
I didn't anticipate that the atmosphere would be so "club-esq." It was noisy at night. Conducive to dancing and partying. The staff were nice and helpful but not friendly. The space feels clinical and impersonal. It was functional but lacked any personal character. Great location, very safe, good facilities and good services. 
It would have been nice have had a chill space to hangout away from all the partying. The internet area had a constant traffic of people entering the club/bar area.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: I loved it!  Overall extremly good!

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: The place was clean, fresh sheets and a towel were provided. Each bed has a curtain for privacy and a pull out locker under the bed to store belongings. Bring your own lock, if not locks could be purchased from the reception. Lockers to store baggage are readily available  very accessible for the cost of 3 euros for the entire day. Either than the aircondition that broke down midway through my stay, everything else was good!

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: First solo trip and couldn't have asked for anything better. Stayed in a 4 bed dorm and it was perfect. Each bed has a curtain for privacy and its own shelf with a power outlet and a lamp. Security is perfect you can't enter the door to the steps and elevator for the rooms without a key card. Rift next to Gare Du Nord station so easy to get everywhere. Only downside was the shower would turn off after 30 seconds so would have to keep pressing it but only a minor thing.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: No flushing toilet for two days, woken up four times by the staff because of double booked beds, loud music until 2 am, having to move room randomly with no explanation pretty much sums this place up. For the money, there are far better places to stay in Paris, wish I never opted for this, one of the worst experiences I've ever had.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Good location, competent staff, very clean rooms, straightforward process with a few glitches.  Book directly with hostel to get free breakfast.  Book shuttles in around ance (or not all and use the metro to save more than half).  Very respectful roommates, quiet in the rooms, hot showers.  I recommend though I don't know if it is truly Paris best hostel.  Worked for me though.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Room and Bed were okay for a stay for 2 nights in a city like Paris. What i missed was a bigger social place in the Hostel to meet people. My stay was satisfactory and i enjoyed my stay.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Excellent location, neat facilities. 10/10.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: The staff was very helpful and friendly. The rooms were nice but it got a little hot and stuffy, even though fans were present.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Perfect location, helpful staff, comfortable bed

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Great location, clean facilities. The front desk staff are great. Only complaints would be that it's the only hostel I've ever been to that makes you pay to leave luggage. Also on my last night one of the security guards was quite aggressive to another guy accusing him of sneaking in despite having a card and ID but didn't check others (white people, myself included) even when we asked if he would like to. Wouldn't think you needed training on racial diversity in a place like Paris.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: The rooms were not well-equipped for summer. The bathroom of my room was insufferably tiny (my friend is a 1.85, corpulent guy who barely fitted in shower). The facilities are good and the bar at the first floor is amazing. Breakfast is good but they lack staff for it, as the cutlery or glasses were not cleaned up on time. Front desk is very helpful and friendly (some of them are quite handsome). Location is convenient for metro but it feels a bit insecure around.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext:
Clean rooms and the beds have curtains for privacy. Lockers in room with a luggage room if you need to store your things for the day. Breakfast provided for only 1 euro. Washer and dryer onsite. I will say that the bathrooms aren't the best. I stayed in a room where we had our own but it's one of those showers where water will eventually get out and soak the whole room. 

NOTE:  They have a bar/club outside the lobby which is great for meeting ppl but the music thumps so bring earplugs.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext:
Right next to Gare du Nord, easy access to the rest of Paris by Train.
Booked a double bed but was given bunks. No AC and the temp was in the 30s during our stay.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: The staff was pretty sweet. The location is a bit far from the city center but close to a metro. It's also located in a sketchy area. I wasn't a fan of how loud it was until early hours due to the bar located downstairs. Overall, it was a nice hostel but not sure I'd stay again.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Great hostel! Stayed in 8 female bedroom. Loved the private curtain and The locker under  the bed for my stuff. As well as having my own USB and outlet right by my bed. Staff extremely friendly and it's very clean !!!

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Only stayed here one night but everything was great. Room and facilities were clean as well as common areas. Breakfast was a bit lacklustre even for 4â‚¬ and the location seemed kind of seedy. Other than that I enjoyed my stay and it seemed very easy to meet people.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Had to change rooms because of street noise and overall hostel roommates who talked all night. Would not recommend for people who want at least 4 hours of continuous sleep....also- lots of notes regarding having sex in dorms and how its prohibited but it's not like the security checks for people who don't belong there, in fact I saw how they let their friends in at night without hesitation. Not very safe and beds are uncomfortable and lumpy, possibly even have human DNA if you catch my drift..

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Eventhough the showers were not clean and the neighbourhood was not the best, we had a great stay there. The staff was very nice and was always willing to help. They spoke a broad variety of languages which was nice too.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: It's a great place to meet people but I hope you don't like sleeping! They have huge parties every night and of course it's in the center of he complex so no matter where you're in the budiling you can still hear it. Also, since hey don't have AC you have to leave your window open, which makes it easier to hear the wild parties going on. It great if you want to party and no sleep

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext:
Never, never ever stay here!
The loud music from disco downstairs make sleep impossible .... until 2:00 am.
Although they provide the ear-plugs and location is convinient, nearby train station.

I guess for travellers all alike, we need sleep. Thus, this is super important!!

Also, the door access card was malfunction.
Eventhough I extended the check-out to 1:00 pm., the door access card was mulfunction. Something wrong with the system.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Only stayed here for 1 night but it was awesome! Downstairs is literally a club which is sick, and security is awesome - bouncers outside the entrance and massive lockers under the bunks. Everything was super clean and modern, would definitely stay again.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: One of the worst hostels I've stayed at on my travels. First red flag was that the 'free breakfast' isn't even free. You even have to pay for the handwash in the bathrooms? No atmosphere. Staff were very unhelpful, when I asked to switch rooms, they said they hadn't anything available, even though both Hostelworld and their website said they did. Clearly the woman at the desk didn't want to hassle. Last straw were people in my room mentioned/complained of BED BUGS! Booked elsewhere immediately.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Bar downstairs was a disappointment. Blasting music till all hours but the place had no vibe. Good transport links though and friendly staff. Not bad for a weekend away it feels safe. Just get out and see Paris :)

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Everything was great from the private ensuite room we had to the amazing food and service we received. Only issue we had was no one ever came to clean or restock our room during our 4 night stay. Ran out of toilet paper and desperately needed new towels. Otherwise, very happy with our stay!

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: It is a super clean place. But that's about it. All the advantages of hostel is not there. The bar play so loud music all the time (also in the afternoon) so you don't get to talk with other travelers. So it is basically as anonymously as staying in a hotel. Would not recommend if do want be social

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Piss in the hallways. You have to pay extra for towels. Showers soap dispensers were empty. No curfew expiration's are fine, but the lights stayed on in my room all night, and when I turned them off, someone else drunkenly stumbled in and turned back on. On the bottom bunk it wouldn't be so bad, but I had a top bunk so it sucked. I've stayed at several hostels around Paris and this was by far the worst. We chose it because of it proximity to Gard Du Nord, and that is all it has going for it.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Very good hostel! No issues, close to major train station and heaps of cafes/restaurants. All very clean and secure. Good internet, good breaky, our 10 bed room was very spacious and even had a sink which was convenient. Wish it had a kitchen. No complaints

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Good location, staff were friendly, rooms had everything you need but nothing more - it's what I expected from a hostel that costs a bit â‚¬30-â‚¬40 but not worth â‚¬70 for a night, and then another â‚¬90 for an extra night, was definitely not worth it

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: The hostel is very well done, the bathrooms are nice, the shower is super practical, the rooms are private with the little curtain and they have A/C, the restaurant is good and not expensive. BUT... the location is not safe, specially at night, peoples are weird and doesn't make you feel safe. I stayed in Paris before near the canal and it was safe and nice even at night. Otherwise the Gare du Nord is at 2 minutes walk witch is practical to go back at the airport.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Great location next To gare du Nord Parijs Staff was ok Did NOT have breakfast So I do NOT know about that

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
