reviewtext: This place is amazing! The staff were all very friendly everything was convenient. The facility and the rooms were all clean at all times, security was major at this place room cards were needed to get into the elevator and floors and rooms. They had laundry machines and they conveniently had a restaurant/bar and 24/7 security guards. Also they had many activities through out the stay and shuttles to landmarks and airports. Ladies this is a place to feel very safe and outlets for all your needs.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: the experience was okay. the location is pretty good. it was okay clean. also actually felt safe there.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: This is a great and fun place to stay and meet people. The bar makes it a social place and nice area to hang around after a day of exploring. Location was 1 minute from the Gare du Nord station which was very convenient. Facilities were all good and staff was willing to help when needed. I ended up booking another St. Christopher's in the next city I went to because I was so pleased.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Bathrooms were dirty and stinky. The room was ok. Not the best hostel in Paris. Location is good, easy to find and walk from there around Paris (but as a woman it didn't seem safety area by night).

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Great location, great for young people as there was a bar and music down stairs. Great vibe. Dont forget to take a lock as there is storage in the rooms, you just need to bring a lock!

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: No problems with hostel, and the best that I have stayed in so far on my travels. Only issue I had was that Athens Gare du Nord station, which is nearby, is a bit rough and unwelcoming at times. However, I didn't spend much time round that area so wasn't much of a problem.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Great hostel, location is poor although the metro system is really good so it's easy to get around. Belushis was good just lacking the hostel bar vibe.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext:
Lovely hostel. Rooms are very comfortable and the bed curtains give some privacy. Security is very good and the showers/toilets are basic but thats to be expected from a hostel. The bar/restaurant is a great place to make friends and has a good atmosphere. Close to Gare du nord station and the metro which makes going into the city and getting international trains very easy. 
Overall a very solid hostel in paris.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: This is a good hostel for single travelers who want to participate in a party scene and enjoy some American creature comforts while away from home. It missed the mark with me a bit as I would rather go to bed early and wake up early, but the bar attached made that difficult due to loud music until 2am on weekdays and 4am on weekends. The location is okay. The facilities were clean and seemed well kept. I met some good people while staying here and the staff were mostly helpful and attentive.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Stayed for 3 nights with a friend. The hostel is clean, well renovated, staff are as always. As with every St.Christophers, there's a bar attached so it's hard to meet other travels as it's difficult to tell who's just at the bar, and who's at the hostel. Also if you're unaware, if you turn right when leaving the hostel, you arrive in a very shifty area that feels genuinely unsafe. Obviously once knowing that we turned left out the hostel n it was lovely!

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: The staff were disrespectful and condescending on several occasions. The bathrooms were filthy and smelled like they had not been cleaned recently. I went for a drink in the restaurant/bar and there were nice running around on the floor. Thank goodness I didn't choose to eat there. The other guests were drunk constantly and came crashing in and out of the room at all hours of the night. They had no respect for anyone else in the room.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: It was an amazing experience. Truly loved it. Everything was really good.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Hostel is very lively and has a great atmosphere for meeting people. The restaurant/bar has good food and decent drinks. I stayed on the 4th floor in a mix dorm style room with 10 beds total and did not feel at all cramped. The shared bathroom had 4 stalls. 2 toilets. 2 showers. Bathroom cleaned regularly and nothing majorly disgusting. The laundry room was sh*t. Use at your own risk. Staff friendly and informative. Great location right outside a major train station. Made getting around easy!

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext:
I was only there for a short time but have been before and this was the reason I booked again. Lovely staff, good facilities and great location for the Eurostar terminal.
The rooms were clean and well organised plus they had privacy curtains which is always a bonus.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: This place is AMAZING! I loved my stay here in Paris was perfect and I really loved how kind the staff was and how clean all of the restrooms were! I would recommend this hostel to everyone!

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Very fun and happening hostel to live in. Close to Paris Gare du Nord so it is easy to commute from hostel to attractions in Paris using metro. Bar is amazing

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: I stayed in a female dorm 8 bed. They have a very comfortable bed. Best thing is they have the curtains for each bed. The pub is awesome and they have very interesting events every evening. The bathrooms were neat and clean. Staff is friendly too. The location is perfect as it has very good connectivity for all over Paris.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext:
Good bar area with a strong party vibe. 
Reception staff are friendly.
Comfortable beds with curtains and power and lights and 6 bed dorm. 
Big room with lots of space between beds.
Large lockers beneath beds which can store even big backpacks. 
Can only access showers on your floor and often had to come back later when they were all in use.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: So close to everything, so many people, hard to not make friends. Had a Summer romance here as well and without this hostel we wouldn't have met - amazing start to my travels x

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Was very nice but lots of bathroom traffic and guys didn't clean up after themselves well enough so that was the only issue.  Friday and Saturday night's the bar DJ played extremely loud until about 4:00am so earplugs needed.  Overall stay was very good with great location near the train station which helped us to get around greatly.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Wonderful hostel for those looking for a convenient party hostel. I most appreciated the proximity to Gare Du Nord and Est, as well as the bar/restaurant in the middle. Great accommodations but certainly not quiet.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Great hostel with a good atmosphere and nice people! Everything was clean and worked well, it felt very secure. Lots of activities for solo travelers or just to meet other people in the hostel. The location is great because it's right next to a metro station and not too far from the Montmartre area or Canal St Martin. It's located in a somewhat sketchy area but it didn't make me feel unsafe. Would stay here again!

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Super nice stay over the weekend!

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Spacious room, with a fun bar atmosphere downstairs.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: This probably the best hostel I have stayed at in my Europe trip ! It's definitely more like a hotel feel with curtains to shut your bed off so you feel you get the privacy! The staff were so helpful with everything I needed I couldn't recommend staying here enough !

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Great hostel! The rooms were super nice and clean! Loved the privacy curtains on each bunk! The bar was super fun and happening, always a good atmosphere there, as well as some good drinks deals!

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: It was unbearably loud due to the bar below playing pounding beats late into the night, it was impossible to sleep. Not suitable for business trips or anyone who needs some sleep and to be out the next day.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Curtains on the bed help for privacy, but the trade off is that it kills the social aspect of the experience.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Of all the hostels I've stayed in this one was the best. I highly recommend St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord in Paris.  The hostel was clean, the atmosphere lively, the staff was friendly and helpful, and I felt secure and safe staying there. The rooms were nice, spacious enough and unlike other hostels I've stayed in, provided a bed with plug points for chargers, a privacy curtain and a spacious locker under the beds. Bathrooms were clean and relatively good in size too.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Was the only girl in a mixed dorm of all men, asked to move to a room with at least one other girl and they moved me to another room that had no girls in it for the next three days remaining. However the staff were nice when talking to them. Not much of a vibe either

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Fantastic hostel, only short distance from train station, great atmosphere at night and lovely food ðŸ˜Š

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: The hostel was in a very sketchy neighborhood, that me and my friend got followed back to the hostel. So if you're a woman especially, please be extra vigilant. There was no AC in my room, but some mentioned they had it in theirs. There is a bar smack dab in the middle of the hostel that blares music till 1 or 2 in the morning, and since it's so hot our windows had to stay open. Was hard to sleep. But it's close to the subway so that was nice.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Big, energetic hostel. Very popular bar downstairs but there will be noise at night. Didn't bother me but may be noteworthy! Location is close to Gare de Nord but it's not the best area at night or for late night convenience. Pretty far from all sights even by metro.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: The hostel itself was great, the breakfast was reasonably priced (4Â£, free if you book directly through them) and the metro is so close, that it's not a problem, but if you're looking to drink, and explore the area after hours, it's extremely sketchy at night, which is probably why they have a bar, but that bar is limited, and the atmosphere varies.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Bit far from your "tourist traps" but does the job. Pretty dodgy round place late at night but hats Paris. Great rooms great atmosphere meeting a few locals and pretty close to some solid canals where u can take a beer down and drink with locals. Music goes till late and really loud so don't try and chat without yelling in mains bar. Probably most partying hostel on trip.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Place was great. Clean and comfortable.  The area is kind of sketchy at night by train stations. But hostel itself was very safe. I needed to use my key card at least 5 times before I got to my room.  Very secure

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Facilities a bit dirty, I slept on the top bunk and found pubes all over the shelf. Staff were nice, bar downstairs is a bit loud, beds are comfy. Located right next to the metro which is needed to get anywhere significant

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Good place to stay, close to metro and main station, rooms were a little hot but of course they would be at this time of year, staff are very helpful and friendly, nice beds with charging station and light, also curtains.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext:
I would not stay here again! The location felt unsafe & I was uncomfortable waking in the streets to get to/from the hostel. 
The reception staff were lovely. A few things about the hostel: you have to pay for a seperate locker for your valuables in addition to your room charge, we were told we would get fresh towels every 2 days but we didn't get any for the 4 nights we were there, the room was really hot with only a small pedestal fan + no airflow from the window, very loud, room smelt

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: They played extremely loud music until 3am. Do not plan to get any sleep until late at night every night.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: My only complaint is sometimes the front desk can be slow and the location is a bit far from everything. The events they hold downstairs at the bar area were a lot. Of fun and a great way to meet people.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Echoing what's already been said. There's a bar and the place can be loud. They supply ear plugs and after a couple 2 for 1 mojitos I had no issue sleeping. We slept two nights in a dorm and 2 nights in a private and had no issues. We'd stay her again.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: It's very loud because it sits on top of a bar, so light sleepers beware!

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: It is good for a party place but provides zero paris aesthetic or feel. We stayed because our flight got delayed and as an over nighter it was fine.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Love that it's right next to Gare du Nord, easy to get around the city. My only issue might be that some things come off as "false advertising." For example posters in the rooms say breakfast is free, but it really depends on your booking whether or not free breakfast is included. And in the board in the lobby they listed prices for various events and tours but when I asked about it they said it's outdated and the cost is actually higher. Other than that, fantastic hostel and I would stay again

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Everything was great! I did have a minor inconvenience but it was fixed by the next day. However the location was pretty sketchy.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Overall good experience. Location is good, walkable to most things if you're like me and walk most cities instead of metro. Had AC but was still unbearably hot, especially the second night. Very good staff. Good vibe, and pretty social atmosphere. Loved the privacy curtains on the beds. Just a heads up- book this hostel direct and you can get free breakfast instead of through hostel world and then having to pay :)

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: This place was HOT!! As in my room was so hot one night that sweat was dripping down me just from laying in bed. There is no air conditioning except for one fan in the corner that was far away from my bunk. Plus the windows only opened a little bit. One night I went to reception to tell them how unbearable it was and the guy was really nice and let me sleep in another room for the night. But that room was also hot, only slightly cooler. Also the elevator broke down every day

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext:
Beds with curtains, own light, two normal outlets and two usb outlets were perfect! The room was pretty hot though. They had a few fans in the room but they didn't do much for everyone.
Overall pretty standard, I only stayed for one night but would stay again.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext:
Very very big hostel, with a good bar with good food on the ground floor, location is great if your using gare du nord, but need to be careful outside the hostel.
It's clean, lots of good beds, secure big lockers in each room

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Probably wouldn't recommend this hostel to anyone unless you're travelling in a big group. No decent common area to meet other travellers and the location not that great if you want to be able to walk to the major sites

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Great price benefit, everything was fine and they have even lockers to put the bag. The only thing it was too hot and the room didn't have a fan or aircon. Room was clean.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Would certainly use your Copenhagen sister hotel again but Paris is noisier than the Peripherique in rush hour so would not stay with you again, sorry.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext:
We arrived late and was very tired so we got to bed as the first thing, although we were told: "sleep easy", was it a bit hard bc of the club going on downstairs. A lot noisy. On the other side, was the club/bar great. Good location as it is just nearby the trainstation and metro on every corner, if you would like to see Paris! A lot of many other back packers so you can't avoid to get to know other people. 
The cleanliss was okay but we were told that it would be cleaned pr. 2 day - it was not.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Great atmosphere! Very good if you like making friends. However, the location wasnt very nice and the breakfast was pretty bad. luckily it is easy to get a metro to nicer parts of Paris.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Really great hostel you get value for money and the staff are incredibly helpful and lovely. The rooms are very clean and our view was incredible considering the price we were paying. I would highly recommend this place and will definitely be back!!

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: The hostel is located in a sketchy area of town so its not safe to walk around the area at night. If you get a room on the first or second floor, you will not be able to sleep until the bar closes every night. Even if there are only 5 people hanging out at the bar, they will blast music until at least 2:45am. The bathrooms are small and unclean and smell like urine and vomit. If you plan to drink every night you stay here then the bar can be fun. The staff is also helpful and friendly.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Everything is perfect, location is a little wary if you're a female walking on your own at night, but apart from that worth every single penny!!

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Good hostel if you like to party. Bar tenders are friendly and welcoming. Comfy beds. Good food at a great price. Would go back for sure !

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: It was really nice to have the hostel located right next to Gare du Nord, and the security is really top notch. I wa located on the top floor and I could barely hear the bar at night. Given the semi-low price-point it was an okay stay, but the rooms themselves were nothing to brag about. No AC, so we had to use small fans and let the door and window be open during the night, and even though I laid on top of the duvet it was far to hot. The sink didn't drain and the toilet was unclean and smelly.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Stayed for 4 nights at the beginning of August. Facilities were nice, comfortable bed and clean rooms/bathroom. Location was nice and close to the main rain stations. However this neighborhood is not safe after dark, there is a reason why they always have 2-3 security guards out at all times. If you are planning on going out at night in anything but a large group I would not stay here I would suggest a more central location due to the neighborhood.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Best hostel chain for students and people of similar ages, an amazing atmpsphere and great facilities makes for a positive experience overall. Popular, with lots of friendly visitors. Only thing I would say is it isn't right in the city centre so metro ticket needed to access this.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Lovely hostel but I stayed on the top bunk of the 5th floor. Was so hot even with fans going that I couldn't sleep so checked out at 1am and slept at the airport instead. If you get a room in the lower floors there is air conditioning so much better.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Overall a very nice hostel, very big so you meet a lot of people. Beds were spacious and comfy and each one had a privacy curtain which was very nice. The place to store your luggage in the room is pretty small and if you need to lock up more stuff you have to buy a locker. Great atmosphere with events basically every night that usually include free drinks or food (they have a bar) so that's always good! Location is a bit far from the downtown tourist stuff but easily accessible by the metro.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: I stayed here for a night when traveling through Paris. The curtains around the beds are AWESOME. Very close to the metro and a fun bar downstairs if you're looking for fun right there. Would recommend!

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: It's a nice hostel, clean and well located, the only thing i didn't like to much was the attitude of one of the receptionists, besides that I would recomend people to stay there.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Everything was A-grade except for certain bartenders who were either so sleep deprived they couldn't remember who to serve next or they deliberately ignored males and went straight for females.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: A bit too loud and very hot, no air conditioning and the windows don't open very wide.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: As always, St. Christopher's does not disappoint.  Lovely rooms, great food and staff and a location so close to gare du nord you could literally throw a stone to hit it.  Amazing.  Will always try to stay here when in Paris!

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext:
staff was friendly and gave great recommendations of non-touristy trendy places to go
really enjoyed the mojitos workshop!
it was quite hot when i got there, but i really appreciated the air conditioning fan that was near my bed because it kept things cool during the day and at night.
breakfast at belushi's was extremely convinient
great location right next to the gare du nord

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Was great!

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext:
This place has everything you'd need! The hospitality staff are excellent, hosting a number of team activities every night at Belushis bar, you'll never feel left out. Just strap in and enjoy where the night takes you.

The free walking tour is a great way to spend an afternoon and the hostel is just down the road from montmatre District.

It's a beautiful walk down to the river!

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: My stay at this hostel is always great. You do have to get use to noise though as it's in a very busy area with a very popular bar. Curtains on the beds are a big bonus. Location is awesome since it's so close to a main train station

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Very good hostel. Stayed in a 10 person/all female dorm and adored it. Location was fantastic, staff where on par. Only complaint is the showers could have used a little extra attention when being cleaned. But would 100% return and use their other locations.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext:
La zona donde estÃ¡ ubicado el hotel no es de las mejores de ParÃ­s ni la mÃ¡s bonita, pero lo bueno es que tienes mucho comercio alrededor como restaurantes, minimarkets y la estaciÃ³n del tren y bus que parten a donde sea. 
En cuanto al hotel, me pareciÃ³ lindo y cÃ³modo. El desayuno no estÃ¡ mal para 4 euros adicionales.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext:
Location: Really close to metro and two major train stations. Some are saying it's sketchy. I had no problems though I did see girls being catcalled a few times.

The hostel was fantastic in every respect (security, lockers, cleanliness) except for the fact that it's too hot at night. Can't open the window more than an inch. We had to open the hallway door to get some cool air into the room.

Noise wasn't an issue but we were on the 5th floor. Request a higher floor if you're worried about noise

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: The bar downstairs pumps music till 230 am every night which can be annoying sometimes. Super easy to get everywhere from here. Gare du nord and Gare du l'est are walking distance away. The neighbourhood is 'eclectic'. Would stay again solely for the familiarity of staying somewhere I've stayed before

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Room was very clean and the hostel is in a good location. However the room smelt AWFUL and the air con wasn't working for the whole time I was there and when I asked the staff when it would be fixed they said in a few days, so being in the middle of summer it was absolutely boiling in the room. Also the staff were very reluctant giving back everyone's deposit (which we are entitled too??) for things such as towels and key cards.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Awesome, will definitely recommend

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Hands down one of the best hostels I have ever stayed in. Comfortable beds with privacy curtains, spacious dorm rooms, lockers to lock your valuables, clean toilets and showers and an awesome bar to eat and drink at. Staff were exceptional and even installed a portable air conditioner for us. Only slight downside in the locals like to congregate out the front of the hostel and it can be a bit intimidating at night but apart from that would 100% love to stay again.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Great staff, really helpful. Good location and easy to meet other people

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Really great place and value for money.  Loved how it was very secure. Nice place to make new friends and amazing night life at Belushi's

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: The woman below my bunk got her LOCKED camera equipment stolen from a man who was supposed to be in the same room with us. The area around the hostel is very sketchy with a lot of loitering men around all hours of the day. There is a security guard in front 24/7 but I would not stay here again. The only good thing is that is it is near a large train station and convienent.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: This hostel has a belushis attached to it which provides for a lot of drinking/party. However this also leads to a lot of noise and dirty rooms. Everything is cleaned everyday but I still found myself in a dirty environment. Also the rooms were exceptionally warm. I had trouble sleeping and just lay awake sweating. The worst bit was the location. It is far removed from everything and there are dozens of men standing on the street corners in the short walk from the train station harassing people

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Good hostel if you want to party.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Nice place to stay. Great Location. Great Facilities. Good Price For Money. Very Clean. Good Security as there is normally a security guard at front door and each floor is key protected. Only negative is the loud music coming from the restaurant / bar area until around 2am every night even though earplugs provided to help so makes it slightly harder to sleep. But would stay there again if ever back in Paris.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext:
Great hostel and the staff were really great and helpful! Bedroom was great nice and spaced out and cages for storage under the bed were a great size! The breakfast for 4 euros was worth it considering it's all you can eat and the night life was solid too! Only thing that could be worked on was the bathroom on my floor wasn't the cleanest and smelt bad the whole time.  All and all I would definitely recommend to people and would stay here again!!

Thanks a ton!

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext:
Location was great  , and the bed was comfortable . But it's too hot while I was staying there 2 nights ~even we have had a fan running  all day even in the midnigh ! By the way, the NOISY from the Bar on ground floor was terrible!
It was terrible nights I have ever had been ~

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: The air conditioning in the room wasn't working during an extreme heat wave which made it almost impossible to sleep. After complaining at the reception multiple times nothing happen despite claims that they're gonna fix it the same day. After complaining a fourth time and threatening to leave we were finally offered another room with working air conditioning. The location of the hostel is great; located between two main train stations you can get anywhere by metro or train.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Good for a party. But tons of kids can't handle their booze so there'll be vomit in bathrooms. No AC at night makes it hot as hell.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Good location- right near main train station so getting around is easy. Rooms were hot, even though they had air con, it was just a stand alone aircon and on a top bunk it curtains, it was very hot. I would still come back though :) streets at night aren't very safe for solo female traveller. I caught a cab back at night times instead of a train.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Close to Gare du Nord, rooms lack air conditioning, bathroom was too small to be functional, all our bed linens had someone else's hair on them when we arrived, and many of the rooms overlook the bar...which plays loud music til at least 2am EVERY night. Staff was friendly; but bring air freshener and earplugs if you plan to stay here.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: It's good value for your money. It's far from a lot of the main attractions that Paris has to offer, but the train station is close by. The neighborhood is not very good, but the hostel is safe! The main issue is that Paris is hot in the summer and there is no AC in the rooms. If you are ready to sweat while sleeping or not sleeping at all, then this is the place to be! Really though, it's worth sucking it up a night or two.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext:
Ive stayed in belushis in Newquay, bath , and Amsterdam I thought parts were great and other parts terrible. 
Check in 10/10 superb
Bar staff 0/10 just ignore you! The long haired guy who is quite feminine finally served me on the last nigh of my 7 days.....I had to scream at him in a way that I would not have done if I still wanted to stay the next day. 2 or 3 times the bar staff actually requested I walk round the bar to them instead of them coming to me. I get 150 characters!!! Sums it up!!

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Staff pretty unfriendly and incompetent at times. Security outside the door is really reassuring plus all the card key locks. Having belushis there is nice but can be annoying when trying to go to bed early. Bathrooms were pretty gross most of the time and not cleaned that often. The location is good because it's so close to Gare du Nord but the surrounding area is very sketchy.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: I used to stay in Christopher over the world they always choose the best location in heart of the cities,clean, restaurant very good and safty so I recommend Christopher for ever

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Super loud music blaring from the club every night. Mostly just old people hanging around. Gare du Nord location is good but sketchy. Window only opened two inches and the fans they gave you are ineffective. So sweaty and hot 24/7.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: The staff were unwelcoming and rude and ignored us whilst they played on their phones. The rooms were too hot due to their small size and lack of air conditioning. This meant that we had to keep the window open despite the really loud music that went on in the bar directly under the window. There were not enough toilets and showers in the bathroom to be suitable for a whole floor of people.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Super location, clean, spacious. I stayed in the dormitory and in one bed there was enough space and the whole room wasn't crammed at all, which you can find in some of the dormitories. Totally recommending.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Hostel is in a sketchy area. Didn't feel to safe late at night. In the hostel I felt perfectly safe. Rooms and bathrooms are clean. Close to the train station. Overall great place, just be careful outside

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext:
The hostel is very close to the station Gare du Nord. It is very helpful when you have an early train.
However, there is a night club inside the hostel. So don't expect to sleep before 2:30 am!!
And there is also some low class people on the street talking very loudly. So I had a very bad sleep...

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: EVerythng was fine! I've been there few times already, good atmosphere, cool people have fun guys!

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: This place was exciting but not strictly pleasant.  The building is huge, and the central courtyard is a bar which is open late, a blessing and a curse.  We had a private room which was reasonable and affordable, but the in-unit bathroom was less than a closet.  Facilities were decently clean but not immaculate.  Amenities are good and staying at the hostel gets good discounts at the bar and restaurant.  The price varies dramatically by date, so value is not cut and dry.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Really enjoyed the stay at this facility. The distance to the train station and metro were great and lots of options for food right around the area. The denizens of the immediate surroundings were occasionally a little questionable.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext:
No aircon in room, tiny window.
Room was ridiculously small, your locker under the bed would hit the other bunker.
No room for 4 people in a 4 bed dorm. 
The tiny fan supplied was noisy & old, also asked for a double adapter several times for the fan & so 2 bunkers could also have power. 
They advised me to go 'buy one one myself'.
Noisy party hostel music just gets louder from 10-3am. 
Dodgy area. Didn't feel safe out on the street or near Gard du nord station. 
Good security thou @ hostel.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Could improve breakfast with more options such as croissants, bar was good but a bit clubby late at night could use another quieter comunal area. But the rooms and staff were great in a good location.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Clean hostel with good facilities. The storage area for suitcases was smaller than in other hostels. In your room, you can hear the music from the bar so this can make sleeping a bit hard. The environment didn't really facilitate meeting new people but I still met really cool people in my room.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: The area that the Hostel is located in is a bit sletchy especially walking around at night

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Bathroom smells really bad and is dirty all the time. Drainage system doesn't work so there is a pool of water on the floor all the time. Staff doesn't care and are very rude when you ask questions.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Pretty good stay while here. My only real complaint is that the ac was not working at all during my 4 night stay, but I don't think this is a common occurrence at this hostel. Use the metro.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Would definitely recommend this hostel if you are staying in Paris. Only minutes to Gare du Nord and Gare de L'est metro stations by walking. Great place to meet other travellers on your trip as well. Staff are friendly and are willing to help if needed. Lockers that slide under the bunks were provided in the room, I would advise to bring your own locks. Toilets and showers were cleaned everyday. I would definitely come back if I'm ever in Paris again.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: I visited during a heat wave so my room was unbearable without air conditioning. I went to complain and they said all the rooms were the same which was incorrect since I knew people that had real AC in their bunks. They only had fans but after a while they ran out of fans for everyone. The bar is located downstairs so it was difficult to sleep since they Party until 4am so opening a window wasn't any better. Great location next to Gare du Nord but I'm convinced their staff stole my converter.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Great overall hostel. Clean rooms with plenty of privacy and security to compliment the fun restaurant and bar down stairs. Cant get much better for the price

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext:
Stayed here before and both times it's been amazing, clean and I felt comfortable. 

My only problem was heat, I stayed in a 10 share this time and the fan was broken and we only had 1 small fan for the whole big room and I couldn't sleep the whole time due to sweating. Asked staff to help but all they said was sorry it's broken we're waiting for someone to fix it.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Loved my experience at this hostel. It was very clean and the rooms were nice. They had fun activities to participate in (make your own crepes) and fun entertainment in the bar. However, I would not recommend this hostel for anyone that does not like noise. Since they have a great bar, you can often hear it from your room at night. This wasn't an issue for me but I know it bothered some. I would definitely tell people to stay here and would go again.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: The hostel is good, but when I first came to my room, my bed was still occupied so I had to wait a couple of hours. The guys in the room were annoying and dirty, but when they left everything changed and the room was more clean and fresh. Good location and if you want to book here do it directly from their webpage (you get a lot of benefits).

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Loved that they had the bar downstairs, it was a fun place to be, and then we got discounts.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext:
A great hostel.  Everyones welcoming and friendly, From the security staff to the receptionists to the bar staff. 

Private rooms are great and the atmosphere in the bar downstairs is amazing.

A great weekend stay and would definitely recommend as a place to stay!

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: The location is worth the extra money, I have stayed at both of their locations in Paris and this one is better because the location is so much better, and very close to the subway. There is a party every night in the courtyard bar so if you don't like that then ask for a room that does not face the inside. Overall a great experience.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Great hostel with fun events and a fun bar. Super easy to meet people. Only major downside was the location - it's in a bit of a sketchy area

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Lovely hostel, super close to the train station. Clean bathrooms and bedrooms with sinks in the bedrooms which is good. Not so good if you need/want an early night because the music from the bar can be heard in the rooms even with the windows shut!

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Fine place to stay.  Not the nicest neighbourhood, but near convenient transport to city centre, etc.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: This was a nice hostel to stay at if you're looking for a fun place to stay in Paris. There is a small lounge and full bar on site. The breakfast was okay, but definitely book direct and get it free! It was weird that the rooms didn't have soap, so you had to go to the floor bathroom to wash your hands. Also, check in and rebooking was slow compared to other places. They also had tours and activities for guest during the day and some nights! Beatrice hosts an awesome wine and cheese night!

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Great chain hostel! Staff are super friendly and helpful. Bunk beds have a curtain, light and electricity point and are a great size. Belushi's bar is great food and a lot of fun! Felt very safe within the hostel however the area isn't super safe. As a 18 year old girl travelling alone I didn't feel safe using the surrounding transport, so I would suggest travelling in a larger group in this area. Overall a great hostel.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: The continental breakfast is very basic, otherwise my stay here was great!

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Love it would highly recommend

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Solid hostel, great crowd downstairs, very welcoming staff, and loved the in room bathroom setup.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext:
Awful. I checked out 3 days (2 nights) early without refund. 
Room was an oven (8 share, top floor) no A/C and three tiny, filthy fans did nothing but push around dust. 
Door to room had to be left wide open to cool. 
The bar downstairs also plays loud trash til 3/4am making sleep even more of an impossibility. 
Bathroom smelled dank due to poor ventilation. 
Would never stay again.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: This hostel was one of our best and most memorable experiences. We stayed in a private twin ensuite and it was very clean. The bar downstairs was a lot of fun and where we met so many people! The breakfast every morning was delicious. The staff were very helpful and accommodating with suggestions for tours and other things to do around Paris. The location is great - near bus tour stops and the Gare Du Nord train station. Highly recommend. :) A must stay in Paris if you want a good time!

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Bed bugs

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext:
I stayed in a female only en-suite room which was very clean and had comfortable beds. I also felt safe, as keycards only allowed guests to enter their designated rooms and areas. The bar downstairs could get very noisy, but free earplugs are provided by the hostel. 

However, some amenities did not work. The phone charging stations and lights above beds were faulty and it was extremely hard to access my luggage in the cages provided as they needed to be propped up and there was next to no room.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Unfortunately the aircon unit leaked a lot and there were some pretty large puddles all over the floor in our room and some bags got wet. Other than that great hostel, awesome facilities, helpful staff and located right next to the main train station. Not the best area at night time though!

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext:
Location is a three minute walk from a major station, so that was great. It's very secure and bathrooms were clean and comfortable.

I didn't know this before booking but the first floor is a courtyard/bar and had music playing insanely loud until 2:30 am on a Thursday so I assume it's that way every day of the week. Which was wonderful for the night I wanted to party but prevented me from sleeping until about 3am the other couple of nights!

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext:
My friend and I had a lovely time staying here. There were loads of offers and free social events in the bar which were great for meeting new people. We made a mistake when booking in that we didn't check that this was a hostel that allowed minors in shared dorms due to an error on my part (my friend was a month off 18) meaning upon arriving at the hostel we had to change our booking to a private room. The staff were eager to help and were very understanding.

I would definitely stay again.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext:
Fantastic place to stay.
Amazing helpful friendly staff, breakfast and food great, awesome atmosphere..

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext:
Overall, the stay was okay. Security was top notch and aware at all times, the area in and around the hostel was cleaned regularly.  The room looked just like in the photos.

However, I did not get what I paid for.  The staff made mistakes several times that set me back from being able to get out and explore Paris.  There was a lot of confusion and accidents that occurred that could have been prevented.  Disappointed that this happened because I love staying at this company's hostels.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: This hostel was absolutely amazing, and fitted all my needs as a lone traveler. The bar was a great place to meet new people (it had an event 5 nights out of the week), and Beatrice put on fun social events each night as well that were FREE. The only negatives were that the rooms were very hot at night and it's neighborhood is not the best, but being close to 2 Metro stations makes it very accessible. A perfect hostel to experience Paris!

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: The hostel was really nice, staff were lovely and very accommodating.  The location is good, your about 4 minute walk from the metro line.   The whole place is so clean.  However the beds are very hard, so not very conformable.  Overall a really lovely hostel!

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: This place is my favorite hostel in Paris. Super cool vibe down at the bar. Had a cool dinner on Tuesday night. Make sure to go to that if you are there on a Tuesday, super easy way to meet amazing people

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: The Mojito night was amazing!! The host from Spain was amazing, she was fun and made the experience very interesting!!

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Seems quite far from most things, but close to metro station so that was handy. Rooms are fine, but the main thing about this hostel is the bar area. Good food and discounts for staying and great place for drinks and to meet people.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: I stayed at both st Christopher's in Paris and I think the other one had a better location but this one had a better bar and the rooms were nicer.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Great place! Friendly staff that had good attitudes, food was great and cheap and rooms were very clean and tidy! Would happily go back!

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Fine place, clean rooms/bathrooms, no kitchen, loud bar

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Solid hostel. Belushi's gets dirty as the night progresses. It's a party hostel.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Really secure hostel, need a card to get basically anywhere. Good and close o the train station however a kind of dodgy area at night. The breakfast is worth the â‚¬4 but if you book directly to them it's free so probs better to do that. Unfortunately the kitchen only has a microwave and fridge so you can't really cook but still a good hostel

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: We stayed at other St Christophers before, and have had no real problems before, but this one was understaffed or underprepared for the middle of summer. The staff seemed shocked that the place was booked out and used that as the excuse for why our rooms were filthy and uncleaned at check in time, though when they were finally cleaned, it was to the good standard of St Christophers. Everything else was fine though the breakfast has gone downhill, warm milk, dirty plates, bit of a let down

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Staff is so amazing. I missed my train so I went back and Mohamed helped me figure out what to do with my stuff (since I had already checked out) and also had answers to everything I had questions about. Location couldn't be better, a 3 minute walk from the station. Each bed has a curtain which gives you total privacy, and every bed has outlet plugs overhead with a little shelf. Will be looking into St Christopher's in other cities too, thanks for such a good experience!!

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Solid hostel that's close enough transport wise.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: I stayed in two rooms from the time being there, the front desk staff were lovely and very helpful however it was always chaotic when checking in and out. The mixed dorm seem to have always found it's way dirty, so I moved to a female dorm which was much better. The music (nightclub) was very very very loud when trying to sleep, up until 3am in the morning. The rooms do not have air conditioning, which would have much been preferable for the amount of money paid for accomodation.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Loved staying here for two nights. If you're looking for somewhere quiet to put your head down, this isn't the place. The music from the bar is loud and continues quite late, but it wasn't an issue for me as I expected that. The staff on the desk accidentally assigned my key card to the wrong room, meaning we were given access to someone else's room which was a bit of a concern. Other than that fluke, the bathrooms were clean, showers were decent and in general it was very clean.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Shared a double bed private room, small but perfectly fine. There was a fan to combat the heat, could not get to sleep on a saturday night until 3am. Lockers are secure but you need to pay for them. Staff are efficient. Location is next to Gare du nord (convenient for trains), but the 10th arrondissement is far from the core tourist sites.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Unfortunately charged twice the â‚¬5 for a late check out and staff member not very helpful in trying to refund

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Pretty clean nice beds/rooms. Showers had mold on the edge of the floor. Had to use key cards to get into stairs/elevator and room so that's good. Has lockers under the bunks. Area is close to the train station but in a ghetto part of town. Overall not too bad for the price

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: I enjoyed my stay at the hostel. It was a good location close to Montmatre, and a walk to the river. It got a bit loud for sleep with the bar downstairs. The room was clean and the facilities good.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: It was amazing.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: This hostel is conviently located close to Gare du Nord but the area is a little sketchy. As a girl, I felt uncomfortable walking outside. Also, this is definitely a party hostel. The music does blast until 3 am and if your room faces the bar, you will hear it prominently. It is really hot in the rooms as well so you don't want to close the window. The hostel is really clean though and the security is great as you have to have your key card to use the elevator and get onto the floors!

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext:
This place was awesome and is right down the street from the Eurostar station, which makes it very convenient. My friends and I stayed in a 6 bed private suite, which came with two (extremely tiny) bathrooms, but they were clean. 

The bar downstairs played great music and had good food/drinks, but the bathrooms were disgusting and smelled liked they were only cleaned once a day (in the morning). 

Overall, this place is good for a nice, affordable, and convenient stay in Paris!

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext:
The hostel was alright for what we could find at the time of booking. The room was rather small for what we were paying for for a twin share. We were advised the room gets cleaned every 2 days and new towels provided which never happened. It was rather hot cause there was no proper ventilation besides a crack in the window (which couldn't be left open at night as the music from Belushi's could be heard throughout the night). 

The hostel is close to the train station which is convenient.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: A brilliant place in a brilliant city. I fell in love.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: This hostel is in a bit of sketchy part of town. Metros nearby. The bar downstairs is okay. Lively, loud music until the crack of dawn. Rooms were nice and big and the curtain on the bed was cool for privacy. Probably wouldn't stay here again because of the neighborhood but it was alright.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext:
Only spent one night here however my friends mistakenly booked st Christopher's canal (common mistake apparently ) so I spent the night with them there at the bar 

However. Comfy bed, quiet room for such a big hostel. Very safe and good atmosphere 

Location is a bit sketchy at night but next to station

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: I was frustrated by how there wasn't any outdoor seating and the bar crowd took over what outdoor space there was.  The sink in my room was clogged most of the trip, and I noticed some clogging in the bathroom sinks.  Also, a foul smell returned in the shower drain a couple times.  The staff was very friendly but they seemed to be having too much fun at times and neglecting the work.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext:
Clean, fairly modern, comfortable beds. Seems secure. Staff were helpful. 

Literally around the corner from Gare du Nord, which can be good and bad. Handy for transport purposes, but the neighborhood is a bit rough looking, especially at night.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: A huge hostel, with a lot of rooms, but it's a great place. There's an amazing bar there and it's close to the subway (even though the neighborhood can be a little sketchy at night). The staff is friendly and the rooms were confy and clean. My two complaints are that there was no AC in the room (and the windown didn't fully open) and also that with the parties in the bar, it can get a little bit too loud and it's hard to sleep

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: The private room did the job for my partner and I, for our two night stay. As we were there during the World Cup we got to experience the sports bar downstairs going off, and though it was loud on the ground it wasn't too bad up in the room. Without air conditioning it got a little toasty in the room, though the pedestal fan helped with this somewhat. Very central location, and fairly reliable wifi connection.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext:
Great hostel with good facilities in room to lock away belongings (bring your own padlock!) Staff were very friendly. Within the hostel is a bar/restaurant which was always very busy with friendly staff and a good atmosphere! Quite far from the main Parisian landmarks if you're walking but is only a 2-minute walk from the metro which you can get into the city. 
Would recommend this hostel to any travellers looking to meet new people and have a great time without breaking the bank!

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: I stayed for three nights. The first two had issue with toilet keep flushing whole night, hard to get sleep because of the sound. The first day was too hot and the room was sultry with only one small fan. Lift can't be use in first two days. The second floor environment smell moldy, third floor was better after changing room. Ground floor is a bar, quite noisy at night especially when world cup won. Staffs all super friendly and willing to help, but the toilet kept broken, not their fault tho.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Very social hostel - the bar downstairs is friendly and they have events almost every night. The rooms themselves were very clean, and the bed curtains were great to have. Not the best neighborhood to walk around in, but the hostel is located right next to Gare du Nord which has multiple metro stations and local trains.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: This place was wonderful! Very friendly staff, great atmosphere with an on site restaurant/bar. Good WiFi. Good location, 5 mins from Gare du Nord train station. Very clean, great security- you need a room key to get into most places on site. 100% would recommend this place.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Great staff, the location was very close to the subway and the breakfast was good.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: It's the best hostal I've stayed in!!

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext:
The hostel itself is a very well kept and clean building. The rooms are immaculate and have good facilities - a wash basin, a desk and USB charging ports in addition to standard plugs. The shower area was immaculate also. 
the hostel bar was the highlight of this hostel. It has a great vibe with lots of music and lighting. The only flaw with this hostel in my experience was it's location, whilst it's proximity to transport is great, travelling as two 18 year old girls, we felt "hassled" at times

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Great hostel, good location to get to places using subway, pub down stairs great for meeting people and they hold great events

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext:
It's located in a grungy part of Paris, which I liked after being located in the center for a few days. 
BUT it doesn't feel that safe!

They gave me a one-bed room which sounds like a good thing at first but THE ROOM HAD NO AC! I swear you could literally fry an egg!!!! 

I peeped in a dorm and it had AC

So in a nutshell, I left here with no new friends and extremely sweaty!

(One of the staff members did go out of his way to help me find cheap transpo at 5am) so.... points for that.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: The wifi in our room did not work for our entire stay. We asked the staff about this and they said they would take a look at the router but nothing changed. The AC was also creating a pool of water around it. We were definitely not blown away by anything at this hostel unfortunately.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Great place for the price. Pretty Central to transportation in the city. Staff was AMAZING! Everyone some at least 3 languages.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: I could barely sleep at this hostel because the bar was so loud. They had insanely loud music going until 3 in the morning. The only thing I enjoyed about this hostel was the reception staff. The noise pollution was terrible, the ladder to get into the bed is very awkward, the location is super hectic, the lines ay reception were huge, and the rooms were hotter than any other hostel I've been to. I'm never staying here again. It honestly ruined my last two days in Paris.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext:
Clean, safe and secure. Less than a 2min walk to transport links into all  Paris districts. Ideal base for exploring the sights and sounds of Paris. Lively bar, with great food and atmosphere for socialising.
Merle on the reception deserves a mention for doing a fantastic job in welcoming me to the Hostel ðŸ‘.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Stayed here for a night travelling home with a stop off in Paris. Very close to Gare du Nord. Good menu, clean rooms and lively bar. Stayed in a few of these while travelling around, they're always reliable.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: stay was pretty good with great atmosphere, nice staffs and proximity to gare du nord railway and metro stations. The ventilation system wasn't good enough in the 8-bed dorm room where I stayed. The windows could only open to a very small extent, making the room quite stuffy. When I inquired about the absence of air cooler, the receptionist said that that room was not supposed to have air cooler. They did keep some stand-up fans but those were not enough to maintain good air circulation.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Four of my friends and I stayed in a 6 bdrm dorm in July.  The room was entirely too small to properly fit 3 bunk beds. When the cages were out from under the bed of one set of the bunk beds, we could not open or close the door. Six bodies in a room made the room INCREDIBLE hot at night, and, although fans were provided, there was not enough air circulation to help cool down the room. The hostel was clean, but a bit out of the way from the touristy areas we went to see.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Great place to stay, well located and cool staff.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Awesome hostel with amazing facilities and large sized rooms. Bar downstairs is heaps of fun and good atmosphere. Staff were helpful. Only downside is the suburb it is located in - quite a dodgy area and a fair walk / train ride into the city centre. Not many things around the hostel so we spent a fair bit of money on train tickets. Other than that it was great!

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Cool place with a great atmosphere- especially the bar. The area which it's situated in is OK, it's not the safest place in Paris and even as a group of guys we wouldn't risk walking home. Other than that, everything about this hostel was fine.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext:
St. Christopher's Inn was a good beginning hostel!
Pros: near 2 central subway stations so getting around the city was easy, had a diverse amount of shops and markets nearby (some open on sundays), friendly and helpful staff, lots of good tourist info (maps, guides, discounted tours, etc.), and a nice bar beneath the hostel!
Cons: when we first arrived our bedding was dirty though it was changed after we alerted the staff, breakfast was so so, rooms could get hot if the AC was not left on 24/7

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: **LOCATION is MISLEADING on Hostelworld** You are at the outskirts of Paris in a pretty s**tty neighborhood. I walked to the metro 100m away and at least 3 guys offered to sell me loose cigarettes. There is a guard in front of the hostel 24/7, but mostly because there needs to be. This is not the place/neighborhood you want to have to come back to at 2-3am after a night of drinking.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: A great central location in Paris. Clean facilities and rooms which was a great start to my adventure.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: DO NOT STAY HERE DURING THE SUMMER. The windows hardly open and there is no air conditioning in my room which made the stay unbearable. Also it's ridiculous that the showers have buttons which need to be pressed every 15 seconds to keep the shower running. It makes showering ridiculous.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: More variety at breakfast

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: overall great hostel, not best location in paris but super convenient to the airport.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: When you take money from my credit card at 2am in the morning and when asked why refuse to provide a reason I consider this a fraudulent transaction. I would not recommend this place due to fraud committed by them on my account. I will also be ensuring that I tell as many people as possible about this as well. Anyone staying there, pay by cash. DO NOT give them your card details.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Fairly standard chain hostel in good location. The air con in the room didn't function very well as kept having to be emptied of water. Other guests in room seemed to be mostly long-term so not the best atmosphere.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext:
The room was way to hot and there was no air con. We spent the two nights sweating it out in our room. 
Also the breakfast options were really basic and there wasn't too much to choose from. 
The hotel was great looking though and the staff really friendly. 
I didn't expect Paris to be such a difficult place to get around and this was a little out of the city. But the train station next door was good.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Nice hostel. Had a promblem with room mates bringing people back and spewed in the room. But not the hostels fault. We enjoyed our tim there :)

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Great hostel, great facilities. Just a bit pricey

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Rooms were clean,  but for a large hostel chain such as St Christopher's Inn, there should be AC installed in the dorm rooms. Unfortunately, there isn't any, and when Paris gets temps up to 36 celsius, the room is an actual furnace. There are a few fans in the room but it does little to combat the heat and if you're unlucky enough to have a top bunk, there's no relief from the fans whatsoever and you can't open the windows at night because the noise from the bar. Atmosphere good otherwise!

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: The only good thing about this hostel is it's location. I've stayed in several dozen hostels and this one is by far the most impersonal and characterless. To be fair, the hostel does disclose it is a party hostel but even then the party rages on until 3 am or so in a bar that smells of vomit and sweet hookah smoke while very many annoying kids drink and yell themselves silly. Rooms hot, no air con bathrooms not clean. The rooftop picture on Hostelworld is fraud, guests can't access it.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Merle was excellent and security was top notch! You need your key card to get in everything, and there's always security on site. The bathrooms were clean, privacy curtains and big lockers for luggage are nice. But the bar below turns into a bit of a club late at night, and it is SO loud up until 3 AM or later. Ear plugs don't do anything when you can literally feel the bass bumping. I liked the locationâ€” incredibly close to the metro, but be prepared to travel 30+ minutes for major sightseeing.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Gets very hot with no AC in the room. Otherwise great

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext:
The hostel was super easy to find from the Station and was conveniently located. Hostel was overall pretty good, the rooms were quite hot a night time though which made sleeping difficult. The ensuite rooms were quite small, especially the bathroom.
There was a party atmosphere which meant there were rowdy guests around as well.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Great location right near the train station and the metro making it super easy to access all the major attractions of Paris. Rooms were big, clean and had good security with a storage cage per person. The bar has a great atmosphere making it easy to meet other people.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Perfect location really close to Gare Nord. Bad thing is that there's a nightclub going on every night so it will get really noisy, but on the other hand I did not request a quiet room, and besides, most of the time it was good music. :) And the breakfast was not really good, but on the other hand, the ones I shared my room with enjoyed it so... Recommended!

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: The rooms were clean and beds were comfy, staff was super nice. The only problem at the hostel was there was no real "hostel atmosphere". The meeting room was a bar where they served super expensive drinks. So then you were not allowed to bring your own drinks and music was too loud to communicate. All in all ot was a good stay.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Great place! Great staff!

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: In a really dangerous (sketchy/seedy area) rooms are gross and smells weird bathrooms smell weird showers are bad, the workers are nice and so is security but its in a really bad area

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: This place is kinda soulless. It's a big money burner tailored to be appeasing to uncultured Americans who aren't well traveled and Australian party animals who you can find throwing up in the street as early as 12 at night. The staff were decent but everything is quite impersonal as there are something like 2-300 guests in this place facilities are fine but sometimes they're kinda shitty... I recommend this place if you wanna get fucked up and have meaningless conversations while drunk.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Very nice accommodations, but the rooms are very hot. The hostel provides some fans, but they aren't quite enough. And opening the window is very noisy from the bar in the courtyard. Everyone was very friendly though, and the hostel is quite lively. My only complaint is how expense extras are. Beer is not very cheap at the bar, and if you want to buy flip flops or a lock, the prices are quite high. Also, because it's sort of a party hostel, people will puke in the bathrooms every morning.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: I have stayed at multiple St Christophers and whilst overall it was good I was surprised that there was no aid con in the rooms. Especially when it seemed to be random on which rooms got air con and which didnt as my friends room had air con. The showers were also horrifically small compared to every other hostel I've been in. I couldn't stand in the shower without both shoulders touching the side walls which is very uncomfortable to shower in. Staff and bar was amazing however.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: A very nice and clean hostel, it's good that have individual lighting and curtain for every bed, Good location also.  it will be prefect if windows can be opened as it's hot when in summer with no aircon and no circulation.  But I will come again if next time I visit Paris.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: I wouldn't recommend staying here if you are a young female traveler. The area is kinda dodgy, and the hostel is usually full of guys. I love St Chris's but the one on the Canal is way better than Gare du Nord. The security at Gare du Nord isn't great, and the rooms are really confusing to find, it's like a labyrinth.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: very nice... if there is a swmming pool i will give 10

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext:
Close to the train station and 20 minutes walk from the city center.
Overall a good hostel.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Good all around stay here

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: All in all it was a great stay. i met new amazing people

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: It's great place to stay if you are visiting with friends as it is located next to Gare to Nord station which is accessible as well as it connects to all major places.  Recommend for young people!

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: I loved my stay here!! I was a solo traveler and I was looking to make some awesome hostel friends and see Paris together. What St Christopher's does - which is wonderful - is they host a mixer each night so we can meet each other. On Thursday, it was free delicious cheese and wine. I made 3 new friends and after getting tipsy, we saw Eiffel Tower and had an amazing night. Memories for a lifetime. Thanks to this hostel. Special props to the Portuguese staff girl Elle for being a great hostess!

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Great hostel - best I've ever stayed in. Location is handy with Gare Du Nord very close however the area itself isn't the best. But no faults with the hostel - so happy!

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: I've stayed at the St. Christopher's in France and Barca and absolutely loved my time at both. The staff are so friendly and polite. I absolutely love the staff behind the bar at Belushis they were absolute angels and helped me out when I had a horrible hangover. Probably isn't located in the best area in Paris but I have plenty of stories now so I guess it wasn't all bad hahah I honestly don't think I would've enjoyed Paris the same way without this hostel and it's night life!

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: This place had great security and was right next to a main train station. Our main problem was that it was  overpriced for basic faciliities and it's distance from the city centre.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Centric hostel with standard features. The staff is friendly but not necessary caring, it doesn't have AC so during summer it gets very hot inside the rooms, the cleanliness of the bathrooms is questionable because every time I would go there I would see the same trash laying around.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: This hostel is in a great location, a very short walk from the Gare du Nord where using the very efficient Metro Service you can get anywhere in Paris. The features I liked about the Hostel  were the large bar area which had lots of screens for watching World cup games. I liked the curtains on the bunk beds for privacy and the reading light, charger and USB points above the bed.  The staff were very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was cheap at 4 Euros but not of great quality.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Only stayed for one night but was clean and very easy to find. Great location right by Gare du Nord, which was perfect because I was only in Paris for a night before taking a train out. Would stay here again.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Great hostel, staff very friendly. Perfect location, near train station so easy to get anywhere. The only downside was the rooms were extremely hot and no airflow. Other than that very good stay and would recommend.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Very nice hostel! People seem to complain about the location here but it's honestly fine. The bar here is really cool also. Only thing is that there was always a line at reception and it made it a little frustrating when you just had a question to ask/needed help with something but had to wait in front of a bunch of people who were checking in. I guess since it's a larger hostel they are going to have more people at the front desk at once, and they can't really help that.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext:
Had an amazing stay at this place. Was welcomed by the very cheerful receptionist Eli, who also did a wonderful job of setting up events for people at the hostel, including a mojito class. The location was great, perfect if you're wanting to be in an artsy area. It was very clean and tidy and a great place to stay. Staff are willing to help with anything, including directions and maps and anything you need. Just remember to ask nicely 
Wonderful stay

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Decent hostel, however wouldn't stay again. Lobby smelled of cigarettes due to the security smoking right outside the door. Men's bathroom only had 2 toilets and 2 showers for an entire floor and showers were on a 20 second timer so you constantly have to turn them back on. Rooms are nice, there's a curtain on the beds for more privacy, a sink in every room and the Wi-Fi is really good. There's a door stop in the middle of the floor which seems hazardous. Bar is great, lots of food and drinks.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: The security is good it is right next to Gare Du Nord meaning it's easy to get everywhere - however it's not the nicest area so solo female travellers may not feel comfortable walking there alone at night.  The toilet facilities were really clean but our room smelled bad (really bad) the whole time we were there and our beds weren't ready by check in so we were told we had to wait to freshen up which wasn't ideal. Beds are comfortable. Overall it's a good hostel but I don't know if I'd go back.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Great location, close to gare du nord and gare d'lest. Great vibes with the belushis underneath.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext:
The area was definitely a bit sketchy and I did not feel safe walking alone past 9pm in the area. The hostel itself has 24h reception and the staff is nice. Rooms are great, I stayed in a mixed dorm and every bed had a curtain, outlet, and light! Showers were very clean. 
However,  the atmosphere when I stayed wasn't great, lots of young girls and older men hanging out in the bar. Would only stay again if it was significantly cheaper than other hostels.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: It's a little loud, very late, (most of the patrons are really young so kinda makes sense, lots of partying..)  There were ongoing problems with the elevators but the staff was really helpful (recommendations were not great but they can't know everything...)  - some problems with the lockers.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: This hostel was so comfortable and safe. Even the breakfast went above and beyond! Five stars dude ðŸ’–

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Accommodations were fine. Not in the best neighborhood though, and the music being played in the bar downstairs was super loud. My room shared a courtyard with the bar, and even though I was on the fourth floor the music was audible all night.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: So noisy at night with the bar blaring music until 2am or later. Thanks for the ear plugs but they barely helped. Vomit on the bathroom floor. If you want to party into the night, this is the place. I guess breakfast was worth 4 euro but your money would be better spent on a good coffee & a pastry. We didn't hate our stay but would never stay there again.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Very nice

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: If you want to be close to Gare du Nord for traveling reasons, this is a great option because it's right across the street; otherwise, I wouldn't recommend it. It's basically a bland hotel with hostel-style accommodation in a not-so-nice neighborhood.
