The common area is an American bar, with lots of sports and loud music (even at breakfast) and a menu of British/American food. The sleeping areas were a little smelly in my experience from what seems to be a issue with the plumbing.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext:
Very close to gare du nord - which is great for connectivity for airports etc but also means you'll have to walk through crowded street which smells of pee.

Once you reach the hostel - it's all good. The rooms are spacious, the staff is helpful. All good.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Do not book this hostel if you are a lone female traveler, you will feel so unsafe leaving the hostel to get to the station. I would recommend staying at the other st Christopher's in Paris. I couldn't leave at night by myself and had to be home before dark as it was unsafe if I did not find a male to walk with me.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: Hostel was very nice. Staff were friendly and location was very good. The bathroom in the room was very small, which was difficult to use.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext: If you're looking for a party atmosphere, this is it. Bar/club is open late. Great location to the Nord(train station). I did not find my stay enjoyable as the facility smelled of heavy cigarette smoke. They keep the property very clean, so I'm assuming it's a ventilation issue. My room was very humid and smelled terribly of old stale cigarette smoke. I left early as a result. If you smoke, it may not bother you but even as an ex smoker I found it repulsive.

name: St Christopher's Inn Gare du Nord
reviewtext:
Staff was friendly and helpful, easy check in and out 
No AC in 4 bed room 
Bathroom is very tight 
But for over all it was good experience at this hostel and may recommend for low budget solo travelers

name: Le Montclair Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: They have a weird system where you leave your key at the front desk when you go outside and when you come back just say what room you're in without any ID/verification...this does not seem very safe/secure! There aren't enough plugs in the rooms although the wifi is good. The bathrooms are really small but the water pressure and hot water were good.

name: Le Montclair Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Only plus is I liked the area of the hostel. Other than that the beds were so noisy, there was no lift, staff were not that friendly, our room was really dirty and it's right by a school so you have screaming kids early in the morning.

name: Le Montclair Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Location great. People nice. Clean.

name: Le Montclair Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: The front desk staff were super nice and helpful. The hostel doesn't really look like the pictures(i think the dining room pictures were taken at a different hostel because it's nothing at all like that) the rooms were ok, I'm not sure if I would stay here again

name: Le Montclair Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: The dorms were big and spacious

name: Le Montclair Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Friendly and easy going atmosphere. Close to the subway for easy transfers. Walking distance to good restaurants as well as to the top of the hill where you oversee everything. Highly recommend to others.

name: Le Montclair Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: I had very good time there. I just felt cold one night. But the staff is super and the cleaning was done every day. Most of facilities works. Just one thing: I would have liked to stay more than one week! I recommend it.

name: Le Montclair Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: This hostel has an excellent location just a few minutes away from SacrÃ© CÅ“ur. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I would definitely come back to this place on my next trip to Paris. The lady who serves breakfast is awesome!

name: Le Montclair Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Just OK. Lacking in so many small things. Handsoap in the loos? Come on, that just shows a complete lack of trying to make things pleasant for guests. And no individual reading lights. That would make such a difference.

name: Le Montclair Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
I really enjoyed my stay at this hostel!
Big room with bathroom. Room got cleaned almost every day. Small common area but I met very nice people there! When I arrived there where a few families and not a lot of people around their twenties but I got to meet young people too!
They could have a few more cooking supplies like pots, knives, plates. Sometimes you have to wait or wash someone else's plates. 
Perfect location, everything's near by.
Will definitely come back!

name: Le Montclair Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Very chilled vibe, lots of different people all interacting. However our room was on the ground floor in the courtyard (room 1) and it felt as if anyone could walk at least to the window. The key not be a key card meant that other people were inclinded to adjust the lock so that the room was left open - this made our stuff very vulnerable as there were no lockers in the room.

name: Le Montclair Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Best Hostel experience ever, will stay again! Amazing location.

name: Le Montclair Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Good value stay close to Montmartre. Had some confusion in the days before checkin over needing a credit card or paying a deposit, but seemed to resolve itself.

name: Le Montclair Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Great place to stay, great location if your not in central Paris, super close to the metro stations. Friendly and extremely helpful staff

name: Le Montclair Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
Room clean but old
Staff very helpfull

name: Le Montclair Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: We only astates for one night. However the atmosphere and staff we really liked. We were also grateful that they held our luggage for us after we checked out. We didn't use the kitchen but it was there and looked good.  The toilet in our room was not great (even for a hostel) however there was a larger bathroom just downstairs so it wasn't a big deal!

name: Le Montclair Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: WiFi is amazing, staff are really friendly. Only downside is the lockers aren't big enough to fit your bag in so you have to leave your bag in the room the whole time and the rooms were a bit dingy. All in all okay for the money cheap and cheerful.

name: Le Montclair Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: The staff is great and really helpful, thank you for everything guys. The beds are comfy. The hostel is near to the metro station, you are in the centre in few minutes. I definitely recommend it.

name: Le Montclair Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: The hostel is located a couple of minutes from a metro station and 10 minutes from sacre coeur. The beds were comfortable but there was not enough plugs in the room, we had to take it in turns to charge our phones. There was just 2 plugs in a 6 bed dorm. Overall I was happy with the hostel and would stay again next time i visit Paris.

name: Le Montclair Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Staff were amazing and the place was clean. Room was tiny and the shower was rubbish.

name: Le Montclair Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: I booked this hostel purely for its wonderful reviews on aircon in the peak of summer, however, I was unlucky to get 3 roommates that refused to sleep with it on. The train system was easy to manage! Not heaps of atmosphere, which didn't bother me as I was exhausted all 3 nights I stayed! The staff varies a lot, but one of the guys was great and wrote me down bulk suggestions. Beds weren't too bad. Showers were noisy, and very high pressure! But worked fine. Not bad overall!

name: Le Montclair Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Great place to stay, The staff were helpful.

name: Le Montclair Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Due to last minute travel issues we were not able to make it to the hostel so I contacted them and they were very kind about it and did not charge my card ! They seem to be very nice people.

name: Le Montclair Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Staying here was probably the worst experience I have ever had at a hostel. I didn't like the area it was in, the front desk has no idea what customer service is, and there was not outlet or clean sheets for my bed. Do not stay here! For what I paid for, I would have rather stayed at an Airbnb.

name: Le Montclair Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: It's a small hostel, rooms can be cramped, but the kitchen facilities are nice. Be sure to label your food though as others will eat it! The hostel is also far from the city centre but you can take the subway. Close to supermarkets. Laundry facilities are good.

name: Le Montclair Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
My experience in Le Montclair was amazing.
The staff are super friendly and always try to give you attention and information.
The atmosphere is great. There're females rooms and that's great!
I recommend Le Montclair and on my next visit to Paris I'd definitely stay in this hostel again.
Le Montclair staff, mercÃ­ beaucoup pour tout! :)

name: Le Montclair Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: The location is great! Close to a subway and to many attractions. The beds move a lot, some rooms have AC and some not, there's no privacy at the beds, facilities look quite old. I think bed allocation could be done considering people's age. I

name: Le Montclair Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: The shared rooms didn't have lockers but there were lockers available in the lobby for valuables so it didn't really matter. Hostel was in a great location, the staff were very friendly and the facilities had everything I needed.

name: Le Montclair Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: In-room AC was a huge blessing to return to after being in Paris during the heat wave! Beds are fine, no breakfast and no lockers, but they did have a luggage room that we didn't use. Kitchen and common areas were nice. Better than we expected, seems like a slightly above average hostel to me. Location was great because it was by the metro, but it isn't very central. Montmartre is a neat place though.

name: Le Montclair Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: No lockers. Next to no kitchen equipment to use to cook. No oven. Most doors didnt lock. Next to no atmosphere.

name: Le Montclair Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Spacious room which was very clean. Staff were very friendly and helpful, I would definitely stay again!

name: Le Montclair Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: This hostel has a great lovation. It is near metro and beautiful Montmartre. Our room and bathroom were cleand everyday. Hostel has a nice kitchen, outdoor area and luggage storage that you can use after you check out. The staff was very friendly and helpful! Overall, I would recommend this hostel.

name: Le Montclair Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Very friendly staff and super helpful. We will stay again. Great location too.

name: Le Montclair Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Very nice place although the showers in the ground floor are very small.

name: Le Montclair Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: A bit of a walk to the city center, but a great location and hostel! Would recommend to anyone

name: Le Montclair Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Great hostel! Staff are super friendly, place is located close to all the biggest tourist attractions and it's very clean!

name: Le Montclair Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: This hostel is close to sacre coeur but otherwise not close to much else. But for being a low cost as it was and paris' metro being easy to use location wasn't that big of a deal. They did not have much of an atmosphere at all and overall the staff wasn't the kindest but they weren't mean. Not a very clean facility but the bathrooms were ensuite which was nice. I would probably stay somewhere else if I was in Paris again.

name: Le Montclair Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: The rooms are really small and there were ants and other bugs on the floor. But I was at the 4 bed female room so it was kind of ok in terms of privacy, and the air conditioning worked well which was really important that week!!

name: Le Montclair Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: This hostel was lovely & quirky. It was in a fab location - lots of local bars nearby. The staff were really friendly. The kitchen was small but the right size for the hostel so it never felt overcrowded. The rooms are very small, but there's air conditioning so they weren't uncomfortable. Overall I would stay here again :)

name: Le Montclair Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Staff were really friendly and very helpful!

name: Le Montclair Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: this hostel was okay, location is okay but felt a bit unsafe as a solo female traveller. however everyone in hostel was really nice and met some cool people. plus always felt safe when in the hostel. probably wouldnt stay again but was fine for a couple nights.

name: Le Montclair Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Good hostel in a convenient location - close to the Jules Joffrin Metro station and around the corner is a supermarket. If following the directions from this website, be aware that the Mercadet-Poissonniers Metro station is currently closed. I stayed in a dormitory with an en suite bathroom and I'm glad I did because the smell of the bathrooms downstairs was hard to stomach. The en suite bathroom was very clean, however. Hostel not recommended for those with mobility issues due to stairs.

name: Le Montclair Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: We stayed here for 2 nights in the very hot July weather. On entering the dorm (via security card) I could hardly breathe, it was so hot and stuffy. It was impossible to get the window to stay open. I located an aircon switch on the wall, and asked the man at reception about it. He came up and put it on, and we were able to sleep despite the heat. The next night I came up late to the dorm and it was just the same. Being very tired, I didn't go back down to ask but regret this. It was terrible.

name: Le Montclair Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Family of four, had a family room with own key, perfect! Clean and with private bathroom. Very glad we did not have to use the shared facilities, they were not appealing...

name: Le Montclair Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: The showers were really powerful, but the space was a little small. All the staff were lovely and the location close to a metro was really useful. The room was really damp though.

name: Le Montclair Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Location was so average Nonfunctional ac. Wasnt the nicest place. They had no hostel. Was not noteworthy

name: Le Montclair Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Staff was very helpful and the hostel itself was comfortable and fun

name: Le Montclair Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: It had a great atmosphere and vibe to the place; very welcoming for people traveling. The location was very ideal as t was close to he metro and not too touristy (meaning it wasn't overly expensive). Overall, great place!

name: Le Montclair Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: The pictures are just highlighting the nicest part of the hostel, not the reality of the rooms. Room #1 for instance is not as nice as these photos in Hostelworld and you need to leave the key every time you leave the hostel for visit the city, breakfast they said that is buffet but in reality it is not since you can just eat one type of bread per menu (they are just 3) which is ridiculous for a BUFFET. Not worth it at all.

name: Le Montclair Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: The room had a balcony which we loved and the staff were very friendly!

name: Le Montclair Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Clean room, good lockers - but could be bigger in order to fit whole bag inside. Kitchen decent. Good atmosphere in the evening.

name: Le Montclair Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Lovely staff, great atmosphere in the place, good facilities. Merci!

name: Le Montclair Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Great place to meet people at the kitchen. Good location and you just got to take the metro day pass! Bathrooms and shower are tiny though!

name: Le Montclair Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
I had an awesome time at this hostel!
Reception is 24 hours and the people are super friendly and helpful when it comes to tourist info, printing bus tickets, etc. The room was great. Mine was up four flights of stairs which could be a problem for some travellers but it was fine for me. Good location, close to supermarkets and the metro. Would recommend!

name: Le Montclair Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
The kitchen is well-equipped. The hostel is generally clean and organized well in the rooms and public place. Wifi is good even in the room. 
The location is 3 mins to a Metro station and 5 mins to another bigger one.
The area it locates is said to be not so safe, but I personally think it is okay.  
The room is smaller than the picture shows, just like most of the things in Paris.

name: Le Montclair Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Nice hostel in a great neighborhood. Super close to metro lines.

name: Le Montclair Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Great location, lovely area near Montmartre but not in the really busy tourist area. Hostel staff were really friendly and helpful. Only complaint was that there weren't many outlets in the room near the bunks.

name: Le Montclair Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Nice hostel, staff were friendly. We had a 4 bedroom dorm which was great as we were a 4 person group so we had our own space and a private bathroom. Room was clean.

name: Le Montclair Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Such a lovely atmosphere! Within walking distance of the sacre-coeur and the metro which could take you everywhere else:) Would return again.

name: Le Montclair Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: The hostel has no lift. Had to take the stairs all the way to the third floor. Breakfast was â‚¬6 per person. The location is very far from the city center but the commute in Paris is great.

name: Le Montclair Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
I have left a complaint to the hostel as I was not happy with my stay. 
Get back to me on this matter immediately please
I would like a response on this. 
Amber Wilson

name: Le Montclair Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Great hostel, very clean! Good atmosphere to meet new people. However, far from most of the tourist attractions. Close to the SacrÃ© CÅ“ur but that's it. You have to take the metro to get anywhere, and if the lines are down you can possibly end up in a rough neighborhood.

name: Le Montclair Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Great place to stay for few days, not complains at all. Recommend

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: Super. Nice breakfast

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: Front desk staff are extremely kind and helpful, however the facilities were pretty gross. The bathrooms were disgusting - floors and showers had a thick layer of dirt and stains so it was pretty clear they'd rarely mop or wipe showers down. They don't provide pillow cases for the dorm rooms. Sink was broken in the dorm and no shower curtain was provided in our 2nd private room. Also, we paid for late checkout and the cleaning staff still came in early (without knocking) and insisted we leave.

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: This hostel is decent as far as hostels go. The place seems fairly unorganized with the aim of just cycling as many people in and out as possible and is expensive for what you get, although it is Paris. The location is mediocre as far as the city goes, but you can walk/metro from there. The bathrooms were a bit gross, although the rooms seemed really clean. The best part of this hostel is the rooftop bar that has pretty awesome views of the city (and Sacre Coure). Also, lots of cool young people

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: Very expensive for crappy rooms, crappy beds. Generator should be transparent about the pictures shown and the rooms we actually get.

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: Dont find most of tge staff welcoming or friendly. Showers in room 203 has mold arounfmd tge corner/ edges it could be better.

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext:
Right next to the metro making it super easy to get around, very comfortable hostel beds and every room has an ensuite! Friendly staff and all beds have a powerpoint, lamp and a locker beneath!
We would stay here again if a bit cheaper

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: Gostei muito do hostel Generator pela sua estrutura, prÃ³ximo Ã  estaÃ§Ã£o do metrÃ´ o facilitou muito. Equipe atenciosa. CafÃ© da manhÃ£ tipo buffet muito bom. Pontos que precisam melhor Ã© em relaÃ§Ã£o a limpeza dos utensÃ­lios para tomar o cafÃ© da manhÃ£,  varios dias estavam muitos sujos. Outro ponto a melhorar, Como fiquei em quarto com banheiro dentro por duas vezes acabou o papel higiÃªnico no banheiro e tive que ir providenciar na recepÃ§Ã£o. Entao fica a sugestÃ£o para melhoria nesse quesito.

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: Really good stay in generator! Little bit far out from main attractions but the metro is great! Friendly staff and room was great! T

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: Excellent. Great location, great facilities and great price.

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: Played super loud music at the bar until past 1am and I had a plane to catch at 6. Shower wasn't super clean. 1 min walk to the metro.

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: Great building, lots of easy access to great food/ sights. Everyone I stayed with was very respectful of the shared areas and the staff were really helpful too!

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: We loved the location of the hostel but the facilities were all being worked on, the rooms smelt pretty bad and weren't very clean. The ensuite bathrooms were dirty, as were the bathrooms in the hall. We never wanted to be back in our hostel because the environment was just off. We're staying in the same hostel in Rome and I'm considering changing our reservation.

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: Generator is a great hostel, we really enjoyed our stay!! It's super easy to get around as there is a metro station less than a minute away and it is a really clean and safe hostel. The only complaint we had was that you couldn't bring any food in from outside, so you either have to eat out every night or order from the generator cafe, which is slow service and is very expensive. Otherwise, it's a very good hostel ðŸ˜Š

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: All girl dorm was great, just about enough space. Extra bathrooms in corridor. Could be cleaner but as hostels go it's very good. Very friendly staff.

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: We booked this location for all the added amenities: amazing looking food top bar, restaurant and club  only after we arrived did we discover that everything was closed or under construction. Also, no kitchen facilities and foods not allowed in the rooms. I think we should have been notified before booking if basically everything but the room was unavailable. The cost of the room was not worth the price if nothing else was available.

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: Staff at reception seemed interested in only doing the minimum work required.  Specifically one bald man with a tattoo on his head. It seems like he makes up stuff as he goes based on my observation of his interactions with other customers. I asked him to add an additional night to my stay and he just forwarded me to go online and rebook from scratch all over again n, meanwhile my roommate requested the same at reception and the girl did it for him happily. Ultimately, I decidedto book an Airbnb

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: I had a problem with my bed on the first night and had to change rooms but despite that had a good stay. The hostel are very well located, super close to many metro stations. The room is big enough and also the lockers. Would definitely stay again!

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: The hostel itself was clean and modern. In terms of social life not the best as there was no really lounge area just the restaurant and tables and then the rooftop bar was only open until 10pm so had to move downstairs which was always quiet. The location was good in terms of transport but wasn't really in walking distance to anywhere and no where around was open at night but had a good stay and did find some other solo travellers. The hostel was very secure with security on the door.

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: Nice rooms, clean, and organized. Kitchen staff seemed a bit unprepared, maybe someone was recently hired when I was there, still got my order correct and served quite quickly. Bar was not as cheap as other places I've seen, but great prices and selection overall. Smoking area was a new one for me, right in the center walkway between the lobby and cafe. Nice spot to hang out and talk to people.

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: It has been a wonderful stay. Met a lot of friendly people. Staff was super nice and ready to help. Room was clean, bathroom could have been cleaner, but overall it was okay. The Rooftop is awesome! It's one of the nicest bars I've been to and it was in our hostel... what do you want more?? It's a bit of a shame the rooftop closes as 10pm, but however, it's awesome. I'll be back!

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: Great stay, friendly staff would stay here again.

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: Great place,  everything was superb less location- the area is not very pleasant in the evening, but it's Paris, baby. Also, lockers a bit overpriced.

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: Easy to go and see everything you wanted to see the beds were comfy and the rooms were clean

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: Although more a hotel than a hostel, I have no complaints. Ticked all the boxes.

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: As others have said as well, this hostel is quite large and it has somewhat of a hotel feel to it due to the size. However, it's Paris and Generator is a large and well known hostel chain. The roof top bar was fantastic and the location was great. The only thing that I could fault is the fact that there are no lockers in your room and if you don't bring your own lock, you can only purchase one. They have paid lockers available there to rent on a lower floor, and that worked O.K.

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: This is not a Hostel. This is a Hotel with shared room. The rooftop closes at 10pm. You will not find hostel experience while staying at this place.

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: Maybe this is just me, but I was extremely irritated to find that we were not allowed to have any outside food in the hostel. Every other hostel I stayed in, in France, had an available kitchen or allowed food. I also think this hostel was trying very hard to have a "party vibe" which seemed very unessecary.

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: Great hostel, location is great, staff were friendly and made lots of friends.

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext:
I've stayed here many times. The staff are always super helpful. I've seen complaints on lines checking in, but it's really the staff taking care of each traveler individually. Thank you for that!  
I can't say enough good things about the friendlyness of them. 
I highly recommend this hostel in Paris for short and longer stays. Train stop is right next to the hostel. The neighborhood is good, but not downtown. So be prepared to be in a residential area, which I love.

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: A hotel design hostel, spacious and well thought in the room. Check in to get the key is not great.

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext:

Good beds, outlets, light per bed. If you arrive early it costs money to store your luggage which was a pain with a later than typical check-in.

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: Generator hotel is much more of a hotel vibe than a hostel. There is no kitchen or common area. There is a 'chill area' but it is a part of the cafe/restaurant. I found it harder to socialise in a relaxed environment. Room was good, bed comfortable. The shower wasn't the cleanest but still pretty good for a hostel. The 'free' walking tour from the hostel (sanderman) was great for getting a bearing of the city. They meet you at the hostel and help you catch the metro, great for your first morning

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: I stayed in two different hostels while in Paris so I could experience different parts of the city. This area was much rougher (homeless population, beggars, etc.) I still enjoyed it because it's real life and every city has that but just be aware. Genorator tries to be hip cool place but you can tell it's understaffed. The rooms were "clean" but not when you looked close and if I'm sleeping my somewhere I pay attention to detail. I'd really only recommend this place if you had a large group!

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext:
the place was not clean. At the same time, they ask money for lockers 1 hour 3 â‚¬ 4 ours 5â‚¬. for Every single thing, they charge you. 
I would prefer to stay a cheaper place which offer free breakfast and more clean place with free locker room. 

Also at the entrance, they say "free city tour" but when guide comes, he said us, it is different from hostel, if you do not give us money the guide have to spend his own money. normally for per person it is 10 euro"
So wouldn't recommend

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: Right by a metro station so it's easy to get around everywhere! Roof top bar was great. Allows everyone to interact easily

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: We were very disappointed with our stay at Generator. Don't be fooled by the images, it's not nearly as nice as it looks. We only stayed for one night so can't say much for the atmosphere but our room was dirty. There was mould in the shower and the sink wouldn't drain so anytime you turned the tap on, hair and gunk would come up into the basin. It was cheap so I guess you get what you pay for but they get you for an extra dollar wherever they can - towels, luggage storage etc.

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: Definitely best hostel I've stayed at so far. Pretty much a hotel, except you share a room with other people. Staff are extremely helpful and friendly, rooms are so spacious with ensuite bathrooms, but there is also a public bathroom in the corridor that you can use which is also extremely spacious. Rooftop bar is great and the bar/club in the basement is fantastic. Metro station is less than 5-minutes walk away, and hostel is located in a district with good restaurants. Highly recommend.

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: Very chill and socially inviting atmosphere, lots of like minded travelers who are looking to have fun together. Facilities were clean and secure. Highly recommend for a stay in Paris for the backpacker and outgoing type.

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: Location wasnt bad. Pretty far from the city center but right in front of the metro station. Personally prefer cleaner hostels even if its further from the city center. Drains were clogged but overall facilities were very clean and new. But no common room so prolly not the best if ur looking for friends as well

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: Highly recommended! It's clean, safe and secure and the rooftop bar is LIT! Plus, the metro is quite close! Only downside is their luggage locker isn't free unlike other hostels. And some of the reception staff aren't too friendly, which is quite important for frontline staff like them. Matters a lot so they should improve more on customer service. Otherwise, my stay was lovely! ðŸ‘ðŸ‘

name: Generator Paris

All staff aside from Ricardo at the front desk rude. Asked a reception staff member in the hall who had a walkie talkie for additional pillow in the room and she refused to check. No kitchen.

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: First off, great value hostel if you're looking for something reasonably cheap, clean and with great metro access. The wait can be a while, and I'm not sure if it's their software/computers, but people were frequently put in wrong beds/booked to wrong rooms, etc.

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: This is by far one of the best hostels I've stayed in thus far. Their coffee is great and the cleanliness is impeccable compared to most other hostels. Only downside, the night before I left the women's restroom was full of vomit and urine but, that's probably because one of the girls might not have handled her alcohol well. The ambiance is great as it is a party hostel but, there's also room to work by sitting at the cafe and stare out at a small garden. There's also an upstairs terrace!

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: Staff was superb

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: I liked this hostel and if I came again to Paris I think that I will stay again in it  but I think that the breakfast price is high little  pls try to decrease it  thanks a lot for your services I hope you succeed more and more

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: Came over for a weekend with the other half and we had a brilliant time. Would highly recommend going to the hostel again brilliant staff & great atmosphere.

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext:

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: Room is nice and clean, the view of the rooftop bar are great, good cafe and lounge area, staff but cold but cos they are busy, need to pay for the lockers and sometime is full.

name: Generator Paris

The result was we had to check out and in again the next day.

name: Generator Paris

All in all though, great stay, would stay again.

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext:

Also, they have weird rules about bringing outside food in the hostel! I've NEVER experienced this! They yelled at a father of 3 for bringing in pizza but their kitchen isn't open all night!

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: Staff was extremely rude to guests. (They only focus on collecting their money) They are not helpful at all. The hostel felt like a hotel. name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: No kitchen. No fridge and no outside food allowed. Obvious money grab. Super huge so it is more like a hotel except you share rooms. It is really beautiful and super clean. name: Generator Paris

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: The hostel is maybe a two minute walk away from one of the train stations, which is very nice when you're exhausted from walking around all day and exploring the city. name: Generator Paris

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: A wonderful hostel located just far enough from the center of Paris to not price out everyone, but just close enough to be a 10 minute Metro ride to the Louvre, Notre Dame, and most of the other landmarks. The hostel staff was incredibly accommodating, especially for non-francophones.

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: My favorite hostel in Paris! Great and clean facilities. Spacious and with AC. Great lounge area and club downstairs. WiFi Strong! Place can be lit if you want it to be. name: Generator Paris

name: Generator Paris

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: Generator was well equipped with nice beds, rooms, showers. Had lockers for bags and plug ins and lights at each bed. Location was out of the way, nice and close to the metro though! Good vibes but felt like more of a hotel than a hostel.

name: Generator Paris

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: It's crazy that no outside food is allowed. Especially when the staff usually messed up my order. Overall, it was a good experience.

name: Generator Paris

Price is a bit steep, but that could be because of the summer rush - I recommend this place.

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: We really enjoyed our stay at Generator - Paris. So much so, that we decided to cancel our next booking in Amsterdam and change to the Generator - Amsterdam Hostel! Great place, great people, good food and atmosphere. We really enjoyed our stay and would return for another visit. Highly recommended!

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: Awesome hostel with great rooms and facilities. Staff were a little unwelcoming and for the price you would expect to be allowed to bring your own food in.

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: It was actually a great place to stay overall. The only thing that I didn't mind was how far it was from city center but you could easily hop on metro and go. Easy enough to handle. Great staff, busy at times but all around an enjoyable stay.

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: North-East of the city. 30 minutes from tourist sites/central. Security is tight: guards, cameras, key cards, and lockers. Staff are cool. Room was clean and everything in good condition. Nice shower and bathroom. Breakfast is worth the money and the cafe serves good food. Table tennis/foosball table. Big place with many travellers. I would stay here again.

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext:
Pros: Great price!!! Very nice and helpful guest services!! Near the metro, cafes, grocery and coin laundry. Cafe and bar within the facility. Overall cool looking place. A power outlet and USB in each bed. Lockable storage(bring a lock)
I was only there for one night so didn't utilize everything they had to offer.
Cons: BLACK MOLD IN THE SHOWER! No privacy curtain on beds. Shared bathrooms with men. BLACK MOLD IN THE SHOWER. Sketchy hood but you'll be fine as the streets are usually buzzing.

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: Booked 30 minutes before I checked in and was happily surprised with the fantastic atmosphere and facilities. The roof terrace is beautiful and has a great view over the city. Inside the rooms there were well thought out touches like individual lights, shelves right where you want them and easy access plugs. Would heavily recommend to anyone looking for a fun and safe space to stay in Paris.

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: Goood but expensive

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext:
The neighborhood is quite dangerous at night Some dudes tried to robbed me.
Overpriced to be a hostel, no kitchen, far away from the main parts of the city.
Installations are good, clean comfortable

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: No words to describe the amazing experience I had here, and Paris itself! Met amazing people, went to a rooftop live lounge evening and watched the sunset as amazing artists excelled in their talents! I am honestly in love with Paris and would 100% say this hostel and the vibes and amazing people helped make my stay so much better. I'm planning to come back again this winter! So much love xx

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: Only stayed for one night and got in very late but staff were helpful and the rooms were nice and clean with good bathrooms. Quite expensive though

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: Generator is more like a hotel. They offer a large range of facilities and there is a metro across the road. The bathrooms would benefit from fans/better ventilation. Air conditioner in the rooms is fantastic. Huge complex so be prepared for a "party like" atmosphere.

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: I had the worst check in experience ever. I got there an hour early, asked if I could check in, they said no, rooms won't be ready until 2pm. Waited till 2pm, they said its still not ready and to stand by. Waited an entire hour with no news. Went up to front desk and they told me to stand back in check in line if I want to check the status of my room. The line was ridiculously long and i said no, I had to get angry in order for staff to check my room. No apologies. Female staff here are so rude!

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: My experience was over all very nice. My first night they overbooked my room TWICE! They booked 9 people in the 8 bed dorm we we're in. But a staff member came up and helped everyone who needed help. It's not the most social place, didn't speak to many people other than those in my room. Even at the disco club people seemed to stay in their own little bubble. Not the best hostel in the world but I would definitely come back again when in Paris. The area isn't too bad and the staff we're great!

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: The hostel is out of the way of any tourist attractions but there's multiple metro stops within walking distance. The staff was very friendly and helpful, and both the bar/cafÃ© and the rooftop terrace bar were excellent! The only problem was how often they cleaned the communal bathrooms â€” the one on my floor wasn't cleaned for 3 days and it was kind of gross.

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: Clean, safe and secure. Close to transport links into central Paris. Ideal base for exploring the sights and sounds of Paris.

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: I was very surprised with the very good quality of the instalaciones, the cleanliness, the comfort and most important the personal that runs everything. Congratulations!

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: Worst experience ever! Never stay at this hostel. First off, the guy in the bottom bunk (I was in the top bunk) was jerking off the whole night and refused to stop! So freaking weird. The people here were extremely creepy. And he wasn't the only weirdo. Secondly, I walked to the bathroom for 5 minutes (across my bed) and had my stuff STOLEN!!!!! The most unsafe, weirdest and worst hostel in the world. Take my advice and don't stay here.

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: Lovely staff people. The time of year was so very busy that the desk was continually swamped, yet they managed all that and we're helpful. The security and cleaning staff were just great. I thought the facility was very thoughtfully organized in that having bath and shower rooms apart from the bedroom provided more privacy. One criticism, which I'm sure you've heard,is there really should be more sinks and toilets for the women's bathroom.  That's important.  In spite of that, they were clean.

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: We booked this hostel because of the roof top bar. It was closed for our entire stay because private functions had booked out the entire venue . Very disappointing. Staff were not overly friendly either.

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: The barman did not know that I knew French.  I asked for ice water and he told me they don't have ice.  The lady behind me asked for "glaÃ§ons" and he went behind a door and came back with cup full of ice.  It was a very hot day and it was hot at night too.  Very disrespectful.

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: It was a nice place to stay but the room didn't get cleaned very well and the shower smelled like mildew. The bar was understaffed and the rooftop bar was always too crowded. Overall an average place to stay and not really worth the money.

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: It was a good stay, close to metro

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: Fancy hostel right next to a metro station. There's a bar, rooftop terrace, and air conditioning (which is needed during summer months). The room was very nice and clean but the ensuite bathroom was lined with mold. The staff was the worst part. They seemed overworked and were not friendly at all. I rarely say anything negative about a hostel but the unfriendliness really stood out to me. One staff member even complained about being overworked in front of everyone. It is social but also too big.

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: It is located very conveniently next to a metro station, but not too close to the Centre which is ok because of the transport link. The bedrooms were spotless and it was really great having a USB port in the bed etc. and a light. The bathrooms and showers could have been cleaner. The Who experience was interesting because it was like a huge swanky hotel but you shared a room and bathrooms with people, the place was massive. At night it was very hard to sleep with the noise outside on the street

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext:
Good Place to sleep, good facilities and close to the subway
Not bad bit pricey

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: The place looked more like a hotel than a hostel. Sure they had a rooftop bar and a kitchen/bar/club downstairs. But there wasn't a real common area to just chill with people near your dorm. I guess I just wanted a different atmosphere. Kitchen staff were lovely and so were the security. Reception staff were nice enough but several just had the worst attitudes, like not even acknowledging your existence after you greeted them/opened the door for them. Place was near heaps of shops, solid outfit.

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: Generator Paris was my first experience staying in a hostel and I absolutely loved it. There are showers and toilets both within the bedrooms and in three extra conveniently located on every floor. The sheets were clean, each bed had its own light and outlet, lockers were huge. I was surprised a cleaning crew came in everyday to clean the bedrooms, staff was really friendly with giving me directions and city tips. Overall experience was great! Only staying at Generator hostels from here on out.

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: This place is like a hotel for young people! Probably the coolest hostel I've ever stayed in. There's a bar and a restaurant and a club downstairs! It's pricey but if you have the money to splurge it's well worth the cost. My only complaint is that the front desk people didn't seem to care about attending to me despite the fact that I was clearly in tears from a hard day of traveling. Can't recommend their attitude but I loved everything else about this place

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: significantly overpriced...disgusting food...bad overpriced wine...8 bed dorms with noisy ensuite toilet and shower...dull neighborhood

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: The main negative is it's a large hostel, with only 2 washing machines and 2 dryers. The bathrooms are also stuffy and not always very clean. But as a place just to sleep before exploring Paris, it is literally across the street from a metro stop

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: Excellently located in Holland Park. Multiple train and bus options nearby. The curtains on the bed give you an ability for some privacy. The showers are fairly clean. The staff was absolutely divine!

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: This hostel was great! Easy to get to using the metro. Rooms were spacious and clean. Staff was really nice and helpful. Toilet and shower were super clean where I felt good to be barefoot. Lots of people coming in and out of the hostel but there's security at the door. The bar is expensive tho. Would definitely recommend this place

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: More of a hotel than hostel. No kitchen. Not supposed to consume food from outside, inside hotel. Mediocre food served at restaurant. No common area. Overall, a very GENERIC hotel experience!

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: I only stayed here for one night but it was a good stay. Modern facilities and a nice rooftop. Check in was a bit slow, but easy. How good the location is is completely relative to where you want to be in Paris. This is close to Gare du Nord, but if you are looking to hit the main Paris tourist attractions it is a bit out of the way.

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: great hostel but it is a bit far out from the main sights. close to a metro stop so its east to get around the city if you dont mind figuring out the public transport. comfy beds, great food in the cafe and the rooftop bar is lovely too

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext:
Generator Paris is a very well-run establishment. However, I have some minor complaints about the cleanliness of the bathroom/shower facilities. The shower room had traces of mold around the edges, but seemed fairly well kept otherwise.

The breakfast options are very solid for 7.5 euro, and the staff was helpful and friendly. Remember to bring your own lock to keep your belongings safe, otherwise the hostel will charge you 6 euro to purchase a basic master lock. Overall, good location.

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: The hostel was very clean and central. However the check in time is 2pm which is late, yet I and a number of others couldn't get into the room until 3pm because housekeeping was  late. This can be quite annoying especially after long travel.

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: Great location near the metro making it easy to get anywhere you need

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: This was my first time staying at a Generator Hostel and it was the best experience I have had at a hostel. I was able to meet new people and discover parts of the country I was visiting.

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: Amazing hostel, from the cleanliness of the rooms right down to the amazing staff at the reception desk. In particular, a staff member who I think was wearing the wrong name tag saying "Sofia", he was early/mid twenties, dark skinned and always smiling and ready to help. The staff are unbelievably helpful and go above and beyond, nothing was too much for them especially the one we highlighted. He was funny, friendly and made our first hostel experience a delight. We love generator!

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: The generator usually has very nice hostels, our ensuite 8 bed room was pretty good, clean and modern and enough space for everyone. The shared bathrooms however are disgusting, almost like they are never cleaned. The food and drinks at the bar are very expensive as well, same with breakfast. The rooftop bar is a cool place to go and drink and socialize. It's a good place overall, just expected it to be cleaner with the price of the rooms.

name: Generator Paris
reviewtext: Rooms were clean, had decent privacy in your bunk, and good storage for your bags. Busy place, especially for young people.. the bar could use an extra hand, seemed to always be a 10 min line up for food/drink. Also, only had 2 washer and dryers for the entire building, which were always being used, never had any luck washing clothes. The men's and woman's washroom on our floor had only 1 working toilet during our stay... not sure what was up with that.. probably wouldn't stay here again.

name: FIAP Jean Monnet
reviewtext: This is our favourite place to stay in Paris. Good transport links including the RER B to and from the airport. Quiet safe area. Good local shops and cafÃ©s. Accommodation spotlessly clean, bright and airy. Free luggage storage before check in and after check out. Generous breakfasts and a nice bar for an evening drink. Reasonable price.e

name: FIAP Jean Monnet
reviewtext: This is the best hostel I've stayed in so far. Just minutes from a metro station, getting to the rest of the city from here was easy and convenient. The facilities were spotless and the breakfast was excellent.

name: FIAP Jean Monnet
reviewtext: Clean room and bathroom, modern design and nice lobby, free towel, hair dryer at bathroom, everything is perfect except just that the rules are quite strict here... No food or drinks allowed to bring into hostel from outside, a security guy check your bags and your key card every time you go into the hostel, and checkout time 9:30am..

name: FIAP Jean Monnet
reviewtext: Not very lively atmosphere, but there were a lot of older travelers which is great if you're looking for a place to sleep and not socialize. The showers were very very hot and stayed hot , and located inside each dorm along with toilets. They also provided plenty of towels. Location was close to a metro but a bit weird to get to.

name: FIAP Jean Monnet
reviewtext: The place is nice. It is safe for a woman to stay.

name: FIAP Jean Monnet
reviewtext: Weren't told about lockers being available until we found them at the very end of our stay. Room was lovely

name: FIAP Jean Monnet
reviewtext: the best hostel I've ever been to

name: FIAP Jean Monnet
reviewtext: I stayed here on a Sunday, and with that caveat, I have to say that it was mediocre.  When I arrived, I found the reception staff to be unfriendly.  I was told they had a

name: FIAP Jean Monnet
reviewtext: The team was super awesome and helped me in every possible way. Thank you so much ðŸ˜Š

name: FIAP Jean Monnet
reviewtext: Amazing staff! Helped with any issues I had.

name: FIAP Jean Monnet
reviewtext: I was so happy to stay here. Everything was clrean, tidy. Even the sheet was changed everyday. The staffs are nice. Except the one of lady who working at dinning room. She was quite rude. But except that, everything was perfect! I can recommend this place. :) If I visit patis agian, I will definitely stay here again.

name: FIAP Jean Monnet
reviewtext: Clean, simple place, comfy beds, all the amenities I needed for my one night stay. Only downside was no lockers in room so I slept with valuables under my pillow!

name: FIAP Jean Monnet
reviewtext: The breakfast buffet allows you only one trip to the counter. That's kinda odd ...

name: FIAP Jean Monnet
reviewtext: My friend and I had an excellent stay at FIAP! We would highly recommend !! Extremely clean, very spacious (twin bed) room and good shower. Reception were very helpful (provided us with a hairdryer when asked and filled our water bottles at the bar). Breakfast included and had a decent selection. 5 minute walk from the Glaciere metro station which was 1.80 euro journey to the centre of paris. WIFI was dodgy at times but not our top priority. Would thoroughly recommend to anyone!

name: FIAP Jean Monnet
reviewtext: Hostel very well located, near train and metro station. Clean, A/C in the room. Conveniant 1 day charging back pack storage, and good breakfast for the 4â‚¬, friendly staff anf fair price. Only negative observation is excessive time you spend on the front line desk. They need to implement an INFORMATION desk line to separate from the check in/out one.

name: FIAP Jean Monnet
reviewtext: My friends and I stayed in FIAP Jean Monnet for 3 nights and we could not recommend it enough! It's in a perfect location, less than a 5 minute walk from a metro line and is in a nice area. The room was very clean and the beds were comfortable, and included a complimentary breakfast. The staff were very friendly, and although we made a mistake with the payment, they refunded us without any problems. We felt very safe there and would definitely return

name: FIAP Jean Monnet
reviewtext: Rooms and bathrooms are huge and absolutely pristine. No social events and nobody else in my 6 bed room (2 toilets and 2 showers) for 3 of 4 nights, so it was hard to meet people. Giant facility with 100s of rooms, so not one of the cozier hostels. Free luggage storage and big lockers in the room. Very comfortable beds, free towels, and quiet. A bit of a walk to metro stations. Great free breakfast; lunch and dinner also available. Basically got to enjoy some alone time in a fantastic facility.

name: FIAP Jean Monnet
reviewtext: We stayed here because our conference was here and we loved it. Room was clean and good for a hostel lots of space to roam around if it's raining and near the RER soclose to everything!

name: FIAP Jean Monnet
reviewtext: The person we interacted with at the front desk was pretty rude- I'm sure the other people on staff are friendlier, but he left a pretty sour taste in my mouth. The free WiFi was horrible, and they charge for better service. A fee of 8 â‚¬ for their breakfast is added to your overall payment (even if you don't want it) and the quality was poor. The location was subpar - in a weird neighborhood, lots of construction all around. The rooms were nice, but the hostel was loud. Wouldn't recommend.

name: FIAP Jean Monnet
reviewtext:
The hostel is a very clean place which offer 24 hours reception. The staff is friendly and helpful with all the enquirers. The room is clean and nice. 

The location is 5-10 mins walk from the train station.

name: FIAP Jean Monnet
reviewtext: Excellent. Just an excellent set up. The staff, especially Fabrice were 6* concierge level helpful.

name: FIAP Jean Monnet
reviewtext: I was really nervous to stay in any hostel because it was my first time! I found FIAP and it seemed a little too good to be true. But after reading the reviews I decided to go for it. I'm so glad that I did. Everything about my stay was wonderful. I stayed in a 6 person female room and I'll the girls I encountered during my stay were super sweet. I never felt worried about the security of my belongings or myself. And the closest metro is maybe a 5 minute walk away... very convenient!

name: FIAP Jean Monnet
reviewtext: I only stayed for one night. So I can't say a lot. But it is clean, friendly staff, little cosy garden/terrace. In general a good place to stay.

name: FIAP Jean Monnet
reviewtext: Value for your money in Paris which is a very expensive city.No Aircondition though. Since we had our 2 teen grandsons we  would try new adventure.Location was close to 2 metro stations and grocery stores and dining . We paid for breakfast which was reasonable price ,good choices.we came from Orly airport from London. so much better than CDG for passport control.Fixed Taxi ride for 30Euros  cheap for 4 people.We got 7th floor room with one bunk bed and 2 twin beds , very spacious and 2 showers .

name: FIAP Jean Monnet
reviewtext: Booked a private room for my friends and I for a night. The room was quite spacious, with two showers in the ensuite! The entire hostel is huge and quite clean. There's a cafeteria-style dinning room, a cafe, and a bunch of other amenities. Was a little tricky to find, but that's because we're all awful with directions.

name: FIAP Jean Monnet
reviewtext:
Place is for staying during schools trips, no entertainment for adults. 
That rule about no food allowed to be brought into wasn't followed very strictly (at least in July 2018), although bags have been checked every  time at the entrance. No air conditioning makes it very very hot in the rooms, hardly possible to have a refreshing sleep, and no soap is provided at bathrooms/wc

name: FIAP Jean Monnet
reviewtext:
Not worth the cheap price.
Hostel does not allow food inside, security tries to confiscate your food, because they have a "restaurant".
Also, they do not have a decent wifi, they instead want to sell you "premium wifi".
Does not have any "hostel vibe" whatsoever.

name: FIAP Jean Monnet
reviewtext: No locker in my room so kept my valuables with me. Hostel had great facilities and amenities but did not have an atmosphere to take advantage of them. Seems better suited for families. There were also a lot of school trips happening when I went so the breakfast area was filled with kids.

name: FIAP Jean Monnet
reviewtext: Facilities clean and accessible to Paris metro (nearest to line 6).  Staff were polite and helpful and answered questions/concerns about accommodations and schedules willingly.  Travelers planning to use the RER train line B should plan for a 10 min walk to the nearest station.

name: FIAP Jean Monnet
reviewtext: Far from everything except catacombs, area is quiet and non touristy. Walking and commuting to the rest of the city is annoying, and the hostel itself isn't great. The lobby feels like a cafeteria to a college and it's been full of little kids for some reason. And the free breakfast was a croissant and cereal. Spend 10$ more and stay somewhere worthwhile, in a nicer neighborhood.

name: FIAP Jean Monnet
reviewtext: Great hostel with great staff, clean rooms, and nice showers in each of the rooms. This is just not a very young and social hostel, so don't expect to meet any travellers around 18-35yo. Maybe it was just the time we came but it was mainly kids with their parents hanging around in the common area.

name: FIAP Jean Monnet
reviewtext: Very good place to stay, only thing I didn't like was the location, it wasn't very close to the town centre.

name: FIAP Jean Monnet
reviewtext: Rooms were really nice, wifi was aweful. Seemed more like a place that was hosting conferences, as such the social atmosphere was almost non-existent. They have no lockers in the rooms and a security guard that searches your bag for food everytime you enter.

name: FIAP Jean Monnet
reviewtext:
We found this hostel last-minute and paid a very acceptable price. In return, the four of us got a very comfortable room with a large bathroom and TWO showers. Since the denfer-rochereau station is unde 15 minutes walking distance, you can reach the hostel day and night and during the day the RER train gets you to the city centre with the blink of an eye!
Downsides:  We found no other young people, no party   atmosphere (compared to St. Christopher's) and it's not the most exciting neighborhood.

name: FIAP Jean Monnet
reviewtext: Very very very hot. No AC.

name: FIAP Jean Monnet
reviewtext: Stayed one night in a single-bed room. Everything was fine.

name: FIAP Jean Monnet
reviewtext: Room was very clean and facilities were very nice. Only complaint is that it is far away from most attractions. Luckily, the metro station was very close and there were a lot of bars and restaurants within walking distance.

name: FIAP Jean Monnet
reviewtext:
Solo in Paris, location is excellent as it situated in a good neighborhood,  major metro station is 10 mins away.
 well maintained facilities i had a good sleep there. 
lots of school groups staying in the hostel too so if you are a solo traveller like me it can be lonely from time to time. 
the lack of social aspect of this hotel makes me go out explore all the time
if you want a quiet place just to sleep then this will be a good choice.

name: FIAP Jean Monnet
reviewtext:
My friend and I stayed at this hostel for one night. It's not allowed to bring food into the hostel, so you have either have to eat outside or buy food at the hostel. The check out time was a bit early (09.30).
The staff were very nice and helpful. The room was like a hotel room with our own bathroom which included showers.

name: FIAP Jean Monnet
reviewtext: Great hostel, super close to the metro and very clean. Be careful however when it is warm outside; since there are no fans in the rooms and the windows cannot open fully, the room will get very, very warm. Other than that, the room itself (4 beds) was amazing and clean, and the free breakfast in the morning is a nice plus!

name: FIAP Jean Monnet
reviewtext: Great place with the cleanest facilities and rooms I have ever seen in a hostel. I stayed here last second due to a cancelled flight by my airline. I was very scared because I was alone in Paris with no working phone and no place to stay. I found this to be one of the highest rated places and it deserves it! The beds are so comfortable and they provide you a towel, a very good comforter and a great pillow with a full armoire that has a coded lock. I loved it so much! Would definitely stay again.

name: FIAP Jean Monnet
reviewtext: Good place to stay. Clean, nice room. No major complaints. The one sink in our room didn't work but there were two. Overall, we got pretty good value for a 4 bedroom private compared to the other dorm prices in Paris.

name: FIAP Jean Monnet
reviewtext:
I book for room of 4 beds , they give me room of 6 beds .
Also the time to check out is 9:30 am , its need to change at least 10:30 . 

Everything else is good .

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Good stay. Better than many other hostel stays for me. I was very impressed with the affordable bar, friendly staff and cleanliness.

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Guys at the desk were really helpful and friendly and welcoming. Rooms were very clean. Only small downer was abrupt ending of breakfast every morning.

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: We were giving something completely different than what we booked. I guess this is commen. The staff didn't seem to care because the only thing that was said was "ya it's annoying but you still have a bed"!  towards the end of the conversation they gave us free towels and a drink. Witch don't get me wrong that's cool and all but I feel that when it came to the pay they switch me into a 4 person room and I had to pay the price. My friend & her sister booked a room with 4 beds but got an 8 person

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: A bit far from the city center if you wanna walk to the tourist places (I did a 1 hour walk everyday to get to most of them), but there's a metro station just around the corner, so I don't think the location it's a problem. Great hostel & friendly staff! Everything was really clean and the free breakfast it's delicious. If you wanna meet people this hostel it's a good option, the bar downstairs it's really nice (and the volume of people talking didn't got to the rooms, witch was great).

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Great location. Comfortable bed. And a great atmosphere. Would definitely stay again

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Pros: fantastic location (especially compared to many other Paris hostels), great bar with nice courtyard, solid free breakfast, clean, good A/C. Cons: crowded room and overall hostel layout, a little difficult meeting other travellers, not the best vibe.

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: It was my first time at a Hostel . The staff was great the price was good. Very clean met people from around the world  . The owner  is very helpful  helping me to get around Paris.

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
I liked this hostel and would definitely come back but it also was the most expensive hostel I have stayed in in 4 months of travel and staying in hostels. 
The staff were great; breakfast was carbs(bread and more bread, croissants, cereals  and mediocre)
The 4 bed dorm was just too small for 4 people and their luggage. 
Atmosphere was friendly with lots of people in the courtyard making use of the bar. LOTS of choices of bakeries, restaurants shops very close by, including the laundromat.

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Really great place to stay - very close to the Eiffel Tower and metro stations. Staff were really friendly and the bar was good too ðŸ˜Š

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Pretty good value, but the beds were horrendous. They were a thin layer of padding on a metal frame- very uncomfortable. The staff was welcoming and answered every question. The location is okay considering it's right next to the metro. Overall, for the value I'll stay there again.

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Quality hostel, kept clean and has a really nice courtyard area outside.. not super close to Paris main attractions by foot but the metro is 2 mins away. Free breakfast was good! Would stay again

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: My stay at the Three Ducks was amazing. The staff were really helpful and nice. The eiffel tower is just a short walk away although to get to Notre Dame it is about an hour walk . The Hostel is located near some really good restaurants. So really if you stay here just enjoy it, we met so many cool travellers. The only faults was the bar was a bit noisy but they can't help that. The beds were a bit squeaky, WD-40. And there is a church next to it with a bell that rings. But it's a great place!

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Sure helpful and wonderful service. Love it

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: 20 min walk from the Eiffel Tower, along the way there is shops and restaurants. 2 min walk to the metro. Tiny little locker big enough for a handbag to store valuables but no room for luggage to be locked away. Turned into what seemed an up class bar at night. Bedroom smelt like pee ðŸ‘ŽðŸ¼ If you're looking for hostel vibe this didn't seem it.

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Facilities are clean, hostel is not as central as I imagined. It's close to the metro but you will likely need to take public transit everywhere. The rooms are ok. Stairs and No elevators to take luggage to the room. There is a church next to the hostel and you can hear the loud bells every hour, very disturbing. Breakfast was bad. Coffee was bad and I attempted to have a piece of bread but it was too hard to bite into it. things are very expensive because it's 20 min from Eiffel. Staff friendly

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: 10/10! Best hostel I've ever stayed in! Made so many friends and the staff was really accommodating.

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Very well located, 15 min walk to the Eiffel Tower, metro station just a few steps away from hostel. Lots of options for eating out and to buy groceries. Staff was very friendly and helpful. AC and internet worked good. Good atmosphere to meet fellow travelers.

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
Stayed here for three days on my first solo trip. Good place to meet new people both locals and fellow travellers. The staff were helpful and kind, which is very good. Close proximity to the Metro station.
Definitely recommend it.
Tips to those travelling solo, try to be more outgoing, people here are kinder than they might seem.

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Good location and mostly nice staff. Room smelled and wifi was slow, not worth the money.

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Staff was great during my stay. Bathroom was clean, and breakfast was basic but tasty! A lot of groups were staying here during my stay, but I met a few friends and ended up hanging out with them multiple nights! It is in a quiet neighborhood, but many locals come to the bar for a drink and there are plenty of restaurants nearby. Overall a great value for my first hostel experience!

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Not a bad hostel, some of the staff are super nice and others are super rude. Free breakfast is standard bread, cereal, and coffee. The outside bar area quiets down pretty early so no worries if your room overlooks the bar. About a 20 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower.  Beds all have a light, outlet, and USB ports, top bunks could use a shelf. Small locker for valuables but not for luggage. Overall it was decent but a little expensive.

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Just the right distance from city centre, away from the noise. The atmosphere was amazing, friendly staff, comfy bed and pillow. Small suggestion: to have floor towels outside the shower and if the lights from outside (the sitting area) could be turned off earlier. Otherwise I loved my stay here.

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
The receptionist was quite rude,but the cleaning staff were very friendly. There wasn't proper WiFi connection. Steep stairs makes it difficult to carry luggage upward.
Kinda okay for very short stay per say 1 or 2 days max . Won't recommend though.

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: The walk to the Eiffel Tower is about a 15-20 minute walk which is still convenient, but not as close as it was described. Some of the staff was extremely rude, yelling at people to finish breakfast just minutes after the serving period had ended, and refusing to acknowledge/help anyone who didn't speak French. Facilities are NOT cleaned daily. They were never cleaned during our stay. Floors, bathrooms, and walls were disgusting. Also, they will find everything possible to charge you on.

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Was here for one night - so can't tell much about the bars or parties. My room was very clean and the showers/bathroom was as clean as any other hostel. Had A/C which was HUGE, because of the heat wave. ~15 minute walk to Eiffel Tower and in a quiet neighborhood ðŸ‘ðŸ¼

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: A friend and I stayed in this hostel in a mixed 8 bed room. The room was awesome with the shared bathroom in the room. The location of the hostel was great. It was a short walk to the train station and a grocery store. The bar is great and all of the staff is very friendly. It was overall a great experience! I would definitely go back.

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Ensuite with one toilet room and another for the shower allowing people to use the toilet without blocking the shower in the morning. Small lockers in the rooms too tiny to be of any real use, yet the luggage storage in the entrance is shared and you don't even have to show a room key to the staff in order to get the key to get in. Staff were kinda just there - not unfriendly but not really talkative either. Breakfast was decent for the price. Cleanliness amazing some places, lacking in others

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: The staff was very knowledgeable about the city. The train station is nearby and easily accessible. Eiffel Tower and the Seine River are 10 minute walk away.

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
BEST HOSTEL EVER!!!

Niko :D

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: The hostel was great! It was clean and efficient. Clean  and quiet rooms. Not the greatest location wise, but really close to the subway so not an issue!

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Staff may have bad days from time to time, but the 24 hours I stayed there, the receptionist lady was entirely rude and wasn't really enthusiastic to help, even the next day when making a mental note of being super nice using manners she still persisted to be rude. Plus the check out is quite early (10:30) considering the check in time is 2pm.

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: I stayed here about 8 years ago and i was very impressed with how much had changed in those years it's amazing and will definitely be recommending it to everyone!

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Very nice atmosphere. Beds were pretty comfy and the AC in the rooms was so clutch. The staff were all super nice and helpful. The bar is definitely a more local spot but was still enjoyable. Didn't meet too many people but I was also there on a Tuesday night.

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Great staff and clean, secure place

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Lively atmosphere. Location was solid and the staff was extremely helpful. Main annoyance was that the beds would squeak every time someone in our room would turn.

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: I really enjoyed my stay there! I found the staff to be extremely kind and welcoming. I loved how tidy and clean all the spaces were. I felt safe there which was initially a big worry as a solo traveler but I certainly felt at ease there. Also it's right between two metro stops which makes getting around super easy!!! Highly recommended!!

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: No common room or kitchen to drink your own wine with your friends

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Great great experience. Staff was extremely nice and check in/out was seamless. Great location 15-20 Mom south of the Eiffel Tower right outside metros and another quick 10min walk to the direct train to Versailles. A bit far from the foodie areas of the city but it's all walkable if you're down for a beautiful hour walk. Contrary to the noise complaints in most of the comments, I found that they always closed the outside area on time which controls for the noise veg well. Can't beat the free BF

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: It was hot and humid when we went, and the air conditioning made all the difference, maintaining a comfortable 19Â°C. There is no blackout curtain over the window, just a shade, so bring an eye shade. Also, there is a church nextdoor that rings its bells on the hour starting at 8:00 AM, so bring earplugs. The location is less than a twenty minute walk to the Eiffel Tower, and there are subway stops for two different lines really close by, making getting anywhere very simple.

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Fantastic place great location. Comfortable beds

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
Great location, walking distance to Effiel tower and back. 2 metro stops on line 8 near by and good food & gelato. Grocery market around corner. 
Stayed in a girls only dorm, which all were very respectful & nice. Little lockers with self digital code to use per person in room for important stuff. If you are staying on the weekend bring ear plugs because of people stay up late outside at the bar. Only concern was my big bag in a closet room with everyone else's stuff, but is behind locked door.

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: I was only in the hostel for a night. The staff seemed to be friendly and everything was secure. I felt very comfortable, but the bathrooms were not very clean. Also, I liked the rule to keep the rooms quiet, but did not see a good place to hang out with other people and talk that was not the bar.

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
Place was nice enough. Hostel refused to give my deposit back because I didn't hold onto a paper receipt from 5 days ago, despite there being no way to check in without a deposit. 

Bar is located right next to checkin area. Was having a glass of wine and the backpack of someone checking in knocked the glass right over all over my white shirt and the table. It was a honest mistake, but I asked for the bartender for some towels to clean up the mess and he hands me a couple napkins and doesn't off

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Nice facilities. Subway and groceries around the corner. Hostel is a bar as well. Unfortunately the bar closes at 2am and if you have to wake up early your kinda SOL. Bar is mostly french as well.

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
Overall an okay hostel to stay in.
20 minute walk to Eiffel Tower, and plenty of restaurants and shopping nearby.
Wifi was terrible, we had a few codes that didn't even work and had to ask for more and just gave up in the end.
Our room didn't have a shower holder so had to physically hold the shower head in order to properly wash. 
Beds were small so not suitable for tall/overweight people. 
Bar downstairs was nice however would've expected a discount on drinks for hostel guests.

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Honestly 10/10, great atmosphere and such a great neighbourhood. Lots of croissants for breakfast! I ended up extending my stay because I loved it so much, definitely recommend.

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Nice hostel with an excellent location. Partygoers at the bar downstairs could get noisy though.

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Paris hostels tend to be pretty expensive and for what I found this was on the lower end of the scale. It's not too bad, the breakfast is pretty good, and the staff are great.
