AC is the rooms is clutch. There are several close by metro stops. The kitchen is SUPER small and not very stocked so if you are looking to cook that is going to be an issue. Seems to draw more of a party crowd (it is part bar, after all), so be weary of that if that is an issue.

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
3 Ducks was a great choice for our family of 4 adults.  We had a newly renovatedprivate  4 bed suite and although the toilet and shower room was a bit cozy, we managed to make it work.  There was a lively checkin/bar/breakfast area with glass doors that opened up into an interior courtyard.  They offered a generous breakfast included in the hostel rate.  
The property was located a two minute walk from the metro and was close to restaurants and shopping.

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Overall really nice hostel but I think an area of opportunity is the locker situation, personally just wished they were bigger to make me feel more comfortable. The staff were amazing and incredibly helpful but it gets annoying in the main check in center with so many people in the area for drinks. I loved this hostel and I would come again.

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Area is really good. 20 min walk to Eiffel tower. Staff was great and the beds were comfortable. Nice bar to meet other people but the vibe wasn't very sociable for some reason. Breakfast is pretty simple. Overall good experience.

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: My sheets had hairs and a booger in them upon arrival. The top bunk had something brown smeared under it. The bathroom was not clean. The wifi barely worked. The staff would run the hostel and bar at the same time and so you were always waiting on them to get something. Overall will not stay here again due to cleanliness issues

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Didn't know what to expect when i booked but ended up loving my stay here.

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: other room mates had rotting food on the table, no one cleaned it up the entire time i was there.

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
Okay place. Location was good. Enjoyed staff. I didn't like that the lockers were so small. That was a surprise to me. I normally could fit my small suitcase in a lockerâ€”not this time. 

Also, workers were completing tasks in the courtyard at night and morning. Not cool.

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Location and bar/courtyard ambience was the best thing about this place. Rooms are doll house tiny! And bunks are absolutely minuscule. Toilets and bathrooms are also 3x3! Not very comfortable after a whole day of site seeing. Not recommended for plus size people.

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
Reached the hostel before check-in time and the staff was kind enough to let me keep my bag there (They have a room just for this which is very secure).
The location is 20 mins away from the Eiffel tower. And 2 mins away from Metro. The rooms and toilets are regularly cleaned. My room had AC, which ensured a good night sleep given the heat. The bar is good too. Had a blast there during the World Cup.
This was the first time that I ever stayed in a hostel and 3 Ducks was a great first.

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: My first hostel experience ever. I walked in the door was greeted and the transactions went smoothly and was given complete full service. The rooms were adequately organized, shared between 8 people, bathroom and shower were clean and USB chargers built into the wall. The atmosphere was amazing, locals came in for drinks and given the right circumstances you'd be able to join in, the area that the 3 Ducks is in amazing and easy to access the Metro. My stay was too short, but I will be back!

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: This is my second time staying at this hostel and will stay again in the future. Beds are comfortable. Pablo and the rest of the staff was very nice and welcoming. They have AC in the rooms. It's at a great location, very close to the metro.

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Very friendly, good location

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: I really liked staying in this hostel. Nice staff, clean facilities, nice guests and a great location (walking distance from the Eiffel Tower). Great hostel!

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: I was only at the hostel briefly because I was meeting with other friends while in Paris, but the staff are super helpful and friendly and the rooms are quiet and clean despite there being a bar right outside the rooms. My only complaint would be that I was never able to maintain a consistent wifi connection (not even enough to check email).

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Fantastic hostel with a welcoming, friendly, and helpful staff. The atmosphere was beautiful and welcoming. We enjoyed our stay in the cool, clean rooms very much. Would definitely stay here again!

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: We loved the room in this hostel and the AC. The staff was great and everyone was nice.  The only drawback I have would be the price of the drinks at the bar and maybe that it feels a little far from things for walking but the metro station isn't far. Overall a good hostel and price for Paris.

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Stayed here more than a year ago, and this time round has been just as nice as I remember! Very modern, clean, and friendly hostel. Great location and within a good walk of the Eiffel tower (or metro). Lots of shops and restaurants nearby, and the hostel itself has a decent selection of drinks. The rooms have A/C, which in Europe is a major plus!

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Had a lovely stay here. Good location, just a block from Metro. Enjoyed Paris neighborhood feel and so close to restaurants. Helpful and courteous staff, always willing to please!

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: This was my first time staying in a hostel and I loved it! We were able to stock up on a big breakfast and were located a short walk from the train station. The rooms were clean and you were able to put your valuables away in a locker. I stayed in a room with 8 people and we shared a shower and toilet. We all became friends and went out together on our last night!

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: I really enjoyed my stay at the 3 ducks. It's in a wonderful neighborhood and you can walk to the canals and Eiffel Tower and the louvre is a beautiful hour walk from here. The staff is super friendly and it feels like a locals bar downstairs which I enjoyed. The courtyard is chill and the breakfast helps start the day. The WiFi is a little slow but that shouldn't stop you from going here. Will definitely be back next year!

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Stayed here my for my first night of Paris and loved it. It's small but lively and the staff is beautiful, funny, and welcoming. The Eiffel Tower is a little walk away or in my case a quick run to catch the light shows. I would definitely recommend to family& friends and would stay again.

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Superb hostel! Stylish design, few steps distance to metro, helpful and friendly staff, breakfast is a nice thing to start the day with the aircon is just so wonderful for the summer night! Also a big plus for having a heated towel rail in my room which is out of expected! Can't wait to stay here again!

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Majority of the staff were very friendly and helpful (especially Alessandra and Pablo). Rooms were modern, stylish and immaculately clean. I only have two qualms with this hostel. One is that it's rather difficult carrying luggage up the stairs, so an elevator or escalator would be amazing to have! The other thing is breakfast could be more varied (example: addition of fruits, veggies, eggs, bacon, etc.) I would definitely stay here again!

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Nice location however they don't have lift facility.

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: GREAT HOSTEL NEAR EIFFEL TOWER,GREAT BREAKFAST,GREAT FACILITIES LIKE COMPUTERS AND GREAT WELCOMING

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Nice hostel, no real issues. I just found that you had to catch transport to everything. Public transport is easy in Paris but just a little inconvenient. They have a cool bar down stairs but there's not a real hostel vibe as it's open to the public

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Great location and atmosphere, met plenty of great people, would highly recommend.

name: The 3 Ducks Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Great hostel, in a great area and only 10 min walk to the Eiffel Tower without being too touristy. Some great little cafes that are close for lunch/pastries. A bit away from Montemarte and other places, but the metro line is right around the corner from the hostel so that made it very convenient! There is a bar in the hostel and a nice courtyard to meet some cool travelers as well. Good breakfast in the morning! Loved the hostel, will come back!

name: Enjoy Hostel
reviewtext:
The staff could not be any more disinterested in their work at the hostel.
My sheets were dirty, I had hair in my bed. It's hard to sleep as the bunkbeds are not stable at all and as you turn the other person sleeping above or underneath you wakes up. You hear every noise in the hostel. The breakfast was VERY simple. Baguette, butter and Marmelade.

name: Enjoy Hostel
reviewtext: Expensive for a hostel but it's worth it, the metal beds didn't squeak. Everything was really clean and bathrooms were great. Good shower. Stayed in a 4 bed dorm. I arrived early and was able to leave my luggage in a store room and my lap top was kept safe for me behind reception. Easily walkable to montparnasse train station which was what I needed

name: Enjoy Hostel
reviewtext: Overall pretty good, the location was great. Close to metro and shops. There were a lot of cafes and restaurants near by, as well as supermarkets. The 4 person room is really tight, it's managebale but not a lot of room for everyone. I was disappointed with the breakfast as it was only bread, jam and butter. The common area also could have been more inviting so that people could meet and mingle better. Pretty good value for money.

name: Enjoy Hostel
reviewtext: Upon arrival, the lady at the reception offered us a double room instead of a dorm for the same price. That was very friendly. The room and bathroom were quite small, but had everything we needed. The bed was very comfortable and clean. Breakfast was basic, but sufficient since it was included in the price.

name: Enjoy Hostel
reviewtext: Hostel is located in a quiet and nice area. Metro stops are about a 10 minute walk. The staff were welcoming and helpful. The rooms were a bit cramped but the beds comfortable. Locker in room wouldn't lock. The free breakfast was bread with choice of jam or butter. Bathroom could have been cleaner but easy to overlook if you have ever used a shared bathroom before. Grocery store down the street. Cafe and restaurants close by.

name: Enjoy Hostel
reviewtext:
Good hostel with reasonable accommodations. 

What was cool: host bought a bunch of snacks and wines for happy hour he organizes on Saturdays

Good: place is clean 

If you're looking for exercise : you have up to 5 flights of stairs to climb to get to your room

Vibe of the space: meh. People are open to talking but the space could be arranged to better facilitate interactions. 
Ex: arrange breakfast so people can stand next to each other while getting bread /butter /jam

name: Enjoy Hostel
reviewtext: Rooms were simple with a bed, a locker and most importantly self-controlled AC. Bathroom is nice and spacious, but there is no soap. The shower is nice, however there is no door or curtain on one half, so the entire floor was soaked when you got out. Breakfast is some bread with two kinds of jam, and coffee/hot chocolate and you have to wash what you use, meaning that some glasses or plates were still a bit dirty because people didn't spend the time to clean them properly.

name: Enjoy Hostel
reviewtext: Great location and price for Paris downtown, close to metro. We had a private room and it was small (small bed, small bathroom/shower) but had all what we need and it is appreciate it to have some privacy. It doesn't have elevator. The staff: the guy at night doesn't seem to know how things works around and we got charged extra amount which was refunded later by the hotel directly to my credit card.

name: Enjoy Hostel
reviewtext: Two things: The rooms are too small. The second deck of the bed is way too low that I couldn't even seat properly on the first deck.

name: Enjoy Hostel
reviewtext: I struggled with the size of the pillows and ended up using my small travel pillow instead. My minor complaint is that the bottom bunk have very little head room and I couldn't even sit on the bed properly because of it.

name: Enjoy Hostel
reviewtext: Overall great experience! Location was far away from attractions, but a quick hop on the metro and you were right by everything! Staff was very friendly! We only stayed one night and did not utilize the amenities provided but everything looked very clean and organized! Great stay!

name: Enjoy Hostel
reviewtext: Indeed value for money. Excellent hostel with all the basic facilities: an air-conditioned room with a nice bed and pillow with reading lights, simple french breakfast, and fortunately we were treated by the hostel management with plenty of wine on a Saturday. I would recommend this hostel if you are just looking to live with basic facilities necessary for a short stay in Pairs.

name: Enjoy Hostel
reviewtext:
Nice place to stay bonus it has AC in every room,
Reception staff were not very friendly. Room was clean n tidy small ensuite. The hostel let some one change room in to ours at like 3 am which woke everyone up with him moving all imhos things in

name: Enjoy Hostel
reviewtext: This hostel is located in a really nice area of Paris, away from the tourist hotspots. It's very basic but clean and safe. It's the type of place where you would stay just for a night or two. If you wanted to do any cooking it probably wouldn't be great as the kitchen is quite small. The breakfast in the morning is bread and jam but there are nice bakeries across the road and at least three supermarkets close by. The inside could do with some redecoration but overall it's fine for a short trip.

name: Enjoy Hostel
reviewtext: Absolutely disgusting customer service!! The front desk lady, Victoria, was angry, aggressive and downright rude. There were various issues with my reservation and room allocation, she refused to explain but instead shouted over me and pointed in my face. While I remained calm, she threatened to call the police and forced us to leave the hostel even though we had a reservation and I had paid the deposit! She refused to give us a room , so we had to find another place to stay for that night...

name: Enjoy Hostel
reviewtext: Really nice hostel, great facilities and comfy beds. The lockers in the room were unable to be locked but other than that this place was a very pleasant stay.

name: Enjoy Hostel
reviewtext: The hostel is acceptable. However, it has some drawbacks. In the first place, the hostel page says that it has a kitchen. This is a missleading expression, because it is not possible to cook there. They only have a microwave and a sink. I was not the only person that felt cheated about this. In the second place, some electric connections in the room were not working. There is nothing very special about this hostel. There are no activities in it, nor a kitchen neither a bar, so it is only useful

name: Enjoy Hostel
reviewtext: We were lucky to have double entry into our room,  meaning we had to go through one room to get to ours, adding to the security grade. Close location to bars, supermarkets, metro, and Catacombs. Staff was least talkative I've been around, but noting negative. Breakfast offered is traditional French breakfast (Bread and jam), so don't expect much if you have an American or English appetite. Coffee machine is free in the morning and it's great!

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: Too good, great location near to river and very cool place and easy to find, comfortable. Love this place to stay again.

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: This hostel has no working wifi, no security lockers, no sinks in the toilets, very few power outlets in dorms, no shower head in our shower and no kitchen area at all. I know Paris is expensive and but a lot of these facilities could be provided with very minimal effort and cost. This is unacceptable considering how crazy expensive it is, especially compared to most other European hostels which have all these things for a quarter of this price. The location is amazing, but not worth it.

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: Only 2 outlets for a room of 10. Staff was friendly but not helpful.

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: Lovely hostel in a gorgeous old building. Great location, quiet, safe and secure. Would recommend!

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: After reading other reviews I honestly expected more from this hostel. The rooms were ok the bed comfy but privacy is limited with no security boxes for your valuables. Also, you cannot enter your room from 12-3 each day due to cleaning. Here I felt uncomfortable as someone in my room had money stolen at this time from her bed space. The showers are good but the top bunk in my room could see directly into the shower which was a little uncomfortable. The food at the restaurant is awful don't do it

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: I liked that there weren't bunk beds (at least in the room I stayed in). It kind of sucked that the toilet was on a different floor but with old buildings you get what you get. Rooms were cleaned every day and staff was helpful. Most importantly it felt safe.

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext:
Incredible hostel 
 Pros:
- close to metro stations
- right on downtown
-nice staff
-clean rooms
- bathroom options 

Cons:
- no private secure space for storage (bring a padlock )
- would like a bit more variety for breakfast (fruit or different yourgurt flavours)

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: Nice location and friendly staff. Provides free breakfast. Simple rooms but could have more facilities.

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext:
Awesome time in this Hostel. Rooms were clean, Staff very nice, Location is excellent (close to Notre Dame and centre Pompidou, far from Tour d'Eiffel though). 
The breakfast is limited per person, but that's ok for it being included. WiFi is only available in the Common areas, and the patio (where it is very nice to hang out!). Luggage room is available, and we had two showers in our 7 bed dorm. The beds are solid, so they don't make noise when someone moves around. Beautiful building also!!

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext:
Mije de Paris may be one of the most beautiful hostels I have ever seen. Set in old mansions near Ile de Saint Louis and Notre Dame, they're in the heart of the city.
One word of warning though, is that the WiFi signal is very weak and it only exists in the lobby, and there are no lockers to keep your things safe, you just have to trust those around you.
Otherwise is was a magnificent stay in Paris. Thanks Mije!

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: Bad internet only available only in lobby . No internet in rooms. Very good staff. Address hard to find. Good atmosphere. Minimal facilities inside room.

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: Super nice! A lot of big groups of kids in school (I'm assuming) staying there. Not so many solo travelers, WiFi doesn't reach the 3rd floor which kinda sucked

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext:
8 bed dorm with 4 plug sockets!! They have a light at every bed so why did they fail to install plug sockets. They also expect you to vacate the room between 12-3pm so they can clean, which when located in the heart of a party district is a little absurd.

The staff were friendly and the location is great, but it was let down for the above reasons.

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: Very clean and great location. The issue of only having one power outlet mentioned by an earlier reviewer was not an issue - each bed had an electrical outlet and some has USB outlets as well. Wi-fi was unusable from anywhere on the property.

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext:
A nice hostel in a solid location. Security was good and rooms were clean. Im a bit disappointed by the facilities though... 

- WiFi was only available in the lobby and would not load even during times with few people. 

- Electrical socks were also extremely rare with only one per shared room with 4 girls. 

- Atmosphere was very young. Many families and school trips. People seems a bit cold and kept to themselves. Wouldn't recommend if you're a solo traveler looking to meet people.

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: I'm glad I decided to stay here for one night. I needed a place to sleep since I was going to visit the city for a day. I left my bag before the checking time without any problems. I was surprised to find out that you share the room with only two other guys, even when it says you might stay in a room with 10 beds. Wi-Fi connection sucks though, so be prepared to use your data. Apart from that, it is what advertised.

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: I came really late in midnight. and the security accepted me. so I could sleep normally. then at 7 in the morning I had a good breakfast:) All service of stuff was perfect.

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext:
Nice little hostel easy walking distance to the metro in a really safe area. 
The only bad things were having to carry my extremely heavy bag up 3 slights of winding, uneven stairs, but I already knew this as I had read others reviews. And the dorm slept 6 girls but only had 2 power outlets. Bringing a power board would really help as 2 girls charged their phones all night, leaving the other 4 of us without phone charge

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: I didn't like being told my booking was at a different location.  That's sketchy but a minor issue. More importantly, international travelers rely on Wi-Fi.  It's inconvenient to travel so far to use Wi-Fi which is only available at the front desk area and even there it's not dependable. Also there is only one space for one electrical socket per room... very poorly planned.

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext:
I really liked it here. I might return.

Pros:
Great location especially for the cost
Great atmosphere - you feel like you're in old Paris

Cons:
No lockers in the room
The wifi is poor quality and only available in the lobby
The breakfast is very light and not healthy

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: Paris is expensive however you look at it. The hostel may seem really basic for the price but again - it's Paris. There are 2 outlets in the room. No WiFi in the rooms. Breakfast is basic - croissant, bread, cereal, coffee/tea, and orange juice. Really great location and easily accessible metro.

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext:
Great location.nice staff.
No atmosphere, not enough plugs and bad wi-fi

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: Great location. Breakfast a little basic, but there are great cafes round the corner and a Starbucks. Metro is also really close by. Shower was pretty good, which is needed when you have long hair also it was in the room so not shared. Fairly quiet, other than guests of all ages here I.e. children.

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: Great place, location, atmosphere and staff ! About a 2 min walk to the metro station and restaurants, there's no lockers in the room but there's a luggage room downstairs that the staff only have access to ! The staff were super lovely and helpful ! Everything was clean, each room had a toilet, 2 showers and 2 basins, each bed had its own light you could turn on and off yourself which was great for when people wanted to go to sleep but others wanted to stay up ! Great, safe area as well !

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: We stayed here for a weekend in Paris and were lucky enough to get a three bed dorm for the three of us, so it was more like a private room. The hostel is in a fantastic location that is near tons of public transport, and the facilities were always clean (having the toilet separate from the shower and sink was a bit of an adjustment, but it works). The free breakfast is a great value, but a very French breakfast (no eggs or waffles here, but simple, delicious, and gets the job done!)

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext:
Great hostel, the staff are very helpful and welcoming. The hostel has a beautiful court yard, the rooms are spacious and very clean and the location was perfect to get around either walking or metro. I went with my little sister and felt safe and secure at all times here. Lovely free breakfast in the morning too. 
Would highly recommend and would return here.

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: Nice quiet hostel, great location, in a beautiful building, breakfast is pretty basic but you can't argue with that really.

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: Would definitely recommend for those who want to explore the city of Paris; perfect location right next to Saint Paul Metro, and walk-able distance from many sights and attractions, plus if you want to walk along the river Seine with its scenic view. Rooms cleaned everyday, staff are helpful and friendly, breakfast is satisfactory. Wouldn't recommend if you're looking for a sociable hostel, or if you want somewhere more quiet; broken sleep due to noise from streets outside, and other guests.

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: WARNING: BED BUGS! ONE OUTLET FOR 5 PEOPLE!! Nowhere comfortable or private to sit in the whole hostel, just rows of dining tables in the lobby despite not having a kitchen. Night security was extremely rude to me bc I couldn't remember my room number. I told them my name and to look me up & the security guard literally said to me "I don't believe you". After about 10 minutes and me showing him my room card, he looked me up and saw my name and let me up without an apology! Wish I could write mor

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: Great hostel, very close to St Paul's metro station and Bastille area which was beautiful. Beautiful courtyard with lots of areas to hang out and relax and friendly staff would stay here again!

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext:
Things you need to remember:
* no elevator
* no towels
* breakfast included

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: it was an okay hostel in an okay location. however no kitchen, staff were not very helpful. filled with kids on school camp or something. not a very sociable place, wifi only worked whilst in the lobby and our room was up about 8 flights of stairs. rooms were basic. would not stay again

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: Incredible location, beautiful, very clean. Would definitely recommend.

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: Great experience. Nice staff, perfect location, super clean. Loved it !

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: It is in a really convenient location and the place is really quite.

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: Good hostel to stay at for a couple days! It was clean and the location is amazing! The shower in our room was also really good. The down-side to this hostel that there are almost no plugs in the hostel rooms and the breakfast could be improved.

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: Wonderful Parisian atmosphere!! Beautiful hostel, perfect location, very very clean!! And very quiet...  no parties at the hotel, so suitable for families...

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext:
First stop on a travelling trip. Was greeted by staff who were a little rude, though others there were really nice.

The place was quite basic- felt like small mattresses on a floor; no security lockers, no air con and was really hot. The place was cleaned daily, but it meant everyone had to leave the room for 3 hours without being allowed back in, which was really annoying.

Breakfast was so basic; I think a third of a plain baguette and a mini pastry thing. Lovely building and great location.

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: Clean, comfortable hostel with big rooms. Really quiet and chilled out, close to the city and its attractions. Staff are helpful and friendly with a good breakfast to start the day!

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: I felt completely ripped off by this place. Not only did it seem that we were staying in the overspill of the beautiful building round the corner (in the photos), but the hostel's facilities were terrible. No lockers and one plug socket in a room of six people. Uncomfortable sausage shaped pillows... We were convinced that there were bed bugs, as we woke up with bites each day. Poor, limited breakfast. One rude, unhelpful receptionist . I won't be recommending it.

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext:
Best hostel I've ever stayed at.
Great location.
Beautiful place.
Affordable.
My only criticism is that their beds were very, very squeeky, every little turn at night was quite loud.

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: Most beautiful hostel I've ever stayed in and amazingly located! I stayed in the 10-bed female dorm which had a loft, bathroom, showers, and sinks. It was very well designed and cozy. The only issue for me was that there were no small lockers for valuables, e.g. my laptop and passport. I did not ask if it was possible to leave my laptop at the desk. Towels cost 6 euros, and the full cost of room had to be paid by cash before they would return my passport after check-in. Overall very very nice!

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: Good, simple hostel but offers only the the bare minimum.

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: Not really sure what I was expecting but I wouldn't call it a youth hostel. I had a lovely time and the place was beautiful but there were a lot of families. Also you can't get in or out from 1-7 and if you do you can't get back in. However if you're looking for a safe, quiet place to stay this is a nice one.

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: Great location, beautiful anbience, we stayed in level three - there are lifts but they are slow! Included breakfast is a real perk! Staff was super helpful

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: Very simple atmosphere, I wouldn't suggest for lonely travel looking to make friends. Great for groups, close to the center and attractions, also very clean!

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: Gorgeous building, spacious and well ventilated rooms (afaic). Recommended

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: The facilities are gorgeous, however, as others have mentioned there are limited outlets and no toilets in the room. The space was incredibly clean. The tall ceilings and windows in the room were gorgeous. Fabulous location close to the Seine and the gay bars.

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: I wish there was a filtered water station but other than that was awesome!! Definitely would come back

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: Amazing location. Clean facilities. I knew coming in that there weren't any lockers in the room, but just a warning to those that might have a problem with that. The place was so great that that didn't bother me at all. I stayed in the 10 room dorm and the room was huge and divided into smaller rooms.

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: This hostel does not have a social atmosphere at all. I stayed at the 8 bed female dorm that had 2 showers and one toilet in the room. There was no soap in the bathroom!! and there are no lockers. The breakfast was minimum but ok.

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: MIJE is great! Awesome location, beautiful building, really no complaints. The only thing that could have been better was that there are very few outlets because its an old building.

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: The location and building are fabulous but it could not be more minimal on comfort. So, as long as you bring your own water, towels, bathmats, soap, cups, bottle openers and corkscrews and don't mind having no kitchen and no tea or coffee making facilities, then it is fine. The breakfast was good and staff lovely.

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext:
Pros:
Nice and clean courtyard
Breakfast included
Clean bathrooms
Secure luggage storage
Desk staff was quick to help
Great location near the metro

Cons:
No outlets in room except near the shower
No air-conditioning(it was hot in the room!!)
No soap at sinks in room
Showers were not clean
Room was outdated/dirty walls
Wifi barely worked
No lockers in room

Overall: got the job done and was a nice stay but could have been greatly improved with outlets and air conditioning

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: Not a super social hostel, but the rooms were decent and the building beautiful. My bed was very creaky, and lack of lift is difficult when you have to lug large suitcases up a winding staircase. I rated down for the fact that there was not even a fan in the room, and in Paris heat it was genuinely unbearable.

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: Amazing breakfast, lovely rooms, friendly staff, superb location and just all round amazing place. Would 10/10 recommend. Only thing to note is that there were no lockers in the rooms.

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: The location is really great, near grocery, metro and everything around, BUT there's no A/C and no real pillow. It was really hot when I was in Paris, so it was hard to sleep and you only have like a half pillow (a long little thing) so it wasn't super confortable. From August 4 to 8th.

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: This hostel is located in such a great quarter, I spent a whole day just exploring the area. It's extremely safe, too. However, there were no towels and my room was on the top floor with no elevator, which were both pains. No wifi in my room, either. But the courtyard is a great place to sit and catch up on your phone, and the staff were very sweet!

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: Centrally located hostel. Cool building. General atmosphere is very antisocial- I knew going into my stay that it wasn't a party hostel, but the guests were pretty much completely closed off. If you're looking for a relatively inexpensive accommodation in Paris in a well-located part of the city, I would recommend this hostel. If you are looking for friends on the road, look elsewhere.

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext:
This is a nice a quiet hostel. It's in a convenient location close to the river, many cafes, restaurants, shops and sights. Staff is friendly. Rooms are clean and simple.
Something to note: this hostel does not allow guests in their rooms from 12-3pm because of the cleaning people. This wasn't a problem for me, just something to note.

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: Real nice hostel, good location, good staff and good breakfast!

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: The hostel was alright, but it could be great if they had lockers in the rooms, more PowerPoints and not the cheapest toilet paper on earth, apart from that great location and beautiful rooms and stay

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: we had a brialliant time at the Mije, slept well and the staff were very kind and helpful!

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: the place was pretty great but the policy where you cant be in your room between 12-3pm is stupid. I was the only person in my dorm so i didnt want anything cleaned as i had only used my bed, after a 20 hour flight i really needed my rest. Cleaner made a huge fuss and then got a staff member to kick me out. Quite annoying

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: The location is very good, the rooms are okay and the WiFi does not work on the room. No lockers, no kitchen. Breakfast was good and the staff is pretty helpful, but I don't think it's much worth the price

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: Best location,best staff and very clean hostel

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext:
I loved this hostel! It was in such a great location and the front staff were very friendly and helpful. The design of the hostel is very cute and wonderfully set up. The breakfast included was better than I was expecting. The hostel is a 2 minute walk from the Metro and in a good neighbourhood not far from downtown. 
Only wish they had put a power bar in the room since it nly had two outlets for the entire room.

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: Old rooms and very thin mattress. No soap on toilets to wash hands. Very run down

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: The location us phenomenal. 2 minutes walk from the metro, 5 minutes walk from the beautiful island and area Notre Dame is on, 7 minutes walk to Notre Dame. The courtyards in the hostel were beautiful, and there is a supermarket 1 minute walk around the corner. Cannot stress enough how phenomenal the location was. It was super easy to get all around Paris. I was traveling by myself (20 year old American female) and felt completely safe in the hostel and walking back to the hostel late at night.

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: I loved my stay at MIJE. The location was superb and the space itself was so beautiful. Really enjoyed getting to know my fellow travellers in a clean and safe environment, plus getting a free breakfast in the morning was nice (and having it in the pretty inner patio!). Only issue I had was that the toilets are located outside the rooms, and you have to go back into the room to wash your hands in the sink lol. And no hand soap. But overall a really lovely stay! Would totally go back.

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: This is the best hostel I have ever used,love it so much!Good location,friendly staff,free breakfast,nice garden,it's perfect for me!Would love to come back again!

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: The Breakfast was pretty great now that I have a few more hostel stays under my belt. It was fairly clean. I stayed in their dorm style room it would be better with more outlets but over all a good experience.

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: Great hostel in Paris! Great value!

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: The hostel is in a beautiful location and the staff was helpful. I didn't stay for breakfast because I had to leave early in the morning to catch a train, so can't comment on that. Would have liked security lockers and there was no wifi in the rooms.

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: Would not recommend! The hostel cleanliness overall was average, as there were stains on bedsheets ect. The staff were very rude, and very unhelpful. Very unorganised, and didn't care the room I was supposed to stay in was fully occupied (after the checkout time), so my bed wasn't available. When I asked the reception about it, the staff member on didn't seem to care, and didn't know if they were supposed to be checking out or not and got angry at me over it. Not coming back.

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: Such a wonderful hostel! We had a fabulous stay!

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: The place itself was lovely...very french, and the dorm itself was nice enough with only four people in the room. There was no socializing though, so if you're looking for a social element you will not find it here. There were also about 40 tween age kids on what seemed like a school trip...they weren't loud or anything, but for sure not a crowd to mix with if you're looking to meet people and go out. The place itself was very nice though and served a nice breakfast.

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext:
Gorgeous hostel, so handy for the metro. The room only had two sockets between 8 beds (thankfully the room was only half full) and had limited charging points downstairs. 
Staff were nice.

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: Very loud youth hostile. If you are over 21 I wouldn't recommend. Full of highschool kids. And they do not enforced any quite time. So they laugh and yell and scream til the wee hours. Hardly slept.

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: The hostel is nice and clean  but not a very social hostel.

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext:
It's super Parisian! So gorgeous!
The location is perfect!
BUT, it's like they find anything that would make a traveler comfortable and they do the opposite.
-The staff does the bare minimum
-There is no elevator and they don't even offer to help a 90 pound girl with her luggage up to the 4th floor (trust me... it's ALOT)
-There are no outlets in the 5 bed rooms. (Well there's one in the shower room and another one hidden somewhere)
-No Internet
-No pillows
-Check in is ridiculously late

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext:
Awesome location, 10 minutes from Notre Dame and from La Marais district which has all the cool bars, patisseries, shops etc. Also nice rooms with showers in each room.

Downsides were no kitchen (although breakfast provided), slow wifi and the fact it was not a great hostel for meeting new people (e.g. no activity nights, pub crawls etc.) But as I planned to eat out and was staying with friends these downsides were not deal breakers (but I bought a sim), and I would definitely go back.

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: Beautiful hostel, located in a nice area. Rooms are minimalist, but very clean. The hostel has a homely feel to it. The receptionist was very polite and helpful. A big plus is the breakfast served every morning- it was tasty and filling. Only downside is that the WiFi was very slow even in the main lobby area, and virtually non-existent in the room- it would be great if this could be fixed. All in all, I would recommend the place! :)

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext:
Cute little place. No lockers in the room, but had to be buzzed into the main building. They actually have 3 locations, which the site didn't specify so i had to walk to another one. Staff was polite, but not super friendly. Breakfast available. Little on-suite showers were nice. Only a few minutes walk to the metro.

Would stay again, but not really a place to meet people/socialize.

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext:
First, my reservation was shifted to another MIJE place (12, rue de barres) upon arrival. This despite having made a call the night before. The  new place was smaller, building was cramped and had no garden. 2 other mates in the dorm also had same experience, one arrived post midnight.
The management is falsely luring customers with pictures & description of a nice property but asks them to go to a different location. Worse, they do not even inform you the change of place till you arrive.

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: In a awesome place good rooms really good hostel a bit more expensive because of the location

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: Clean hostel and breakfast was decent but not really a friendly atmosphere or a good place to meet other travelers.  Also there are no lockers to lock up valuables

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: Enjoyed my stay. Walking distance to the Notre Dame and other attractions, as well as public transportation. Clean. Stayed in a 10-bed female dorm but it was really 2 areas of 4 beds and another room with 2 so I was very pleased.

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: It was a great hostel, but there was no air conditioning and it was so hot that I didn't sleep at all. Not even fans.

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: The best hostel I've ever stayed in in Paris.

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: Hostel was ideally located, staff were lovely, allowing us to leave our bags before we checked it. Rooms were clean and a decent size, beds comfy, 2 showers per room so no need to queue. Only downfall was the WiFi only works in the common area. Would recommend and would definitely stay again.

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: Friendly staff, central location. The bathrooms are usable but not the best.

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: I stayed in a private room in The Maubuisson building. Not bad, but not amazing. Fantastic location. The room was a little dirty, it looked like the floor hadn't been moped when I checked in. WiFi should be in rooms! Atmosphere pretty terrible with primary school aged kids on a camp. I used the luggage room at the start and end of my stay - I was pleasantly surprised by the security. They asked to see my ID before they unlocked the room. So I felt quite comfortable with my bag left there.

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: Wasn't aware I would be moved to another location 5-10 min away. Wifi wasn't the greatest as I could only use it in the lobby and not my room. Overall it was okay and staff was friendly

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: Just spent one night here, wish we had booked our entire stay here. It was far better than our previous hostel. We were impressed with the charm this hostel had, a very authentic French feel to it. Our room had French doors that when opened, gave a nice view into the street. This hostel is located close to a lot of trendy restaurants as well, which made going out for a bite to eat very convenient. Would definitely stay here again!

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: Perfect location in the heart of Le Marais, nice venue. Unfortunately absolutely no hostel atmosphere: School classes, no drinks allowed although the really nice courtyard would be perfect to meet people. No air con, staff admonished me at breakfast just to have one little baguette when I wanted to take a second. The breakfast is included but not really good considering the price of 40 EUR for a 10 bed dorm. Don't go there as a solo traveller but look for cooler places in the area, which is nice

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson is a fantastic hostel right in the heart of Paris (10 minute walk to Seine) which combines both convenience and luxury which I have never before experienced within a hostel at such a great price. The rooms are pretty standard but they lie within a beautiful old French building and courtyard, the staff were very friendly and multi-lingual and there was no curfew for coming home at night. Overall, I would fully recommend this to anyone looking to explore Paris.

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: GREAT HOSTEL,GREAT LOCATION,GREAT FACILITIES,GREAT WELCOMING

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: I loved staying at MIJE. It's in  a great location, close to Notre Dame, the Seine, the Pantheon, and most importantly, the subway. Also, the neighborhood Le Marais is awesome for walking around. The rooms are clean and confortable (great showers) and the breakfast is good. It was perfect.

name: MIJE Fourcy Fauconnier Maubuisson
reviewtext: My daughter & I stayed in a private room and it was terrific.  The room was clean, had our own private shower and sink, and the location was convenient to get to metro, Siene, and restaurants.  Staff was helpful, breakfast was basic but perfect to start the day. I would stay here again!

name: The Loft Boutique Hostel Paris by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: It's an ok place to stay if you don't plan on spending much time there. Everything was fine, but no better than that.

name: The Loft Boutique Hostel Paris by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
The door lock for the room that I was staying was spoilt. Couldn't tap my card with it. It was a tad troublesome to either knocked the door the get my roommates to open it or got the receptionist to opened it for us. :/ 

Kitchen size is decent. Cat is cute. Got to meet some lovely hostel mates from this hostel! :) 

The blanket given to me was not clean...I was so itchy from the blanket that I scratched myself so badly that my arms, legs and back were red :/

name: The Loft Boutique Hostel Paris by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: The atmosphere isn't great here because you can't bring in your own alcohol, so no one wants to stay at the hostel to drink their expensive alcohol and meet people. I've never had such an antisocial hostel. Otherwise, my stay was great.

name: The Loft Boutique Hostel Paris by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Great little hostel, small but cosy and chilled out. Staff were very helpful and friendly. The location is close to metro and very easy to get to centre of paris and attractions etc. Cant recommend enough, i only booked 1 night out of my stay but wish id booked for longer. Would definitely return

name: The Loft Boutique Hostel Paris by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Great location. But my room was poorly ventilated. And it smelled awful.

name: The Loft Boutique Hostel Paris by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Nice hostel. It takes about 40 mins to get to the Eiffel Tower on the metro - not too bad. The adjacent street has nice food options and a supermarket. Wasn't overly social, but nice and clean.

name: The Loft Boutique Hostel Paris by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: This place has BEDBUGS! Just don't book it. I had stayed at the Generator previously and was accused of bringing them with me when most everyone knows the Generator is one of the cleanest hostels in Paris! The staff did change me from the room but I found another one on my pillow the next morning. Also, the pictures show the place looks bigger than it actually is. The staff also offered to wash some of my clothing but, said it was out of courtesy. I spent the next morning washing myself.

name: The Loft Boutique Hostel Paris by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Good hostel, I didn't spend much time in the hostel tho, I would probably stay here again!

name: The Loft Boutique Hostel Paris by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Too far from town even though it is by the metro station. Wouldn't say it was how they described the area of Paris. Clean and tidy hostel though

name: The Loft Boutique Hostel Paris by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Was great place to stay with a lot of Asian restaurants near by & close to the metro. We arrived with a booking of a mixed  dorm room & were upgraded to a twin room ( WAS GREAT:) !! ) great place to stay would recommend, although a solo female traveller may want to look else where as I found walking back at night to the hostel from the metro a slight bit scary ( NOT THE HOSTELS FAULT) great place despite this & enjoyed the stay

name: The Loft Boutique Hostel Paris by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
Overall very good hostel. It is a 5 minute walk to the metro station and anywhere from 10 minutes to 30 minutes to get to any of the main attractions by metro from there. 
The staff was very friendly and helpful, every thing was clean and I felt safe. The chairs in the main patio area aren't the most comfortable but otherwise it's a good atmosphere to be in. I would stay here again if I came back to Paris!

name: The Loft Boutique Hostel Paris by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Clean and nice hostel, friendly staff.

name: The Loft Boutique Hostel Paris by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: The hostel was clean and the beds were comfy. Lockers were a bit small but not a major problem. However, we arrived about 11pm. The area doesn't feel at all safe and is a long way from the city centre. When we arrived the guy on the front desk barely said hello and was not at all welcoming. Safe to say we both felt very unsafe on our first night. There was a timetable of 'events' for each night but they were poorly organised so no one actually went to them. As a result the atmosphere was dull.

name: The Loft Boutique Hostel Paris by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: I had a great stay! One of the best hostels I've ever stayed in!

name: The Loft Boutique Hostel Paris by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Staff were super friendly and helpful. Relaxed And quiet atmosphere away from the busy city centre. Really happy to stay here. I would definitely come back.

name: The Loft Boutique Hostel Paris by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Very clean and quiet. Great if you want a place to relax like I did. If you you're looking to party there's probably better options. It's in Chinatown and not much going on in area but 5 min walk to 2 metro stations so no issue getting into city.

name: The Loft Boutique Hostel Paris by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Really loved Belleville to see a different side of Paris outside of the super touristy spots! The girl that checked me in didn't seem to know much about the area and things to do, but she did give me a complimentary map. Really clean rooms for the most part, but the inside handle of my bathroom had some crusted remains of what might have been gum. Decent kitchen space, though the hot plates weren't working when I was there. They have some planned activities in the evening which could be fun.

name: The Loft Boutique Hostel Paris by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
LOVE LOVE LOVE! This was our first stop and it definitely set the bar high for other locations. 
Staff is super friendly and helpful. Our room got upgraded for some reason, no complaints there! Rooms were cleaned daily, and the space was very trendy. Didn't get to spend much time at the hostel, but it seemed like there were a couple of other travelers, ages 20-30.

name: The Loft Boutique Hostel Paris by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Nice hostel with a great friendly staff. Guests were a bit loud but young people generally are. But that being said, it was close to the metro so being far was not an issue. The neighborhood is awfully dirty and not completely safe to walk around late at night alone. A couple women and I were walking home from the metro and were stalked but the gentleman at the reception at the hostel took care of it. That being said, the price is excellent for Paris but you're far away from touristy places.

name: The Loft Boutique Hostel Paris by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: As its name indicates, this is a small hostel and so everything in it is on the small side as well (kitchen, rooms, bathrooms etc), however this is not a major problem. All the rooms come with their own bathrooms, which is definitely better than using communal bathrooms. It is located a bit of a distance from the city centre, but is close to metro stations so it is easy to travel around Paris from. The staff could be a bit more proactive, as I was not told the WiFi password until the second day.

name: The Loft Boutique Hostel Paris by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Was told there was a stove to be used in the kitchen for food so I bought some food to cook only to find out by another receptionist that it was broken and not working. They have nice computers however they barely even work. Other then those issues however, rooms were nice and tidy and fairly spacious. Beds a bit small but still comfy. Kitchen was nice and clean as well.

name: The Loft Boutique Hostel Paris by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: I had a great stay at the Loft! The staff were super helpful, the rooms were clean and there were lockers in all of the rooms. The hostel cat is super cute too. Although I didn't spend much time hanging out but there were activities each night that seemed like fun. As a young woman travelling alone I felt safe at the hostel and I had a really great stay.

name: The Loft Boutique Hostel Paris by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Not too sure why it we got a free upgrade from an 8 bed to a 2 bed private room which was a lovely surprise:) the staff were great and we could hold our bags for as long as we needed on check out day so we pick ours up at around 10:30pm. The hostel offers lots of facilities and different events each night which you can get involved in if you want. The hostel is in a very cultural location situated 2 mins away from China town

name: The Loft Boutique Hostel Paris by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Fantastic Hostel. I wish the bathroom and he lockers were just a little bit larger. Our backpacks did not fit in the locker. I also wish there was more comfortable seating outside in the courtyard.

name: The Loft Boutique Hostel Paris by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Switched to the Loft after a horrible hostel experience in Montmartre. I should have stayed here from the beginning of my trip. The staff is amazing and attentive (Hiurma is super kind and cool and Matthieu saved my life when I accidentally injured myself and offered to take me to the hospital). The communal spaces make interacting with other guests easy and the kitchen is super convenient. Belleville is my favorite neighborhood in Paris and the Loft is super well located. Will stay again.

name: The Loft Boutique Hostel Paris by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Nice hostel with a location that is either good or bad depending on what you like: Cool if you like alternative and diverse neighborhoods, not cool if you are looking for the romantic fantasy of Paris (is there people still doing that?)...

name: The Loft Boutique Hostel Paris by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
A generally decent, nothing special but it isn't bad by any means. Although if you're on a top bunk bed there's a chance you could fall out if yours isn't against the wall. 
The location is okay but fairly far away. As I said, not amazing but not bad either.

name: The Loft Boutique Hostel Paris by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: If you're an early riser, (is   REALLY early for a traveler?????) consider somewhere else.  There's one early morning staff member who won't let you into the communal room until 7.30.  The coffee's made, the room is empty....... I asked him why?  But some reply: that's the rule.  Funny how I'm allowed in when other staff member have the early morning shift.  Otherwise a decent place.  This guy has gotta take a course on customer service - or look for another job....

name: The Loft Boutique Hostel Paris by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Stayed there for 3 nights, good value and clean...nice Asian food places around...

name: The Loft Boutique Hostel Paris by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Add air con in rooms, stay need to be nicer, lower the price as it's definitely not worth the prices we paid

name: The Loft Boutique Hostel Paris by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Great hostel, clean and in a really nice (not touristy) area of Paris. Only complaint is the low quality beds which gave us some back pain. Also there isn't a laundry.

name: The Loft Boutique Hostel Paris by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
Everything is Good But on the first day you had CUT one night price, And the receptionist told me After maximum two days we will return this money to your card ..,But until now i Can not see that money in my account!! 
Thanx.
Mohnd arf skr

name: The Loft Boutique Hostel Paris by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: I had a ground floor room, which I appreciate.  Everything was OK.

name: The Loft Boutique Hostel Paris by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Good hostel. Location is in Chinatown which is cool but about at least 15-20 min metro to most tourist spots. Laundry is offsite. It is clean with friendly staff, and nice courtyard. Go to Wenzhou for Chinese food!!

name: The Loft Boutique Hostel Paris by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: I really liked it there. Very secure lockers, nice staff, great drink prices. One negative is that the hostel has a cat that is all over the place including all over the dishes in the kitchen.

name: The Loft Boutique Hostel Paris by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: It was a great authentic experience. I enjoyed everything the hostel offered. The place was always neat, calm, and clean.

name: The Loft Boutique Hostel Paris by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: This location is a little far from the center, but the metro is very close and can get you around.  The security lockers we're small (can't fit a carry-on sized backpack) hence the lower security rating I gave. I never felt unsafe though. No outside alcohol but they have social events and reasonable priced bar.

name: The Loft Boutique Hostel Paris by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
It's in china town but only a 5 minute walk to the metro and the 11 runs directly to ChÃ¢talet near all of the museums in the heart of Paris. 

The bunk beds are squeaky so it's very easy to disturb your roommates if you wake up early or come back late.

There is no air conditioning so if you're on the top floor in the middle of summer, like I was, prepare to be pretty sweaty because the fan they gave us did not cool the room down enough.

Very safe and well priced

name: The Loft Boutique Hostel Paris by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: I loved the courtyard communal atmosphere at the loft and the kitchen was nice. Breakfast very overpriced so we didn't eat it at the hostel. Staff friendly and the desk manned 24hrs. The hostel cat is lovely, came into our room and slept on my bed with us for a while!! Belleville is a nice area of Paris, and only a short metro ride from the centre. I recommend a stay here.

name: The Loft Boutique Hostel Paris by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
The staff were incredibly helpful and available 24/7, the security is solid, and the neighborhood is charming.
I wish that they had available on-site laundry, but they did provide a map to other laundromats in the neighborhood.

name: The Loft Boutique Hostel Paris by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: A bit far from everything. Otherwise a good place. Bathroom and shower in the room. Small rooms.

name: The Loft Boutique Hostel Paris by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Great hostel in a good location. Clean and modern rooms and good facilities. No complaints here :)

name: The Loft Boutique Hostel Paris by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: My friend and I stayed here in July and enjoyed our stay here. The hostel was clean and secure, with helpful staff. Rooms with en suite bathrooms (we did have a funny smell in our bathroom, not sure what to attribute it to.) Kitchenette and lounge area small but well equipped and clean. Great location and close to transport links. Highly recommend a look around the famous Pere Lachaise cemetery nearby. The hostel was good value and highly recommended (plus a cute resident cat called Espiga)

name: The Loft Boutique Hostel Paris by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Overall really great place! 10 min walk to underground, short ride into city center. Beautiful view of the city from the park just around the corner from the hostel. Staff was super helpful with anything you needed, directions, printing boarding passes for flights, etc. Clean rooms with an en suite bathroom & shower. Rooms on the second floor do get pretty hot in the summer months, but they provided a really powerful fan which helped (still pretty hot though). But would definitely stay again !!

name: The Loft Boutique Hostel Paris by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Brilliant first night on our travels - got upgraded from a room of 8 to 4 and all rooms very clean. Staff very efficient and friendly and allowed us to check in early. The kitchen was well equipped and also very clean.

name: The Loft Boutique Hostel Paris by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: It's very close to the metro, that's an advantage. However, the washroom was tiny and not really that clean. I felt I paid a lot for a stay in a hostel.

name: The Loft Boutique Hostel Paris by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Great staff, beautiful spot and interesting travelers!

name: The Loft Boutique Hostel Paris by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Too far from central Paris and paid way too much for what what I received.

name: The Loft Boutique Hostel Paris by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Really fun hostel. It's tough to find things in Paris this time of year so this place was great value for the money they charged.

name: The Loft Boutique Hostel Paris by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Very laid back and pleasant hostel. Every bed has a locker in each room, so very secure. We were four in a 6 bedroom dorm, and our four beds were secluded in a smaller sub-room, which was great . Very good vibes, and near a beautiful park. Location is in Chinatown - a more edgy part of the city - but certainly not hard to get in to the center. I would happily stay again.

name: The Loft Boutique Hostel Paris by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: I would reccomend this hostel to a friend. I felt safe and comfortable. Belleville is a little out of town but it's still a very nice area that you probably wouldn't get to see if you were staying clothed to the river. It's walkable to nortredame etc but there is also a metro that takes about 6 mins

name: The Loft Boutique Hostel Paris by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
We booked this place last minute and stayed in a 4 bedroom dorm. Its a small hostel and our room was really tiny but it was fine. We loved the location -belleville is a really cool area with a lot happening. The hostel staff were friendly and helpful and overall I'd stay again. However the hostel preauthorised my booking and after a week the money still hasn't cleared. May have to email them about this soon. 
Also there are no elevators and we were charged for printing. But overall good hostel.

name: The Loft Boutique Hostel Paris by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Lovely hostel with a good atmosphere and range of guests. Bar onsite with happy hour was a hit! Great location surrounded by bars and shops but don't try to walk to the Eiffel Tower and other tourist destinations-it's very far! Cheap and easy to grab the metro from nearby for sightseeing.

name: The Loft Boutique Hostel Paris by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Nice little place, easy to get to and from but can take some time to get into the centre of Paris. Ended up being put in a private after booking a dorm at no extra cost so can't complain!

name: The Loft Boutique Hostel Paris by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Stayed for just one night, friendly staff and really nice room! Also in a cool neighborhood and right next to the metro.

name: Perfect Hostel
reviewtext: The big issue was the toilet, it is very small more than your imagination

name: Perfect Hostel
reviewtext:
First of all - the location is amazing! The room was okay, a bit dusty though.The security system was okay too-but there were no locks on the boxes where you keep your belongings in the room+there was free access to the baggage room,didn't feel safe.
The bad part was stuff.On the very first day my phone died and i asked the guy at the reception what was the day off for the Louvre - he looked at me like like i was stupid, said he didn't know and said to google. No hint of trying to help.not nice(

name: Perfect Hostel
reviewtext: I loved my stay here the woman at reception was lovely, helpful, and very pleasant. The whole hostel was clean and my room was spacious, light and clean, I had a very comfortable bed with a clean towel given to me every day. I loved the breakfast very traditional. The only thing was that there was no basin in the toilet only in my room. But overall I loved my stay here and it's not to far from the Paris attractions by subway I'll definitely stay here again thanks Perfect Hostel.

name: Perfect Hostel
reviewtext: Great stay in paris.It is over a km walk from Paris Nord . Otherwise easily accessible by metro to all the tourist spots.

name: Perfect Hostel
reviewtext:
Staff was consistently helpful. 
Everything was fine. 
The only tiny issue for me was that they close the kitchen and lobby area at night - maybe around midnight or a bit before - so there was nowhere to eat food or talk once they did that.

name: Perfect Hostel
reviewtext:
Hostel had kitchen in ground floor.
My first night I ate something at kitchen after 11pm, I didn't make any messy, Was ok however in my second night I went to the kitchen around 11.10pm and the receptionist didn't alone me to eat, he said was to late to use the kitchen,  this let me furious!!!! I argued with him, I was hungry I had my food and I couldn't eat!!!! What was ridiculous!!! I don't back for this hostel neither recommend for nobody

name: Perfect Hostel
reviewtext: It was very nice, clean place. The manager was very helpful, kind and resourceful. She helped us in transportation and other activities. Our room was very nice and clean. We got free towels everyday and room service. The location was great, very close to the bus stop and the underground. If I go to paris I will use it again and I will recommend to others

name: Perfect Hostel
reviewtext: The staff were nice, the rooms were clean and the brekky was simple but very nice. The only thing is our room was boiling hot and there aren't many showers and toilets. Overall a nice experience.

name: Perfect Hostel
reviewtext: We checked out, however the forth person in our room said we could leave our stuff with her stuff because we were going to the catacombs. When we got back there had taken all of our stuff in the entire room and placed it by the front desk. Including our roommates things who was staying longer. She then presumed to blame us for this awkward situation saying that it was our fault that we even had to have this conversation because we left our stuff there. Very unprofessional.

name: Perfect Hostel
reviewtext:
The best location in Paris. It feels like a very safe area and is very central. Great transport links.
The hostel itself is clean and tidy. Breakfast, towels and room lockers are a free bonus. 
The only thing that could be improved was toilets/showers - very tiny and no sink. The sink was in the room, but it means you have to walk back to your room to wash your hands.

name: Perfect Hostel
reviewtext: Great location close to metro stations, 10 minutes walk from Gare du Nord station, and very close to the Montmartre area, beware of con-artists and pickpockets there though. Good security, key cards to get into rooms and good sized lockers. Breakfast was pretty basic but at least it was free. The dining/seating area would close around 11, so nowhere to chat after that. Showers needed to be cleaned more regularly as often were dirty/hair on floor etc.

name: Perfect Hostel
reviewtext: Great base for exploring Paris. 5 min from Sacre Couer, metro station nearby, and a cute neighborhood with plenty of food options. The rooms were a bit small, but since we were gone all day and only used them to sleep they were perfect.

name: Perfect Hostel
reviewtext: A bit far from all the sites but it was close to a train station at least. There was no air conditioning so it got quite hot at night. Provided a towel which was nice but my keycard stopped working multiple times and had to get it fixed at front desk. Everything else was fine.

name: Perfect Hostel
reviewtext: I arrived late due to a delayed train but they had no problem still checking me in. Security was good, with each room needing a key card to get in. Sheets were decent, and the ensuite was very clean. Perfect for my one night stay!

name: Perfect Hostel
reviewtext: Very nice place and a good location. Breakfast was great. I just wish there was air conditioning

name: Perfect Hostel
reviewtext: Dirty. Uncomfortable facility. Unfriendly night islamic male staff

name: Perfect Hostel
reviewtext: The staff was super nice and helpful. Everything was perfect for the price! Nice location near the metro. Free wifi. Free breakfast. Loved it so much and would definitely wanna come back. I recommend this place so much!

name: Perfect Hostel
reviewtext: Good location, nice staff and free breakfast!

name: Perfect Hostel
reviewtext: One toilet of each of the six floors, two showers on every other floor.  Said we were arriving at noon and nowhere on the website did it say check in wasn't until 2pm.  Had to leave stuff in an unlocked luggage room.  Two outlets in the room and only one of them worked.  Fan didn't help at all.  There is an elevator, it was broken when we went, I suspect that it never actually gets fixed.  Had to climb 6 flights of stairs to get to room.  Would not recommend for the price.

name: Perfect Hostel
reviewtext: The receptionist made this place, so welcoming and lovely. We had a nice, light twin room with a city view. Decent free breakfast every morning. Good location, lots to do near, with  easy access to metro and international station. Only minor downside was the showers were not on our floor, but that's just me being lazy as there's also a lift. Would recommend and stay again x

name: Woodstock Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: One of a kind hostel! Definetely worth staying. Probably not the most modern one but very cozy!

name: Woodstock Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: This place was a nice quiet place. My brother and I got a private room and it was smaller than I expected and there wasn't a lot to it. But it had a nice feel to it. I felt it was a little overpriced for what I got but close to gare du nord which was nice.

name: Woodstock Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: The manager/owner was amazing but everyone else was just ok or not

name: Woodstock Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: easy to access wonderful, polite and helpful staff with excellent English - great value for money

name: Woodstock Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Really lovely little hostel.  5 mins walk from a metro stop and right in Montmartre anyway.  Staff were lovely and facilities were all clean and easily accessible: kitchen has loads of pans and plates, as well as kettle, fridge, hot plate, microwave etc.   At first it did seem quite quiet compared to other hostels I've been to but actually I think this was just because it is smaller, which turned out to be a really lovely place to stay in.  Would highly recommend to anyone!

name: Woodstock Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: I loved Woodstock! Quirky atmosphere, most of the staff are really kind and helpful, free breakfast with delicious orange juice, coffee, tea, croissants and some cereal. No AC which got pretty steamy during the day and at night if it wasn't a cool night or if you have to close the window because of loud neighbors. A sweet outdoor patio, clean enough bathrooms, great location (5 min walk to metro) and great price! No security lockers in the room, but they're free and secure in the lobby.

name: Woodstock Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: The hostel is good, but it has two serius problem. First of all, the staff is bad and the people at the reception know English badly. Then, each floor has just one wc and one shower. However, the location is not bad and it was clean.

name: Woodstock Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
No cold water in tap, could not fill water bottles. Very hot, no AC, no fan in room
Comfortable bed, great staff, great location

name: Woodstock Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Close to station which was nice once arriving in Paris . Rooms quite cramped and no proper ac . This is a small hostel which is quite quiet at night which is good . The breakfast was fairly good and was included in price of room. Would stay again for 1 night but probably not more. Staff were friendly and laid back and beer was fairly cheap .

name: Woodstock Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
Good price.

Not allowed to bring drinks from outside (super downer).

Not allowed to smoke (downer).

1 bathroom per floor, with the toilet and the shower in separated places. For those who like to poo before showering, that's also a downer

name: Woodstock Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Very good for the price. It is very close to the Anvers metro station, so it is easy to go anywhere from there. As a solo female traveler, I felt safe during my whole trip. Very clean. Breakfast is OK, very light but it is like this anywhere in France. I did not had to use the kitchen but I checked around, it is small but functionable. The only downside was that it was very hot. It was 35 degrees and I was on the third floor. They added a second fan on the next day, which was really apprecited.

name: Woodstock Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: I was not happy with our stay here at all. The staff was incredibly rude, we were not told prior to arriving there that we would NOT be receiving our own room key, and our room was essentially a shoebox with absolutely no ventilation so get ready to sweat your ass off.  The room key issue pissed me off the most, as our roommate was off with the key and kept us out of our room when we were tired and just wanted to get in the room.

name: Woodstock Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Pretty nice hostel! They have a really weird drinking policy which is hard to understand but basically you buy their overpriced beers behind the counter or you can't drink alcohol in the lobby. The cat is cute, the place has a lot of character, it has access to the metro but the closest one to bring you to central Paris is a solid 15 minute walk away. Read up on the policies because they're kind of ridiculous at times.

name: Woodstock Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Nice place to stay-everything was clean and functional and there was a shower and toilet on each floor. Staff were friendly and helpful. Only complaint is that there was a very loud garbage truck that came crashing by at about 6:30 every morning. Not the hostel's fault but something to consider if you want quality sleep.

name: Woodstock Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: I say don't go in summer time. There is no air conditioning in the rooms it's like a sauna in the rooms. It would be a great hostel during the winter or spring, but definitely not summer time. Otherwise it's a great hostel in a very ideal area of Paris.

name: Woodstock Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Nice and clean hostel in a good location. Great breakfast included. The lady on reception was really kind. Only downside was that the room was incredibly hot. Some pedestal fans in the rooms that don't switch off every couple of hours would make the world of difference.

name: Woodstock Montmartre by Hiphophostels
