reviewtext: Great location. The room lock out was slightly disruptive - even if we didn't want our rooms cleaned we still had to leave the room. Staff were friendly. Breakfast was basic but nice. Shower on our floor was poor - we had to use the showers on other floors. Overall good stay.

name: Woodstock Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: I came to Paris for Lollapalooza and was in the hostel only at night. I did not see many people in the common area during the breakfast time even though the hostel was full. This is the only issue that seemed weird. Possibly that's the thing about Paris - travelers have other stuff to do. Location (super safe - important in Paris!! and close to metro), safety, free lockers, luggage storage, breakfast (croissant and baguette -  sooo yamm), staff, cleanliness, mattresses - everything was perfect.

name: Woodstock Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Everything about this hostel is great, as long as you're not looking for a super social hostel.  The kitchen area closes at midnight and the courtyard closes even earlier, 10pm.  They are pretty strict with the rules around the hostel, which is nice in some ways but definitely makes it hard to make friends at times.  Everything else about the hostel is great for the money you're paying.

name: Woodstock Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
Kitchen had the weirdest smell. I saw people cleaning it but wouldn't want to cook there. I just made sandwiches and got out.
The staff was typically French:cold but helpful when they needed to be.
Great location outside of the city center. Montmartre is awesome and the hostel is very close to the metro!
Lockers available in the lobby for valuables but I didn't see any lockers for bigger luggage. I felt like my stuff was safe in the dorms.

name: Woodstock Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: The hostel was well organized, it was a little out of the way but very close to a metro station. The metro wasn't always direct where I wanted to go. Staff was great, room was private and clean. They kept my luggage the day I checked out for no problem.

name: Woodstock Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Was only here one night but had a great time. Atmosphere was a bit dull on the night I spent there and reception lacked a smile (still had an efficient check-in/out though). Otherwise breakfast was good enough for me, rooms and bathrooms were clean so I was happy to stay. Amazing building with some cool decor and great location!

name: Woodstock Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Great place, lovely staff and even comes with a cat (named Jesus) ðŸ‘ would stay again

name: Woodstock Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Good value for money, location is great (close to Gare du Nord and to metro), nice place.

name: Woodstock Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Great place to spend a night or two. There's ample security and a friendly staff. It is a little bit away from the closest metro, but honestly that's not a big issue. They're aren't any outlets by the beds and the lockers are only large enough to fit small valuables (passport, camera, small tablet).

name: Woodstock Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: I hope I'll write his name correctly :) Evan who is a staff is so friendly and helpful. Thank you !

name: Woodstock Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Very helpful staff who gave us recommendations and directions. Had a quiet laid back atmosphere. Only downside was a strange odor coming from the bathroom at all times and the free breakfast was a bit too light.

name: Woodstock Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Lovely little hostel in central Paris with an intimate vibe. Fully functioning kitchen with hob. Cute cat called JesusðŸ± breakfast included which was nice :-)

name: Woodstock Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Accommodations could be better. Can't be in rooms 11am-2pm because of cleaning. There are no lock boxes in the rooms. Only 1 luggage room on bottom floor. No air conditioning. 1 bathroom and 1 shower per floor. The hostel cat looks like it needs to be fed more. Breakfast in morning is limited. Not in the best of areas.

name: Woodstock Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: I had a good stay at this small but nice hostel. The free breakfast was decent and the bed made for a good sleep (slept in a 4-bed dorm). Rooms were really hot, but then again it was 30+ outside... Kitchen was basic but clean, as were the room, toilets & common areas. Great with a free safety box! I did not appreciate that you had to be out of the room between 11-14 when cleaning was ongoing. Close to the Metro. Very friendly staff!

name: Woodstock Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Great location in Montmartre, not a lot of communal space, kitchen pretty bare bones, but great for a place to crash in a good location. Staff was excellent and everyone loves a free breakfast.

name: Woodstock Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Hostel is ok for the price, but it could be cleaner and have a space with a coach for relaxing time. The shower could improve too.

name: Woodstock Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Definitely not a party hostel. Our stay was ok

name: Woodstock Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Good hostel, it's cute and definitely has a cool vibe, like they've been doing this for a while. Kitchen is okay at best. There are lots of steep stairs and no elevator. Very small safes that are in the main reception area and only one bathroom and shower per floor, which did not seem like enough. It's super close to SacrÃ©-CÅ“ur

name: Woodstock Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: friendly and helpful staff. Pleasant one night stay. So close to the SacrÃ©-Coeur that I couldn't fail to visit including the dome after a 300 stone steps up. Fantastic and clear 360 degrees view from there. I enjoyed the fancy indoor decoration too.

name: Woodstock Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Don't go in summer. There are no fans in the rooms and it is so very hot. It was hard for me to sleep because it was so hot. Hostel was ok. Location to train station was the best reason to stay. Cheap and worth the money in that regard.

name: Woodstock Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: This hostel was in a great location. It was within walking distance to a ton of sites and the metro and bus stations. There are great restaurants and a grocery store nearby too. The common areas and breakfast made it easy to meet other people. The only thing to be aware of is that the security lockers are very small, but you can at least leave your passport in it. It can also be loud at night, but if you close the window that helps a lot with the noise!

name: Woodstock Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Overall, the staff was friendly the minute we walked in. They were very helpful when it came to recommending sites, restaurants and best form of transportation. It is centralized to major monuments, will have to walk a little, but worth the sites.

name: Woodstock Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Everything is okay expect to kitchen.

name: Hotel Andre Gill
reviewtext: Given the price a great choice if you're just looking for a place to use as a base to explore from. Not the best choice if you want to spend much time in the room. Only serious suggestion for improvement would be to hang up full size curtain in our room (24). There simply was not enough coverage but overall very happy with the place

name: Hotel Andre Gill
reviewtext: Everything in the room was broken , toilet, sink, shower, door.

name: Hotel Andre Gill
reviewtext: Was more of a hotel than hostel. So not really an "atmosphere" which is fine- especially cause the Montmartre, the suburb which the hotel lies, is really buzzing. Super cool area with lots of places to eat. Staff friendly and room was cleaned daily.

name: Le Village Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: This hostel was clean. Small lockers in the rooms. There is an outside terrace which is a decent spot to meet other travelers. Location is about a 5 minute walk to the Sacre cour basilica, watch out for scammers and pickpockets! Breakfast was not included and was 6â‚¬ for croissants, bread and coffee. I think slightly overpriced for what the hostel offers but definitely wasn't a bad stay.

name: Le Village Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Lovely friendly staff and super close to SacrÃ© CÅ“ur. Everything you need for self catering.

name: Le Village Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: I'd say this is one of the better hostels in the Paris. It's near Pigalle (a happening neighbourhood) and reasonably priced. Bathrooms and rooms are reasonably clean, albeit a little small. The staff was friendly. It's not really a party/socializing place and there weren't many activities to meet other travellers.

name: Le Village Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Great atmosphere lovely staff. Awesome location in Montmartre, which is the best neighborhood to stay in

name: Le Village Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: My room was infested with bed bugs. The room had a strong musty odor, the sheets had brown spots/stains, and when I got up in the middle of the night to go to the bathroom, I saw 2 bed bugs crawling on the bed. The receptionist Rafael was prompt and professional in helping me find a new room and recommending nearby laundromats. Sheets in the new room also had brown spots. I spoke with the manager who issued a refund for my stay. Even without bed bugs, this hostel is overpriced. Terrace is nice.

name: Le Village Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
It is a really nice hostel and it is in a convenient location. 
Bathroom was always clean but had a particular smell. 
I wish there were individual plugd and lights for each bed.
ðŸ˜€

name: Le Village Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: The rooms were a decent size, however the lock on the bathroom didn't lock.

name: Le Village Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Loved this hostel! The staff was very friendly and helpful, and you couldn't find a better location!

name: Le Village Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Very cozy hostel, nice atmosphere and absolutely lovely staff! Only stayed for one night but really enjoyed it. Luggage storage was good and secure after checking out x

name: Le Village Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: The place was pretty good! But the toilets in our room smelt horrible and so did the drain in the shower. The patio area is amazing and great place to socialize!

name: Le Village Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Wouldn't recommend it, friendly staff, but not impressed with the rest of the place.

name: Le Village Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
A good stay. Very close to MontMatre barely 10 minutes walk. 

Lovely friendly staff sadly had to make our own beds and also lack of bed lamps and privacy curtains. A good budget experience and well located for Anvers metro. 

Very helpful staff who helped us get a taxi too after a tiring day.

Needs wholecase lockers as a small locker is not sufficient for travellers...

name: Le Village Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Really great place with nice friendly staff. It was located like 3 mins walk from the SacrÃ© Coeur and you could easily get to the city of Paris by metro. It was a bit noisy because our studio flat was on position near the road. Would definitely recommend as it was such good value for money.

name: Le Village Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
This is a great no frills kind of hostel. Close to the main station and located along the main "sex" strip, the action is never too far away. 

The common area is an awesome place to meet other hostel stayers and there is air conditioning in the rooms which was great given how hot it was!!

The staff are super friendly and the rooms were clean and got cleaned regularly. Lockers are provided so your valuables can remain safe. 

Really enjoyed my stay here

name: Le Village Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: We loved this hostel. The location was fantastic - right in the heart of Montmartre. It has a great patio with a phenomenal view of Sacre Couer. It's connected to a bar which hosts pub crawls a few times a week. The hostel lets you lock up your things if you arrive early. We stayed in a private room for two people - the rooms are small but clean and they have hotel key-access. The showers were barely big enough to turn around in, that was our only complaint.

name: Le Village Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Great place to stay. Would come back if had to again

name: Le Village Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Amazing location, very quiet, small dorms, really clean, gorgeous terrace overlooking the street. No complaints!

name: Le Village Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
Excellent location, easy to get to the subway (metro), 2 small grocery stores mere steps away, many small shops and restaurants nearby.
Great staff, very helpful people.
Room 107, off the terrace, had no noise problems at all.  A nice sized room with space to put down luggage.  Small toilet and shower rooms, but typical in Europe.  Would have liked a shelf in the bathroom to put down glasses and phone without them having risk of falling on the floor.
Terrace was small but useful.

name: Le Village Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Couldn't be happier that I spent my only night in Paris here! Fantastic location next to metro, park and less touristy area. Took the metro to get everywhere. Staff was super friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay again, the private room was great!

name: Le Village Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Long story short: we didn't stay at Le Village because they lied to us about electrical problems and moved us to a "sister hostel" down the street. When I called later to find out exactly what those electrical problems were the receptionist told us he was unaware of any problems and they were fully booked. The hostel we were moved to didn't have air con (why i booked Le Village) and we ended up getting a refund and moving to a completely different hostel the next day.

name: Le Village Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Great location, friendly and knowledgeable staff, nice kitchen, comfortable beds, clean rooms, cool terrace area. All-around great vibe.

name: Le Village Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: I really liked this hostel.  The location is great.  Clean.  Friendly staff and travelers.  Highly recommend.

name: Le Village Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Fantastic hostel for solo travelers especially, as the roof terrace was a great, chill spot to meet people. The rooms were well kept, and the air conditioning worked very well. The lockers in the rooms were small enough for only a book bag, and there were no outlets next to the beds. One of my favorite stays ever in a hostel.

name: Le Village Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: The staff were amazing always willing to help and  always went the extra mile providing cheese and wine nights and extras. The location is perfect in a lovely village all attractions are easily accesssble supermarkets and restraunts all so close. Overall perfect hostel for a trip to Paris

name: Le Village Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Awesome location, very relaxed atmosphere. The hostel is located directly below the steps to the Sacre-Coeur and within easy walking distance to the Maison Rouge area. The hostel provides clean, bright rooms â€” with air conditioning â€” and a nice outdoor patio area that makes for a good break from the busy streets around the hostel. Though there's an associated bar beside the hostel, it was very calm and less social when I was there.

name: Le Village Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: when I checked in early I asked to use a bathroom to freshen up. All they had was a closet with a toilet and no sink! So I had to wash my hands in the kitchen sink which is not sanitary, and no option to wash my face or have a quick shower, which most hostels allow you to do. In the room I was in there were four beds and 3 outlets and all were low, so being on the top bunk I had no way to securely charge my devices and no light for reading.

name: Le Village Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Amazing hostel, it's just a bit noisy during the nights.

name: Le Village Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: This is probably the cleanest hostel I've stayed at. It felt very professional but still casual. There's a decent-sized common area to eat or just chill, and the bar next door is fun to go to at night, if you're not feeling up to venturing out too far. You are walking distance from the Sacre-Coeur (I had a beautiful view of it right from my room's window!) and in the middle of the Montmartre area, a very artsy/hip area. I would stay here again!

name: Le Village Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: The hostel was great, and clean and close to everything

name: Le Village Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Great in every way, but approx a 1hr walk to the Seine and all main attractions

name: Le Village Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Good place to stay. Not so busy and loud. Very clean. Great location.

name: Le Village Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: My room had bed bugs and I had a severe allergic reaction. The staff denied they had a bed bug problem and only vacuumed the bed and did not give me another room so I couldn't sleep the whole night as I refused to sleep on the bed. I will never stay in a hostel again.

name: Le Village Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Great Location and they have a very nice Kitchen.

name: Le Village Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Well situated in a good location near Sacre Couer. Well-stocked kitchen with lots of space and fridge. Staff friendly. Accommodation was basic, relatively small living space. Small lockers in room not large enough for large backpack, although you can keep luggage in luggage room downstairs. Not much of a hostel vibe here, occasionally some people would be hanging out in reception or the attached bar. Worked as a basic place to rest my head, would consider staying again.

name: Le Village Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Staff very friendly. Good atmosphere. Common  room was great for relaxing and watching the football on tv. Room was big enough. Bathroom was small but clean. As for the location, the area immediately surrounding the hostel is fine, lots going on - supermarket etc, but walking to the metro (5 mins or less depending on what station) was a bit undesirable and seedy. It's fine, but late at night I would be a bit nervous. But, I have to say I found that to be the case in Paris generally.

name: Le Village Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
Had a brilliant one-night stay at Le Village Hostel.  Lovely room on the 3rd floor, cool and spotlessly clean, good shower, comfy bed, kettle with tea/coffee, large opening windows out to front street.  Left my bag for free during the day.

Staff were really friendly and helpful.  The place had a lift which was great.  Only one thing - bar down stairs was very noisy at night but I had earplugs so was ok.  Would highly recommend!

name: Le Village Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Great. Loved the deluxe room on the terrace! Loved the air con even more.

name: Le Village Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: It took an hour and a bit to walk to the Eiffel Tower but the location was still very nice. It wasn't crowded by tourists and felt a little bit closer to local Paris. The staff were lovely and the rooms were great, clean and comfortable. Very happy with this hostel!

name: Le Village Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: The staff here are amazing! Just wanted to say thanks so much for helping me so much! The location is great! I don't know why reviews say the hostel is in a sketchy location, that's just how Montmartre looks: a beautiful old neglected woman. If you get a room facing the back, you get the most amazing view of Sacre Coeur. The rooms are small, but clean and adequate. They're all ensuite. Bring a lock from the room lockers but they have small coin ones in the lobby. Great hostel! Would stay again!

name: Le Village Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Great hostel, clean and have everything. The staff is nice and friendly. I totally recommend this hostel.

name: Le Village Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Really cute hostel in a lovely neighbourhood. Staff was always nice and helpful, but I didn't find much social atmosphere there. The common area could be better and more inviting.

name: Le Village Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Clean, comfortable, great atmosphere and great value for money. Staff very friendly and knowledgable. Located 5 minutes from the SacrÃ©-CÅ“ur and most places within a walking distance.

name: Hotel Montmartre Clignancourt
reviewtext:
Great. Particular shout out to the staff, who were exceptionally helpful when I had an issue with the booking and to change room.

Rooms are small but functional, cosy and clean. Excellent boulangerie downstairs and supermarket next door.

name: Hotel Montmartre Clignancourt
reviewtext: Located at the edge of Montmartre close to Sacre Coeur and the artist colony. Would stay there again. Didn't have to use personal towel. One provided by hostel.

name: Hotel Montmartre Clignancourt
reviewtext: Very nice clean hotel! Staff was so friendly and spoke English perfectly. Nabourhood did not always feel too safe, but it was close to metro, bakery and supermarket.

name: Hotel Montmartre Clignancourt
reviewtext: Basic and clean. Great for a one night stay if you are on the move, as it is very close to Gare du Nord. Wouldn't choose it for a longer holiday. The area around the hotel is not pretty but we enjoyed exploring the city.

name: Hotel Montmartre Clignancourt
reviewtext: This location is outstanding. Everything you require is right there.

name: Hotel Montmartre Clignancourt
reviewtext: Convenient and idyllic.  The staff was friendly and the room and bathrooms were very well maintained.  The location was beautiful, bustling, and convenient to bakeries, cafes, Metro, and groceries.  It is a wonderful area to walk around or eat.  Fabulous hotel!

name: Hotel Montmartre Clignancourt
reviewtext: Worth the money with great location, nice staffs :)

name: Hotel Montmartre Clignancourt
reviewtext: No a/c, not mentioned at all when we booked. Lady was pretty rude. Good for a day or 2 though

name: Hotel Montmartre Clignancourt
reviewtext: Can be worse, can be cleaner, good location

name: Hotel Montmartre Clignancourt
reviewtext: It's a good place, the location is good. It's super closed to sacre coeur.

name: Hotel Montmartre Clignancourt
reviewtext: My bf and I stayed here for 2 nights. I know a decent amount of French, that helped me a LOT with talking to the staff. I'm sure it would be fine if you don't know much, though. So first of all, my review might be a tad biased bc France was in a heat wave at the time (~31Â° C/ 90Â°F). The room was miserably hot, and being on floor 5 didn't help. No elevator. We brought our own sheets, but that's bc I'm used to Hamptons. Also the area didn't seem safe at night. If ur tight on money, it's decent.

name: Hotel Montmartre Clignancourt
reviewtext: Beautiful.

name: Oops Latin Quarter by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Loved this place. Cool vibes. Good croissants for breakfast. Good location. Helpful staff.

name: Oops Latin Quarter by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
It is a very good hostel, the room was clean, bed comfortable, staff very nice, the breakfast a little poor but the croissants are delicious. 
The room for 4 was very small and there are no lockers inside. The location is very good, it is in a main avenue and there are 2 metro stations very close with a lot of options for food.

name: Oops Latin Quarter by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Kitchen closes at night. An ok breakfast. MÃ¼sli and croissant and a small bread. Bathroom in the room which is great. U can walk into the hostel all the way up to the rooms without any security. For the rooms you need cars keys.

name: Oops Latin Quarter by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: good location, many food arround and close to metro line/bus station. really nice for the free breakfast, good wifi. but the bed somehow is too small and also locker is too small and located outside the room. staff are helpful, you can left your luggage in luggage room (but keep in mind that it's a public access) even when you have check out and it's free. this is a plus! overall nice to stay for a solo traveller.

name: Oops Latin Quarter by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: A really good place to stay. Friendly staff, superb location near the metro and the facilities were spotless. You will not be disappointed.

name: Oops Latin Quarter by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Stayed in a 4 bed dorm (with bathroom) for 4 nights.  It was clean and spacious, had natural light, and AC.  The staff and guest are all really friendly.  Basic breakfast (coffee, juice, granola, croissant, buttered roll) is included.  You can leave your bags in a locked closet before or after you check in.  There are a few metro stations, bars, restaurants, and grocery stores within walking distance.  There is not really a common area/lounge.

name: Oops Latin Quarter by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Great option, affordable, clean, safe and well located. I booked this hostal 1day before O got there it was a really good choice. Rooms and bathrooms and clean and nice, also with A/A (great!!), my only comment will be related to the breakfast which is only a croissant, coffee and butter. But it was a great choice.

name: Oops Latin Quarter by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: It was nice for an overnight stay! The rooms were very clean and the bathrooms were very nice. It was very close to the metro. Would recommend to all

name: Oops Latin Quarter by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: This was my first time in a hostel, so I've nothing to compare it to.  In general, it was a good stay!!  The staff was friendly and allowed me to store my backpack securely until check-in time.  It was also nice to have safes available outside the room for valuables.  The rooms were small but clean.  The shared bathroom was tiny, but it was nice to have one in the 4-woman dorm.  You can't beat the value if you're going to stay in Paris!

name: Oops Latin Quarter by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
Great location within Paris, close to 2 metro stations. Not much interaction with staff, but they were very pleasant and professional. Room was air conditioned which is great. Lockers are located in the hallway not inside the room. 
Staff cleaned room daily so bathroom was decent, however the shower constantly floods the bathroom, so design is poor. I might stay again, but I wouldn't be my first choice. Breakfast is included and is a croissant, bread roll, jam, & butter. Location is safe!

name: Oops Latin Quarter by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: There's nothing really wrong with this hostel, but there's nothing that's great about it either. The rooms are quite small and so maneuvering around roommates can get quite interesting. The bathrooms are also very small and the floor is often wet as the shower curtain rarely manages to keep all the water in. The hostel is located near two metro stops which is a great help. There's no common room apart from the kitchen which is not the most comfortable, but fine for 1 or 2 nights I'd say.

name: Oops Latin Quarter by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
It was great for a quick one night stop
in the city, but would not recommend to stay while you explore Paris. No atmosphere and no place to really hangout.

name: Oops Latin Quarter by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: About what should be expected for the price. Pretty bare bones, but that is all I needed. Rooms were tiny, as was the en suite bathroom. Facilities seemed fairly clean and staff was nice. The common area was not much to write home about, but I did not spend much time there overall; this was a good place to call home base for a couple of days. It would have been nice to have easily accessible lockers (I guess there were some on another floor somewhere?). Location alright - close to Place d'Italie

name: Oops Latin Quarter by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: The staff were so nice here and the area feels really safe so I was never worried when I had to come back late at night, plus there's a metro stop literally 1 minute away and another one no more than 5 minutes away.  My only issue was that the showers tended to get spray all over the bathroom floor, but that was easily solved with a towel.  Overall I'll definitely be booking here again when I come back to Paris!

name: Oops Latin Quarter by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Very good hostel, good facilities

name: Oops Latin Quarter by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Nice location, lots to explore around the neighbourhood and really close to public transport. Kitchen was not good at all as you have to go to the building next door and there is only a very small fridge and no proper stove or  bench area to prepare on. Room was small and beds were a bit soft and squeaky.  Overall fine for what it was.

name: Oops Latin Quarter by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
A friendly welcome at the youth hostel and a warm support in locating a free bedroom for another night were charming as well as very well perceived. Special thanks to Juan.


Plesae receive my best regards,

CÃ©cile

name: Oops Latin Quarter by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Well located hostel in a safe area. No lockers for bags so that made me uneasy. Very very small rooms which is too be expected in Paris. Roommates can be hit and miss- the first few nights I had very messy, rude roommates who made a lot of unnecessarily late at night, turned lights on whilst others were sleeping at 2am ect. But later they left and were relaplaced with much nicer people! Free breakfast is good and a nice ad on. Beds are awful, squeaky and very uncomfortable.

name: Oops Latin Quarter by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: This place isn't too bad, but I felt too big for the bunk bed, my head and feet touched the frame which was uncomfortable, and they're really cheap bunk bed frames. They shake a lot getting in and out of them. The 4:00pm check in time wasn't great either. But it's a good location, around one of my favorite parts of Paris.

name: Oops Latin Quarter by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
Loved the location of this hostel, loved the 4 bed female dorm! There wasn't much of a hangout area, breakfast was included which is awesome but it was very basic. Loved the big window in the room that opened for a breeze! 

The beds are kinda short (I'm 5'7 and fit okay but much taller than me might not). The kitchen was a sink and a microwave. 

Good spot for a quick stop - I was happy for one night. It's an okay bed and small breakfast and perfect location to explore Paris!

name: Oops Latin Quarter by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: I didn't like that the lockers were small and outside the rooms. Also there is no security system for the luggage room and they could easily implement a way to monitor that bags aren't stolen to give guests some comfort. There is no age limit at this hostel so a mixed bed dorm room was a weird vibe in a cramped space. Very great location at least. Would not stay here again.

name: Oops Latin Quarter by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: if i could give this place more than 10 stars i would. it was the best hostel i have ever stayed at,bar none. the hostel itself was amazing, spacious and clean and so much fun! but what makes this place is the staff, they are beyond friendly, so helpful, and thoughtful in the way they treat the people staying. have to give a special shoutout to joÃ£o who took us to sintra and then went out with us to dinner the next night, an incredibly kind and funny man he was and we will never forget him!

name: Oops Latin Quarter by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: The staff broke my charging wire left no note or gave me any reason ... while checking with the staff , she didn't show any eager to help me solve this , basically how I feel is letting me just shut the fxxk up! This is so not professional! Worse experience ever had!

name: Aloha Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Very mello atmosphere. Staff was helpful, location was perfect and I was comfortable. Only issue I had was the tiny shower with such short time on between pumps but I guess you get what you pay for. Overall good value for money

name: Aloha Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: I was traveling with a friend, but I would not recommend this for a solo traveler. I would not feel safe walking around in the neighborhood at night and there is no way to meet people at this hostel. When inquiring about the bus options to the airport, the staff seemed like they didn't know. Every other hostel I've stayed at has always been knowledgeable about that. There is only one bathroom per floor and they allow families to stay there. The walls are thin so don't plan on getting good sleep.

name: Aloha Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Nice location to visit Eiffel Tower and come from there late at night, good breakfast, welcoming staff, secure hostel.

name: Aloha Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: There is not hot water for shower - I know this place is cheap and you get what you paid, but at least the basic, like hot shower, should will have.

name: Aloha Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: It was insanely hot. Especially a place where you keep many warm bodies in one room in today's climate/season, it is not acceptable to not have some form of relief from the heat. And in general it felt more like a very cheap motel with dorms rather than a convenient alternative for travelers on a budget. Many of the occupants seemed semi-permanent and not like travelers. The one I am currently staying at has much better atmosphere, facilities, and location while also being cheaper.

name: Aloha Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Staff friendly and helpful, good free breakfast in the morning. Only downfall is that there are no lockers in the room to hold valuables in.

name: Aloha Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Aloha Hostel was very average. First of all you had to pay for your stay in cash only which was highly inconvenient. We were on the top floor and the rooms were very hot at night despite being next to an open window. Thankfully we asked the staff for a fan and was able to get one. The showers were mouldy and cold water. The free breakfast was pretty good but you had to be fast otherwise the milk and juice would be warm.

name: Aloha Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: It was good staying.we can eat breakfast for free.Staff is friendly.We can walk to Eiffel tower easily.I was able to find friend  who travel with. There is only one thing bad. Shower room was small.

name: Aloha Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: It was ok, but could've been cleaner, and the hostel lacked a good atmosphere, but the location was really good.

name: Aloha Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: The hostel is really nice for the price and location. You can walk to the Eiffel tower and you can even come back walking at 2 am in the morning and the neighborhood is okay. The staff is awesome. They really helped me with all my doubts and they were really chatty and welcoming. I would stay again for sure.

name: Aloha Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: The room of 6 was spacious and light which was nice. The location was quite good, lots of cafes nearby. The staff were great and helped us a lot, the first night I stayed was very hot and although I was next to a window it didn't help much. The next day we asked if we were able to put a fan in the room and the staff helped us with that which definitely made that night a lot better! The only thing I couldn't deal with was the size of the shower in the room, absolutely tiny and only cold water.

name: Aloha Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Rooms were awesome! Bathrooms a little dirty and the showers were on a timer and were really cold! Great location!!!! 20 min walk to the Effiel tower! Hope to be back some day!

name: Aloha Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Nice calm hostel

name: Aloha Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
The hostel was under maintenance and they moved us to other place, that was at other part of city and took an hour to reach.

They should have told us earlier, we wasted our time coming from airport to the hostel, and then they told to move at other location, that was way back from the same metro we boarded from the airport.

we have to go around 20 stations back from the same metro and missed our Eiffel tower entrance which was at 2pm, we were an hour late there. We need total refund.

name: Aloha Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Hostels electricity was out so we got moved to an alternate hostel

name: Aloha Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: The Hostel burned down the first night i was there and they have yet to give me a refund/ they did not provide alternative arrangements

name: Aloha Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Overall, my stay was awful! When I check in the staff lady was mad. WORST OF ALL I had to sleep in a gym with other fellow travelers on a garney for the night! The staff didn't know what to do there seemed there was no protocol for this situation so unprepared! By the way while I was staying there they been having difficulty with the wiring and lots of people complained because all the floors would go without electricity this was happening for two days! And of course they didn't seem to care.

name: Aloha Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: The management of the property clean out their hands after an incident and they have to evacuate all their custumers... we ended sleeping im a gymnasium in a military cod, they hostel didn't showed up to take responsability for anything or give us the money back for the inconvenience. In general the mess up everyone vacations at that point.

name: Aloha Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Great hostel and atmosphere in a fantastic location. Only complaint is that the showers are way too small and the water sprays out at you in ten second intervals! The wifi also does not work well at all. For a short stay in a great location it is perfect!

name: Aloha Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: a fairly small plave but the rooms are really nice- staff are p friendly and theres free breakfast which is great

name: Aloha Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
Postitive: Shoutout to Christopher for doing such an excellent job and always taking care of us -we truly appreciated your kindness! 
Negative: 1 tiny uncomfortable shower per several dorm rooms -always a very long wait to shower

name: Aloha Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
The location was good! Easy to figure out around and quite a number of restaurants and stores nearby.  It was good for a night walk to the Eiffel Tower. 
I found the dorm very congested,  the beds are tiny and the washroom facilities for the dormitory were not that great. The reception staff was okay, however since the place is busy so they don't explain everything clearly. It would be good if the dorm facilities can be improved.

name: Aloha Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
I enjoyed my stay here. The rooms were a little dusty and the showers weren't the cleanest but the beds were okay. 
The breakfast is very basis and if you want to make your own breakfast you have to wait until the free breakfast is over as the kitchen is very small. 
There is luggage storage which was very helpful as I got there early and didn't want to carry my bag around Paris for the day.

name: Aloha Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: I only stayed one night and it was a good place for a small stopover. I feel like the staff could have been friendlier.

name: Aloha Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Shower and bathroom was dirty and the stairs had a bad smell. Rooms and common area were ok though

name: Aloha Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Staff were condescending and rude. Food was pretty average. Guests were treated like cattle, taken advantage of because they didn't have much money. Basic things like squeaky doors and filling the soap dispensers weren't fixed. Terrible vibe. Cheap but nasty.

name: Aloha Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: I was rudely awoken on the morning of my checkout by a strange man in my room. He did not identify himself as a member of staff, nor was he wearing anything to show that he was working there. He began screaming at me in broken English that I was not allowed to be there, when in fact I had under an hour until checkout. I found this very threatening and uncomfortable and as a young woman travelling on her own, I would not recommend Aloha Hostel for this reason.

name: Aloha Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Firstly - there are not enough lockers. Secondly, the hostel overbooked my room - forcing another resident to change rooms, me to change beds, and all of us to be subject to intense questioning and suspicion at about 11pm. Not only was this a disappointing slip in managment, but I feel the entire situation was handled poorly. An employee raised her voice duing an otherwise calm discussion & I was approached *while in the shower* by the same employee for further discussion. Not cool.

name: Aloha Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Very dirty bathrooms but located near the subway

name: Aloha Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: This hostel is alright. Showers are extremely small and have mold in them. Not as close to the Eiffel Tower as advertised. Decent over all.

name: Aloha Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Good location from the metro station. Breakfast was good and breakfast staff were nice. There's a weird smell when you walk up the stairs (like a dead rat). The shower wasn't draining or was draining very slowly that I had to shower in ankle deep of someone else's used water.

name: Aloha Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Smell of mould all through the stairways and clearly inside the showers (it was evident they had been painting over old mouldy plaster), beds where uncomfortable and continental breakfast was anything but good.

name: Aloha Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Staff was great! Showers were weird and wifi was horrible. Overall not a horrible place but thought it was a little expensive for what it was.

name: Aloha Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: If you're a young traveler I would recommend somewhere more north than the 15th area. Some of the staff were nice, some weren't. One of them woke my friend up in the AM by banging on her bed and saying she had to switch rooms? While smoking outside around 8pm, a French woman poked her head out of a nearby window and asked us to go inside to speak, that was kind of funny but if you're young looking for a fun hostel I would try somewhere else. Luckily the metro is quick and cheap to get around.

name: Aloha Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Very friendly environment, nice breakfast and polite staff

name: Aloha Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Great location, staff not very friendly. The shower flooded and was very enclosed. Overall a standard stay.

name: Aloha Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: This hostel was 29 minutes from the eiffel tower, not 15. The shower was unusable because it was so dirty and there was literally black mold on the ceiling. There was no A/C in the rooms, only in the lobby so our room was a sauna during the day. We were soaked by the time we changed clothes and locked up our bags. I couldn't sleep in the heat and ended up just sitting in the lobby for most of the night. Lastly, the wifi was super spotty and I couldn't get online for more than 30 seconds.

name: Aloha Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
Really nice stay at this hostel.
The hostel was clean and they had good facilities. 
One of the female staff was rude, which was a shame because otherwise I would have come back to this hostel. Other than that, the staff on the whole were really lovely and accommodating.

name: Aloha Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: We had a big fan in our room. That's good in hot weather. Wifi is slow when using in the room. The woman in reception help us print tickets, but she made mistakes and still charged us. It's rude. The bathroom was not clean. The breakfast is fine.

name: Aloha Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: It was really hot in the rooms and I had a hard time sleeping. I also had to carry my bags up 4 flights of narrow stairs and really struggled.

name: Aloha Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Staff didn't want to check a long line of people in as she needed a lunch break, understandable but in this case should be replaced. Rooms are average, beds super squeeky and annoying with no elevator. Showers were disgusting, basically had been set up in a closet and looked like it hadn't been cleaned in a long time. Only thing this place has got going for it is the location being somewhat close to Eiffel tower. Look elsewhere.

name: Aloha Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: The staff was not only unfriendly but downright rude. The showers were cramped, unclean, and would only produce hot water which during the hot summer is uncomfortable. It is, however, very close to a transit station and near a number of nice resteraunts.

name: Aloha Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: I can't believe how the staff could be so rude. That annoyed me a lot.

name: Aloha Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
Loction is great.
Need to ad AC or at list a fan in the rooms.

name: Aloha Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: After reading several reviews for this hostel I was a little nervous about staying here, but my overall experience was fine! It's conveniently located just a few blocks from a metro station which made exploring the city extremely easy. The staff was pleasant and I did not have any major issues. The only negative issue that I experienced was how stifling hot my room was. My roommates wouldn't open the windows at night, and just adding a fan to the rooms would help tremendously.

name: Aloha Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Overall a great stay! The lady that checked us in wasn't the friendliest but that didn't matter as the guy working later on made up for it. Decent sized rooms and beds were comfortable. Bathrooms are pretty underwhelming - very small showers and you have to keep pressing the tap on. Security was good and the location is perfect for getting to all major attractions and is in a nice, quiet and friendly family district of Paris.

name: Aloha Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Great place and excellent location if your looking to be walking distance to the Eiffel Tower! Tons of shops and cafes around as well. Rooms were clean but shower was a bit odd as you had to keep pressing the button to keep the water on. But all in all a great place to stay in Paris on a budget. Breakfast was great as well but didn't start on time which caused us to miss our airport shuttle :/ but staff was helpful in calling a taxi immediately.

name: Aloha Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Great location just a few minutes walk to Volontaires metro station. Staff were mostly friendly and informative. Although there are lockers available, they're on the ground floor which is a bit inconvenient. Also no AC in the rooms which could be a bit of a nightmare in the height of summer. If you're looking for a relaxed hostel, would recommend.

name: Aloha Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Awesome place, the only thing that I don't like about it is just the showers were to small to fit in. Other than that it was good experience and I recommend ppl to choose it because it's close to everything and cheap.

name: Aloha Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
- nice clean rooms
- very dirty bathrooms
- helpful staff
- free breakfast which is good

name: Aloha Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: The hostel is well located and easy access to public transport. The clearness was ok and staff was friendly. There are no lockers in the room, so only small bags can be stored in the lockers outside the rooms. The luggage storage for check-out was only until 6pm, so if you journey is late in the night be prepared to carry your luggage with you. I had a problem with the door locker (which seemed to be batteries) and they were not replaced or fixed. The is only one shower and one toilet per level.

name: Aloha Eiffel Tower by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Amazing stay, super friendly staff and the Hostel was super clean and very very nice. Definitely stay here!

name: L'Hotel Particulier
reviewtext: Great location! Very close to train station.  Check in time was 1100 and the room was not ready. If the  cleaning lady had not been there we wouldn't have been able to get in to leave our bags. The room was nice, perfect for two people. The host was very prompt in response time. We requested a fan and he delivered one by the time we had gotten back. Overall, we enjoyed our stay.

name: L'Hotel Particulier
reviewtext: Great location on the cutest street. No WiFi and the owner only accepted cash which was annoying. Very clean though!

name: L'Hotel Particulier
reviewtext: We had a pleasant stay. It makes you feel like a Parisian, and the room is a decent size. There is no A/C, and it got quite hot. We were only there to sleep, but it was a bit uncomfortable. You can open the windows, but there are a few mosquitoes. For the price, it is not bad though. It would be great in the winter. It's less than a 5 minute walk to the metro. Check in was very smooth, and the host was very nice. We arrived later than expected, and he waited for us. For 1-2 people, not more.

name: L'Hotel Particulier
reviewtext: Awesome little apartment! We weren't sure how to get in at the start (have to call the owner to come and meet you there) but otherwise a really nice stay. The street is beautiful too, and easy walking distance to the train station.

name: L'Hotel Particulier
reviewtext: My daughter and I loved our stay here. The location was a big plus, cute little street closed for traffic, with colorful townhouses and cobble stone. We were able to walk to most of the cultural objects, and took the ferry back. Place was clean and Danielle was super friendly and helpful. Thank you!

name: Young & Happy Latin Quarter by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Friendly staff, clean and good location.

name: Young & Happy Latin Quarter by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: The staff were friendly and overall the Hostel was good. The showers were kind of dirty and they didn't drain quickly enough.

name: Young & Happy Latin Quarter by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Stayed at a 6-bed girl dorm. To be able to enter you had to first enter the building via buzzer, then enter the part of the building where what I presume the 3 female dorms were using your key card and then use your card again to enter your room. Staff at reception was nice and helpful and polite and multilingual speaking English French and Spanish. According to my roomate who purchased the breakfast it was a lot and good. The area felt very safe at night - busy wit lots of restaurants and bars.

name: Young & Happy Latin Quarter by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: This hostel has cockroaches.

name: Young & Happy Latin Quarter by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Good breakfast to wake up to and friendly staff! The private bedroom was nice to have and we always felt safe!

name: Young & Happy Latin Quarter by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
Overall great stay, amazing area, clean facilities, helpful staff. Paris is expensive but this is a great option for the price. 
Some cons:
Not amazing communal vibe, no organized events, only 1 outlet per room, beds slightly creaky. 

Side note: check out Anthony Bosson Boulanger a few blocks away for amazing pastries and coffee (get Kouign Aman or macarons) if you enjoy starting your day that way.

name: Young & Happy Latin Quarter by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: The area was great. I loved staying in the Latin Quarter because it felt like I was a real Parisian and away from the tourists.  The staff was friendly, but the other guests weren't as sociable as other hostels I've stayed at.   I'd definitely recommend the Young and Happy hostel to anyone staying in Paris.

name: Young & Happy Latin Quarter by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Virtually no hot water. The drying machine doesn't dry. To top it all off I saw a mouse in the kitchen area (basement). Honestly wouldn't complain if the rating was lower and I had expected less, but this place isn't cheap and to have very poor facilities/ cleanliness is just terrible.

name: Young & Happy Latin Quarter by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Hostel is in a very good location for seeing the city and having things nearby to do. However, there was no air conditioning, forcing windows in the rooms to be left open. Unfortunately the street is quite busy and the bar across the street plays music late into the night. It won't be the most comfortable or restful sleep you ever have, but it was nice enough to stay in again.

name: Young & Happy Latin Quarter by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Perfect location.  Not a lot of interaction between the guests.  The rooms are fairly warm throughout the night (no one used the blankets provided to us) and there is a lot of light and noise from Rue Mouffetard.  However, the location of this hostel made it worth it.

name: Young & Happy Latin Quarter by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Young and Happy Hostel. The staff were kind, friendly and so helpful. They even helped us how to figure out the metro routes to different places. Overall there was a fun and lively atmosphere within the hostel itself and we found that the hostel was so central Paris.

name: Young & Happy Latin Quarter by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: I found the hostel easily thanks to the directions on the website. Check-in was easily, although a towel was not included in the original price. There was also no AC and it was hot and humid, so I had to sleep on top of the covers in as little clothing as possible. The bathrooms and showers were decent (only two showers, and one had no soap in the dispenser), and I didn't use the laundry facilities but it was good to know they were there. The breakfast options were somewhat limited (rolls with b

name: Young & Happy Latin Quarter by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Do not use this hostel while it's summer in Paris. It was 97 degrees all 5 days we stayed there and even though there is an air conditioning unit in the room, it did not work and the only window to the room opened up directly to two bars that stayed open until about 4am. By morning two we seriously contemplated checking out and moving to a different hostel. Besides the unbearable heat, the toilets/showers were only on the first and second floors even though there were 4 stories of rooms.

name: Young & Happy Latin Quarter by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: This is definitely an okay hostel. Going in, I knew there wouldn't be much community atmosphere, etc, and that was totally true. My room was a 6- bed mixed dorm and it was small, with creaky but comfortable beds. There were only two outlets in the room, and the overhead lights were basically in the face of the upper bunks. But it was a great neighborhood, everyone was nice, things were clean, and I would stay here again. I def felt safe at night.

name: Young & Happy Latin Quarter by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Nice hostel, but lack of powerpoints. Was a quiet hostel to sleep in so if your a fan of sleep its great!

name: Young & Happy Latin Quarter by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Excellent location, you can easily move to anywhere in Paris from here. Located near bars, so expect noise until past midnight. Excellent staff: friendly and helpful. Small rooms with shared bathrooms and shower for each floor. Shower smell weird.

name: Young & Happy Latin Quarter by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Fantastic location - really close to wonderful restaurants and cafes and easy to navigate. Bathroom was clean but the shower was tiny. Staff were friendly and helpful.

name: Young & Happy Latin Quarter by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: The location of this hostel is fantastic and is only a 15 minute walk away from the Seine. The staff was pretty nice and efficient. The issue is that the hostel isn't great for socialising. There isn't really an area for people to sit and talk and the bathrooms aren't that clean. Overall it's a good place if you want something convenient but not the best place for meeting new people.

name: Young & Happy Latin Quarter by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Amazing location and pretty nice! No elevator, only two toilets for two floors of people though! No aircon or fans in rooms and it was so hot.

name: Young & Happy Latin Quarter by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: really great friendly staff- very approachable and helpful!

name: Young & Happy Latin Quarter by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: The hostel was located in a great area, lots of lovely Parisian cafes and restaurants nearby, and really easy access to the metro and other sites. The kitchen was lovely and clean and we could store food in the fridge. Only downside was the limited number of toilets for quite a large number of rooms. There also wasn't a very good social area for travellers wanting to meet people.

name: Young & Happy Latin Quarter by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: It's decent place. A little more ruckus than we expected.

name: Young & Happy Latin Quarter by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Nice place, easy to meet good people and in a friendly area on the city. Though it's a bit noisy on weekends if you're trying to sleep. Great place overall.

name: Young & Happy Latin Quarter by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: This hostel had a great location in the middle of the Latin quarter! However I found that this hostel had no atmosphere, it was cute but if you want to socialise and young this will not be place to be. The cleanliness wasn't the best either, and showers were crap! Overall ok!

name: Young & Happy Latin Quarter by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: GREAT HOSTEL,GREAT LOCATION,,GREAT FACILITIES,GREAT WELCOMING

name: Peace & Love Hostel
reviewtext: In general it is a good place to stay, well located. Bathrooms were so small, you can barely move inside it. The service were so bad. I have to wait about one hour and half to make the check in. They didn't want to give me a towel and I waited almost two hours to get one. After I left my room they throw the towel in the floor. It was a bad service. If you want to stay only to sleep and take a shower maybe worth it.

name: Peace & Love Hostel
reviewtext: Have friendlier staff. No air conditioning. Had to walk up 13 flights of stairs.

name: Peace & Love Hostel
reviewtext: The staff where nice and the place was clean and it was in a good location

name: Peace & Love Hostel
reviewtext: This place was so bad I had to cut my stay short and head elsewhere. In fact, it was so bad it turned me off all hostels all together. The 3 bed dorms are so small I felt claustrophobic. The shower is in the tiny room only half a meter away from the bunks so having a shower is as awkward as it gets. The bar downstairs isn't filled with other traveller but rather local men. Safe to say I didn't feel at all comfortable here and woukd really advise you to pay a few extra euros for a better place

name: Peace & Love Hostel
reviewtext:
Shady location shady atmosphere. Rooms are extremely hot in the summer.
Beds are clean. The staff create a unhealthy atmosphere and the rooms are uncomfortable in terms of temperature.

name: Peace & Love Hostel
reviewtext:
our stay in this hostel was incredibly bad, the reception is also a bad bar, when we arrived they did not pay attention to us, so we had to wait long to have the key to the room.
the internet connection is terrible and forces guests to sit at the bar, where we were repeatedly approached by drunk men, the only thing we wanted was to leave there, so we try to spend our days as far as possible.

name: Peace & Love Hostel
reviewtext: The facilities are not so good, theres no confortable place to hang out with any other guests, I got a room at the top floor with is 6 or 7 and climbing through those stairs in the summer is not easy... location is really good and it's fairly clean taking into account the fact that there's no space so in the morning all the sheets are in the stairs while they clean the bedrooms so it's harder to climb down the stairs.

name: Peace & Love Hostel
reviewtext: Cheapest hostel in Paris. And you get what you pay for. Pay the extra ten bucks and stay somewhere else.

name: Peace & Love Hostel
reviewtext: The WORST hostel in the world. Rooms are so tiny, there is no space to move around. Ceilings are too low so that if you sleep on the third level of the bed, you can not sit up as your head is touching the ceiling. Shower, toilet rooms are tiny and dirty. Staff is not helpful, we found our room unlocked and left open two times and they did not do anything about it. BED BUGS!!! They are all over the bed and bite you in the night. The worst experience in Paris.

name: Peace & Love Hostel
reviewtext: Fine place for a short stay! Rooms were very hot and slightly overcrowded, lockers needed!

name: Peace & Love Hostel
reviewtext: Worst hostel in 9 months of traveling. Nonexistent WiFi, with cleanliness/comfort level equal to a frat house: sticky beer floors, cramped dorms, dismal toilet rooms, and BED BUGS. I hardly slept for two days because my first room was infested (room 7), when I switched to room 11 they were also there. The staff didn't bother to change my dead bug/blood spotted sheets even though I asked. They are constantly on the phone with someone more important, making guests wait for them. Awful experience.

name: Peace & Love Hostel
reviewtext: ***BED BUGS*** Don't even consider staying here, it is not worth the money. I got bitten all over and contacted Paris tourist and hygienic authorities with photos to make an inspection here and shut the business; totally irresponsible of the owners that they neglect regular deratisation. Well positioned, but no AC and the rooms are cramped - don't take the lowest bed (literally mattress on the floor with still two bed bunks above - you'll get bitten the most. THE WORST EXPERIENCE EVER IN PARIS

name: Peace & Love Hostel
reviewtext: We got top bunks that were so close to the ceiling it was so difficult to climb up and get into bed and impossible to sit up in. There was no air conditioning and the bathrooms were super small. The staff was indifferent except for one person. There was so common area to relax and stretch out in. The rooms themselves barely had any room to walk around and no space for each person to put there luggage except on the already small beds. The lockers are only small one that can't even fit backpacks.

name: Peace & Love Hostel
reviewtext: Exactly what you'd expect for what you pay, we were mistakenly given a private room when we arrived! No complaints there, the room was pretty standard, very clean only problem was how hot it was at night. The staff were friendly and the bar downstairs was decent. Would only stay in a private room here as they don't have lockers in the rooms and only small ones downstairs. Overall not bad for approx Â£15 per night

name: Peace & Love Hostel
reviewtext:
Ok place if you need to crash but a little dirty, and the showers without any coverage is strange. 
Found a few bugs in the bed.

name: Peace & Love Hostel
reviewtext: There's nothing actually, but its got a few things that make it quite uncomfortable. There are 7 floors and no elevator. There is no AC, and the rooms are the most cramped I've ever seen in a hostel. I slept on the 3rd bunk, 2 feet from the ceiling, on the 7th for in 32C heat, and it was barely tolerable. The bathrooms and shower are the smallest they could possibly be; obese people could not stay here. There was no soap in the bathrooms... gross. Lockers are too small to fit open bags.

name: Peace & Love Hostel
reviewtext: Bed was covered in tonnes of bugs, was pretty disgusting mixed in with the heat, was probably the worst night sleep I've had at a hostel and definitely the worst hostel I've been to.

name: Peace & Love Hostel
reviewtext: It's near by metro station and also there are three shops in

name: Peace & Love Hostel
reviewtext:
Rooms are somewhat 'bijou'. Shared shower in the three bed dorm is in the room three feet from the beds, with only frosted glass between you and the others in the dorm. The beds were triple bunks, middle bunk quite difficult to get into and the entire bed frame seemed somewhat unstable (there was at least one screw missing from the frame).
Location was good. Staff rather unhelpful. Bed frame could do with a good clean. Door to hostel not locked after 6 as website says. All dorms key card access.

name: Peace & Love Hostel
reviewtext:
Didn't really understand reseptionist. Scared me ðŸ™ƒ with their French traditions.
No soap in the room
Room is enormously small and stuffy 
View and location are wonderful

name: Yooma Urban Lodge
reviewtext: Great location. Very clean. Will definitely stay here again!

name: Yooma Urban Lodge
reviewtext:
The location was close to the Eiffel Tower and train station.  It wasn't a great location for feeling like we were part of the Paris atmosphere because it's in more of a business district and on a busy street.

The room was nice and clean.  

The lockers were great for storing our luggage before check in - But you need to have Euro COINS to use the lockers so have some with you.

name: Yooma Urban Lodge
reviewtext: Yooma Urban Lodge exceeded my expectations. The facility is amazing not to mention the location (10 minute walk from Eiffel Tower, cannot top that). I definitely recommend this Lodge if you want a nice comfortable and relaxing stay. I didn't take advantage of their media room or sauna, but I will in the future.

name: Yooma Urban Lodge
reviewtext: Fantastic stay, great location, spotlessly clean, would stay again

name: Yooma Urban Lodge
reviewtext: Amazing place! Went for Bastille weekend / The World Cup and had the time of our lives! Very convenient location, very nice and modern, friendly workers. I recommend this place to anyone! Cheap for how nice it is/ the amenities. If I come back to Paris I am always going to book with them!

name: Yooma Urban Lodge
reviewtext: Fantastic! Great position, great rooms, wonderful breakfast.

name: Yooma Urban Lodge
reviewtext: We enjoyed our stay, the hostel is nice, provides all the necessary amenities (towels, soap, everyday cleaning). The room was clean, the only reason I rated less is that the room had a problem with the venting hole bringing some toilet smell into the room. Apart from the smell everything was very good

name: Hotel Bonsejour Montmartre
reviewtext: Great location, and probably ok value for the price in that area. Our room (no. 12) was definitely not renovated and if so, I don't want to know what it looked like without renovation. The corridor was under construction and looked more like a building site. Cleanliness could be improved in general. A plastic sheet between mattress and bed sheet didn't exactly make the bed more cosier and ear plugs are definitely needed because of the noisy bar outside, but also possible noises from inside.

name: Hotel Bonsejour Montmartre
reviewtext:
Good value accomm in Paris. Noisy spot though (even with window shut) & no a/c or fan so sleep was hard. We also had people on our floor (we were in own room) yelling & fighting 11:30pm & 5:30am!!
You share bathroom with one other unit but we had unpleasant people (2 different sets) during stay, banging on door when you are in their - toilet being in same room as shower).
Shower too small - I struggled as a medium/small build. My husband would not fit in this shower if he had been with me.

name: Hotel Bonsejour Montmartre
reviewtext: I loved the place. It is very conveniently located just 10 min walk from Avignon Central station and very close (walkable distance) to most tourist spots in the city. Staff is very friendly. Breakfast was very good.

name: Hotel Bonsejour Montmartre
reviewtext: Great gem of a place in the middle of Montmartre. Best location to stay in Paris with heaps of cool bars and restaurants within metres! Exceptionally clean rooms and bathrooms, friendly staff, and a nice atmosphere. Loved that we had a basin in our room, and because there aren't many rooms on each floor the shared bathroom was literally never occupied! Amazing value for money too considering how expensive everything is in Paris.

name: Hotel Bonsejour Montmartre
reviewtext: It was nice stay, but near pub was kind a loud so it was hard to sleep tik 12-1am, but the hotel is near good restaurants, one pf the best bakeries and landmarks.

name: Hotel Bonsejour Montmartre
reviewtext: Dirty hostel with no ac, and when we came to open the windows it was so loud that we couldn't sleep. Rented a private room that was so small and there was no space. Once r Windows we're open, bugs came in the room. Would never stay here again.

name: Hotel Bonsejour Montmartre
reviewtext: The hotel was in bad need of repair and decoration, with peeling wallpaper and damage to the walls and floor finishes. The room was very basic and cleanliness of shared bathroom was poor. Staff were pleasant and friendly and location was great. However, overall a disappointing stay.

name: Hotel Bonsejour Montmartre
reviewtext: Small but beautiful, had everything you could need and the staff were lovely. It was a pleasure!

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext: Very expensive, not worth it. Thi place is very aesthetic, but the experience less inviting. Night staff was very unaccommodating and unhelpful. They are also very strict about who is around reception or in the common area when. WiFi is also only available in the common area, not in the rooms. There is only one key per room, so either the door is always unlocked or people get locked out. Also, heads up: rooms facing the street can expect a lot of noise from cars and trucks early in the morning.

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext: Lovely place to stay however it needs to do something about the stairs cause carrying a huge suitcase up three floors is extremely hard. Lovely staff and roommates

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext:
+Helpful staff
+Free breakfast
+Regular cleaning

-No lockers
-Small, hot rooms

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext:
One of the most beautiful hostel i ever stayed in (building) 
The staff is nice and tries to help where they can, the common room and the courtyard are very nice, and you can drink wine ar beer there.

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext: It was great! But we missed a kitchen.

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext:
The location is just perfect and breakfast was better than expected. 
There are few things that should be improved. There are not enough sockets in the room, no lockers at all - it's not really safe to leave your staff in the room because the door to the hostel is open most of the time.

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext: Would really recommend for those wanting a more laid back atmosphere (as opposed to other hostels filled with inter-railers stumbling in drunk at 4am etc). Really clean, staff impressively multilingual and very friendly. Only thing I'd say is important to note is that there are no lockers in the rooms to keep valuables while you're out and about.

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext:
The hostel is great in terms price, location, and cleanliness. The staff were generally friendly and helpful. I felt the allocation of beds (as on one night I found someone else sleeping on my bed so I had to switch to another room) and security (in terms of checking who is entering the building) could be better organised. Breakfast was average. 
But the location and the price more than make up for everything because in any case one is out in the city for the majority of the day.

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext: The building itself is beautiful and the location is great right next to the metro and an easy walk to the arc and champs Elysees. However, that is the only positive thing I can say. This is one of the most disorganized hostels I have ever stayed in. Multiple nights the room was overbooked, and I found someone sleeping in my bed. I was told by staff to just sleep in any open bed I found. It was stressful coming back at the end of the day not knowing if I would have a bed or not.

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext: I left early one morning for an event. And according to the other girls in my girls only room the staff let two males and a female in after I left. All of my stuff from my bed were dumped on the floor and some strange man slept in it! Then apparently another staff came and kicked them out but they stayed until the afternoon. It's incredibly violating and clearly there is absolutely no security. I will tell everyone I know not to go near this hostel.

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext: Really loved the area! It was walking distance to the Arc and Eiffel Tower, grocery stores and tons of restaurants and shops.  Also, it was close to the metro which made going out at night a lot easier and cheaper. For a short stay in the city, this is a pretty fabulous place! There's limited showers and toilets but it never was a huge inconvenience. No kitchen for storing or making food just FYI.

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext: My friend and I requested all female rooms for the 2 nights we were there and the first night we had to switch rooms and the second night when we returned men were in our beds and they had moved our things. When we asked to move the man at the desk struggled to understand us and only showed us one bed so we left that night and went to a hotel. Throughout the whole experience we were treated poorly and none of the staff tried to help us feel safe and comfortable

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext: Not recommended! Staff is rude. Especially people responsible for breakfast. Rooms are nice and beds are comfortable. Even it is closer to city center, still you have to take metro in paris so better take cheapest hostel.

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext: The location is pretty convenient, the atmosphere is good, could be a lot better but I guess it depends on the guests. I found it odd that reception makes you fill out your own paperwork and makes you wait on top of that but it's not a deal breaker. Also the doors to the rooms are very loud so getting a peaceful sleep isn't guaranteed when sharing rooms. Overall decent stay and value for money.

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext: Good location and breakfast!! No lockers but still a good place to visit the city. Value for money is highly recommended.

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext: I found a great location, very large rooms, however lacking a bit of organization in relation to the beds as they are in the morning and when I returned the night had a person sleeping in my bed ... but a very good place, would stay there again certainly

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext:
Someone, who has tried hostels like GENERATOR and FIAP will surely have different standards to compare it with. Let me share some problems with you which I faced at BVJ and that too when I was there just for a night.
1. Wi-fi doesnt work in rooms. You have to sit in the lobby area to access it
2. There are no washrooms inside the rooms. Not even a loo
3. No privacy for female dorms
4. They don't have automated billing system. They write the bill for you on a piece of paper and accept ONLY cash.

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext: Check-in is extremely slow and needs to be improved.

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext: Great stay! I was here almost a week and enjoyed it. Staff is really nice, free breakfast, good location and clean bathrooms. Only downside is that there are no lockers. Overall, great value for the money!

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext: A good location (a few minutes from Arc de Triomphe) and a nice interior space. I only stayed one night but it was everything i needed. Also, free breakfast! Cant go wrong!

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext: Rude staff

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext: I really enjoyed this Hostel; it was very spacious and the building itself was beautiful, having a very authentic vibe to it. The staff was very friendly and I was able to meet some great people. The facilities were clean and the breakfast was pretty decent too. All for a very great price. The location was great too, located near the public transport, parks. I was able to walk to the Eiffel Tower and the Arche De Triomphe from there as well pretty easily. Would definitely recommend and go back.

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext: The guy in the reception area (a young one, with black hair who looks like a Turkish ) was in a really bad mood, he treated us as if he were doing us a favor, we asked him a doubt about something he had said that we didn't understand very well and he told us "I already told you..." in an aggressive way. We didn't feel welcome at all while doing our check in,  this guy must be kind and answering guest doubts in a good way, that's why we are paying his salary. I'll never stay there again.

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext: Apart from wifi not reaching the rooms and the lack of lockers, it has just what you need.

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext:
Quiet yet central - 10 / 15 minutes walk from the Arc de Triomphe. The hostel is very close to the Metro. The building combines cool modernity with architectural grandeur.
Very clean and a very good breakfast with lots of choice. The staff are friendly and speak good English. The shower rooms I used were cool and modern. Parc Monceau is a nice park near by There is a lovely courtyard with chairs and tables. I would highly recomend this hostel..

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext: This was one of the worst hostel experiences I've ever had. There were mice running around the room and then when I tried to speak to the manager about it he literally walked away from me and got mad at me for even saying anything. I would NEVER recommend this hostel. Extremely unimpressed and disgusted by the facilities and the management. Also there is 0 security, the door that they claim locks is always to the outside and you share a room key with your entire room.

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext: Overall, I really enjoyed my stay here. The location is fantastic, and value for money is incredible. Free breakfast was so helpful and staff work hard. Place was very clean, and the building was beautiful. Only problem I can think of is then lack of places to charge phones in rooms, and toilets and showers are always in use. But obviously this would be the case when sharing a room with at least 10 other people. I would 100% recommend this place, just make sure you bring a portable charger.

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext: A very nice hostel great location and price

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext: Lovely staff! Great place to go if you want a quiet place to relax. Supermarkets close by, and all round lovely place to be!

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext: Nice place. 10 minutes by walking to the Arc de Triumphe, 20min to the Eiffel  tower. Staff were nice. I loved it ðŸ˜„

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext:
Cons:
