If a booking option says "Basic 10 male bed dorm" Then it should just be a dorm with 10 males and nothing else. Doesn't mean a room with 33 other people -_- If past reviews have mentioned this, maybe perhaps be honest with people and list it as a "Basic 33 mixed bed dorm"

No lockers. Anyone can steal anything easily during the day time

Few working outlets

No wifi in rooms

Pros:

Breakfast

Location...thats it

Looking at very old reviews, it makes me wonder if they're learning at all

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext:
Difficult to find but other than that there are few complaints. 
Breakfast was included which was great and the location was excellent. We managed to walk everywhere. 
The showers are good but the smell is a bit dampy which could easily be improved by keeping the door to the outside open. Also there are no lockers or places to securely store your bags although we didn't really find that an issue or have any problems with that as the main door to the rooms can be locked when you leave.

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext:
No cuenta con lockers, ni buena ventilaciÃ³n, si abres las ventanas hay mucho ruido, las puertas son extremadamente ruidosas. 
El Ã¡rea comÃºn estÃ¡ linda.

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext: Really cute courtyard and great location, free breakfast was an awesome plus!!! I don't mind the 1 key per a room thing (last person out the room brings it to reception, first person back brings it to the room), but there are no lockers in the rooms??? Really gotta trust your roomies. Otherwise, I appreciated the good water pressure and cleanliness ðŸ‘

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext:
Better than expected. It wasn't real clean in the room, but the lobby and bathrooms were fine. 

Breakfast spread was good. First time ever drinking coffee from a bowl - haha. 

Will stay again.

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext: First, key was lost to the room and we didn't get another one.  Nothing happened but I was worried my entire stay.  Shower and bathroom situation is a disaster!  Smells and dirty. Only one hook in one shower for entire floor 24+ people.  Girls bathroom was in a room with a boys bathroom but was so small couldn't even get in the stall to close the door. Rooms were brutal. Dirty! Main bed sheet was never washed and blanket never changed. Floor was filthy.  No air condition or fan. Was so hot!

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext: There were no locks in the rooms or anywhere else in the hostel for that matter. There was only one key for a room of 30 people so you couldn't really leave your things in the room either-or at least I didn't feel safe doing so. The service at the hostel was fine but some receptionists seemed almost upset to be working which was uncomfortable to say the least. Also there were no individual plugs/bed and no wifi in the rooms. You're better off paying a little more and going to a better hostel.

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext: Very friendly staff, they let us move rooms when we complained about a man being creepy towards us. The security and lock system is very odd, only one key for each room and no lockers. The last person to leave the room has to lock up and hand the key into reception. Although, it did feel quite safe and has a very pretty courtyard to sit in and meet people, and the free breakfast is perk.

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext: I really want to say thank you to the staff who was very welcoming and friendly!

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext: The rooms were clean and spacious however the lack of air con made some nights impossible to sleep and it was very very sweaty and uncomfortable. However the free breakfast was great as the food in Paris tended to be expensive this helped save money. The location is also great and there is a lovely park around the corner which is great for a run or work out. Beware there are no lockers and the rooms are not secure so be sure to lock valuables in your suitcase.

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext: UwU

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext:
Very calm place and there's a metro station very near. BUT: 
* There was only 1 key p/room, so the room would be open the entire night, since someone could arrive and be locked outside
** Apparently everything was clean, but I saw a rat passing by the main room (where we have breakfast), so I don't know.
*** The bathroom light turns off while you're on the shower. The WiFi has absolutely NO sign at the room. You shouldn't say there's WiFi when you actually have to go to the reception to use it.

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext: This hostel was perfect for us!! The rooms were very clean and spacious with a sink which was a bonus. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the free breakfast is always a perk! Yes location is very nice with a metro station close by and the Arc just around the corner! I would definitely recommend this hostel to anyone :)

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext: Nice place with good location and breakfast. But the staff was horrible (except for Lucas, he was amazing). Poor security system. No lockers. Only 3 showers without any hook for 80 people. Plugs without function. No facilities

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext: We would like to thank the staff for all their help and kindness. We felt very comfortable at the hostel. It has a great location in Paris as well. We definitely would come back and we recommend it to other guests.

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext: Great location. The building is lovely and well kept , even immaculate . Atmosphere is great in courtyard, lots of young people. The room size was very large, about 12 in a room connected to another room of 12. Please note if you want to sleep well, don't book this room . Book a smaller room with less beds . However the hostel is good value for money as it's in a very good location with  nice places to eat , walk and shops. No lockers which was a shame but I'm sure the staff would find something

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext: Their page is completely false. Pay for a room of 10? Expect to be placed in a room of 18! Mattresses- paper thin. Triple bunk beds. Power outlets in the room? None of the work and the hallways are littered with people sitting and charging their devices. 3 showers for a floor of about 50. Free breakfast is essentially cereal and juice. Everything can be heard thru these thin walls, and the doors slam hard even if no one forces them shut. If you want a good night sleep, pick anywhere else!

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext:
Good location and decent breakfast. However, there are no social activity. My boyfriend and I are both very sociable people and we often make lots of friends while traveling. But the atmosphere of the hostel is quite isolated. Everyone hangout with people they already know. No one really make any new friends. 
Also, very noisy. If you are a light sleeper like me, you might have trouble falling asleep with the loud music and drunk people screaming right below you. But the staffs were helpful.

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext: The breakfast was so good, the location of  the hotel was  not bad ... about 30 minute far from the eiffel tower . The bus station is close to the hotel.but the wasn,t a hair dryer in hostel.

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext: Its a beautiful building that they keep very very clean! I enjoyed the people working the desk. Many conversations and plenty of cigarettes were shared. One recommendation would be air-conditioning in the rooms but this was a minor subtraction to the overall value of the experience.

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext: Great place, you can find a good company also .. Good breakfast .. the only problem is that the rooms are hot with no fans or air conditioning.

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext: Amazing atmosphere and great location, closer to main places than the map says. Staff were friendly and breakfast was good. Rooms were ridiculously hot though and no air conditioning would definelty stay again

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext: Was an awesome hostel in a great location really close to the metro and bus and a 15-20 minute walk to the Champs ElysÃ©es. Had free breakfast and a modern and clean common area, and the staff were extremely helpful and nice. The only reason I wouldn't stay here again is because there is no air con or fans in the room which made sleeping nearly impossible in the summer heat. If this was fixed I would 100% recommend to everyone but unfortunately this ruined the experience for me.

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext: I absolutely loved this hostel, it's very clean, the staff is very friendly and attentive. It's in a very safe and central area just minutes from the Champs Elysees and close to the metro station. I would definitely stay here again! :)

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext:
Room with 12 beds had only 4 power outlets and non of them worked. 
Internet didn't reach the room either.
The showers had no hooks to place your towel or clothes so you would have to throw them over the top of the door, which stood at  3.5m.
Also expect to be woken at 7am by loud garbage men driving past the Hostel

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext:
For my opinion the hostel is very clean but 
I didn't like the staff in the reception only one of them is very nice person.

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext: The staff was awesome! Would recommend highly for the location, ambience and the absolute value for money, wish there were more washrooms though!!

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext: The stay was nice. It was conveniently located near the louvre, Concord square and the arc du triumph. It also was not far to the Eiffel tower. It however was not located near any train stations so getting to it originally was a bit of a problem. It was also located 30 mins or so from a club called duplex (I recommend it just be sure not to go to the gay bar on accident). the room key situation was f****d. One key per room and none in my room knew what's the key was, we just propped the door open.

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext: The hostel is exactly what it describes. You get a great location and not many amenities. There's no wifi in the rooms but everything was clean, especially the showers. As they say there are no lockers and the rooms just have one key that the last person gives to the front desk. It's a little bit of a funny system but it works and also this is likely the cheapest to get in Paris!

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext: No kitchen which is annoying, and they don't give you a key to your room so you have to ask reception if nobody is there. There are no lockers either so everyone's stuff is just everywhere on the ground. Staff are semi rude but the bathrooms are good and the breakfast and atmosphere are good! Good location right near a metro station too. Would stay again but not for more than 1 night.

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext: This is a good hostel in a beautiful building. The rooms have a lot of charm and I really appreciated the free breakfast, which hardly any hostels ever have. They were doing some construction during my stay and throughout the day men would come into our all-female room. Also we had to share three outlets between 18 girls. But all in all staff if nice, especially Lucas, who was patient with me extending my stay multiple times.

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext:
Beautiful hostel in a nice part of town. Close to a metro line. Convenient if you need to go to Paris BVA early in the morning. 

But, had to wait an hour to check in, and even though I'd booked a 10 bed dorm through hostelworld, I was placed in one that had 27. Only one key for a 27 bed dorm, last person out is supposed to bring it to the front desk but this essentially means there's no way to lock the dorm.

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext: Good atmosphere, decent breakfast and perfect location. Near a metro station, a couple of markets and all the attractions of Paris are easily accessible. I would recommend!

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext:
I booked for a 10 bed dorm and was put in an 18 bed with no truthful explanation or offer of compensation. No lockers, no power sockets and unreliable wifi that doesn't work in the rooms. Only one key that the entire dorm has to share so the room is often left unlocked and anyone could walk in. 
When I asked for a corkscrew I was told it was "against the Hostel's rules" to drink alcohol purchased from outside, a rule that no one is told about. 
Luckily it's a good location and a nice building.

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext: Good location near two different metro stops and easy walk to the Champs-Elysees and heaps of attractions. The staff were super friendly and helpful when needed. Not a lot of communal areas so hard to meet others if you're travelling alone and also no storage for your things, but good for a few nights none the less.

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext: The place is beautiful but it lacked of lots of practical things. There weren't any sockets at the beds to charge; there were only 3 sockets in the whole room on the floor for 12 people. They don't have an elevator. Check out is way too early than normal - 9:30M - and also breakfest is from 7:15 to 9:15. And the bathrooms also lack of sockets and space to be able to change.

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext: Location is great and the building is beautiful, only positives. The staff had several booking issues, we were made to check in to one room one night and to a second the next day, forcing me to wake up before 9:00am on the only day I had to sleep in. The staff was really rude on almost every occasion we spoke. Security is pretty much non-existent with no lockers and no bed assignments. The facilities were not well kept, especially the restrooms. Has potential, but terrible experience overall.

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext: The front gate is unlocked during the day, the luggage room is almost always unlocked, the door to the room didn't have a key so it was always unlocked, and there are no lockers. So basically anyone can come in and take anything at any time. Luckily nothing of mine was stolen but two of my dorm mates had chargers stolen.  There's no lift so if your on the top floor, be prepared for a hike up the stairs every day. The WiFi doesn't reach the room so you have to go downstairs every time.

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext: Overall it was a beautiful building with very clean and open rooms. However, within our dorm of 10, there was a singular tiny sink with little counter space in the corner. The bathroom was the only one on the floor I believe, and was to be shared with everyone on the floor, meaning about 20+ people. There were two decent sized toilettes but one even smaller sink with no counter space what so ever. The courtyard was beautiful and wifi only works there and sometimes the second level.

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext: The bathrooms and showers are dirty, there was no liquid soap to wash your hands at any time. in the room I couldn't charge my mobile because all the USB adapters didn't work. the wi-fi connection doesn't work in the rooms. In the rooms is very hot in the summer and have no fans. I had to sleep on open windows on the ground floor, and people passing by on the street could see the whole interior of the room. On the other hand, the location of the hostel is great and the staff are wonderful.

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext: Front door to the garden was always open/unlocked even though there's a security system? Also, the one-key-per-room system was strange. But overall had a nice experience: breakfast was great, hostel was beautiful and clean, in a lively location.

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext:
Pros:
* Bright, open atmosphere - we ate breakfast outside, lovely!
* Nice staff
* Really close to the metro (2 streets)
Cons:
* Could only pay in cash
* Showers on first floor: hard to keep clothing dry, water spilled from under the doors. Second floor: water was cold
* No security lockers - we took our own locks from home, still, it's something every hostel should have
On the third night our room was changed, but they'd forgotten to tell us. But no complaints: upgraded to private room!

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext: The hostel works, would stay again knowing what I'm facing. Don't have much expectations about it and you'll find it just fine. The breakfast was good, plenty of choices of what to eat. Rooms were too hot and some of the windows wouldn't open.

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext: No hot water to shower. No fans or airflow in the very hot rooms. No electrical plugs by the beds. The hostel did not even have a computer or debit machine, their schedule is in a note pad. Location is far from everything if you are trying to walk around Paris. Close to a metro station though.

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext: Get an airconditioner or some fans, the rooms were overwhelmingly hot. Please tell your staff not to bang on the dorm door at 1am and maybe have more than one key per room. Ran out of towels and only one toilet and two showers shared between an entire level of dorms.

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext:
Only 1 good thing about this hostel is its location right in the heart of the city, the metro station is very near.

1. No tray or locker with the beds. 
2. Water get clogged in the shower the minute you open water. Very unhygienic.
3. Most reception guy except one are slow and make faces when you ask them any questions, I suppose if it's a hostel the staff needs to be welcoming. the one was great except that he was there in only 1 shift.

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext:
-Cons:
-Amazingly depressing small rooms with no ventilation. 
-no fan and no AC (in the list they have mentioned, no laundry, no locker but there was no mention of no AC and no fan). It was extremely hot and in that 4 bed dorm we couldn't survive and asked them to refund the money.
- no wifi in the rooms 
- no free water, you need to buy 2 Euro bottle
- no hot water on second day
- unfriendly staff except one guy. another one was guy. Pls improve your service.
Pro
- good breakfast 
- Location +

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext: This hostel is one of the best deals ever!! It's very clean, the staff is amazingly helpful, the breakfast is nice and the location is quite awesome, there is a metro station less than 2 blocks away and if you want you can walk wherever because it's so close to the city center.

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext: The staff were incredibly rude. Would not stay here again.

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext: Clean room and facilities right near Champs-Elysee. I would stay here again.

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext: Great place, but costly for a hostel. They accept only cash. Beds are unmarked but staff was helping. Recommend it since the location is pretty nice! :)

name: BVJ Champs-ElysÃ©es
reviewtext:
The door was open all the time, so actually, anyone could get in. 
The beds were not assigned so that we just got into the room and took one that looked ass if it was free... but it wasn't, so it was pretty annoying for the girl who slept there the  night before to get there and realize that someone else was sleeping on her bed. 
the wifi didn't work 
there were only a few wall plugs next to the door of the room, so we had to leave our phones there. 
the breakfast was great

name: Absolute Paris Boutique Hostel
reviewtext: Great location close to the metro and plaza, however very noisy at night with drunk people screaming while you are trying to sleep. The rooms are old and not very well kept. Good morning buffet style breakfast and free baggage storage though.

name: Absolute Paris Boutique Hostel
reviewtext: A little pricey for a basic room, but it was clean. Loud at night. Breakfast was over right on the dot, and I missed it. Otherwise bed was comfy, room clean. Nice person at front desk.

name: Absolute Paris Boutique Hostel
reviewtext: The room was clean and it is a great location. Ensuite bathroom is very nice to have. Hot with no fan and on busy street. I booked a 3 bed mixed room and ended up in a 2 bedroom with a man who came stumbling in at 10pm plastered, did not respond when I said hi, peed and then left. I felt unsafe staying in a room alone with him so I headed to the airport 10 hrs early. Receptionist did not offer to change my room.

name: Absolute Paris Boutique Hostel
reviewtext: The rooms are very comfortable and the bathrooms are perfect. Nice and clean. The breakfast is very good and tasty. Nothing to complain about.

name: Absolute Paris Boutique Hostel
reviewtext: In a fab location, in a lovely neighbourhood, close to everything you need, i.e. Maccies and bakeries! Close to Metro station and safe to get home late at night.

name: Absolute Paris Boutique Hostel
reviewtext: The key flaws in this hostel were down to the fact it says hostel in the title and not hotel, as in, there was a lack of atmosphere and the staff seemed a bit confused by us wanting to use their cooking facilities (which were literally just a microwave and nothing else)

name: Absolute Paris Boutique Hostel
reviewtext: Absolute Paris was a comfortable and accessible Hotel only 5 or so minute walk from a Metro Station. We visited in the peak of summer and I'm sure the temperature in the room at night didn't drop below 26-27deg C. It was very uncomfortable. No airvents/aircon in the rooms either, only a miniature desk fan that really didn't provide much relief. Besides the heat, the staff were lovely, bed comfy, close to a number of eateries and very accessible.  Would stay again, just not when it's so hot

name: Absolute Paris Boutique Hostel
reviewtext: excellent!!

name: Absolute Paris Boutique Hostel
reviewtext: Fun quirky neighborhood with metro stops very close so you can get into the city and see all the sights easily.  It is located above a few bars, so it gets noisy at night and the street is pretty noisy too, so bring earplugs if that bothers you.  I had a room with just one other bed, and our own private bathroom ensuite. Very chill atmosphere.

name: Absolute Paris Boutique Hostel
reviewtext: Its very nice

name: Absolute Paris Boutique Hostel
reviewtext: Staff are friendly and helpful.  Keycard security for rooms but none at main entrance.  The rooms are small but clean - perfect if you're just using it to sleep.  The washrooms are so small that it's difficult to move around, especially in the shower.  The WC was clean but from the drains we had a constant sewer smell which affected the whole room and we had to keep the door closed so we couldn't smell it at night.  Good location - only a half hour walk to the Louvre, & a few Metro stops nearby.

name: Absolute Paris Boutique Hostel
reviewtext:
Do not make the mistake of going to the wrong Mcdonalds (as provided on the site)!
We were in a private room during our stay and it was very cosy. Although room space is very tight, you have the necessities at hand. There's an elevator for those staying on higher levels (only takes 1 person (+ their luggage) at a time).

The staff at the hostel are incredible! So helpful, fluent in English and literally go the extra mile for residents.
Location is perfect. There is a train station a block away.

name: Absolute Paris Boutique Hostel
reviewtext:
Absolute Hostel is in such a great location and near several metro lines. Republique is one of my favorite areas because it has everything you need but it's less touristy and only about a 30 minute walk to the center. 

Would recommend this hostel if you just want some alone time in Paris or if you're traveling with friends because I didn't see/interact with anyone outside of reception.

name: Absolute Paris Boutique Hostel
reviewtext: My stay was very good. The staff were excellent and could't have been more helpful. I already decided to recommend Absolute!

name: Caulaincourt Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Good hostel for stay in Paris, free breakfast is a nice touch although maybe some more variety of food could be included.  Quite a quiet hostel, which was ideal for me.

name: Caulaincourt Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
Cons - No lockers, no area to hang and meet people, doing renovations during the dates of my stay, room wasn't attentively cleaned (trash was taken but floors were covered in dirt and hair), the kitchen consisted of a stove top and microwave, stated lock out hours of 11am-4pm (didn't appear to be strictly enforced)
Pros - Hot showers, breakfast was decent, the sitting area had lots of places to plug in and charge, the staff were all very friendly, to rent a towel are only 1 euro, the location

name: Caulaincourt Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: More of a hotel than a hostel. Closeness to the metro was really good for visiting the rest of Paris, and of course all of Montmartre is walkable.

name: Caulaincourt Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
I loved the experience so much!!! It's a great place to stay and I would definitely come back. 
The atmosphere is great if you're just trying to relax and have a good time resting. If you're looking for a party hostel that's not the place

name: Caulaincourt Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: My kids, cousin and I enjoyed our stay.  Breakfast was delicious and was included. There was no air conditioner, but it didn't bother us as we were gone all day and there was a nice breeze in the evening. There's no elevator, but we didn't mind it at all. The stag was nice and it was very clean:) it was walking distance to many places we wanted to visit and the easy access to metro.

name: Caulaincourt Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Really good hostel. Near a station (5 min walk) and right next to a boulangerie, cafe and convenience store. Even when it got to 37 degrees in Paris I was able to sleep fine.

name: Caulaincourt Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Nice hotel, which has some rooms that are laid out as a dorm room. I stayed in a 3 bed dorm, which was nice, tho the bathroom/toilet are really small. Breakfast was nice, oh and be aware of there being a curfew at 2AM.

name: Caulaincourt Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Good wifi, staff very friendly, new towels daily. Perfect location (save for the Montmartre stairs everywhere..) which allows you to see all of 1, 2, 8, 9, 17, and 18th arrond. by foot, and is on the Line 12, with easy access to Concorde and puts you in close walking distance to L'Opera and great shopping and attractions. The bad: Mediocre kitchen, and the shower, though it has great pressure, drained very slowly and pooled, and has mold on the door when pulled shut.

name: Caulaincourt Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Not much of a social hostel, but only a short metro ride from the center of Paris.

name: Caulaincourt Montmartre by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: They didn't say they had construction going on. It was really loud early in the morning and also the smell of cigarette smoke was really strong in the hostel. As if they smoked in the building.

name: Adveniat Paris
reviewtext: As a solo woman traveler I felt really safe and secure . For the location I was a 20 min walk from everything in the center of Paris and loved the walks . The breakfast is very humble but very sweet and the staff was  friendly and super helpful.  I was there for the month of August so it was a bit hot but rooms are well ventilated . In a calm part of Paris so I got to sleep well .  Overall best hostel I've been too.

name: Adveniat Paris
reviewtext: one of the best hostel, ive been. clean easy to access. just perfect for those with a budget. certainly will recommend to others

name: Adveniat Paris
reviewtext:
Worst hostel I stayed in my life!
*Check-in is only from 4 to 10 p.m. If not you have to leave your PASSPORT to a very rude man until you leave.
*Price is not true. They force you to pay a fee to be part of their "community"
*Beds are not ready, you have to make your own bed. (No bed sheets in the room)
*No close plugs, no personal light
*Dirty bathrooms
*Nonexistent staff
*Breakfast is just stale bread with marmalade and coffee
*No hostel atmosphere.
The ony possitive point point is location.

name: Adveniat Paris
reviewtext: When I first came to Paris, the hostel graciously stored my belongings in their storage area free of charge. However, when I went to check in, there seemed to be problems with the arrangement of the living situation. This seemed to be a problem with the booking online rather than the hostel itself, but it was handled with much panic. They have placed all my friends (of different genders) in the same room by accident, but they were very adamant about their Christian rules and reacted strongly.

name: Adveniat Paris
reviewtext: Really great location for sightseeing in Paris. There is no WiFi in the rooms which was a bummer, but overall really nice facilities and a free small breakfast in the mornings. Can't beat the price for the location.

name: Adveniat Paris
reviewtext: great location,clean room,i love it.the price is not soooo great.when i checkin,i paid 5 euro as membership fee.

name: Adveniat Paris
reviewtext:
Excelente hostel, cerca de la zonas mÃ¡s lindas de ParÃ­s. A cuadras del Grand Palais, el Sena y Champs ElyseÃ©s.

Muy cÃ³modos los cuartos y excelente ambientaciÃ³n y facilities.

name: Adveniat Paris
reviewtext: Really great hostel in a great location. Hostel has a very late check in and you are not able to be in your room from 10-4 which is a downside. Rooms are great with 2 showers and 1 toilet to 6 people. Very nice stay.

name: Adveniat Paris
reviewtext: Great place! Close to everything! City is easily walkable from here and can just get on the river to go anywhere. Place was clean and the people were nice! 2 bad things: the bathroom floor was a little dirty and the beds were squeaky so when people rolled over you can here it. Those are tiny bad items. Great place, would recommend and would stay again! Also there is no bar here.

name: Adveniat Paris
reviewtext: This is the worst hostel I've stayed in on my travels. On arrival I got told it was 5 euros extra for membership which isnt clearly stated on hostel world, then go to ask for a towel and its 7euros when on the website it says 4 euros and no apologies... The staff were so rude (didnt know his name but the guy with asian descent) when asking for help to get around the area  and not helpful at all felt very disrespected. The bathrooms had mould growing and dont think it got cleaned every day.

name: Adveniat Paris
reviewtext:
Hostel was in great location but room wasn't clean! 
Overall It was an average stay.

name: Adveniat Paris
reviewtext: Clean place, pretty quiet and a nice backyard area. Good for familys or people that dont like it noisey. Only bad part was no air conditioning.

name: Adveniat Paris
reviewtext: Nice place to be close to the Champs ElysÃ©es. Although the area is totally downtown, this may be the main problem: everything around is extremely expensive, and there are not many shops or supermarkets. Yet, you can buy cheap drinks and vending machine food at the hostel. As for facilities, beds and shower were reasonably comfortable, and they provided a ventilator to fight the heat, which was ok (no air conditioning though). Breakfast was included. There was no Wifi in the room, though.

name: Smart Place Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: This has been my favorite hostel while traveling so far! I got sick the first couple of days I was in Paris, but the cleaning lady was very kind and tried her best to stay quiet for me.. I was able to meet lots of people, and the staff was more than amazing whilst helping me around and giving me advice on things. The place is a little far out, but there are a couple of metro stations within walking distance. I would definitely recommend this hostel to anyone!

name: Smart Place Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Excellent location, very near Gare du Nord which was what I needed. Nice, international staff. Room and bathroom were small but should be expected in an expensive city as Paris. Would like to thank the Serbian night staff for telling the Pakistani guest hassling me to leave me alone. Thanks, man.

name: Smart Place Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
My boyfriend and I had an amazing stay at your wonderful place! Very convenient, clean and the staff were super helpful.

Would recommend to others and would stay here again if ever back in Paris.

name: Smart Place Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Great location in terms of being very close to Gare du Nord (amazing only having a 4 min walk after arriving). The area isn't very nice though and don't feel very safe walking around when it is dark. The Hostel was nice though and the staff were friendly. Clean as well and the kitchen was good.

name: Smart Place Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
Cute little hostel 
Good the have a bathroom in your dorm 
The wifi was a pain! Had to keep re-entering the code for it to work

name: Smart Place Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
The location was really  convenient to Gare du Nord which is why I chose it and it was easy to get to the main attractions from either on foot or metro. 
There were parts of the surrounding area where I didn't feel that comfortable (as a solo female traveller). This is not a criticism of the hostel just a note.
There was black mold in the bathroom which was really off putting and not something I would expect to find in any accommodation I am paying for. 
Staff were friendly enough.

name: Smart Place Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: A nice place to stay directly next to the Gare du Nord train station. Only problems were the staff was not as helpful as we would've liked them to be (asked for a recommendation on a place to eat nearby at about 11am and they told us everything in the area would be closed but there were several cafes that were open right across the street) and there was black mold growing on the ceiling in the bathroom (don't have to touch the ceiling so it didn't bother us much). Room was small but fine.

name: Smart Place Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: The room was on the street so it was noisey. but cool at night.   No air conditioning.   Staff was friendly.   It had an elevator!

name: Smart Place Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: i wouldn't recommend this hostel to anyone. very overpriced, very very small rooms (4 bed dorms are absolutely not big enough for 4 people), visibly dirty. woke up covered in bed bug bites however i have received a full refund for my stay. strange atmosphere. location wasn't bad but i am sure you could find better. probably the worst hostel i have stayed in. the photos do NOT add up to what you're actually staying in!!!

name: Smart Place Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: The location of the hostel was unbeatable for the price. It was a quick two minute walk from the train station, which was incredible. The restaurants surrounding the hostel had amazing food for very reasonable prices. However, the facilities were lack luster. The kitchen was small so there was not a lot of space to cook things. There was also no A/C which was rather difficult when it was almost 35 degrees outside for almost five days straight. But overall, a wonderful place to stay.

name: Smart Place Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
-Good for only a few days. 
-So HOT! 
-Very small lift! can fit 1Person and 1 luggage.
-Corridor and back stair is dirty. 
-You can hear the door bangging especially when the House keeping is cleaning.
-Noisy from the street.
-Reception is helpful 
-Expensive

name: Smart Place Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
Decent if basic rooms, small but with enough space. 
The bathroom was a little dirty but again not bad. 
Staff were very friendly and helpful, and the location was great! The bakery down the road was a big help for quick eats. 
All in all, would recommend.

name: Smart Place Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: I stayed during some quite hit days in summer. There is no air con or fans so we had to have the windows open all night and it's a noisey part of town so it was hard to sleep. The shower was at a weird angle so it sprayed all over the bathroom. The staff were friendly but noone seemed to know that the RER trains to Versailles and Disneyland weren't running (including people that worked at the train station) so it took ages to get there (but normally the location is good). Ask for a Metro map!

name: Smart Place Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Location was convenient in that it was near a main train station but it was rather sketchy (as two girls we felt uncomfortable being outside during the day). Staff was average-friendly and the common areas were clean. The bathroom in the room was unpleasant. Shower was moldy, toilet was visibly unclean. Double charged my credit card shortly after booking. I haven't heard back yet about fixing it, but it is the weekend.

name: Smart Place Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
La limpieza estaba bien. La ubicaciÃ³n bien, cerca de la estaciÃ³n Gare du Nord, lo cual te facilita moverte; pero muy lejos de los centros de atracciÃ³n comunes en Paris. 
Lo peor del hotel, la mujer que limpia, quien maltrata constantemente a los huÃ©spedes y se muestra molesta si al llegar estÃ¡s en la habitaciÃ³n.

name: Smart Place Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: Decent but super hot. No AC or air flow on a hot summer day in Paris

name: Smart Place Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: A good practical hostel to stay in. It felt secure and a good location beside the train station, however the room had no air conditioning so we had to sleep with the window open with sounds of sirens and motorbikes all night, so not great for any light sleepers like myself!

name: Smart Place Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: While the location of the hostel was conveniently close to the north train station, it did not have basic amenities. There was no shower curtain and the shower was in view of many neighbors, the laundry service was down so we were unable to rent towels and the hostel was unbelievably hot during the entire stay. The bathroom showed obvious signs of a lack of proper cleaning, for example we found bugs in the bathtub and lots of hair on the floor.

name: Smart Place Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: building was definitely secure. It was incredibly hot, no air conditioning. Location was very good, close to multiple metro stations and the central train station. Staff were friendly. Foosball table was dope. Bathroom was very small and lots of mold on the ceiling.

name: Smart Place Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext:
WiFi could barely be used, which many international travelers rely on. Facilities need an upgrade as the shower water would rocket from ice cold to scalding hot without prompt and there was no way to avoid this water as the shower is so confined (shower space was less than 1m x 1m or 1yd x 1yd). Rooms were cramped with little storage space and incredibly hot in the summer months. 
Despite this, the staff was excellent. Very friendly and happy to help! The location also could not be beat!

name: Smart Place Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: The staff were excellent, the rooms average. The bathrooms in particular very poor, I couldn't even put the shower head back in its stand it wouldn't fit, the shower glass partition is a safety hazard. It would have been nice if we had a fan as it was so study, with the only ventilation the windows. The windows we needed to close at night due to the noise. The staff and the downstairs area was the best part of the hotel.

name: Smart Place Paris Gare du Nord by Hiphophostels
reviewtext: The sta was excellent. Location is the biggest plus as its 5 minutes walk from Gare du Nord station, and the staion has well cnnctivity across paris. It has round the clock reception and secure card entry to the room.

name: Hotel Darcet Paris
reviewtext: Thi is excellent hotel I loved it, very cozy, very clean and organized and the staff are super polite.I indicated

name: Hotel Darcet Paris
reviewtext: Very helpful and friendly staff!!! Nice location and clean!!! Having a breakfast option would have made life easier :)

name: Hotel Darcet Paris
reviewtext:
Very recently remodeled rooms- practical, comfortable and modern.  Plenty of hot water in a nice shower.  The staff members were a highlight- very friendly, helpful and happy.  Located near Place de Clichy metro- very convenient, off the main streets so it wasn't too loud.  Otherwise, the area immediately around the hotel doesn't have a lot to offer.  This is a residential area.
I will recommend this hotel, for value, convenience, comfort and security, to friends and family.  We will be back!

name: Hotel Darcet Paris
reviewtext: Lovely staff and we walked to most major attractions. Shutters worked really well to block light and noise. Great shower, good air conditioner and comfy bed. Just needed a little more room to put two suitcases.

name: Hotel Darcet Paris
reviewtext: Hotel Darcy was in a very cool location, close to the Metro and the area of Montmartre. The room was clean and comfortable and the air conditioning was great. I loved the Nespresso machine available to use in the lobby.

name: Hotel Darcet Paris
reviewtext: Near Moulin Rouge and the Sacre Couer. Very clean and has everything needed, showers and bathroom were good and there's a shutter on your window to close out the light. Nice, quiet and quaint neighborhood. Free tea and coffee and there's a communal kitchen to use as well. Our beds in the twin room were comfortable and clean as well.

name: Hotel Darcet Paris
reviewtext: Loved our stay here! The staff were so welcoming and we were in a great location to get around the city. Clean and quiet.

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext: Very average hostel, I was only staying a night between transport changes but I wouldn't want to stay for any longer... Cheap accommodation by Parisian standards but they want to charge lots of extra costs and the building/facilities are a bit run down and lacking.

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext: only good thing was the stale breakfast. 1 plug per room for 4 beds. not clean. WiFi hardly works.

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext:
I made a reservation to be placed in an all-girls dorm. However, somehow I ended up in a mixed dorm with three girls and one guy. It was a frustrating mistake on the hostels part and I was told that there was nothing that could be done. Uncomfortable and unpredictable situation. 
Location=great, easy metro access
Cleanliness=okay, our room was neat
important note: there is a baggage storage for all those wanting to leave their belongings during the day before/after check out.

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext: Excellent. I definitely recommend Auberge International des Jeunes in Paris, France.

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext:
Unfortunately, I cannot recommend this place.

I've stayed in over a hundred hostels around the world and all of them have managed to allow the cleaners to do their job without shutting down the entire building for 4hrs per day - except this one! Yes, that's right - you'll be asked to leave the building from 11-3pm every day.

This is some of the worst WiFi I've ever experienced. I had to re-enter the password approximately 20 times per day, and it was unavailable in the lobby for half the day.

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext: Not a bad location - great if you're staying in Paris for an event at the Accor Arena like we were! (Just a 20 min walk). Showers were decent and the room was spacious enough. Not many toilets, and no sinks in them, you back to your room for that.

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext:
Hostel was really dirty and there was mould on the windows also they didn't seem to wash the duvets at all as they had no covers and smelled really bad. Also the cleaners moved all of our stuff around but didn't actually seem to clean anything. Even without the state of the rooms the hostel felt unfriendly and had weird rules to do with the keys. Also the WiFi didn't work. Worst place we stayed in the entire trip.
However breakfast was nice and the metro station is close by.

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext: Really great price and location. A little odd with WIFI cut offs every night.

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext:
I would recommend! Excellent location and value for money. Open 24h and breakfast included. The staff is very friendly and helpful. 
A few details on the downside: the internet in the rooms was not working and the network at the reception is not accessible all the time. The computers available at the hall do not work either. The rooms facing the street are quite loud at night since the hostel is facing a bar.

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext: The place was great. Awesome people staying there very friendly. There were no bag lockers. Though there were safes for your valuables. It's a bit far out of town but that's fine. Overall very memorable stay

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext:
good cheap hostel, wouldn't stay here for too long, but the breakfast is ok and the rooms are fine.
Don't like how you have to stay out of the room between 11am and 3pm because they are cleaning?!

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext: The hostel is in the perfect location, very clean and nice atmosphere

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext: My stay was great as I just needed a bed for the night and ended up having a 2 bed dorm to myself. The safes in rooms for storing valuables were free to use. My only real negative is that there was no hand soap in the toilets.

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext: The staff were nice and the luggage room was useful and they have CCTV in the reception area of the luggage room. The lockers in the room are very small so only fit a small bag and a few valuables. The area is okay in safety but it is a bit out of the way. The hostel is cheap so weren't expecting much for the breakfast (it was a bread roll) but it was fine. The hostel was good for the cost but everything was just okay :/

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext: Ok so starting with the location , it will take you almost 2 hour to reach eiffel tower by walk , rooms are good for this price . They have lockers in the rooms so your stuff like passport money are safe there .breakfast was fine. The only trouble that I faced was : on one night I came late it was room 110 with 3 shared beds ,so I went to reception to pick my keys but they only had two keys for 3 shared bed room , and I had to knock and yes the guys were disturbed as well other than that its ok!

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext: First off, you can't be in your room from 11am-3pm for "cleaning". Which would be fine if the rooms were actually clean, they aren't. However, the beds are rusting at the bottom from all the "cleaning" they do. You can't even be in the lobby from like 10am-1pm for more cleaning. Someone threw up in the lobby and the worker made a few people clean it up. It says it's â‚¬2 for a towel rental when it's actually â‚¬3 and the towels are just floor mats. All-in-all, not great.

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext: Helpful staff, very clean hostel. Would come back!

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext: The thing that made me more upset was that it did not have stairs so you have to carry your own things 3 or 4 floors up. It was comfortable and affordable.

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext: Location was good and they kept the place generally clean. Beds were no good and caused my back to hurt, and considering I stayed during the summer, the rooms did not have fans.

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext: Stayed here 3 nights and it was pretty good. Easy to get into the city center either by metro or walking. The free breakfast was good and the room was comfortable. not much to complain about the place but could do with a bit more atmosphere and friendliness from staff, as well as more shower space. Also having to leave the premises from 11-3 is a bit ridiculous.. I think overall its a good place to stay

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext: Had the impression that no-one invested anything in the hostel since they won some price in 2005. Mattress was not changed since then for sure, it felt like lying in a hanging mat. No soap in any toilet or bathroom. Dark room, no possibility to sit and no cupboard for clothes. Room to store luggage is damp. Very small showers with no possibility to hang towel or clothes. Positiv: the shower-head, they clean regularly and it was cheap.

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext: Ã„Â°ts good i like it , fiyat dengesi iyidir

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext: Not the best but it's cheap and close to a metro

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext: Awesome place, awesome location. Rooms are fine and really just for sleeping so no complaints. Breakfast not the best but for the price no surprise - kept me going for the morning.

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext: It's an excellent place to meet new people, as there are people from all over the world, very open to socializing. The men's toilet on the first floor had its flush broken so it was dirty most of the time, I usually ended up going upstairs to the restroom. The staff were very varied, there was a woman during the day shift who was really nice, but then the man during the night shift was rather rude and unwilling to answer my questions.

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext:
One issue it makes me a bit uncomfortable, I have to leave the room for 4 hours from 11:00  to 15:00, which is long for me because you don't have the right to access to your room even if you need something from it.
For me, cleaning service should be not more than 2 hours .

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext: Simple and clean. I wish they had hand dryers and soap in the restrooms. One night people were loud, but the staff took care of it by quiet hour.

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext: Good staff, Room clean, we stayed at here for 2 nights and private 4beds room.  Not far from the city center.

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext: I never was in the hostel since I called to the hostel one day before to cancel my reservation but apparently they not made it, I want to ask to return my money please.

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext: The location is good but the place is weird. They don't let you go into your room from 11-3 which is super super annoying if you're staying for more than a night. The WIFI if horrible.

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext: You are getting what you paid for. It is cheap. That's that. The worst part was that I booked a double but it was a bunk bed rather than a double.  And you have to drop you key off at the front desk when you leave everyday and pick it back up to access your room again. Very odd.

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext: Biggest issue here are the absurd rules that no other hostels have (with good reason). Review them first before deciding to book. They were a major inconvenience. I'd reconsider coming to this hostel if I could do it all over again. But it was clean, and location is good. Some staff were helpful.

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext: It's not good, but the location and price are great.

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext: This place is nice if you're just looking for a cheap place to stay inside the city. The breakfast was really small and nothing special, you have to leave your room for some hours during the afternoon, the wifi also doesn't work the whole time and the number of showers isn't enough for the number of guests. The stuff was really stressed when I arrived, but all in all friendly.

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext:
The (only) two good things about this hostel are its location and cost(breakfast included).
Honestly the facilities were okay though they don't have elevator for 4th floor's guests.  Ohh I forgot that no A/C was awful.
When I tried to check-in before arriving, their homepage was crazy and didn't work so I just went to reception directly the day I checked in.
I waited almost an hour in the lobby and Idk how to explain the situation. It was just amazing in bad side,
You know, cheap is cheap.

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext: It was bad... but cheap

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext: The rooms were clean and the staff was nice. The WiFi in the rooms is horrible at all times of the day. The reception WiFi is decent, but they shut off the WiFi and kick you out of the lobby at 2 am.

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext: Breakfast was very poor. Rooms were very hot and beds very loud and uncomfortable. Other than that the room was fine, the lockers were good and the showers were very good.

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext: We stayed in a room of four which had one plug socket for the whole room. You weren't allowed in the rooms from 11am - 3pm, as they would kick you out to clean it. The staff were nice and they had free breakfast, which is a plus.

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext: Staff not too friendly, the room was fine, but it was very hot and there was no air conditioning at all in the building, no kitchen either which was a bit annoying but location was really good.

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext: The breakfast consist of only bread and a low quality marmelade. Drinks were like water at all and have no taste. Luggage room has really narrow stairs and has a bad smell.  There are a lot of weird rules like you cant have shower after 11pm. They cut off the water after 11 pm. Only one wc for one floor side which is really not enough. You always have to leave your keys when you are leaving. Only good for one night stay not for longer accomodations. Not recommend at all but cheap hostel anyway

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext: We found our stay here to be awful, there was no assistance from the staff. We asked for water to fill our drink bottles and were sent to the dirty outside garden tap  which did not look clean. We were kicked out of our room from 11-3, we paid for a room which we were unable to access for 4 hours a day. We had to drop off our key to front reception every time we left the hostel, this did not make us feel safe about our belongings. The place was dirty and smelt like mould!!

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext: Good location - just a 10min Walk from Gare de Lyon. The breakfast is pretty basic (just a baguette, jam, orange juice) but generally a good choice to stay - comfy beds, decent bathroom, good nightlife.

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext:
Kitchen had the weirdest smell. I saw people cleaning it but wouldn't have wanted to cook there. I made some sandwiches but couldn't stay long inside.
The staff was typically French:cold but helpful when they needed to be. Great location out of the city center. Montmartre is awesome and this hostel was nice and close to the metro!

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext: All clean and lovely staff and accommodation, had an amazing stay here. It was quite far out but if you are happy to walk or catch the metro it's brilliant.

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext: Lady at reception was very friendly and helpful. Beds were comfortable. Lockable Safe in room. Only one toilet per floor. Microwaves available and free breakfast and coffee. Not a friendly atmosphere. Bedrooms are off limits for 4hrs a day 11-3pm. Cleaning lady was very rude to us when we asked to go to our room during this time. Hostel is not in the best location. Overall an average experience and would not stay here again.

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext:
If you can work the metro, the hostel is in a great location. But otherwise it's a long trek around Paris. 
The receptionist we met when checking in was great and helpful. 
We stayed in a 4 bed mixed dorm ensuite. The ensuite was small but value for money. 
All in all. Was a good stay in Paris.

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext: The only bad thing is that is doesn't have refrigerators and the unisex bathroom (and also the breakfast its a bit greedy). But overall is good considering the price

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext: Good value for money. However there is basically no power points in the rooms, which force you to go downstairs to charge.

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext: Ensuite toilets and showers were very bad, the main ones were better. A nice location just a bit shoddy. No lockers but safes. Cooking facilities only consists of a microwave. However it is cheap and near central Paris.

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext: For a bed to sleep in for a cheap amount in a good location this place is fine.  However the atmosphere was non existent - there was no guest kitchen and the half of the staff were incredibly rude.  My biggest problem, however, was the cleanliness of the room - I ended up having to go to the doctors and losing a lot of money after getting bitten by a spider in the bedroom and having a bad reaction to it - making me think that the room was not kept particularly clean.

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext: Really cool location, and nice atmosphere

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext: Great location, just needs updating and WiFi kept cutting in and out. Breakfast was nice but just a microwave as kitchen facilities is hard.

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext: Really bad service. Also really bad beds and they where not clean. This hostel does not worth your money since is not that cheap.

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext: A true hostel experience. The wifi sucks, the free breakfast is repetitive, they kick you out of your room from 11am-3pm for cleaning, the bathrooms are tiny, the beds are not the greatest, and checking in takes forever. HOWEVER, it's in a pretty cool location--walking to central Paris takes about 30-40 mins, the wifi being terrible pushes you to go out and explore the old fashion way and the people you will meet makes up for a lot of the hostels cons. I would definitely book this place again.

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext:
Had to wait 40 minutes in a queue in to collect my keys to my room, even though I had checked in online before, and there were only about 4 people in the queue in front of me. 

When I got my keys to my room, there was someone's stuff all over the bed I was meant to stay in, obviously a bit of a miscommunication problem here. Receptionist seemed reluctant to help. 

1 plug socket in a 4 bed dorm and the ensuite bathroom reeked of blocked drain, no bath mat or anything so water everywhere

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext: I had an awful experience here. Not only do the rooms feel unsafe and unwelcoming but the staff are also rude and incompetant. I was told even though i was very sick i was not allowed to go into my room between 11 and 3. Then as if this is not enough, i asked to extend my stay two days before i was due to check out and the reception told me to come back on the day that i was due to leave and rebook it then "it will be fine" when i did this they said they had no room. this is the worst hostel.

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext: Staff were helpful, rooms were clean, breakfast not really worthy of being called breakfast.

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext: Upon arrival the reception staff did not seem to know about our booking and told us that they were fully booked. It was only after we showed them booking confirmations that they managed 'squeeze' us in, although not in the same room for both nights, they split us up for the second of the two nights. The communal area is open and a good place to meet other travellers and the breakfast is okay. The receptionist also gave us the wrong key card so a man walked into our room very late at night.

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext: Place is alright but slightly pricey. Near a local metro station too

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext: The people who stayed were much older than 30. It wasn't the atmosphere that I predicted. Also, my room only had one power socket for four people.

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext:
Honestly, I can't find any reason to come back anymore. The room is absoulety hot even I opened the window, noisy anytime since the room is very close to the corridor, everyone keeps walking and talking. 

There's only 1 dark light in the room, very difficult to see. Luggage store/room are smelly, there's no lift, you have to carry all your stuffs.

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext: This does not feel like a hostel, but like a factory: you're not treated like a person, just another unit to make money off. The rooms are tiny and without character, the breakfast is measured out and impersonal, and the luggage room feels unsafe, so we dropped our stuff at a locker at the train station instead. Would not stay here again.

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext: Excellent stay, we received our own room, two beds for ourselves!

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext: Really hot, with a LOT of random rules that make no sense. Wouldn't stay here again.

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext: Absolute joke, never been to such a s**t hole before. The beds are disgusting and the frames sink in. They close the rooms for 4 hours a day. Oh you left something in your room? Well f*** you then come back in 4 hours. And breakfast is one piece of dirty bread. Literally they gave a baguette that was dirty. They also don't enforce their age limit I met a guest who was 60+

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext: Great place to stay short term. Alittle outdated, could use a good renovation. Breakfast was ok, nothing special. Staff was friendly and helpful. Close to the Metro and mcds and other good street food. Walking distance to the canal and other main attractions. Showers were decent. Lights could be brighter. Overall a very cute old school hostel.

name: Auberge Internationale des Jeunes
reviewtext: The location is good and the complimentary breakfast is good value but the staff weren't very nice, the facilities are old and lacking (no outlet ports at the beds, one toilet per floor, shower drainage was bad so water went everywhere and there was minimal room to get changed after a shower. We paid for a private room with two beds and got a bunk bed which was disappointing.

name: BVJ Opera-Montmartre
reviewtext: Over it was good. But I don't like how they do not check each person card when they come in. The sheets could be replaced, they looked dirty but I was too tired to do anything about it so I slept in them. They served coffee, Orange juice, toast, yogurt, and cereal for breakfast which was nice.

name: BVJ Opera-Montmartre
reviewtext: I had booked this place on a whim before reading any reviews, which i chose to do on my way to check in and there were tons of bad reviews. However, I thought the hostel was very clean, bathrooms and showers separate which is nice. Only one key per room which would be my only complaint really, and no lockers to store my stuff so you are putting alot of trust into your roommates which I had no problem with. Front desk was friendly and helpful. For a decent price I wouldn't expect much more!

name: BVJ Opera-Montmartre
reviewtext: The location is amazing. Except one of the staff who apparently was bored of people, others were so nice. Breakfast was good enough as well. However, the biggest issue is not having lockers. Or appropriate place for leaving your stuff. It made me very tired carrying all my stuff for two days.

name: BVJ Opera-Montmartre
reviewtext: Spartan sanitarian installatons, messy reception desk and  flap secury devices for personal belonging downsize overall impression

name: BVJ Opera-Montmartre
reviewtext: I really like this place I will come again

name: BVJ Opera-Montmartre
reviewtext: One of the best Hostels I have stayed in Europe. This says it all!

name: BVJ Opera-Montmartre
reviewtext:
Very pleasant staff, multi-ligual which is very appreciated, especially in France...
Only flaw I could find is, in my opinion not secure luggage room.
Thank you very much for everything.

name: BVJ Opera-Montmartre
reviewtext: The hostel location is amazingly good. The facilities in the hostel such as the beds, shower, access to building anytime is super good. Highly recommended.

name: BVJ Opera-Montmartre
reviewtext:
I was told there would be lockers for me to keep my stuff but there weren't any and I had to roam around Paris with my bags on me all day.

One of the sinks in the room was clogged throughout my stay.

name: BVJ Opera-Montmartre
reviewtext: Great place and friendly staff but the showers and washrooms are a bit scary.

name: BVJ Opera-Montmartre
reviewtext: Had a nice stay at BVJ hostel, initially it was hard to find. The key situation concerned me in terms of safety of my stuff, but everything was fine. The lobby is quite beautiful and the area it is in has many bars and restaurants and is very central

name: BVJ Opera-Montmartre
reviewtext: BVJ Opera-montmartre is located in a very good area, it's convenient to go to any place in Paris. They also serve good breakfast :)

name: BVJ Opera-Montmartre
reviewtext:
The building is absolutely beautiful, more so than many hotels I've stayed at. Especially the lobby and courtyard. 
The rooms are neat, and beds have draws beneath (not big enough for luggage) and sinks and mirrors in the rooms. Free breakfast is decent, cereal bread coffee juice etc. 
Only negatives are the toilets have no seat and no sink or mirror in them and showers very small so hard to avoid getting clothes wet.

name: BVJ Opera-Montmartre
reviewtext:
Lovely hostel!
Good location!
No lockers, and only one room key. However great staff!
Breakfast was basic

name: BVJ Opera-Montmartre
reviewtext: BED BUGS. This hostel has a bed bug problem that is out of control. My legs have 10 bites on them after my stay. The morning that I checked out on 8-26, I finally found one of the bugs and when I squished it blood came shooting out of it. That is the blood that the bug had been sucking from me all night.  Unacceptable and I wish I would have checked out immediately but they want there cash up front for your stay. It almost like they knew about the problem and force you to stay or lose your money

name: BVJ Opera-Montmartre
reviewtext: The place is beautiful. My biggest issue is that I'm confident there is a bed bug issue there that isn't being handled. When I checked into my room it had a pungent smell, I checked my sheets and the mattress and I saw a bed bug. I went to grab my phone take a picture of it but the bug went away. I checked google reviews of the hostel and the staff response to this issue was deplorable. I wasn't in the mood to argue or anything so I just checked out the same day.

name: BVJ Opera-Montmartre
reviewtext: Very friendly staff, and a beautiful building in a great location! Very close to a metro line. The facilities were a bit worse than expected, but you get what you pay for. (The toilets didn't have toilet seats on them, and the 11-person dorm room only had 4 electrical outlets so everyone was jostling to charge their phones at night). But otherwise, great place for this price and location, with free breakfast too.

name: BVJ Opera-Montmartre
reviewtext: Just the kind of place I needed in Paris. Charming. Basic. Well located and with great people at reception.

name: BVJ Opera-Montmartre
reviewtext: Le dÃ©jeuner dÃ©butait tardivement, les gens de la cuisine Ã©tait peu serviable, pas de cuisine, pas de couvre-feu, bruyant, pas de casier de sÃ©curitÃ© barrÃ©e. C'Ã©tait propre.

name: BVJ Opera-Montmartre
reviewtext: The location was really great and close to montemarte, as well as the metro line 12. Room was nice, bathrooms were kind of dirty and not the place where you want to spend a lot of time. Staff was great and breakfast was okay.

name: BVJ Opera-Montmartre
reviewtext: Awesome place, really pretty, clean, and friendly staff. The prices include breakfast which is satisfactory, showers are warm and clean, nice temperature even without AC with big windows. Would highly recommend this hostel to anyone who doesnt mind being a little farther from down town. It is a quick walk to moulin rouge and the basilica up on the hill, beautiful veiws.

name: BVJ Opera-Montmartre
reviewtext: Staff were great and very helpful. Showers and toilets were often dirty and smelly. Happy with our stay!

name: BVJ Opera-Montmartre
reviewtext: We really enjoyed our stay at BVJ and have both said we could come back in a heart beat. The staff were really lovely and so helpful, we couldn't have asked for more helpful staff. We ended up extending our stay in Paris because we loved it so much. I would highly recommend staying.

name: BVJ Opera-Montmartre
reviewtext: The staff was helpful and the hostel was clean and comfortable. I would stay here again.

name: BVJ Opera-Montmartre
reviewtext:
BEDBUGS!!/DES PUSES!!// CHINCHES DE CAMA!!

I wish I could show you my body! I was bitten Soo much! After I brought it to the attention of the person in charge, he didn't take any responsibility saying that someone must have brought the insects into the hostel. He switched our room but neglected to tell the other 6 girls in the room of the event. In fact they just made the bed as if nothing happened. This place is a menace to your health. AVOID at ALL COSTS!!!

name: BVJ Opera-Montmartre
reviewtext: The hostel's location is ideal and amazing staff. Cleanliness and breakfast could be improved. Overall I enjoyed my stay :)

name: BVJ Opera-Montmartre
reviewtext: Good place

name: BVJ Opera-Montmartre
reviewtext: Great Location, friendly staff & average breakfast (it does the job, fill up on carbs if your on a budget ;). You don't get your own key for the room nor a locker for your valuables which is a shame. Showers were really bad, not many worked properly and flooded the whole shower room & drains smelt pretty bad. The court yard is really nice and social and they have a piano which is played all night long (no joke, bring ear plugs) would stay again for location!

name: BVJ Opera-Montmartre
reviewtext: No kitchen at all not even microwave, fridge or utensils so make sure you're ok with that before booking. Security is not great I was in an all female dorm and woke up one morning to a man sleeping on the top of my bunk, he was very creepy towards me in the morning and we told staff and they later removed him. he had gone into the wrong room upon check in.. this can happen as there is only one key everyone shares so the doors dont get locked at night. They definitely need a safer lock system

name: BVJ Opera-Montmartre
reviewtext:
The bathrooms are terrible.. although the room was really good. And also the kept me waiting for check in till 2:30 when i reached at 1:15pm at the hostel even though the room
Was ready n i asked them that i wasnt feeling well.. i could understand if the next day i didnt see that the let other people check in at 1pm .. so i did not like this that they are biased.. for whatever reason now.. at that time small things mattered.. coz we r bagpackers n we come from long journeys

name: BVJ Opera-Montmartre
reviewtext: Stayed 5 nights at this hostes. Really good location but really bad wi-fi and bathrooms. Water was way too hot. Bathrooms were like a sauna and mot much space.

name: BVJ Opera-Montmartre
reviewtext: Great staff. Good location, I felt safe early in the morning and late at night around the hostel. Breakfast was meh. It was good to start but I need something else.

name: BVJ Opera-Montmartre
reviewtext: It felt like a very safe place to stay. For the location it was incredibly good value. I'd definitely recommend walking up towards Montmartre to see the view. The receptionists are friendly and helpful and let us keep our bags in the luggage room on the day we arrived and the day we left. Each room has a key which has to be handed back to reception when the last person leaves. The breakfast was very good and the ladies nice but they are very quick at putting it away at 9.15. Would go back.

name: BVJ Opera-Montmartre
reviewtext: Dont be fooled by the facade or reception area. Showers aren't great. It's near impossible to use the toilets. Very little security as the dorm rooms are nearly always open. Lack of kitchen for the visitors. Lack of assistance from some of the staff regarding noise. The only plus is that the beds are comfortable and clean aswell as the location is fairly close to the centre.

name: BVJ Opera-Montmartre
reviewtext: Very beautiful building.

name: BVJ Opera-Montmartre
reviewtext: Great laid back hostel, a great place to hang out and read during the hot Paris afternoons. Friendly staff, and good free breakfast.

name: BVJ Opera-Montmartre
reviewtext:
Breakfast lady seemed upset with others and then me.
Construction/sanding noise would have been OK but workman opened my door during my sleep and told me to pack my things for a new room. Then new room assignment took a few hours. Very uncomfortable

name: BVJ Opera-Montmartre
reviewtext: The showers were kind of gross and there was nowhere to put your stuff because it was wet everywhere. There's no lockers in the rooms and you all share one key, so if one person is in the room the room will be unlocked. The patio is nice but expect to be woken up by the clanking of the furniture at around 7 if you have a window facing it. Free breakfast was great.

name: BVJ Opera-Montmartre
reviewtext: The Opera Hostel is so good, nice rooms but left connections for charge phone near the bed. The garden is amazing for drink and eat something with friends and relax. The breakfast is amazing, a lot of foods and many kind and all you can eat, I loved this hostel and I advice for everyone, I hope come back someday

name: BVJ Opera-Montmartre
reviewtext: Great youth hostel at a great price. Check-in was easy, they have a luggage storage room and free breakfast, and the bathrooms were kept relatively clean. Keep in mind that bathrooms on each floor are shared and co-ed even when you're staying in a girls only dorm. The shower stalls are also small so don't bring your clothes in there or they will get wet. Only 5 minute walk from the metro 12 line, and like 10 minute walk from the heart of Montmartre neighborhood.

name: BVJ Opera-Montmartre
reviewtext: This is just a place to stay. Feels like old France but facilities there are just there because you need them. No toilet seat covers, shower floors flood. The day we left (a day early), there was a lot of obnoxious construction in the halls where there was tons of dust, definitely not safe for people to inhale and painting. We left for the reason and emailed to get the nights stay refunded, but no response. No AC and no place to lock up stuff. Only one key for a shared dorm ??

name: BVJ Opera-Montmartre
reviewtext: more than 30 mins to check in, in other hostels it takes only 5min.i had to fill out a form again with the same info even if i already had done my reservation online and pay by cash cause they didnt have the terminal which i had to go find an ATM . Not very good security, there's only one key to the room, and the last one to come out has to take it to the reception but people tend to forget and they dont give it back. the baggage room doesnt have lockers and  anyone can have access to it,

name: BVJ Opera-Montmartre
reviewtext:
bugs in the room
Only ONE key to share with all the roommates (it means...door always open to let everyone enter)
very low quality food for breakfast
no hair dryer available at the reception
only a few people in the staff were nice
no rules for the check in and the check out
no credit card accepted as a payment method
the only good things were the location and the beautiful old building

name: BVJ Opera-Montmartre
reviewtext: Great bed room. Tight compact washroom and facilities. Breakfast isn't really their strong point but what you get is the price you pay for. Ridiculously cheap. Great backyard. Thank for having me

name: BVJ Opera-Montmartre
reviewtext: No seats on the toilets or soap, mold in the hallway and showers. Very unclean.

name: BVJ Opera-Montmartre
reviewtext: Friendly staff. Breakfast was free but mostly breads and cheeses, the coffee was burnt. Beautiful, historic building and the location was excellent. Really just a place to sleep, though the outdoor courtyard was lovely. My friend and I were in a 4 bed female dorm but there was one set of bunk beds and the other was a bed with another pull out one in the middle of the floor. It meant absolutely no walking space and was certainly not advertised as a bed on the floor, it was advertised as bunk beds

name: BVJ Opera-Montmartre
reviewtext: It was by far the worst hostel I have ever stayed in. I stayed in a room for 10 people and they only had 4 plugs (only close to the door, not one for each bed) and we had to take turns charging our phones, also I couldn't be in my bed and near the phone at the same time. They didn't sell adaptors, but they said they did. The wifi didn't work properly. They don't have a public kitchen, which is ridiculous in a expensive city like Paris. The key to our room was broken and we had to share it.

name: BVJ Opera-Montmartre
reviewtext: The hostel itself was absolutely gorgeous and very clean . I definitely enjoyed my stay here. The unfortunate thing is that while I visited my roommates were well into their 50s, there were also dozens of children there for a field trip, in conclusion not the best place to meet fellow backpackers. Location wise if you want to be right in the middle of all of the sights, this isn't for you. But if you don't  mind a 15-20min walk it's perfect.

name: BVJ Opera-Montmartre
reviewtext: Lights in our room did not work. Shower drain was plugged. Toilets did not have seats. Bedrooms were dirty and sheets were ripped. Some beds were just mattresses on the floor. Coffee was served in bowls.

name: BVJ Opera-Montmartre
reviewtext: Such an amazing location and so many great group activities that are available with this hostel!

name: BVJ Opera-Montmartre
reviewtext: Beautiful building and great location for exploring Montmartre. Not much of an atmosphere, but still a fun place to stay due to location. Near metro lines, so there is flexibility as well.

name: BVJ Opera-Montmartre
reviewtext: Very nice hostel, clean and very good location.

name: BVJ Opera-Montmartre
reviewtext: Good Hostel. Wifi is now free. Sadly no lockers in rooms and need to pay for lockers. Sinks and toilets are not in the same room. Good location and fun atmosphere.

name: BVJ Opera-Montmartre
