reviewtext: Bedbugs! Right on my pillow crawling! I went to the desk asking what could be done and they moved me and another guy who had gotten bitten already! I had to go through my bag and clothes and once I was in the new room it also took me a long time to sleep and even when I did I always woke up since I feared there might be bedbugs there as well. I tried talking to the receptionist but they kept on pushing me off and telling me to email. I have emailed several times but they never responded...

name: BVJ Opera-Montmartre
reviewtext: The one thing I didn't like about this hostel was that they have no air conditioning. In a room that you are sharing with 12 other people, you can imagine trying to sleep in a humid 80+ degree environment.  The other thing that I didn't like is that the rooms have no lockers. so everyone  leaves their backpacks out in the open hoping that the last person out locks the room. I came from a hostel in Rome which had air conditioning, and individual lockers in the room. The breakfast is actually good

name: BVJ Opera-Montmartre
reviewtext: Generally good, too expensive for what you get but so is everything in paris. Really clean, nice staff, comfy beds, no lockers so thats un settling. You cant change the shower temperature so they are really hot, there is space to leave your bag if youre early. I had to move rooms and was not allowed in any room for 2 hours which was annoying. Wifi is really good. No power points at beds either. Overall was okay but probably wouldnt stay again.

name: BVJ Opera-Montmartre
reviewtext: The recipient looks great. Toilets, bathrooms and the room aren't that clean. I was in a 10-bed female dorm, there were two bed on the floor without a proper bed frame. There was no AC and we couldn't keep the window open as people were talking super loudly in the garden till late at night . It would be much better if people can be asked to return to their room after 11pm. The best part about the stay was the free breakfast.

name: BVJ Opera-Montmartre
reviewtext: The hostel was very accommodating when we had to arrive before check-in time. The only downfall was that the bathrooms lacked ventilation and therefore smelled and were damp. However, the staff was great in addition to the free breakfast spread.

name: BVJ Opera-Montmartre
reviewtext: This property is infested with bed bugs. I was notified of this by a fellow traveller who was COVERED in bites. When we said that we did not want to stay there they refused us a refund and treated us very poorly. We slept in the cafeteria on their banquettes in order to avoid the bug infested rooms. Prior to the bug discovery, I tried to shower but the communal areas haven't been cleaned in weeks. The building also smells of mold. RUN away from this hostel. Find somewhere else to stay. Please!

name: BVJ Opera-Montmartre
reviewtext: Quite simple accommodation, just a bed in a room. The area could be a little noisy at night, making it difficult to get straight to sleep. Otherwise the place was comfortable and the staff helpful. Note that there are no lockers. The breakfast in the morning was quite good, including fresh baguettes. The entrance to the building is beautiful and the location is quite convenient to walk or catch the subway to the main attractions of Paris. The location seemed to be family friendly as well.

name: BVJ Opera-Montmartre
reviewtext: Location was good. Disappointed there were no lockers in the rooms, but the place felt safe. Breakfast is ok. Showers were cold. Paid for a bed in a 10-bed dorm but there were actually 12, so felt cramped. Had to make do with a mattress on the floor for a bed.

name: BVJ Opera-Montmartre
reviewtext: Apart from the beautful, this hostel has little to offer. The staff does not give you a room key when you check in so you have to rely on the other roommates to let you in, and if they aren't there you have to go all the way back down to the lobby for another key. The showers only work if you hold down the button the entire time and attempt to bathe with one hand, and the toilets were always gross. There is also no a/c and its absolutely unbearable, at least in the summer.

name: BVJ Opera-Montmartre
reviewtext: El staff es muy amable. En el cuarto que yo me quede (dorm 10 mujeres) no habÃ­a aire acondicionado. No hay enchufes cerca de tu cama, solo alentar al cuarto. El desayuno es muy sencillo pero definitivamente te ayuda a matar el hambre! Hay una estaciÃ³n de metro muy cerca.

name: BVJ Opera-Montmartre
reviewtext: I had a really great experience tho I doubt it's typical. I paid for a bed in the 10 bed all female dorm last minute. Yet in the end there were only 2 ppl including me in the room. Plus there's a door in the middle of the big room that sort of separates it into 2 small rooms. So essentially I had a room of 4 beds to my own. Naturally I had a lovely time. (Tho there's no plugs in my half of the room). (I could hear some noises, the weirdest one being someone playing an actual piano)

name: Boissiere
reviewtext: Great hostel! Location was great! It's very close to the metro, line 3. It wasn't in Paris city center but very close to it! I would stay here again. Rooms were clean and decent sizes (private ensuite). Not sure about dorms. The staff was also very friendly! Luggage storage was great as we got to spend the early part of the day around Paris before catching our train.

name: Boissiere
reviewtext: I really enjoyed my stay there.

name: Boissiere
reviewtext: A nice room with a window to the street outside the hotel. Comfortable bed and bathroom. Good wifi. Quiet neighbourhood and not far from a Metro station.

name: Boissiere
reviewtext: Cute place. Very nice staff

name: Bastille Hostel
reviewtext: No wifi on the third floor and a weird shared key system. But it was cheap and had breakfast so not all bad! I would probably stay somewhere else next time but wasn't unhappy with my stay this go around.

name: Bastille Hostel
reviewtext: Good hostel, would stay again.

name: Bastille Hostel
reviewtext: Woman at the reception was rude

name: Bastille Hostel
reviewtext: This hostel is a good price and a great location. It's located right next to Gare de Lyon and Place de la Bastille which is good for both walking and taking transit. I had a somewhat negative experience here, because my booking was lost so I had to change rooms every night. the Free breakfast is a dry baguette and some coffee so don't plan too heavily on that. some of the facilities felt like they were one step away from breaking. It's a budget place, so I would not expect too much.

name: Bastille Hostel
reviewtext: Where do I start. They didn't give me a key to my room, I had to be let into my room every time I left to go to the bathroom. It was extremely hot. There wasn't a real locker in the room. They kick you out of the room to clean at 11 when your trying to catch up on sleep after travelling for 2 days. I wouldn't recommend this hostel to anyone. Staff wasn't great either.

name: Bastille Hostel
reviewtext: This was a terrible hostel to stay at. The amenities were okay. Breakfast was fine and the rooms were fine. The main problem was the staff. I booked here. Was charged three times. They switched my second night room, and proceeded to make me pay cash for the the second night again. They didn't have a key to the room so I had to be escorted there and once I was in my room, I couldn't leave because the door would lock behind me, so I couldn't use the washroom or shower. - staff were uncaring.

name: Bastille Hostel
reviewtext: Definitely the worst hostel I've ever been to. Extremely rude staff.

name: Bastille Hostel
reviewtext: Staff ok, room clean, but all ugly and old.

name: Bastille Hostel
reviewtext: This hostel was decent for the price for a private room with a shower. However, the AC does not properly work and when you are on the 6th floor it's so hot you can barely breathe. I cancelled my second booking and stayed elsewhere because it was too hot. The sheets were also unwashed. If you stay here I recommend doing so during cooler months and maybe bring your own sheets. The free breakfast was nice and you are close to the metro though.

name: Bastille Hostel
reviewtext: I had a nice experience at this hostel, but the elavator was not working when we were there. Staff was very friendly, location was okay. I think the breakfast could be a bit more or just diverse, for example not the same every day. I was a bit dissapointed by the breakfast, but overall nice experience.

name: Bastille Hostel
reviewtext: Bad WiFi, very hot with no AC. Front desk people hardly will talk or look at you. The beds are squeaky and uncomfortable. There is one bathroom per 3 floors or so and I had to leave my room at 11AM for cleaning and I couldn't get back in until 3. I'd say that is no reason to put yourself through this if you are able to spend a couple more Euros

name: Bastille Hostel
reviewtext: Overall a good hostel, great location, but was very warm at night and could be a little cleaner.

name: Bastille Hostel
reviewtext: They have a lockdown daily from 11:00 to 15:00. For me, this was a huge inconvenience. The staff members were not very nice. The elevator didn't work and had to carry bags up and down the 4th floor, but they didn't care to help.

name: Bastille Hostel
reviewtext:
STAY FAR AWAY.
Spend the little extra money and get your self a real accommodation
The room was ok. The AC does not work, i suffered in very hot humid room throughout day/ night .. Bring your own towel because they don't provide i had to use my bed sheet.

Staff is hit and miss some are are rude some are nice
wifi isSOOOOOOO slow
you will be kicked out everyday 11pm-3pm for "cleaning"
breakfast is a joke.

over all don't come here and waste ur money spend the extra few euros

name: Bastille Hostel
reviewtext: This place was severely below average. No AC and rumors of bed bugs. Left after 2 days despite having it for 3. Could not handle another night there.

name: Bastille Hostel
reviewtext: The accommodations were advertised as having AC, which was broken upon our arrival. Given the warm temperatures outside and lack of ventilation in the rooms, we were unbearably hot and had to check out a night early. We would not have booked our stay if we had known there would not be AC. The cleaning staff also put my filthy suitcase on top of my bed, leaving dirt all over my pillow and sheets. I was told by the front desk receptionist that I would need to pay for clean sheets.

name: Bastille Hostel
reviewtext: They cancelled my booking!

name: Bastille Hostel
reviewtext: Unsecure: there is a lockout from 11-3 where u are not allowed is your room AT ALL not even to get a jacket. At 10:30 someone walked in my room while I was getting dressed without knocking. This happened the second day as well but I made sure I was dressed. I had locked the door from the inside but apparently that is just false security. I felt very unsafe sleeping here knowing that several people could get into my room. Security was the biggest downfall but I could keep going. Don't stay here!

name: Bastille Hostel
reviewtext: "Free wifi" pretty much only worked in the common room downstairs, and it was very slow. The staff seemed like they'd gotten the complaint before and didn't care. The rooms only had 2 outlets, one of which was attached to a light. The hostel itself was in a convenient location, which made traveling easier.

name: Eurohotel St Denis
reviewtext:
The man who was in the reception was so disrespectful. He didn't even speak english or made any effort. As he said, he only spoke french cause that is Â«Â the language spoken in FranceÂ Â». 
Moreover, the hostel was vert hot and we couldn't open the window because it was in the street side and everyone could see us (there wasn't any blind, just a thin curtain)

name: Eurohotel St Denis
reviewtext:
Two words
BED BUGS
Saw bugs in bed horrid! Went down stairs asked for a refund. Which is not the worse the worse is when you go back home 
1. Didn't refund me gave me some dry Pasteur for free for breakfast
2. Has to throw out $400 worth of luggage 
3. Has to buy tons of cleaners to kill the bugs
4. Things that could not be cleaned had to be thrown away!!!
5. Itching 
6. The place is dirty 
7. The area is horrid I saw places no one would want to know exist in Paris
8. Cost hundreds!!!

name: Eurohotel St Denis
reviewtext: The rooms are stuffed with beds and no moving space. Lot of noise and terrible wifi. The overall ambience and the neighbourhood is terrible. Rather pay a little more and stay in a better locality. Overall not VFM

name: Luna-Park Hotel
reviewtext: I stayed here for one night and I don't think I would have liked to stay for very much longer. The place is okay but it is very dated inside, the beds are very hard and there are no toilets in the rooms (toilets and showers are both down the hall, in different directions). The people at the front desk were nice. Definitely just a place for people passing through, no atmosphere or place to meet other travelers like at many other hostels.

name: Luna-Park Hotel
reviewtext: Great location close to several subway stations. Friendly staff and decent rooms for just staying the night. The reception is open 24/7, so you don't have to worry about returning too late!

name: Luna-Park Hotel
reviewtext:
It's in a good location, near to metro stations.
Our shower was broken and the bathroom is really small (double bed and ensuite).
In their hostel world page they say that they have Luggage Storage. I assumed it was a locker or something, but we had to leave the bags on the floor at the reception.
The housekeeping service was nice.

name: Hotel Gerando
reviewtext:
It's a decent little hotel quite near Metro and few minutes walk from Montmartre.
Although it was missing on the character the hotel was very clean and that's obviously very important.
It's a good place to book if you travel on a budget  and just look for a good night of sleep after a long day on the streets of Paris.

name: Hotel des Arts
reviewtext: I really enjoyed my stay at Hotel des Arts and feel it is a great value. It's very trendy, well located for walking into central Paris, and the front desk staff is exceptional. They all went above and beyond to make my stay pleasant. I would highly recommend them!

name: Pariscoree
reviewtext: Overall great experience. Make sure you check your email to know how to get in before you arrive! It's not in central Paris, however a short walk from the metro, a shopping centre, and plenty of food. The staff was a lovely family, they even let me store my bags there for a few hours while I waited for my train. As far as hostels go, very low key and chill environment. Comes with lockers, curtains on bed and free fruit. Thank you Pariscoree for the lovely stay â™¥ï¸

name: Pariscoree
reviewtext: Staff was very nice and friendly. Close to metro and buses so easy to get around. Would definitely stay again

name: Pariscoree
reviewtext: Wasn't the best hostel. There was no environment and the location wasn't great in general. It is very close to the Paris subway though, which makes it quite a comfortable trip anywhere.

name: Pariscoree
reviewtext: They were very friendly and helpful people who went out of their way to make us feel welcome! The location was also very good as it is only a 2 minute walk to the metro stop. However, it is worth noting that the 'mixed dorm' is not a proper room but rather has been set up in the corridor and so it can be difficult to sleep as the lights are kept on until very late and it is noisy.

name: Pariscoree
reviewtext: Clean and safe, but there is only 1 shower for all of the guests (maybe 2 if you count the one we are not really supposed to use downstairs,) no lounge area, no activities, and shotty wifi. It is basically a family home with a hostel squeezed into the upper floor. The breakfast is decent and the staff is friendly enough. However, they could not even leave a baguette out for me when I asked if I could get my breakfast an hour or so early because I had to catch a train.

name: Pariscoree
reviewtext: The hostel is a bit outside of the main Paris area, so its cheaper and you have to take the metro for 25 to get to the very center. it is small and has a positive athmosphere. the hostel is managed by a korean family and they are very friendly and helpful. its very clean. I did not like that the sleeping space is openly designed for the 4 beds in the middle, you can hear a lot of doors banging and people coming and going until late night. there are also only 2 toilettes and 2 showers for all bed

name: Pariscoree
reviewtext:
Great place. Clean, nice hosts. Breakfast was great. Fresh fruit. I felt safe and happy there. It was definitely a more calm hostel environment. Had some great conversations and would recommend it to someone who likes to relax and chill. Location great because right on line with the 7 metro, which connects with everything. The host family is from South Korea, and a only a few speak English. They are all nice.

Thanks pariscoree, will be back one day

name: Pariscoree
reviewtext:
Pros-courteous hosts, nice brrakfast, fresh fruits
Cons- cramped, Only 2 toilets, 1 shower & 2 sinks for 16 beds. 1 toilet seperate, rest all in one bathroom. Lockers are flimsy but my stuff was safe.

Nice place for small stay but interaction with dorm-mates was limited.

name: Pariscoree
reviewtext: My stay was wonderful! The hospitality was wonderful. It is a hostel, but its more like a community of travelers being invited into someones home. Breakfast is free and had around one table. The place was very clean. It is a little creeky, so be careful not to wake anyone up if your getting in really late. The location was perfect. You are just barely outside the touristy part of Paris. So it is easy and quick access to the biggest attractions but without all the dang people around all the time.

name: Hotel Du Globe
reviewtext: The staff was great! Helpful and friendly. The security was great as well. The bed was as hard as a rock and the other guest coming and going were extremely loud. All the doors in the building seem to stick so they were constantly being slammed throughout the night. The cleanliness could definitely be improved and updates. The location was great for getting to the metro and walking around. It is next to some sex shops but the more I explored Paris the more this seemed to be a common thing.

name: Hotel Du Globe
reviewtext:
Pros, friendly staff, located next to subway, lots of restaurants in the area, comfortable bed.
Cons. Door was hard to open and close, mold near the shower, shower head broken, made it hard to take a shower.

Located in a non child friendly area with sex shops, but a safe neighborhood.

name: Hotel Du Globe
reviewtext: It was location right next to a strip club and on a street where there were a bunch of sex toy shops. We did not feel the safest walking back to the hostel at night. The room was okay but the bathroom located on the top floor had a strange smell. The tiles in the bathroom were disgusting and around the shower was also very nasty. If you stay here make sure you bring flip flops to walk around the whole hostel. The room i stayed in faced other rooms and the curtains on the windows were transparent

name: Hotel Du Globe
reviewtext: It is a cool old hotel. Shower facilities are sorta hard to get in and out of but it's europe. I liked having my own room. I loved the location and loved the atmosphere outside. Staff was easy to work with and they added another day for me with no issue, they also kept my bags. I was very very pleased!

name: Hotel Le Terrage
reviewtext: The location was ok but we still had to catch a metro everywhere, the ibis budget was roughly the same price and I wish we'd have stayed there. With it being so hot we had to keep the windows open as there's no fan or air con. The noise that came from the building next door was so loud every night, so every morning all we wanted to do was sleep, which ruined the trip a bit. I'm usually an "it'll do as long as there's a bed" person, but all three of us found it hard to sleep.

name: Hotel Le Terrage
reviewtext:
It is fine, basic but clean and good price for pairs. Corridors do smell of cigarettes too but rooms smell fine.
Just be careful, they said they only needed to charge 1 night instead of 2. i thought i was getting a discount but turns out they took the other nights stay out a few days later of your bank account. They told me they only wanted to charge 1 night so i thought i was getting a discount. Just a little cheeky in my opinion. everywhere else usually just pay it all at the start

name: Cafe Hotel de l'avenir
reviewtext: Amazing place to stay if you wanna be away from the city but close imenough to pop in and out. The nicest people ever!!

name: Cafe Hotel de l'avenir
reviewtext:
Good place except it is difficult to take a taxi from the city. It is outside Paris and most taxis don't go outside the city. At day you can use the metro, but if you are going to hang out later than 12am be aware of that. 

Also, it does not have air conditioner. I stayed in July and it was very hot, it is difficult to sleep and it is very good to get to a cold room when you have been out under a hot sun all day long. You wont get that in this hotel.

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext:
I only stayed for one night and I wouldn't stay longer. The location is very far away from the center and it's a bit scary to walk in the area alone as a girl. There's a bad smell in the rooms.
The room that has a window to the street is always loud and people from the street can look inside.
Also didn't like the fact that there's a scale in the girls' bathroom ? I don't want to be reminded how fat I am on my vacation. Totally ruined my day.

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext: The location is okay, not in the centre but the metro is very convenient. The staff are also very helpful. The mattress is okay but the bed is worn out; the drainage in the bathrooms are not very well, and it makes it hard to have a good shower while the shower holder is broken, or the hook for clothes are broken, in the small shower rooms. Overall it's fine.

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext: Amazing hostel, located a bit far out but still a metro stop basically right next to the hostel so very easy to get places. Great atmosphere and the facilities leave nothing to be desired. Standard breakfast (cereal, toast, orange juice), costs around 2 euros. Very tidy and is cleaned every day, also check out at noon is all you need in life when you're shattered. The people working there are incredibly helpful, especially Hadiya who checked me in, super cheerful and friendly guy

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext:
Very friendly staff. 
Spacious rooms.

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext: This is a lovely little hostel, the staff are very friendly and helpful, there is a comfortable lounge and a kitchen. The location can feel a little bit out of the way but you're right next to a metro station so it's fine really. The area is very quiet at night so you can get a good night's sleep and not get woken up by drunks or loud traffic, when I go back to Paris I will stay here again.

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext: The staff of the Trendy Hostel was so incredibly kind the moment I walked in. I was just staying for a night, but they gave me suggestions and made me feel welcome. Checkout is at 12, but they will hold onto your bags for free, and even have a shower you can use once you check out.

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext: This hostel has a serious bedbug infestation. As others have mentioned (take a look at reviews on Google) the hostel is infested. I immediately found a dead bedbug in the bed, and lifting the mattress revealed the signature black markings of droppings in all the corners of the frame. I addressed this with the front desk, who clearly knew this was an issue. She offered me a bed change in the same room: more dead bugs and markings over the wall. Refused a refund for money I'd paid 10 minutes prior

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext: Personnel hyper accueillant, c'est dommage car les personnes qui partageaient le dortoir n'Ã©taient pas trÃ¨s respectueuses du sommeil d'autrui. C'est le seul bÃ©mol sinon trÃ¨s bien

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext: Great stay , awesome staff , close to the main metro rail station that goes into the center of the city.

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext: Everything was great honestly, except there's not much to do around the hostel, expect a good transit ride to anywhere Though it's worth it for the price, Paris transport is pretty easy to use. The staff is pretty chill and the atmosphere is casual & comfortable. The room was very ACed at night it got really cold and made it hard to sleep. Good thing i had an extra blanket. The place is kept neat and tidy and the wifi connection is pretty good! A weird strong smell in  washroom in room 5 though.

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext: This hostel was great. A little compact but everything was so clean, the workers were very helpful & 24/7 assistance was great especially since I arrived quite late. First time I've stayed in France & had good AC, too!!! Definitely recommend.

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext: We stayed in this hostel for a total of 3 nights. When I got back home I started breaking out in hives! After reading the reviews I've confirmed that yes! In fact this Hostel has BED BUGS! Do yourself a favor and do not check in this hostel. Bed bugs are so hard to get rid off. Most likely all of the mattresses are  infested with bugs. I regret not paying the extra money to stay at hotel. Now, I'm covered in bites and fear that I might have brought some bugs home in my luggage. â˜¹ï¸

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext: I stayed one night here, area surrounding the hostel was a little strange, I wouldn't want to walk around alone at night especially for females. Staff was super nice and accommodating. Breakfast is FREE!!!! Locker storage is pretty small but travel backpacks 50l should fit no problem, mine did. And it's very clean and excellent place to meet some friends.

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext: Trendy Hostel definitely kept the Parisian Vibes with their "trendy" lounge, quiet location, fun people, easy metro access and more. It was for sure worth our money $$$$$$

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext: Nice little hostel with friendly staff. It is situated quite far from the city centre but the price compensates the distance. Everything was great apart from the bed bugs!!

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext: First time visiting a hostel and loved it! Friendly staff and good rooms.

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext: There are many other hostels to choose from in Paris, I would not go with this one again. I had to leave early and find a different hostel because of a bedbug infestation and my whole body was covered in bites. This is not the staff's fault and they tried quickly to clean the place, but I think because this is one of the cheapest hostels, you'll get more people who are bringing in bugs and that can really ruin your whole trip. I woke up with a swollen hand one day due to so many bug bites.

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext: Check in was simple and easy, front desk was friendly. We did not Sleep at this hostel due to suspision of bed bugs. Later on reading reviews we found out there was an infestation of bed bugs. This should have been disclosed right away! Even before we checked in. Location is far from major Paris attractions. Not worth our money.

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext: For a cheap place to rest ya head, it wasn't bad. Pretty weird location though - felt v suburban. My man complaint was the guy who checked me in was uncomfortably flirty - writing his name down on a piece of paper for me so I could "tell my family there were still gentlemen left" etc etc. Apart from that, my experience was fine, but that incident made me feel super uncomfortable. The rest of the staff were nice though! Cheap breakie in the morning too.

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext: Firstly the bathroom had a palatable stench, it absolutely reeked of damp. One showers light was broken and not fixed during our stay so was unusable. One shower for 18 people! Plus no temperature control, just scolding hot. Secondly, a boring inhospitable atmosphere. Thirdly, absolutely ages away from the centre, good 40 minutes at least on the metro! We travelled across Europe using hostels and has to be the worst one around! Bed bugs and grim interior - not that the outside is better.

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext:
The hostel was so clean and the beds are so so so comfortable!!!! I loved the fact we got a bathroom for our room, it's really nice. 
The staff there were the nicest possible, Hadiga (I'm sorry if I spelled it wrong) was really nice and thoughtful!!!! 
Basically our experience there was the best we could ask for.

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext: Amazing staff!! We loved the guy on reception he was the best, made us feel so welcome when we first arrived and lifted our spirits. There were lockers in the rooms and the rooms had really good air con!! The toilets were really clean and had enough room. Breakfast was so good, unlimited toast and coffee. Would defo recommend

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext: Cute hostel, funny staff. The kitchen is just a microwave and the breakfast is horrible. Just a bit jam and toast and two kinds of cereals. There was not enough cluttery for everyone, so we had to get ours out of the dishwasher. Not the best service... Metro is just 1 Minute away, but goes 15 Minutes to the city centre. Overall we were happy with our stay, it was pretty relaxed :)

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext:
Only stayed here one night, it was serviceable but I think you can find hostels in better locations with competitive pricing points.
The atmosphere was nice enough, the rooms were quite spacious and fairly clean, but a little bit hot (I'll concede that the weather was very hot when I stayed).
Security is questionable - I didn't need a swipe card to enter my room.

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext:
I spent three nights there and I am happy with the service in general. The place is well located, metro is 5min away and there are several supermarkets and places to eat very cheap. 
The hostel has a happy environment and it is quite easy to interact with people and to make connections to hangout or just enjoy there. I fully recommend it.

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext: Super clean and spacious bunks, staff very friendly! Although a bit far from city centre.

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext: The beds were nice and it was clean enough but what a weird vibe. The staff gave off a weird vibe and a lot of the people staying there were super odd. I also had a credit card emergency and they wouldn't let me use their phone to call about it. They also didn't have a printer to help us print museum tickets. When I checked in they couldn't give me change so I offered just to get a breakfast chip instead and found out later that I should have gotten it for free anyways. Unimpressed.

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext: Staff was not very friendly.  The hostel is in a bad area.  Refused to turn on Air conditioning unless it was midnight.  Not sure the bathroom was ever cleaned in my time there.

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext: Really good staff and atmosphere! Thank you guysss

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext: When I arrived to this hostel, the card reader was broken so I was forced to find an ATM and pull out cash. All the lockers in the room were filled or locked so I was unable to use them. I had to be moved rooms because my bed had bedbugs and was not given any discount because of the bedbugs or the room was larger than the smaller one I had paid for. One of the showers available only produced boiling hot water and you had to hold the shower head because the latch head holder was broken.

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext: Exactly what it looks like in picture, every chill environment. And the staff is really helpful. Would totally recommend this place.

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext: Awesome time here met so many cool people few minute walk to the metro station felt like there were a bunch of people living there which was awkward but they were cool guys also

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext: I mean they had Netflix in the common room which was cool but the ac didn't work at all. We were in a 14 bed dorm and the room was at least 10 degrees warmer than it was outside. We were in a female dorm and the male staff would come in at weird hours. We booked it for two nights and only stayed one because of how horrible it was. Please don't stay here until they fix it up!

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext: Hadiga was an absolute legend and made our stay really great! We throughly enjoyed our stay, and getting into the centre of Paris was super easy. I think because of the insanely hot weather, the dorm was pretty stuffy...but only on one night. Would highly recommend!!

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext:
-Man who checked us in was welcoming and funny
-Got free breakfast tokens for a breakfast of toast, cereal, tea, coffee, juice
-Rooms are quite cramped and beds squeak but electric sockets on every bed and privacy walls up around top end of beds
-Bathrooms clean but was an issue where lights would turn off whilst in the shower and water didn't stay on for long
-Far out of Paris centre but a very easy metro link just down the road. Area is dodgy at night. Me and my girlfriend got harassed.

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext: Had a pretty good stay here! It wasn't the best location but the metro was a block away so it worked out in the end. The beds were comfortable and had screens so it felt more private. The door into the room needed a key and they had little lockers to put valuables in. I had to leave my big bags in the open though and we were in a room of 18 so I was a little worried. The bathroom smelled kinda bad but it wasn't horrible and the showers were either too hot or cold. Overall I had a decent stay tho

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext: Had a really nice experience at this hostel, everyone there was very friendly and there was an excelent atmosphere. It is kind of far away from the center but there is a metro stop near by which makes it easy to get around. I would stay there again if I am in the area!

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext:
The hostel was great for what it was. Right next to a metro stop that took you straight into Paris, and a 15 minute walk from a huge Asian neighborhood that was very interesting to explore. The hostel itself is not walkable from the city, but you can do it if you have an hour or so to spare. It felt secure, the staff were helpful And nice.  My only issues: 
The bathroom in my bedroom absolutely reeked. It wasn't dirty but the stench was almost unbearable. 
The showers were very small.

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext: The staff were amazing! The guy that checked me in (don't remember his name but it started with an H) was super welcoming and the guy who was there when I first arrived was extremely kind. They even let me shower before my check in time. The breakfast was good, very simple but for the cheap price it was worth it. It's far from the city but it's a super easy train ride so don't let that turn you away! The beds were great too and the other guests were very friendly!

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext:
There is no kitchen, just a fridge and some cutlery. There was no atmosphere when I was there and nowhere to go if there was.

Could find something in a better location of the city.

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext: the staff were really good the bloke who checked me in upgraded me to the female dorm without any extra cost which was really nice

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext: I had a brief stay â€“ booked in for 1 night, checked in late & checked out super early to catch a flight out of Orly. Hostel seems cozy & there was a good atmosphere/vibe that was really conducive to meeting people. The staff were friendly and helpful. My only complaint would be that it's a bit far out of the City Centre, about 40mins to 1hr on the metro. But, it's only a 2 min walk from the Metro Station. Area is quiet at night though, not sure if I would feel safe walking alone at night.

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext: great staff, made lots of friends, great hostel overall!

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext: Don't stay here! After staying 1 night, I returned the 2nd night to find they had given my bed away and my stuff had been thrown on the floor. It took reception an hour to figure out what happened/move me to a new bed because their system deleted my reservation. I understand stuff happens, but good customer service is going above and beyond to make-up for an incident that caused me loss of sleep + stress. They refused to reduce my bill when I asked at check out. Terrible customer service!!

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext: Had an excellent stay at this hostel. The staff was helpful, the rooms very nice and showers clean. Offered a decent breakfast and was less than a 5 minute walk from the metro. Considering it was was the World Cup and Bastille day, the hostel was very affordable and everyone who stayed there was chill. I also liked that it was near a university housing area.

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext: This was my first hostel experience and it was such a great one! The staff were very welcoming as soon as I walked in, they made sure I was comfortable. They had sheets for the room and towels to rent if needed. The common area was open and relaxing. I'll definitely stay here again if I come back to Paris.

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext: We are interrailing so it was handy that the metro station was a five min walk, the staff were helpful and welcoming. There were 7 of us so we went in a room of 18. The room seemed clean enough and was fine however, there was 1 man in the room who was French who worked nights and slept in the day. He spoke to us very rudely and shouted at us to be quiet when we were not particularly making any noise just getting ready for the day at 10:00am. Will probably not return as it was not in a nice area.

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext: After a few days travelling on the road, we got to the this hostel and Hamza was very much accommodating to my friend and I. Overall he helped us have a better experience than we did at our hostel before that. I couldn't have felt more taken care of by him and his staff!!! Loved the showers too

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext: Best hostel I've ever stayed in, hands down. They maintain in so well its cleaner than my house. You can tell the staff cares because this is their property, not some random person. 10000% Excellent

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext: Great place! Friendly & helpful staff, very clean, and the location is decent: very close to two metro stops (two minutes walking to one, maybe seven minutes to the other) with some groceries and food nearby. But going downtown takes 40 minutes by metro, or almost an hour for Montmartre, so it's a bit far. But the only thing I hated: the motion sensor lights in the shower shut off every 90 seconds and it was completely annoying to have to flail around to get them to turn back on.

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext: Hadiah was very friendly and quick getting me checked in. Overall conditions were good. The only thing I think is fair to point out is that the shower is the type where you have to keep hitting the button every 15 seconds or so to get the water flowing. Despite that I can say the staff were very nice and helpful, so overall good.

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext: I arrived at the hostel after getting lost on the metro for an hour, so I was very tired but Hadiya was funny and very helpful during the check in process, he was truly a superman. I got to choose the bed I wanted, the room and restrooms where clean and the air conditioning worked fine. Overall it was an amazing deal and I would definitely stay again!

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext: Our experience at Trendy Hostel was overall pretty good! The staff were great, and it's always nice when there's free breakfast! The wifi was also really good here, and the common area was awesome, anyone sitting in there was always down to have a conversation and get to know each other a bit. The hostel was overall very clean, the only issue was we did see a bed bug here, only one though so maybe it's not an issue!

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext: The door to my dorm didn't actually need a key to open. The shower light would turn off during my shower and I'd have to open the door to make the sensor activate. The water didn't drain properly in the shower either so it would sit in the bottom of the shower. There was only one staff that seemed to actually work, he was very nice & helped us with directions to get to places. The rest seemed to just be hanging out around watching tv & smoking outside.

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext: The room had 18 people crammed in, there was even two people sleeping on the same bunk. Way out of the way of paris but next to the metro. Not great for the price.

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext:
Trendy hostel is near the metro, easy way to go to city center.
You can also try the local patissier and brasserie in the area for cheaper price compared to the center.
You can wash clothes for 6euros. 
This was my 3rd hostel of my europe trip and I can say that the place could be improved a bit, the toilets/showers for ladies needs to be checked for foul odor.
Over all the place is good for solo traveler. 
Tips: bring towel and toiletries or you can rent for 2euros.

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext: Everything about this hostel was pretty good and it's only 2 minutes from the metro. The only thing to watch out for is if you want to rent a towel, they don't have to many and you may have to find another option. The laundry service is 6â‚¬ which is very expensive. Also, be aware that the water in the toilet/shower areas will either be lukewarm or too hot to stand under. That said, I would stay here again.

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext: It is around the corner from the metro, which allows for easy travel. There are great food places in the near by area. The staff were very friendly. The hostel was very clean!!

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext: Good atmosphere for socializing. Not great location, but you're right next to a metro line that takes you directly to the louvre, so it's fairly easy. Just don't try to explore on foot. Bedding and bathrooms were clean.

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext: Bathrooms smell really bad. Showers are too small and the shower curtains smell terrible.

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext: It's right next to the metro line which is really handy. You get a small locker for important items and can leave your bag at reception if you want. Breakfast is worth it, but it isn't the best I've had. The social area is fine, but the layout makes it hard to properly meet people.

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext: Very bad experience

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext: Hadith was sound and checked me in and the lady that I checked out with was lovely also. The free breakfast is really good and beds and showers are clean enough. The location is a bit annoying as it's about a 40 minute ride on the metro to Paris but the metros cheap and only a 10 minute walk away so it's not that bad considering the price

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext: Very friendly staff, clean rooms and bathrooms although showers were all slightly broken in some way. The location wasn't great but definitely value for money. Can't complain about my stay, enjoyed having air con in the rooms.

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext: Excellent hostel. It met my expectations. The place is so clean. Its location is very good. It is also in a really safe neighborhood in Paris. The guys at the reception were very welcoming, so nice and helpful. I enjoyed my stay so much.

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext: Bed bugs!

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext: The staff were lovely and made us feel welcome as soon as we arrived! Bit of a distance from the main tourist area of Paris but there's a metro only a 2 min walk away so wasn't a major issue. Perfect hostel is you are staying one night or so.

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext: It was a comfortable place to stay. It's a bit far from the city center. Otherwise, very clean super friendly staff and a comfortable, chill environment.

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext: Located near a metro stop made it easy to travel to other parts of town; great front desk staff but I got bedbugs from this place which really put a damper on my stay in Paris. There are nice bathrooms and a common area, but the hostel is very much bare-bones so you get what you pay for. If you're looking to travel as cheaply as possible, I would recommend it except for the bedbugs.. if you have a little more to spend to enjoy your stay rather than just scrape by, I would do it

name: Trendy Hostel
reviewtext: Very dirty bathrooms in hostel. Set up of dorms is awful.

name: Hipotel Paris Belleville
reviewtext: what the place advertises and what it delivers are two very different things instead of free wifi like it says it costs 100 euros for 24 hours of wifi the rooms paint/wallpaper is pealing the staff are disinterested in people and are passive aggressive towards travelers

name: Hotel France Albion
reviewtext: We really enjoyed our stay here, it's perfect for family trips and for a nice getaway time in Paris. Staff is helpful and location is also great. Thank you!

name: Hotel France Albion
reviewtext: In my opinion the best thing about this hotel is the staff. They were always incredibly cheerful and happy to help their guests.

name: Hotel France Albion
reviewtext: My boyfriend and I spent a wonderful weekend at hotel France Albion! The check in process was smooth, staff very friendly and helpful in offering tips on how to get to different places around and outside of the city. The room was comfortable, clean, and quiet. The buffet breakfast is slightly expensive, but the quality of the food is very good. I would highly recommend staying here! Good for couples and friends looking to spend a couple of days in Paris.

name: Hipotel Belgrand
reviewtext: maybe a little too clean, haha. the cleaners they used have a strong smell. nothing open windows couldn't cure, but I imagine if it was raining or cold outside, that might present a proble. other than that, staff was friendly, room was clean and decent size. located literally right next to a metro stop.

name: Hipotel Belgrand
reviewtext: Stayed for one week and would go back again. Room in back of hotel which was extremely quiet and had a nice view.  Did not have room cleaned every day to minimize chemical smell other reviews noted.  But when room was cleaned it was done well - kept windows open to air out room. Stayed there during heat wave(40 c) and was not to terrible with fan in room, drapes closed and windows open. Great place to stay on a budget in Paris.

name: Liberty Hotel Paris
reviewtext: Hostel was very disgusting and dirty, felt as if I did not want to move and probably would of been better sleeping on the streets of Paris. The hotel staff were very rude and not welcoming at all. Our room was not clean and was on the top floor. The temperature was unbearable because of no aircon provided.

name: Liberty Hotel Paris
reviewtext:
It was our last resort and the only place we could get. We got a private room with a double bed. There was a sink and a urinal 2 steps from the bed. A communal shower on the first floor. We were on the 4th! Never ending spiral stairs and no lifts. 

Now it did the job because we needed somewhere to crash but the area was so rough and scary like we had to be back before dark as you couldn't risk walking the streets at that time. I wouldn't stay there again but to be fair it was super cheap

name: The Student Hotel Paris La DÃ©fense
reviewtext: Super clean hostel it felt like a hotel. I was by myself and the walk from the station is about 10mins which is not too bad. Felt safe the whole time.

name: The Student Hotel Paris La DÃ©fense
reviewtext: It's a very good hotel. It's a little walk from the metro station but the locality and amenities are really good.

name: The Student Hotel Paris La DÃ©fense
reviewtext: I checked in earlier than expected only to be greeted by the friendliest front of house staff. Traveling to Paris by myself over one of the busiest travel weekends of the year was a bit overwhelming, but the staff made me feel at home and always had a smile. The room exceeded my expectations for student accommodation: clean, modern and had really great views. Truly a breath of fresh air. I'd definitely recommend the student hotel in La Defence for anyone visiting Paris.

name: The Student Hotel Paris La DÃ©fense
reviewtext: ExcelentÂ¡Â¡Â¡

name: Chez Godo
reviewtext: My family had a great time at Godo's place. I have a family of five with three young children: 8, 10 and 15 years old. It was great have a private space in a guest house with a shower and a kitchen.  My children loved the garden with grapes, fish and frogs. In addition, Godo (and, his girl friend, Paquita) is a super host. They invited me to a BBQ. We had a pleasant conversation about politics and culture. Thank you, Godo.

name: Hotel Marignan
reviewtext:
This is the perfect place to stay if you want your own room but don't need all the bells and whistles of a hotel.  I had a bedroom with a sink and my floor had a shared toilet and shower.  Everything was extremely clean and comfortable.  The location is ideal- in the Latin Quarter, across the river from Notre Dame, and right next to a metro stop that I used frequently.  The staff was kind and helpful.

Very positive experience!

name: Hotel de la Terrasse
reviewtext: The location, staff, and facilities were all in order, but the cleanliness of the room was far below standard. Tiles in the bathroom floor were loose and coming up, there were holes in the ceiling above the shower, the top layer of the bed sheet was very old, and there was no way to leave the window open without fear of letting pigeons into the room (there were about 20 pigeons in the courtyard that regularly landed on the windowsill if they had the chance).

name: Hotel D'Amiens
reviewtext: Very nice 3 star hotel in Paris next to Gare du Nord-a significant train station that allows you to go anywhere in Paris or Europe for that matter. Also located near lots of little shops, restaurants and bars. So, the location is great. No A.C. though. Facilities are leagues and bounds better than a hostel (TV in room as well), but it's more expensive than a hostel (like 4x a night), which is to be expected as it's a hotel. I stayed here just one night before flying out and it was well worth it.

name: Hotel D'Amiens
reviewtext: I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone and it's near the train station.

name: Apparteo Paris 13
reviewtext: The staff here were so lovely and understanding of the language barrier and the rooms are great for your dollar! We stayed in two different rooms and even the downgraded one was lovely. Would recommend if you want something a little nicer for your trip in Paris.

name: JP House
reviewtext: A very nice flat near Ourcq metro station. Less than 10 min walk.  It was acceptably clean since this is a flat where a single man lives. The kitchen had a small table for 2 or 3 people eating, a cooker I didn't use, a microwave oven, a kettle and a fridge. There was a living/dining room combined where it was more comfortable to eat and it had a nice big TV. The bedroom had a bunk bed and the mattresses would need improvement in the near future. I think we could improve this point.

name: JP House
reviewtext: Very good and would recommend to my friends

name: JP House
reviewtext: JP house was priced competitively for Paris and a nice enough place to sleep for a night, but please know that it is essentially an extra bedroom in JP's two-bedroom apartment. You are sharing a bathroom across the hall with JP and the door to the bedroom does not lock. JP was very nice and accommodating; this just wasn't what I expect when I think "hostel" and not something I would have chosen as a solo traveler. Probably better for a couple that doesn't mind bunk beds.

name: Mary's Hotel
reviewtext:
This is a decent hostel in Paris.  Good location.  Easy to access and use metro to go anywhere in the city.  Rooms are small and don't have AC.  But they do provide a fan.  It's not to bad if your just there for a place to sleep.
    Staff was very friendly and helpful.  Rooms where clean and the main door is always locked and has an attendant.

name: Mary's Hotel
reviewtext: Me and my girlfriend stayed at a night at Mary's Hotel before travelling to Bordeaux. Room was small with a decent size bed. It was an extremely warm day so we have to left windows open through out since we got in the room.  Not much privacy for a couple if you are planning a romantic night in the room. But it was ok just to sleep and get ready for the next journey.Shower was leaking from the point where it fit the shower head. So much water wasted during showers.  It was reasonably tidy. Thanks

name: Hotel des Olympiades
reviewtext: It was everything i could hope for in a hotel for this price. There were a few bugs but not many and the staff was very nice and helpful.

name: Hotel Beaugrenelle Saint-Charles
reviewtext: The hotel was quiet & nice. The staff was really friendly and helpful. My boyfriend & I had a great stay.

name: Hotel Beaugrenelle Saint-Charles
reviewtext: I very much so enjoyed my stay! The metro was so close and very awesome to get around the surrounding areas, there was a great atmosphere, the bar and bar tenders were amazing, we had a great time. Only downfall I could even think of would be no AIr con in my dorm of six girls however many fans were provided so it sort of made up for it!

name: Hotel Maubeuge
reviewtext: Great little hotel in a great spot. We would stay here again!

name: Hotel Mogador
reviewtext: I was blown away by how lovely the hotel is! I booked it on hostelworld last minute and did not realise it was a lovely boutique hotel in a perfect Parisian location with working air conditioner and great breakfast. Everything greatly exceeded my expectations.

name: Hotel Eiffel Rive Gauche
reviewtext: Amazing location, good quiet street within 5 minute walk of eiffel tower and super close to metro station. Staff was more than helpful. Clean room. Only down sides were rooms a bit small, shower was small and no air conditioning.  However our room was equpiped with two very powerful/ good working fans. So while we had no air con we were still kept quite cool at night and this was in July. Would stay again.

name: Hotel Parc Even
reviewtext: Friendly staff, Room was cleaned every day, location was great (only 3 min walk to closest metro). Also, the area in general seemed quite safe. Streets are well lit at night, just around the corner there was a large open air market, and in the other direction is a couple grocery stores. Don't have expectations of a super high class hotel, but for what we needed (a bed and place to shower), this was perfect. Awesome value for the cost!!

name: Hotel Parc Even
reviewtext: Clean room, friendly staff. Would stay again!

name: Kyriad Italie Gobelins
reviewtext: Very clean place, nice atmosphere, and close to restaurants. It is close to the chinatown area in Paris, so you will find lots of asian food :) . Its is like 30-40 mins away from Eiffel tower, but the subway system works fine, lots of trains round that area. I felt very safe while I was there. I definitely recommend it.

name: Kyriad Italie Gobelins
reviewtext:
Hotel in great Location close to Place D'Italie and Les Gobbelins Metro stations

Fantastic clean room and modern bathroom

Only drawback was lack of Air Con. We had the fan on full blast constantly as it was unbelievably warm during this heatwave, especially on the 6th Floor
They turned the Fan off when cleaning the room which meant that when we returned it was sweltering

Other than that we couldn't fault this hotel and the value for money is superb. Location is easy to get to.

name: Kyriad Italie Gobelins
reviewtext: A little removed from downtown Paris but in a good location near multiple metro lines. Room was small but clean and very nice, though the lights in the hallway were broken. For the price it was a good place to stay.

name: Kyriad Italie Gobelins
reviewtext: The hotel was pretty good. It was clean and in awesome location (basically a 20 min train ride to all the attractions we wanted to see such as Eiffel Tower, catacombs). The price was a bit a expensive as we had to book last minute due to issues with the Hotel we had already booked

name: Hotel Rachel
reviewtext:
They have good rooms and bad rooms , depends on your luck which one you will get.
I extented one night and paid directly there and just on the last night the man of the reception gave me back the money and asked me to look for another hotel because this night was previously booked by another person and he did not know.
He literally kicked us out !

name: Korner Eiffel Hotel
reviewtext: We absolutely loved our stay here!  The staff is very friendly, speaks English well and extremely helpful answering questions!!  I'd stay here again for sure.

name: Hotel Audran
reviewtext: Parking was fairly easy.  Hotel staff were very friendly and gave good recommendations.

name: Handcircle
reviewtext: Chantal's place is wonderful. She was very helpful - offering maps and assisting me with transit and airport pickup - and is delightful and travel-savvy herself. The house felt very secure, there's opportunity to be social with Chantal and her family but also plenty of comfortable private space. As she writes in her description, transit to Paris is very convenient - about 10 mins to walk to the station and 15 min train ride to Gare du Nord; with the Paris Visite pass it's quite affordable

name: Hotel Beaugrenelle Tour Eiffel
reviewtext: Good location. Staff were nice. Paris prices are always too high for what you get but nothing you can do about that. They cleaned the place well enough. Overall I don't have any complaints.

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: I really was delighted upon first impression of this hostel. It is very unique and very beautiful! Seemed to have everything you'd need available or for rent. I loved the schoolhouse vibe and the great design and furniture in the main lobby/lounge downstairs. The wifi connection didn't make it to the second floor, which was sucky, but the warm blanket made up for it (for me ðŸ˜Š)

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: Good prices for our group! And it was what you would expect.  The location was a short walk from the Elephant and Castle station which is a pretty major transit center so that is really nice. Only complaint; our floor only had one shower because the other was out of order. But not a huge deal.

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext:
No self catering
Everything else was greatðŸ‘ðŸ‘

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: We have stayed in many hostels and love a good time. We have never heard anything louder than the group above us. The group started loudly singing at 1am and kept everyone up until 4am. Unsure if there was even an attempt for the hostel to control the situation. We spent our next night in a well-known party hostel (st.Christopher's inn) and managed to have a much better sleep.

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext:
The other guests ruined the visit for me - they were so loud! Not at all respectful to people trying to get a good night's sleep - pretty ironic at a place called Rest Up!
There was a very very loud and crazy sounding party going on in the dorm above ours. Shouting, screaming, rattling bunk beds and stamping feet, the lot. The staff did nothing about it and it went on until around 3am, after that the guests in my own dorm were being loud. Really irritating, would not recommend this place.

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: I read a lot of bad reviews before arriving and wasn't sure what to expect... I was in a 30 person room dorm and where most hostels give plugs and a light to each bed, this was lacking. 30 beds in a room yes it might be impossible to give everyone a plug but not a single one in the room. No lockers so had to leave my stuff and hope for the best. Bed was comfy had some noisy roommates but that is at no fault of the hostel. Staff were the worst part, seemed like they'd rather be anywhere else.

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: Beds are a little uncomfortable and squeeky. The road is very noisy so Def worth buying the ear plugs they sell and it is a bit of a walk from the station but for the price you can't really moan too much. If you go in expecting these things you should find it OK, staff are friendly and helpful and it's clean. I recommend getting a Kebab from Lebo opposite as they were incredible.

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: Staff are rude and the facilities are next to none.

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: Never done a hostel as a family before. It was the perfect choice to keep our overall cost down. Positives were staff and cleanliness. If i had to give one negative that would be traffic noise. But it is a city after all ðŸ˜

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: I highly recommend that hostel! Very clean, good food, e z going stuff:) great location, and even greater prices for that good standard.

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: we had a great stay. Comfy beds, and it is clean all over. Reception staff had been amazing, and very helpful especially with the tips on the city tours. It is a big hostel, but it kind of feels homely, with its atmosphere and other guests staying in the lounge. 500 m form Mercato which is wondeful place to eat, drink and party. all in all, for that little price we expected much less, and we were positively surprised.

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: Larger dorm rooms are packed with beds leaving very little space for peoples luggage, especially when the bunk beds are triple height. The lack of storage lockers for your valuables is very poor as well. It is cheap though, so I guess you get what you pay for.

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: Cool vibe to the place - it's massive! The double twin private room was quite small but felt secure. Did have a window which needed to be open to cool down the room but the street below was very busy and loud. We paid extra for an ensuite and the shower didn't work properly which was annoying, but luckily the girls bathroom down the hall were very clean. At least a 10 minute walk to Elephant & Castle Station. All in all a good stay

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: I did not have high expextations as it was a super cheap hostel. I don't care if the beds have 3 levels and if someone moves both neighbours are moving as well. I don't mind mixed gender toilets and showers (it was a bit uncomfortable though). BUT there were absolutely NO plugs where I could charge my phone!! I had to go to the lounge, but even when I left my phone there for an hour (which is not so safe..) it only charged like 2%, was super slow. I spent my days in Starbucks instead.

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: Get what you pay for, very very average room in a nice building.

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: U cant take a normal shower, mattress are used and not changed for last 4-5 years, clean? Definitely not, yes in the morning they clean, but as there is 600 of course u can expect not to be clean, but the cleaners are more eating and talking between each other than clean... about the stuff... No words needed. The manager is body builder, he think he can treat clients as he treat his mates in a gym. For sure not professional. Value of money!? Definitely not. Smelly rooms

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: You didn't cancel my reso and charged me

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: This was my very first stay in a Hostel & I really enjoyed it. The staff was amazing! I'm so glad I stayed there!

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: You charged me double for my stay on the bases that I had to arrive well in time for check even though I send out an email to say I will be late. Guess it doesn't matter to you.

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: you're paying for what you get.. however staff weren't very welcoming and there was no vibe

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: I loved staying at Rest Up. I made plenty of friends while staying there and the staff was very friendly. The bus stop right outside gets you nearly anywhere you want so you don't have to go too far. The restrooms were always clean and so was the lounge. Basically, cheap and cozy.

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: Awesome Hostel, good value for the money, good location. It could do with more power plugs, but I think it's just people are using more electronics these days.

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: Would rather sleep on the streets with the homeless than stay one night at this dump. The private twin room I booked felt more like a prison cell than a safe space. The room was located right next to a lift as well as a bunch of rowdy school children running up and down the hall way until all hours of the morning (even though signs say to please be quiet after 10pm). It got so bad my partner went down to the desk at 2am to request a room change. Which barely helped in terms of comfort.  Poor

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: I very much enjoyed my stay at Rest Up  over three nights. I was fortunate to have a whole dorm to myself with an en- suite shower. I was able to stay for a three day event I attended which would have been impossible if I had to stay in a hotel. It was easy to get to either by walking or bus from Waterloo and the atmosphere was very congenial with students, families and others like me. I could work on my lap top in the dining room using WiFi which was great.

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: There are way too many beds stuffed into a tiny room. Also no lockers. Nice location.

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: Definitely the largest hostel I've ever stayed in. Quite far away from the main part of London, but for the price, that's expected. Everything else was adequate.

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: I found the facility to be an interesting and a historical building..  Possibly it was a school or hospital at one time.  The price was excellent and it served my purposes of a place to  spend the night while catching a flight of London.  There is not a great deal  of privacy which is probably to be expected.  There was a wide cross section of people from families to student travelers to older single travelers.  No one should feel out of place here.  Great spot for a layover.

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: There are no wall plugs in the rooms only 2 in the hall that you have to share with everyone else. And the bathrooms are co-Ed and for 40+ people there are only 2 bathrooms and 4 showers.

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: Shower didn't work! wasn't nice enough for the money

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: Place is very easy to find, located not so far from town, good connection with city centre, 24/7 reception, it's just those unfortunate bunk beds that gave me headache. Literally...

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: Nothing much special, but cheap, simple and a decent breakfast.

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: You have to Pay for lockers and towels

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: Beds were terribly uncomfortable. WiFi barely worked. Crowded common areas.

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: The restrooms were disgusting and there was children running around, which didn't make it very comfortable for the actual backpackers/travelers. The common rooms close at 12pm which are the only places you can charge your electronics. There are no ports in the rooms. (I stayed in the 33-bed.) You also have no storage in the room and are forced to pay 3 pounds (everytime you open it) for a locker if you want to keep your stuff from being pinched. But the staff was very friendly.

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: Had a amazing time. Could not fault anything. Bus stop right outside. Shoppe and take away 2 min walk. Tube 5min walk. Clean. Staff very helpful and happy.

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: The locker room is ridiculously small for the number of rooms. Most of the staff was extra unfriendly and without proper training, from receiving a guest and making check in to things like serving the food. We understand the hostel was packed, and with many teenagers, but still. Unfortunately we cannot recommend this, because we dont see how it could be a good experience (even if you change staff and triple the locker room), given the size of hostel and therefor the lack of self-service kitchen.

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: Overprised and unclean, chaos in dorm rooms

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: Great hostel in London wider centre. Very comofrtable and clean beds, great and helpful stuff. Will go back certainly

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: This is great value for a capital city location with easy access to all the key tourist attractions. You can walk to Westminster in less than 30 minutes or just a 10 minute walk to the tube if you prefer! How good is that for London?! Staff are great and loads of interesting fellow travellers. Really clean facilities with excellent quality linen, But the building is tired and windows don't shut, blinds don't work, toilets get blocked and bunk beds are probably from a correctional institution!

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: Brilliant  and helpful staff. Located near public transport.  Room and facilities were clean. I spent  5 nights in the 33 bed dormitory which was  quiet at night. Tv and lounge  were nice.  Kitchen was  nice and self catering  allowed. The  was no tap in kitchen if we need drinking water I noticed a tap outside in the front garden and I used  that one.  As it was about 30*C  I needed to drink as much water as possible. Overall, a nice stay bear in mind the price i paid. will use again. Thanks.

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: To start, I booked a 30 bed room. The room had 10 bunk beds that were each 3 beds high... I was on the top! It was so dangerous to climb up and down be the steps we're almost nonexistent. I almost fell off every single time and I'm a fit 21 y/o. Was told that ppl had their passports/laptops etc stolen from that room yet lockers are on main floor and cost 2-3Â£ each time you open them. I felt so unsafe. When I asked to switch rooms they were so understanding & it wasn't a prob. Lots of kids there!

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: Im not the type to review anything, but this was truly a disgusting experience. My friend had her purse containing her passport, credit cards, and cash stolen after being in our room just ten minutes. I wish I could say the staff was helpful, but with the exception of the manager looking at cameras, the rest seemed indifferent to our terrible experience. There's young children running around and disgusting bathrooms and dorms, if you want a positive London trip, do NOT stay here.

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: Just don't stay here. Very far from most tourist attractions and popular nightlife area. First night there, a girls laptop passport money were stolen from the room I was in; the staff could not care less. My phone dropped from the bed without my knowledge and I couldn't find it in the dark. Went to reception to say I couldn't find it and he looked at me like I'm swine. Absolutely despicable. I didn't feel safe at all. It's worth the extra money to go elsewhere to feel safe. Very dodgy hostel

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext:
We rented a double bedroom with a private bathroom and the room was too small for 2 persons. The washing basin in the bathroom was super small as well; you can't wash your face without having water on the floor. 
Their was no air conditioning and you can't open the windows widely (security reasons) so we ended melting inside as temperatures were 35C  outside.
wouldn't recommand it to anyone.

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: Having to pay 2 pounds everytime you want to lock your locker is a total rip off. Other than that quite a good experience. Good staff, toilets very clean, bed quite comfortable.

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: A nice place full of people all the time from all over the world, i ve been twice there twice this summer and i came back cause it well connected, Safe and fun , thanks so much

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: Staff are rude. Two toilets to nearly 100 beds. Beds are wack and the rooms smell. Has some nice decor tho

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext:
Loved this Hostel ðŸ˜ðŸ˜ðŸ˜ Arrived late at night and the reception Arron was super helpful and was incredibly welcoming across my whole stay.

Would 100% recommend this hostel if you are looking for a place in London especially if you are arriving late at night.

William Cartwright

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: The only lockers are Â£2 every time you open them. Don't go here if you don't want to hang out with a bunch of 17 year olds on field trips. 3pm check in means there's a rush of a hundred people every day then and you have to wait. Inexperienced travellers with no dorm etiquette. Prison showers with 30 second bursts. Extremely airless dorms with no fans. I'm sure it's fine for big groups but don't go as a solo backpacker.

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext:
Utterly disgraceful experience. 
Looked forward to our stay, having read the seemingly positive reviews. Literally spent two nights without any sleep due to kids (teenagers) running down the corridors screaming shouting etc. until gone 3am both nights. Banging doors, on walls, screaming,ultimately acting feral. This initially was the main annoyance however this turned to genuine concern when the teachers literally lost a number of children and at gone 3am had to knock on doors to find them.

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: Dope hostel.

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: I was only there one day and one night but I really enjoyed my hostel experience. The staff was friendly and accommodating and I would definitely come back to this hostel again!

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: It's a good hostel but the big room is super stuffy. There are three levels for the bunk bed! I was kind of shocked but thank God I got the lower bunk. There's a lot of people in the hostel, mostly junior high/high school students I guess? So it's hard to find a place to chill out, or even charge my phone. But for the price it's alright.

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext:
We stayed here for two nights in double room with private bathroom.
The room was very small and did not even had a wardrobe to put our clothes but the worst was that the room was really hot, did not had air conditioning. It was so hot inside that we could not sleep and we were sweating all the time. 
Another problem was the check in hour. We could only check in at 15h and this was not flexible and we had to pay a locker to leave our bags until check in hour.
The staff in general was nice.

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext:
Good location for trips to downtown.  Coffee is very nice, has wifi, use the lower floor showers that have cold and hot water (all the others are only hot) if you like to have a cool shower in summer.  Busses to E&C tube and railway right outside, only a ten min walk anyhow but bus takes merely a couple of minutes.   
Food is decent for the price. Beds and accommodation are very basic, but for a traveler on a budget it cannot be beaten as a base for going into the city.  Will stay here again.

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: I liked the staff, very friendly and corteus.

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: I stayed two nights and feel prertty satisfied, it was queiet at night although I was in a dorm for 30 people everybody was respectful and there r nice areas to relax. The only thing that bothered me and I can give it as a suggestion is to give adaptors for the elextricity for rent instead of selling them because if a person plans to stay for a short time in England it is a useless ourchase to be made.

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: So easy to book and use. Clean. Friendly helpful staff. Can't fault it. Would definitely use again and recommend.

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: Rude staff, way too busy, no room, dirty bathrooms, so hot, uncomfortable

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: Our stay was ok, we were booking quite late and this was the only hostel left near the centre - so we were happy about the location but also Elephant & Castle is not the prettiest of neighbourhoods. Our room was quite expensive and it was literally just big enough for the bed, no storage space etc. Also quite noisy because of the busy road outside. It was fine if you just came there to sleep but I probably wouldn't want to spend time there.

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: If there's a way to screw a dollar out of a budget traveller these guys have already firgured it out and perfected it. The staff look at like you've just kicked their dog. No bar, no atmosphere and no fun. Unpleasant.

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: Hot as hell. I mean, unbearably hot. No AC + room with 10 people = good luck sleeping.

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: The staff was very rude, facilities were dirty and small for a superior 4 room. I'm not joking the walk way was nonexistent, and had a broken shower that leaked a ton of water out that made the floors, with no toilet. Avoid at all cost they are a scam!!!

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: I was pretty disappointed in my stay at Rest Up London. The lobby, my dorm room, and the bathroom all had different and very bad smells, the front desk employees were consistently unfriendly, and the locker situation, where you have to pay Â£3 EVERY time you want to lock up your stuff, was ridiculous. The wifi was good in the common areas, but didn't even reach my first floor dorm room. The showers were so gross and had a really annoying  "button on" operation. I hated my stay.

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: great place, very professional, fast acting! I love the outdoor lounge, and the in-door lounges as well, great places to meet awesome digital nomads, back-packers!

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: Clean place, wifi in public areas not in rooms, decent breakfast/other ammeneties. Worst part about stay is small rooms with no fans. Really hot summer and hotter rooms

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: Any fault of the hostel was cause of the guests (and cause of the lack of air conditioning). The staff was very very nice and helped myself and a friend get through a worrying blip in the system. Sweaty, loud, but comfortable.

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: I enjoyed my stay at Rest Up however the first night I was allocated the incorrect room meaning that I had to check out and store my luggage the next day. I was compensated with free continental breakfast and a towel but it didn't seem enough given the true inconvenience that was of no fault of my own. Atmosphere was good however a lot of European high schoolers at the moment. Fairly close to Elephant and Castle tube station but does require a 10 minute walk

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext:
For what you pay for, you get. The beds are really thin and uncomfortable, and the showers in the room smell like mildew. However there are more bathrooms and showers available out in the halls that are a lot better and bigger than one square foot- no exaggeration
The receptionists were not very helpful most of the time- from how they treated me and answered questions most of them seemed like new staff.
