Food is good, the atmosphere is good, the price is good, and the location is pretty great!

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: Staff nice and helpful. Fairly good location, slightly out of way. Basement rooms are a little loud and hot when sleeping, but have outlets. 33 person room is quiet but NO outlets which left you stuck in hallways, lounge or charging station (have to pay) to charge. The basement bathroom is musty and come, 7 am is jam-packed. Would appreciate more places to hang your things in the shower. Appreciated that I could stay in the lounge before check-in until time because I got no sleep. Good internet.

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: Horrific experience, completely ripped off. I would advise it...

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: The place is very well located, you can go to all the main attractions by bus or tube in 20 minutes. Staff is not the most cheerful but they will answer all your questions. My dorm was very noisy because it was close to the garden and windows were open because it was so warm but it was fine. If you're looking for a place to meet people and have a fun at night I would'nt recommend it but other than that it meant all my expectations.

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext:
This hostel is perfect for large groups; but one feels insignificant as a solo traveller. There is no bar, only lounge areas full of people staring at their iPhones.
The quality of the Full English Breakfast was low. The food was flavourless. Environmentally, the breakfast was a catastrophe for myself and a German friend who was also staying there. Use of single-use paper plates, and plastic drink cups is inexcusable in my opinion. The only choice of bread was soft white anaemic bread.

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext:
Clogged shower
Clogged sink
Noisy young kids everywhere, knocking on our door and shouting.
Busy place!!!

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: Lovely place with nice friendly staff.  Only area for improvement would be more plug sockets to help keep our phone charged

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: This hostel is located in the Southwark area about a 15 minute walk from the nearest tube station. The place was clean and there is a bar area where you can order drinks and food. However as a regular guest you can only order food until about 6pm and then the kitchen cooks for all the high school groups visiting from other countries. No alcohol can be purchased or consumed on the property. Another let down was the staff.. They were not very friendly at all and made no attempt at being welcoming.

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: The hostel is too far away from city centre. That's not the main problem. The problem is there is no guest kitchen for travellers to cook. No free coffee and tea like other hostels that supply 24 hours a day. There isn't any hot water to make your own coffee. The breakfasts are overpriced. The top bunk beds are too difficult and inconvenient to climb. No PowerPoints to charge electronics devices in my bedroom. You have pay to lock your bags if you arrive before check in time an after check out.

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: Rooms are dirty, showers are terrible, staff are unfriendly, the location is not great, This place has a lot of school kids staying at it so it feels more like a high school summer camp than hostel.

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: I met a few nice people here and the hostel was nice, the dorms get a little hot at night but that's to be expected in a hostel. When it comes to location, it was right next to a bus stop which was really nice, but when it comes to stuff nearby, there wasn't much so you were looking at a bit of a walk/bus ride to go to a decent pub or restaurant. Overall good hostel though.

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: First hostel I've ever stayed in and it was a great experience, only stayed for one night as a place to crash after a night out! Perfect location and facilities for what we needed.

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: Great place for a stay over the weekend. Good atmosphere. 10 minutes walk from station.

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext:
We booked a one night stay for 2 people. When we went to our assigned beds we noticed that one of them had another guest's bags on it. A staff member removed the items but did not inform the guest. 

The guest came back. We tried to find the bed he was supposed to be in but they were all occupied. It turns out the room had been overbooked. Security was asked what bed was free but he instead became confrontational and escalated the situation 

Overall a terrible experience.

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: The customer service was very poor here. Asking to purchase a wall converter for my cellphone was greeted with a shrug and a distance gaze of boredom. The room are very tightly packed. This is also a pre-teen wasteland full of the high-pitched mushed conversation of legions of 13 year olds.

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: The staff was very friendly, this hostel was not very clean for my standards.  There really isn't a ton of room if you are traveling with luggage. There are lockers available for an extra charge. Towels were also extra. The mattresses felt like a gymnastics mat. Their beds were so cramped and pushed against the wall that it was impossible to charge your phone or electronics if you were on a top bunk. I stayed in 4 different hostels during my trip and this was my least favorite.

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: The room are tiny. The beds old and unstable. There was also extremely little ventelation within the room. The bathrooms were fine.

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext: This was my first hostel stay so I don't have much to compare it to. However, the atmosphere was great and it was easy to meet other people. The wifi doesn't work in the tiny rooms and the beds are super squeaky. The place is rather clean and quiet when you are up in your sector of the building. Not really close to anything location wise which sucked but easy to get to with oyster pass. Would recommend if you don't mind taking buses to popular areas.

name: Rest Up London
reviewtext:
Nice place, cant grumble for the value for money.

What I can moan at is the price of lockers. its absolute daylight robbery. Â£3 every time you need to open it. 

The showers are really bad too. no temperature control, just raw scalding water and that's it...

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: The room are very tiny and uncomfortable, nothing to put our stuff and no plug in the beds

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: Awesome location, staff are very happy to answer all questions. Good food on site but perhaps a bit pricey compared to the other options around. The free walking tour of Royal London was fantastic, although I think a walking tour of the immediate area and where shops etc are situated would be a good idea... Overall very much enjoyed my stay, would stay again!

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: Toilets and bathroom needed a upgrade

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: Extraordinarily clean, in a brilliant location, and cheap - what more can I say!

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: Location is pretty good but dirty bathrooms and room, average atmosphere and the staff in general were moderately helpful.. One in particular was sarcastic and rude when I asked if my travel card had been left there.. Wouldn't recommend

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: The rooms in the basement had now windows so it gets extremely hot and stuffy .... also the bathrooms were constantly "closed for cleaning" and you had to pay Â£8 if you want brekkie there which wasn't that great....

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext:
Excellent place.  I would return.  All the desk workers were wonderful and the guests were very nice too.  The cleaning crew was also nice to everyone.  Bar tenders were nice.  Great experience.  

We had one traveler in our dorm that would turn on the light every time he felt the urge.  Disrespectful of all the rest of us.  Don't know how the Generator could change this guys behavior.   Don't blame any one but him.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: The hostel was in the perfect location and staff were super helpful -- easy check-in and check-out. Hostel itself was well equipped and you could not hear noise from lobby/bar in the rooms themselves. Facilities themselves were just okay -- I found the room to be smaller than I had expected based on pictures.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: I think out of my entire trip of two months this was my least liked hostel. Location is good and the Cafe downstairs is good as well and the staff were nice. The power point situation is terrible, couldn't charge my phone except for in the Cafe. The men's showers was pretty shocking. Out of the 6 showers we had on our level 3 of the doors were broken so they wouldn't shut properly and the setup of the showers with a communal drain in the middle which you had to walk through to get to a stall

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: Generator is always my first option when it comes to Hostels. And the ones in Amsterdam and Dublin are amazing in every aspect. GenLon is great, although the toilets are really really bad and it has to be said. Also there's only one tiny lift for a 5 floor building...

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: Rooms were extraordinarily small, you couldn't even open the door.  Tiny window so there was little to no ventilation and it got quite hot in the rooms. The no external food rule meant that there was no fridge/ microwave/ hot water facilities at all which was frustrating as I always had to eat out which added up. The showers all leaked and got everything wet. Not bad if you are only staying a night or two as it is well located but I would not stay there again,  especially for longer stays.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: Great location and good facilities. The main issue with the hostel is the very loud airconditioning; expect to lose sleep over that.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: My bed was super comfy - kinda didn't want to get out and explore London! Staff were really helpful and the location was convenient because it was very close to King's cross and st Pancras.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: Perfect location for a hostel. Everything is very clean and feels very new. Bar area is lovely with good events on and a new pool table. Would recommend to anyone

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: Super super cramped rooms. No toilets in room and very far away from your room although that is dependant on where you've been put. Facilities are mostly clean although toilets/showers are sometimes smelly.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: Really cool space, room for 4 was a bit small but as a group of 3 we had a great 4th person that we ended up getting a drink with at the pub after

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: I'm 71 yo and had to walk a long way to the toilets at night . Maybe some consideration for a bunk closer to the facilities could be considered when requested. Not many electricity points fir charging phones. Otherwise it's great. Will stay again and recommend.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext:
Stayed in a double room with my sister during our 5 day stay in London. Was in a very central location close to both Russel square and Kings Cross metro stations making it very easy to get around the city. 
Room was neat and tidy and they supplied a free towel. 
The only thing that would make this place even better would be an area that you can eat your own food that you have brought.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: Came from a night out 7 in the morning. Slept couple of hours to check out for 10 so dont even know much what to say âœŒðŸ»

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext:
-Good and delicious breakfast, 
-friendly staff, 
- beds could be a little longer (hit my head at the top)
- dirty bathrooms

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: Good overall hostel

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: Very good

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: Chose this hostel bc it said luggage storage but when I asked reception said no but my bag would fit under the bed and I could buy a padlock. It didn't fit so I put the padlock on the zip. When I got back it was undone (picked?). Nothing valuable in the bag but it made me uncomfortable. Staff were very sympathetic and let me switch rooms although there wasn't much they could do. Later found out there were lockers so idk why they didn't say! Still, great location for me as I only wanted Kings X.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: Generator was in a great location, not far from Euston and St. Pancras station and I liked that the hostel wasn't directly on the street so felt safe. The hostel was clean and the staff were very helpful when giving directions and recommendations.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: I was in a room right beside the allocated smoking area, so every time someone was in that area the smoke would seep into the room which was not pleasant. Also the room only had two PowerPoints for 8 people. Other than everything else was good. Great atmosphere at night.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: Pretty nice place, not too far from the underground and plenty of nightlife in the area. Rooms were clean and well kept, and staff was very helpful.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: There was no furniture in the rooms; not chest, nbot table, no chairs, although there was plenty of space. The boxes or crates or whatever under the beds are the worst "substitutes" for any normal furniture. They are inconvenient, cumbersome to use. Has it never occured to anybody that a table and chairs would ber nice in a room? The foolish little knobs that were supposedly fixed to the wall as hangers were nort very great either.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext:
Great spot, value for money, was using the shared bathrooms and all but one male worked. lift was inactive as well but that was easy to overcome.
Staff didn't seem to be real friendly as they didn't really smile .
All in all was exactly what I paid for.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: our stay was great. we had a private room, which came with towels. it also had a sink with a mirror and a full length mirror as well. we arrived early way before check in and were allowed to use the showers after our 24 hour flight, thank god! the luggage lockers are a bit expensive. the single elevator is very slow and we spent a lot of time waiting for it haha. but otherwise, really decked out place, looks great, awesome staff, clean and cute rooms, comfy bed, night security as well.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext:
I was only here for a night but found this anorettt comfortable hostel to stay for that period of time. Room was a little crowded and stuffy but a portable air conditioner was provided for the room.
Staff were very warm and friendly.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: The location was great! In between two stations and walking distance to many cafes/bars. Mostly clean but visible stains on the bed and rooms were not practical. The 6 bed dorm has only 2 power sockets down the bottom. No chance of Charging your phone over night and setting an alarm for the morning. Although you pay more for a 6 bed room compared to 12 bed room the 12 bed has more space and is a nicer room. Took 10 minutes to find my room as staff only point you to the elevator.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext:
Great place to stay the food in bar was great and staff was friendly. The only thing is the security guard takes his job way too seriously and plays favorites when it comes to inforcing the quite rule in the smoking area. Had to ask me if I actually stayed there when I wasn't saying anything and got blamed for being to loud. 
But overall great place . Don't let that one thing deter you from staying there.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: I stayed in a totally unventilated basement room with basically no natural light that stank of wet towels and feet. The temperature in the room must have been over 80 F, though it was quite tolerable weather outside. Truly a terrible experience. I've previously stayed at Generator Barcelona and expected better.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: Great place to stay great location close to the station. Only downside is no power point next to the bed so made it hard to charge phones when the power point is on the other side of the room I know you shouldn't charge your phone over night but having it on the other side of the room is a bit of a security risk of it being stolen. The storage locker under the bed were quite difficult to access expecially when there was someone in both the lower beds

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: Really clean and tidy and comfy beds. Plenty of toilets and showers available. My only complaint is that all of the ladies toilets were closed for cleaning at the same time in the morning. I'd stay here again for sure. Thanks!

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: Upon arrival to our room, our roommates had put all of their clothes all over our beds and took over most of the room with their stuff. We booked a 4 bed mixed room and expected it to be bigger but you are basically laying one body away from the next bunk. There are no chargers or lights in each bunk and no privacy curtain. Bathrooms are smelly and the water from the showers floods into other stalls. No dry space to put clothes or bags so if they drop on the floor, it's soaked.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext:
Good hostel! Excellent location, it is 400 meters from the subway station where Harry Potter was filmed. Friendly staff, very clean bathrooms, comfortable beds and rooms (each one has a locker). Highly recommended!

Buen hostel! Excelente ubicaciÃ³n, se encuentra a 400 metros de la estaciÃ³n de metro donde se filmÃ³ Harry Potter. Staff amable, baÃ±os muy limpios, camas y habitaciones comodas (cada una tiene un locker). Muy recomendable!

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: I spent two nights at generator hostel and it is honestly so overpriced. The rooms I stayed in were both TINY, and only had one or two power outlets on the opposite side of the room that weren't sufficient for the amount of people. No hot water in the shower while I was there, and when I arrived a little bit early for check in they told me I had to pay eight pounds to storage my bag even though I later found out they had a storage room. The page made out like breakfast was included but wasnt.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext:
Definitely for a younger crowd. There is a bar/night club-ish area within the hostel itself. I could hear music play late at night in my room. Don't know if it was another room, or the bar though.

When I checked in, someone had claimed my bed already, but the staff were helpful and relocated me to another bunk. The bunk beds are metal and squeek constantly. 

Toilets were absolutely DISGUSTING. 

I imagine this place sleeps hundreds at a time, and it feels that way.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: you cant almost charge your devices in rhe co ed rooms

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: Stayed at the Generator in Berlin & Paris & loved them, which helped me choose this hostel but I was left underwhelmed & unimpressed. The staff were stressed out & unhelpful, and I never saw the reception without a queue. Reliable aspects are the lockers under the beds, large rooms, free wifi, key card entry, BUT no bedside lamp or plugs, no AC, expensive towel hire (Â£5), & nowhere to put your things in the shower cubicle. Would prob try somewhere else nxt time I'm in London.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: Unsafe! I checked in late at night and the hostel manager said that there was an error and I needed to give him cash for my stay. I didn't have any cash, so he told me I needed to leave my credit card or my passport as collateral. This seemed very suspicious, so I refused. He then put pressure on me saying to find another place to stay, however it was very late and I wouldn't be able to find other lodging. I argued with him for a long time until the system 'worked' again. Hope mgmt contacts me.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: Bright clean hostel. It's huge so loses a little atmosphere and oddly there were loads of kids and family around which is totally cool, just unusual for a hostel, particularly one that has a bar open until 3am. Staff were nice and friendly but super busy so hard to get much information about the area or tips. Overall a good experience, except for the fact we were traveling as a couple with a private room but got bunk beds!

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: Amazing people. There was a misunderstanding as I booked via an app and the staff really went over their way to keep me happy. Tayler the Kiwi guy at reception amazing person and Alex the GM also awesome. If you're looking for a vibrant and central place in London, Generators is the place to be.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: Felt very safe there.  The staff were all friendly and accommodating.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext:
After checking in to my room I discovered it stunk of smoke I wasn't the only person who complained. I asked to move rooms, I was expected to pay to move to a room that didn't smell of smoke. I was put on the 5th floor the lift was broken.
 The rooms where poorly ventilated 2 old noisy fans where in our room. You couldn't open the window. I couldn't sleep due to the noise. Also not enough sockets for everyone in the room. WiFi was glitchy.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: Absolutely fantastic value for money, found the place pristine for a hostel and in particular I found the bar downstairs very good and very sociable. I was staying on the 6th floor and the elevator was out of order yet the hostel offered 20% off food and drink vouchers for the inconvenience. Overall I'd recommend this place if planning a lads trip to London etc. and I'll probably use it again.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext:
Rude staff, elevator not working, non helpful staff to help with baggage. I have a health condition and couldn't physically carry my things up 3 flights of stairs, I booked this hostel specifically because they have lift access. The staff member said I looked healthy enough to lift them myself which was disgusting. 

Also blood on my bed and cleaners refused to do anything about it and told me to cover it with a sheet.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: This hostel is in a great location, it is a 10 minute walk from Kings Cross station and accessible to all major London attractions. Overall, the hostel was good, it was quite stylish and had a good atmosphere. The room I stayed in was very small, but it served it's purpose. It was a long walk from the room to the showers/toilets which was slightly inconvenient.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: Good and bad here.  The location, beds, showers, atmosphere in the bar, cafe food all good.  The fire doors on all bedrooms close with a loud bang, so the noise prevents any sleep, even with earplugs.  In a hostel, there are comings and goings all night, so sleep is impossible.  Only stay here if you don't need to sleep or the doors are changed to soft-close fire doors!

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: The bedrooms where to hot. The rest was awesome

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: Highly recommend this place, friendly staff, clean, easy to get to. Good food & drinks.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: Many thanks. Enjoyed my stay. I was very pleased to see that an air conditioning unit had been installed in the dorm, which was much appreciated. I do miss the buffet breakfast which Generator do not seem to do any more. Staff were great as always. One negative point is that I was concerned that I had to write down my driving license number on the registration form. I haven't needed to do this before, and I wonder why this is required, and if this information is stored safely.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext:
Hopefully you visit here when it's not hot. There is little to no air circulation and since it's London there isn't any air cons. This generator is a bit dated and lacking compared to the other Generators we have stayed at before.
There isn't easy access to a plug or light unlike other Generators that have them in your bunk. Also some of the bathroom situations are pretty tight and can get very weird when more than two people are trying to maneuver around.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: Stayed with my two friends in a private room we had such a good time. Room was lovely, staff very friendly and a great atmosphere. We made so many friends and would definitely return. Only issue was no air conditioning and it was very hot but we knew we would have none so we were prepared for it.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: Stayed one night the showers were small and sprayed your cloths and drain into a central channel so there's no dry space...the room had no air flow and windows can barley be opened woke up sweating.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext:
Dont stay here at summer time 
This was the worst experience that i've Ever had
I went to many others generators before but I never felt so disrespected in my entire life.
I'm traveling with my mom which is nearly 60, they put us on the 4 floor but the lift wasn't working for two days but that not the worst 
The bedroom tells more like a sauna that a room 
When I asked for help they gave us only ONE fan ( the smallest type that you can imagine ).
So we stayed 2 days but couldn't enjoy.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: It was a weird mix between party hostel and a family hotel - I couldn't quite figure out which it was. The restaurant/bar was a cool place to hang out, and had good food.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: Everything was perfect apart from room was really hot and needs air con.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: It's fine. Expect any hostel you go to in London to be hot and stuffy. This place, however, charged for things like luggage storage, and locks whereas other hostels have that for either a deposit or free. It's hip, so when you walk in, you definitely know what you're paying for. Some families and older folks were staying when I was there, but it's mostly a haven for the 20-something travel crowd. So, typical hostel experience in that way. Truly, it's typical, but it's by no means great.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: Fantastic hostel. Clean washrooms and beds. Hostel bar is open late for those who like partying, but also not loud enough for the noise to bleed into the rooms if you want a good night's rest. Beer pong, pool, great music and a live DJ on weekends. Cheap beer for London prices too. Highly recommended for those who are solo traveling and looking to meet new people!

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: It's all Gucci

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: The room was not very clean and the bathrooms smelled damp. Apart from that it was a great hostel, good value for money and location.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: Unfortunately we were there in summer and they have no air-conditioning or fans so it was very hot in the rooms. The shared bathrooms weren't particularly clean.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: Although the rooms and the cleanliness were good this hostel left us a bad impression. This looks like a huge dormitory with few atmosphere, far away from the philosophy of travelling on a budget and focused on making a lot money. There is no free luggage room, but lockers you can rent for a mere Â£8 a day! Unlike many other hostels there is no kitchen or dining room. Plus, it is forbidden to eat your own food in the few common spaces. Only food purshased at the "restaurant" can be eaten there.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: Very good hostel overall, although it doesn't quite live up to its counterpart in Paris. No aircon in the rooms, and separate shower facilities to all the rooms (no ensuites at all). Location is a bit out of the way compared to a lot of the big sights in London, but it's close to several tube stations and London St Pancras/Kings Cross, making it easy to see London and England as a whole with the hostel as a base. Overall would recommend.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: Everything was perfect, except that I asked 3 times for bed sheet before they gave me some

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: I stayed here with a friend at the end of July 2018. Good little room and noise level was fine. The bar area was fab-great atmosphere and friendly staff. A member of staff in the luggage store was unhelpful and actually really rude so that spoiled what was an alright stay.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: Your average generic hostel with no real personality. They don't let you store your things for free if you arrive before the move in time which was really shocking to me. They don't provide towels either  - you have to pay. Another big problem is the lack of personal plugs next to each bed.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext:
The is only one bathroom per floor, that means 5 showers for about 50 rooms!
The power outlets are on one side of the room, which is very inconvenient when traveling as you use your phone as alarm clock and also for navigation, etc so you need to charge it but keep it close.
The staff wasnt willing to let anyone check in early even tho there were plenty of empty beds.
Also, there were a lot of families and "older" people staying, which I don't really mind but just take that into consideration

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: I would never recommend this hostel. Firstly my badroom wasn't like the one on it's website (4 bads in a really really small room and warm but very warm). Secondly it wasn't a clean hostel and tge bathroom was warm as well and not clean. When i asked for a coffee on the bar, breakfast time, they said the machine was being cleaned (perfect time for it). I've never been asked to pay for my boarding pass prints in a hostel, but there i had to. So i am very frustrated with this hostel.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: It was very hot and stuffy in the room and it's a goot idea to think about air conditioners (nobody knows how the weather will be next year).

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext:
The pictures on the site do not deplict the actual hostel. The rooms were tiny the bunks were awful and squeaky. Half of the showers didn't work and the toilets didn't flush or the knobs were broken. The lift was out of order the whole time I was there so luckily I had someone take my bag to my room when I arrived but had to lug down the stairs when I left. The food was average and who doesn't sell real (still) water and only sparkling in the club/pub section!?
Will not be back.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: This place is a joke. All these amazing facilities and things to offer and then you're placed on the 6th floor with no elevator and no AC in your room that's 35+ degrees. Like a Ferrari with no tires. I woke up in a pool of my own sweat and had to go outside and lay on the curb to cool down. I've been in Finnish saunas that we'rent as hot as my room. Thailand, Vietnam, Greece, Malta, Rome... hottest room I've ever been in- england. They should just shut down and start over.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: just needs a working elevator

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: Perfect location from kings cross! Overall really enjoyed my stay however, The massive downside to this hostel is that there was no air conditioning and no windows in our room. This made it very hot and uncomfortable. I appreciate the heat we experienced is not normal for London, but a window might of been nice.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: common area is nice; room was way too small for 6 people and only had 4 power outlets, no AC and no fans which means it was nearly impossible to sleep in this little hot box that was called our room; location is great; canÂ´t recommend in summer though

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: Bottom level had good air-con and showers. Very good location, walking distance to British Museum and Kings Cross. Felt safe as well

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: Generator was awesome! We only stayed one night, but they have great staff (who hooked us up with a fan!), amazing water pressure in the showers, great food and bar, and many many options/ideas for traveler excursions. They are located right by Kings Cross. It is a big hostel, so there's some wait check in/check out, but that's expected. Unfortunately the lift was not working while we were there, so if you have big bags or mobility issues, I'd recommend to call ahead to make sure its running.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: Horrible hotel to stay at. I never give bad reviews to anything but this place is not worth staying at all.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext:
The dirty condoms in the shower were just what I needed 
Other than that it was an okay experience 
If your Sub 25 years of age it's a metropolis

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: Everything is easily accessible by public transportation. Very clean. Was in a 4 person room - and it was a tad tight but you'd still be comfortable.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: Great place to stay aircon I. Rooms would be great as they are so hot and stuffy

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: As there is no air conditioning in this hostel and during mid July its was super hot and stuffy inside the room. I cant really sleep with it! There is no air ventilation in the room.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: Elevator was broken and facility was horribly ventilated. Extremely hot.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: Great location. Good vibe

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: The location is great ,the hostel is close to two underground stations. The atmosphere is nice and the staff people are nice. I had a problem with two things: 1. There is only one elevator and it didn't work. They don't say it when you arrive and you need to figure out that you're staying on the fifth floor without elevator. The minute I realized that I told them no way and insisted on a room on the ground floor. 2. The storage cost money.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: Pretty much a standard hostel. The room was kinda small (we had a 4 bedroom). The communal showers were clean so there wasn't an issue with that and our room itself was clean. Only like a 10 minute walk from Kings Cross too

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: Amazing hostel. Loved the dorms set up with lockable drawers under the bunks. Location was perfect for central london (e.g Oxford St for shopping) Bar had great food and staff were more than accommodating with my booking requests. Would stay again happily :)

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: Great atmosphere in the common areas. Staff were friendly and helpful. Rooms were modern and clean. Plenty of bathrooms and showers. There is a bar/restaurant but we would have liked to have a kitchen. Short walk to train station. Maybe enforce a lights off policy after 11pm. We had other guests coming in to the room at 1am turning the light on when we had to catch an early train. Apart from that we loved this hostel and would come back again.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: I've stayed at this hostel before and loved it, but this experience wasn't the greatest. The staff weren't overly helpful and also double booked my bed. There's also no fans or AC so it was really hot

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: Overall was nice and the rooms were nice. Although the shower head was too low in some showers (I'm 5,10) and I was a full head above the shower head so made it very difficult to shower. Also the elevator was out of service so had to carry my 20kg backpack and other backpack up 6 flights of stairs. Was very inconvenient and it was like that all week, staff didn't talk about it whatsoever or apologise/offer anything for the inconvenience.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: when we first came to the hostel at about 12:30, we were told we had to wait until 2pm to check in (which we did). when we went into our rooms, my bed was not made and the pillow smelled like sweat and there was an empty soda bottle on the bed. the rooms were unbearably hot (we were on the top floor) i woke up at 6am to go downstairs to sleep because i was covered in sweat. my friend that i was traveling with got Â£250 cash stolen from her out of the bathrooms.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: This was my first time staying at a hostel, amazing location, the staff was beyond friendly, the vibes made you feel so welcome! Unfortunately there is no AC it's was warm inside. I would recommend this place to anyone especially if you are traveling alone. The downstairs area is a bar where you can meet people from all over.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: so very hot, only have facilities for cold weather, very unprepared for hot weather

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext:
I have stayed at the generator in London several times before and usually got breakfast automatically. IT was basic cereal/toast/croissants/tea or coffee & juices.
However that has now changed and you have to pay Â£8 each day for breakfast. The breakfast was of poor quality and elements of the hot cooked part were in such small quantities that they were hardly available and you had to wait substantial periods for any to arrive at the self service.
The rooms & Beds were fine
The showers were poor

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: Its a good hostel. A little out of the way from things but the metro is nearby and easy to use. The oyster works for all forms of public transportation. Good bar and common area. I would recommend it. My only complaint is once you check out there's an 8 pound charge to rent a locker for the day. Madness!

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: It's in need of some TLC, the shower was falling off the wall and the toilet door wouldn't lock. The staff are overworked,  there's always a queue of 5 or 6 people at reception.  It's one of those huge hostels that lacks any real personality, you're just one of another 3000 travellers staying there.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: Overall good location and really good communal areas.There were a few downsides, our room was below the bar/club so it was loud all night and very hard to sleep. There was only a couple of sockets in a room for 8, and no mirror but a sink which was handy. The staff were sometimes fine, but not the friendliest. Because of the location it was good overall, but it was probably too expensive for what we got, especially given the room being dark/too loud to sleep with a wall right outside the window

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: 13 people in a room with only ONE place to charge all your equipment. Two outlets and two USB ports... for 13 people traveling with phones, tablets, laptops, cameras etc. Only one SMALL tower fan provided ventilation for the entire room, luckily my nights in London weren't hot ones but in a room with 13 people giving off body heat it can get warm and sticky in there

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext:
The ladies bathroom had a horrible smell the whole time. The room next door was very very noisy at night, some kids where shouting and screaming, think they where ask to leave at the end, but it was 2am and it was impossible to sleep.
Really hot the room, not even a fan to make it easier to stay. It was worse than I expected sadly. thanks.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: The bathrooms were really gross to be in and it's pretty terrible that, if you're in one side of the shower, all the water from the other showers across runs through your shower and into yours. The rooms were insanely hot, for summer in London, there really needs to be aircon or at the very least a fan, especially disappointed in that because I was in a private room. The basin was dirty when I got to the private room. My private room had bunk beds instead of a double.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext:
We enjoyed our stay in Generator last week-end.The only problem I found was that toilets in shower room, two of the cubicals were blocked for the three days we were there.
Also in room 019,where we stayed,noise such as air conditioning and sound of dripping water at night was a bit offputting. Apart from these gripes we had a great time.

Yours, Paul Wearen

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: Beds and showers were clean, staff were enthusiastic and friendly, and the location was perfect. Would recommend to anyone staying in London. No complaints

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext:
The location was fantastic. Central and easy to get to a lot of things. But that's about it. The room was SO hot. There's no air con so if you plan a stay over Summer, do not stay here. I don't mean regularly hot, I mean stuffy and sweaty 24 hours a day. It never cools down. The beds were dirty, and we had to move rooms twice because they had over booked and couldn't give us the room we originally booked.
Not staying here again that's for sure

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: I had two beds booked. We cancelled the day before and they charged us over full price as a 'cancellation' fee!! Absolutely terrible service.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: Super disappointed with our stay at the generator. We booked a private twin room for two nights and definitely didn't get our money's worth. House rules were not enforced people were running around the hallways yelling at 2 am. It was ridiculously hot with very little ventilation and no offer of a fan to rent. Nearly every door in the bathroom didn't lock for both the showers and the toilets. The only positive was that the sheets were clean, definitely won't be staying again

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: Cafe and bar a bit expensive otherwise my overall stay way amazing.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: The hostels bar is great for meeting people and the rooms are clean. Breakfast is delicious but a bit expensive and the staff could be a little friendlier. Defs recommend the free walking tour though.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext:
Really good location, comfortable beds. Friendly staff.
Quite small and hot rooms, but we asked and got a fan, it helped a bit.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: Great vibes for a hostel, bar was good fun and people everywhere. Bathrooms could stand to be cleaned a little more regularly and where incredibly hot with little to no ventilation. Staff really helpful and friendly. Rooms are tiny though, we travelled Europe for 6 weeks and stayed hostels almost everywhere we went, we had a three bed private and the room was by far the smallest we stayed in. Almost impossible for everyone to try and get in their bags and dress at the same time

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: I had the top bunk in a 4 person dorm on a higher floor & was absolutely miserable. No ventilation at all. The bunk had a ledge on the side where you could put stuff- mine was so full of dust bunnies. Not even just a little - a lot. My allergies were so terrible I could not breathe or sleep at all. I was supposed to stay for 6 nights but booked a hotel by 5 am my 1st night there. Plugs far away from beds, showers smelled, mattresses that popped when I moved, the bedside wall was dirty! Ewww.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: It was a lovely stay and I met some great people only thing is the rooms got really hot and there was no aircon. Other then that good stay would go back

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: This was my first experience at a Generator Hostel. I was expecting a great experience as my DIL and son have traveled extensively and RAVED about the Dublin and Paris locations. It was filthy in the common areas. Windows  facing the "smoking patio made our room reak of cigarettes. Perhaps inform guests?? The bathrooms smelled of sewage. So bad we had to use WC on other floor. Obviously the Generator name does not equate to universal excellent lodging- do your research!! Never again in London!

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext:
Really good and friendly staff! No aircon in the rooms made it hard to sleep on the hot summer nights.

Other than that good stay.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext:
Staff were nice and welcoming
And helpful with every question. I would recommend this place and would stay again

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: Staff were helpful but not friendly. Really good location as not far from st Pancras and kings cross. Only 4 female showers for a whole floor which considering the size of the hostel isn't ideal; they were also not great showers. External food wasn't allowed in the hostel which was very annoying as we got in late on a Saturday night when the bar was very busy so had to go out and find somewhere to get food.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: A lovely friendly place, convenient for major London stations yet in peaceful Bloomsbury. Good basic accommodation and with cafes, bars and music.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: Overall good! Rooms were a bit tight on space but other than that I really enjoyed my stay! Plus the PUBCRAWL was amazing I had so much fun & made some really awesome friends!

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: One of the best hostels in central London.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: He staff not friendly at all someone was in my bed 2 nights in a row

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: Staff were friendly. Room was clean. Bathrooms were not clean and water wouldn't drain properly in showers. One elevator for entire hostel which was always packed.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: So hot and rooms were awful

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: The hostel itself was clean and in a great location. The downside is that no food or drink was allowed inside the hostel, and food at their restaurant and in London is relatively expensive.

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: Great helpful, coutisious and knowledgeable staff from front end to kitchen.  The breakfast option was very good and provided the fuel to keep going all day.  Well worth the money in all regards. Thank you.  Linda

name: Generator Hostel London
reviewtext: I stayed at the 4-bunk mixed dorm. The room was extremely small, and it was not really possible for everyone to open up bags, move around etc... It was also pretty hot inside. The electric sockets were pretty far from the bed, and there were no reading lights etc... But toilets were really clean. Staff was very friendly and location is also good; lots of nice cafes and pubs around.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Really enjoyed my stay awesome location close to central easy access to tube!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: An excellent hostel, highly recommended. Its close proximity to many popular tourist sites like Tower Bridge, Tower of London, and the Shard make it a great location. The staff are very friendly (especially compared to some of the other Wombats hostels) and allowed me to check in 2 hours early because I was so tired upon arrival. I had to switch rooms but it was no big deal. The all-you-can-eat breakfast is worth the Â£4.90 and the amenities are spotless. Will definitely stay here again!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Stayed here 3 times, going back again on Tuesday. Staff are top notch and the place is clean, atmosphere is great, happy hour beers are cheap. Location is great, close to shoreditch, santander bikes are right outside, metro is a 10 minute walk away if you want to go to central london. Can't fault the place honestly, it's just great. Special shout out to Matt who was particularly helpful.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Had an amazing time here!  Super clean, awesome staff, terrific bar & atmosphere.  If you are undecided, don't be.  Just book before it sells out!!!  Will definitely come back here again.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Huge hostel, but very good, modern facilities and huge bar in the basement. Lots of common areas to hang out in, which is nice. The breakfast is a bit pricy for the budget traveller, but it is a buffet.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: The location of this hostel is good.  If this hostel was located near the center of things it would be the receive the perfect score 10/10 imo.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Clean rooms, easy going staff, very accessible to city centre areas, great value for money for a quick night in the city. couldn't ask for more.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: This is a great hostel! Very clean, basically a hotel with multiple beds in the room. The staff was friendly and helpful, and the downstairs bar is a great place to meet other travelers.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Amazing! Helpful staff and great overall experience.  Absolutely loved it !!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Pretty good hostel,  my matress wasn't too great. Not easiest place to meet people although I didn't use bar, so maybe me!.  rooms are really nice and its very secure,  just needs a bit of maintenance in rooms.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: The whole vibe of the place was wonderful! They have an area that you can lock up your luggage while waiting to check in or after check out if needed which is such a big help. The location is perfect due to it being by many food places and all of the public transportation. The inside was awesome. Free WiFi, charging stations by each bed, cheap laundry, a whole downstairs bar area with hammocks and games, kitchen area, and really nice staff that even give you a free drink voucher. Loved it!!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: We were pleasantly surprised by Womabts! Our room hadn't been visited by housekeeping when we arrived, and we had to wait about an hour - but other than that very small issue, our stay was great. We stayed in a 6 bed dorm - the room was a decent size, didn't feel like you were living on top of each other. There were individual lockers in the room, as well as power points at each bed, plus more around the room. The shower was great. Security within the hostel was 10/10, felt safe and secure.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext:
All staff are very helpful , except @ the Bar during Happy Hours , took too long to get our beer order...the guy forgot to serve us and he asked me 3 times  how many pints our order 

..but over all still sound !!!!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Everything is great!!! Need to improve beds, they are noisy and not to comfortable, other than that, perfect!!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext:
I loved staying here so much that I extended my stay by 2 nights.  The staff even kept me in the same room.  The whole place was clean and spacious and they keycard entry and locker access felt very secure.  The hostel was easy to find from the nearest tube station and I always felt safe walking to and from the area in both day and night time.
Happy hour in the hostel bar was a great social setting.  I would highly recommend this hostel to anyone traveling to London!
(8 person mixed dorm)

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext:
Very clean, everything seams shiny and new.
It's a big hostel in a big city, you have people that get up at 6am and others that go to sleep at 4am.
The Location its ok, its not superb but you are 5 blocks away from the subway.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Amazing facilities and great location. Service at the bar could have been better. I ordered a pizza that took one hour - they obviously forgot about it, and the day before I tried ordering food right after a guy in front of me had JUST ordered a pizza, to be told the kitchen was closed. I know it was right at 10pm but I was waiting on the line for at least 5 min just because the staff was slow to receive orders, so it would have been nice if they had been a bit flexible.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Very clean! Staff was extremely helpful. Easy to get to all main attractions. The bar is such a great atmosphere and really easy to meet new friends. I was a solo female traveler and felt very safe and comfortable here! I would def recommend staying at this hostel!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Very satisfied overall!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: I live in London, but i always make sure I stay here after a holiday as it is so close to my train station. I love this hostel, its very well set up, very clean and each room is up to a high quality standard.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: This is a great hostel. Very clean, friendly staff and great location.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Great hostel. Good location and great downstairs bar, kitchen and hangout area.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Great value for money

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Loved the bar atmosphere down stairs. Rooms were clean and linens can dry cleaned which was nice. Breakfast was a nice convenience, and the happy hour drinks downstairs made for opportunities to meet people to tour the city with. Only wish they had orchestrated some more hostel sponsored events to facilitate meeting people. I was lucky enough to, but its a big place and people can tend to stick to themselves.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Really good hostel with an awesome bar. Walking distance to a few underground stations. Only disappointed that our 6 bed room didn't get cleaned for a couple days which resulted in a our bin overflowing and running out of toilet paper until we went down to reception to fix that.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: I couldn't of chose a better hostel to stay at while in London for the first time! I was on a solo trip and was able to meet so many other solo travelers! The bar was so fun and I definitely recommend going down there and talking to people! The room was great and I was lucky to have amazing roommates! I was in my room when the daily cleaning happened and they don't skimp on the cleaning and it shows! Thanks for the great stay!!!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: pretty good hostel. location Looks good on the map but it's a 10 min walk to the nearest underground station.  the bar was cool, just wish they'd have an age limit - didn't really get the hostel vibe/made it hard to meet others our age when our room was full of 40+ people.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Overall, a great place to stay. Only issue was one of the Elevators broke, and the other one was really slow. I dont fault the Hostel for that. I'd definitely stay again!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: such a great stay, way better than saying in a hotel by yourself.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: The staff are super helpful and friendly, everything super clean, definitely will be back.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Booked an 8 person room, but was put into a side room with 1 bunk, while an adjacent room had 3 bunks with two doors separating the rooms. Disappointing when contact is a positive draw of being in a hostel, and that made it difficult to speak to my "roommates." Toilet wasn't very clean either. Second room was a lot better overall. For being a party hostel, most people weren't very sociable either, instead shooting glares when I tried speaking to them. Some staff were standoffish, most were good.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Secure place. Great room, lots of space. Elevator broke multiple times on our stay and I was actually injured by the lift because there was no signing and was hit by the door. Every staff member apart from one weren't very pleasant to interact with. Great kitchen, bar was great, again bar staff weren't pleasant so only ordered one drink. The atmosphere was good. Not far from a tube station so transport was very easy. I'd stay again but I wouldn't stay it's the best hostel I've stayed in.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: everything you could want in a hostel: clean, friendly staff, good location, safe, good value

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: This is the place to be... Just 7-8 minutes down from the Tower Hill is this spic and span hostel... Absolutely loved it...â˜ºï¸â˜ºï¸â˜ºï¸

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext:
I had a very comfortable stay at Wombats hostel. Rooms were big, clean and spacious. Staff were helpful and really nice and attentive. 
They have a big kitchen and shared space when you can sit and chill. 
Plus, the location was quite central and near two tube stations. The neighborhood was safe as well. 
Although I stated only for one night, I really enjoyed myself. 
If ever I'm going back to London I'm definitely staying at Wombats again.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: The basement bar was a great place to hangout and meet people, it was a great casual place just for the hostel guests. The rooms and ensuite bathrooms were kept very clean! The big problem I had was the noise from both the city and the loud construction across the street. We had to keep our windows open for the cool air but would then be woken up by the construction or road noise, not to mention the DLR across the street! Avoid the low-level rooms facing the construction sites.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Amazing hostel! Would be great for first timers. For groups of 4 or 6, sharing a room would be just as good as getting a hotel (if not better due to the added atmosphere of the bar downstairs). Other than the hot rooms I can't fault this place.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Best hostel I've ever stayed at. Super clean, great ppl staying there and working there, very close to Tower of London and other cool spots! I'd definitely stay here again!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: A great place! If I could live here I would

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Absolutely loved my stay here!! Super clean and secure, and insanely fun. The bar downstairs is so cool and the perfect place to meet others, especially as a solo traveler. Great location - walking distance from the train as well as some of the major sights. Definitely coming back next time I'm in London!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext:
Great customer service.
Spacious room and clean.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: This is the best hostel I've stayed in. I stayed in a six bed female dorm with ensuite. The beds were super comfortable and the bathroom was like a hotel bathroom. The hostel has a great atmosphere with lots of different spots to spend time in when you're not in your room. If I could have stayed for more than a week, I would have!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: One of the best hostels I've ever stayed in. The showers were awesome, great security, lots of people around. Only downside was that my room was quite hot and the beds very squeaky!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Staying here was absolutely great. The rooms are all clean and neat, the front desk staff was super friendly and helpful with any questions you may have. Awesome downstairs bar. Truly no regrets staying here I would highly recommend

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Great hostel!! It felt really safe and was really close to everything, including tube stops. Great value for money, the only downside was that our bathroom was pretty gross and the toilet seat was broken. Overall, great place to stay though.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: I had a pleasant stay at this hostel. It has a great atmosphere and amazing staff. The whole check-in and check out process was super easy. I stayed in the 4 bed room and it provided plenty of space. There is a cleaning service everyday, so the room is always clean. It can get a little warm in the night if you are staying in the interior part of the building. However, this is only relevant in the warmer months and it did not take away from my overall experience.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Wombats is the best hostel I've stayed at. Great facilities and an awesome social atmosphere.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: A really good hostel. Nice staff that helped with directions and suggestions for food. It's located about 5-10 minutes away from a couple of different tube stations. The bar downstairs was pretty cool and a nice place to hang out and meet people. The breakfasts were worth the cash and the rooms and lockers were good.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Wombats was great, would definitely stay again.  Great location close to tower bridge and underground.  The bar area is really nice place to hang out.  Staff very helpful and friendly.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Loooove Wombats! Probably one of the best hostels that I've stayed at. Love the security of the facility and all of the amenities provided. Highly recommended!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Great social hostel with an awesome underground bar, would recommend.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Nice hostel in close walking distance to pubs and the tube. Clean, well kept, safe people and their belongings throughout the day, fun bar on-site full of fellow travelers. Would recommend to others and would stay here again, especially after seeing other hostel options in London that were not nearly as nice.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Super nice place, very clean and staff all very friendly! Rooms very spacious and toilets and showers are right in the room with you and are cleaned everyday :) feels very safe and is very comfortable. Amazing stay!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Only thing I hated were the beds. Everything else was great!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Really good hostel with all the facilities you need and the bar is good, almost twice the price as most other hostels but you get what you pay for

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Great place to stay. Unfortunately the beds are a little squeaky and do not have curtains to give you a little privacy. Breakfast is really worth the Â£4.90! Would stop by again.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Love wombats! You guys are the best! Great bar, great kitchen! Super clean rooms and huge bathrooms! Super close to everything! Shoutout to the guys on front desk for being super rad and nice!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Really nice hostel! Very friendly staff on first arrival, took time to explain everything thoroughly. I stayed in an 8 bed mixed ensuite dorm - you have to carry your luggage downstairs as there's no lift for these rooms, but that was ok for me. The room was VERY spacious, clean, and comfortable. The room-key also works for lockers so don't need your own locks which is convenient. No privacy curtain but didn't bother me. The beds were very comfortable. Good self-service kitchen area.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Wombats was an excellent place to stay. Everyone that we encountered was extremely helpful and friendly and it was clean and well maintained. The only complaints I would have is that it is so big it almost makes it more difficult to meet people. Also, it was a little bit far from some things and the walk to the metro took at least 10 minutes. Overall, we had an extremely positive experience.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Bathrooms were super clean! It was really convenient having two sinks when one person is in the shower you can still get ready.  The staff were friendly and helpful. The keycard system made me feel really safe and the lockers were big enough for my large backpack. The pillow was pretty flat, but the mattress was really comfortable so that made up for it. Overall, I had an amazing time there and would definitely stay again.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Best hostel ever, hands down

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Great hostel. I stayed in a 6 bed female dorm and the ensuite shower was the nicest one on my whole trip. Super nice touch that the shower and toilet are in separate rooms even though it's ensuite, and with a separate sink and mirror as well- so many can get ready at the same time. Loved that the big lockers were controlled by our room key cards- no padlock required. Bunks were so comfy and not squeaky, place was super clean, bar downstairs when you want to go but it's not noisy when you sleep.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext:
Great in every way. 
Great cheering staff. 
Great kitchen. 
Great breakfast

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Friend staff and clean rooms. The downstairs kitchen, bar and hangout space was awesome, along with the garden seating. Location not bad.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: First time hosteling and Wombats was a great experience!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: I thought it was great.  The beds were comfy and we met fun roomies.  The underground was close. We were able to do our laundry and breakfast options were  plentiful.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Had a great stay. All details were accounted for: towel service, key card lockers, very clean, well appointed bathrooms.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: No complaints at all. If I had to give something negative I'd say the breakfast is overpriced and there is a slight lack of much going on in the very immediate vicinity. That being said, the bar in the hostel basement is a great place and well priced.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Overall great stay, just what we needed especially with the hotels being so expensive for the Nottinghill Carnival weekend!!!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Best Hostel I've ever stayed at! Incredible social atmosphere with the bar downstairs and plenty of communal spaces. This was my first time traveling alone and Wombats made it so easy to meet people. The lockers in the rooms are huge and they let you store your bigger bags in the luggage room at reception. I had piece of mind that my stuff was safe. Location was great! People were great! It was great!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: My stay at Wombats was amazing, the location and atmosphere were wonderful and staff were very helpful and pleasant. The room was spacious, clean and had good power outlets next to each bed which I appreciated. Bar down stairs was good fun and a good place to meet other travelers.I will definitely be staying here again!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: I only stayed here one night in between flights in an 8 bed dorm and made lots of friends! The showers in particular are superb.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Overall the place was great. The only thing that really grossed me out were the mattresses. I feel like they should probably invest in some new ones.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext:
This hostel was great for the cost! The location was a nice walk away from the center of London and a lot of tourist monuments. 

The bar downstairs was lively and fun and the free breakfast is a great way to start the day!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Great hostel in prime location close to Tower Bridge and many other London sights! The staff were lovely, and the breakfast was great!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Overall a great hostel! Can't really speak to the social aspect, but it's definitely harder to meet people at bigger hostels. Overall super nice though, and like 10 min walk from Tower Hill tube station which takes you pretty much anywhere you need to go.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Me cobraron demÃ¡s una noche en prÃ­vate room  y al cuestionar porque me indicaron que se hizo mal la reserva lo cual no es cierto y no buscaron ayudarme

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Nice and clean, able to use guest shower before check in

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Overall the hostel was great, big rooms and lots of space. Only thing was my mattress didn't have a cover on it while the bed not being used did, but they fixed that easily for me. Overall was a great experience. Loved the bar at the hostel and the outdoor area.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: A friend recommended this hostel and it lived up to the hype. The staff were very friendly and helpful with any questions I had. The hostel had a great atmosphere as everyone wanted to mix and mingle. Amazing location as well.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: No AC so windows needed to be opened and there was extremely loud construction outside.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Tried 3 different hostels, definitely the best one with the best party vibe at the bar !!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Best hostel I stayed at, very modern and up to date. The bar is great, lots of fun and very social. Breakfast was cheap and good. Rooms were very clean. Location was good, close to train station and not too far from tourist attractions.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext:
The best things about the hostel are the spacious rooms and the facilities. 
Even though the location is not good, I would definitely stay at Wombat's again.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext:
Hands down the BEST hostel I've ever stayed in! Very clean and secure. The staff is so helpful and friendly and the bar downstairs is so cool - cheap drinks in a city that's crazy expensive! 
Must stay here!!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: I really loved this place. The location was perfect and made London very accessible. Staff were helpful and always available. The dorm room layout was probably the best I've seen in a hostel. Keeping the beds separate from the bathroom area and adding an additional sink with mirror to free up the shower is genius - I never found myself waiting long to use the facilities. The bar was a lot of fun and located far away from the rooms which is a huge plus. Will definitely stay again!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: On a cycling trip, fast check in. Staff are friendly, was able to securely store my bike, key card system was very good. Big bar area on the bottom floor, very good vibes. Can't find a single fault with this hostel. I paid for breakfast the next morning, was very pleasant with a few different options and got to chat with a lot of nice people. I will consider this hostel every time I stay in London now.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext:
One of the best and cleanest bathrooms I've been in any hostels. Nice and spacious dorms, free lockers in room and charging point in each bed.

Pretty much everything you seek from a hostel. Only slight downer is the walk from the tube station which is about 8-10 minutes away, tube being your prime means of commuting in London.

Overall a good hostel. Recommended

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Absolutely amazing hostel

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: A brilliantly located hostel close to the tube station and the Tower of London. Travelling alone it was a great place to socialise and make new friends. The dorms were spacious and incredibly clean, equipped with modern facilities however anyone sleeping next to the road will be waken up by the traffic in the morning. The staff weren't particularly welcoming or friendly, keen just to process you in or out. Something to improve upon. It's overpriced for what you get but would recommend.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: It was a really good experience! There a lot of trevelers, but unfortunatly I didn't get in touch with anyone

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Stayed for 3 days/nights. 7 mins walk to tube/Tower Bridge. Good place to stay for the value. Bed a bit dirty.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Wombats was a great hostel- the rooms are really well kept, new and spacious. Bathroom was really nice. Bed comfortable! Facilities were great the bar was awesome and had great drink specials and things to do. A free waking tour/pub crawl or other organised activities would have been good. Wasn't the best for socialising mainly because of the size but also my dorm mates weren't very friendly. Breakfast was what you'd expect of a hostel buffet. Lots of space to chill outside the rooms

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Had an awesome time here. The place is extremely clean. The bar is maybe a little too inviting haha. Close to everything but tucked onto a quiet street.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Wombats itself is a nice hostel but it is super noisy. The beds all creek and there is a lot of construction going on around the building so you can be woken up super early by workers!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Fun hostel! Took the metro from the train station and then walked to the hostel. Close to Tower Brudge but about an hour walk to Buckingham Palace/Big Ben/tourist destinations, but lots of cool pubs and cafes on the way. Hostel has a great lounge area and downstairs. Pretty social and a younger crowd. Breakfast is great for the price. Room has a separate shower and toilet with the sink outside, which was nice.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Easily accessible to anywhere across the city, thanks to it being really walkable to the metro. The bar they have in the basement is great for meeting new people in the hostel, and they run happy hour from 6 to 11 so there's a budget friendly pub there all the time. Helpful staff and clean rooms. The beds in my room unfortunately creaked a lot, which meant if anyone moved even an inch there would be noise that might wake someone up. Heavy sleeper here though, so wasn't a huge issue.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Spent about 4 nights here and loved it so much rebooked it for the end of my trip. Stayed in 3 different rooms while I was there. Each room had at least a sink, shower, and toilet. Some of them had these separate and some had an extra sink! Super clean and rooms looked organized and nice. Bar downstairs was great was a happy hour and overall awesome atmosphere to meet people. They provide towels as well. Super close to Tower Hill stop on district line which was convenient! Would stay again!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: I Really enjoyed staying at wombats they had a great vibe to the hostel and it was super safe. Sweet location close to the tower bridge, great food options as well as having Tescos close by. The 6 bed female dorm we stayed it was spacious and the ensuite facilities were nice and clean. The only thing was being warm in lodon meant the room for super hot, so it was gross and muggy overnight. But other than that loved it and would definitely stay again!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: A bit eastwards in the city, but nicely situated in between 2 underground stations and near the river. Short walk into Shoreditch, Spitalfields, Brick Lane, Flower Market, etc. Hostel itself is super clean and has proper amentities, wifi is good. Construction site across the street was very loud, but this is temporary and eventually the windows will close in colder months. Only major downside was other hostel guests loitering outside, clearly fresh from the bars, being insanely noisy.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Good and fairly cheap place to stay in London for a couple of days.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Staying at Wombats was really excellent: believe the hype. Great vibes, good location, and you really don't feel like you're in another hostel: there's such a comfy attention to detail.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Wombat felt like home away from home. Thank you so much!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Some of the workers at the front desk are very passive aggressive...they look like they don't even want to be there..cheer up mates!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Everything about this hostel was great. Clean, airy rooms (mine even had a view), nice showers en suite, and a bar downstairs that gets busy and has super cheap beer and fantastic bartenders. I would definitely stay here again.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Really good hostel, had the best kitchen, awesome bar/cave and outdoor area, really good bathrooms and comfortable beds, location isn't amazing but is close to two train stations that are walking distance! The only thing is in summer the rooms get soooo hot because there's no air conditioning

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Best Hostel I've stayed in yet! Definitely worth the price and made my experience in London that much more enjoyable. Excellent staff, atmosphere, cleanliness and security. The beds and the temperature in my room were the only things that weren't perfect, but not unbearable and didn't take away from my overall experience.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: I only stayed here for one night and it was absolutely amazing. The room was clean, toilet and shower inside the room, clean sheets, good breakfast. The roomates were friendly and the athmospere all around was like in a student camp. I enjoyed it a lot!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext:
Very well organized hostel, clean rooms and modern facilities suited for travelers. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They also offered breakfast at a reasonable
price. The location is amazing near Tower Bridge and London Tower, there is also an underground station just a few meters away so it was very easy to move around the city. I would definitely recommend this hostel to my friends.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: It was exceptionally hot; the beds are not assigned meaning you cannot stay with your group (thus waking up the entire room); had to KEEP ID to use the locker in the room (I do not mind letting you copy it, but I was not notified you would need to keep it behind the desk)

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext:
Easy to reach from the airport. We had arrived before the check-in time and the reception area was large and had a lot of space to hangout and rest. 
6 bedroom mixed room we booked was very clean, and even though it was a little small, it felt cosy. The shower and toilet rooms were bright and clean. My only complaints about the room is that there was no soap in the dispenser (we asked twice) and it was fairly loud outside the windows (construction/ traffic).
Overall, I am very happy w/ WOMBATS

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Overall the hostel was well located and clean but the rooms were too hot and they didn't have A/C. The wi-fi connection was very good.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
