reviewtext: Amazing hostel, tons of amenities, nice beds with a shelf, light and outlet. Really clean and with an awesome bar downstairs. Also pretty well situated in the city, close to the underground and the Tower of London

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Great Hostel, I stayed in a twin private and it was just like a hotel room. Location is also great couple of blocks away from 'Tower Hill'  subway station wich will conect you anywhere around London.  For 5 pounds you have a very complete breakfast that its totally worth it compare to London's bar's prices. It's a very busy hostel and sometimes it could be hard to use the kitchen, Atmosphere: If you wanna meet some travellers you will definitley do, because the bar is always full of people.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Breakfast not being included in the price was a disappointment for me

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: One of the best hostels I've stayed at. Rooms were super big and clean. Bathrooms were awesome! Theres a huge bar downstairs with great drinks. Not the most social hostel so not the best for solo travelers and staff wasn't super helpful with giving advice about places to go and helping to book day trips but overall a super great hostel!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Clearly the best Hostel I have seen in all of my Europe summer travels.  Thanks for helping to answer questions about getting around the city.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Quality hostel. No point of fault: good location, quiet, clean and reasonably priced.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: We had a great time, would definitely recommend! The staff were brilliant and such a good location, handy to everything either walking or super close to trains. Had a great time!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: awesome place, highly recommended

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Wombats is a great place to stay. The staff is excellent and very helpful. The atmosphere in the hostel is great, the rooms and bathrooms are very clean and tidy. Definitely recommend this hostel to anyone traveling to London.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Can't complain about anything. Really clean hostel, with the right atmosphere, a cool bar

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Overall, great experience! Very welcoming environment and was able to do everything that I would need in a hostel (shower, laundry, storage, etc) it is a little loud at times but nothing to unbearable (bring ear plugs?) great place and highly suggest!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Wombats Hostel was truly outstanding. I chose it mainly for the location, slightly east of the city which for me is the best part. It is close to several tube stations and walking distance from many sights, restaraunts & bars. The room itself was super clean and comfortable, noticeably so for a hostel. The staff were fantastic and willing to help with anything 24 hours. I highly recommend the hostel bar too, it gets quite lively and fun. 10/10, I would certainly stay here again.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: great all round

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Great experience! Wonderfully friendly staff. I had an unfortunate circumstance happen and they were really great about it.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Good first hostel experience. Beds were nice and facilities were clean. Bar had a good atmosphere but music was a little loud and both the foosball tables had flaws :( Staff seemed friendly. Provided unlimited free towels (used that up). Great location, I walked down to the Thames below tower bridge every morning and had a cup of coffee. Also a short walk from the metro station which is right by the Tower of London.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: This hostel is amazing. Very modern and well thought out! Very comfy beds and great common areas. The bar was awesome. Te rooms could get hot though. Overall an awesome place!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Wombats had everything you could want in a good hostel. Rooms were clean and had nice showers. Plenty of different lounge areas you can hang at whether your looking for a quiet place or somewhere to meet new people. Bar was always fun and easy to meet new people with plenty of activities going on, plus great happy hour prices. Can't go wrong staying at Wombats London.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: One of the best hostels I've ever stayed in. I travel the world and usually prefer to stay in a hostel. The rooms and the bathrooms were as clean as a good hotel. Very friendly and understanding staff. Not to forget the lovely bar in the hostel, it just adds 3 more stars to the place. Pretty much connected to everything in the city. And I'll never forget the walk to tower bridge from the hostel it was the best part of my trip. Thankyou team Wombats, i hope to see you all againâ¤

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: As 2 females were in a room with 6 guys we felt quite safe! The atmosphere was great, the other travellers were so welcoming and friendly as well as the staff.! The space in our dorm was relatively large in comparison to some of the other hostels we've stayed in as well as your own shower and toilet. The basement bar was super cool! Close proximity to public transport! Definitely would recommend to solo travellers and groups :)

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Our first impression wasn't good... this blonde girl greeted us with a rude stare was like "what??"  But the guys that worked there were really friendly and we were able to check in the second time we stayed there at 4 am which was nice! The bathrooms being in the room was nice and they were clean. Sick location. You can walk to the Tower of London and Tower Bridge and a cute little canal with boats and yachts and food trucks nearby.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext:
Wombats hostel is a really great place to stay- the location is great within easy walking distance of tube stations - this was my second time I stayed here. 
I would recommend this hostel 100%

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Nice spaced out rooms, nice bathrooms in the dorms as well. Although shower was below average. Great big kitchen and outdoor area to eat, really nice bar staff :) Â£6 to wash and dry laundry is a bit steep for an Australian traveler though (au$12) but besides that was a pleasant stay and 10 mins walk from about 3 train stations

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Had a great stay! Would recommend.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Pros: Clean, wifi worked well, there's a huge bar and kitchen in the basement, the staff were always helpful and knowledgeable.  Cons: The beds squeak loudly at every move, when I was there it was hot as hell in London and the windows would not open all the way, making it an oven up on the higher floors.  I understand they have the metal cables on the windows to prevent people from smoking in the rooms and possibly jumping out while drunk, but damn it was hot.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Great hostel and great location! The staff was kind and helpful, and there's almost anything you could need either for free or for a small fee. Few issues I'd say are that it's a very big hostel, so even though there's an awesome bar/pub downstairs it's a bit tough to be social when there's that many people.  Also, as many reviews have pointed out, no AC in rooms and while I was there it was almost unbearably hot. With summers getting worse, they should definitely consider installing AC.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: The lockers were a little but confusing to use, but overall everything else was great! Made friends here easily and would stay here again.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Go here. Of all my hostels on my two-week trip, this was my favorite place.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Was okay for a few nights, I was meant to stay for 3 only stayed for 2. Rooms nice and spacious, charging dock near bed - not too hot and stuffy considering how hot it has been in the UK.  However bunk beds creek like crazy so if you're a light sleeper wouldn't recommend. Also quite far away from the city, there are hostels in better locations with a better atmosphere from my experience.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Other than the rooms being really hot with not great circulation the hostel is awesome. Rooms have a cool set up and nice bathrooms. The bar is fun and a cool layout with good happy hour deals.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Really high standard and nice place. would def come back.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Wombats was great! The dorms were super clean and bright and the bathrooms were crazy nice for a hostel! The location was great for the Tower of London but a little bit further away from soho and oxford circus but it wasn't a problem as the tube was only a 5 minute walk away! No aircon but that's pretty standard for London and leaving the windows open at night helped! Pretty decent price for what we got especially for London. Would stay again :)

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: There was a blood on my pillow so I checked out 10 minutes later.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext:
Great hostel and enjoyed my short stay there. 
Very close to Tower Hill Tube Station and easy to get to. 
Very good security so felt safe and the staff on the reception were brilliant. 
Would stay again ðŸ™ŒðŸ¼

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Great facilities, super clean and more spacious than some hostels I've stayed in. Love the card locker system as it means everyone can securely stow their valuables with no stress of locks being picked etc. Not the most social hostel but amazing nonetheless.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Decent! More like hotel than hostel

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Stayed here twice during my trip to the UK, once for a week and the other for a few days and i can't recommend it highly enough! So so clean and secure! The bar is also incredible, always with a good atmosphere and cheap drinks! Have made so many incredible friends here, will be staying again! :)

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Great hostel! Its size and the vibe in the common areas makes it have more of a hotel than a hostel atmosphere though!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Really nice hostel. A bit further from the centre than I thought but still close. It was clean and nice and had a good kitchen, although I had a few of my foods taken, which I think is partly due to drunks... good place to be if you want to party too.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Awesome hostel, one of the best I have ever stayed. The only con is the lack of AC, London was very hot in this summer.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: I've stayed here before, so the fact that I came back should tell you a lot!  This place is great--comfy beds for a hostel, very clean, very secure, elevators, etc.  Like with last time, I did find that the location could be inconvenient, since it's far from a lot of the stuff I wanted to do (certain museums, Kew Garden) but it's close to other stuff, like the Globe.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Everything was great! Would definitively stay there again!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Nice hostel, good location and reasonable social atmosphere. The bar wasn't particularly busy the 4 nights that I was there and there were no organised pub crawls, themed nights or events which would have been great. The pool table, table tennis, beer pong and board games were fun though and could have been better if there were events on and more people getting amongst it. My main issue was the lack of air conditioning. No fans and couldn't even open the windows more than a ajar...uncomfortable.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Good everything except for the rooms were too hot to get a restful sleep

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext:
Very pleased to have discovered you.Will evinitelgbtsexagain here and in Europe
But it could be good to have shower shampoo dispenser in shower as well as besides basin ( in private room)

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: I stayed at 4 different hostels during my trip and this was by far the nicest one. The room was nice and spacious, and it had AC (none of the other hostels did)! My bed did not have a pillow or bedding on it when I arrived, but a staff member brought them to my room after I asked. The bathroom was really clean and the little shelf at the bed was really convenient. The bar, kitchen, and games area were clean and well maintained, and had a nice chill atmosphere. Would definitely come here again!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: My second stay at this hostel (which should be indication enough that I like the place). Very well run and incredibly clean. Good location and comfy beds!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: What a gem! I loved everything it about! It is an excellent bang for the buck! I was only here a night but I WILL BE STAYING for future trips. I hope to have the same experience at other locations.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Good location, though the construction at the time was quite annoying.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: wombats its awesome. A grade set up and facilities... close to tower bridge and plenty of public transport. will come back, cheers

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext:
Pros: Room layout was nice, electronic lockers that open with room key, super clean bathroom/shower, ensuite bedroom toilet and shower are separated, affordable breakfast buffet, nice bar with some games to play.

Cons: bunk beds were ridiculously creaky/squeaky, room was hot/stuffy during the night even with windows open, lot of loud cars and motorcycles driving by at night.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Clean rooms, spacious enough for 6 girls to share. Good location and secure lockers. Little bit of construction on the street which started early in the morning, but not a big problem. Nice bar and good staff!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Welcoming staff and atmosphere. Location is close to the tube and tower bridge. The bar was a lot bigger than I thought and was a fun spot to hangout!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Very clean, very fun

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: It's a clean hostel! Room is big and comfortable! Bar atmosphere is good, and staffs are helpful and friendly. Breakfast is good.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Great spot. Location is a bit out of the way but London is so big it is almost hard to find somewhere to stay that you won't have to walk or take the tub to. Very clean facility probably one of the nicest hostels I have ever stayed in and the bar had a good atmosphere.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Very good hostel

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Spacious by London standards, modern ensuite facilities. Plug and USB socket by each bed ðŸ‘ðŸ¼ðŸ‘ðŸ¼Late checkout ðŸ‘ðŸ¼ðŸ‘ðŸ¼ My personal niggles - only ensuite rooms available, with the nature of a hostel, people come and go at various hours and this means even more noise and disruption. There were lengthy hairs in several places, on the bed and in the basin and shower - no one staying in my room could have been responsible for these. Out of the hostels control - but no air flow, and no a/c. HOT!!!!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Very enjoyable. Perfect for someone in their young 20s. Free towels, good beer, great basement bar, good staff, close enough to the tube station. Would recommend to anyone

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Situated in a great spot near two underground stations, great facilities and awesome breakfast and bar. Fantastic security and value for money. Would recommend!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Great location as it is an easy walk to the Underground or to use the buses nearby along with tourist attractions. We were a group of 4 mid 20s backpacking around Europe & enjoyed the hostel and bar! Super nice workers. Felt extremely safe entire time and loved we were able to leave our bags there after checkout to explore. Only downfall is no AC in summer. Our room was not street side and had no airflow so we were sweating horribly all night. Got fan for 2nd night but it's pretty small.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext:
Great location - close to tower bridge and various tube stations. Great facilities - safe lockers (and easy to use), toilet and shower in each room, very clean, charger station at each bed. 
My only criticisms would be the creaky beds - everytime someone moved they creaked! And because they had no air conditioning, the windows were opened to keep the room cool, which brought in noise from the streets. 
Apart from that everything else was very good!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: One of the  better hostels I've stayed at. Very clean, and our room was spacious with the toilet and shower ensuites separate. Pretty comfy beds, the complimentary towels were a nice touch . Great vibes at the bar downstairs . Only thing was that the wifi was a bit slow

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Great hostel! I really appreciated how organized and clean the hostel was. The staff was very welcoming and kind. The rooms were super clean as well which is always appreciated. The only thing I have to complain about was that it was a bit hot in the room I was in and there was no fan provided or so.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Clean, good security, locking lockers, ensuite bathrooms. No air conditioning which made for some hot nights during the July heat wave. Close to metro, grocery store, lots of restaurants. Nice bar, kitchen and basic breaker for 5 euros. I would stay there again.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Good hostel, but happened to be there when it was very hot, they have no aircon so didn't get much sleep as rooms were extremely hot.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: We really enjoyed our 1 night stay & would return when we need a place in central London!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: This hostel is one of the best that I've ever stayed at! The bathrooms were super nice and clean, the staff was hilarious and extremely helpful, and the downstairs is so much fun! The breakfast staff were very sweet too. Definitely would recommend for meeting new people and solo travelers. Location was spot on as well- 10 minute walk from the Tower Bridge/Tower of London and there are bikes for rent for cheap just outside of the hostel. Oh, and you get a free drink at the bar with your check in.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Great hostel, the only thing is they don't change the sheets between the guests

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: I have never, ever been treated with such disrespect as I have with Marianna at the bar!!!  There were no customers and I went up, she was busy on her phone and extremely annoyed she had to put it down to serve me.  I asked her if there were any specials on and she pointed to the menu that said cocktails.  I asked if I could get a long island iced tea and rudely while rolling her eyes said "I guess"  slammed the drink down and started at me.  I took 2 sips and left upset. Not a good time :(

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Unfriendly staff. Overpriced.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: I absolutely loved this hostel! It is a great pace to meet people from all over. It was kept very clean. The bar downstairs was fun and offered good drinks and deals. The hostel was a bit far away from the Big Ben side of town but it also had easy access to public transportation. If I am in London again I will book Wombats!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext:
The hostel itself was great, staff and cleanliness.

There was a massive issue with the airflow though. No air conditioning which is fine, but all windows and doors are secured so you can barely open them to let any air into the room. They're are disgustingly hot and they don't provide fans. 
It's a real shame because the hostel could've been amazing if it wasn't a constant sauna.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Wombats would've been nearly perfect for my one-night stay except for one key detail: it was impossible to sleep. Despite ok temps outside, the dorm room was sweltering â€” I could only manage two hours of sleep when I first got in bed, before the temps got too terrible. The staff was really lovely, the room was top-notch clean, and the facilities are just as warm and adorable as pictured, but I wouldn't stay in summer unless you're sure they haven't run out of fans (as they did the other night).

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: I was in a 6-bedroom with ensuite bathroom. The room was quite spacious, with USB socket, and a little lamp for each bunk bed. The basement floor has a laundry room, a kitchen (with free ingredients like pasta, oil and spices), a nice bar to meet with other travellers. A local supermarket is only 200m from the hostel to buy water and ready to eat food. My flight was at night and the hostel let me leave my luggage in their luggage room free of charge. Overall - a great hostel!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Had a great stay. The breakfast spread is well organised. Location is good for hitting the tourist attractions.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Security was top notch, with you requiring a swipe card for access everywhere! The facilities were super clean and modern (I did stay in a private double ensuite however). Unfortunately it wasn't the greatest sleep due to London going through a 'heat wave' and the hostel having no AC, although that's kind of normal for London. Location was good if your looking for somewhere near Brick Lane ect, but I'd stay more inner central next time personally.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext:
It was a great hostel, the location is amazing and it's a cheap place to stay in London. I love the 24h reception and the staff were very friendly. Sometimes it got a bit loud, but it wasn't an issue. There was an issue with our room and we had to move to another room, which was a bit annoying, but the staff gave us free drink and breakfast coupons. 
Overall, an amazing hostel and I can highly recommend it.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Great atmosphere. Here you can easily socialize with different types of people depending on your preference. the best part of this hostel - clean restroom. Cheers to your great staff!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Staff weren't very friendly, hospitable or helpful. Apart from that - good, clean hostel with really good common areas.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Definitely is way too hot inside with no a/c for me to consider staying again in the summer, but I'd potentially come back in the winter. The staff was nice and the rooms feel secure.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Nice hostel! But quite warm in summer with not much air movement in some rooms! Otherwise great location and great social area for solo travelers!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: I arrived super late at night (about 2 am) and check-in was no problem. Getting bedding on at that hour without disturbing roommates was a bit difficult but I managed. Didn't have breakfast or spend much time at the hostel. It's clean and the facilities are good (except the elevators weren't working--luckily I was only on the third floor). Good location for exploring Shoreditch/Brick Lane/Spitalfields and also easy walking distance to Tower Bridge.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: The only thing missing would be a the ability to hire fans when it is incredibly hot as the rooms are quite airless and also certain power points tripped the power

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Was a little far from the main part of the city so you have to take the bus or tube to the city. Also there is no AC so it can get very hot at night and after taking a hot shower can make your room hot as well even with the windows open. However you can rent out a fan and get paid back.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Great Place good location close to the river , rooms are very stuffy with no airflow even with windows open needs fans or even better aircon other then that it was good

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: The place is great cleanliness and staff wise. The location is somewhat far from the main attractions. Glad I stayed only 1 night after leaving my friends Airbnb. This is not a party atmosphere hostel more so relax and study.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: everyone was very friendly and helpful. I liked the facilities and outside area. I wish it was not as hot in the rooms, but still manageable.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext:
Probably the nicest hostel I've stayed in. I was in a 6 bed female dorm. We had a private toilet room, and private shower room, and an additional sink. Our room was cleaned everyday and everything was very nice.
The basement bar is huge with lots of games, it was very good. Huge kitchen to cook your own food. Staff was all very friendly and helpful. No complaints!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: We stayed in a private room for three nights. Very disappointed as NO AC - it was stifling hot and extremely uncomfortable. We hired a fan, which was so noisy it nearly jumped off the table. They also didn't inform us there was building works which started at 8am. I have stayed at many hostels and unfortunately these were small but annoying factors that made our stay uncomfortable.  I feel it was not value for money to hire a private room. Besides this the staff were fabulous, location excellent

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext:
9/10
Everything was exceptional.
Only downside was the heat in the room.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Nice common areas, although everyone seemed to be glued to their phones. Rooms were nice. Good size, but extremely hot. Windows only opened slightly so there was no good ventilation and it was so warm it was hard to sleep. I'd stay here again, but probably not during the summer.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: A very large hostel, overalls pretty good ... would stay again. Okay atmosphere but absolute full of Australians .... well at least that's what it appears to be as they where the only ones keen to socialise.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: We loved the people staying at this hostel. Everyone was extremely friendly and the bar had a good vibe to it, and there was a man who brought his guitar which was extremely fun. The staff weren't the friendliest, especially at the bar. Security was amazing and there were several things to do (tourist and non tourist things) around the hostel. It was a great experience overall.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: nice place. bar is crowded but generally its really nice & people aren't too loud.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: A short walk to the Tower Hill underground station with good access to all of the major sights.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext:
Clean hostel, bar is good to meet people but would be cool if they organised nights out or had events there. 

Dorms are almost unbearably stuffy, in desperate need of AC in the summer or at the very least some fans.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: The hostel was great but I was unlucky to have a very noisy couple of people in my dorm, including an American couple of pornstars apparently. Didn't get much sleep.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: One of the best hostels I have ever been to! The location is not too far away from the closest train station (Tower Hill) and the facilities inside are outstanding: amazing bar and dinning hall, clean and well equipped kitchen, and spacious and safe rooms.  It is also one of the first hostels I've been to that does not charge for a towel and HAS AC IN THE ROOMS. The rooms were always at a perfect temperature and no matter how many people were inside (we were 8) it never felt warm/suffocating.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Location was 10 minutes away from two different underground stations which was good. Staff were very helpful. Breakfast was good and the bar downstairs is probably the best I've ever seen in a hostel. You get clean linen and towel when you check-in. Showers and toilets were impeccably clean. The only problem that comes to mind is how astoundingly hot it was at night, with no A/C or fans, sleeping was torture after a long tiring day.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Some staff weren't super friendly and the rooms were SO HOT. No fans or air movement whatsoever so we had to sleep with our door wide open. Very secure hostel though with great lockers and key system. Common areas were very groovy and good atmosphere.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: I really enjoyed my stay at Wombats. There is a great space to socialise and relax downstairs, away from the bedrooms. My 6 bed female dorm was spacious and clean, albeit warm because of the summer heat. The location is good and you can ride the Santander bikes that are located out the front for 2 pounds a day. The shower floods slightly but the bathroom is really nice for a hostel. Other pros: individual lights, charging stations and lockers!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Only stayed one night and I really just needed a place to sleep so it's hard to rate everything. From what I could tell the atmosphere seemed great, like it was easy to meet people. Location is great, close to the tower of London and other sights in that area. When I was there it was hot and there's no AC in the rooms, which I didn't love. But if we kept the windows open it cooled down enough at night that I wasn't miserable. Rooms and bathrooms are very nice and clean.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Awesome hostel. If there weren't so many in london I'd always go back. Bar was awesome to have, has huge potential to be a great night. However when we were there it was a little dead, but anyone who isn't afraid t introduce yourself should be fine. Rooms were nice but no Air conditioning. Overall stellar place!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: This was a great hostel and seems like a fantastic value for the money.  It is centrally located, clean, modern, and affordable.  The bar in the basement is a good time too.  I would definitely recommend it!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext:
Overall, this place was amazing. Wombats City Hostel in London was my second time ever staying in a hostel. Super impressed. The showers and toilets were very clean, and love how I had them in my room, versus walking down the hall to a shared place. The bar downstairs was really neat and underground like. They had a great outdoor seating area, with hammocks and comfy fold out chairs to sit in. The beds were pretty comfy. 

The rooms were super hot and stuffy, as the building didn't have AC.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Very disappointed by this hostel, as I had high hopes! Rooms & lockers were very secure, bathrooms were modern/clean, location was fine- 2 nearby tube stops made it easy to get anywhere. But the room was SO loud (and hot) that I barely slept for 4 nights. The hostel overlooks a major road that is crazy loud all night, made worse by the frequent shaking/rumbling from a nearby train. Had I been able to find anything remotely affordable at the last minute, I definitely would've left early.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Overall very good, only downside, rooms were a bit hot.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: At first it looked like a great hostel: clean, friendly people and nice location. However and unfortunately I got bed bugs and only found out when I had already checked out. So I called the hostel to inform them and the only response was a bored: what room were you in? Ok I'll let them know. Not even a We're so sorry for the inconvenience and thank you for informing us. Disappointment I must say.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext:
Everything was fine about this place, except for 2 things:

1. There was no fan/ac in the room and in this London heat, it's impossible to breathe in an environment of a dorm. 

2. My dorm bed 211 was at a very odd place, with a narrow staircase and no lift, making it brutal to carry the luggage up and down.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: No air conditioning and it was uncomfortably warm, I understand however that temps aren't usually that high in London. Other than that, it was a pleasant short stay.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext:
Loved this hostel. Upon arrival, staff are super welcoming and helpful with questions and suggestions. The whole vibe of the place is great and I felt super safe there the whole time.
I was super I'mpressed with the cleanliness and the facilities available. 
It's a little tiny bit out of the way of the city centre but it's super easy to get the tube, bus or taxi to the main hub. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to everyone!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Great place to stay, super cool atmosphere and everything you need for a good rest!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Great stay! Got a free upgrade to a 6 person.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Amazing place - real thought has gone into everything super convenient and clean,  staff are delightful- only one thing - for breakfast there couldn't been more vegan options. Thank you for a great stay we will strongly recommend xx

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext:
I know these high temps are not Lodnon's norm, but goodness it gets to be a sauna in the rooms! You can rent out fans, but there aren't too many (especially large ones) and the fans can only do so much. 
Staff is hit or miss. Some are nice and some are slightly rude.
It takes about 30 mins to get to most places in the city. 
Wish they had more fun events that people participated in!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: It's new and clean. Location is a good 5-10 minute walk from any public transportation, so keep that in mind. That said, you're walking distance from the Tower Hill station right outside The Tower of London/The City of London. There is a grocery store about 5-10 minute walk away. Nothing is that close, but it's not that far either. Be prepared for construction that starts on the hostel at 8:00 every morning. This was my biggest complaint, really. Quite annoying.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: A fantastic experience at wombats! Rooms were clean and tidy, facilities were great! Bar was perfect with a great atmosphere to meet many people! Would definitely recommend to others and of course would stay again

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Great place to stay clean comfortable and updated..reception staff very helpful friendly..facitily great clean great kitchen and bar...would recommend to others ..train about 6 blocks away but easy to find...

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: I was a bit intimidated by the size at first and was worried about meeting others but the bar downstairs and the friendly people made it super easy! I spent most of my nights down there playing table tennis, foosball, or pong and hanging out with everyone. The security was very good with everyone needing a key card to get everywhere and the staff was friendly. The rooms were a bit hot but someone in my room had got a fan from the front which helped! Overall it was a great experience!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: You can see why it's been voted the best in London. Although so many people, it took a while to get my washing done. Awesome atmosphere and great kitchen! No aircon so I was sweating most of the night.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext:
I left due to extreme heat in the hostel - "not built for those temperatures" as the receptionists said, blaming "global warming". Some rooms got fans, but the rest, oh my.
The windows could be opened approximately 5 cm. The receptionists seemed either not suffieciently trained or uncapable of dealing with such situations and kept referring me to their managers (I was refunded the money  the following day, and Hostelworld did so too as a "token of good will", after a few rounds and two weeks)

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Wombats was fine. Nothing special. As a solo traveler I always want a place with a good atmosphere and it felt awkward since it was such a big hostel. Felt like a hotel. Bar was nice but I wish there was a bar crawl or something. Room was great! Beds were perfect and super clean. Only thing was it was SO hot.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Extremely hot dorm rooms, not enough fans for residents. Not a very good night's sleep, major cooling issues should be addressed. Otherwise, it is a nice space, with good atmosphere. The kitchen and outdoor seating are superb, and it is not terribly far from a tube station. It would be nice if they included breakfast at least during this messed up construction season, residents would be less inclined to murder.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: The hostel check in area was easy - keep in mind that you have to provide a photo ID (library card, driver license, work badge, etc. for them to keep while you have the hostel's key). There were a lot to do, a lot of information and the bar below exceeded my expectation! The room itself was clean, spacious, love the lockers' lock. The hostel is nearby two underground stations. My only feedback is to add personal fans per bed because it was a bit warm! Under than that, it was a great hostel!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: This was 3rd hostel in week of travel and it was chaotic and unsafe.  They were buzzing anyone into luggage room.  There were people sleeping on couches in lobby...totally laid out.  People coming in and out of lobby with no one watching.   We felt unsafe and did not stay.  They charged us anyway even though they probably rented out the beds.  Lots of very young people and definitely not place for a more conservative safe traveler

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: I was disappointed that there were bedbugs found in my room so I had to spend a day of my trip doing laundry and moving rooms. A huge inconvenience.  Probably wouldn't stay again just due to that. The rooms were nice otherwise.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: The Wombats Hostel is a fun, energetic place situated near an underground station and just a brisk 10 minute walk to the Tower of London. We stayed in a dorm that had a window that was locked, so it couldn't open all the way. In 90 degree weather, this was miserable, so we borrowed a fan.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: I really liked it and was pleasantly surprised because it was my first stay at a hostel and expected it to not be like the pictures shown. It was clean but my bed was messy from the person who was there before me but overall I enjoyed it and the atmosphere was perfect for me.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: NO AIR CONDITIONING IN THE ROOMS. Didn't realize that until i got there, so something to keep in mind. I'm sure for Spring, Fall, or Winter it's fine, but during Summer it was hard for me and most other people to sleep. Everything else about the stay was great, bar had relatively cheap drinks and plenty of games to play with the other visitors, not too far from Tower Hill subway which will get you to pretty much all the places you want to see. Despite the AC, would definitely recommend.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext:
Great location, not too far from the tube station. Beds were comfortable, showers and toilets modern and clean, rooms were quite large and the staff were really polite. 

The downstairs communal area was a great place to meet other people and had a really chilled out vibe to it. Was a bit on the expensive side but would probably stay again.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: The room was ridiculously hot, all roommates complaining about it and having a hard time to stay/sleep. When I talked to the reception, the answer was "there is nothing we can do, it is not usually this hot in London". Not even a fan. The windows are right in front of a construction, and besides that, there is an annpying sound 24x7 (not sure what that is, probably a machine always on.)  Location is ok, the hostel is very nice. Staff not really. Bathroom inside the room was good.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Nice stay overall, very easy to get to from tower hill. Dorm beds have lamps and charging ports which is fantastic, also beds aren't assigned to you- so you get to pick why bed you what in he dorm! Dorms don't have air con so it get very stuffy and hot. It seems overrated for the price your paying, I've stayed in hostels at the same standard for 3/4 of the price. Overall good stay though.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: This was one of my favorite hostels.  Bathroom/shower for each room.  They've done a great job of making an open, talkative atmosphere so, as a solo traveler, I met people very easily.  Location is decent, only a short walk away from the underground.  Place was very clean and luggage lockers were large enough to fit my whole bag.  Overall great stay.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: No AC in the room.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: I stayed there for two nights, I enjoyed every second of it. High safety and very clean room with big open area, but there waa no a/c which was really hot this time in London. I Recommend it!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Booked this hostel last minute due to a delayed flight & wanted to sight see in London the next day. The directions online were easy enough & staff was very helpful when I arrived, even with directions to Reading. There was no AC/fans in the scorching hot rooms. I got a small plastic fan for a deposit, but it was still hard to sleep... Uncomfortable beds, hot rooms & loud street below with the open windows as ambulances drove by & drunk people were loud until 4am. Close to attractions though.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Not as good as other Wombats. The bathroom constantly smelled overwhelmingly of urine, the rooms were a bit dingy, the location is not very convenient for getting around London, etc.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: The cleanest hostel I've ever stayed in. I stayed in a 4 person room and the bathroom was amazing. Please note that there is no AC and it can get really hot in the room when it is hot outside. Bar downstairs was fun and drinks were affordable. Also close by Shoreditch which offers fun nightlife. Would recommend to anyone!!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: This one is really great. There is good wifi, huge bathroom, lockers in the room, the staff is nice and will help you get to where you want, there is security 24/7 plus you need a key card to get through all the doors, the bar is so so so fun and I met some great people, the atmosphere makes it easy to meet people, and the beds don't squeak which is so nice. Its 10 mins walking from tower hill and Aldgate W. Its also close to Cam/sditch. I would recommend to groups and people traveling alone.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Really clean and nice hostel, perfect for the solo traveler. My 8 bed female dorm came with it's own bathroom which was great. No complaints at all! :)

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Rooms were very nice and bar down stairs was pretty cool. Would stay again.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: The hostel was great, but the staff we dealt with was pretty horrible. The worst, a very tall, mid/late 20s Caucasian guy eternally in skinny jeans, some sort of crew neck tee and quaffed up light brown hair. Since this "review" only allows for a few characters, I can barely write half my story before it cuts me off. But in a nutshell, 3 of the 4 people we dealt with were incredibly rude, didn't apologize for their errors, spoke down to us and made us feel very unwelcome and uncomfortable.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Absolutely loved my experience at Wombats hostel, I was a female solo traveler and Wombats was my first hostel. Always felt safe, staff were friendly and the place was always clean. The atmosphere was amazing, the bar downstairs has cheap drinks especially during happy hour and the perfect place to meet people from all around the world. Overall loved my stay and will definitely be back.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Couldn't imagine a better experience

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Location was nice, for my first hostel it was pretty decent as well.  However, the staff a the front ask were pretty rude, one guy in particular which put me off for the rest of the stay.  The guy in the morning was much nicer, if I had to stay somewhere last minute I would stay again.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Definitely a party hostel. Everyone is very nice, the staff are cool. It's pretty easy to meet people if you drink. The rooms are so hot at night if you go during the summer but I imagine they would be great during the winter or when heatwaves are less of a thing.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: It was at least 30 degrees Celsius in our room each night.  Ridiculous.  I asked for a fan or information on a refund the first night.  The aussie working the desk told me I'd have to wait for day for any information and didnt have any fans available.  Customer service isn't the career for him.  Clean hostel, good wifi, nice basement bar, very secure.  Just needs new desk personnel and fans.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext:
Home away from home.
London's top hostel located near the city of London/Tower Bridge. Staff and management are friendly and will go the extra mile to accommodate you. Rooms are clean and comfortable and the WiFi is great. Nice touches of free towels and a drink on arrival. Only improvement would be better laundry facilities and air circulation in the rooms.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Awesome place! Would stay there again!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Great stay. The staff are great. Good location right by tower bridge.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Had an awesome  time. Met some great people. Staff was amazing. Great location. Would definitely recommend and come back next time I'm in London.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Absolutely loved this hostel. Great bar downstairs where you could chill and hang out with people. Pretty spacious as well. You get free towels which is always nice to have. It's situation at the end of zone 1 of East London. Not a far walk from the tube station and the buses. You could easily walk to the tower bridge and the brick lane market.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext:
Pros: good location, safe, nice kitchen. Free towels provided.
Cons: No soap in dispenser. Bed dirty upon arrival.  Waste basket full.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Best hostel I've stayed in so far backpacking Europe!! The atmosphere is great, only thing is they could make better prices on some drinks ðŸ˜„

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Best hostel I've stayed in. Amazing staff, super clean and very easy to meet other travellers with the bar downstairs!! Will be staying here again next time I visit London

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Fun place! Bedroom was comfortable and secure, kitchen, bar and patio were well equipped and a great place to relax. Staff were super helpful and accommodating. I would definitely recommend and stay again.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: It is a very good hostel. Appropriate facilities, very clean, with a complete kitchen (tough the knives for cooking are very dull) and nice rooms. Very recommendable.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: For the most part I really liked wombats, the rooms were spacious with enquire shower and bathroom which was really handy. The kitchen and common spaces were really nice and comfortable and made it easy to meet people. The beds were sub par, not very comfortable and really squeaky but that's pretty minor. My only issue the whole trip was that on my first night they placed me in a 8 bed room with a 7 person bachelor party, In my opinion it was really irresponsible to place a single girl there.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Lovely staff, perfect location right near the city and an amazing underground bar with a rocking atmosphere. Would highly recommend Wombat's to anyone. Only downside was we had to ask a couple of times for fresh bed sheets when we arrived.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: This is simply rated lower as I think this hostel is best suited towards a younger audience. It is also a huge hostel with many floors of rooms, similar to a clinical hotel and does not have an intimate feel. The staff seem to treat the many customers indifferently (yet politely) which possibly speaks to how big and impersonal the hostel is. However, this hostel I'm sure would suit younger travellers who are possibly travelling alone, keen to meet lots of people.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Love this Hostel, stayed in a 6 bed dorm which was clean and spacious. They had great lockers for storing valuables. Hostel bar had a great atmosphere and lots to do. Breakfast not included but cheap and a good selection.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Amazing time here at wombats! Staff are friendly and helpful. All round had a blast and the bar down stairs gets pumping!!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Great facilities, friendly staff, and good location. Would absolutely stay again.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Stayed in a 6 bed mixed dorm. A first for me traveling solo. Had no issues and found it to be in an excellent location between two different tube stops. Would stay there again.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Great rooms and bar downstairs always good to meet new people! Also nice and close to the tube and the bikes you can hire to ride around London. First heat wave for London so was pretty hot so if you stay hire a fan and it'll do ya wonders!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: I found some of the staff really rude especially since they work as receptionist. They should work on being more inviting/friendly. Also, I had a problem with my room and blood was on my bed from the last hosteller. It was disgusting and they almost were going to make me "deal with it" as the one guy said. Don't think I'd stay there again b/c it seems like all the fancy pictures and marketing are just a facade to a crappy hostel. Only thing I liked was the Â£5 breakfast and the central location.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Enjoyed a very pleasant stay at wombats. I had an ensuite shared dorm. The shower was amazing!Everything was nice and clean. The kitchen facilities were very handy. Close to tower bridge and brick lane, both very nice areas to explore. Would recommend staying here!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext:
I enjoyed my stay at Wombat so much! 

Pros: 
1) Great design and facilities - every bed had a mini shelf and socket, many hooks in the room, room is spacious
2) Great location - walking distance to 3 subway stops and Tower of London 
3) Ambience - most of all, I love the fun, friendly and vibrant people and vibe here. I had so much fun and made so many friends. 
I would highly recommend Wombat and would stay here again!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Super close to the tower bridge which was nice to walk on! Closest metro wasn't so far either. The staff dead friendly, and rooms were clean. It was extremely hot at night which made it uncomfortable to sleep. The lockers in the room were a great size, and fit my entire suitcase in it! The bar was super fun, and we met some great people! I would definitely stay here again.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: The cleaners didn't come every day even though there was construction next door which left black dust on the ground and they filled in the days they hadn't come on when they did eventually come to clean on the log sheet. 2 people in our 6 bed dorm got bed bugs and they gave us washer and dryer tokens to clean all our clothes. the laundry process took all night as a lot of people were waiting and people weren't diligent. then moved into another room. other than this wombats was pretty good.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Great bar, game room, and staff.  Location is good.  Coming from the US, I was shocked to find there was no air conditioning in the rooms.  During my stay, it was particularly hot in London, so sleeping and getting ready wasn't very pleasant.  Other than that, this hostel was ok for the 1-night stay.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: This hostel is amazing. I didn't know what to expect going in, but I loved any and everything about this place (except maybe the construction that started early in the morning that the hostel can't help.) I'm a young female traveler and I always felt completely safe here, and I was so happy that the Wombats brand attracts other young travelers. Meeting other people in the bar was so easy and led to an incredible night. From the second I walked in I knew I would love Wombats, and I was right.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: I think the boat has sailed for me and hostels. The overall vibe was nice and the staff were good at Wombats but the bed was absolutely filthy and the room was oppressively hot. I didn't stay for the night. Picked up my bag later that evening and went to the Travelodge.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Great place for meeting fun people from all over. Staff are awesome too

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: We had an amazing time there. The place it's amazing the environment it's welcoming and you will never get bored at the bar. It's really clean and safe! I'm coming back soon!

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext:
Great hostel. Clean, great atmosphere, close enough to two underground stations. The staff were nice, and the breakfast was much better than most other hostels. 

I would definitely recommend staying in this hostel whether you are traveling to site see, party, or see friends.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Close to train station. Awesome bar! Was able to meet people being alone traveller. Would stay again

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Really enjoyed my stay at this hostel. However one the second night I stayed there was a guy sleeping solo in the top bunk in a female dorm. He left at 5am. It was very strange and uncomfortable for and the other girls staying. Better security would be recommended. Otherwise great hostel. Would stay again. :)

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Awesome location 6 minutes away from the tower with supermarket and restaurants nearby. Modern and super safe hostel with its own bar in the basement. The only negative I have is that some of the staff could be nicer and more helpful. I had an issue with my booking and the staff member I talked to was not cooperative and did not seem to listen to my arguments. Other than that a great place to stay in this great city

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Absolutely amazing. Modern and clean; with a great underground bar. Would definitely stay with Wombats again! However check in is 2pm not 1pm as stated.

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: We arrived late, had emailed ahead to say so, and everything was sorted when we arrived, immaculate room, very modern with excellent facilities. Bar was still open in the basement which had a really nice vibe to it. Highly recommended, will be staying here again next time I'm in London

name: Wombats City Hostel London
reviewtext: Really awesome atmosphere in the bar downstairs! And rooms were really comfy and clean. Definitely would go back :)

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Entire hostel was neat and tidy with all the facilities to suit our needs (kitchen, luggage room, laundry room, multiple bathrooms and showers). Although we didn't have much interaction with the staff, they were friendly and helpful whenever we had questions. A good place to stay, for sure.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Rooms and toilets are so tiny. Rooms have no ventilation unless the window is open so you hear street noise all night.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Good security at the front door. Comfy beds. Great bar in the basement, good to meet new people

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Cool place and if booked in advance good value for money. Decent location. The staff are fine. The atmosphere is pretty awful, no one talks to eachother at all not even amongst the people in the dorm I stayed in. Not really the hostels fault but something to bear in mind. I was there for one night after flying in to London before heading home the next day and for me it was ideal. Id recommend it for that but not as a place to meet travel buddies.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: The greatest advantages of Clink78 are the location, a 7 minute walk away from King's Cross. The breakfast here is very generous and there is a Stanstander bike station literally just next to the building. The kitchen can get crowded but everyone gets by somehow. Atmosphere was friendly, many opportunities to meet with fellow travelers.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Beds weren't that comfortable and the rooms were super small. Much more of a backpacker type of hostel. Shared bathrooms with the floor/ hallway. Bar downstairs was good. Had a laundry room. Can't really complain. Location right by Kings Cross so it was easy to go anywhere.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Probably won't ever be staying here again. Bathrooms were dirty and smelt moldy. 8 bed dorm was tiny in the basement barely had room to get ready if other people were trying at the same time. Had a super strange encounter with this weird guy in the bathroom and he wouldn't stop bugging me, 30 minutes later he getting arrested out front of the hostel. When I asked the desk what had happened they were just rude and said "none of your business". Far better hostels to stay at in London.

name: Clink78
reviewtext:
We got a room, that had no air condition what so ever, so we opened the window to get some air in, but then we could'nt sleep since there was so much noise from the kitchen, and bar.
Then it also felt like we were staying in a kitchen, since it was smelling like a kitchen with whatever dishes they were making down there.

We politely asked to change room, but there was no can do according to the staff we asked..., so we just had hang in there those 3 nights we stayed .

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Great hostel in London. Not in the center of London, but very close to the metro! Awesome events held in the hostel for travelers to meet.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: This hostel had the best atmosphere out of all the hostels I've stayed at (about 20). I loved the bar downstairs and felt safe there because it was just for guests. They had plenty of bathrooms. My only complaint was that the windows didn't have any curtains, so I was woken up early by the morning sunrise right in my eyes.

name: Clink78
reviewtext:
YAMIN!!! It's a Great hostel for all type of goers, has a big bar, a big sell catouring kitchen pool table and it's got staff. Wifi is great everywhere, no air cons in some of the rooms but you don't really need it.
Quiz nights are fun there, I'm also gacked when typing this hey Jake Price-budapesh. All round good hostel would definitely go back! 
9.7/10ðŸ™ƒ

name: Clink78
reviewtext:
I loved my stay at clink! They have a different activity on every night! My favourite was karaoke night! 
Comfortable beds and the girls dorm was very spacious! Only thing I didn't like is that you can't change the temperature of the showers and they were super hot!!!! 
But all in all, great location, amazing staff and very good security! Plus you get a free drink when you check in in the bar! :D

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Good beds, good atmosphere, nice and cheap breakfasts, locker in the room, plugs at every beds to charge your stuff, and a place to store your luggage for free on the first and last day of stay. The showers did not have a curtain to separate your dry clothes from the spray, but they are large enough that your stuff don't get wet. Loved my stay there.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: I stayed here for two nights on my first trip to London after a friend recommended it. Now, I recommend it fully. Easy to find, great location, wonderfully helpful and pleasant staff upon arrival. Facilities were worth the price. Fun atmosphere with a lot of options for entertainment. Most impressive was the security. I felt no cause for danger, to myself or my property, at any time, which was the highest criteria I had. I was so fully satisfied, it made the trip just a little bit more fun.

name: Clink78
reviewtext:
Alway my first choice when traveling through London. Great location, staff, and facility make this the best experience. Having the Kings Cross Train Station a short walking distance allows me to feed my Harry Potter Addiction. A stop at Platform 9 3/4,  within the train station, allows me to indulge at the  Potter Store next door to the Platform, taking mementos with me on my journey back home. 
One of my best stops . . . Always.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Close to Kings Cross station, nice little bar and breakfast available too

name: Clink78
reviewtext: majority of the time the bathrooms were disgusting, the wall around my bottom bunk had dried (god knows what) over it, my bunk smelt like urine and i felt extremely dirty in it. we were in a form of four and the beds were so close together you were practically sleeping next to a stranger. the female showers were fairly clean and decent though. majority of staff were kind and helpful, but it's the odd one or two that ruins it for the lot. wouldn't recommend this hostel to anyone.

name: Clink78
reviewtext:
The location is good, 10 min walk from King's Cross. The smell is awful both in showers and in dorms. There isn't much space in rooms as well. You do have a locker but you either need a personal padlock or you have to buy one at the reception. So yeah... that is for security.
Breakfast is good and it costs you 2Â£. The problem is the fact that you have to eat this breakfast and pay or you can wait till 1p.m. to use the kitchen ://

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Great staff, okay location, however the place felt a bit overcrowded and overwhelmed to cope with the amount of people there. Smelt like s**t, and rooms where as you expext it to be being in a 14 bed dorm, only stayed the night and glad i didn't stay longer.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Clink 78 is a great overall hostel. The price is cheap, staff friendly, and kitchen area very spacious. The beds were comfortable, although cramped together, and lockers were provided in each room (being your own lock, or rent one). Plenty of eating space, and even an in house bar open in the eating area at night. Breakfast for just a small extra charge.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Great hostel to stay at. Great food in the area and close to one of the main railway stations.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: I was very happy with my experience at Clink 78. Arrived on Friday night and went straight down the road to the Ninth Ward for craft beer. Next morning I jogged along Regent's Canal to Camden Town. It takes 30 minutes on foot from Clink via British Museum to Shaftsbury Avenue. There's no curfew, breakfast for 2Â£ is awesome and the staff are always helpful. I had a great weekend and I could go there again next weekend. :)

name: Clink78
reviewtext: I was only here for one night before my train to Paris, but the hostel was super modern, clean, and quiet for a good night's sleep. It's a pretty big hostel and I didn't have time to visit the bar or common areas, so I can't really say how good the atmosphere was, but for a night it was a great place to crash. The rooms themselves are pretty tightly packed but the bathrooms had plenty of space and the location was right near King's Cross, which was great for taking public transport.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: My stay at Clink met my expectations. The room was decent and I slept soundly. The shower area was big and they had hot water. The bathrooms were tiny but did the job. The Â£2 breakfast wasn't the best, just toast, yogurt and cereal. I enjoyed the bar and the cheap drinks. Not that far of a walk from the city center, I suggest you get a Â£5 daily bus ticket to get around. Would stay here again.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Great room, seamless check in and check out. Room got very hot though, could have done with a fan.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Good location, only stayed for one night but I would definitely come back here. Staff were friendly and helpful.

name: Clink78
reviewtext:
Clink78 is a well situated hostel, perfect if you want a place to sleep and just adventure in London during the day. The toilets and showers don't seem the cleanest but again it is still a great value for the money.
The atmosphere at the bar and common area is great, prices aren't too expensive and most people there, whether it be staff or other visitors, are quite nice and friendly.
Quite a good experience overall

name: Clink78
reviewtext:
The best about this hostel is the staff. They're super friendly and helpful. 
I stayed in 3 different rooms in a week. Some where quite small but each bed comes with light, plugs and USB so it's great.
Location is perfect, a few blocks from king cross.
There are many common rooms including the kitchen, bar and TV room.
They also allow you to leave your bags for the day in a storage room.

9/10 will definitely come back.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Room was TINY! Much smaller than pictured. No AC so it was hard to fall asleep at night because it was so hot. Showers were terrible, always too hot and just a trickle of water. My sheets were stained. The bar was nice, appreciated the free drink ticket on arrival but didnt realize it expired the same day.

name: Clink78
reviewtext:
Stayed at the private room. Its definitely not value for money. Its just a bed and that's it. Light comes into the room as the sun rises and there are no curtains. For a very little extra money you can have an awesome room in a very good hotel.
When taking a shower is not possible to regulate the temperature of the water which happened to be too hot. Hostel facilities are good, staff is ok, breakfast is good.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Had a great stay on a thursday night. Place was buzzing with people from everywhere. I was traveling with my three friends so we got a room for the four of us, had an entire room with a bathroom/half shower. It was on the third floor of the building, and I know it is the summer, but the room got so hot that one friend had to leave the room because of hot flashes. It was a cool night outside but no fresh air got in. Third floor 301.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: I shared a private room with my friend and it was good. It was small but since we didn't spend much time there it was completely satisfactory. The toilets all smelled really bad (overly perfumed cleaning agent) and were pretty dirty. Some of the showers were dirty and smelled too much of that cleaning agent as well but others were just fine. We explored until we found a shower that was good. Location was great, abt a 1o min walk from King's Cross station. Friendly staff. Would stay here again.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Everything was amazing & I loved this hostel so much! Thank you Clink78 I will be back soon!

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Great location, bar, and staff! Cleanliness was the only issue but didn't outweigh my great experience overall at all.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: We had a nice time at Clink78. It's a 5 minute walk from the station which is great, except I probably wouldn't feel comfortable walking around the area as a lone girl as there are some interesting characters around there so I was glad to be walking with my partner. As for security, on our last day a full can of soft drink disappeared from our room (and no other travellers were staying there then). We know it's only sprite, but weren't very impressed that cleaners seem to have taken something.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Hostel is situated close to Kings Cross, which makes it very convenient to reach...staff were very cooperative and helped us out big time on multiple occassions. Some rooms are quite small, others are okay. So you need to get lucky to get a decent sized room. Kitchen is quite big and well equipped. Breakfast is also damn cheap and good for the what they charge.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Nice and clean hostel. It got everything you need and it is comfortable

name: Clink78
reviewtext: This hostel is excellent and in a prime location. In some listings, they say the breakfast is free- however that is not the case. It is 2Â£. The breakfast is certainly worth that though, and is one of the best meals you'll find in London for that price. The beds are close together but everything is clean and the staff/people are some of the best.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Great hostel in a good location. Close to tube stations to get all around london. Primary complaint is the temperature in the room. Way too hot. The security was great and each bed had its own security locker.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: We stayed at one of the hostels in London for 3 nights. The first two nights weren't a problem but then during the third night the front desk let 3 drunk middle aged men into our room (a room that only had teenagers in it, and 90% of those teenagers were girls). During the night they were talking very loudly, one guy was singing for about an hour. Later one of the guys asked a different guy if he is masturbating and he answered with yes. And then one of the guys peed in the room twice.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Great place to stay if you're looking for a more party atmosphere. I would certainly suggest it to all my friends!

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Room with weak lighting and limited space. The double bed came in a bunker, with a single bed on top of us hitting our head every time we went to bed. There's only a small window and this limited ventilation. The shower room has poor hygiene with constantly wet floor. There's also no control over the water temperature as well. I will not personally recommend this hostel.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Overall not a bad place to stay. Decent enough beds to sleep in. However, no window in room, leaky toilet and extremely thin walls.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: The room was small but other than that it was great.

name: Clink78
reviewtext:
Probably the largest hostel I've ever stayed in. Which left for a weird vibe tbh.

My room felt a bit cramped, and the showers were literally the worst. Never staying warm, and due to the angle of the shower head and the pressure of the water it kinda felt like you were being attached?

However, it's in a great central location which is easy to navigate. But if you value the ability to meet people and a bit of space (there for privacy!) maybe check out Wombat's London instead?

name: Clink78
reviewtext:
Really friendly staff and an amazing vibe at the bar. It gets a bit hot in the rooms because there is no air conditioning.

Definitely will stay again!

name: Clink78
reviewtext:
Friendly and helpful staff. I was there for one night. I booked a 4 bed dorm because I wanted to sleep better before traveling. Extremely hot in the room, and we were in the basement right next to the dining room, so super noisy from that as well as the street. The bathrooms were unisex so I didn't feel I had a place to change my clothes, that was a bit odd. 
Great atmosphere though if you're looking for a fun night drinking with new people. I'd come back for that.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: I never imagined I could have such a nice time in a Hostel! Even if I was out every morning and most of the afternoons during my stay, I enjoyed sleeping and being at the Clink 78. Nice beds and rooms, big lockers, clean and varied services (personally loved the Courtroom!), and very helpful staff. Will definetly stay here again and recommend it to friends! It's very safe (no keys! Just card!), is right in the centre of London... and cheap! What else can you ask for?

name: Clink78
reviewtext: The room that we were in was a 12-bed room, which is nothing crazy, but the size of the room for that many beds was ridiculous.  It was tiny.  It was so small that four of the six bunk beds were all next to each other the long way with a little wooden divider between the beds.  My friend and I immediately shared a look that said, "you have gotta be kidding me."  Reception tried to claim that everything is small in London, but the number of beds for that smaller size was ridiculous. Sub-standard.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Good place with nice people and atmosphere. Thanks for time in London

name: Clink78
reviewtext: it was brilliant, the staff were incredibly nice and accommodating. i would stay here again.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: The epitome of a factory hostel. I'd like to say the bar at this hostel is really cool, and the design is nice with different floors having a different personality. The room however, smelt terrible. One toilet had puke all over it, the other wasn't flushing a large log left in it. To be fair they clean regularly, but my experience wasn't great. Also I wish the showers weren't time controlled for 10 seconds and would just flow.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Staff help was great, nice beds, enjoyed making friends at the downstairs bar and can't say a bad thing about my stay

name: Clink78
reviewtext: This property deserves even less than 5. Wish they had asked us to rate the room! We took a quadruple room and in pics it looked good and comfortable. But to our surprise, it was tiny and really claustrophobic. The london weather too added to the havoc. We thought it'd be better at night, but no it was really hard to sleep. Also, the breakfast was so average. I have stayed in hostels before, but this was really sad. Also, the cleaning lady kept touching food items with her dirty hands. Horrible!

name: Clink78
reviewtext: It was a very good place to stay.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: The keycard didn't function at first, had to walk all the way back down to get it fixed. When I did get into the room, I was disappointed by how horribly cramped the room was. All the beds were right next to each other, so it felt like we were all sleeping in one big bed. Not every bed had their own electricity socket and light. The showers were terrible and the pipes were leaking all over. They were really clamped as well. There was no place to leave your stuff or to undress.

name: Clink78
reviewtext:
Hi just letting y'all know the private room is not worth it. 
Ours was in the basement with a small window that led to the kitchen leaving us our luggage/ clothes smelling like food. We had no air conditioning in the middle of a heatwave and we had to ask if they had any fans we were not offered any.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: The staff was really nice, they had common spaces such as a bar and a huge kitchen which allowed us to meet a lot of people. However, the dorms were REALLY uncomfortable, hot and there is no space between the beds. There are no windows, no fans and it smelled really bad. The bathrooms were not clean AT ALL. I do not recommend staying in a shared bedroom. The hostel is 2 or 3 km distance from downtown.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Great location and staff, rooms were pretty cramped, outlets and showers did not always work properly

name: Clink78
reviewtext: This hostel is in a pretty good location. It has a nice bar downstairs though some of bartenders are nicer than others. A simple place to sleep but overall not much atmosphere.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: In a dorm with some sketchy and older people. The bar was nice and created some atmosphere to meet people

name: Clink78
reviewtext: My experience at Clink78 was very horrible. My bedsheets had blood stains on them. The shower would randomly go from burning hot to freezing cold with no warning. There was no space for walking or belongings and all the beds were touching each other. It was unbearably hot in the room and it constantly smelled like a men's locker room. In 7 nights I never slept through the night. I would not recommend this hostel to anyone and if you're thinking about staying here checkout Sohostel instead.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: The hostel was great! Guests kitchen was really handy. The bar downstairs was awesome, different event each day, beer pong tournament was the best part. The beds were set out so we all felt comfortable and safe.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: No form of cooling in the room or curtains

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Overall experience was positive. The Clink Facebook page informed me I could keep luggage stored for the entire duration of my stay, but the actual rule at the hostel is that they could only hold the luggage before and after checkout. Thankfully the staff let me keep the luggage stored due to having proof of the conversation. Besides this miscommunication I would recommend this hostel.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Clink78 was our first hostel ever and it was a great first experience. Very social hostel with the bar downstairs. Easy to meet people! It was clean and the bathrooms were maintained. Easy to get to from bus station, but it's right on a busy street so can be a bit noisy. Well worth it though.

name: Clink78
reviewtext:
The bar was really lovely, did karaoke and felt really welcome! I was in an 8 bed mixed dorm but there was only me, my friend and 1 other person staying. 
The toilets are pretty bad though, just a small cubicle (pretty much a plane toilet!) and didn't look/smell very clean. 
Overall, would recommend for the atmosphere in the bar and the helpful staff.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: This hostile is perfect for people 18 and older. They have a great night life and a great bar. It's in the perfect area to explore the nightlife of London. I would stay there again if given the chance

name: Clink78
reviewtext: I liked this hostel a lot! The atmosphere was really cool and there were always events going on. I stayed here in the summer, so just be aware that it gets pretty hot without air-conditioning. Otherwise, I had a great time.

name: Clink78
reviewtext:
Brilliant location, a few minutes walk from several train and tube stations with lots of restaurants and pubs nearby.
The staff were friendly and we had no issues with our room or the showers.
