The hostel bar was cool but it was quiet when we stopped for a drink so didn't stay long.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: showers are joke in this hostel. stay away!!!

name: Clink78
reviewtext:
Pro - great location, not in a too touristy area, lovely pub called The Queen's Head very close by; the building is cool (old Town Hall), clean, safe
Con - unable to sleep due to lack of air circulation, they cant change the building so it is outdated, absolutely no oxygen, small room, no window; staff could be friendlier and say something about what hostel offers; too big, families and big tourist groups
It seems like a nice hostel, but dont stay here, you wont be able to sleep at all.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: This hostel was amazing! The staff was so kind, the bar was great, and the kitchen was huge. The rooms held a lot of people, but never felt cramped. The only downside was the lack of A/C which I would assume is normally not an issue, but I visited during a heat wave. I would highly recommend this hostel to anyone and everyone. Well worth the cost.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: We were there during the heat wave so we struggled with the no aircon but other then that rooms were basic but did the trick

name: Clink78
reviewtext: The location is good,near to many pubs and restaurants but the room and beds are too uncomfortable.The room was not air-conditioned or ventilated,so there was too hot inside.The stuff was helpful and the breakfast was good but simple.Clink 78 is a noisy and crowded hostel.I wouldn't recommend clink 78 hostel for your stay in London.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Terrible stay here. The room were incredibly hot and there was no A/C! Restrooms were dirty the place smelled bad. Do not stay here!!

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Clink78 is an average hostel with the benefit of a great location & good price. It's just a few blocks from Kings Cross, which connects you to the rest of London and England, and within walking distance to places like the British Museum. In summer months, the hostel will be hot,  and only allows scalding hot showers (you can't set the temperature) and has very few windows for ventilation. Bring a sturdy lock - someone entered our room at night and broke a cheap luggage lock off someone's locker.

name: Clink78
reviewtext:
Had a quick overnight stay but I was in a mixed 6 bed dorm and it was so hot! There's only one tiny window and the room was like a sauna. Everyone was sweating just sitting in the rooms.
When I went to take a shower that night there was also no hot water...
Took another show in the morning and there was hot water.
Everything else was fine but I think the hostel should provide complimentary fans or something to help keep the room cooler.

name: Clink78
reviewtext:
A good place to sleep. The price is good but dont expect to get more than what you pay for. The lockers in the room are big enough for a carry-on if its flexible, but they are cubicle, so if you have a rectangular bag that's a fixed frame, it won't fit. You would either have to keep it under your bed or out it in the luggage room.

Showers could definitely stand to be cleaner but they're not disgusting. Staff is perfectly friendly. Location is great. The bar is fun. The place is cute +  clean!

name: Clink78
reviewtext: The hostel was unbearably hot. Also the room I was in the windows have no curtains so the sun was beaming down on you very early. There was also a lot of noise from the road that made it hard to sleep. The staff were nice and helpful. The bar was good, but they would blast music when nobody was in the bar so it was hard to meet people and have a conversation.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: This place is decent. Good location, good vibes, cool bar. The one thing I didn't like is there are no bathroom inside your room. Toilet is separate as well as the showers. Also, rooms are small and the bunks ladders are ridiculously small and kind of dangerous.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Overall a decent place to stay. Only issue I had was that the beds were quite literally touching each other with privacy barriers in between. If you really need your own space then this isn't for you but overall nice place with clean showers and good wifi

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Don't stay here if you want to sleep. My room backed onto the hostel alleyway and there was constantly racket from carts and employees throughout the day. Also no fans in the room so borderline unbearably hot. Also, the washrooms are the size of airplane washrooms so almost impossible to wash your face do your makeup etc. Great location tho.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Hostel was okay. Very confusing hallways and the room was dark and dank. Terrible breakfast for 2 euro and definitely one of those corporate party hostel type things. Not great, but a fine place to sleep for a short period of time.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Rooms were so hot. No age cap, so a lot of older men by themselves. Facilities overall were good. Close to train station.

name: Clink78
reviewtext:
positives:
-10 minute walk from king's cross/st.pancras stations
 really nice vibe to it, lots of travellers & social activities every night 
- Â£2 breakfast. 
-staff was nice and helpful 
-bathrooms and showers were pretty nice 
-each bed came with a normal uk outlet, two usb outlets and a light 
-storage room for you suitcases 

negatives:
-way too hot. like really hot and you couldnt open windows. dorms with 8, 10+ people also start smelling bad really easily

name: Clink78
reviewtext: My friend and I stayed in an 8 bed mix which had no AC or room to open your backpack. I would not recommend this place to anyone. I have never stayed in a hostel that gave guests such little room and unsatisfactory facilities. Also- If you are looking for a party hostel, go elsewhere. The place had guests between the ages of 10 - 65. The website did not state families were staying at this location as well. Worst hostel I have ever stayed.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: If you know what Hostels are about, you know it's a place to rest your head for the night/no frills accommodation or to meet new people, and Clink78 is exactly that. I felt secure, the place was very down to earth and the staff all very friendly. I spent a few nights here while in London and the location is near for several Tube stops as well as quick walking distance to King's Cross.The Ensuite bathroom was incredibly small and the mattresses were a bit worse than a US college Dorm.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Was here for just one night before a flight early in the morning. Big party atmosphere in the basement but fine for sleeping upstairs. Huge place. Good location right near King's Cross.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: The hostel is very comfortable and well-decorated. The staff is superb, always looking after one and making sure the experience is great. I had a great encounter with one of the interns there named Sophie; she made the experience there just that much better.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: One of my neighbor is keep shouting and hitting the board at night until 3 am, very annoying. Other things is good!

name: Clink78
reviewtext: The hostel was great location and value for money bed and bathrooms clean and good bar atmosphere to meet people but rooms only just have enough space to open your bag so really just a room to sleep not to spend any awake time but the overall reason I would go back was due to the friendly helpful staff they were fantastic!! Thankyou to them

name: Clink78
reviewtext:
Great location close to Kings Cross. Atmosphere is very chilled and the building is interesting.  Was upgraded from an 8 bed mixed dorm to a 4 bed mixed dorm. Great that you can hire towels and borrow a hairdryer. 

My 'upgrade' was to a 4 bed mixed dorm in the basement. The room stank and was unbearably hot. Requested a fan but it did little. I barely slept. Miserable. Staff just shrugged shoulders. Shame no info about history of building.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Great location and friendly staff. Would not recommend shared rooms of 12, not very nice at all. Rooms are hot and stuffy, have extremely limited airflow and no air conditioning. You get what you pay for, affordable but at what cost?

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Not the nicest of hostels. No aircon or any airflow in the rooms, so they're really hot and smell a bit gross; the bunks in the dorms are crammed in and there isn't any room to do anything else in the dorm except sleep, and there was a really loud school group staying there too. There's only one female toilet shared between a bunch of dorm rooms and the showers smell pretty gross too. Beds were comfy and the location is great, but I wouldn't stay here again.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Clink is really well established and has heaps of facilities which is great. We were in a 6 bedroom on the 3rd floor which was fairly tight and ridiculously hot. Other than that it was pretty good value for money considering the location in London.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Stayed here during Lovebox 2018. So the location was ideal. It was central London. Located near Kings Cross. Also has corner shops in front for whatever is needed. A Wetherspoons was also near Farringdon Station. So Cheap Booze and Food accessible. Breakfast at the Hostel consisted of Toasts, Cereal, Tea, Coffee and Fruits. All for Â£2 is brilliant! Hostel was clean and beds comfortable. The bar wasn't loud at all. Also each bed had two USB sockets and one plug. So charging devices was painless.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: V big and sprawling! Rooms were hot in summer, ask for one on the lower levels. Upstairs showers are terrible, but downstairs they are fine! Lovely staff, karaoke was wild!

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Overall fine, doesn't have much atmosphere, especially as a solo traveller. Rooms were hot and little squishy.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: We had a great time! The staff was great! The location was close to both the overground and underground. The only downside was the lack of air conditioning. We were in a private room with a small window that did not let in much fresh air so most of the time we were in our room we were extremely hot. Other than that we had a great stay and look forward to staying with them again!

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Clean and central hostel which is perfect for anyone young staying. We stayed on weekdays so there was no bar crawl or anything organized by the hostel which was annoying but great dorms clean bathrooms and central locations is a big win!

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Good facilities, nice bar and decent drink prices. Rooms are quite small which can get hot in the summer months, showers and bathrooms were decent - overall good experience

name: Clink78
reviewtext: We chose this hostel because of the convenient location near king's cross, but there wasn't a lot else near this area. Definitely worth being near kings cross if you have a lot of places you're trying to go. It was quite loud at night a lot, and we had trouble falling/staying asleep due to noise in the hallways and outside. We stayed in a twin private, and the room was small but clean. We also got our own sink in the room and 2 towels for free. The staff was helpful. Bathrooms were pretty clean

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Fantastic hostel with a great bar and atmosphere, most staff seem happy to be there and up for a chat. Beds provide privacy, great charging station and light also decent sized lockers. They close the kitchen after breakfast (10am) and 11pm - 12am for cleaning which isn't really advertised but otherwise great facilities.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: It's a lovely place and it's tidy. Easy access to laundry and cookery facilities. Great location with 5-10 mins walk to King's Cross Station. In addition, bus stops located nearby which access almost the whole London.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Too many young kids (12-16) disrupting the atmosphere and being loud in the bedroom hallways... Without supervision. The bed sheets were dirty (bodily fluid marks) and the bunks were not checked (dirty ear buds, old shampoo bottles remaining from previous tenant). Overall, great potential but poor execution during our stay. Staff was friendly but slightly clueless in problem solving. This was our cheapest option during busy times in London.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Clink78 was very well staffed. Cheap drinks, and good atmosphere! So convenient if you are traveling through St. Pancreas, as it is less than a 10 minute walk to the station. Great option if you are looking to stay near Kings Cross. My only complaint was the showers on the top floor ran cold. Ended up going down a floor, and the showers were warm there. So not a huge inconvenience.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Showers could be better. Maybe a fan in each room would help.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Don't stay here there is no AC and the rooms are disgustingly hot even though it's cold outside. Also the rooms/bathrooms aren't clean. Probably one of the worst hostel experiences I've had.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Very hot in the rooms

name: Clink78
reviewtext: We checked out a day earlier than planned as we were very dissatisfiedwith the room. Although we booked a six bed dorm for 5 of us so we didn't need to share with others, only 4 of us stayed in dorm as it was very small and cramped. The temperature was horrific especially during the night with no fan or aircon. Two of us slept on the floor to try and get cooled down.  The heat and lack of ventilation was so severe that it was a risk to our health.  Do not recommend!!!

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Fantastic place! Really cool and big hostel with a great bar. Clean rooms and clean facilities. Friendly staff at all hours who help you with any question.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Hostel dorm room was very crammed and the lockers were tiny, but it did fit my 38 L bag. The hostel itself was pretty awesome though with cool rooms and a nice downstairs bar!

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Within 15 minutes walking distance. Quite disappointed with the room been arranged - 8 people bed but different from pictures online. Small and dark. All the bed arranged together so your movement in the room esp on bed is very limited. The air ventilation in the room is not good. So mad when find out the window is actually facing the big dustbin outside and come back with rubbish on my pillow from outside road. The good thing is they have kitchen for you to cook.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Dorm rooms are a bit tight, there isn't much room to move around in. It is definitely hot in the summer. Finding a place to put clothing when taking a shower is difficult. But overall, for the price it can't be beat. Staff is kind and helpful. Breakfast is not bad for 2 pounds. I have no idea what that cheese is at breakfast but I loved it!

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Although the location was good, for us this hostel was not worth the hassle. The showers were unclean and smelled so horrible we did not shower there. There is no air conditioning in the building and our rooms were hotter than it was outside (30 degrees)! This unbareable best in our rooms kept us tossing the entire night. The staff at the front were rude and unhelpful. We ended up leaving 2 nights early because we couldn't handle another night there.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: To be honest, most of the problems I had with this hostel, weren't due to the staff, its cleanliness, the location or most its facilities but rather with its size and the people it attracts. It's rather big and obviously a 'party hostel', which I didn't really feel in the mood for. Call me crazy, but I don't exactly fancy brushing my teeth next to lots of used period pads and a condom, someone left in the showers. I feel bad for the staff, for having to deal with these kind of atrocities.

name: Clink78
reviewtext:
The hostel is huge and even a little disorganized, we stayed there for 3 nights and the noise was often too much. The staff cleans everyday so dirty is rarely and issue there. What amazed me the most was the lack of care in the toilettes, sometimes they seemed to be abandoned by the staff without any ventilation. 
In general is a good deal,

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Our experience was overall excellent, however we noticed our room was very hot and musty.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Really enjoyed most of the stay, and I'm still giving the high rating because I feel like I experienced a situational bad moment while staying. While we were all sleeping, a staff member came in and flipped on the lights somewhere between 12-1am to make a guy that was sleeping in the wrong bed move.. they were both quite rude to each other. Then a girl who was asleep, had her things in the wrong locker...staff woke her up and made her move it. It was just handled wrong I think..at the wrong time

name: Clink78
reviewtext: I can't really think of anything good to say about this place. The staff is unhelpful and unfriendly. The beds are noisy and uncomfortable and the room was a literal sauna. One of the worst hostel experiences I've had and I've had hundreds. Go somewhere else.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Rooms are incredibly small.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: This hostel is in the best location!! It is the perfect base for exploring London. My only issue with it was that there are no lockers in the room. The Â£2 breakfast is pretty good - you can have toast, cheese, jams, yoghurt, fruit, four kinds of cereal and tea, coffee and juice.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: It was a really dissapointing stay , and unfortunately we were staying for 8 days. The people at the reception when we arrived were rude and we were super tired from our trip so they made it even more difficult for us.. The showers and toilets were not clean, our room was poorly ventilated and small for 8 people so it smelled awfully. Also, someone stole my things from the fridge and the stuff didn't care. Wouldn't recommend it specifically for someone who has to stay for so many days.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Great place, the bar was great

name: Clink78
reviewtext: I love this place. Been here several times and it's always great.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: My siblings and really loved staying here, everything was clean and nice, the breakfast was decent too. There was 4 of us staying in an 8 bed mixed dorm and we liked the dividers that allowed for some privacy. There was a lot of people to hang out with, though I wouldn't call it a party place, it was a very social place, though we did have loud drinkers outside one night (really best for heavier sleepers), it was pretty great overall.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: This is the first hostel I have ever stayed at, and I stayed as a single female. I felt so comfortable and enjoyed the bar staff every night. The people here are all so friendly and open. I found myself staying up all night with a bunch of other lone travelers, vibing till the sun came up. Shoutout to the bar staff who made sure everyone was having a great time every night! (:

name: Clink78
reviewtext: The location and staff were great. However the room of 6 beds was extremely hot and that the shower was so difficult to use.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Great stay but check it at 2pm was pretty late and I would have liked for it to be at least 12pm since check out was at 10am.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Private room was stuffy during hot weather. They only have 4 fans to distribute between all guests, and they were all taken. Therefore all nights were a bit uncomfortable. Hostel is for all ages, and people can be loud in hallways, at whatever time on phones, lacking common sense to go in common area. Dj music downstairs can be heard at night, but didn't bother me. Showers were warm and toilets were kept clean. You get what you pay for. Location was great though. Easy access to buses.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Great place to stay in London clean rooms good atmosphere easy to get to, great location mostly young travellers stay here.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Awesome hostel if your looking to have fun!also amazing place if your a solo traveler.specail shout out to Eve from france who really went out of her way to help me out your awesome and great vibes!!!

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Rooms really hot, no air conditioning. There was only a thin wall between mattresses, beds really close together. Shower disgusting, shower curtain, that had been white in the past clinging to your body and water pressure so hard that it hurt.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Room had a small window that wouldn't open in the middle of June. We pretty much fried in the room, it was extremely uncomfortable. Bathrooms were not well maintained.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Bartenders were amazing there! (especially Sara)

name: Clink78
reviewtext:
stayed in a 14 bedder dorm and the area was very cramped as beds were placed right next to each other - we didn't have any issues as everyone came and left quietly at night and early in the morning but could imagine that it could be really noisy and difficult to get a good nights rest. 

otherwise, great location, great value for money, staff were moderately friendly. would stay again for the location but probably not at 14-bedder dorm.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: It's was a great atmosphere, but was a little farther from King's Cross station than we thought. The showers on our floor were also under maintenance so we had to go up two floors to use their showers.

name: Clink78
reviewtext: location isn't super great but really close to kings cross which kind of redeemed it. basement bar was a huge plus, but the lodging isn't ideal with everyone in bunkbeds all connected

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Not a super central hostel but relatively close to the Underground and in a nice location. Clean and relatively quite. Bunk beds have individual lighting and plug-ins although these didn't always work. Staff were helpful and friendly. Would recommend!

name: Clink78
reviewtext: Lovely staff, clean environment, perfect location, WiFi is good

name: Clink78
reviewtext: I have had limited experience staying in hostels and did not know what to expect. The room I stayed in was extremely cramped and was far too small to sleep 6 people, even 4 would be a stretch. The room got so hot at night, even with the window open and the fan open. The window is tiny and there is no air flow, everything stinks in regards to the rooms at this place. I have since stayed at a cheaper hostel with a room 4x the size and it has less beds for a cheaper price...

name: Clink78
reviewtext: This hostel and the people we met here made our trip. The only thing I wish it had was an air conditioner in the room as we were on the ground level and our windows opened directly onto a bus stop. I think I'd have felt more comfortable being able to close them but that said I never felt unsafe in this hostel. Apart from that the mix of people was fantastic. Breakfast was Â£2 with a decent variety and you're a 7 minute walk from one of the most connected tube stations in the city. Loved it!!

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: I've stayed in over 50 hostels on my travels and this was definitely my favourite. Only got to stay for a couple of nights but had the best time there and would recommend it to everyone. I mean there's a pub inside what more so I have to say?

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext:
Really cool hostel. Great staff and great atmosphere! it could be called a party hostel but there's no pressure to go out, you'll make friends either way. 
There are nicely sized lockers that you could probably fit a pack into but the staff put a lot of work into maintaining a good atmosphere which  translates into everyone knowing and respecting each other. Staff also join in on the fun too. Thanks so much Gonzalo (hope I spelled that right), I don't know where I'd be without you!

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: Great hostel! The stuff organise activities for day trips and night parties so there is always something to do. It's not in the center of london but very easy to get to with the tube(underground train)

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: I had an ameasyand love my git time in camden w these lovely people!! All of the staff were incredible, but a special shout out to Michael for taking such good care of me!! also love my girls leah and bali â¤

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: I had a great stay at Hostel One Camden. Staff were super friendly, and they always have loads of social activities going on to make you feel welcome. For example, when I returned to the hostel after my gig, I was invited out with some staff & other people staying there, so we hit a bar just down the road in Camden. I didn't want to go to bed straight after the gig so it was perfect. Just make sure you bring your own padlock to use on the lockers or you'll need to buy one when you arrive.

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: This place quickly became a second home to me and the staff a second family. Could not recommend more highly if you like never sleeping but having the time of your life. Staff are all absolute weapons (ask Leah to take you to Koko and you'll never be disappointed #fuckinghampalace) and already counting the days till i can go back â¤ï¸

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: They were all amazing!!!

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: Loved the place, really good vibes there thanks to all the wonderful staff. Everyone is super friendly, and with all the daily and nightly events, there are always fun activities to do. Definitely recommend for solo travelers looking to meet new people.

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: Great people! Perfect for groups even better for solo! Greg's a G too!

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: Thoroughly enjoyed my stay at Hostel One! The staff and volunteers were welcoming, friendly and super fun to hangout with - they made our trip that much more fun. The free dinner was delicious and a great way to meet everyone staying. The structure of happy hour + drinking games + going out is a great way of doing things and made everyone staying at the hostel feel like a friend. Definitely recommend!

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: Has an amazing time getting to know everyone in the hostel. Enjoyed the day activities and going out to bars/clubs at night. Overall a great experience!

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: The hostel was amazing and honestly I want to go back for a weekend! Great facilities, lovely staff, and plenty of activities they host!

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext:
I think the best part about this hostel was the great social atmosphere and planned activities! It made it really easy to meet and hangout with new people as a solo traveler.
The downside however would be the unfinished remodel of the bathroom nd the cleanliness of the dorm room. But otherwise the location is good, situated in a relatively quiet neighborhood serviced by the northern line and a couple bus routes. The staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful for everything.

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: Hostel One is unique.  Run by awesome people who really care about their guests and the service they provide.  They have a really good set up, so people still enjoy their socialising, but the rooms remain quiet.  It is a fair walk uphill to be mindful of if you have heavy luggage to tow or don't like to walk a good distance.  Directions on how to get there could be more detailed.

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: Absolutely great hostel. As usual of Hostel One, this Hostel boosts everything a traveler could need (an affordable breakfast, free dinner, lots of activities), and the atmosphere is top notch! Absolutely recommended if you are travelling alone or just looking to meet some cool new people.

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: Best atmosphere of any hostel, nights out were great and loved the dinners!

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext:
Great hostel
Especially for those who travel alone.

Friendly staff and great people.
The rooms are clean and all in all I highly recommend it

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: Due to horrid flight delays, I had to book 2 nights the day-of. Because of my first hostel experience here at Hostel One, I am so glad the airlines weren't on-time. The entire staff here set the mood for everyone here -- so welcoming, so awesome, so helpful, so interesting, and so fun!! I made life-long friends here! Location was great, you could hop on public transportation easily or walk to the beautiful Camden Market. Beds are comfy, felt very secure. Pub is charming and great!

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: Excellent location near camden. Great atmosphere at the bar.

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: Super fun and friendly staff and great place if you're looking to socialize! Cool common space with Netflix video games and comfy couches. However, the rooms were VERY cramped, there was nowhere to put your stuff, but there were safes which my laptop fit in that I appreciated. The room also smelled a bit. I wish I would've known about the three story bunk beds, as I was assigned to the very top and it was a huge pain getting up and down, especially without disturbing people.

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: Awesome hostel, definitely my favourite hostel in London and I've been to six other ones. It's not in the heart of the Camden nightlife but about a 15 min walk from it and in a residential area above a pub. Leigh was so accommodating and great and really helped make my stay wonderful. The best part of the hostel is the atmosphere and great for solo travelers. They put together awesome activities in both the day and night and I highly recommend this place!

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext:
I really appreciated the fact I walked in, new to London and Greg basically grabbed me and settled me in so I felt right at home. 

Greg dialed me in that I wanted to make it to Zac and Emma's dinner at 8 where all the hostel meets and starts the social interaction for the night. 

Rafael was perfect behind the bar and Lieghe was super friendly at the front desk

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: I wish I could give this hostel more then 10/10 stars it was probably the best hostel experience I've ever had!!! They are so welcoming and wonderful!! They have day and night activities every day and make sure that everyone feels included, the social aspect is 100%. They accommodated all my needs when I decided to extend my stay, and they overall made me feel more welcome then anywhere else I've ever visited. Location is super easy to find! Book them now and have an amazing stay in London!

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: I absolutely loved staying here! Great atmosphere, and super friendly and helpful staff. Close to transit so getting around from Camden isn't a problem. I'd definitely stay here again, would have extended my stay if it weren't the end of my trip!

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: Super fun and social hostel right near Camden! The atmosphere is amazing for meeting other travelers and the bar downstairs/family dinners are a ton of fun. Only downside was that it was a little far from the city center (but easily accessible by the tube). Also wasn't the cleanest of hostels I have stayed out. Would definitely recommend though!

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: Hostel was good, facilities were very basic. Pillows were worn out, the dinners were good, night activities were good, location was near Camden market and about 25 mins to main city

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: I had such a pleasant experience at hostel one and can't wait to book in another city! Friendly staff and free organised days and nights out are the best. Free cooked meal for dinner, brings everyone together and is great for solo travellers trying to meet new people and make friends. Hostel was clean and beds comfy with plugs right next to bed head. Cannot fault hostel one.

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: I stayed here twice! I can't recommend it enough. The staff if very friendly and easy to chat with. The free dinners and daily outings really make this place feel like home. It's close enough to the metro, and within walking distance to Camden Town. The only note I have is that the showers are a bit grossâ€” but not very bad. I just wish I'd brought sandals to wear into them. Overallâ€” this place is wonderful.

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext:
Staff was helpful and amazing!!
Best place to stay if you're a solo traveler. The day and night activities let you meet new people and socialize endlessly. Location was great, many shops and markets nearby and Camden Market was only a short walk away. Room was clean and comfortable.
Didn't have to wait in the line to use showers and they were clean also. 
Cliffy and Alex were great!! â¤ï¸

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext:
I loved my time at H1, enough so that I stayed there 3 times during this trip. They make you feel like you're part of the family. Their activities were fun and inclusive, and the dinners were great for getting to know people.

I don't have anything bad to say other than the fact that there are only 3 showers for the entire hostel so you do need to wait in line. 

Overall, I would absolutely stay at Hostel One Camden again!

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: Hostel one Camden was a great time - perfect place to meet new people and a great location to explore the city. The hostel has day and night events every day which really creates a super social atmosphere. Also, Camden itself is a really cool area with great nightlife. Most importantly, the staff at this place was incredible. They really go out of their way to make sure you have a memorable experience. Ryan was especially great!

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext:
This hostel is well-organized around partying.  They have happy hour in the pub at 7, a free group dinner at 8, drinking games in the basement at 9 or 9:30, and then going out around 11 or 12, all organized by the staff.  It felt  forced to me but most other guests really seemed to enjoy it and I did have some fun.  
The facilities need some work but in general the hostel was very clean.

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext:
Had a lovely stay over a few days following some work meetings in Central London. Staff are super friendly, competent, and always at hand.

The pub downstairs is the perfect place to hang out and trade travel tips / stories with other guests, and there are programmed activities every night. 

It does a great job of finding that "just right" medium between raging party hostel, and dull, antisocial hotel, and I would definitely recommend it.

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: By far the best hostel I've stayed at. The staff are awesome and make everyone feel a part of their family. Free dinners every night, with drinking games and the option for a night out. Can't wait to return!

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: Great hostel, friendly staff with an excellent pub. Right in the middle of Camden, so really close to the market and great bars and shops.

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: This was my first hostel experience and it was absolutely amazing! The staff were extremely kind and welcoming! Both the staff and other guests were all very friendly and sociable, I easily met people and made friends. There's a pub in the bottom of the hostel, free dinners, free day activities, drinking games as a group and fun nights out! I would come back to London just for this hostel. Thank you from Canada

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: This hostel is amazing. The staff is incredibly friendly and will know you by name by the time you leave. The provided dinners are delicious and a great way to meet other people and the staff plans activities every day. This is an amazing hostel for solo travelers. The friendly atmosphere causes you to be able to meet essentially everyone in the hostel so it feels very safe. It is a little far from the touristy things but you can reach them by tube or bus. I hope I can come back through soon!

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: If you like staying at a hostel with great atmosphere and heaps of social events then Hostel One Camden is the place for you! The staff were all awesome, the facilities were good, there's free (free!) dinner every night, and if you're especially lucky you might catch Greg, the receptionist and possibly nicest guy on the planet, doing a bit of fire spinning.  Seriously though, can't recommend this place enough, do yourself a favour, stay at Hostel One Camden.

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: This is a small hostel that is great for socialising. You quickly get to know everyone, and the staff are great at creating a friendly and open environment. The rooms were too cramped and the showers could've been cleaner, but this wasn't too bad. Overall I enjoyed my stay!

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: The friendliness of the staff outshines everything. They let you feel at home the moment you walk in. Many possible activities that are organized which lets you get to know the people of the hostel very quickly. Totally recommendable

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: Great staff with great service. The group activities were really great especially for me as I was travelling solo. I wish I had more time at Hostel One.

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: By far the best hostel experience I've had!! Location-wise, it's a fairly quick walk to Hampstead Heath and pond-swimming above and Camden Market below; there is much more to do of course but those were my favorites. As for the vibe, it was the first truly social hostel I've stayed in, with free family dinner and different/unique planned outings everyday. Plus the showers are really big and the bedding was cozy! Hostel One Camden felt like home and I was sad to leave. In short, highly recommend!

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: My friend and I stayed at this hostel for 3 nights and it was our first hostel. We absolutely loved everything about it. The staff and everyone staying at the hostel were incredibly friendly and it is so easy to make friends. There are nice, simple breakfast options for cheap and there is a free, social dinner every night at 8pm. We really couldn't have stayed at a better hostel to start our trip. The location, people, and activities and awesome and we wish we couldn't stayed longer!

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: Had a great stay here two times, definitely recommend!

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: Would definitely stay again. It's wonderful having daily group activities, it is also conveniently located near the tube so you could get around on your own just fine. The staff are great and I left feeling like part of the family. So friendly and welcoming!

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: such a fantastic hostel! A really welcoming and warm atmosphere - great for a solo traveller! Staff were absolutely lovely and extremely approachable. I would definitely recommend!

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: A great location and aptly fitted out. Although at times the dorms were difficult (due to the uncontrollable hot weather), the stay was overall quite breezy. For the price paid, the amenities were sound with sound cleanliness. All in all, a fantastic hostel made even better with the AMAZING staff members who well and truly go out of their way to make you feel comfortable and at home. Great group activities offered as well, all free! Would highly recommend.

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext:
for what some may have thought to be an overstay, and others not long enough - my time at hostel one camden was both bitter and sweet. 
 sweet, as twas not one of the radest hostels i've ever accommodated in, but the best.   bitter, on the other hand, as i had to eventually make tracks and go on with my travels through EU...
***************
docs.google.com/document/d/10rJHTDLmBIfXTVElMzoM4SiVcmjsGkcSAtuBnpXDKso
****
[full review!] 
â€” josh :)

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: I found this hostel an excellent place to meet people and socialise, the staff are very friendly and happy to help. They provide free dinners every night which was really good - having been on a budget. This also makes it really easy to feel comfortable. They suggest good places to visit around the city. And their facilities, like kitchen bathroom and common room are all pretty good. It was a bit hot -  but still bearable, London was having a heatwave at the time. Overall I had an awesome time!

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: Really enjoyed my stay at this hostel. The staff were all super friendly, helpful and loved a good time. I didn't have any plans for London so the daily events both during the day and night meant I didn't need to plan anything as they were very enjoyable. They put on a dinner for the guests every night which as backpackers saving money most guests would show up and made for the perfect way to meet people. 100% would stay again when I'm in London next.

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: My stay here was wonderful. Wish that facilities could have been cleaner. Appeared as though my sheets had never been washed when I arrived. The staff was wonderful, however for the day activity to little Venice the staff member had never been and was in charge of taking everyone there. After we arrived we spent about 20 minutes there and said she was ready for us to go back to the hostel.The other guests were a cool bunch. Vegetarian dinner was not actually vegetarian seeing how they added tuna

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: Spent two nights here when needed a place in London for a funeral. Relaxing but upbeat which is as perfect rather than sitting in silence in a hotel. Great staff.

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: Rooms are cramped, nowhere to put bags and only tiny lockers. There were bags of dumped clothes that sat in the room for my entire stay even though I notified staff several times. Beds were so rickety that it was a core workout not to have the top bunk swaying. Dinners were great, staff were very friendly and kind, kitchen was great. However the night activities were variations of "never have I ever" which really brings out the creeps and felt forced. Not very comfortable in the summer heat.

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: I have nothing but nice words to say about this hostel! They have such a good location, the staff are all incredibly kind and helpful, and there is a family atmosphere that makes it impossible not to make friends. I really really enjoyed my stay there - and can't wait to go back! Can't recommend it enough :)

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext:
This was my very first hostel experience and I was welcomed by friendly staff and felt at home straight away. Nice vibe and daily group activities and night activities as group, dinner was all very nice. 
Shout out to Johan, Leah, Mike, Greg, Rafael for amazing, friendly help and will definitely come back next time I'm in London!

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: Great hostel! I only stayed for one night, and I wish I could have stayed longer. The staff was very welcoming, and the atmosphere was good. Nice common area, and did I mention they are attached to a bar? They have day and night activities planned, so it's great for a solo traveler looking to meet people. The rooms and bathrooms were clean and the bed was comfortable. You do have to type a code to get into your room, which I kept forgetting, but the staff was understanding about that.

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: Really great hostel, with organized activities nightly. The lockers were secure, and there were adequate stalls for showering. The staff were helpful and allowed me to print off boarding passes. Security at night was good, and the staff ask that you wear a wristband for admission. It takes about 25-30 mins to get into town via public transport, but it definitely keeps you away from the crowds of the city. I would definitely stay here again, but maybe not in the triple bunk rooms!

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: The hostel has a lot of potential. It hs an amazing staff with great hospitality. One individual that made this experience wonderful was johan machado. He went above and beyond to make sure we felt welcomed. One thing that needs improvement ASAP is the AC. We couldn't sleep at night because it was so hot. It's a must!

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: It was boiling hot and the room of 6 only had one fan that the person nearest too would just turn it around and point it at themselves. Basically woke up in a pool of sweat thinking I'd wet myself. The atmosphere of this place is definitely weird and forced. A bunch of people who don't know how to make plans so they expect the hostel to make plans for them.

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: Great hostel, amazing vibe and super friendly staff

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: The best hostel I've ever stayed at. I didn't have a plan going into my London trip, but this crew was AMAZING and made me feel right at home (so much so that I kept extending my stay) will absolutely be back and staying here again.

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: Staff are nice. Situated near a metro station, nearby shops, supermarket and 15 min from the Camden market. All the staff are nice and friendly. They do free family dinners daily just like all hostel ones which could be nice for meeting people. Showers are hot. The bathroom: people ratio is a bit low though- so that's something that could be improved on.

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: This was my first time traveling by myself and staying at a hostel, and i'm so glad I chose Hostel One!!! It's perfect for solo travelers because everyone at the hostel is very willing to make friends. The staff was great and so welcoming. It is a bit far from center so you have to take the underground or the bus, but for the price and atmosphere it's worth the travel time. Overall I highly reccomend!

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: The people that are working the hostel really make this place what it is. Super chill and laid back environment and everyone was friendly. Will stay there again when I come back to London.

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: Tried too hard to have fun. If you like manufactured entertainment - Hostel One's are your place

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: Great hostel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. It's a very social hostel with a free dinner and activities on the day and in the evening where a lot of guests take part in. We had a great time there.

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext:
Such a fun hostel! 
Hostel one is great for solo travelers and they create an environment that makes it easy to meet people and go out. Also, the rooms are nice because they are locked with codes so you do not have to worry about carrying a key. Without a doubt, I would stay here again!

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: Definitely the best hostel experience I've ever had! Awesome people, awesome location, and amazing for solo travelers. There are free, delicious dinners every night cooked by the staff and all vegetarian! (Soz if you were looking for chicken...or squid :p) Day trips are offered each afternoon, and the staff is really fun and involved with everyone. Shout out to Ryan, Michael and Johan for being extra great

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: I read loads of reviews before choosing this place and my experience couldn't be better. It was my first time travelling alone and the hostel was an amazing place to know other people. The staff were incredibly friendly too. The free dinner time was the perfect moment to catch up with people . I would definitely stay there again and Inplan to stay in other Hostel ones around Europe :)

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: Agree with previous comments, it's older and "feels dirty" but is pretty clean. Basic but all you need. Great people and the staff are awesome. So good for a solo traveller keen to make friends!

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext:
My absolute favorite hostel in London! Very near the tube and Camden town, but still in a nice and quiet area. 
Besides that, the staff is amazing! You feel like home from the second you walk in. They don't only work there, they actually want to get to know you and want you to get to know the other guests: a very social hostel! All the staff members are great, but I especially got to know Michael and Ryan! Make sure you participate in there activities during the day or at night.

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: Great hostel, everything you need. Great social atmosphere, staff are great and make you feel welcomed. Definitely stay again in the future.

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: The staff here were very friendly and helpful. I only stayed one night so did not get to take advantage of the nightly gatherings but it seemed like they really try to foster community at this hostel, so it's good for solo travelers. The building itself is really old, so the hostel itself doesn't *feel* very clean, but I think they do try to keep it clean. The beds squeaked a lot and were uncomfortable, I could feel the springs on them. I appreciated the plugs next to the beds. Decent hostel.

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: Ideal for solo travelers!

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: Great stay - the staff (Michael specifically) made you feel comfortable and fostered a fun environment which was great for people like me who are traveling alone.

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext:
hostel was wonderful. staff was great and there was a very inclusive vibe so it's ideal
for solo travelers. one of my
best hostel stays yet!

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext:
If meeting new people is your priority, this hostel is it. As soon as you check in, greetings were friendly and was invited to activities. They have regular activities and the staff is great at gather people. The hostel is adjacent to their own pub so that is pretty much the lounge. They have another lounge area downstairs too. That's where drinking games usually happen. 

Traveling alone can get lonely so make sure to come here and get plugged in.

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: This place overall is awesome! Not only is Camden a cool place to stay in London, but the people that work at this Hostel want nothing in the world but to take care of their guests and they do a great job at it too. I would 10/10 stay here again. Only thing I wish was they had more bathrooms.

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext:
Was excited for this one, but was disappointed. Hostel One's are generally really great, but I didn't love this one as much. Avoid during hot summer months as there is no AC, and not enough ventilation in the rooms to compensate. It was HOT. and I generally avoid making criticisms based on a lack of AC but this one was the worst I had experienced. 

Staff were fairly great, with the exception of one or two who acted like they really didnt care. Which is too bad because the rest were great.

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: The location is nicely tucked away so it doesn't get loud at night.  It does however get very hot in the rooms at night in the summer. There was a small fan in our room but it was still very hot. The laundry facility advertised is run by the staff and costs 5 pounds to do a load. Free dinner every night. There are still a lot of younger backpackers here trying to make this their epitome European vacation and hooking up in the kitchen. Other than that, good place for the price.

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: We had a lovely stay at Hostel One Camden! Everyone was so friendly and we loved exploring with other travellers and going out with groups from the hostel. The free dinners and cheap breakfast are a nice bonus, and the hostel is within walking distance of tons of great restaurants too. The pub was a nice place to sit and meet people, Raphael was so friendly, and the common room downstairs was always lively. It was also super easy to take a bus or the underground to get to tourist attractions.

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: Had a great time in my few days staying in Camden. The staff are super friendly and great fun, organising day trips and nights out. All round a brilliant hostel.

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: Perfect neighborhood. Such a fun atmosphere. I was sad to leave. The staff especially were the best!

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext:
The lockers were too small for my bag and I had to leave it out (as did everyone else). The room was also really hot as there was no AC and it was the summer time. 
However, the staff were incredible as were the guests. They cook free dinner and plan days and nights out so you really get to know everyone. There is a legit bar attatched to the hostel and they have a common room with a ps4, pool table, and darts. I would definitely stay there again!

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: Hostel One Camden is the best! Awesome location and atmosphere, as a solo traveller I met people straight away and made friends to hang out with the whole stay in London. The bunk beds and security could be improved, they felt a little bit dodgy, but the vibes, the family dinner and the pub crawl made up for it. Would definitely recommend to anyone wanting a fun, social time in London travelling solo!

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: Great value, and convenient location to get to Ronnie Scotts Jazz club for an evening show via the Northern line tube from Chalk Farm.  Was grateful for the sash windows which helped aerate the dormitory through a very warm night. Close enough to Primose Hill and Regents Park to enjoy a delightful walk and lunch en route to Marylebone mainline station to come home to Oxford.

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: One of the best hostels I've ever stayed at hands down. First of all, staff is so freaking friendly, will chat with you for hours and help you out if ever you need. The atmosphere is phenomenal because of the organized day and night activities, bar downstairs, and best of all FREE DINNER! I extended an extra night because I was having such a good time. Didn't love the triple bunked beds but don't let that deter you. Would highly recommend this hostel!!!!

name: Hostel One Camden
reviewtext: Had the best time ever at this hostel and i extended my stay multiple times. Really enjoyed the day and night time activities and the free dinner was always delicious. The staff were all amazing especially Joshua, Rachel and Greg. Can't wait to stay again next time I visit London.

name: SoHostel
reviewtext:
Great value for money. Decent free breakfast. Good location. Very colourful and appealing to the eye.

Need more ventilation in the bathrooms.

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: First time staying at a hostel, was here only 2 nights because I had already rented an airbnb. This place was clean, nice and in a great location also met alot of travelers from all over the world. Would definitely stay here again and for the price they offer so much.

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: Staff may be too busy to remember to be hospitable. My first impression was from the front desk and being overlooked or forgotten when trying to check in.  I purposely didn't do three walking tour because i didn't think it would be good company.. Luca and the young lady at the bar were fine. Also didn't like being asked to leave the common area so they could clean.

name: SoHostel
reviewtext:
Loved the Karaoke Night. People went nuts:)!
Very pleasant stay

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: I had a great time here. The staff is friendly and really fun to be around, and there is a good atmosphere. Soho is a lot of fun and there are a lot of good restaurants nearby. My bed was comfortable and the happy hour at the bar was excellent! The only thing I didn't like were the metal cages that they have instead of lockers. They wouldn't pull all the way out from under the bed and were loud. Overall, I would highly recommend staying here!

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: Good hostel very central. Nice beds, okay breakfast. Was a Construction just outside on the road that made a lot of sound in the morning, But Thats just temporary.

name: SoHostel
reviewtext:
The only good thing about this hostel is the location. Perfect walking distance to the main sights and easy access to the underground. 
We stayed in a private room which was so tiny we didn't have any space to open our suitcases. The room has a bed and a sink. The window to our room was above a bar which closes at 2am. The construction site next door commences work 7am. A nightmare! Be aware of 'upgrading' breakfast for Â£1. The hot option is 'instead of' the continental.

name: SoHostel
reviewtext:
Great location within a short walking distance of everything ! The building and the rooms are colorful, modern and regularly cleaned which is a very important for a hostel. 
The staff was very kind and super helpful when needed ! 
We had the breakfast included in the price : buffet with a large choice of cereals, cookies and beverages. Very good ! Moreover You can upgrade to the English breakfast for 1Â£.

To make a long story short, I highly recommend this place for your trip to London !!

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: Best hostel I stayed at during my whole 6 week holiday! Great atmosphere & great rooms, only wish that the bunk beds were a little sturdier!

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: It was a great place to stay. Very clean and comfortable

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: I had a phenomenal time at the hostel.  I stayed in a 6 sleeper all female room with an ensuite.  My breakfast was included. The room was absolutely clean and lovely as with the bathroom.  Staff were amazing when it came to assistance and recommendations.  Even after checking out I had needed help and they were all still eager to help.  The general atmosphere was great, the addition if the pamper parlour helped a lot and the convenience was the best part!! I definitely reccomend staying here.

name: SoHostel
reviewtext:
Really great hostel, very clean, great location, hot showers, beds really comfy and plug sockets next to every bed. 
My only complaint is that they use one use disposable plastic cups for breakfast which along with all other plastic does not get recycled. Washable glasses would be perfect and cut down on the horrendous amount of plastic waste.

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: Great location. Facilities were basic but fine. Staff were friendly but weren't around very much. Not much atmosphere. Breakfast was terrible. I would stay here again but mainly due to location.

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: We were on a 6 bed female dorm. It was impossible to sleep! All night people in an out, banging the door, up and down the beds, no respect whatsoever for the ones sleeping. A nightmare really!! I couldn't leave any earlier!Also think the bar could be open a little bit longer on a friday night. Went there to have a beer and at 01:45 he said he wouldn't serve us as it was closing! The location is perfect and it is cheap. That's about it!!

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: A bit noisy since there are construction workers right outside, but the place is clean, the atmosphere is nice and the location is amazing.

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: Great Hostel overall, the lounge areas are awesome and the staff are very friendly. The location can not be beat. I stayed in the large 18 person dorm it was a little hot but not too uncomfortable for sleeping.

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: The hostel is definitely well located, very close to everything. I liked the staff since they were very friendly all the time, the facilities too are great. The hostel made me want to return even more to London!

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: I spent 7 nights here and the location is unbelievable! Extremely friendly staff and thoroughly enjoyed my time here, being my first hostel experience.

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: Great location, good breakfast and atmosphere was fun!! A few bathrooms and showers were broken right by my room, so that was a little annoying. Overall a good stay!

name: SoHostel
reviewtext:
Very clean, very nice staff and very good breakfast, but the small rooms (both bedrooms and common rooms), uncomfortable beds and high price kind of ruin the experience.
Also, there's only 2 showers and 2 toilets per floor, which means you might have to queue in the morning.
All in all we did enjoy the stay and I especially appreciated the fact it was absolutely spotless, but a few little improvements (i.e. leave the game and breakfast rooms open, add shelves next to the beds) would help.

name: SoHostel
reviewtext:
Great spot, excellent location, and surprising amenities (like a room with hair dryers and hair flatirons!) 

Had issues with someone spraying heavy perfume in my dorm room and the staff was willing to let me relocate. One section of the hostel was slightly musty/moldy smelling, but other areas were fine for environmental sensitivities.

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: Picked this place because it was in Soho. Great location to supermarket, pubs, restaurants, tube line, and walking distance to attractions. The room and beds were clean. The bathroom in my shared room was really clean. The room can get a bit stuffy, so sleep with the window open. A downside is the noise. My room faced the construction of the new tube station, so there were a lot of construction noise as early as 6 am.

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: While the location of this property is quite nice, the hostel itself did not meet expectations. My bed, which has been made up for my arrival, had two pairs of women's underwear in the sheets. The bathrooms were filthy. The furniture was worn out and most looked damaged. And, the breakfast had a poor selection. However, the food at the bar on the ground floor was good with decent prices. I would not stay here again.

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: Really nice place, but doesn't have any self catering facilities. Staff weren't the friendliest people which dampened the mood of the place. Breakfast was good. Otherwise location and bedrooms were great.

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: The hostel is in the middle of Soho, but you don't hear a single thing of the noice outside. Restaurant serves good food for a good price but there are lots of restaurants and bars around. Very clean hostel

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: The staff member who works the desk late at night is very rude and condescending and he was terrible to my guest who just wanted to wait in the lobby for me. he acted like a bully when trying to explain that guests couldn't be in the building. It was as if he was waiting to yell a someone all night and was very confrontational. Every other staff member was very kind and helpful. I suggest you bring your own towel! Their's are very small and to the hostel i suggest you get small chairs for room

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: Staff were cold and unwelcoming, and the check in process begun with a list of "do not" rules. The hostel is like a maze, and there wasn't any socialising happening in the common area. Facilities were adequate, and the storage cages weren't fixed, rather they were attached to the underside of the bottom bunks with a chain, and mine had no chain, so they were useless to me.

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: such a great place. Awesome location and the people working and staying there are so great. The only reason that this isn't a full 10 is cause twice I went to the toilet room and there was no toilet paper! But whatever, cause everything else was perfect. I stayed somewhere else last year and when comparing the two there is no competition, this hostel is much better!! stay here. I was in a 4 person coed with a male friend of mine and two random roommates who were wonderful.(1 male, 1 female)

name: SoHostel
reviewtext:
I stayed at SoHotel for 3 weeks, and it was absolutely amazing! The staff is friendly and always willing to help you, the location is near all the tourist places (I did everything by foot), the bathrooms and accommodations were always clean and the breakfast was delicious! The only thing that can be an issue for those travelers with low budget is that there's no kitchen for us to use. 

I surely recommend this hostel! Thanks for everything!

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: Perfect location. Great breakfast and bar. Agree with other travellers that the heat in the dorms is quite oppressive when it's 30 degrees ce lcius outside.  Could possibly think about this more next summer and supply more fans in the dorms. But for 10 or 11 months of the year it wouldn't be an issue

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: The rooms were cramped in comparison to other hostels I've been and it was hard to find as there was construction out front and no outward sign showing that it was the hostel, the address given wasn't taking me to the hostel either, but the hostel itself was neat and clean, happy hour was nice.

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: Very hot hostel. No AC in the room. Cannot sleep at night because of the heat. Not coming back. On the positive, there is one staff who is extremely helpful . Her name is Tamara.

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: They do a really good job here. No early check-in. Staff cordial and professional. Clean and well-maintained. Soho is a great location for seeing sights. Much to walk to and experience. Tesco across the road for cheap eats. Highly recommend.

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: Friendly staff and lively atmosphere. Would be great if rooms and bathrooms are equipped with clothing hooks and some surface/tables for placing small items and clothing.

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: Great experience, great people. Everything I hoped it would be

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: Nice location but unfortunately construction noise outside.

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: Great hostel in a central location. Staff were all pleasant on each encounter and the included breakfast selection was fantastic, something for everyone. I would highly recommend this hostel. Finding your room may be a maze but they have troubleshooted this my colour coding areas and also by escorting you to your room at check-in. Great hostel, the only thing I would recommend is maybe a small shelve in the showers to place your bar of soap, shower products but this is no biggy. I will be back:)

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: Great location and facilities. Only negative was toilets didn't flush and beds were uncomfortable

name: SoHostel
reviewtext:
The rooms were hot and dirty.  The bathrooms were disgusting and not kept clean or stocked with toilet paper.  We had expected this hostel to be decent based on its previous ratings, however, this was by far the worst hostel we had stayed in while traveling Europe.  The establishment is pretty run down.

DO NOT STAY HERE.

name: SoHostel
reviewtext:
Superb location, walking distance to many theaters, local attractions and underground stops. Power sockets at every bed along with a light which is great! Useful luggage storage for when you check out though its a shame that you cannot pay for late check out.
Rooms are very warm but they do provide a fan that is already in the room for you. The bunk bed ladders are some of the worst i've ever experienced though, I know it sounds ridiculous but they were the most awkward ladders to get down!

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: Hostel is obviously in a great location. The building itself is massive and kind of tricky to find your room (they send somebody up with you to help). I stayed during the hottest day on record and there is no AC. Not uncommon for London, but I would stay elsewhere if it's going to be hot. We had a fan in the room but cord was very short, and the fan ended up blocking most of the doorway. Bathrooms need better ventilation. They were as clean as could be for the situation but felt very mildewy.

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: My only complaint was the heat but it was an abnormal heat wave and we only had 1 fan in the room. Apart from that, everything was fantastic!

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: Location was great and hostel was clean. However we had to relocate our last night to a hotel with air conditioning as the hostel room was a sweat box and they could only provide one small fan for a 4 bed dorm.

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: Very good. Rooms were quite warm (middle of the european heatwave). Fantastic location, would stay again.

name: SoHostel
reviewtext:
Nice, clean hostel- good value for money.
I appreciate this is the hottest it's been in England for many years but I was really uncomfortable throughout my stay-a fan in an 8 bed dorm is not enough.

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: Stayed here for 3/4 nights as I was doing a acting course nearby, the hostel was clean, the room and the ensuite was clean. My bed was comfy, however I had the top bunk and it was awkward getting up and down as the bunk actually moved. The shower in the ensuite was alright but couldn't get any cold water, also the bit where the shower head is held was broke. Undecided if I would stay again or not.

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: Online, SoHostel looked promising. In real life it was not. For starters the staff were not very friendly and seemed like they would rather be anywhere else. The security lockers were flimsy, and we had 1 fan to cool a 18 bed dorm which was very ineffective. The toilets were smelly and the toilet paper was 1 ply tiny single squares which made me feel like my hand was going to break through. Rooms that did have aircon machines, we weren't even allowed to have them on. Wouldn't stay here again!!!!

name: SoHostel
reviewtext:
Great place! Right in the center of everything. The only bad thing I have to say about it is the fact that it was so boiling in every room. It was super uncomfortable to sleep and chill around with the temperature being so hot. They need to install some air conditioning !
Staff was also amazing and so friendly.

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: Great location for a solo trip to London! It's just a five minute walk to the Tube and very convenient to get around. I met lots of other friendly travellers at the hostel. Be aware that it is quite warm during the summer (hence it may be hard to sleep at night).

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: Great location in SoHo right off Oxford Street.  Facilities are excellent, very comfortable.  Staff was friendly but my contact with them was limited as it's a large hostel.  Comfortable lounge in the basement and affordable food is available.  Atmosphere is average, but that's a challenge with large hostels.  Overall a good, affordable place in SoHo.

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: We stayed in a room with a private bath which I would highly recommend. The cages under the bed were plenty big enough. I would recommend this to anyone traveling to London!

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: The location of this place was great, so was the breakfast, however the lifts weren't working (lots of stairs) the rooftop bar said it was meant to be open every night but we checked on 4 different occasions and it was shut every time, the showers we're covered in mould and stunk so bad. The rooms we're soooo hot and the windows were bolted shut so we couldn't even open them. The rooms had 1 small fan that didn't move so it only hit 2 out of the 4 beds and it was so loud. No towels provided :(

name: SoHostel
reviewtext:
Horrible rooms.. beds were not comfortable at all. I understand it is not the Hilton inn but the beds should not feel like I'm sleeping on wood!
The lift was also broken so we had to walk up so many stairs.. odd rules from staff as well

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: The service was lovely and the hostel had a good general vibe. The lift was broken when I was there which made the floor flights of stairs very unpleasant. There also isnt air-conditioning or alot of airflow. The rooms were quite hot. Beds were comfortable though.

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: First night I wasn't too impressed with the hostel - the lift was broken (I suspect it has been broken for a while based on other reviews) and the room was pretty small for 4 people. Toilets clean-ish. Did appreciate the fan to circulate air. Free breakfast was good and meals were available to purchase - decent quality and really affordable. Pamper room was a nice touch although a few hairdryers weren't working. Laundry facilities are good and location couldn't be better!

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: The place is very clean, the beds are comfortable, there's enough space in the room for the luggage because there's a cage under the beds that you can use a padlock in it (I stayed in the 6 bed mixed dorm ensuite). The Hostel is well located, with metro stations nearby. There's also a lot of pubs around the neighborhood, within a walk distance, but far enough so their noise won't disturb the sleep. The staff is very polite and helpful and everything is well organized. Breakfast is simple.

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: The cages used for locking your stuff up are absolute nightmares. They are small and anyone can see what's in there... if someone really wanted to they could probably get into your cage and take your stuff. Great location & friendly staff. Always felt very clean. Room was very very hot and the fan did not help too much.

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: Rooms are very hot, no air con at all.

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: Clean rooms and shower facilities, friendly staff and the free breakfast was pretty good too. I was travelling alone and only staying 1 night but I think the atmosphere would be better if you are in a group. Location is great, 5 mins walk from Ox Circus and Tottenham Ct Rd stations. Access to rooms was with key cards and lockable baskets were provided under beds. Layout was a little confusing but not a major problem.

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: I had a long layover in London and stayed here for the night! It was in a nice area and pretty close to some touristy places. The bar was very nice, and drinks were at very reasonable prices. Everything was very clean and I really appreciated the "glam room" that they had where you could get ready!

name: SoHostel
reviewtext:
Pros: 
1) its biggest pro is its location location - near shopping and major tourist attractions. You'll save money on transportation. 
2) comfy beds, reading light and sockets next to bed, locker cage under bed 
3) pamper room 
4) WiFi throughout hostel 
5) room had fan for the hot weather 
6) helpful staff

Con: 
1) lift was not working throughout my stay 
2) place is a maze 

Definitely worth the money you pay.

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: A few staff members seemed irritated when they needed to help people, but the majority of them were helpful and friendly. The lift was broken so I would have liked someone to help carry luggage all the way to the fourth floor. The basement where breakfast is was uncomfortably hot and made the meal less enjoyable. I'd reccommend a few fans down there. Food and drink at the bar areas was fairly inexpensive and it was nice that the cafe next door gave hostel stayers a discount!

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: I was here for a short visit during the World Cup semifinals. This is a great area of London to be in and the staff was super helpful and accommodating. My only problem is that the bathrooms weren't in the room for a very large suite. Good hostel otherwise!

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: This place is enormous but not in a bad way. There are bathrooms all over the place, which was awesome and I never felt like I was waiting for a shower. The main common space is somewhat loud, and hot because there was a heat wave, but the lobby area is much quieter and open all night so there were a few different places to hang out and use WiFi other than my room. When you check in they personally give you a tour and take you to your room. The reception people aren't the most chatty, but nice.

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: Location is superb and the rooftop lounge was a neat feature. But the overall feeling is quite average. The included breakfast is very bare bones (cereal and bread) and there was no air con in the room I stayed in.

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: I was a bit disappointed with the dorm. Toilet door was stuck (in an 8 person dorm...), the faucet sometimes did not work, had to hold it all the time to drop water and the stairs to the top bunk were a nightmare, the bed didn't seem to be fixed and it kept moving when I tried to go up, also they really hurt my feet. The lift was not working for most of the time I was there but maybe that was just a bad coincidence. Besides that, the breakfast was good, very good location and staff.

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: Decent hostel. Very nice people and nice common area, but somewhat of a suffocating atmosphere. No AC and very low ceilings and their lift was broken. And the rooms are packed and claustrophobic. But still great experience, good location, good beer, great people.

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: Would have been nice to have a safe available for our passports. We got a room with a double bed which was kinda uncomfortable and the room is small. Great location but would have preferred a comfier stay for what we paid for. When we were there it was extremely hot in London and very stuffy throughout the hostel.

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: One of the best hostels I have ever stayed in, period. Great location

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: Great value for money  bit of a maze but you soon figure it out.ðŸ˜‚

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: The hostel has no air conditioning and the 3rd floor has no cold water, that's right it was either hot showers or boiling hot showers. I was there during a heat wave and that was rough.

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: Black mold on the ceilings, broken showers, And overall grimy. The hostel was also super hot and uncomfortable. The facilities were gross and I won't be returning. Huge disappointment.

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: Pros: Great location in SoHo near food, drinks, and subway. Friendly, helpful staff. Clean, well-run dorms, showers, bathrooms, and kitchen. Cons: loud at night (no quiet hours), not very social, and no air conditioning in the dorms. (The fans help a bit). Also, the ride from Heathrow by subway is easy-but-long.

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: We had a towel stolen from us, people from the hostel promised to refund us but they never did....

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: The hostel was very clean and the rooms were nice. Bunk beds in the dorm rooms had ladders which are sometimes hard to come by. The location was perfect for shopping and food but the nightlife was average - even after England winning their 1/4 final match in the World Cup, every pub within a 200m radius was shut after 10pm. The bar in the hostel is open till late which helped us with that problem. Breakfast included is a + too (toast, cereal, yoghurt etc). Overall a good stay!

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: Very clean and secure hostel right in the middle of a hopping location. About a 5 minute walk to the tube station made it easy to get around London. The Rooms were very clean and organized but warm (there is no AC).   The Hostel itself was very quiet, most of the guests kept to themselves while I was here. So if you are looking for a quiet place to stay this is a good option. If you are looking for some place more upbeat that creates a party atmosphere I would look elsewhere.  Great Stay!

name: SoHostel
reviewtext:
awesome hostel, really great facilities including free brekky and a pamper room! 
staff were really lovely and helpful with any questions we had! Would definitely come back here!

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: UbicaciÃ³n excelente, cerca de estaciÃ³n del metro. El desayuno se sirve a 730 ðŸ‘ðŸ‘ y es completo 100 puntos.  Bastantes duchas y sanitarios pero vi las toallas de piso siempre sucias y los lavamanos son muy pequeÃ±os.
