Las camas no son las mejores y el acceso a lÃ¡mpara y conexiÃ³n elÃ©ctrica individual son Ã¡reas de oportunidad para mejorar. El staff es muy profesional aunque pueden mejorar su presentaciÃ³n. No hay jabÃ³n de manos en sanitario, deberÃ­a ser algo bÃ¡sico.

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: Overall amazing stay! Such an awesome location, and while not cheap compared to other hostels, was OK for London prices. Facilities were good and convenient. The rooms even have USB chargers which was amazing!

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: Really good :))))))

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: Our stay at SoHostel was for four nights to have a great home base location to see London. Great location with clean rooms and shower facilities. Easy access to SoHo and Metro lines, although we walked mostly everywhere. Big plus having a Tesco up the street to grab drunks, lunch or snacks on the go.

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: Would definitely come back!

name: SoHostel
reviewtext: Amazing hostel, our room wasn't ready at check in so we were offered a free drink in the bar while we waited! Facilities were top notch and the people in our room were lovely :) breakfast was really handy and the location could not be better!

name: Safestay London Elephant & Castle
reviewtext: We were a group of 6 and stayed here for a Hen party weekend. The hostel was easy to get to by the tube. Staff on reception were friendly. Our room was clean, well decorated and spacious. We paid Â£5 for the continental breakfast which was good with freshly baked croissants and pan au chocolate aswell as cereals, toast, yoghurts, meats and cheeses. Staff encouraged us to help ourselves and take one for the road. I would definately stay again next time in london.

name: Safestay London Elephant & Castle
reviewtext: It is a great location for visiting London, highly recommend.

name: Safestay London Elephant & Castle
reviewtext:
The room was clean, I especially loved the curtains around the bed, that way you can get some privacy + your roommates don't wake you up when they turn on the lights. I loved the fact that the bathroom and the toilet were actually in the room.

The location is good, fairly close to the underground station (Elephant and Castle; Bakerloo and Northern lines), and you can walk to Big Ben (around 30 minutes). The neighbourhood is a bit sketchy and really loud though.

name: Safestay London Elephant & Castle
reviewtext: I found this hostel very well cleaned nice bunks with light . Not bad location near quite close to public transport. I enjoyed staying there . Very good facilities especially the lounge . The breakfast could be a little bit more on offer for the price but apart from that . Very good.

name: Safestay London Elephant & Castle
reviewtext:
The hostel itself was good. The five am fire alarm was not, that was just unfortunate.

The late check out fee, especially because I was not informed that the check out time was 10 or that there was a late check out fee for exceeding this. Upon being informed of this unexpected fee I expressed my surprise and unwillingness to pay this, the staff member was rude and extremely unprofessional.

name: Safestay London Elephant & Castle
reviewtext: Nice place! But please guys, fix the fire alarm. It wasn't funny at all waking up at 5.30 am and go out to the freezing cold just for nothing.

name: Safestay London Elephant & Castle
reviewtext: I have stayed here many times. The main attraction being all round room comfort and its location so various places can be accessed easily through bus, tube and bike.  Beds are super comfy and en-suite shower and washroom really welcome. There was a problem one night with noisy guests in an outside passage. Mentioned it to a passing staff member and it seemed to die down after.  Noticed a new one pound charge now for left luggage.  I really don't like to see places doing that, Hope it is changed.

name: Safestay London Elephant & Castle
reviewtext:
Really enjoyed my stay here! The cleanliness was awesome! I saw people ALWAYS cleaning! 
The atmosphere was great and I made a friend. The lounge/bar downstairs was a great place to hang out, have drinks and food. The rooms were nice also. The beds having curtains for privacy was a nice touch and I really appreciated that. 
The staff was always super helpful and friendly which really made me feel at home. I will definitely stay here in the future!

name: Safestay London Elephant & Castle
reviewtext: The hostel was good. It's a very nice place and very clean. Location is fine, just take a bus and go to the city centre. Breakfast is paid (Â£5) and you can help yourself what you like. I do suggest you include vegan or healthier choices for vegan people. I really enjoyed my stay in this hostel. Staff are very friendly and always willing to help you. Totally recommended.

name: Safestay London Elephant & Castle
reviewtext: Great staff, we had a disruptive arrival (our plane was delayed 4 hours) sent them an email making sure they new our late arrival was going to be even later (ended up showing up at 5 am) and since we informed them they were more than accommodating. When arrived someone was in assigned bed which they promptly fixed and were very apologetic. Very pleased with experience :)

name: Safestay London Elephant & Castle
reviewtext: Really nice installations of the hostel: new and clean. Nice location to arrive by bus or subway to every important place in London. Good services to offer internet cafe, bar, luggage saver.

name: Safestay London Elephant & Castle
reviewtext: Out of the 8 lockboxes in the room, only 3 had lids to actually lock down (and they were being used by others), so no secure way to store my bags. I asked to leave my bag behind reception, which wasn't received well by the staff member I there. Even behind reception it was left in plain sight and felt even less safe!

name: Safestay London Elephant & Castle
reviewtext: Bad environment, they will charge you a fortune for every facility sold at the hostel...

name: Safestay London Elephant & Castle
reviewtext: Great place to stay. Curtains on beds provide privacy even in a full dorm. Friendly staff. Great location.

name: Safestay London Elephant & Castle
reviewtext: Upgraded my friend and I to a semi-private room for free! the location is kind of out of the way and can look scary but its fine! Just a few bus stops away from Elephant & Castle tube station and 2 bus stops outside the front door!! Luggage storage was great since my friend and I were leaving late our last night after a show. Breakfast/ bar area really nice!

name: Safestay London Elephant & Castle
reviewtext: Avarage Next To railway station Elephant and Castle but hard to get from London st Pancras

name: Safestay London Elephant & Castle
reviewtext: Staff were friendly, facilities were clean and good -- only thing is the garden wasn't open and I was looking forward to that :/ overall a really nice and clean hostel, I felt safe and people were respectful .. good stay:)

name: Safestay London Elephant & Castle
reviewtext:
Excellent place to stay -
Welcoming & knowledgeable staff -
Extremely clean and modern -

name: Safestay London Elephant & Castle
reviewtext: As many others have mentioned it was particularly warm. Our window opened and so at night I thought it was fine!  Other than that the stay was fine, and the staff very friendly!

name: Safestay London Elephant & Castle
reviewtext: I thought as it was a hostel, I would be able to have al the services such as adaptators for phone charging, towel rental etc. The option was to buy those things and if you are planning to go light on a low budget it's not ideal .

name: Safestay London Elephant & Castle
reviewtext: Lovely cool staff, met some pretty cool people!

name: Safestay London Elephant & Castle
reviewtext: I had a great stay at safestay. I felt completely safe and comfortable. The room mates were lovely and friendly. The staff looked a little stressed but were also friendly. I loved the privacy I got from the curtains. And it was very clean

name: Safestay London Elephant & Castle
reviewtext: The room we had was ridiculously hot and we had no sleep whatsoever. Myself and my 12 year old son ended up sitting in the lobby all night because we were dripping wet with sweat and couldn't breathe in the room.  The design of the room with only one tiny window was awful. We also asked the staff to put an ice pack in the freezer as my dad's medication urgently needed to be kept cold but they put it in the fridge meaning that his medication was ruined

name: Safestay London Elephant & Castle
reviewtext: really glad that I chose this place as my hostel. Would definitely recommend!

name: Safestay London Elephant & Castle
reviewtext: The hostel is outside central London but easily accessible by train/underground; about a 12 minute easy walk away. The rooms are large, beds reasonably comfy with privacy blockout curtains, and there is separate toilet and shower room ensuites. There is a large cage lockable (BYO) storage under the bed which needs to be pulled out fully to operate. The wiFi is decent, the staff can be abrupt but helpful nonetheless, the breakfast is decent for value, and the bar is rarely staffed

name: Safestay London Elephant & Castle
reviewtext: One of the best hostels I've stayed in. The room was really clean and the location was good. I also liked the curtains around the beds. I would absolutely recommend staying here.

name: Safestay London Elephant & Castle
reviewtext: room was hot and a little stuffy, but bathrooms were clean and sheets were clean. Absolutely excellent service-- woman at the desk went above and beyond to accommodate us.

name: Safestay London Elephant & Castle
reviewtext: Rooms were clean/in good condition. Very hot and poorly ventilated, however. Wifi is spotty. The thing that makes me not want to come back was that the staff walked in our rooms probably 3-4 times a day, late in the day (4-5 PM), without knocking or asking to come in and when they did come in, they didn't even say what they were in there for or asked if it was okay and continued to do what they needed. It made everyone in our room extremely uncomfortable and was hugely intrusive to privacy.

name: Safestay London Elephant & Castle
reviewtext: Organised a get together weekend with friends, didn't know what to expect and was pleasantly surprised by the accommodation.  Staff were fantastic and a really nice location with good transport links.  Recommend.

name: Safestay London Elephant & Castle
reviewtext: The staff were great and really accommodating, it was clean and super cute and the beds were nice. Only complaint is lack of AC and the windows in my room were not allowed to be opened, so it was extremely hot in the room. Otherwise great experience.

name: Safestay London Elephant & Castle
reviewtext: Whole building lacks ventilation so sleeping was extremely hot and humid. Made it impossible to sleep. Instead of lockers they give you a cage to lock your stuff, made it annoying to grab stuff on the go. Showers had no water pressure  and WC floors were gross. No towels provided. Location is ok, bit of a walk to major places so you have to take the tube. Hostel is noisy, during my stay there were a lot of kids who made a lot of noise. Fire alarm was pulled twice in the night. Not coming back.

name: Safestay London Elephant & Castle
reviewtext: NOT solo backpacker friendly. Caters to LARGE groups of young kids. Rude bar staff in basement. When I asked to extend my stay at reception, I was immediately told 'no more availability.' Inquired about the availability showing on Hostelworld. Was told I'd have to check out tomorrow morning at 10am and return at 2pm if I extended with the website. Outdated system? Pros - AMAZING facilities and plenty of space. Privacy curtains. Close to tube. Facilities are very clean. Spacious.

name: Safestay London Elephant & Castle
reviewtext: Very clean and quiet. Plenty of privacy if required.

name: Safestay London Elephant & Castle
reviewtext: Worst staff, bad administration

name: Safestay London Elephant & Castle
reviewtext: I got in so around 11 pm and left by 5:30 am so I can't give much a review. Staff was helpful as I was confused about what tube lines I could access with closures for my trip the next morning. Had an ATM in the lobby. This place probably feels closet to the hotel that you can get with a hostel. Wifi is good, private bathrooms with a shower. Closer to elephant and castle station which makes it very easy transfer if you use Gatwick Airport.

name: Safestay London Elephant & Castle
reviewtext:
Super tidy and well kept hostel. A couple of the staff were absolutely AMAZING and took the time out to help with recommendations and any queries, whereas others were rude and abrupt. 
Great facilities, good location, other customers during my stay were also very respectful. This is not a 'party' hostel, there are a lot of school groups and older travellers that come and go, so if you're looking for somewhere quiet and safe, this is a great option.

name: Safestay London Elephant & Castle
reviewtext: This hostel hosts many school camps and therefore is over run by young kids. Room was uncomfortably hot and had to get a fan in the room. Staff were helpful but rude especially in the bar, sometimes waiting up to 15 minutes for a glass of water.

name: Safestay London Elephant & Castle
reviewtext:
Amazing and beautiful amenities, the beds did not make any sound, clean and tidy. 

The only con is that there is nothing for you to heat your food or eat it as they have a restaurant. My way of thinking is that if you are backpacking and saving money the least thing you think is to go an eat at the hostel restaurant.

name: Safestay London Elephant & Castle
reviewtext: Great place...very clean, friendly, and accessible. A bit more pricey than other hostels around but definitely worth it for a few nights roughing it at other places.

name: Safestay London Elephant & Castle
reviewtext: I was welcomed by staff that couldn't really answer of my questions because they were either new or couldn't really speak good enough English. You didn't have anything to cool down the rooms, yes i know England is usually cold but surely summers are warm enough in London to need some sort of cooling system. I didn't feel safe walking the streets(lone female) and it was quite far away from the tube station. School groups stayed there and were especially noisy. I ended up leaving early.

name: Safestay London Elephant & Castle
reviewtext: The hostel was nice and nothing bad happened, but when I first when to check in, i arrived too early and they didn't have a place to store my luggage in. The locker they give you went under the bed but was very difficult to get out because there was a pillar right next to the bunk bed and I couldn't access the locker without having to move the other person's. Location isn't great, had to take the tube everywhere and nothing really stood out in the area it was in.

name: Safestay London Elephant & Castle
reviewtext:
The hostel it's self was redone beautifully, it's modern, there are elevators. 
The rooms need fans and screens on the windows. As it's so hot you sleep with the window open but bugs fly in.  
Also they have no kitchen and allow no outside food, but offer a bar and restaurant in the hostel. Except when I was there, the restaurant was fully booked for 2 nights in a row so no one else could eat there haha. Not very organized. 
Also find it strange how every room has an ensuite??

name: Safestay London Elephant & Castle
reviewtext: Decent hostel, beds are comfy and curtains for added privacy are cute. Staff is friendly enough. Not much atmosphere in my opinion, so perhaps not that great for solo travellers, who are keen on making connections. Due to its large size it feels a bit 'industrial and my fellow roomies had a shocking lack of dorm etiquette. Cleaning could be a bit more thorough and a kitchen would've been nice.

name: Safestay London Elephant & Castle
reviewtext: I was in the female dorm. No air condition and we only has one window.  It was super hot. I complained of bud bugs and the front counter person told me it's impossible I was like why would I lie.after much hesitation he got the manager of the cleaning department who changed my bedding I did experience any bed bags after that. Breakfast was ok. Most of the staff was good except one staff member as above.

name: Safestay London Elephant & Castle
reviewtext:
Felt welcomed and had helpful info whenever I asked a question. Staff is very knowledgeable and fun to talk to also! Would definitely go back to another safestay hostel in other locations...I thoroughly enjoyed the breakfasts to start my travelling day, it takes the hassle out of planning where to go. Also the events run through the evenings looked a lot of fun even though I didn't have time for them. 

Thank you to the staff at safestay, elephant and castle for making my stay a good one.

name: Safestay London Elephant & Castle
reviewtext: One of the best hostels I've been too! Great environment to socialize and get to meet new people. The rooms do get really hot but I little fan was provided for us. Definitely would stay here again

name: Safestay London Elephant & Castle
reviewtext: Reception staff were given my rayban glasses that I accidentally left in the common bathroom by a roommate of mine . They said they never received them. I lost my glasses.

name: Safestay London Elephant & Castle
reviewtext: For sure I will book there when I came back to London!!! Really nice place to stay :) very clean, good atmosphere, and the best facilities ever

name: Palmers Lodge - Hillspring at Willesden Green
reviewtext: The location is good for the price, close to the tube stations which are still located in Zone 2. I stayed there in summer so the room could be too stuffy, so I needed to open the window. Otherwise, the staff are helpful and the breakfast is amazing!

name: Palmers Lodge - Hillspring at Willesden Green
reviewtext: staff wasnt ready when i was scheduled to check in at 2 which is not an early time and room was still dirty and wanted me to leave early next morning to prepare room

name: Palmers Lodge - Hillspring at Willesden Green
reviewtext: Excellent place to stay. Needed a cheap place to stay in London, ideally near Wembley the after the football, and this place fitted the bill. Very clean, showers excellent and coffee, juice and toast in the morning. Super value for money. Will stay again.

name: Palmers Lodge - Hillspring at Willesden Green
reviewtext: It is very difficult to sleep in certain dorms. Not only does the sound/vibration from the elevator permeate through parts of the building, but the keycard access lockers are extremely loud. I use earplugs to block out excess noise, and I'm usually a deep sleeper, but my recent stay here was not a pleasant one.

name: Palmers Lodge - Hillspring at Willesden Green
reviewtext: It was very nice how there were curtains on all of the beds, but it smelled very sweaty in the all females dorm. The location is also not too great, quite a bit of a way from Central London, but you can't beat the price. The bathrooms and showers were pretty clean also.

name: Palmers Lodge - Hillspring at Willesden Green
reviewtext: The hostel was a good choice for us because we were just passing through London, the beds are very comfortable with curtains so it is easy to get a nice sleep. The location is good because the underground is only a 5 minute walk to the hostel. I probably wouldn't stay here again though because the atmosphere wasn't my favourite and there were a lot of older adults staying at the facility.

name: Palmers Lodge - Hillspring at Willesden Green
reviewtext: Its really amazing Hostel.  friendly people, Breakfast is Good, Beds are really comfy.

name: Palmers Lodge - Hillspring at Willesden Green
reviewtext: We booked for a night just to have somewhere to stay before moving onto another hotel. We booked a private twin with shared bathroom - were surprised when we arrived and had a shower in our room which was a great bonus! The hostel itself looks nice - we didn't spend much time there but it seemed to have a good atmosphere. Luggage room was spacious and secure. Our room itself was clean, but there were a ton of spider webs in the corners...in the basement with our window open it was very loud.

name: Palmers Lodge - Hillspring at Willesden Green
reviewtext: Great location.  Not too far from the subway and there are various restaurants and supermarkets in the neighborhood.  My only complaints were lack of variety for breakfast but then again there's a kitchen to make your own food and breakfast is free.  Also with the dorm so close to the bar, it can get pretty noisy at night.  Otherwise, well worth the money and I'll be back again.

name: Palmers Lodge - Hillspring at Willesden Green
reviewtext: Good as usual apart from a few members of staff who bring your stay down

name: Palmers Lodge - Hillspring at Willesden Green
reviewtext: A man in our bunk room complained of bed bugs which made my night a bit unsettling.

name: Palmers Lodge - Hillspring at Willesden Green
reviewtext: Brilliant meeting place for international community

name: Palmers Lodge - Hillspring at Willesden Green
reviewtext: Great value for money, and in a good location- a quiet area in walking distance of a tube station to reach central London easily. I stayed in a 4 bed dorm, which was very comfortable, and the bed was ready made (unlike many hostels I've stayed in). I liked the keycard lockers and free breakfast too. It is quite basic (as can be expected with the price) , but perfect if you just want a cheap to stay. Would come back again.

name: Palmers Lodge - Hillspring at Willesden Green
reviewtext:
If U want o stay in a peaceful suburb, then this is the place.  So pack your bags and give it a go.

Also it has all the necessary facilities and a  is a place U can meet people from different cultures.

name: Palmers Lodge - Hillspring at Willesden Green
reviewtext: The staff were super friendly! The hostel was pretty far from central London, however it was easy to get to city center using the tube. The showers were clean, and the lockers in each room were awesome!

name: Palmers Lodge - Hillspring at Willesden Green
reviewtext: Excellent. I use Palmers Lodge every time I have to go to London. It is extremely good value and no trouble at all in any aspect. Always recommend it.

name: Palmers Lodge - Hillspring at Willesden Green
reviewtext: Good place for staying in London, cheap and clean enough. There aren't so many young travellers, and we unfortunately found a scaring (for my girlfriend) old man roomate, that wasn't behaving properly for staying in a hostel. After all, the atmosphere is poor, but is cheap for London, in a good position, so, especially if you're a single traveler, is a fine accomodation.

name: Palmers Lodge - Hillspring at Willesden Green
reviewtext: Bathrooms flooded multiple times, rooms were boiling, and showers left much to be desired.

name: Palmers Lodge - Hillspring at Willesden Green
reviewtext: Everything was fine, I loved the place...

name: Palmers Lodge - Hillspring at Willesden Green
reviewtext: The atmosphere was dead. Woke up in a pool of my own sweat because of the horrible ventilation. There was a disgusting stain on the wall about 5-10cm from where I layed my head. The staff were boring and had no interest in getting to know their customers. Including the walk to the tube , it's about 40-50mins away from central London, which they don't tell you about on the website. I'm probably never gonna stay there again and I wouldn't  recommend this hostel to young travellers like myself!

name: Palmers Lodge - Hillspring at Willesden Green
reviewtext: Great place to stay, clean bathrooms, spacious environment, curtains, power and lights on bunks, clean well maintained facilities, great bar and dining area, even has a huge antique motorbike collection to look at. Definitely recommend, will be staying again soon.

name: Palmers Lodge - Hillspring at Willesden Green
reviewtext:
It a bad place at all to stay. Good staff and location isn't too bad. You just have to take the tube back and forth. Make sure you buy/get an Oyster card because it is cheaper to use. Is card than to buy tickets each time. Hostel is about a 10-12mins walk to the station. 

Beds were decent and they all have curtains for privacy and lock boxes under the beds - just bring your own lock. 


Will stay again.

name: Palmers Lodge - Hillspring at Willesden Green
reviewtext: Great set up

name: Palmers Lodge - Hillspring at Willesden Green
reviewtext: This hostel is very nice to stay at. The only downside is it's location. It's very far out on the jubilee line and it takes a while to get to downtown London. The facilities are clean, however and the staff was very friendly. We had a mix up with our room and they were quick to fix it and apologize! I would stay here again!

name: Palmers Lodge - Hillspring at Willesden Green
reviewtext: Overall clean facility and friendly staff. Do not recommend staying if the temperature is warm. The room was like a sauna, it was unbearable and I needed to go outside multiple times during the night to get some fresh air

name: Palmers Lodge - Hillspring at Willesden Green
reviewtext: My mom and I stayed here while we were visiting London. We really enjoyed our stay. Things were clean, the reception staff were nice and incredibly helpful. It takes about 20 minutes on the underground to get to the city center. The only thing that was a little uncomfortable was the room temp- it was very hot and stuffy, but we opened the window which helped a bit. Overall, great hostel

name: Palmers Lodge - Hillspring at Willesden Green
reviewtext: Loved it ! Extended my stay and don't see a reason to go any other place.

name: Palmers Lodge - Hillspring at Willesden Green
reviewtext:
Its was lovely hostel and I loved it 
I will definetly come back and stay a bit more again .
Cheers 
Sedef

name: Palmers Lodge - Hillspring at Willesden Green
reviewtext: Good area, five minutes from a tube station that runs the Night Tube. Safe walk for solo female from tube to hostel. Only complaint is that rooms are very dusty/dry.

name: Palmers Lodge - Hillspring at Willesden Green
reviewtext: Very nice place! Would definitely recommend.

name: Palmers Lodge - Hillspring at Willesden Green
reviewtext: Its a bigger hostel, so I feel as though it was a little difficult to meet people. Its a short walk to the tube which is awesome, and it was very clean. Felt secure with keycard licks to the gates and rooms.

name: Palmers Lodge - Hillspring at Willesden Green
reviewtext: Clean, quiet, apart from the room mate phoning home to South America at 2.30am. Good breakfast and a pleasant part of London

name: Palmers Lodge - Hillspring at Willesden Green
reviewtext: A 14 persons dorm is not ideal if you are looking for a peaceful early night with some people checking in at midnight and of course making a racket. Lovely reception stuff! HOWEVER I had a MALE cleaner enter the ladies toilets/bathrooms on the ground floor without knocking to see if any ladies for present in the restrooms before entering and then started to ARGUE with ME when I told him to leave!! Thankfully I was dressed however I had to complain about this.

name: Palmers Lodge - Hillspring at Willesden Green
reviewtext: Fantastic hostel, very secure, friendly staff, very comfy bed (I may be biased due to intoxication!), very clean, good shared bathrooms, great location for my purposes (a friend lives 8 minutes' walk away) although I'm unsure if it would be the best if you want the touristy stuff. Didn't get up for breakfast but I'd imagine cereal, toast etc. Will return, highly recommended.

name: Palmers Lodge - Hillspring at Willesden Green
reviewtext: Nice place.   Breakfast is free.   Bar is great.    They need to clean showers twice a day.

name: Palmers Lodge - Hillspring at Willesden Green
reviewtext: Overall this is a good hostel. The beds were very comfy and the bathrooms and showers were nice. The staff was super friendly and helpful.  I have stayed in LOTS of London hostels and this one is far superior and, therefore, worth the distance from the center of London.  Would definitely stay here again.

name: Palmers Lodge - Hillspring at Willesden Green
reviewtext: I was given a basement room, with no AC and almost no windows. Also very noisy all night long.

name: Palmers Lodge - Hillspring at Willesden Green
reviewtext: Awesome hostel!

name: Palmers Lodge - Hillspring at Willesden Green
reviewtext: Love staying here. Great beds, good showers.. well maintained hostel..

name: Palmers Lodge - Hillspring at Willesden Green
reviewtext: I thought everything was great at the Palmer except the breakfast. Toast and croissant. Cold cereal. Juice, coffee. A sour Apple. No protein! That brought the Lodge down.

name: Palmers Lodge - Hillspring at Willesden Green
reviewtext:
The hostel was good, a bit far from the center and the neighbourhood was weird.
We stayed two nights in there and there was a group of teenagers that were making noise both nights, at 3 am and later. The staff didn't apologize or solved this situation, knowing that most of the people sleeping there were turists that only wanted to rest.
Including the breakfast was a good idea. I recommend it.
Despite this, very improvable in general.

name: Palmers Lodge - Hillspring at Willesden Green
reviewtext: It's an okay hostel in a decent location. Close to Wimbledon if you are in town for that. Tube was about a 10 minute walk and the neighborhood is nice. But the front desk staff tried to rip us off once or twice, the breakfast isn't what they promised. One of my buddies walked into the bathroom and there was poop on the walls.

name: Palmers Lodge - Hillspring at Willesden Green
reviewtext: It's very good value for money and is perfect for getting out about close to some nice restaurants as well overall a nice place to stay

name: Palmers Lodge - Hillspring at Willesden Green
reviewtext: Stayed in the big mixed dorm and rooms were great, but room and enough space between each bed! Having the curtain there for privacy was also awesome and something other hostels should do! Bathrooms were cleaned like 3 times a day and showers were big! Staff helpful and awesome common room. Only let down was location, although close to a train station and food it was about 20mins on the train to get into the main attractions. Would definitely stay again!

name: Palmers Lodge - Hillspring at Willesden Green
reviewtext: For me it was a big small, but you have everything you need.

name: Palmers Lodge - Hillspring at Willesden Green
reviewtext: I really enjoyed my stay at Palmer's Lodge. Everyone was nice and I was very comfortable with the facility. I stayed in all female 4 bedroom and left with a new friend. Awesome place overall.

name: Palmers Lodge - Hillspring at Willesden Green
reviewtext: Very pleased with staff and sleeping arrangement. Would recommend the bar be open earlier.

name: Palmers Lodge - Hillspring at Willesden Green
reviewtext: Me and my family stayed here for our trip to London. We had a private tour person room and were very very happy was perfect for what we needed. Was clean comfortable and a breakfast included was brilliant too.  Is a very short walk to Willesden Green tube station which is perfect for any journey to London. Will defo go back again

name: Palmers Lodge - Hillspring at Willesden Green
reviewtext: Clean! Friendly staff! I got a very good night's sleep.

name: Palmers Lodge - Hillspring at Willesden Green
reviewtext: Great place to stay. Stayed in the 22 person room which I was worried about but the beds had curtains to make your space private and the room was cooler than the other rooms in the hostel. Thoroughly enjoyed my stay. Bar is always a nice touch as well.

name: Palmers Lodge - Hillspring at Willesden Green
reviewtext: Convenient place to stay, particularly if you want to go to Wembley or Lords. Found the ventilation in the rooms to be pretty poor so it constantly smelt of sweat - other than that no complaints.

name: Palmers Lodge - Hillspring at Willesden Green
reviewtext: Great stay!

name: Palmers Lodge - Hillspring at Willesden Green
reviewtext: Very decent hostel! There are tons of common areas to relax in, including a bar. The bathroom in our room was clean, although the temperature in the shower kept fluctuating from extremely hot to extremely cold, which was unpleasant. The four person room that we stayed in was a bit small, and due to no AC it remained pretty hot in the room the whole time. The beds were very comfortable though and had reading lights so some can sleep undisturbed while others stay up. Great free breakfast!

name: Palmers Lodge - Hillspring at Willesden Green
reviewtext: It is fairly easy to find, and I felt safe there. I was very happy to find they have top sheets as well as a duvet on the bed (most in UK have only duvet) because it is too hot to use the heavy cover, but still nice to be covered with the sheet. I do wish breakfast started earlier so it would be easier to get where I needed to be at a more reasonable time.

name: Palmers Lodge - Hillspring at Willesden Green
reviewtext: The atmosphere in Palmers Lodge Hillspring is really cool. The people working there are from all over the world and really friendly. I have met a lot of cool people in this hostel and I really loved the beautiful neighbourhood, which is more quiet than the crowded city centre. But it still has its own fresh vibes. It takes some time to get to the city centre but if you like to experience the London Underground, then there should be no problem with that!

name: Palmers Lodge - Hillspring at Willesden Green
reviewtext: Bathrooms were smart and clean but the woman checking us in at reception was rude and difficult at times. Someone else happened to be in our assigned bed and she made out like it was our fault and was very huffy about solving it. The 22 - bed room had people coming and going at all hours which made it difficult to sleep.

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: Felt very safe in the area as a solo female traveler. Clean. Comfortable bed. Really nice breakfast for $5. Would not recommend if you are a light sleeper - loud corridor doors could be heard slamming throughout the night. Also would not recommend if you are looking for a party vibe - most of the hostelgoers I saw were over 30. I would want to stay a bit closer to the city center so I could save money on transportation.

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: 5 min walk from Swiss Cottage tube, no escalator at train station, fantastic building awaits you and great social aspects. Lockers in dorms are so tiny but extra locker space available including a safe. Poor approach to welcome orientation by all staff. Close to all amenities

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext:
I wouldn't stay in the big dorms again: I felt as if I were in a potential fire trap and it was difficult to find.  Difficult also to carry suitcase there.

I like the common rooms and free tea which encourages people to sit down and even talk.

I love that you repurposed a big beautiful old house in such a wonderful location.

Some staff were more helpful than others.

Altogether positive.

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: This hostel was very charming and unique. The location was close to a train stop and easy to get to. I do wish there were more outlets in the rooms, we had to rotate who could use the 2 outlets available. Also be aware if you are located in the basement you will hear the music being played in the reception upstairs all night long. Otherwise the staff was very nice and helpful, food was good, bathrooms were clean, overall had a pleasant stay.

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: Overall, very satisfied for my stay there. Convenient & safe location; friendly staff, comfortable, homey atmosphere. Almost gave it a 10 except that i'd like to draw their attention to almost 1/3 of the chairs in the resting hall. They are in so such old, shabby, broken condition  that nobody wants to sit on them. Their condition also makes them look dirty!!! It's a shame they are there in an otherwise very welcoming, well laid out & well thought out hall.

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: Always great staying at Palmer's. Ah, if only the kitchen were bigger. But I know you know that is a concern. And your plaintbthat you are not permitted to build a bigger kitchen because it is a listed building is pure waffle. Still and all, it's a good place.

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: Gorgeous old building with a lot of history. Staff so friendly and helpful! I like that the beds have curtains but the beds are quite small and the lockers and chests under ths bed end up being very noisy, use earplugs when you are sleeping!

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext:
Excellent location, hostel is beautiful, classy and clean, offering great amount of privacy (curtain with each bed), great social aspect (bar and restaurant are attached) Terrace is a big plus. major supermarkets close by. 

My suggestion to this hostel is please improve the kitchen facilities, even bringing some old pots + pans + cooking utensils from your kitchen next door.  pot and 2 pans and will not be enough for the whole hostel, I got more to say but please seriously review it.

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: Really enjoyed staying here! Great location and the staff (Michael,Lina and Tom namely) were brilliant and friendly and overall I think this is my new place to stay in London!

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: Great hostel in a good location. Wish their bar had been open a little later with some better food options, but still great value for the money!

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: The accommodation is comfortable the facilites are good and excellent value for money

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: The room was clean and well served.  The hostel is a very good position to reach in the night.  The guys at the reception were kind and fast in service.

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext:
BEST HOSTEL EVER!!!
Really nice rooms for relaxing, awesome beds with super pleasant linen.
Very tidy bathrooms (and a whole bunch of them).
Wifi works. Free coffee. Nice bar, two dining rooms.
If I had to live in London and they would allow for more than a 14 day stay, I would just live there.

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext:
Staff. GREAT,HELPFUL and KNOWLEDGABLE
I travelled alone and met many new friends. Bar is small but fun. I would recommend a 12 bed room or less just for comfort and bathrooms are bigger imo
Short or long your stay will be fun

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: I was looking for a cheaper place to stay in London and Palmers Lodge was the perfect find. It is a little outside the city in a quieter area but the subway is a 4-minute walk and takes you right into town in about 10 minutes. I felt safe and the rooms/bathrooms were both clean. The bar was nice and the staff was friendly. If you want more of a 'nightlife' scene this might not be the place for you â€“ but if you're looking for a quieter location then I would highly recommend this hostel.

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext:
Would stay again.
Close to trains in. Everything you need in the area. Place is pretty nice for what you need.

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: Stuff was STOLEN during the night and on the morning the lady at the reception just DID NOT care or want to no.

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: Great hostel. Parking was great as I visited on motorbike. Bar downstairs was good after a long trip. I would suggest for people needing a place to stay but don't want to go In to the heart of London.

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: This is my second stay in this hostel this year. Everything is done for keeping the place clean.

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: Beds are fine and clean, a little bit short for taller people, but the rest of the place is relatively untidy or not so clean. Ther whole stuff is kind, always available  and  willing to help.  Atmosphere is good, I liked the all you can eat breakfast for 4,50 Â£,  the food was really good, especially muffins â˜º. And the lounge area is also a nice place to relax. After all would say a good value for money, just the higyene level should be a little bit higher for my consideration.

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: This was my absolute first hostel experience, including european trip and I couldn't have been more happier. The location was great, short walk to the tube, pubs or grocery shopping. Short bus ride to Camden town for wider selection of pubs and restaurants. The hostel had a great atmosphere, staff at the front were really helpful and knowledgeable, beds comfortable, clean showers, big hand to the cleaning crew.

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: Palmers Lodge was great.  Really comfortable beds, delightfully quirky room.  Lovely old house.  Absolutely smashing all you can eat breakfast with fantastic coffee.  Only downside for me was it was a bit noisy at night, slamming doors etc. but that could just have been the couple of days we were there.  I would recommend and will stay there again.

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: perfect place...thanks....

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: Tiny kitchen, but the essentials are there. Teamwork is necessary to have more than one person cooking. Only real drawback is the quality of the washing dryer, expensive because one machine doesn't work and I didn't know until I asked. Great people, place, and super close to 2 tube stations, plenty of places to eat, and grocery stores. Thanks for a great week in London!

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: Deffenlt stay hire if you like a true doorm feel i thought  it was great

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: Good price for a hostel near the centre and the tube station. Rooms where clean but hot in summer with fans only and small windows so becareful. Had only few choices in there breakfast.

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext:
Fab little gem of a place, and easy walk between to 2 tube stations.
lovely staff

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: I couldn't use my room for 4 hours after check-in time as I was assigned a used bed. Easy mistake to make, but instead of just assigning me a different bed, or just letting me remake my bed, the front staff were rude to me; acted as though I was being dramatic; and insisted on getting the cleaners to do it. As the cleaners were busy with their many other tasks, I had to wait until 6pm to actually have my bed. I had also been up since 3am for my flight and the staff knew this, but did not care.

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: First time using a hostel and this experience was fantastic. The place had great vibes, great information, Great staff help. Convenient to the Tube. Would definitely stay again !!!

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: Overall really loved this hostel! My friend and I met so many lovely people and even went on day trips with them. The atmosphere is great and there are plenty of spaces in the hostel to hang out- we really liked the garden bit. No aircon :/ but there were some fans in our dorms so it was manageable. Bathrooms are clean. Staff are friendly. We are definitely planning on going back!

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: Building and staff were very nice! Our 9 bed room was dirty and stuffy. The lockers in the room were too small for our backpacks and there was no where to store them in the small room, so had to sleep beside my bag in the bed.

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: Had a really nice time here, wasn't quite the atmosphere I was expecting (was middle of the week though so no complaints there) but was a really relaxing place. So much so I found it hard to get the enthusiasm to actually head out and do stuff rather than hang around in the common room. Overall was a nice stay and can't really say too much bad about it.

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: Honestly best hostel I've ever stayed in. The house is beautiful and the staff are great! The bar has really cheap drinks and does specials every night. It's close to the metro and not far from most attractions in the city. I had a great experience and highly recommend

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: Roommates noisy and coughing all night ,if you are not picky your money is worth in this hostel .Hostel need some updates pretty run down .But location is very accessible to everything.

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: Great value for money in London. Buses and underground in a short walking distance. I stayed in the 18 bed room and it was large and comfortable. Beds have curtains, so you can have more privacy. On my first night weather was hot, and they provided us fans which was really nice. I recommend this hostel!

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: Overall a great experience. I was in a 23 person room but due to extensive security measures it felt like I was in my own private room. Would recommend to any traveller.

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: A fun and atmospheric place to stay in an ideal location right near the tube.  The place has a fantastic social energy and was one of my favourite spots on a very long journey.

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext:
Good hostel, nice building . Good location .
But no air conditioning..  typical of the UK in that regard :)

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: This was my first time staying at a hostel, and I loved it! I actually just booked another 3 nights for when I come back to London. The staff is helpful and friendly, bathrooms + bedrooms are clean, and the location is excellent. Only downside is that it got really hot at night in the 3rd floor female dorm (more the heat wave's fault than theirs, but the fans weren't enough) so it was sometimes difficult to sleep. Looking forward to being back soon though!

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: I've stayed at this place a few times, and have always had a brill time and have always been impressed by the hostel. This time I had 1 little thing that I have a complaint about. Everytime I have stayed so far, I've never had any problems or complaints about the staff, this time however I feel as though I was rudely mistreated by an Eastern European girl that was working in reception, it was the way I was spoken to that offended, me and when I asked for help locating my room, she did not help.

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext:
Only complaint is the bald guy at the check in counter (heavily)  made out with a woman  downstairs near the restroom/ lockers and then took her into the staff key locked room all while I was a few feet away gathering my things from my locker. Like congratulations on getting laid but be more discreet when people are around. It was very unprofessional. 

On a side note, the showers and toilets were very clean. So thumbs up for that.

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: Terribly hot! Like stay in hell

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: We stayed in the female only dorm, and it was really nice. Good staff, good location, good value. The one draw back would have been no air conditioning, but fans were provided to help fight the heat.

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: Beautiful building which perfectly conveys the Old traditional English home atmosphere. Staff are very friendly. Beds are comfy and rooms and bathrooms are very clean.

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: Great atmosphere at the pub downstairs, spacious lockers underneath beds and extra lockers in the hall if you need the space.

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: Very easy going quiet place, enjoyable!

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: Spotlessly clean, comfortable, great staff, handy location, decent price for London. Surprisingly nice decor for a hostel. Outside garden at the back. Breakfast is good, nice bar.

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: Really friendly staff, clean property. A couple of extra sinks and another pillow would've made it perfect, but otherwise a great, relaxed place for our stay.

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: People there are amazing. Friendly environment. Very helpful. Bathrooms were super clean

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: Amazing. Clean, friendly and a wonderful location in London. All staff was helpful and happy. Only thing is no AC so you might want a hand fan.

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: Awesome place to stay. My flight was delayed and they handled my 3AM check in with no problem at all!  I'd stay there again in a heartbeat.

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: Beautiful building. Amazing breakfast. Location is close to two train stations. Staff was kind. Rooms can be a touch stuffy. Not a party hostel.

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: Everything was good except no air-conditioning, July in London is very hot and there was no relief when returning to the hostel. I found the staff helpful, the place was clean and well kept. It is in a good location, not more than a short tube ride to get anywhere, but it was difficult to sleep due to the heat.

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: Very good hostel. Not much to complain about, maybe the bathrooms in the upper floor could be renovated. The bar in the basement is really nice.

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: Second time staying here. The rooms are awesome and the staff is really helpful.

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: Really great location in such a beautiful home with tons of character. Even though I was in a 28 bed room it felt even more private than other hostel rooms that had only 6 beds. The bathrooms are nothing special, but the breakfast is worth it!

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext:
It was a beautiful building, with a very fun bar and common room! We loved the location, it was very safe feeling, accessible and spacious! 
Our bunk beds had curtains and felt like little dens which I loved. Lastly we loved the bartender, she was so funky and nice!

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext:
It was ok. I have stayed here a few times as the location & price is not bad. 1 Communal sex & non private bathroom for multiple rooms ðŸ‘Ž bad idea. 

the lift is broken & had been for months & so if you have heavy bags like i did you gotta carry up or down precarious steps.

Try not to book in a big dorm room downstairs as theres only 1 unisex bathroom which doesnt feel v private, tbh it just feels uncomfortable even brushing your teeth. Its also right next to the bar so gets veeeerrry noisy.

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: great hostel if you like architecture because it's gorgeous but not quite as good if you want to have a beer and party. It was very clean and we had a private room which was quaint but pretty small which was okay because I'm super agile but it did get quite hot as they are located on the top floor. Overall it's nice if you like catching the tube into the city because there isn't much going on at Swiss Cottage.

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext:
Room was very smelly and hot, I know we've had amazing weather in England lately and we don't have air con, but I was on the very top bunk and barely slept, so hot!
Room smelt like other people's sweat, not the best! I feel this would be better in winter!
Staff lovely, facilities great, just a smelly and sweaty Room!

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: We stayed in 3 hostels between London and Dublin and Palmers lodge was definitely our favorite. The atmosphere is nice and relaxed. The staff is lovely and the privacy in the bunks was great! Great location in a cheap part of town and really close to the underground. Really no complaints from our stay.

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: I arrived and checked in only to find my bed was the only one without curtins. I specifically chose the hostel for its privacy and requested a bed change but was told that there were no other beds available so I left the hostel and moved into an airbnb. Best decision ever!!

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: The rooms were private with the curtains on the beds but that doesn't allow for much socialising and there was little to no air circulating so it was extremely hot.  Due to the showers in the same room as the wash basins it is almost impossible to apply make up without it immediately sweating off unless you set up in the hallways (if you have your own mirror). Amenities were good and clean enough and the staff were friendly. The hostel is not too close to the main attractions but easy to get to.

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext:
This place is fine. It's basically your standard no-frills hostile.

Security boxes are annoying because they're tiny and roll under the beds.

The crowd was interesting: teenagers to older travelers. But if you put yourself out there at breakfast, in the bar, or in the lounge, you'll make friends.

Easy to access via the Underground's Swiss Cottage station on the Jubilee line.

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: We came to the lodge during a very rare hot few days or so, which isn't the hostel's fault, but the fan in the room barely worked which was extremely unfortunate. Overall the rest of the hostel was satisfactory; there were lockers you could rent in case your room wasn't ready, the hostel is a five or so minute walk from a metro station, and there were separate bathrooms for girls and guys. The lack of air con and a good fan was really the only problem we had.

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: I really like this hostel! I've stayed here before and came back because I really like the atmosphere of this place! The curtains on the bed are a nice touch and if you have quiet roommates, you can get a good nights sleep. The curtains are quite heavy which makes the beds quite warm in the summer but the privacy is worth it! I would recommend this hostel!

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: Everything about this hostel was pretty great except for the temperature of the room. It was so hot in the room at night that you couldn't sleep and there was no air conditioning. Even with the window open it did not make a difference. However everything else was awesome, there is even a bar in the hostel if you want to get a drink!

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: I stayed in a 10 bed female dorm which was on the bottom floor. I liked that each bed had privacy curtains and an outlet and lamp, very convenient for travelers. The bar area had a great scene and the breakfast was generous for the price. Swiss Cottage station is four minute walk. What I didn't like: our Closest bathroom is down the hallway and required you to walk past the bar to the get there. The door to our room SLAMMED shut and woke up everyone in the room if you weren't careful closing it.

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: Palmers Longe was a really fantastic tidy hostel with friendly staff,Lina at the reception makes everyone feel welcome and the atmosphere was nice.The room was a bit humid and too hot at first, but I guess in those days everywhere would be the same.The common spaces are amazing,the breakfast's quite tasty,the most impressive thing is that the bar is pretty nice with tap alcohol,I was really satisfied!I was woken up first night by the staff who was checking the bed,but they apologized so I'm fine

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: The biggest thing that I disliked about this hostel is that they stuffed 12 beds into a small room without air conditioning. I understand that England doesn't hav air conditioning for the most part, but nobody could sleep in their rooms. They all slept outside on benches. I wouldn't recommend staying here in the summer or spring if you dislike sleeping while sweating.

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: OMG best hostel I've stayed at, couldn't ask for anything better from a hostel. The building is beautiful and the inside is equally beautifully, mostly furnished in wood. The staff are very friendly and helpful, the beds are comfortable and there's a slide out storage unit under each bed which you can put your things in and lock up. Everything is very clean and I felt comfortable enough to walk around barefoot. Absolutely love this place and wouldn't stay anywhere else if I'm in London again.

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: Overall a really nice building, clean bathrooms and showers. The only thing is that some outlets do not work.

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: Palmers was great in terms of their facilities and ease of checking in and out. It's fairly distant from the city center of London and you need to purchase an Oyster card in order to make the trip back and forth from the hostel to the city. The layout of the rooms also make it difficult to talk to anyone or meet new people. Everyone is basically sleeping in their own "pod".

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: This place is great! It's a gem

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: Easy to get into the city, for a large dorm there was still a feeling of privacy

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: The hostel was just ok. It wasn't the best location or cleanest place to be. The building is quite old and the lift wasn't working (I doubt it ever did) based on how old the place looks. We had to carry our suitcases up about 50 steps. The stairs at the time of our checkin (after midnight) were full of young people chatting sitting down in the middle of the way. We had to ask them to move aside. Also while we were in reception a girl came to complain about how there was no light in her room.

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: The locker under my bed was damaged, so I didn't have the best confidence in the security of my belongings. However, they had airtight safes available for rental  where I was able to keep my valuables. The location is right next to the underground which made for easy transport. The place was clean, the aesthetic charming, the other people polite and the surrounding area had lots of food options. Don't forget to check out the Hampstead Theatre while you're there! They give under 30 discounts!

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: 10/10! Amazing. Really great place only a few mins away from jubilee line. Very very clean. Staff was very nice (thanks for no trouble with checking out so late haha)

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: Great place!!! Only the toilette, almost all the time has paper on the floor. And the shower flood itself. Great breakfast for 4.5 pounds. Privacy because of cortins. Big screen in the bar. Good location. No towels included. You can rent them.

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: Always a good old standby.

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: This place is really cool and it was located right near an underground tube stop so close enough to get where you need. It was very hot in the rooms though, if you're staying here in the summer be mindful of that.

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: Although the location is not necessarily ideal, it is a 2 minute walk away from the Jubliee and Metropolitan lines, which can get you to wherever you need to go. The staff were all lovely, helpful, and fun (shout-out to Tom). The facilities all worked perfectly and the World Cup game was always on in the hostel bar. Definitely a good time and would reccomend!

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext:
Really nice spacious and clean hostel - very good value for money. Great bathroom facilities; plenty of cubicles, space, good, hot showers and clean!
We were a group of friends sharing a six bed dorm after a concert and this was perfect, we will return! Could have done with a fan in the room but warm weather was exceptional and did cool down later.
The kitchen is very small (as a listed building this can't be changed) so not so good if relying on self-catering but there is a bar and restaurant.

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: Great atmosphere and location. Easy to get to all of the great places in central London and easy to get home at any time of night on the weekend as it is on the Jubilee line which runs 24/7. Staff are very friendly, but seemed to lack local knowledge, when asking for food recommendations we were advised to go to M&S or subway, which was not exactly what we were looking for. Would definitely recommend this hostel.

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext:
A great place when you travel on budget. I stayed in the 12-bed female dorm with ensuite bathroom which was great. It was kept super clean which is not a given in other hostels. Privacy curtains on the bed were also appreciated. 
Palmers is not the most socially vibrant hostel as people tend to keep to themselves (at least that was my experience). You can meet new people at the bar though. Beware, it closes around midnight - a bummer for revelers, a relief for those sleeping in rooms nearby. :)

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext:
Palmer's Lodge Hostel is an interesting building: it has the feel of a country manor house and an old boarding school. There's a spacious reception hall and sitting room and a huge staircase.  Nice bar in the basement.  The showers and toilets are very clean. The white bed linen is clean and - best thing - the beds are already made up!  The staff are friendly and welcoming.
This hostel is well-situated and very good value for money. I recommend it.

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: The best accommodation I had in my life! 100% will recommend it

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: Great hostel. The beds have curtains and don't move when others are climbing up into the top bunks which is awesome. Each bed also has a mirror, a light and usb chargers which I looooved since I had forgotten my converter. I'm not sure if all the dorms are this way but I was in the 12 bed female dorm and it was great. I was able to do my makeup and stuff in my little bed with the mirror and light so I didn't have to go to the bathroom for that. Would definitely recommend.

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: Comfortable beds

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: Nice staff, close to underground, great bar and lounge, music all night at reception (didn't prevent me from good sleep on first floor), small beds, but perfect for travelers

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: Had a lovely stay at Palmers Lodge. The facilities are neat and well looked after. The staff is very friendly and considerate. Easy to find and a short walk from the underground. The free coffee and tea is a definite bonus!

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: This place is amazing. Everything you could ask for in a hostel. I loved how the beds were super private, and the place is super fancy. I would definitely stay here again if I come back to London.

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: Great value for money. Haven't got a bad word to say about the place.

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext:
very beautiful building in a nice residential neighborhood. because the hostel is literally a giant mansion, a lot of groups stay here. 
Great location, 5 minutes walk to 2 subway stations. Starbucks and grocery store just 5 mins walk as well. 
because there's no AC, so it can be VERY hot.

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: I got in late and left early, so I wasn't there much at all, but it was great! It's a super cool building and I liked that the beds had curtains around them for a little extra privacy. It is a ways from the city center.

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: This was a great first hostel to stay in. It's in a quiet(ish) neighborhood yet seems close to everything through the proximity of the tube station. If you're into theatre like I am, check out the Hampstead Theater right down the road next to the tube, there are discounted tickets for under 30! This was a great place to stay.

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: I really enjoyed my stay in this pretty hostel

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: I loved this hostel, the building was beautiful. The staff were so nice and friendly and we had nice chats. The bar downstairs is great to go to before an evening out. We got back quite late and there were still people at reception (it's 24 hours) who remembered who we were, and asked how our night was, which was really nice. The beds have their own curtains to allow a bit of privacy which was a good addtion. The only problem was that the bathroom was a bit far from the room but not a big issue.

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: I had a great time staying here! The room/bathrooms were clean. The staff was extremely friendly and went out of their way to help us! I would stay there again in a heartbeat!

name: Palmers Lodge - Swiss Cottage
reviewtext: Really cool building in a very convenient location. Bar is great value (especially for London) and has a nice atmosphere around it. Only issue was the lack of AC in the rooms, fair enough it is London which isn't the warmest city but in the summer it was extremely warm.

name: Clink261
reviewtext: Excellent location, facilities and quiet environment at night!

name: Clink261
reviewtext: Facilities are all in order, however I didn't feel it was friendly. The strong white fluorescent lighting also felt sterile - my general feel of the place. I borrowed a hairdryer in the morning, and to avoid disturbing my roommates I used the communal socket outside the kitchen. A staff suggested I go into the laundry room instead - he said the hairdryer noise would disturb those in the kitchen, but he added that I would have a mirror in the room. Go stay in Astors instead for a welcoming place.

name: Clink261
reviewtext: Stayed in a 4 bedroom female dorm & when 4 people were in the room was very hard to move around at all- only complaint otherwise overall a great hostel

name: Clink261
reviewtext: I have never become so close to people in such a small amount of time. Truly my favourite hostel experience.

name: Clink261
reviewtext: Is a good price for what they offer but in my room me and my friend couldn't sleep because of a very lowdly snoar of a guy. We requested to change the room but the staff didn't helped us with this issue. We know that it can happen but the hostel could have  tried to find out a solution as it was really impossible to sleep.

name: Clink261
reviewtext:
I stayed here twice in the past month and it was great both times. Personally I found the beds to be some of the comfier ones I've had in hostels haha
And I really loved the powerbars and reading lights and shelfs above each bed! That was super useful and great!!

name: Clink261
reviewtext: A comfortable spot to bunker down for a few nights if needed. Very close to Kings Cross Station, busses, and the underground.

name: Clink261
reviewtext:
It was a decent place to stay; I'd stay again. Staff were nice.

Pros:
1. Close to Eurostar Train and Underground Metro (convenient)
2. Every bed have a light switch attached to headboard and includes both usb and outlet charging station.

Cons:
1. The showers at this place isn't scorching hot enough for me :( 
2. No AC, so windows must be left open or it'll be horridly stuffy with 10 people inside. When the windows are open, the outside cars/trucks are very loud, so put earplugs on.

name: Clink261
reviewtext: Stayed in the 18 bed dorm- comfortable and amenities good (lockable lockers, power outlet at each bed). Breakfast additional but good value.

name: Clink261
reviewtext: I was pretty happy with my stay here. The beds in the large dorms were right next to each other, but they had dividers and this actually helped a lot. It made it feel more private and even helped block out some of the sounds of other people as well and people entering and exiting the room. I was pleasantly surprised.

name: Clink261
reviewtext: I was staying just for a night before my morning train from st Pancras. I was in one of the mixed dorm. It was hard to sleep because of the noise from the street (the Windows were open because was hot in the room).

name: Clink261
reviewtext: Really nice hostel, and an ideal location, only 5 minutes from Kings Cross. That did unfortunately mean that my room faced out onto a busy/loud road, but I still managed to sleep fine so it wasn't too bad! We were in a 6 person dorm, which was a very good size for the two of us! The lockers under the bed were big and spacious enough for us to fit in our two backpacks and my large duffel bag, as well. The hostel was very clean and the kitchen/lounge were lovely to hang out in!

name: Clink261
reviewtext:
I stayed in the dorm with 18 beds. The problem was the lack of any ventilation. Without any airflow, the combo of 18 bodies and wet towels made the room smell pretty funky.

The hostel is pretty quiet. The breakfast is good for a fair price. The location is great. The staff was friendly.

name: Clink261
reviewtext: My friend had her Apple Watch stolen right from the charging dock on her bed our first night here. The beds have absolutely so space in between them making this incredibly easy to do. Along with the fact that there were 18 of us shoved into one room like sardines. The environment at this hostel was very different from any other hostel I have stayed in. Not as communal or friendly as others I have used. Would not come back.

name: Clink261
reviewtext: The location was definitely convenient since it was a 2 minute walk to Kings Cross. However, that also meant the area was loud and dirty. The facility itself is adequately clean. The room was tiny! With 2 or 3 people it was fine but 4 felt very crowded. The staff were all very friendly and helpful so they really made the stay bearable. If you don't mind the small space bring ear plugs and you should be just fine.

name: Clink261
reviewtext: Perfect location and amazing staff, very accommodating to traveler needs. I just wish there were more men's bathrooms/showers. All facilities were kept clean.

name: Clink261
reviewtext: Terrible beds

name: Clink261
reviewtext: Overall it was okay. You don't get much for your money. Small rooms but comfortable matress. Not very helpful staff, they prefer to talk to each other instead of talking the the guests.

name: Clink261
reviewtext: Really close to Kings Cross, great vibe and decor, super-value breakfast (you couldn't get a coffee for that price most places!). Only downside was our room was very hot and the fan provided inadequate. Otherwise everything perfect . Comfy beds and everything super-clean. This will be my go-to hostel choice for future London trips.

name: Clink261
reviewtext: Booked a 10 bed/All female dorm, and got upgraded to a 4 bed/all female. You'd think this would be a good thing however, it was the smallest room in the entire world. No more than 2 of us couldn't be off our beds at any given time. Location was good though.

name: Clink261
reviewtext: Clink 261 was an AMAZING hostel! Definitely recommend.  The rooms were clean and include a sink. The bathrooms were cleaned daily and were kept in good condition. The hostel has very good wifi that is usable at all times of the day. All staff were relatively friendly and knowledgeable, and tried their best to help us. The kitchen is large and includes everything you need, minus an oven. The common area is nice as well. This location is PERFECT, very central and easy to get to anything! 10/10

name: Clink261
reviewtext: I stayed here only for one night. Great location for me as I had a train to catch from St Pancras station the next day, which is only walk away. Atmosphere was a bit off. None of the other stayers seemed very social, spent a lot of time in the dorm on their bed. Hostel as a whole was good though; clean, good value for money and friendly/helpful staff.

name: Clink261
reviewtext:
The location is great, really easy for all trains and the underground. We stayed in a 4 bed mixed room, and it was ridiculously tight. We were unable to roll the lockers under the bunks all the way without hitting the next bed. I think this issue is room dependent as I saw another 4 bed room that was much more spacious. 
As other reviews have mentioned, the showers were a bit on the dirty side but just bring a pair of shower shoes. The breakfast was minimal but has the basics-worth the price!

name: Clink261
reviewtext: The location of this hostel is in the worst possible place in London. The only this slightly convenient is how close the tube station is but with how unsafe the surrounding area is it isnt even worth it. LADIES! there is no female bathroom on some of the floors and the mattress isn't covered with a sheet, exposing questionable stains, and the rooms are boiling hot; even while we were there during a storm. Would never recommend this place, very disappointed in the false advertisement.

name: Clink261
reviewtext: The dorms are incredibly small, the size of the room for 10 beds was similar to a 4 bed dorm in any other hostel, and it smelled very bad.

name: Clink261
reviewtext: Everything was good except the room is super hot and there are bunch of 14 year old kids running and being loud.

name: Clink261
reviewtext: Tight quarters in the 6 bedroom. Place was clean and security was good. We stayed here for a night because it was convenient for an early morning train. I would suggest staying in another part of London if you want to be close to main tourist attractions. Overall happy with our stay.

name: Clink261
reviewtext: So hot in the rooms and very little space between each bed making it feel cramped. Good location to Kings Cross St Pancras though and was fine for the two of us for one night!

name: Clink261
reviewtext:
Prime location 5mins walk to kings cross/st Pancras 
Good stayðŸ‘ðŸ¼

name: Clink261
reviewtext:
Extremely noisy hostels, bunk beds were packed, no space in between beds or even tried to get through to open the window!
Always constant noises, the doors for each room are so heavy, they made massive vibration and noises soon anyone opened the doors. Staff s rude when you asked question.
I totally do not recommend this hostel to my friends or any others 100% sure. Will not come back here even they offer cheap rate.

name: Clink261
reviewtext: So incredibly close to Kings Cross it was amazing. Arrived late, was no problem. Staff was very helpful and informative. Checked out early no problem there either. Room was tiny, could barely open my suit case. Incredibly hot as well but no where in Europe seems to have air conditioning so that was expected. Didn't spend much time here but made my train journey easy.

name: Clink261
reviewtext: This hostel does the trick and the breakfast for 2 euro is good. Location is good too. But there was ZERO ventillation and it was 30Â° out. They had even blocked the window in the dorm with the beds. The rooms were way too crowded (we were tripping over each others bags in the dorm due to lack of storage space) to be comfortable or bearable temperature wise durring the summer months. Plus the heats blocks everyones sinuses and leads to snorring. Also I suggest showering at night to avoid a cue.

name: Clink261
reviewtext: It would be better if the ladder to the upper bunker bed is a normal one instead of the fancy. And it would be better if there was a air conditioning system installed in the room too.

name: Clink261
reviewtext: Awesome place to stay. It was clean, there were good bathroom facilites, a good kitchen and each bed had a light and usb ports. Close to King's Cross station. Free luggage storage. If you're looking for a more social hostel, I would recommend visiting or staying at their sister hostel - I went there to watch the football game that was on and ended up meeting loads of people and having a really good time.

name: Clink261
reviewtext: The hostel is really well located, 10 minutes walk from king's cross Station. The staff was really nice and helpful.

name: Clink261
reviewtext:
We stayed for 3 days and had no problems at all. The first morning we tried the breakfast which is good value for the money!
Location: As we arrived at St Pancras it was just a 5-7 min walk to the hostel. So you'll have really good connections to everywhere from king's cross/st pancras. 
The atmosphere was good and the staff really nice.
The only thing we didn't like was that one man stayed in the hostel and we weren't sure if he was a guest. nothing happened but it was a bit weird though...

name: Clink261
reviewtext: Couldn't be in the common room area while the cleaners were around half the day! Otherwise really good!

name: Clink261
reviewtext: Decent hostel near King's Cross station.

name: Clink261
reviewtext: Great value for money. Nothing extraordinary. Decent bathroom conditions. Average atmosphere.

name: Clink261
reviewtext: The room is a little stuffy at night but everything else is perfect. The staff are super friendly too.

name: Clink261
reviewtext: Staff were very helpful and the security was excellent. The room was very small with not a lot of space for luggage. Would stay again for a night or two but not long term.

name: Hostel One Notting Hill
reviewtext: The location is nice and the people are friendly. The showers on the top floor are very nice. However, the rest of the bathrooms are closet-like and perpetually wet and a little smelly as a result of their size and age. The downstairs hangout area is lovely until someone drops a pen/boils the kettle/opens their mouth/makes literally any noise, at which point it becomes a headache-inducing echo chamber. A fantastic failure of architectural design. The WiFi was hardly working down there, either.

name: Hostel One Notting Hill
reviewtext: Staff are very friendly and helpful! I arrived quite early before check in and they let me put my bag in their locked luggage storage before I could check in. The nightly free dinner is a great way to save some money, but also to meet people in the hostel and start playing games and group up for a night out. I would definitely stay here again!!

name: Hostel One Notting Hill
reviewtext: Fantastic alround!  I was so happy I even extended my stay.

name: Hostel One Notting Hill
reviewtext: Not my favourite hostel. Comfortable enough but the room was very small (although I expected this in London). There weren't enough toilets (maybe one toilet for every floor which served multiple rooms). The bathrooms had been recently renovated but not very practical - unisex bathrooms with showers that had no lock and a slightly frosted glass door. No privacy and no changing space so all your clothes got wet! Bathrooms were dirty every time I used them and no toilet paper in the mornings.

name: Hostel One Notting Hill
reviewtext: Great family atmosphere which is helped by the really chill staff!
