The dinners each night are a nice addition and make it very easy to meet others to go out with afterwards if you're up for it. Unlike pretty much every other hostel in London, there are no creepy old dudes so it's the place to be if you're looking for a laff!

name: Hostel One Notting Hill
reviewtext: Love the new spot! & the people that work there are amazing. Great neighborhood. Stay here if you have the chance!

name: Hostel One Notting Hill
reviewtext: Only stayed for one night but I will definitely be back based off this experience. Everything has been recently refurbished and all the furnishings are brand new. The staff were super friendly and helpful. The amount of room in the 8-person dorm is fairly standard with not a huge amount of space for bags, etc. This hostel has a great common area where everyone hangs out and where a lot choose to park up for the free dinner each night. All in all a great experience and would recommend.

name: Hostel One Notting Hill
reviewtext:
This was one of the best hostel I've stayed in, period. It was just opened a few weeks ago, and looks & feels brand new. Good new comfortable beds, brand new showers and toilets (shower probably the best I've seen in a hostel), free dinner. And the staff is great and lots of fun :)

PS: If you happen to see some reviews on google maps - those are for a different hostel that used to be there, with a different name & owners. I got a bit scared first, but this is an awesome new hostel. :)

name: Hostel One Notting Hill
reviewtext:
What a treat! 

Start to finish - I couldn't be more impressed. The competent staff, comfy beds, and great social atmosphere were on point. The newness of the facilities made it feel like a hotel! 

Definitely made some great friends during my 10-day stint here. One of the staff members, Ryan, went above and beyond by adding me on the facebook, and writing me a lovely goodbye post. Made me feel all the loves. Too bad I couldn't fit him in my suitcase - until next time!

name: Hostel One Notting Hill
reviewtext:
This is not a great hostel. The staff were really lovely- only positive. 
I had to ask for a key to my room and the next two people who checked in to my room didn't get one because they couldn't find any more. The rooms are tiny and cramped with basically no room. There was one toilet on our floor which you could barely get into to close the door. Noisy until the early hours. Uncomfortable beds. Showers with no locks. Very unclean generally (weird marks on the walls etc). 70 stairs and no lift.

name: Hostel One Notting Hill
reviewtext: Amazing stay. Such lovely staff and perfect location, the place was beautiful aswell with great facilities, I just wish I had longer here !!

name: Hostel One Notting Hill
reviewtext: This hostel has a special place in my heart- highly recommend if you're looking for somewhere to stay in London because the staff are so incredibly nice and the location is perfect!

name: Hostel One Notting Hill
reviewtext: We spent an amazing time there. The staff is super, they help you in every possible way and they are nice and funny. Dinners are tasty and the neighbourhood is incredible.

name: Hostel One Notting Hill
reviewtext: Really pleased with my stay in this brand new hostel. Liam and Vanessa were very helpful and the new showers were a nice little luxury. Will be staying again next time I'm in London.

name: Hostel One Notting Hill
reviewtext:
Great location near some of the best neighbourhoods to start exploring.
Near food and other things that stay open pretty late.
Really friendly staff make you feel welcome the moment you walk in the door and even spend some time socializing when off shift.
The facilities are definitely some of the cleanest I've seen.
Overall a great visit.

name: Hostel One Notting Hill
reviewtext: Just opened!! The brand new showers put mine to shame. I was there for two nights and I can't express how welcoming the staff. They have a free dinner for guests at 8 pm every night that caters to vegan and vegetarians and it's a great time to meet other backpackers before a night out. And a hella nice patio!! Only a minutes walk to a grocery if you'd like to cook in the kitchen, or go to Hyde park or Kensington palace or hop on the tube. 12/10 would recommend again!!

name: Hostel One Notting Hill
reviewtext: Can't complain! This place was great. The people and staff were fun. Wish I had been in London for longer so I could have stayed here more nights!

name: Hostel One Notting Hill
reviewtext: I stayed an amazing 8 days. Located in a great area with local amenities. But the best part was the staff and the people we socialized with. We did drinking games and went out to cut some sweet shapes (dancing) and you get free dinner.. I mean who doesn't like free food. LINE UP PEOPLE!

name: Hostel One Notting Hill
reviewtext: I spent the weekend in London and had such a great time at this hostel. The room, bathrooms, kitchen/living area are all spotless and the beds are super comfy. Perfect location right by the tube, bus stops, Hyde Park and Portobello Rd. Most importantly the staff are so helpful and friendly and made my weekend so much fun. A special shout out to Emma, Liyam, Mark and Ryan - what a guy! If you're staying in London 10/10 stay here!

name: Hostel One Notting Hill
reviewtext: This hostel is seriously the best! Dinner was included every night and honestly it was so good, how can you say no to a delicious home cooked meal! It was a very social hostel with new showers and a great vibe. The staff really are the most friendliest people. They go above and beyond to ensure you have a good time!! :)

name: Hostel One Notting Hill
reviewtext: Great hostel in Notting hill walking distance  to underground's and really friendly helpful staff. New shower room and bathrooms always clean and tidy As well as the room and bed itself. Thank you

name: Hostel One Notting Hill
reviewtext:
Very old and teared down hostel!!!
Not even deserve the value og quarter of what I paid per night!!!

name: Hostel One Notting Hill
reviewtext: A very friendly and welcoming hostel.  Small rooms and the staff made an effort to include all guests.  Renovations and improvements are clearly being done and the kitchen area is great.  Recommended.

name: Hostel One Notting Hill
reviewtext: Amazing atmosphere, friendly & fun staff and great location! Will definitely be visiting again!

name: Hostel One Notting Hill
reviewtext:
Clean, comfortable and freshly renovated Hostelone Notting Hill was a great experience during carnival!
Drinking games got the whole house involved and in the carnival spirit and free dinners were a nice opportunity to meet fellow guests and volunteers. 
Excellent value for money.

name: Hostel One Notting Hill
reviewtext:
This hostel is clearly the best hostel that I've seen in London ! 
The staff is a bunch of young people who are fun and caring (probably even too much). 

Everything's brand new (the guests have to be respectful and clean after themselves to keep this place amazingly clean and pleasant). 

Spacious common areas. Kitchen. Fridges to save your food. 24/7 assistance ...

Close to Notting Hill Station, Hyde Park ... Buses ... Shops ... 
Thanks guys. Xxx

name: Hostel One Notting Hill
reviewtext: The staff are super friendly and helpful. Free dinner every night and they cooked a vegan dish tooðŸ˜Š

name: Hostel One Notting Hill
reviewtext:
If you are thinking about staying here do not hesitate!
The hosts are absolute legends and the facilities are prime. If you wanna party this is the place but if you fancy chilling then it's also all good.
Right in the heart of Notting Hill Gate, all the attractions are in walking distance.
Be here right now and you won't regret.
Please do your self a favour and stay here!

name: Hostel One Notting Hill
reviewtext: Stayed for 4 nights with 2 friends at hostel one in Notting hill. Not usually one for reviews but the place is spot on, I couldn't fault it one bit. It has everything you'd expect and more for such a low price over probably the busiest weekend in the calendar for the local area (Notting hill carnival). Staff are excellent and always on hand should you need them and the hostel itself is just a nice place to be. 10/10 from me.

name: Hostel One Notting Hill
reviewtext:
Stayed for just a night but was really impressed with their new showers and common area. The staff were super nice and gave me a great recommendation for lunch down the road. 
Really sad I did not have time ro stay at this hostel for longer.

name: Hostel One Notting Hill
reviewtext: I absolutely love this new hostel one location! It is 2 min from the tube and an easy ride in to downtown. The common area is brand new and super open, it is the perfect spot to hang out and make new friends. My favorite part is the free dinner which is made for you and everyone sits at a table and socializes. The beds are super comfy, the showers are also brand new, and can't forget about the great staff, which is super helpful. Would definitely recommend.

name: Hostel One Notting Hill
reviewtext: Lovely staff.  Got a warm welcome, a wake up call and even tips on what to do in Denmark when I head over there soon.  Staff make or break a business and this hostel has the best.

name: Hostel One Notting Hill
reviewtext: Fantastic hostel, great staff that are knowledgeable and fun, and an overall great experience. Definitely recommend staying when in London.

name: Hostel One Notting Hill
reviewtext: Cool garden and common room to hang out. All new equipment in the kitchen which was a nice touch and they cook a free dinner everynight which was suprisingly really tasty

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: Nice staff, friendly vibe, cool people. Sheets can be newer!

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext:
Great experience. Best location in town close to the British museum. Walking distance to Covent garden and others.

Separate building two blocks away for cheaper rates. Enough toilets and bathroom but quite simply facilitated.

Adaptor and lock rented with deposit. Keycard secured.

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: My brother and I have been to many hostels in London and all over Europe and this is our favorite one! Amazing location and the staff there are so great. Highly recommend!

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: In Hostelworld checkin time was mentioned as 7.00 in morning. We were travelling night. So we thought it will be nice if we got early morning checkin. We booked and at the day in hostel they told check in not possible in morning. They said it's 2.00 in afternoon. That was little disappointment. Otherwise staff and hostel is good to stay.

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: Such an amazing hostel and where I always stay when I visit London, it pretty much feels like a second home at this stage. The staff are absolutely amazing and organise events every night, most of them also live in the hostel which helps to add to the social and chill atmosphere. The hostel is also very secure (I always stay in the 16bed dorm and never need to worry) and in a perfect very central location, getting to anywhere in London is always easy from here. Can't wait to come back again :)

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext:
Very saggy mattresses and thin pillows (all mattresses in my room were visibly worn).
No individual power outlets or lights at the beds. 
Shared toilet is 2 or 3 floors down, some showers lack enough hooks to hang stuff, no towels/hand dryers in the toilets.
And if I book a mixed room as a girl, I do not expect to be put in a 6-bed room with 5 men in it. This is a men's room and not a mixed room. Not cool. 
The charity breakfast is a great idea!

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext:
Location couldn't be better - walking distance to two tube stations, British museum just in front, and shopping nearby!
The area is very safe. Staff was very nice and helpful, and facilities are clean.
Only downside is that there are not enough showers/toilets for the amount of people, and Building 2 can be is noisy at night.
However, in general, it is a nice place to stay.

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: Really nice hostel in terms of atmosphere, location and value. I ended up coming back after staying at a different hostel. Very helpful and knowledgeable staff. Feels home-y and was super easy to meet other travelers. Actually preferred the larger dorms in the "basic" building as it felt less cramped but definitely not an issue either way. They also have a charity breakfast which is a great idea and pretty decent. Would stay again, thanks guys!

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: First time staying in a hostel, really happy I stayed at Astor Museum. Met really nice, cool people, helpful staff, and clean bathrooms.

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: Overall, I have enjoyed my stay. Staff and people were amazing and friendly.

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: Great location.

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: Terrific location which makes getting anywhere in London city simple, right next to British museum giving you the option (since it's a free museum) to easily explore a different part of it over short periods on multiple days. Staff were friendly and welcoming and very approachable/easy to talk to and hang out with and good atmosphere for meeting new people. Very comfortable beds for a hostel and clean rooms. Would recommend staying here!

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: Staff recommended people eat at Pret. Why.

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: Staying at the Astor Museum Hostel transformed a normal holidays into an amazing experience. Oscar, Hugo and all the staff at the Hostel did their best to make guests feel comfortable. Absolutely nothing wrong with this place. Highly recommendable. I will go there soon for sure.

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: Absolutely nothing wrong with this place. Atmosphere is so great, beds are comfy and clean, kitchen has everything you need, breakfast is cheap and great, night time activities are fun, parks surrounding the hostel, easy to catch the tube into the city, grocery store and great pubs very close by, bathrooms were always clean, really great crowd of people there, and staff was so friendly and helpful. Made some great friends and had an amazing time. Great for solo travellers.Thanks Astor Museum Inn

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: I had an excellent time here. Staff were friendly informative and helpful. Security was excellent and made you feel safe. Overall a good stay.

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: Astor's Museum Hostel is in the most perfect location, which makes sightseeing around London easy especially for those on a time crunch. The hostel has the most helpful and knowledgeable staff who made awesome restaurant and sightseeing recommendations. This hostel has an amazing industrial-style kitchen, which is perfect for cooking. I stayed in the 16-bed dorm and found the room to be spacious enough with linens provided. Overall, the hostel had a good atmosphere and was very sociable.

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: This was a great hostel, the staff were super nice and accommodating. The facilities are small (but its central London) but clean. The second building was very quiet, but the main building had a great atmosphere with lots of people just hanging out. I would stay here again.

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: The room in the basement does make you feel comfortable .

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: The best hostel I've ever been! It has the right services compared to the price, but it has such a good atmosphere. The staff and the other travelers are so friendly and sociable. All this sociality is manly caused by the small and lovely shared rooms, I guess. If you are traveling, especially solo, go to this hostel and stay in the shared rooms. The best experience I've ever had in a hostel. It was like home!

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: It's a super cosy hostel.. still maintaining what hostels are for, home away from home. Not commercialised like other hostels which ask for money for every small thing. Staff is cool and location is quite central.

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: Great stay and met some cool people!

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext:
A really great stay! I enjoyed staying at the hostel but the beds and dorm rooms were kind of small and uncomfortable, especially for the price.  Great atmosphere though! Also most bathrooms are upstairs which is annoying if you are staying downstairs.

Staff were terrific!

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: Services should be better. Specially in rooms. Individual shelves in each bed. Plugs. Etc

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: The 8-bed dorm I was in was a bit cramped, but the hostel was clean, in a good location, and had nice community spaces. I would stay here again.

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext:
The location was great as was the atmosphere and staff. However there was no window screen stopping bugs or other things from getting inside. I was attacked by a bird, whilst using the bathroom. It was not pleasant. 

Also one power strip per room so there's little to no security when charging electronics.

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: Great hostel!  Close to tube and bus stations to get you into the heart of London where many major landmarks are, but nice and quiet in the evenings.  Right across the street from the British Museum.  All of the facilities and rooms were very clean at all hours of the day.  Very friendly staff as well.  You can even label your food and keep it in the refrigerators and cabinets.  Finally, the hostel even let me store my luggage in their storage room for the entire day after I checked out.

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: The cheaper building is about five minutes walk from the main building, where the kitchen is.  Highly appreciated the free milk provided.  Walking distance to West End theaters and right across the street from British Museum.  Nearest tube about ten minutes walk.  I watched them vacuum but still found wads of hair in the carpet and the beds weren't very comfy.  Lockable bins under the bed for valuables.  Steep and narrow stairs plus tiny landings made moving luggage difficult.

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: Staff was friendly, but not really enough facilities for the amount of people. 2 of the toilets were clogged during my stay, there was no air con in a room with 14 so it was pretty hot. Nice location, good value for what you get.

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: This hostel was in a great location and was well maintained but what made it a really great experience was the lovely staff. Truly a very fun bunch of people. I'll be staying here again when in downtown London.

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: I usually stay at bnb or hotel, but the experience at Astor museum hostel is so wonderful that I would definitely come back again. Great location, very clean, friendly staff, awesome roommates, and they have different themes fun gathering within the hostel Monday to Sunday! (Like Wine and cheese Monday) And I do feel safe in this district as a female solo traveler. Highly recommend this hostel to everyone!

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: Small hostel, I did get to chat with some people. But there were no events happening in the several days I was there and people kept to themselves. Laundry was cheap though!

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: If you're stationed in their second building in one of the dorms, the scarcity of toilets/showers is a real pain â€” for brushing teeth etc, your options are the one sink in the room or one of the tiny sinks in the rare and elusive toilets. There's also a distinct lack of power outlets in the dorms. If you're only staying for a night or so and have a powerbank on hand, it's fine. Staff are very helpful and knowledgeable, location is great, breakfast is simple and great value.

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: Location is pretty good. About a 15 min walk to major areas. No better location for the British museum. Facilities were kind of meh. crammed shower and sink areas. The setup of the place does not have very open hang out areas.

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext:
There are organised events almost every day like free dinner or a Rallye around town. Breakfast is 1Â£ which goes to charity. The staff was amazing, always very nice and helpful. 
Rooms and facilities weren't always completely clean and the hostel has a very strickt no-food policy in the rooms which means that the staff controlled our room while we weren't there and then we had to take out our fruit-infused water even though the bottles were still closed.

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: I had a brief stop in London and staying here really let me make the most of my time. The staff gave good advice about the area, it's amazing how much is within walking distance, and the other travelers were friendly but the rooms were quiet and there wasn't a wait for a bathroom in the morning. Breakfast is limited but it only costs a pound that goes to charity. Don't be afraid to ask the staff for help with bags if you're on a high floor, you'll be glad you did and they're very accommodating.

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: Absolutely fantastic. Will now only be staying here on my visits to London. The staff and atmosphere were extremely welcoming and the whole hostel has a very low key vibe to it. Great to just chill out and meet people, but also enough going on to meet some friends to party with later in the night as well. The location is great, just 5 minutes or less from Russell Sq, so super easy to get around town for sights/food, etc.

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: Love this hostel, the location and facilities are amazing. Really social atmosphere and the staff are super friendly!

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: Great Hostel with amazing staff. They take your wishes and concerns seriously. Further the hostel has really nice common rooms to chill with others and there are activities from the hostel on a daily basisi.

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: Great staff and good atmosphere, included free dinner and activities ! Great area near the underground; but very noisy at night. No plugs near the beds.

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: Facilities could use an update especially for keeping electronic devices secure while charging.

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: Not bad overall but not my best hostel experience in terms of cleanliness of beds (but overall the hostel is kept pretty clean - the bathrooms/shower stalls/etc.). It was just that the pillowcase smelled funky (perhaps they don't have dryers?) and the sheets had so much dust all over. On top of that, pretty much everywhere in the room seemed dust-ridden. The bed frames, wall hangers, etc.

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: Good location, affordable. Generally quiet at night. Guys at the hostel were very friendly and love the complimentary dinners over the weekend! Rooms and bathrooms are cleaned daily and linens were clean. Building is old and the rooms musty. The bunkbeds creak and shake if the other person moves. Arrived in the middle of the night after 30 hrs travel only to be turned away. Girl told me to leave the lounge area and wait in a nearby diner til morning. Wasn't happy about that.

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext:
A hostel in an excellent central location in London, with very forthcoming and open minded staff that will make an effort to make your stay as enjoyable as possible.
Facilities are good and cleaned regularly, and the hostel events are always good fun.

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: Great location, right in the center of London. Facilities were very secure and the WiFi was good. The staff were very friendly and were happy to accommodate and fix any problems that arise. The rooms were very clean and more spacious than other hostels I have stayed in.

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: This hostel is great as it is close to all London attractions. Very quiet and clean. Only negative is that the stairs are narrow and there is limited railing which makes it hard to get down stairs with heels.

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext:
I had a fantastic time at the Astor Inn! Staff was very helpful and were on top of everything. The dinners and hostel events were well attended and a great way to meet people! I made many friends and everyone was very welcoming.

Only complaint is that it was HOT, and there was no AC (which is common for London) there was only one fan per room. Maybe try to pick up a small fan of your own and you should be fine. 

Overall awesome location and an awesome time

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: Really great location, in a quiet part of town but close to a lot of tourist attractions. It was really, really clean. Would definitely stay again.

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: Hard to find a better location for a hostel. Almost everything worth seeing is half hour walk away. Staff were friendly and ready help you with any questions you had. The breakfast while basic, was only 1 pound and worth it for anyone try to save money on food. If I ever come back to London I know where I'm staying.

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: I really enjoyed my stay! I had a private room with a friend and we were on the top floor. Location is great: near the British Museum and the staff at Astor are really helpful.

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: Location is perfect. Right next to the British museum and walking distance to everything. The staff is super friendly and they plan things to do pretty much every night. Free dinner Tuesday-Friday was another great addition. My 6 person room was pretty tight size wise (couldn't walk by if someone had their storage bin out) and it was located above the courtyard so smelled like smoke sometimes. The kitchen was great but common room a tad small. Would stay again tho.

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: We only stayed overnight as we were catching a train out the next day. The rooms were spacious & had baskets underneath the bunks to lock your things away. Beds weren't too bad. Located in a nice area, public transport only a 5 minute walk. Overall was a very nice, clean friendly hostel.

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: Loved this hostel! Great staff, very friendly and helpful. The rooms were nice and everyone kept them pretty quiet and clean. Also really liked the location. Easy walk to where you needed to go. ðŸ‘

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: In all my life i always had bad perceptions of London, that all changed after i visited Astor, the staff are wonderful brilliant and funny, get stuck in, don't be shy all the staff are class and will look after you. listen to their advice and if you get a chance to party with them, then get ready for a hell of a night out. prepare your consciousness to expand beyond all recognition, to live a life of freedom, thanks to Reece LAUREN kaeman Oscar Elisa Ugo anet Irina Fillipo Cynthia. you the best!

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: Fantastic and beutiful location. Loved the staff, everyone was super friendly and helpful. Although I don't drink nearly as much as Londoners, and I don't smoke, it was really fun hanging out with everyone. I wish I had more time at in London, and I'll certainly be staying at the hostel the next time I'll be in London.

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext:
all of interactions and house rules are well thought out and efficient
even door stopper if want to leave room door ajar works well

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: Good staff, good free dinners!

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: I would absolutely return to this hostel!!! London was my first city on my first solo trip overseas but the people in this hostel made me so comfortable and excited to continue travelling. No, it is not a modern, upscale resort but that is not what these hostels are about. Every employee I interacted with was so helpful, kind, and genuinely wanted me to have a good time in London. The free meals and nightly activities were a great opportunity to meet other solo travelers in a chill atmosphere.

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: This hostel was so social and fun! One of the staff members named Cayman (I honestly have no idea how to spell it so I'm going to spell it like the island) took everyone out and we had a great time. They had free breakfast and dinner, and Cayman's dinners were delicious! I made a lot of new friends at this hostel and I would 100% recommend this place to anyone traveling alone. This was my first time traveling alone too, and I was really scared about what could happen. But this hostel was great!

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: GREAT PLACE TO STAY

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: One of the nicest hostel I've stayed at so far. Very convenient location. Within walking distance to bus stops and the underground. Staff are friendly and helpful. Clean. Comfortable. Nice. Would likely come back again.

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: Amazing hostel with even more amazing staff! The location was perfect aswell, close to everything.

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: Awesome place, awesome people! Highly recommend!

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: I stayed here for one night because I was flying out of London the next day, and I slept better than I was expecting to - but I still would probably not stay here again. The rooms are small and cramped (and pretty hot in the summer), the lobby smells like stale cigarettes, and I had to walk out into the hall and then up a set of stairs to use the toilet and take a shower. The upside is that it was pretty quiet while I was sleeping, and the woman working at the desk was nice and helpful.

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: There were some flaws, like the taps in the kitchen had leaks and the rooms didn't have enough outlets for all the people staying to charge their electronics and keep the very necessary fan working. But most of the staff were super helpful and nice, you cannot beat the location and it's quiet and peaceful, with lots of mingling activities. Definitely would stay there again.

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: Great location, staff, and the kitchen common room is great. Nightly events great for meeting people

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: Thought the location would be better based off reviews but in reality overall a great and safe place to stay! Staff was so kind !

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext:
The location is fine if you want to visit the British museum everyday but it's about a 10 minute walk to the nearest tube. 
Security was great and the staff were very kind. 
The only complaint I have is that there is one small fan to share with multiple people. Rooms got VERY hot.

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: Perfect location, almost on the doorstep of the British museum, and about a 30-45 minute walk from St Paul's in one direction, or Westminster in the other. You can't get much more central, but it still feels quite safe. Guests were friendly and noninvasive. The kitchen is small but very convenient, and there's a cute little patio area for folks wanting to sit in the open air.

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: I would definitely recommend the Astor Museum Hostel! The location is amazing, close to the tube but also walking distance to lots of attractions. The staff there are great - one bed seemed a little dirty when we checked in and they instantly cleaned the bed and changed the sheets for us. They're also super friendly! The beds and showers are very basic (which is why there's a bit lower rating for value for money)  but all very clean so can't complain. Would definitely stay again!

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: Perfect hostel! You have everything that you need

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext:
Our stay here was decent. 

Pros- 
1. Kitchen area.
2. Location wasn't bad(A few diff. metro locations close by, and walkable to sites).
3. Had bathrooms/showers on each floor.
4. Felt safe.

Cons- 
1. Room felt a little cramped for a 6 person bed in my opinion.
2. Started out with one fan then got a second.  
3. The lounge area near the reception area was so hot and small. 
4. The metal storage bins were EXTREMELY loud if someone was leaving in a hurry. 
5. Two extension cords powering stuff

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: The staff in this hostel were amazing. They were friendly, helpful, and attentive. I stayed here for my first ever visit in London, and this place made it great. The only slight issue I had was with the narrow stairs that lead up to the fourth floor--just part of the building, but were difficult to navigate with packs. Otherwise, wonderful!

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: I really enjoyed my stay. It was my first experience at a hostel and the experience here really knocked it out of the park. The staff is super friendly and kind. I highly recomend this place to everyone. But if I could make one suggestion to make your stay a little more pleasant is to bring a good set of headphones for those late nights.

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: The location was absolutely fantastic! The staff were wonderfully helpful and friendly. The dorms and showers were clean and functional. There was even free printing available!

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: Great location, super friendly staff, had almost all "hostel amenities" that make staying there easier

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: Great hostel. Great location. Great staff.

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: Best location, most uncomfortable beds I have ever slept on, expensive for what it is

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: Great location & staff. Felt safe and secure.

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: Good hostel, but the rooms are incredibly hot in the summer. Only one fan in each room and someone will always hog it. No individual outlets at the ends, just power strips on the ground. I had my stuff unplugged during the night and someone took the power cord. Rest of the hostel was alright, small sitting room, big kitchen area with outdoor seating. Not much in terms of environment, organized events were minimal. Overall not a terrible stay, but I wouldn't stay there again, sleeping was awful.

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: I had a great stay at the hostel. Was only there for a night but everything was perfect. Loved the neighborhood and the hostel was nice and clean, as well as quiet at night, which was greatly appreciated :)

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: Pretty nice place with a really good, nice staff. Rooms need fans and more plugs though. Overall, good place.

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: 16 person dorms are hot but the location and staff cannot be beat! Especially good for young people looking to meet others and have fun.

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: Amazing location; atmospheric, characterful building; excellent, friendly, attentive staff; comfortable beds & all necessary amenities. I'll be back!

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: Staff was great, a bit cramped, the shower plugged after a couple minutes and smelled like seweage but it was an amazing location so it didn't really bother me. Not a big common area but everyone was very friendly. I would stay there again.

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: No AC and one small fan in a 10 bed dorm makes this a perfect winter and fall hostel, not a summer one though. As well, two showers were out of order so there was effectively one bathroom down in the basement area. Not a bad hostel, but not the best. Great location though

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: Expensive but that's London, better than most other hostels there so you get what you pay for I guess

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: Great hostel! Lovely ambiance, very clean, the staff is super kind, friendly and available; the position is amazing (5 minutes from Soho)! Nice breakfast for only one pound! I had such a great experience! I would advise this hostel to everybody! I've been in many hostel here in London but this one was the best! If you also go alone 100% you are going to make friends!

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: Overall great place, but we didn't know we'd be staying in the extension a couple streets over.  It was still a great stay, but it was a bit inconvenient if you forget things, and they do nicely provide a LOT of stuff for free.  We really appreciated the fan in the room!

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: Perfectly fine for a short stay.

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: Great location, but uncomfortable showerhead and weak water pressure

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: Been to lots of hostels in my time, and this one really impressed me. Friendly staff, super-clean, nice facilities and very central. Enjoyed my stay, and will stay again for my next trip to London.

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: The lace was really nice. Nicely located across the road from the British museum. Rooms were really small and showers we few. Not a horrible place to stay

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: I had a wonderful stay. Very centrally located for all the London sites. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Beds were a little uncomfortable, but I wasn't there to sleep all day.

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: Tbh for what you pay this place is perfect. The location is right in the heart of the city with a 5 min walk to soho clubs or chill out in a nice park up the road. Its not a luxury hostel but none of that matters when you meet the people. The staff are incredible, you honestly feel like part of a family. Over my stay of 2 weeks I made life long friends. The staff are super friendly and the owners need to invest more into this place. Shout out to Gary!

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext: Great location. Really friendly staff. Didn't get a chance to hang out in common room, but seemed like it had a good social scene. Bit expensive but seems to be the going rate in London. Also semi annoying that you cannot have any food inside the rooms, but the upside is that everything is super clean! Would stay again. Feels quite safe for a solo female traveller.

name: Astor Museum Inn
reviewtext:
Great perks like free WiFi, lockers with locks to rent, very safe, good location, clean. Never had to wait for a shower. Pretty much everything you could ask for.
The room I stayed in was very cramped, but its basically an old house converted to hostel so there's nothing to be done there. And if you're going to be exploring the city most of the day you won't have to worry about it.
I would definitely recommend this hostel, but keep in mind I haven't stayed at any others in London.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Good location and price for London. Bathrooms were generally clean. But the rooms are very smelly as other reviewers have said so I didn't want to stay any longer than a couple of nights. Just comes with the territory of such a large hostel with lots of people in each room. Not my favorite hostel in terms of atmosphere but definitely not a bad hostel if you need a bed!

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: The staff was very friendly and it was a great location to explore London but the wifi didn't work for 24 hours which made planning our day difficult. The room keys didn't work for our entire stay either which was kind of annoying but the trip was still awesome.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext:
Super clean, friendly staff, location was okay but not great

Overall: I'd recommend and stay again.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Brilliant hostel, lives up to the St Christophers high standard. Amazing staff and the bar is awesome.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: I loved the location, close proximity to the underground station and all eateries. It was clean for a hostel despite the many guests present. The room was quite and breakfast was ok. Very cost effective and would stay at the hostel again should I visit London. Perfect place for short duration..was there for 2 nights.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: The place was good, staff friendly, cool bar scene. My only issue was the room i stayed it smelled, probably the backpackers that i was sharing it with, smelled of foot odor and body odor overwhelmed the room. You would think people have common courtesy to wash their feet, or leave shoes outside door but they don't, was going to extend but got Airbnb instead. Beside that issue overall ok.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext:
Hostel was lovely. Definitely more of a party hostel though which personally isn't my thing. The volume in the bar downstairs was tolerable for the first two nights but on the last night it was just ridiculously loud until about 2 in the
Morning. Overall the hostel is very clean and well run. And location is perfect.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Great hostel, the nightly pub crawls were awesome

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Hostel was great apart from the cleaners shouting outside room at 8:20

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Honestly it was great. Price was good and everything was clean. It's a chain hostel so its bigger but they have a chill area to meet people. There's a bar attached which since I was on the 3rd floor I couldn't hear it. Location was perfect, right by the Borough market and by London bridge. Would definitely stay here again if it was a good price again- but I'd book direct for free breakfast.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Fairly clean hostel, easy to find and nice staff. I was impressed for my first stay in a hostel, only stayed 1 night as I was just passing through but have booked to stay here again when back in London, hopefully to get more involved in the atmosphere.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: The staff are so polite and helpful 24 hours a day. The room and the bathroom was clean. The food in the bar downstairs is delicious and the staff there are very nice as well. The only thing I can complain about is I checked in online and the site says that you can skip the line by going to the online desk at check in. There wasn't an online desk and I had to wait in a long line upon check in. That being said,  it didn't ruin my experience and I'll definitely book this hostel chain again.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: This is a good hostel to just essentially sleep in,especially if you are a solo traveler. It's a very big hostel, it's very hard to meet anyone there. One thing I didn't like is that I was on a 3 level bunk, I didn't even know that these exist,and of course I was all the way on the top, and my bed was not made when I came back after a day out in the city, while everyone else's was. That being said,other than the atmosphere and fuzzy room description, the staff was nice and the location was good.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: This was my first hostel experience and I really enjoyed it. There is a fun bar downstairs and they have a pub crawl every night that I highly recommend to meet people. Only issues are that it's on a busy road so at night when there's less traffic people SPEED down the road making a lot of noise. Also, the beds are a bit rickety. Besides that it was a great experience and would recommend.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Excellent hostel, in a great location and great value for money!

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Loved my stay! Clean, cheap, good location. I didn't find it terribly social, however I also didn't go hang out in the communal area so that could be in large part why. Would definitely stay again :)

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext:
We had a decent experience at St. Christopher's in London. Lockers were located in the room and the bathroom was clean. The staff were nice enough. Pretty standard, but the location is great. We used the metro system to get everywhere and it's right by the London Bridge stop. 

On the downside, we were in the mixed 12 person room and the bunk beds are in stacks of 3 so you can't even sit up in bed comfortably. Also, there appeared to be streaks of vomit on the bunk curtain above mine... eww.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: The staff were wonderful to me, but my bedroom was not a good situation. Another gentleman in my room started yelling and cursing at me in the middle of the night, because I woke up with a coughing fit. I didn't feel comfortable being in the same room as him, so I stayed in the lounge area until sunrise.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Great stay and value!

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: This building is packed!! Plusses and minuses to this, but overall I enjoyed my stay. Very easy for a solo backpacker, nice to just drop stuff off and sleep pretty much. It is in central london, right next to borough market!

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Decent hostel but not much atmosphere, 33 bed dorms were too much to deal with

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: I'm hoping there was construction going on. Almost every bathroom on my floor had something wrong with it and out of order signs were everywhere. Showers were constantly dirt, wet and covered in hair. Room was nice and I appreciated the curtains around the bunk. Staff was amazing. No kitchen or real hangout space sucked a it bout outdoor terrace was nice. Did appreciate having to pay for lockers since there is no luggage storage if you arrive early or leave late.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext:
Had such a good stay at this hostel! 100% recommend! 
Good vibe, good location, rooms are spacious with access to lots of toilets.
Also the hostel provides you with free washing and drying which is so good! 
You had to pay for a baggage locker when you check out and wanted to leave your stuff for a few hours which I thought was quite annoying but overall so so good!

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: One of the best hostels I've ever stayed at. I enjoyed the spacious rooms, luggage drawers, privacy curtain on the bed, reading light, and outlet panel. Friendly staff and good vibes from other guests. Excellent location. Only downside is no kitchen, but there's a fridge & microwave and a grocery store across the street as well as many nearby places to eat. Definitely a party hostel and can be loud but it didn't bother me. Will definitely stay again! Also book direct for free breakfast.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Staff were super awesome and very friendly. Location was good, close to the metro and easy to find. Good amenities. Only down side was that they charged for many things such as rental for adapter, or storing luggage. "free breakfast" is advertised as a selling point but it does not count for those who book on hostelworld.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: So I want to start off by saying that the front desk staff and the value were awesome! The hostel was disgusting though. The first thing I saw when I went up to my room was a used condom right next to my bed. So it wasn't cleaned up before I checked in. Half of the toilets and showers we're out of order, and the whole place smelled like mold.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: We stayed in a twin room with en suite for one night. I wish we'd had the chance to stay longer, because this was one of the nicer places that we got to stay. Check in was easy. You need to pay for the keys but you get the money back upon check out. Our bathroom smelled strongly of vinegar probably from the cleaning stuff. It was very handy! And the other bathrooms were right outside our room. The beds were hard and the blankets tiny but they did the trick. Love the chargers built in!

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Overall pretty good hostel, I would stay here again, however not in the 12 bedroom dorm probably a smaller bed dorm due to having an extremely small room filled with 12 people and on the top bunk of a 3 bed bunk bed! Location was great, 5 minute walk to the London bridge. Was relatively clean but the bathrooms could of been cleaned more often! It would be handy if there was a kitchen!

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext:
I've been in a lot of hostels around the world and this was one of the most disappointing places I've stayed. 
- Pictures not accurate with the real dorm (33 dorm triple bunks).
- Few bathrooms, some out of service and not clean.
- They clean at 8.00 am, very unfortunate if you need a bathroom before check out.
- Chill out room has a super dirty microwave, a small fridge and the kettle does not work, so forget about coffee. 
- Luggage storage cost 3.50 per day or per hour.
- > Below expectations

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: This hostel was incredible! My rooms were clean, the bathrooms were clean, and it was so conveniently located for touring and the nightlife. I'll definitely be coming back here next time in London!

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: I really enjoyed my stay at St. Christopher's, but be aware that it is a party hostel. There is a loud bar downstairs but I stayed on the third floor so wasn't bothered by the noise. Very social hostel; met a ton of really cool people in the "chill room" and down at the bar. Had a great time on the hostel offered bar crawl! Plus it was the perfect location for sight seeing!

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: It was an alright stay however not worth what you pay. The whole area where the rooms and bathrooms are is very claustrophobic. There are no taps to fill bottles in the accomodation, you have to go to the bar downstairs which became annoying. The bathrooms were somewhat clean however in the toilet cubicles there was no ventilation so they smelt like diarrhoea 100% of the time, I was gagging in there. Pillows and mattress quite good. We booked a private room and liked the kettle, window, and A/C

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: The staff and atmosphere  was amazing but the bathrooms were horrible!! very small, very dirty and hair was all over the place. Would not recommend if clean bathrooms are important to you

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: I should never believe what people write as reviews. The hostel is decent but nothing special really. Nothing. The 3 level bunk beds are not comfortable and too many people cramped in the rooms, and the app wasnt clear when i wanted the pods but they put me in that horrible room instead i actually left away to another hostel because i couldnt stand it. Even the bathrooms dont have any amenities i mean come on even in 3rd world hostels youll find some shampoo at least how cheap can you be! Never

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Overall good experience! Good to note the pods in the pictures are only in the larger dorm rooms. Rooms were clean as well as bathrooms and showers. Lack of kitchen made it very expensive. There is a microwave upstairs. The free laundry is a great added bonus. About 30 minute walk to the main area which is nice but also close transport. Not too much of an atmosphere in the actual hostel part but there is a bar in the downstairs. Also to note you have to pay 3.50 for luggage storage.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: The best hostel i've been to. Super clean and tidy. The location is amazing. Only bad thing was breakfast. I had a coupon that i bought online when i booked. It was for a cooked breakfast and a drink. I went to the bar and ordered pancakes and a cappuccino. The drink was given to me immediately but after a hour and a half i still didn't have pancakes. I complained and the guy first got mad at me because it wasn't his fault  then when i asked for a refund he literally threw the money at me. Rude

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Wished the bathrooms had been cleaned more frequently, people are so messy but overall a good place to stay.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Very good hostel. In a good location less than 5 mins to train station. Pod beds are amazing. Good bar downstairs, showed AFL when it was on. Only thing I didn't like was the bar/club was open to the public, which made it hard to meet other travellers.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext:
Disclaimer: new to hostels + London, so hard to really properly compare.

I stayed in a 9-bed dorm and was pretty surprised at just how cramped it was. It was also surprisingly difficult to find much in the way of tasty food nearby that wasn't extremely crowded. Only shared areas seemed to be a small, packed 'chill room'. Laundry wasn't particularly practical given only 1-2 machines for a few hundred people. Breakfast was quite dull and I had to pay Â£3 for it since I booked through Hostelworld.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext:
Nice hostel, nice location (between to the Borough Market + underground stop). The rooms were nice and they give out free ear plugs. The in hostel bar wasn't 
 expensive either during happy hour. Would come back

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext:
Not bad a place, not a great place. Decent, clean facilities albeit without a kitchen, huge emphasis on discount alcohol instead. The doors here constantly slam so easily, it's really easy to get woken up and feel the walls shaking from it. 

I feel like this being such a big hostel with five floors worth of people staying, the majority of people do their own thing and stick to themselves. Large city hostels tend to be this way, I find. Not a complaint, just an observation...

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Best hostel I've stayed in hands down the bar is good and the location is amazing. 2 supermarkets within a 1 minute walk.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Amazing price, location and friendly staff. Checked in at 3AM and they had no problem with it, would recommed 100%

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: The air conditioner all night made me sick. My head was going explote the next day.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: We went to 4 different hostels while in London and this was definitely the best one. Even though our plan was to keep hopping around we wound up coming back to this one after seeing some of the others.  The price is excellent although the breakfast is pretty terrible. My only complaints are that one of the toilets had a leak so there was a puddle of pee behind it and if you're in a large room, 33 person, top bunk be prepared to be women by the skylight and having that in your face. Overall great

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Great area and facility. Very close to London & Tower Bridge and The Borough Market. Close to public transportation, restaurants/bars and shopping. Staff was awesome too!

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: The pod bed was great! Gave plenty of privacy, especially in a 33 person dorm. This place is definitely a party hostel but because of that it is very noisy, especially on the weekend. Loud music does not bother me but the constant in and out of noisy drunk people was very annoying. There was also a "chill out" room which is very small but the patio area was great for a quick lunch or drink t night. There is also a fridge to put your food in but unfortunately it is just a mini fridge.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext:
Amazing staff especially the aussies;) 
Great bathrooms, comfty beds and a two minute walk to London bridge/London bridge metro station:) 
No self catering but you get good deals with the bar/cafe which shares the building with the hostel.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Everything perfect

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Much better location than I expected given the price. Great facilities and very friendly staff, one of them took the time to help me figure out how to get to the airport from there. Would absolutely stay again

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: We booked thinking we would be staying in capsules, given the large number of people in our room, but we were wrong. Regardless, this hostel has a very cool bar attached to it where those staying at the hostel get a discount. We had 33 people in our room, but it felt like under 10 because of the private curtains for each bed. Would definitely stay here again.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext:
Stay here if you're looking for a good party hostel! It's a good place to meet people, and the bar downstairs gets pretty fun after midnight. Depending on which room you're in you may find it hard  to sleep due to the loud music. 
The hostel is conveniently located just a short walk away from London Bridge station, which makes it very easy to get around the city. Staff were great :)

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: I love this place. 2nd time staying here and it's great. Good location and always busy. The bar downstairs is a great place to meet people.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext:
Amazing location, right next to London Bridge Station. Easy to get to, so many great places nearby including Tesco, Sainsburys and Pret right next door.
Staff are fab, especially all the Aussies! They are so helpful, friendly and welcoming. Highly recommend for a clean, safe, and fun place. Bar/Pub downstairs is always pumping and nothing can be heard from the bedrooms! Have already told so many old and new friends to stay there for hostel stays. Ill be back!

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Well I would start off by saying is that this is a party hostel so keep that in mind while booking. It was so much fun! Met all kinds of cool people just going up stairs to the terrace or strolling down to the bar connected with the hostel, don't be afraid to strike up a conversation! I say the staff for the most part was cool but i heard thing hear or there from other guests. Also left my makeup bag and messaged them the same day they said they would check but never heard back... so guess not.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Close to the subway but about a 45 minute walk from downtown.  The floors and bathrooms were the dirtiest I've ever stayed in.  I was on the bottom bunk and the floor beside me had toenail clippings scattered everywhere.  The free laundry is nice and the atmosphere is good.  Friendly staff, but I can't get past the uncleanliness to stay here again or reccomend it.  It's cheap if you're really on a budget, so I guess you get what you paid for.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: I enjoyed the stay at the hostel with 4 other people the night before my 21st birthday. We were lucky enough to have stayed in a room where people respected others privacy and didn't go through our belongings. However, I understand that this may not be the case for other visitors in other rooms. I would suggest informing guests that padlocks aren't provided but they're welcome to bring their own or to get one from reception. We all enjoyed breakfast the next morning and loved the surroundings.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: I loved Staying at St. Christopher's Village in London. It was a great Location and loved the atmosphere. The staff was very attentive, friendly, and helpful. I would definitly stay in another one in the future.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Excellent location. Great price for what you get. Kind of dirty bathrooms but the water was hot and there was never a line. Good shared spaces.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Only complaint was the bathrooms were a bit tight , but otherwise an amazing hostel.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Great hostel to party, have fun and be in London's city center. The bedrooms are quite and facilities are fine. A great place to meet people from all over the world!

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Nice clean hostel with good vibes and friendly staff. But rooms aren't the biggest and the noise from the road outside is insane, even with ear plugs in. Not enough showers or toilets.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Great spot would stay again!

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext:
Booked this hostel at the last minute as it was one of the few with availability for private rooms. Room was great value for money. Very spacious and pleasant room. Staff were also very helpful on arrival.

Our only criticism of our otherwise wonderful stay is that left luggage is by way of a locker room which is at the back of the adjacent bar. We picked up our luggage late on a Friday and struggled past a packed bar with two heavy cases. A more sensible location for the lockers would be wise.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Can't really fault this place. Each room has a split system air conditioning, blinds across each bed, linen provided and made on the bed, plenty of bathrooms and showers on each level and clean. The chill out room is cool and the bar downstairs is great. Would have been better if they organised pub crawls or events in the bar but seeing as it was a public bar with decent food and reasonable atmosphere most nights it was good enough value

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: It was a good hostel for the price and the people where great. It was a great location about a 5 min walk from the underground. The only issue I had was the triple decker beds, I was on the top bunk which was inconvenient as it was quite high up as right beside the ceiling light. Also the lockers were a bit small so I couldn't fit my luggage in them, but they were good for storage of valuables as long as you have a lock.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: This is a great hostel. Some of the rooms have curtains, there is a lively bar downstairs, and the place attracts the right kind of people. Clean, cool, and collected.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Huge place with many communal bathrooms and showers available on every level. Free laundry, and a rooftop hangout that was better than hanging at the bar. Showers could've been cleaner, but I realize they have a huge building.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Had a great stay. Centrally located. Great position x Gatwick airport. Very helpful staff.. breakfast could have contained more healthy options. Maze layout of rooms was a bit confusing but you quickly get used to it.. great secure storage under each bed. Would highly recommend it for the lone traveller as well as groups of friends.  Night life is included on the premises..so it was a  bonus.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: I had an amazing stay here! Great place to stay if you want to meet people! The pub crawls were a must, as in every night...still not quite sure how I able to Talley the next day but a big thanks to Micha! He was so sweet and really cares that everyone has a great time.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Staff was lovely, atmosphere was great, always something to do and a great place to meet a variety of nationalities

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: This was my first time staying in a hostel and I thoroughly enjoyed the experience. Staff was great, they did a great job cleaning in the morning, and I never felt uneasy while I was here.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Only complaints is that the bathrooms had to be clean more often. Women's hair were all over the shower walls and floors. And that there was so really place to chill other than the bar or upstairs patio that was always busy.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext:
I stayed here for the price, 33 pubs a night. But after 4 nights, I think it should be cheaper 20-25 pounds.
Positives: location is central, staff are super friendly and helpful. The other hoteliers are friendly too. The pods are self contained and private
Negatives: the pillows are rubbish, you can easily hear the club below (which is noisy till 1/2am). People will be noisy coming and going at all hours and some are not considerate at all.. Leaving room lights on and making a lot of noise!

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Drink your laxative with a sizable amount of candy floss, then give birth to a unicorn. Life is colorful.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Great hostel, can't fault it. Perfect location, clean, friendly staff and a super cheap bar!!

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: I arrived at 4:00 am for my check-in the day before. No issues which meant a lot for someone travelling all night. The building is confusing to get around but after a day, you'll be fine. You can always ask someone anyway. 33 person dorm was surprisingly quiet.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext:
Pros: cheap price for London, free laundry.
Cons: Staff was immature (aussie working holiday children attend the front desk). Too many fire doors with narrow passages, felt like a rat maze. Only place to eat was a tiny and cramped common room with not much space or facilities.
A good case of "You get what you pay for"

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: This was a great place to stay. The ac was freezing cold which help with 85 temperature outside lol. My space was decently clean except for the floor it was super dirty. I asked them to clean it and they did but they only swept it so it was still dirty. Cleaning to me entails sweeping yes even under the bed and mopping.  Beside that i enjoyed my stay and would stay again. The staff were nice and helpful.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Can't fault it & already excited to go back once I finish traveling across Europe at the end of the month. Close to everything highly recommend

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext:
Great hostel. I stayed in the 6-mixed room. Beds were comfortable and temperature was great with the AC. Each bed had its own light, charging station and space to put your stuff. The curtain for each individual bed is a nice touch for privacy as well. Staff was always friendly and helpful no matter the time of the day.

Breakfast was alright and a good time to meet new people (tables get pretty full so you get to share a table with other people). Pub crawl was really fun and worth the price

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: A lot better stay than the St. Christopher hostel down the street in my opinion. The air conditioning throughout the building was great during the tail end of a week of pretty hot weather. The showers are big too and the bar is open substantially later than the ones around the area as well, which is nice when you're done sight seeing but still want to socialize.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Best hostel for Central London if you want easy transport links and a great atmosphere.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Staff weren't the most friendly but I enjoyed staying at the hostel. I also got a bad roommate but that's always a gamble while staying in hostels. Overall it's a good party atmosphere. If you stay here you will get discounted drinks at the bar so that's also a plus. I recommend this place if you want to meet new people!

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext:
It's a hostel in Londo, so you can't expect much. The dorms are ok (please notice that not all rooms have the capsules - most of them have regular bunk beds) and the location is very very good.
The showers look like a gas chamber and are not cleaned often.
7/10.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Great hostel in a great location. Really close to tube stations that will take you pretty much everywhere. Across the road from the borough markets. Always clean, A/C worked really well, great atmosphere. Would recommend the walking tour also

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Clearly a party hostel , the bed have curtains which is nice and the staff is really friendly and helpful. Modern hostel, I would recommend

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: This was our worst hostel experience in a long time. We got robbed and the people in there were as good as nothing. They just wanted to clean their hands by giving us the responsability of filing a police report and do other bunch of stuff when they know people cant afford that much time on their trip. Besides the fact there was a heatwave this year, our room had 3 airconditioners that were almost never on (cheap @#$*&) and the room boiled every night. Floor full of hairs.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Fantastic location right next to the borough market and very close to the River / London bridge stop on the train. Very clean and modern looking place has a great vibe and felt comfortable instantly.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext:
The air conditioner and the location is really bad.
Other than that I think everything is fine.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext:
I had the best stay! 
Met the most amazing people who stayed there, loved the location! Opposite the markets and walking distance to everything! 
The instructions to find the hostel from the airport were so helpful I got there with no struggle! 
Will definitely stay there again when I come back to London!

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: I've never been to a hostel before, but with uncertain plans falling apart on our way back from Germany, this was a last-minute lifesaver for my friend and I. Getting there was easy enough, and we found the appearance, style and atmosphere inside to be far better than we expected for the money we paid. The building interior was not only stylish but the facilities were clean and served their needs well. The room was small, as was expected, but was clean and comfortable, and provided USB charging!

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: The atmosphere is awesome, really easy to meet new people. The staff were heaps friendly and helpful. The bar is amazing, great place for food or to drink.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: I had no idea what to expect (I tend to slant negatively before I actually see and experience new places), but was pleasantly surprised by everything! It was modern, clean and very secure AND the staff were super friendly ... and the location is perfect! No need to consider any other places for my next visits, I've found my favorite spot.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: We stayed on 3 different occasions, and the lift is out for repairs, which is fine. By the third stay, guests were allowed to utilize the maintenance lift. It's small, but gets the job done lol. The "Chill-out room" is basic and bare. Cleaning occurred each day, staff is overall nice and accommodating! The bar staff was gracious to fill our water bottles every day. BFast from the bar is better deal than the 3 pound brekkie down below. SUPER SAFE location! Passcard required for entry. LOVE IT!

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: It was one of the worst I can imagine.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext:
A wonderful hostel for value for money right in the very centre of it all. It lacked somewhat in things like comfy chairs and as it clearly advertises is a party hostel so can be tricky to relax. But hey it did what it said on the tin and cost pennies for a view of the shard. Comfy bed with nice curtain I slept really well for
A hostel.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext:
There's lockers but you have to pay for the padlock.
Location is good.
Not enough toilets and bathrooms for the amount of rooms and they were dirty, there was no toilet paper.
Couldn't sleep because you can hear an event happening, not sure if next door or in the hostel bar.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext:
This is the BEST hostel I've stayed at in the U.K.- the customer service is on point and GENUINE, the bar area is huge and filled with guests and none guests, the whole hostel is so clean.
I love that the bunks have built in plug sockets WITH USB connectuon and a reading light. 

Comfy pillow, temperature controlled room, they also have a fantastic roof terrace with a view of The Shard and I would go back here in a heartbeat. Thanks for the great experience!

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: I would stay here again

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext:
Nice place very clean and well maintained. Excellent location.
It is truly a party hostel :)      very recommended!!

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Clean hostel with party atmosphere. Good location near Borough market and London Bridge. Great value for momey just beware not to bump your head while waking up if you're sleeping on a bunk bed.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Comfortable and stable bed, friendly staff, cool vibe and bar is right down stairs I enjoyed the stay very much cheers

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Great location close to London bridge. Has a bar downstairs to meet other people who are travelling and the staff are friendly and helpful.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Curtains on the bunks and air conditioning, what more could you ask for?

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Great location with social bar downstairs to have casual drinks. Good deals for those staying at the hostel. Beds all have individual curtains which help with sleeping in. Would definitely come back :)

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: The staff was rude, yelling at me to put my feet down off a couch and often times unreasonable. We had to switch rooms and couldn't check in or go into the room until 2pm meanwhile the next day the new guests were coming into our room from 8-10 waking us up and storing their luggage while we were still sleeping. Don't even get me started with the showers and bathrooms. It was hard to find a clean shower as most were always filthy. Waited 24hrs and still none were cleaned. One word: unsanitary.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Good Hostel. Inexpensive for London.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Phenomenal place to stay well located to walk to just about anything you want to see. Chill room and patio was great spent a few nights just staying there it was that good. Only real complaint is the ensuite shower has no curtain so the whole bathroom gets wet.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Air conditioning didn't work , the location was just in front of a very busy and noisy street, and we couldn't close de windows.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Love this place! I Highly recommend it

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: While overall, this is an excellent hostel, there are two absolute flaws in the hostel experience. 1: the fire doors throughout the hostel are very loud. To the point of absolutely ruining any attempts at quality sleep. No ear plug will help you. 2: sitting down to use the bathroom and finding that there is no TP is never a pleasant experience. Happened to me twice at St. Chris.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Only stayed a night at the hostel, but the facilities were great.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Staing there was fun. Everything was clean. But for anyone with an Interrail ticket expecting to get a 10% discount: you only get it if you book through Famous Hostels. I booked through Hostelworld and didn't get the discount.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: What a beautiful place to stay in highly recommend

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: My only complaint is that the room was incredibly hot and you could not open the window and there wasn't a fan available.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Good hostel for how big it is, great location by borough market, at night there's music and dance floor, nice friendly staff

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext:
Good location, staff, and rooms. The air-conditioning was very appreciated with the heat wave, but one was dripping into a bucket the whole time.
The bunks in the large shared room were 3 high so you could feel people move around a lot, but it was still a comfortable room.
The staff was so kind and helpful and offered me a sim card right away so I could get situated quickly.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Really good reasonably priced hostel, with a nice bar attached to it, would definitely recommend staying here! Located in a lovely part of London just a short walk from London Bridge

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Demand is high so quality suffers. Staff's attitude is hit & miss no matter how friendly you are. You're just another number in a region of the world where hostel demand is high. Cleaning crew works very hard every day. Great 1st floor if you like to be social. Elevator next to reception works (but reception probably won't tell you). Aircon in every room is AMAZING (very rare to find!). First hostel I've visited that gets bombarded with a queue for 2pm check in (needs a better system). B+

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: I only stayed a night but it was an amazing night I made tons of friends and went on adventures! This hostel fosters friendship and makes it very easy to meet new people. I would highly recommend staying at this hostel to anyone and I wouldn't hesitate to stay another night.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: I would highly recommend this hostel. It is very clean and has comfortable beds. Unfortunately during our stay the elevator was out of service but besides that every thing was great.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Excellent place to stay in a great location. Bar on site was super convenient and you get a discount for being a guest. Enjoyed the entire experience except that the elevator was down and I was on the fifth floor.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext:
Great location with good facilities. 
The locker system for storing luggage at the hostel outside of check-in hours is a real pain though, and could definitely be improved.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Convient location, good facilities and very helpful staff

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Nice place to stay in downtown London. The curtains on the bunks were especially appreciated. Nice and clean and beds were comfortable. Showers could use stools. Doors to the rooms and in the halls slam loudly. Know that breakfast will cost you Â£3 extra/day and you must book the days you want when you get there. Breakfast isn't available until 7, so if you're catching an early train and ask for a breakfast refund, you may or may not get it, but you definitely will not get a friendly response.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: I really enjoyed this hostel. Great atmosphere and staff. They provide a discount for the bar downstairs and offer a lot of activities. Definitely a hostel to meet people at and party in. However, I was still able to find some peace and quiet. Will definitely stay here again.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext:
This hostel is in prime location. Walking distance from Tower Bridge, Shakespeare's globe, Tate Modern and right next to The Shard. 
This was my first trip to London being solo and felt at ease the whole time. The staff are friendly and the chill out room/outside patio is a good place to meet and chat with other travelers. 
The only negatives I would say, is that there needs to be another or bigger fridge in the chill out room and more toilets. Overall, I had a pretty good and interesting stay

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext:
A quality brand in hosteling that is falling short on some basics.
Staff were really inconsistent at reception esp in terms of knowledge & care factor.
Cleanliness overall was pretty good. However, multiple toilets with no toilet paper 3 days in a row. On one occasion I was told by reception that there was no housekeeping form afternoon to next morning & reception would fix when they got time - it never happened.
