So in terms of Value for Money - top $ (Pound) for this hostel should do better!

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: This is a Mega hostel- think 20 people in a room stacked 3 high. The beds are large and stable so ok if you are on the top bunk. Big problem on the top bunk is the lack of a roof Curtin- the top bunk is very close to the ceiling light so if you are trying to sleep people will come in and turn the light on which shines directly in your face- this happens at all hours. Good location. It's a party hostel so you'll need an eye mask and earplugs to sleep. Friendly guests and clean facilities.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: I was traveling with my partner, so the capsules afforded a quasi-private room at a fairly reasonable price in a great location. Although, because you have to book two beds, the cost ended up being comparable to a hotel. 24 hour reception is nice. The bar downstairs runs until 3 AM most nights, and you can hear the thumping of the music in the capsule room. If you're out to party or if you can sleep with a little ruckus, great place, not the best for light sleepers who want to sleep early.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: It was my first time staying at any hostel, went with this one since it is central to a lot of tourist places and it is very close to the London Underground,overall it's a great place to stay, only thing I will say is that the elevator is still not working, so you have to climb the stairs with your luggage, it can get tiring if you are on the top floor like I was, other than that it was a great experience

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Very clean, and everyone was really nice and helpful.  Lots of nightlife and stuff to do nearby in the area.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: I've never stayed in a hostel before and was kind of nervous! But this place was so much better then I had pictured in my head! Everyone at the front desk was so friendly and inviting, gave me loads of information on things to do and events to meet people! Bedroom was nice and bathrooms were pretty clean! Would def book here again :)

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Amazing location, can walk everywhere, the hidden room top is so great to chill out in and meet people, coming back to this one for sure

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: This hostel is clean, central, and modern. We booked this hostel because we thought all the beds are the pod-style drawer things, which provide privacy, but we got classic bunk beds in a big room with strangers.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: The location can't be any better. Booked a private room for party of 8 and upon checkin found the room was occupied. Staff promptly took care of that. Elevator was not working so had to haul luggage to second floor. Showers and toilets were clean.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Clean and modern hostel. Good location. Would stay again.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: The music from the down floor was way too loud couldn't get sleep.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Cool hostel! Lots of young people but not a crazy party hostel in the sense that you can't get sleep- because you can! Lift and AC were broken at the time of visit but overall would come here again, great location and people and very clean. Curtains on all the beds were a nice touch!

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: *book through their website it's cheaper* been backpacking for a year and this hostel is GREAT. Incredible price for a 6 dorm room and close to everything. Very clean and free breakfast and other deals! Would stay again any day

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: I'll start with the positives - the beds are comfortable and the toilets and showers are clean. Other than that my experience there was horrible. The staff was rude and unhelpful. After getting robbed right in front of the hostel while the bouncers were there, the receptionist refused to offer any help and was surprised that this led to me being frustrated. Furthermore, the bouncer FOR THE PUB decided that it was ok to confiscate my hostel key card because I was "rude to him".

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: In broad terms, the hostel is good. The location is pretty good since you can easily move to the more popular places in London. There were some problems with the bathrooms since most of them were out of service. In any case, the staff is very kind and helpful.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: AirCon!!! Gotta love: )

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Everything about this hostel was perfect. It was clean, had plenty of bathrooms and amenities, and provided plenty of people to talk to. 10/10 place. I honestly have 0 complaints.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Wifi is fast, lift is under repairs which made getting bags up and down very difficult, but the separate and mixed bathrooms were great and very much appreciated. Although the lack of actual toilets made mornings difficult. The washing machine needs a big clean as it ended up making my whites dirtier than when I put them in....

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Everything was amazing. The only complaint I have is the elevator was broken for my entire stay and my room was on the 5th floor .

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: It was OK but the bad outweighed the good. The "chill room" was really bad unless you were there to drink but even then it was disappointing. I would not recommend the pub crawl through their company. It was far out of the city and definitely not worth the money!

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Great location right next to main tube

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Great location close to a handful of cool bars and not far from tube stops, making it easy to get around. Beds were comfortable, although I booked the 12 bed dorm so it was very cramped (kind of expected). Bar downstairs is fun and has good food, which you get a discount on for staying at the hostel. Only complaints are the elevator is under construction right now, and the room was VERY hot at night. Made it difficult to sleep

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Accomodations were goodbut different than advertised. The "pods" were bunk beds with curtains and not at all as pictured, which seems deceptive. Fine for a traditional hostel experience.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: i didn't like the fact that i had to pay for breakfast because i did not book directly

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: The lift doesn't work so if you are in the 2 floor it will be ok, but the noise of the bar can bother you at night.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: If you're looking to visit London and stay in the central area, then this place is for you. This was my first stay in a hostel and I thought it was quite good. The bathrooms were a little dirty but they were cleaned in no time. I was comfortable in my room despite My American self not being used to the fact that there's no air conditioning. Definitely buy a lock to protect your belongings. I thought I made the right choice buying one. Overall, great!

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: I stayed in the mix rooms but too many guys would be snoring so I couldn't sleep at all

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Comfortable and friendly environment, convenient location.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Great hostel. Good party vibe, good facilities and clean.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext:
Staff were good, And helpful in most respects.
Security of baggage was not managed easily. Â£2.50 - Â£3.50 would be charged to stow items in a basement (not easily accessable). This was automated and when power tripped out on the system things rapidly became unstuck. The hostel accepted guests in groups who were not of sufficient age/maturity. One such first in my dorm arriving in the middle of the night, throwing up, And calling an ambulance having been drunk for the first time. Otherwise Good.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Very happy with my accommodation. Very clean and safe.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext:
Elevator not working. And guess which floor they put me in? Yes, the fifth floor! And guess what else? My key card wasn't programmed properly so I couldn't get into my room! I actually called the reception and asked them to come up and bring me a working key, and they refused. My bum got a nice massive workout. 

Great location. Secure. Clean. Aside from the elevator not working and my key not being programmed, it was a decent stay.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Had a nice time at this hostel. Great atmosphere with an amazing bar and good priced food available. The rooms were good; enough room. The showers were disgusting. Very dirty!! Otherwise a great stay. Also would benefit with a better kitchen area too.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: As my first real hostel experience, I was blown away by how nice this was. It made my London experience one I'll never forget. Basically everything was walking distance or a short walk from the London bridge underground. I'd highly recommend staying here next time you're in London.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Nice place, fully renovated and probably one of the very few places with aircon in London.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: One of the best hostels you can find in the Citycentre of London. Beside,their locker is a bit expensive as for 3.50 a day.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: The AC broke and with 30 people in a room, it got way to hot.  I thought all the beds were going to be the cool ones, as did other guests. They advertised free breakfast, but then tried to charge you for breakfast. They did not have enough bathrooms or showers as well. Overall, it was a good place.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Despite the fact that we had to take a cold shower in the morning, the hostel is super well located and the room was very clean. It's definitely a party hostel and we were bummed we couldn't partake as we arrived super late and left in the morning. I will definitely come back though.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Love this place probably one of the best hostels in London. Perfect location and great social atmosphere, met a lot of cool people here.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Very large hostel with a pretty lively atmosphere. Rooms were a bit cramped, especially since the lockers were relatively small so people would leave large bags out on the floor. Things were generally clean, but not spotless. The hostel is well-located though as it's about a 5 minute walk away from two different tube stops

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Pretty much exactly what you'd hope for in a hostel. Good outdoor common room. Bar with cheap drinks. Nice rooms. Clean except for the showers after the rush, but that's to be expected.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext:
well located,
Beds are nice there is a "cage" to put our bags safe , & usb
Toilets are fine.
Breakfast is 3 pounds, cereal/milk/toast bread/cheese /ham its ok
Showers are small not much space to put things.
We were on 1st floor, above the club, be prepared for noise, there is another club next door.
Our room had 8 people, some were talking drunk at 6AM & others shouting in corridors, so not a place for proper sleep, its a party hostel
Maybe have smaller rooms last floor for who wants peace

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: The music is sooooo loud in the bar ,I  lived in the first floor and I can feel the bass on my bed . And the AC is not working . At this moment london is like 30â„ƒ I don't know why can't they just leave the remote for the AC in the room. Also the elevator is out of service and I have to my 20kg luggage and climb up the stairs .The staff are pretty friend and helpful expect the night shift staff(?) Although the location is excellent I will never stay in this hostel again

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Clean room, friendly helpful staff and a good atmosphere. Definitely recommend and stay again.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext:
The walls in the hostel are really thin, so you will hear all the noise going on in the hostel. And the staff didn't make any effort to try to tell people to keep the noise down during night time. Plus the doors are really heavy, so whenever someone is closing them, it makes the whole room shake a bit. So definitely not a good place to get some good sleep.
Also luggage storage costs 2.50/3.50, should be free like in most other hostels!
Probably wouldnt reccommend staying there.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext:
The bar downstairs is pretty cool and the hostel is super close to the train station and borough market. 
Would not recommend the 33 person room. Has a sun roof so the room is always bright. 
Was not a fan of the triple bunks and the maze like set up of the hostel rooms.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext:
The hostel has an incredible location and is very lively and well-organised. The rooms are located above a sports bar and a pub, so as expected it was quite loud at night. 
The only downside I could see was that there was no kitchen, however, the breakfast they provided was very good.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Didn't stay long and I was a bit under the weather but definitely into the curtains on the beds

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Aircon didn't work the whole time I was there, so everyone in the room had troubles sleeping, and when I went to tell the staff they did nothing about it, apparently it hadn't been working for days. When my friends and I checked into our rooms the bed wasn't in its best shape, as my sheet had been thrown to the side with dirt marks and there were blood stains on my pillow case, and this happened to my other friend as well. Otherwise, bathrooms were pretty clean, and there was a good atmosphere!

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: The room we got wasn't the pods advertised, but that's the only thing I had the slightest issue with! The beds were comfortable, the showers weren't bad and there were lockers available. Sadly I forgot to take a lock with me, there were some available to buy but my stuff was safe the whole time. The staff were very friendly and helpful! Would definitely go back!

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Out of the 15 hostels I've stayed in during my trip this round St. Christopher killed it, twice. In Amsterdam and London

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Good hostel especially the deluxe room and the area is superb

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Overall had a bad experience here, had a homeless man that stunk stay in our room the first night - caused us to have to request a room change for the night and sleep in another dorm in the middle of the night. Alongside this man toilets were overflowing, due to the large amount of people staying here - causing the floors to sometimes get flooded or water to drip through the ceiling to the floor below.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext:
We arrived extremely late & were greeted by the best low-key & super cool midnight shift crew. The lift was out of service, as someone w/a prior back injury, i had to be REALLY mindful of going up + down stairs w luggage, they just put me on the 1st level.
The hostel is in great form and is still undergoing even more improvements with another mural of the city scape. The restaurant food is great & the world cup is giving the place extra life. 
We had a great time. Miss it already! Thx

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Super amazing hostel, I highly recommend it. It's right next to the Borough Market and London bridge, the bar downstairs is always bumping and there are incredible drink deals. The rooms are large but everybody has curtains to make some private space, the showers are large and very clean. The upstairs patio was also very cool. I will definitely be staying here again. Just a great hostel all around.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext:
Only stayed here two nights. Conveniently located near the borough market for cheap food, and a great social area downstairs at the bar (was great for watching World Cup soccer). Though it was very hot. I was lucky and immediately
Met some great people in my room so my experience was awesome. Never made it to breakfast so I can't comment on that. Would recommend

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Great hostel. Good location near some good restaurants and close to the underground train. Will definitely stay here again next time I visit.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Great vibe at this place, very easy to meet other solo travelers, especially at Belushi's downstairs. Only thing I'd say is there isn't much space in the rooms (lots of beds in small rooms) and you most likely won't get to sleep in a pod. A few people I met booked the larger rooms (one booked the 33 bed one) and they still ended up with regular bunk beds - so no sign of pods, just a heads up!

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext:
- : When I booked I thought that I would sleep in a capsule (see pictures), but I had to sleep in a normal bed with curtains.
I had to sleep on the first floor. When you want to sleep well at a hostel, please choose another hostel!
Much and so heavy noice, bass trillings from the bar downstairs.

+ : Clean room, toilet, bathroom and perfect location.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Loved the place. I've came alone and did not had problems making friends at the bar. Also, wonderful location, just so close to london bridge, tower bridge and so many other beautiful atractions. The staff changed the date of my reserve as I lost my connection, in order for me to don't lose any day here. Most unbelievably, lost my wallet and cellphone at the bar and the next day they found both n gave it back to me with all the documents and money. Can't wait to stay with you again, ty so much.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Overall was a great stay! However be aware that the elevator is 'out of order' yet our whole stay no workers were there to fix it and I had read previous reviews saying that it was out of order during their stay. This meant we had to climb the five flights of stairs with our20kg of luggage. The facility was very clean and the location was perfect, close to supermarkets, markets, pubs and the London Bridge underground station. Most staff are helpful however some were unhelpful.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Outdoor terrace made it easy to meet people!

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: This place lets you experience a typical London neighborhood two blocks away from London Bridge about a half a mile away from Castle Bridge in about a half a mile away from Elephant & Castle there's plenty of Subway Lines and bus lines in the area and they even have a bar / nightclub that only members of the hostel can get in there so it's very safe to let loose and have a few pints but during the night time course like any other place you got people who prey on other people who are naive

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Arrived for my 1 pm check in time, but the bed wasn't ready. Rude guests will leave their phone alarms on for hours at 4 in the morning. Fight broke out in the dorm. Fire alarm went off. Got a better nights sleep in the public park. DO NOT STAY ON THE FIRST FLOOR IF YOU WANT ANY SLEEP. Ended up finding a different accommodation for the rest of our stay. Bar was the only good thing.

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Showers did not work during peak morning hours (neither hot nor cold water).

name: St Christopher's Village
reviewtext: Great place if you like a lively atmosphere and neighborhood. If it does get a little too loud, the front desk offers free ear plugs, which can come in handy. Very close to tube stations and Borough Market! The staff was very friendly and helpful.

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: Location is a bit quite for partying or even go out but everyone is nice and its close to victoria coach. The showers and bathroom are a little inconvinet

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: The only real benefit of staying here is the location, just 2 minutes from Pimlico and 10 from Victoria metro stations. I ended up staying at a hotel across the street, leaving my room at 12:30 am the first night due to a very unruly bunkmate who was walking around pacing, with the lights on, talking nonsense and accusing me of stealing his bunk, bothering everyone in the room trying to sleep. Aside, the showers were not working on my floor and the sheets were stained.

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext:
My husband and I liked the place even though there was some arrogance attitude from the Spanish male receptionist, when we asked where we should go to find the sitting room and other areas. But really loved the Italian smile girl that changed the energy of the place.  The toilet on our level 1 of them was out of service so we had to go another level to find a free one as on our own area it was quite busy.
Apart from that, nice people and atmosphere.
Thanks anyway for the service.

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: I've honestly never given this low of a rating to any place and it's for one reason: cleanliness. Or the lack thereof. My sheets were threadbare (could see through them), my duvet was yellowed and had some other persons hair on it. My room was so dusty I woke up having a sneezing attack and the showers were just disgusting. The couches in the common room were also cracked, old, and kind of gross. The staff did their best to help, but it just was so unnecessarily dirty on so many surfaces. :(

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: Excelent location, nice staff

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: One of my worst hostel experiences.  My four bed room was so small that it was difficult to move about if another person was standing in the room.  No charging stations for top bunks.  Mattress was like a board, the pillow very thin.  They had no bath towels to rent to me, only hand towels.  The staff I interacted with were unfriendly/aloof.  Many bathrooms and showers were out of order, water pooled on the floor in several places, the bathroom taps only ran cold.  An uncomfortable place.

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: Love this place, third time here. Great atmosphere and staff. A 1Â£ breakfast, comfy beds. The receptionists are always great. The bathrooms aren't great, and there's only PowerPoints on the floor, but the excitement and enthusiasm they bring more than makes up for it. ( great beer pong too)

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext:
I returned this year, as a year ago, my stay was very pleasant. 
Now the state of the bathrooms was below reasonable.
The shower tubs were chipped, at best they were greasy, if not dirty and with grey marks, from not having been scrubbed in a while.
You don't want to forget / leave your flip-flops. 
I saw one of the matresses being changed - several stains in a wide array of colours and sizes.
The kitchen sinks were not far either.
Too bad! This place was great, but it now needs refurbishment!

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: The staff is great. You do have to pay for towels. There is not a outlet next to every bed. They have free adapters for you to use which is great. A 2 min walk to the underground and very close to Victoria rail station.

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext:
Friendly staff and clean comfy bed. The toilet next to our room didn't have a sink so I couldn't brush my teeth when I got back late as I didn't want to usr the sink in the room whilst people were sleeping. 
Breakfast was good and location is great for Victoria station. I was traveling as a single female in my 20's and I felt very safe.

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext:
+ very good location, clean well-lit rooms, spacious. Big lockers, shelves.

- cleaners under terror, cleanliness meticulous, yet there seems to be no maintenance, half-blocked toilets with loose seats everywhere. No mirror and very little shelves in all showers, imp to shave. Kitchen closed at night and after breakfast, late sleeper/wakers, forget using it. Rules and warning signs everywhere.

A little less military-style and a human touch would help. Still good value.

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: Central location, room was fine but the bathrooms are pretty small.

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext:
NO LIFT! I HAVE A HUGE BAGGAGE AND I WAS PLACED AT THE 4TH FLOOR! 
IT WAS ALSO VERY HOT AT NIGHT EVEN WHEN ITS 12-13 DEGREES OUTSIDE
YOU JUST COME HERE TO SLEEP FOR 1 DAY AND THAT'S IT

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext:
The location is wonderful. I expect to find a curmudgeonly man offering diction lessons here. My biggest issues were with the really heavy fire doors that slammed loudly in the stairwell the whole night and the tiny little shower rooms. The shower I used was too slow to drain the whole time I was there and there is so little room in the stall that the curtain stuck to me during the shower. 
The staff were friendly and the rest of the space was clean.

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: While the desk staff was very kind and helpful and it's only a 10 minute walk from Victoria station, there is not much food nearby and the bathrooms were quite dirty.  Also the water is non potable strangely.

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext:
Hi, I am Dr. Suresh Racharla, I stayed one night in Astor Victoria Hostel. Staff is good and facilities also good. but there is no token for our luggage when you keep in the luggage room. Checkout time 10 am that is too early. Atleast it should be 11 am. Apart from these two everything is fine. Very close to Victoria coach station as well as under ground station.

Thanks,
Suresh

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext:
I was only there 7 hours overnight so can't really judge atmosphere etc but bed comfy, and bed preallocated so easy to find in the dark. 
Charity breakfast & access to a hot drink at 1am & 6.45 very much appreciated. Best staff!.

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: I am not really critical with hostels and its facilities, but this hostel was bellow reasonable. The bathrooms are so small and dirty - you cannot even wash your face without wetting everything. The bedrooms were small and uncomfortable for 6 people - there was not even space to walk in the room. The staff was pretty impolite and not at all helpful; if you are expecting a hostel where people will try to help you have a good experience in London, this is not the best option. Also, no lifts!!

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: Awesome place, definitely stay here. Only criticism would be the showers being a bit tight for a larfer guy like me. Nothing to do about that and not a deal breaker at all just something to keep in mind.

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: Weren't the greatest hostel I stayed at, the 8 bed dorm room was tiny and not much space, no elevator so if you have heavy luggage be prepare to climb up many stairs. If your unfortunate to be on the top floor. However the staff was extremely friendly and very helpful. This hostel is fine if your only here for less than 1 or 2 nights.

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: Great hostel, staff helpful and friendly

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: Astor Victoria is such a lovely place to stay.  It's easy to get to from the bus station, train and the tube and the staff are great.  Rhys went out of his way to make sure my stay was a good one.  There are enough facilities to ensure that your stay is comfortable and pleasant and the beds were quite comfortable.

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext:
Overall my staff was okay, first experience in a hostel so was not sure what to expect. Stayed in a 6 person mixed dorm. Room was really dusty Andy allergies played up. Always appeared to be a toilet blocked.

Location was great and close to the tube, Victoria street stations and buses. Was a quiet area and felt safe to be out at night when getting to and from the hostel. 

Couldn't see many cooking facilities though seemed to be consistent with standard hostels.

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: The area was fantastic, walking distance from Victoria Station and an underground line, very calm and unique. Staff was helpful and nice, 1Â£ charity breakfast was great. The sinks in the toilets are very small but there are sinks in the dorms as well. Beds are comfortable. Definitely coming back here when in London.

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: Excellent experience apart from surprisingly unfriendly Canadian roommate and a middle eastern man who will perform his entire morning routine as loudly as possible at 8 in the morning rather than going to the bathroom.

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: Good hostel for location and price. I had some unfortunate roommates for first few nights I stayed but not the hostels fault. Facilities are clean, locker storage is available inside rooms, staff is friendly, and breakfast is provided at all locations. Quiet atmosphere and not the best for meeting new people and socializing so if that is what you are into, stay somewhere else. Other than that, good hostel.

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: Good hostel for the price. Really great location, easily walkable to Victoria Station and Pimlico underground station. Toilets and showers are small and could be cleaner. Would recommend for short stays.

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: Beds are comfortable and clean, but the rest of the place is rather unclean, especially bathrooms and toilets which are also time-worn. Stuff is always willing to help and explain anything necessary. My 4 beded room was pretty small. Atmosphere seems very friendly. After all it could be a value for money depending on what you need or expect, but nevertheless with a bit higher hygienic standard would be better option.

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: Great if you need to catch an early bus the next day at Victoria station. One of the best kitchens I've used at a hostel. They had everything. Not enough outlets in the room, but they added extension cords and junctions to try and solve the problem.

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: Super cramped rooms and no lockers for your stuff. Handy luggage storage facility. Tiny toilet and showers too. Location makes up for it though. 5 minutes from Pimlico and Victoria.

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: I stayed here for one night, and to be honest there are much better hotels in London. The location is pretty good, around a 10 minute walk to the main Victoria station, or 5 minute walk to the nearest underground station - Pimlico. The Hostel itself has a pretty tired lounge area with some sofas downstairs and they also charge Â£5 deposit for room key card. My top bunk was ok, although there were no power sockets nearby. Toilet and shower facilities are also old and not the cleanest or spacious

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: I stayed here for a week and found it to be a really great base for my travels around London. It's in a quiet area, but well connected by trains. The facilities are good (basic, but it's a hostel after all). On my last day I was sick and the staff were very kind to me. It's great value in a very expensive city!

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: Astor Victoria was a great place to stay with very nice, helpful staff. The breakfast is incredible, too! Although they do not have a "free" breakfast, it only costs one pound, so it is a great deal and will save you a lot of money. The rooms are clean, and you get your own compartment to store your belongings. I would definitely recommend this hostel if you are okay walking a good amount.

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: Great location, very near alot of public transport (especially if you're coming in from the airport). Had all the things you could want in a hostel!

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: I've stayed here several times on various trips because it's RIGHT by Victoria Coach Station, for day trips/airport rides/etc.! It's always an easy and pleasant stay; it seemed much cleaner and brighter this time around though! Staff are always nice too. In my experience guests are doing their own thing rather than socializing but there are plenty of people around if you want to make friends.

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: This is the second time I've stayed for just one night and I think it's fine for that. The bathrooms were pretty tiny and not cleaned well at all and the rooms were hot even on a cold day. But the staff were super friendly and the breakfast was good. Plus it's right near the tube and Vic coach station so location is great I think.

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext:
The room was at 5th level- to take the luggage on that level was indeed a pain. Plus the washrooms were very tiny.
Staff were awesome and so are the atmosphere..

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: My bed definitely had bed bugs, as my friends and I all woke up with bug bites. The staff claimed they "ran out of pad locks" for my luggage, making it impossible to secure my luggage. The bathroom were not clean. I will never stay here again, and would not recommend this hostel to anyone.

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: Very good location, toilets awfull...small, and few of them plugged...no AC, super hot in rooms

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: The location was great, close to Victoria and walking distance to a tube, shops etc. The room I stayed in was a 4 person room but was super tiny, they shouldn't have more than two people in a room that small.  Luckily enough I was the only one there, so it was fine. They had two fans to beat the heat which was great. The bathrooms were dirty and smelly and really brought the whole experience down. Reception staff were friendly and the wi-fi worked fine. Good enough for a one night stay in London

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext:
Just had one night here before I caught a coach to Paris. Was lovely and clean, fresh and had good storage system!
Would recommend!

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: It was really cheap, but not nearly as nice as most of the other hostels I've stayed in. Theres not a lot of space, which made socializing difficult.

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: Overall this is a great hostel to stay at if you're visiting London. The bus stop is right down the block and takes you pretty far throughout town and it's one of the 24 hour buses. The staff is extremely friendly!! The reason I did not give it 5/5 on security is because the key to the luggage room is given to anyone that asks and you're in the room by yourself, without a staff member making sure you're only grabbing your things. Cleanliness was good too but there were stain shelves in my room.

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: The room was way too hot, the fan was more successful at making a loud noise than actually cooling the room. The showers were also fairly dirty. You get what you pay for

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: Place loaded with workers and some tourists, not a great atmosphere nor is there a welcoming place to chill out and meet other people. The place is super hot with industrial fans at full blast to get air flow, great sound to sleep to. Breakfast ends at 10am strictly and then you get kicked out so they can clean, so no where to go and chill with a coffee. There is also only a handful of showers and toilets, 2 per floor of probably 20 beds, goo luck getting a free one! Staff and location is great!

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: Actually a very decent hostel. Was surprised by the cleanliness, much cleaner than Astor Hyde park. Has been beds and sheets. The front desk was better too. They actually act interested though they check in people day in day out. I was only there for the night and had the pleasure of a heavy snorer in my room. But can't blame the hostel for that. Would recommend it to anyone on a budget.

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: Best experience, nice place, friendly staff

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: Very handy location with an amazing price!

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: Good location, great atmosphere to meet people and good facilities. Drawback was one toilet and one shower for 8 people, I stayed for 3 nights and it was always dirty. Overall, recommended.

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: Great hostel in such a great location in London! The rooms had everything you needed and the staff were accommodating. The only thing that wasn't great was that they didn't have air conditioning in the rooms during the heat wave, but there were 2 fans that did a decent job. But otherwise if you're staying during any other time in the year, it's a perfect little place.

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: The Hostel was OK. The location was amazing but it would have been cool to know how close things were. The atmosphere was so-so as people didnt really talk to each other, unless you were outside and you have to come in around 11 as to not wake the neighbours. If your on a budget, good place to stay, but if you can spare the extra, I recommend you do it.

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: Great location, lovely stuff - don't hesitate, just book now!

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext:
There were few toilets, they were really small and dirty. The room (6 people) was really small without air conditioner and few energy plugs. Breakfast was ok, but they were lack of staff to replace things..
It was too hot everywere.. we couldn't sleep really

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext:
My Stay didn't go very well as something happened (theft) during my time there , but staff Yago is a complete value-add to the hostel! 
He's been extremely patient and helpful when things happened & was very empathetic and followed through to help with my case. He made the otherwise a terrible stay, a lot better :) 
Thanks Yago!

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: Its location, near Victoria, is great for people traveling. The neighborhood is pretty dead (everything's closed by midnight), but the hostel itself is lively, with people on the ground floor lounge and kitchens late at night.  Thus, it is noisy on the lower floors. The building is also all walk-up with no elevators, so being on the top floor can really suck.  Also, they weren't well-prepared for the heat wave; only a small fan in the room, which is useless for the top bunk.

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: I've had an absolutely lovely stay here!! I've never been to a hostel with such friendly, accommodating staff before. From checking in, Yago was so kind, and the informed me that they will bring my bag up to my room for me! Now I only had a small backpack, but if you have a suitcase this would be a lifesaver as it's stairs only! Then my second night I needed to charge my portable charger and the girl st the desk let me leave it with her for the night to charge since they had no adapters left!

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: Staff were excellent, rooms were a bit dusty, could have used a good vacuuming.

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext:
Bed hostel I ever stayed!
Thank you will come back again xx

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: Great location, good facilities, comfortable enough for a one night stop. Quite a young crowd so pack some earplugs and expect young crew having a good time! Dorms were much quieter than I expected. Would recommend!

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: The place is very warm and welcoming :) The staff is very nice, the beds are comfortable. It was great for my one night stay in London, close to Victoria Coach Station! The toilets were quite dirty though, because they didn't flush well. Other than that, it was a very nice experience!

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: This place was great for the price paid. I was close to everything and really was only there to shower & sleep....however the beds were dusty and the rooms were beyond HOT in the evening. I had a top bunk too so it was very uncomfortable. I would definitely come back...it was a pleasant stay

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: Great stay! We were 3 and booked a 4 people-room. We arrived in the morning, left our bags with the reception who took care of putting them in the room for us so that we could enjoy the city. We came back late at night and discovered our room which was on the third floor (though it felt higher due to all the stairs!) and had a shower and a sink inside the room. The hostel is in a very nice and quiet area. We stayed one night and only slept but it was a good stay. :)

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: Standard hostel, with very nice staff! The weather was pretty hot while we were in London, so the room was extremely warm and humid unfortunately. The shower area was not well kept, and there were only two outlets in the room for 6 people. All in all, the location was decent (very close to an underground entrance), and for the price, this place was alright.

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext:
Pros:
- staff was nice and helpful
- on a quiet street, but really close to the tube
- big kitchen area

Cons:
- rooms and bathrooms are quite cramped (given it is London)
- common room is pretty junky

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: I stayed for only one night but had a solid experience.  Excellent location, friendly staff, I would recommend.

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: Decent hostel for a quick stopover. Great location near Victoria Station. Rooms are small but adequate.

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: Great staff, no problem with anything.

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: Overall, a great hostel! I stayed in a 4 bed mixed room for two nights and would definitely stay here again. The location was really safe, although it was 20-30 minutes by transit to any of the sites, so not great if you plan to come back to the hostel a lot during the day. The rooms were super clean and featured a sink to wash your face and brush your teeth. They also have lockers under the bed and for a 5 pound deposit you can borrow a lock for it.

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: Pretty good hostel with the bare necessities that I needed (i.e. bed, hot water). Staff is very friendly and welcoming! They hold your luggage for free, which I appreciated. Be prepared to walk if you are on the top floor, soooo many stairs. Overall, I am very happy with my decision to stay here. Cheers!

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: Loos and showers let the place down. Its generally very good, but these need updating

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: Amazing place with good atmosphere and nice location. Great staff

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: We watched the World Cup together in the chilling area with the staff as well. It was a really comfortable atmosphere!

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: Staff are very friendly and helpful, and facilities are quite adequate. There are cages under the beds where you can lock up your belongings, which makes them safe but also nice and easy to access. You can also borrow a lock from reception if you don't have one for a 5 pound deposit which they will return to you once you return the lock. All facilities are basic but adequate and relatively clean.

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: There is always staff available to help and hey are very nice and helpful. Hostel is close to tube stations and walkable distance from Buckingham Palace. I would definitely stay there again.

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: The Astor Victoria was pretty you-get-what-you-pay-for. It was painfully hot and humid in early July and we did have some issues with there being no AC and only one unreliable fan, so sleeping conditions weren't great. However, it was a really convenient location close to two major tube stations and out of the way from the louder, wilder atmosphere of Covent Garden or Soho, which is what I wanted. Overall pretty OK.

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: Astor Victoria is super close to the subway at the Pimlico station, which can connect you to almost any attraction in London. Also is close the Victoria station where the great majority of the coaches arrive. The bad part about it is that London City as itself is far away, to tower bridge you'll do a 34 minute ride in the subway! So plan ahead and if you have time is a great place to stay staff is amazing and the rooms are nice

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext:
Super hostel. Staff were very friendly. It was clean. 
Great location for me as I needed to take the coach from Victoria coach station when I left. There is also a tube station not far away. 
I was a solo traveler for one night staying for a training day so didn't want some kind of party hostel, as the area is residential, it was perfect! However, without air con it was way too hot in the room and even with a fan for the 6 bed dorm I really didn't sleep well. Good vibe and lockers for security.

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: the breakfast, location and staff were the only good things about this place. The 6 bed room i stayed in was WAY to small. On top of that it was impossible to sleep because it was SO HOT in the rooms. they provide a fan but it does not reach all the beds. The bathrooms weren't the dirtiest but the toilet paper dispensers NEVER work and if there isn't any extra laying there you are screwed. all in all it would have been ok but if im paying a lot at the very least i should be able to sleep.

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: Had such a great time at this hostel. The crew was amazing and very friendly. The place was really clean. I would definitely stay here again. There was always access to showers and restrooms. The only issue I had was all the stairs and how hot it could be on the 4th floor, but this wouldn't stop me from visiting again.

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: Not really much to say. Wasn't at all what I expected. Ended up checking out the same night I checked in and stayed at a friends place. Only good thing was location but even then I found better options.

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: The room I booked was in the basement with no air conditioning and one fan for 8 people.  The hostel had people partying until 3am right beside my room.  Then after one of the staff was playing a really loud moving at the front desk until 5am.  Washroom was dirty.

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: I stayed here for one night. It was okay. I checked in early morning. They kept my luggage safe until I got my room. Staff was quite helpful. Common room was not clean though. Also toilets in the common area were not clean. Place is quite congested. They don't have a lift and I had to climb stairs to fourth floor (with my luggage).

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: Location was nice and rooms were clean. Bathrooms were disgusting and a lot of the time there was no toilet paper. The showers didn't drain well and two (non-consecutive) of the ten days I stayed there they had to shut off the hot  water for the showers. Staff were nice but not very informative.

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: Showers were small and muggy, with only one per floor. Great location and friendly, fun staff. Excellent central location with access to bikes, trains, busses etc.

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: Great for a good nights sleep. As a solo traveller, the common area wasn't the best to mingle with other travellers. Staff were fantastic, extremely friendly and happy to help with luggage storage etc. I felt very welcome here! Close to a train station but also can comfortably walk to Westminster and around. Not a loud party hostel so it's perfect for a good nights sleep in a good location! Would recommend!

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: It was amazing

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: Great location, 5 minute walk to an underground and tons of stuff within a 20 minute walk. Toilets were really cramped and there weren't enough of them. The free breakfast was pretty good for being free, mostly toast and cereal, but there was coffee and tea. No plugs near the beds, beds were pretty squeaky, and there was a fan in the room which was nice.

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: Decent place to stay- good location, bedding was clean, and there was enough space in the 8 person rooms. (also, kitchen access was great) The bathrooms were a bit small, and often dirty, but mostly because so many people were in the hostel, not because they weren't cleaned. Overall, would recommend, even for longer stays (I stayed 5 nights)

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: This hostel was in good walking distance for what we wanted. Everything was available to us and it's a very secure building. The problem at this time of year (June) is the heat. We were on the top floor with just a fan (8 dorm). Enough to consider elsewhere. Other than that, the kitchen was great and staff were so friendly!

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: Had a wonderful stay here! The 6-bed female dorm was a decent size and even had a sink in the room. The showers and bathrooms were quite close to the rooms as well. Lots of narrow staircases, but well worth it! The neighbourhood is beautiful, and not too rowdy. Super close to Victoria bus station, train station, and some theatres. If you stay here, I highly recommend seeing WICKED at the nearby theatre (which is within walking distance). Lots of restaurants around, too!

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext:
Everything was very clean. Very close to the bus station. Staff seemed friendly. Good brekky spread.

Showers are quite small, but basically that's the only drawback

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: Very good location, near Victoria Station and Pimlico metro. Friendly staff. Clean and confortable rooms.

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: Very nice location but not comfortable. The staff is always nice but the building has no lift so you have to carry your luggages up through very narrow stairs. The bathrooms are also not the clean and the bedroms are really small. It does not have space for all the bads and things from all the people.

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: This wasn't a terrible experience, but it wasn't amazing. The rooms were very tiny and hot. There was a lack of airflow even with the windows open. The bathrooms were not as clean as described. The pillows are also rock hard and flat. I wouldn't stay there again, however, if you don't care about the things I mentioned then you will be fine. The staff are very nice and welcoming. Also very helpful

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: Not the cleanest place in the world. Opted out of showering and wished I'd booked somewhere a bit nicer. Good for a quick overnight on a budget though.

name: Astor Victoria
reviewtext: Bathrooms are terrible, outside the room and very tiny

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: Nada mÃ¡s entrar en la habitaciÃ³n sentÃ­ agobio. Era una habitaciÃ³n en el sÃ³tano sin ventanas y todo temblaba cada vez que pasaba el metro, parecia irreal. La litera era incomoda y hacia mucho ruido. Para rematar habÃ­a una Ãºnica luz en la habitaciÃ³n en vez de una pequeÃ±a lÃ¡mpara por cada cama y exactamente lo mismo con los enchufes. El staff era muy amable.

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: Great location, good price. Will return!

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: Although cheap and located near Kings Cross, I've never had such a bad nights sleep. I'm deaf yet the room was right next to a bar and club so the noise and bass vibrations was so unbearable. This hostel would be great if you were drunk enough to pass out. Everyone else is doomed.

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: Very misleading pictures, basement setup with only 2 super small showers for the whole hostel. Small community room with constant smell of weed

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: Good solid hostel nothing fancy but has everything's no you'd want/expect from a hostel. Amazing location as you could walk to heaps of good spots and anything else is easily accessible from kings cross a stones throw away. Also right next to a Sainsbury's which is handy. Private rooms and common area are downstairs which makes them feel a little cramped and dark but it does keep the noise from the big street out so that's a plus. Dunno bout the dorms but would book a twin room again

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext:
Excellent location to bus and underground. Flexible time to put luggage there.
However, there is a difference between the previous photos we saw online (twin beds) and the actual room we got (bunk beds), which is a bit pity though.

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext:
Bathrooms were clean
Bedding was clean
Bed comfy
Good value for money
Only downside was the heating was on too high, the dormitory was far too hot.

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: Great location, friendly staff and great value for money. Wouls stay here again and can highly recommend!

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext:
I didn't actually stay overnight as on the train to London I found I had an email saying I needed photo ID such as a passport, and if I didn't have it, i wouldn't be allowed to stay.  Well, I didn't (having set off already) so I emailed to cancel my booking and booked somewhere else.  So I can't actually comment on anything else, but it was a good price and the location was great for King's Cross.

So, rather than an email asking about my stay, I'd prefer my refund that I asked for, and they sho

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: Arrived to find reception empty, and waited 15 minutes before someone arrived to help us. The entrance door to the dorm areas was locked and could only be opened by a key fob, which we were not given. "Fair enough" we thought "We're only here for one night" However, once we got through the door we realised that you not only needed a fob to enter, you needed one to exit as well. We had to bug the receptionist for a fob, as we were leaving at 5am and didn't want to be stuck waiting to be let out.

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: There is some construction going on and the four bedroom dorm I stayed was locked and don't have a ventilation. Because of this the room has a foul smell, if we open the windows it will be fine. An AC is provided and will be very useful during the nights when the windows were closed. Air circulation is very bad. The location is great and staff are reallly friendly.

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: Wifi is nearly non-existent. Slow as snail, connected but can't open a webpage. Grr

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext:
To be honest the check in time has to more flexible. I tried to convince the employee working there that I need to check in because I had a lecture on the day of my arrival.
The room wasn't clean there was hair everywhere in the room. No windows only a skylight that cannot be closed, so in the morning it feels like I turned on the fluorescent light on. Electric plugs were loose, the drainage system in the shower was horrible, water was on for 5 minutes and the showerbox filled with a water pool

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext:
The location is the best thing about this hostel, it's just stones throw from King's Cross/St. Pancras, there is a Tesco Metro around the corner. 

The room had some empty glasses and labels, felt like it wasn't hovered in a few weeks. The WiFi was very slow in the room but worked well at reception. 

The most disappointing part of our stay was the atmosphere. The 'rooftop terrace bar' advertised is not accessible from the hostel, you have to go to a bar next door and the common area is tiny

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: You get what you pay for. If you need a place to crash for a night to catch an early train out of King's Cross, you won't die here. Yay. Will you feel refreshed after sleeping in creaky, dirty  bunk beds with questionably smelling bedding/carpeting? No. Spend and extra Â£10 and go elsewhere. You will have to pay Â£5 for a towel and Â£5 to rent a padlock for a locker smaller than any carry on suitcases anyways, so might as well

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: The double Room was really Tiny and the bed was squeaking a lot and the Windows Didnt cancel out the noice outside but the location was great

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: Really lovely staff in a brilliant location. Very basic but for the price can't complain at all. Private rooms are very clean but showers/toilets could be better. Make sure you check windows are shut at night as it's on a very busy road and the builders outside kept opening ours!

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: good stay and nights sleep, nice shower, nearby shops and 24hr, very close to station and underground, friendly atmosphere

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: Great location (especially when catching early morning trains). You walk out the door and are right in front of Kings Cross/St Pancras. Nothing much to criticise other than that our room had no windows and got pretty stuffy. It could have been a bit cleaner. By no means did I have a fantastic stay, but it was decent.

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: Very cold, unwelcoming staff. Mold in the shower. Incredibly uncomfortable bed. Overcharges for luggage storage and late checkout. Overall a very cramped, dirty feeling. Definitely not a good value!

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: Great location. Nice staff. They had run out of towels earlier in the day, but it worked out for us. 1 night in a private twin room with my mom was perfect. Would probably even stay for a longer period.

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: Glad I only stayed one night, the bathrooms were really gross. Condom wrappers and hair all over. People were running through the hallways yelling all night. Two power sockets in the bedroom but one was only accessible if you were sleeping in that specific bunk. Staff were nice and the location was great but I wouldn't stay again unless I had to, there's nicer places nearby

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: Bathroom was tiny and dirty, staff promised me an all female room and then went back on their word and said there were no female rooms available because of construction. You also have to pay extra for a lock and a towel (5 euros for each)

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext:
Helpful staff and nice showers as well as toilets; hair driers were provided which was nice.
The mattress was outdated, the room crammed, very loud due to the busy street and the common area a bit dodgy. 
Ok for one night and very easy for connections as it is right outside of Kings Cross Station.

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: I enjoyed my stay at this hostel. I found the staff to be friendly. The hostel in a grate location. Room was nice, and bed was comfortable to sleep in.  Will definitely be staying there again.

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: The hostel is nice and the facility are nice the staff is friendly. some stuff has been stolen during my stay so people if you stay here lock everything up in the lockers and be on guard.

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: My stay was great.it is near the station,food nearby really nice especially at 8 oclock.staff really helpful.

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: Everything was pretty sound other than I've been violated by bed bugs

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext:
This hostel has declined in the 6 months since I was last there
It wasn't as clean ðŸ˜¢
I felt a bit let down as it was spotless clean in February

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: The beds are very comfortable, and the bathrooms are very well-organized and clean. The staff was very receptive and nice, helping with anything. The rooms do not have a very good air circulation despite the A.C., so the room sometimes smells like feet. But you quickly get used to it (if you are used to hostels). I recommend it.

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: I stayed in an en suite with a friend for 2 nights. We had no window in our room, which was already noticed when we booked but it was not as bad as one could think. Therefore the room and the modern bathroom was very clean. The old spring mattresses were topped with an thick overlay, which made the bed very comfortable (bunk bed). The only drawback was that we neither had towels nor soap in the bathroom, which we had to additionally rent from the reception.

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: Overall, this stay was an amazing experience! Great staff and great location!

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: As basic as it gets. We had a private room with ensuite. The room itself was a mere 8' x 8' with twin bunk beds! Not comfortable at all, but convenient to the train station and with a multitude of shops, markets, and restaurants very close by.

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: Clean, convenient, safe and easy to find. Couldn't have needed anything else!

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: This hostel was awful. The room was smelly, I did not felt that it was clean. I booked for 2 nights but I only stayed 1 and they did not wanted to refund any amount of money. I recommend to check for other hostels, this one is a NO NO, at least for me...

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: Really enjoyed my stay at Keystone. Very clean rooms and comfortable beds. The location is perfect and central for such a good value. Would stay again

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: Good hostel to crash overnight when in  London, location is close to the train station.  Don't expect any hostel experience, you arrive and then you get out and explore London.

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: I didn't feel that the staff were super welcoming or helpful, I was kind of left to just figure things out (ie. how to find my room, bathrooms, common areas, etc.). The rooms were outdated and didn't look like they were cared for that well- mine was missing a lot of paint, and the mattresses were very uncomfortable. However, they were  very clean. The bathrooms were updated and very clean as well. This hostel has no social life whatsoever, but it is in an absolute perfect location.

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext:
Good stop off for St Pancras. I only stayed over night to get a early morning train from St Pancras- which is a 5 minute walk away.

Its nothing special - with a small kitchen area with a few sofas and table & chairs. The beds were okay - it really is just a stop over place and it did its job.

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: The rooms were not clean at all, the beds were very uncomfortable, the hostel was very loud until early in the morning, and items in the room were broken.

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: Alcohol-free hostel. Tiny stairs to get to the upper floors. They did not look too safe. Bathrooms upstairs were nice and new, however bathrooms downstairs towards the lounge looked old and dirty. Rooms were okay, at best. Common area was at the bottom, all the way in the back of the building. Smelled like mildew and common room was very small. There was no coffee for the 3 days I was there (empty jar). No oven just a microwave.

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: Great location, friendly staff, room was small but functional.  The price was right and I felt safe.   5Â£ for a cheap towel was too much.

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext:
This Hostel was an emergency back up as my initially booked room elsewhere was absolutely horrific. 
I was able to find a private room with two beds, right outside St Pancras for less than Â£60 which was perfect.
I arrived, and was given the brief housekeeping and left to find my room. 
The room was small and clean, with a little window and air con! 
The showers was also very clean, the seperate toilets were clean. There is apparently common rooms and a terrace but we didn't' stick about much.

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext:
The first time we check in I was givena room on the 1st floor with an attachment shower and toilet which is spacious despite the room was small. But it is clean.
The second time i checked in, 3 days after the first time it was at the basement and only with a toilet. And near the canteen. Not condusive and the toilet is not so clean

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: Everything was of a high standard the room was clean bathroom was clean to a high standard

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: A nice quiet hostel with very comfortable beds. My partner and I came to London during a few very warm days, so the air conditioning in the room was a nice surprise. Kitchen had two small fridges so we were never at a loss for space, however it did lack a stovetop so cooking wasn't the best option for dinner. The showers were always clean but also quite small, but that wasn't much of an issue. Overall a very pleasant stay and we plan on going back.

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: I thought this hostel was excellent, clean, comfortable, friendly, and in a good location near to main stations. (Euston and St. Pancras). Really enjoyed my stay there, and will be staying again on future trips to London.

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: Location is absolutely wonderful. Especially if you are getting a train at Kings Cross or want to travel around with the subway because it's across the street. The A/C in our room was broken though and our room was absolutely boiling which the staff didn't tell us until the middle of the night when we came to reception to get it fixed. They brought us fans but it was an ordeal

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: Nice place

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: Best King cross hostel. The room are clean and you can store your items safely.

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext:
The online hostel information was not accurate. Wifi is available on the premises but not in the first floor, double-occupancy rooms. Reliable wifi is only available in the lobby.
Laundry services are not available onsite for a fee as described. Services are  actually located down the street for about 10 quid depending on your need. 
Breakfast is not served onsite. It is located at the cafe nearby. This inaccurate, false advertising was deeply frustrating during our stay.

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: Loved our stay here: it was a great value for the quality. The staff was welcoming and friendly, the bed was SO comfortable, and although there was an unforeseeable issue with our shower, such is the nature of an old building, and everything was handled in a very quick and respectful manner by extremely kind people. We used the common shower in lieu of our en suite one, and that was really nice and brand new. Was the perfect place for a quick stay to take the stress off of catching our train.

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: When I went back to my room on my last night at the hostel, they had me changed room from 4-bed to 8-bed said to be because of maintenance. But I had left my bags in the locker and small stuffs on and under my bed. So I went into the room and found that everything is nice and clean ready to have new guests to the room and I LOST my all of stuffs outside the locker. It wasnt okay at all.

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: Overall Keystone is a hostel that is to sleep and leave and explore right away. AMAZING LOCATION. 4 minute walk to King's Cross Station. Although the staff is very accommodating and sweet, the facilities all over the entire hostel have a lingering pungent musty smell that makes it hard to walk into any room. My linens both times were not clean when I had issues with my first bed and was moved to a private room- but when I inspected the sheets there was a good amount of random debis in it still.

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: Very good value for central London, the rooms are bright and airy beds are comfortable. A nice change from some of the older hostels in the area.

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: staff were engaging friendly and helpful.  rooms were tidy and showers were good quality.    location is great.   would recommend and would stay again.

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: The staff was generally super nice and helpful! It has a great location, with a great breakfast place next door. I was not pleased with the cleanliness level - there was a lot of dust, gnats in our room, and spiderwebs in various places in the room and bathroom! There also were fees that I didn't expect (though I must admit they were probably somewhere on the website or something) - we had to pay 5 pounds for a (very thin) towel, and they charge 5 pounds per bag for luggage storage on moveout.

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: Fantastic location steps from Zone 1 Kings Cross San Pancras train station. We came to visit London and were 5 to 10 minutes train ride from everything we wanted to see - Hop On Hop Off Bus, Tower of London, London Bridge, Oxford shopping, the speed train to Paris. The hostel itself was very clean and had a discount for a very nice breakfast at a local cafe. The employees were very helpful and available around the clock. The Wifi was strong in the lobby but not consistent in the rooms,

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: On entry nobody was at reception so I was going airing outside for five minutes.The hostel inner dormetry key pass was broken, the air conditioning was broken and I was woken several times while they attempted to fix this, it should have been checked before. What looked like dried blood was on my pillow. The bathrooms (omega one) stunk overwhelmingly of mould.

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: The staff are nice and the location is incredible. However, I got severe bed bugs during my one night stay. Because they have no laundry facilities the hostel sent my stuff away to be cleaned however it ended up taking over 12 hours arriving back at after 7pm when I was originally told 12pm. I get that this is a situation out of their control but this really messed up my day and will dampen the next week if not more of my trip. Would of appreciated a little more empathy. Disappointed.

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: Excellent location, we had a 6.45am train to catch and this place is right next to St Pancras so was no brainer booking. 5 minute walk if that to the station if that, facilities are clean and well maintained and rooms have AC.

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: The rooms seem to be all underground with no natural light and air-fresheners concealing some unpleasant odours. However the room was clean and the facilities are fine for a few nights' stay. Good valie for money for the location.

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: It is always a good place.,

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: Location was good and the staff were helpful, but that was the only good thing. My private room had a bad mold issue, water was leaking from somewhere that left the carpet very wet, which I only discovered when leaving as my suitcase was over it and wet all underneath (although clearly an ongoing problem as you can see where the carpet has been cut out previously) and extremely thin walls that meant I could hear everything the girls next door were saying.

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: Hostel has air conditioning and will store your luggage for you even after check out (for a fee). Very close to major transport and lots of food options. (Fyi: towels are not included)

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: This hostel was easy to find from kings cross station. The showers were clean and well looked after which I appreciated.

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext:
Room was not ready at check-in time. I had to wait more than an hour to enter in my room.

Perfect Cleanliness. Excellent toilettes. Comfortable bed.

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: Good value for money. Its ok for 1-2 nights.

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: Overall this hostel was very nice and comfortable. Very nice AC and rooms. The bathrooms could've been cleaner and the showers are quite small. Located in a nice part of kings cross and close to transportation but semi far from everything in London. Also, which it is my fault for not reading and reviewing but there is no age limit. Me and my sister were in a 4 person room and two men 40+ checked in at 2am and were put in our room. Once again my fault for not checking but still uncomfortable.

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext:
Ideal spot for a short stay in London as the location offers easy access to the underground. Also lots of bars and restaurants around. 
The beds were ok but the space was cramped, let down was that there weren't individual plugs or night lights. 
Facilities were good, showers offered a space to dry off and change. 
Not a hostle for socialising the common areas were very small. 
Overall if you are there briefly and need easy access to central London keystone is fine.

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext:
showers were excellent. plenty available and well designed. good lighting. 
breakfast room . there needs to be more choice for breakfast.  we need wholemeal bread for those that cant take white bread. we also need  soya milk as an alternative.

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext:
Slept one night there on a private room and was ðŸ‘ˆ with bedbugs. Rooms and facilities on the basement seemed ran down.
There was a noisy air outlet in my room and a bright emergency light that was on all night.
Better spend a few hours bit more I think a better place.

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: A fantastic stay in London, the location couldn't be better in terms of the number of Underground lines, restaurants and close to the city core. Me and my boyfriend had a nice stay in a private room, the staff gave us a lot of help when we needed it and we liked that we could have some breakfast (even though it's quite simple) for free, which is not the case at many other hostels. Can recommend this hostel to anyone, especially those who want it a bit more quiet and easy-going.

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: Really convenient with super helpful staff

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: This hostel is really central and easy to locate. In general the staff were helpful with food recommendations etc. Nice washrooms. Unfortunately there was a pretty serious bed bug incident while we were present that affected multiple beds in the female dorm. The manager dealt with it fairly well, and was apologetic however I feel like there should have been greater urgency to resolve situation and staff should check beds more often.

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: Great location, friendly staff, easy to find, many shops nearby, clean

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: By far one of the top hostels I've ever been to. Thumbs up for its location and its cleanliness !

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: Least attractive hostel in years. Location wqs excellent, but that was it.

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: Hostel asks Â£5 for storage room on your check out which is a hidden fee and uncommon for any accommodation. Showers and bathrooms are not cleaned often and toilets and drains were blocked and filthy with hair and papers, lots of flies in the rooms. Staff was not welcoming to let you in till 14:00 although rooms were empty. Lockers are very narrow in the rooms and not- the gold standard nowadays- spacious under the bed that you can easily put in your belongings.

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: Good location. very clean.

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: The location was perfect due to it being so close to King's cross was also value for money and everyone was welcoming .only thing was probably the showers as they could of been cleaner but overall was definitely worth it.

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext:
Very basic hostel for what you pay. 
No atmosphere at all. Close to the main London attractions by subway or hire a bike. Room I had was no air con on a hot few days. Had to leave the window open but was very noisy with the street traffic, sirens and loud people outside. Lots of older people were around also so mustn't enforce any age limit.

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: Never expected that the 16beds room is more comfort than the 4beds room because of the air conditioner. The bed is very comfort. Remember to request the room with AC while you stay in summer.

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: Over priced ...very unfair on pricing...the price you pay dont match what you get...another hostel is half price (nearby) and is similliar level of quality....it was unclean also apart from bathrooms. There are levels of quality and prices should be charged fairly. You should not sell rubbish for the price of gold. I would say half the price would be fair and i would have no complaints if i paid half of what i did...you get what you pay for applies...in this case you dont get what you pay for.

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: The road noise was fairly loud, even from the 2nd floor. My assigned bed was occupied already upon arriving. The only compliment I can give is that the renovated showers are nice.

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: The worst place I've ever stayed in, and I've been to many places and stayed in many hostels. Got the room in the most top level (no lift, super narrow and steep staircases). The room we stayed in was room 3A (dusty, old and broken furniture, looks like a really old room that hasn't been maintained in ages). Kitchen and common area is down below ground level so it's super inconvenient for you to prepare meal/chill etc. The reception smells like cigarettes, and the staff wasn't very welcoming.

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext:
Good: A decent value for the money - the beds were clean, sheets were clean, the room was clean and there are upright lockers for storage-padlock only. New showers and bathrooms are pretty awesome - nicest I've seen in a Hostel; recently refurbished.  Wi-Fi worked well.
Bad: The older shower/bathroom units near our room had mold and were not cleaned well.  I was there multiple days and can attest to this. Common area floors were not vacuumed. New shower floors weren't cleaned. Noisy. Broken A/C.

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: Amazing location right by King's Cross. Good, spacious rooms.  Nice extras like breakfast. Didn't spend much time in the hostel but seemed good.

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: My mum and I stayed here on a Saturday night on my way back from France. We caught the Eurostar from Marseille to St Pancreas, London. We arrived into London at 10 pm ish and made our way to the hostel, it is literally 6 min walk from St Pancreas International (Perfect if you have lots of bags travelling through London). We were greeted by two friendly staff members on reception. We stayed in a 16bed female dorm which was quiet, the air con was too cold as I was right underneath it! Fab hostel.

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: I booked a 4 people room with private toilet. Unfortunately the room is totally different with the photo shown online, but overall the hostel is still good. Great location, nearby king cross st'pancaras station. The room also provide air conditioner.

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
