reviewtext: Great spot for savvy travellers looking for a place to crash and easy access to all that London has to offer. The price is good for London and being next to Kings Cross means quick travel anywhere you want to go. Unfortunately  the common area/kitchen is in the basement and some of the facility is in need of repair, in fact, someone was renovating one of the showers while we were there. Basement air is very good in spite of there being no windows. Bed was comfy. Pillows were too flat.

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: Luggage room safety and in-room lockers feel safe. Although rooms are very congested. Only 1 very small shower room for all the lower ground floor rooms which makes you to follow a queue however urgent you are. Post check out, if you keep your luggage then they charge 5 GBP per day. I was in lower floor rooms and you actually hear London underground trains travelling under you. If you have problem in sleep if you hear slightest of the noise, I wouldn't recommend but this is not that loud.

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: If you stay here, it is for the LOCATION, which is unparalleled in how close it is to a tube station. The toilets and showers were extremely well kept and clean, but they were the only areas that were. The kitchen/common area is pretty difficult to get to, and residents must wash all the utensils after using them. There is a left luggage room that is supposed to be locked at all times, but instead the door was left wide open, which worried me a lot.

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: One of the worst.. no, it is the worst hostel I've ever stayed! will not come back again. Only good thing is the location and staff's not bad attitude. Limited space, rubbish facilities (bed, no charger, 1 square meter bathroom)..........

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: The location was right next to the train station but it was so loud. There wasnt lockers in the rooms, the place looked really run down, the kitchen was very small and was also the common room, this wasn't a place to meet other travelers if you were a solo traveler.

name: Keystone House Kings Cross
reviewtext: I really enjoyed my time here! The hostel is right by Kings Cross station which is a main hub for anywhere you need to go. The hostel had an old school vibe, but the washrooms and shower rooms were newly renovated and very very clean. Best shower I've had all trip! Free breakfast was appreciated - only wished there was a bit more common space! Would certainly stay again!

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext: Unfortunately doesn't have a good internet connection.

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext: The staff here were great and they were willing to help you with just about anything. The beds were all very comfortable with USB ports on every bed, which was very useful. The only complaints that I'd have are that the hostel was quite a ways away from the nearest tube station and that the security lockers weren't for all your stuff, but rather just for a wallet and passport. Otherwise I'd say it was pretty good!

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext:
I only have two complaints that they can actually do anything about: 1) they didn't always keep to their scheduled events, which since I was traveling alone it would have been great to be able to join some of them. 2) the under bed storage did not lock, so you just had to hope that your roommates wouldn't steal your clothes.

The other complaints were of my roommates not knowing how to be good roommates, and the hostel can't do anything about that. Otherwise it was a perfect location for me.

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext: On our first night staying at the hostel we had been put in a room where members of staff  where staying long term. Therefore the room had a very lived in feel that was not at all what you would like in a short stay. The carpet in the room was  dirty  and the ladders had been removed from the bed making it very difficult to get to the top bunk. There was also only one bathroom for the whole of floor five. I asked to change room and was told I couldn't until the second night. Unpleasant stay.

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext: Great hostel overall! No major complaints of any kind!

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext:
The hostel is located in a quiet and nice neighborhood, the building and facilities are well preserved with excellent conditions. 
Upon our arrival, the friendly staff helped with the whereabouts and directions to the nicest places in London. It only takes a nice 5 minutes walk to the tube or one of 3 free museums around.
Manuel and Rui were very kind throughout our stay. =)
I highly recommend this place, we will come back for sure.

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext: Nice place, wish it was closer to the underground but not a bad walk to get there

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext: this is the best hostel I have stayed in lovely place fantastic area. only downsize is long walk to the tube

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext: Staff were friendly and willing to help us out with whatever issues we faced. Bed was a little small for my friend(who is 6 ft tall) and hence, he had some difficulty sleeping at night. I'd say that if your height is below 5 ft 10 inches, you should be able to fit into the bed comfortably. They charge 5 pounds as security deposit for the key card and another 5 pound security deposit per padlock you take from them. However, this is refundable at the time of checkout. Great location near Hyde Park

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext: Lovely lovely lovely

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext: We like the hostel but sometimes the bathroom smelled bad

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext: Amazing first time hostel experience. Great location, great value for money. Hostel is clean and spacious. Only negative feedback would be that there's no lift to get to the top floors, so bear that in mind with your luggage. Would definitely come again.

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext: Great location and great price! Freindly staff.

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext: Nice, clean hostel in a good location, close to many museums. Dorms could be a bit bigger and would be nice with lockers in the rooms. Breakfast was exquisite!

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext: Great location, good value, perfect for my needs. My bunk had a locker, reading light and personal powerpoint. Very close to Hyde Park, was easy to walk to lots of museums and sights. Didn't have much contact with the staff, and wasn't an overly social hostel. Overall, would choose to stay here again if I return to London.

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext: I had a great time! I wasn't looking for a social atmosphere because I was meeting up with friends, but everyone was very friendly! I do wish the shower was separate from the toilet, but other than that, the facilities were clean and I had a safe place to sleep!

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext: Convenient location. Staff helpful but not really friendly. Beds are comfortable and modern with USB port and compartments underneath for luggage. What would make them even better? The ability to lock them. There are lockers in reception but they are quite small and not enough for everyone. I had to carry mine around all day. The ensuite bathroom was DISGUSTING and smelled like urine. Shelf on my bed covered in dust. Not lockers and the cleanliness were a big negative for me.

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext: Such a great place. This was the very first hostel that I've stayed at, and it was so reassuring when meeting the staff and roommates!

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext:
Pros: 
Good location next to museums in London. 
Good price. 
Large fan in room.
Secure entry and storage.
Had respectful room mates.
Free breakfast.
Thanks to the loud fan, I did get my best sleep here. 

Cons:
Least clean of 3 hostels I stayed in on my 11 day trip.
Moldy shower, only shower was ice cold. Could have been fixed by telling them, I was told. 
WiFi was non existent in my room. 
Bed felt a bit small.

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext: This is my 2nd time staying here and I really enjoy it. The location is fabulous! I love being near Hyde Park, and you can easily cross over it to get to Bayswater and Oxford. As well, the neighbourhood the hostel is in is in itself a great neighbourhood. I LOVE that the hostel is on the Picadilly Underground line, which goes directly to Heathrow airport. Only negatives: 1) no plug for your phone by your bed. Have to plug it in at a communal area of the room. 2) Hard mattresses and thin pillows.

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext:
Located right by Hyde park. 10-15 minutes from tube stations by foot. About the same to groceries too. Old building, tons of character. Staff were good, but not the nicest at times.

There was a bandaid and q-tip on the headrest of my bunk. Pretty gross. Bathroom was shared and doesn't scream "clean", but was adequate.

Nice common spaces, with coin laundry and decent kitchen.

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext: Paid for the private room.  Comforters and beds seems/looked dirt. No towels even in the private room. Did not have pounds for a deposit on the room key so I left an ID which I understand but when I needed an adaptor they made me put a second ID down. Said check in was at 2 but really were ready until 2:25 and were not friendly.

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext:
Atmosphere was good. It was a bit far from station but there are good museums near the hostel.
When I and some people were eating dinner at dining by the kitchen, a staff started cleaning vacuum cleaner...so dusty!!!!

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext: Hostel was very nice and the staff service was top notch. However the kitchen was quite dirty, and there were minimal amounts of clean utensils. Assides from this, the staff were very helpful when I had to check out at 5am to catch a flight.

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext: The location is perfect, I felt very safe and the room was really comfortable. Amazing experience! I would definitely stay there again!

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext: This hostel is very established and efficient. I loved the charity breakfast that was available every morning for just 1 pound donation. Staff were very willing to help and knowledgable about transport and attractions. Comfy beds, clean room, and such a great location right next to Hyde Park! My only criticism would be that the room only had an ensuite bathroom rather than a shower block. So if you are up last you potentially have to wait for 11 other people to use the bathroom first.

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext: The atmosphere was weird. Lots of old people and not good for socialising. The staff were either rude or untrained. They blocked off one of the main social areas to practice their music for their performance that night-super awkward. The mats in the bathroom were stinky and dirty. The location was away from everything but Hyde Park-no grocery stores nearby and a longer walk to the underground. The beds are sturdy but one of the wooden lockers didn't work. Stay elsewhere if you can afford it.

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext:
Honestly, I don't have a bad word to say about this hostel. The location is fantastic. the staff are incredibly friendly and very helpful. Another major benefit was the pricing. The hostel is very affordable and the value for money is fantastic. For anyone struggling to find accommodation in London where affordable hotels, apartments and hostels are hard to come by at the best of times, look no further than Astor Hyde Park. 
Thank you to all the staff who helped make our stay so memorable.

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext: The free breakfast is really great and the wifi is good. I was in the big mixed dorm room and there was two bathroom/shower rooms, so they got pretty dirty at the end of the day. There's no AC, which isn't a big deal normally but with this extra hot summer, the one fan in the room didn't do much. Not many bars or places to eat very close but having the park across the street was very nice!

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext: The events that were promoted, didn't take place and there were no plugs by the bed. Otherwise nice kitchen with microwave and comfy room.

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext: Very nice location. Out of the normal tourist area. The staff was very helpful when the toilet clogged. Breakfast is 1 euro for donation to charity but you have to get there early or there will be nothing left but toast. Would stay there again.

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext: This was a really nice place to stay! We had issues with plumbing late at night but staff was able to help us very quickly! The heat wave is killer so more fans in our room (16 person room) would have been nice. Overall safe and the people were friendly.

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext: I loved waking up early and walking to Hyde Park before breakfast! The lounge and kitchen were nice for unwinding too. BUT the bathroom/shower attached to my 10-bunk room was so cramped and gross I didn't feel clean after showering or like there was anywhere to put my stuff. Be sure to bring shower sandals if you're staying here! And maybe pick somewhere else if you're looking for a social vibe - everyone sort of did their own thing when I was there. It's a very touristy area.

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext: I stayed here for a week in a 6 bed mixed dorm. The beds were comfy, the room had large roll out lockers under the bed, the room was a bit hard to get air through because the windows are tethered to only open half way, not great in 30+ heat. Beds were already made, most of the staff were friendly and up for a chat, big clean kitchen, there are a few guitars and a piano laying around. The events are good, but dont always happen, people just dont rock up. There are lot of stairs. Brekky is great!

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext: As hostels go, this one is pretty standard, but the benefits here are the location (POSH AF Kensington) and the old fancy building. They also only charge a deposit for locks and adaptors, etc. and you can bring in your own food.  Everyone was pleasant and they even took my luggage up to my room for me, which is a first for me so far as hostels go. Yes it's hot in the rooms; IT'S SUMMER! En suite bathroom smelled moldy/funky and the room's one outlet situation was not great.

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext: When I arrived at 11.30pm  after a long journey from Devon. I was turned away in the middle of the night as I did not have my passport with me. On the booking in the small print apparently this is shown but it should be made a lot more obvious. There surely could have been some way to help me and not leave me in the middle of London without anywhere to stay.  Why couldn't I have sent a photocopy the following day?

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext: I stayed in a 6 bedroom all female room and it was a bit crowded and extremely hot! They have a great breakfast in the morning for a small donation which is nice. There is a good atmosphere in the hostel and people from all over. Some of the staff seemed unfamiliar with the area when I asked questions.

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext: My favourite hostel  central to everywhere in london

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext: I stayed here for 4 nights and extended my stay for 4 more.. loved every bit of it . Amazing and friendly  staff they are available 24Ã—7 for any help. Rooms and beds are very comfortable. Great people around , located in central cant ask for more. Home away from home

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext:
Pros: the location is great, and they have locks (with a deposit) and towels for 1 pound. Also they can print for you and have luggage storage as well as storage under the beds. 
Cons: the rooms are tiny and the bathrooms are dirty (smells awful, the shower drain is clogged and overflows after 4 minutes). Some of the staff seemed to be annoyed by your presence.

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext: The dorm rooms were lacking. One outlet on one side of room instead of one each by beds. There were no shelves next to beds to place personal items and no personal light. The ensuite shower/toilet was same room and very small - nowhere to set any toiletries down while washing up. Shower was so small - and nowhere to put shampoo/soap. Only a curtain on the shower - so water leaked out and floor of shower/toilet room was always wet and got tracked into bedroom. Also rooms were not very clean.

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext:
Pros: great location, charity breakfast, cool old building 

Cons: too many beds in a very small room, bathrooms really needed cleaned, an entire school group of young teenagers was staying at the time...

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext:
Awesome location, clean and spacious rooms (9 bed dorm) 
Friendly staff and cool little common room
Bathrooms could do with a decent clean though
Great value for money

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext: I loved it! Made so many friends over there! The staff want to do the best for you, the kitchen was clean to cook, the lounge was really cool to chill out a bit, it's in a pretty quiet environment of London next to Hyde Park which is a beautiful place to relax. The experience I had with the hostel is one I will never forget...

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext: this place is a little pricey compared to others in London, but worth it for a night or two. The staff was friendly and welcoming. We loved our stay! But if u are looking to just save money, there are probably better options.

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext: Great hostel in a really characterful building. Friendly staff and kept nice and clean. The only annoyance was that 'my' dorm had 3 tier bunks in, with only two lockable drawers to each set of three bunks, so extra storage/lockers in the rooms would have been useful. Located on a quiet street, but worth knowing that the nearest shops that I could find are a 10 minute walk away. Breakfast was great value!

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext: Nice place to spend a few nights. location is excellent but about 15-20 min walk from nearest tube station. Good dorms with clean washrooms. Basic breakfast provided for free(1 pound goes to charity). Only major problem I faced is that no lift available to carry luggage all the way till 4/5th floor. Rest is all good.

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext: Nice place really, central location but not so great for tube links and no shops that near by. Expected more for the price to be honest, it is clean but no plugs by the beds and lots of stairs. Unfriendly female night staff. At least the atmosphere between guests is good!

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext: Great place, super clean, luggage storage available and decent breakfast. Get down early if you want any fruit. Easy access to transportation to get around the city. Fan was appreciated in the heat. Pricey but expected for London. Would stay here again!

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext: Really good overall. Location is not convenient for the Tube, but great for local attractions and easy on the buses. Highly recommended.

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext: I was amazed by the free breakfast and the friendly people faces that I met. The building is amazing and it looks more as an hotel. I strongly recommend.

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext: Incredibly hot, location relatively far away and an especially small and cramped room relative to many I've stayed in through Europe. Staff was kind though!

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext: I stayed in the six-beds room. The room size is decent and beds are okay. The weather was very hot during the time I stayed and there was a big fan in the room, but the room's temperature was very hot and humid. The toilet as well was smelly and not very clean. Staff were helpful but not very friendly, when I popped by the reception couple of times. Overall, it is an above average hostel and I would not mind staying there again if I am around the area and have no other options.

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext:
This is Bogdan....
Good quality hostel with top quality people !

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext: The locality is quite good and it is reachable via south Kensington and Hyde Park corner tube stations, it takes 25 mins to walk but there are other options like buses and cabs of course. The conditions of the rooms was good and quite clean although I think more ventilation is required during summers. There is only one small bathroom/toilet combo for 12 people which z concerning. Staff are cooperative but friendliness/chirpiness was missing. Overall a very good option for short stays.

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext: Great hostel experience! Very nice place to stay. Very convenient that the locks, adapters, and towels were available for just a small deposit. The staff was very helpful.

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext: Was pleasantly surprised by this hostel. It's a bit of a hike from the closest tube but it's in such a quiet, stunning part of London, and super close to some of the major museums. Would stay again.

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext:
Worst hostel i have ever stayed at. Staff was so rude and made me feel like I shouldn't of been there. 

Terrible atmosphere. 

Dirty kitchen.

Extremely uncomfortable beds.

DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOSTEL!!!!

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext: Great value for money.

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext: Great hostel. Right near hyde park which was awesome. However it should be noted that it's in an expensive area so if you're wanting cheaper food you'll have to travel.

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext: Nice hostel in a beautiful old building. Close to the park so you can take a break from crazy London

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext:
The friendliness and  willingness of the staff is excellent.

I too was worried it'd be too hot but rooms had fans and windows. No outlets near beds.
toilet problem is so systematic that there are signs in the bathrooms to advise the front desk if gets clogged again- gross.
Breakfast is bread and cereal essentially. It is free though, so it's a nice gesture, just plan accordingly.
Kitchen is excellent w/ great cooking stuff. Common area is as nice as the photos say. Bus service nearby is superb.

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext: Really clean, good bathrooms and kitchen. The lounge area looks really nice. Not much going on socially, so I wouldn't recommend in terms of atmosphere. It was pretty quiet, even on a Saturday night. And no one in my room seemed interested in socialising.

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext:
Good parts
- Nice common areas
- Nice neighbourhood
- People staying are generally of a decent calibre

The bad
- Standards have increased over time, and not providing a charger/light for every bed is an endemic issue until they renovate all their hostels
- Old building, stairs only across 5 levels
- Staff seem to be suffering a case of burnout, enthusiasm for the job about as British as you can get
- Tied to the above, cleanliness wrt to bathrooms also an issue

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext: Every time I visit London I make sure to stay here. Great location, great facilities, great atmosphere and great staff. A big thank you to all The staff for another fantastic stay, cannot wait to come back again.

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext:
There's no reason not to stay here, it's perfect location (walking distance to museums, Hyde park, tube station), staff is helpful and friendly 24/7, donation-based breakfast is nice and hearty, rooms are nice, beds are comfortable, common space is nice and air-conditioned. 

Note (not the hostel's fault at all) if you're arriving late from Gatwick, transit can be expensive and long as the train stops running after a certain hour. Just take care to plan accordingly.

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext: Not a great hostel overall. Firstly, it is not unclean, which is good, but the room was small (even by hostel standards) and felt very dark and claustrophobic. Location is okay, South Kensington is lovely, but there's not much around. It's about a 15 min walk to the tube, fine in summer but in winter would be a nightmare. Some of the staff were friendly, some not. Overall, I'd say book somewhere else in London. It's a great city, and this hostel will not endear you to it in the slightest.

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext: Great location, excellent price, and a bed that is solidly built and doesn't squeak! What more could you ask for?

name: Astor Hyde Park
reviewtext: Staff and management rude and unhelpful. Toilet was slowly leaking everyday, so by the evening there was a puddle in the bathroom from toilet, not pleasant. My locker was broken and was given no alternative. Internet was slow and couldn't send any emails using their wifi setup. Advertised computers were also unavailable during my stay. Only thing saving this place is its good location.

name: The Dictionary Hostel, Shoreditch, London
reviewtext:
Great location, but the rooms were so dusty and dirty they need to be cleaned better, it looked like it had never been mopped and dust had been left for months to gather! The bathroom was particularly bad with damp and mold. 
I'm not the only one who felt like this other girls in my dorm were complaining about it too!

name: The Dictionary Hostel, Shoreditch, London
reviewtext:
Room really dirty, floor looks like havent been washed since opening, lots of rubbish behind bunk bed, disgusting

most of the time toilet and showers are in really unusable conditions 

Noizy, night club next door open till 3AM, music can enjoy music eith low bass in your room for free!
 alots of dodgy and drunk people around hostel due those night venues

staff friendly and helpful, location ok

name: The Dictionary Hostel, Shoreditch, London
reviewtext: Great little hostel, showers are tiny with no room to get dressed in but otherwise, good place to stay.

name: The Dictionary Hostel, Shoreditch, London
reviewtext: It's a decent hostel, good value for money, but not exceptional. A washing machine is claimed but this is not true. There is a launderette next door but it has only 3 machines and when I visited, 2 of them were out of order. No detergent is on sale. If you want to do laundry, you need to find another launderette

name: The Dictionary Hostel, Shoreditch, London
reviewtext:
Hole/leak in the ceiling of room C meaning at least 2 beds are completely unusable. Only one toilet in a room of 16 invariably led to a an unpleasent smell through the door into the toilet/shower area. Showerheads not attached to the wall. 
Staff were friendly and did put a sign up on the second day of my stay to offer a room change due to the ceiling. Free breakfast was good. Location ideal. Good value for only Â£12 per night.

name: The Dictionary Hostel, Shoreditch, London
reviewtext: My father who is 73 years old stayed at this hostel for almost 10 days. The staff were made aware of his pre existing medical conditions and as a result were very attentive and extremely helpful. So thank you!!!

name: The Dictionary Hostel, Shoreditch, London
reviewtext: A good place, only there late at night and left early, but good location and bags felt very safe

name: The Dictionary Hostel, Shoreditch, London
reviewtext: The showers are gross. The bedroom has dust everywhere and I got sick. My food was thrown out of the kitchen twice despite the fact that it had my name and my staying details. Location was good but at this price, its really not worth it purely for location. I have nightmares of the mould filled showers...

name: The Dictionary Hostel, Shoreditch, London
reviewtext: This is in a really great spot and there are loads of people who are great friends if you just say hello, only down side my bed was a bit itchy

name: The Dictionary Hostel, Shoreditch, London
reviewtext: On a street of cool bars and walking distance to plenty of cafes and shops, including the Brick Lane area. Multiple tube stations within 10 minutes as well so easy to get everywhere. Only downside is it was very loud at night, could barely sleep due to the noise on Friday. The room was a little hot and stuffy but there was a fan. Bathroom and shower are very cramped but do the job. Breakfast was crowded but good value for a free breaky. Didn't use the kitchen but it looked decent. Lovely staff!

name: The Dictionary Hostel, Shoreditch, London
reviewtext: In terms of location and staff this place is great, in the heart of Shoreditch and the staff are super friendly and super helpful. The cleanliness of the hostel is what really lets it down. it doesn't really feel like anything is cleaned properly, a lot of dust on the floors, the bathrooms are varying degrees of cleanliness, but none are very clean.

name: The Dictionary Hostel, Shoreditch, London
reviewtext: Pretty good location in Shoreditch, I only stayed a night so it did the job but not the cleanest hostel! Also not great for solo travellers.

name: The Dictionary Hostel, Shoreditch, London
reviewtext: Was the filthiest hostel I've ever stayed in. Sheets weren't changed from the previous person. Bathrooms were disgusting with mold everywhere and toilet wasn't cleaned for 2 days. Awesome area for nightlife and bars.

name: The Dictionary Hostel, Shoreditch, London
reviewtext: Nice hostel with friendly staff

name: The Dictionary Hostel, Shoreditch, London
reviewtext: Great hostel with good atmosphere and great staff. Can be a bit noisy but I really liked it.

name: The Dictionary Hostel, Shoreditch, London
reviewtext: Had a great time. The staff and the patrons were all very friendly and welcoming. My only issues were that the showers needed some fungicide and the room I was staying in had better ventilation. Someone stole my battery power pack, which was not cool either.

name: The Dictionary Hostel, Shoreditch, London
reviewtext: toooo loud. and no restrict for loud and rude customers.  I wasn't able to sleep at all... if someone who wants to stay crazy party night would be good.

name: The Dictionary Hostel, Shoreditch, London
reviewtext: The place is literally dirty and smelly. Everywhere. Mold in my bathroom, smelly room and corridor. Very well overrated !

name: The Dictionary Hostel, Shoreditch, London
reviewtext: THE ONLY thing good about this place was the location. It's disgusting. We first showed up and the sheets were absolutely used (hairs everywhere from last person), asked 3 times for them to be changed, finally changed them ourselves. Watched mutiple new people come in after and sleep on other people's same sheets, never saw them change them...the floors, bathroom, all dirty. Kitchen had a horrible moldy smell coming from it. Would not recommend this place, find another hostel in Shoreditch.

name: The Dictionary Hostel, Shoreditch, London
reviewtext: I'm from Australia so I've had my share of sleeping at night when it's hot but never have I felt like my skin was on fire as I did sleeping in Room Z for these few nights. There was no respite whatsoever. The fan did absolutely nothing for the room. I'm guessing this would be ok normally, but in the freak summer weather this was like sleeping in a fire pit.

name: The Dictionary Hostel, Shoreditch, London
reviewtext: The Dictioanry Hostel was a great location. Super cool area, cool cafes and bars close by. Options for tube lines and overground were accessible by foot or a short bus ride if you felt lazy. Plenty of food for breakfast each morning. Friendly staff. Felt as if my belongings were very safe

name: The Dictionary Hostel, Shoreditch, London
reviewtext: Love this place, will come back on every visit to London!

name: The Dictionary Hostel, Shoreditch, London
reviewtext: A great stay at The Dictionary Hostel with its fab  central London transport links with access to lots of London's leading attractions aswell as  a buzzing nightlife in the evenings. The Dictionary itself has its own bar & kitchen, The Office which serves beers & a variety of excellent wines. The friendly staff are always on hand to help you & the whole place has a very genial atomspere among the backpackers staying here, met some very interesting and pleasant people.

name: The Dictionary Hostel, Shoreditch, London
reviewtext:
I would not recommend this hostel, firstly, as we were witness to a gang confrontation across the street as we were walking up. The staff did not wear any identifying markers, and seemed extremely annoyed when approached by anyone. While the showers and toilets were clean the room floors were covered in dust. There  was only one toilet but six showers for the top two floors. As Sweeney Todd said "There's a hole in the world like a great black pit...
And it goes by the name of London"

name: The Dictionary Hostel, Shoreditch, London
reviewtext: Super cool spot, lots of little hidden outdoor patios and hangout areas. Full kitchen and dining area downstairs so you can stay on a food budget. Tons of bars and cafes right outside the door and all the touristy stuff took one bus ride and one tube ride to get to - super easy. Kind of like a maze inside at first but you learn your way around quickly and it becomes kind of fun actually. Stayed for 4 days and had no problems

name: The Dictionary Hostel, Shoreditch, London
reviewtext: Was in a 12 bedroom which was very spacious- however barely any power plugs. Staff were very kind

name: The Dictionary Hostel, Shoreditch, London
reviewtext: I stayed here for two nights and had a great experience. The staff was helpful and kind and this ended up being one of my best hostel experiences! It is located next to a club so the music is really loud at night but that doesn't bother me much at all. Definitely recommend it here!

name: The Dictionary Hostel, Shoreditch, London
reviewtext:
Staff is friendly and fun. Building has enough social area. Wifi works well. Rooms are clean and secure. Hostel gives ear plugs for free. 

At first stayed at 8 bed dorm. It was very very noisy because of the street, club outside and fan inside. Later changed to 4 bed room - it was way cosier and comfortable.
Breakfast food is good. But, after breakfast the kitchen is closed for cleaning at least 2 hours and so when I woke up late, I couldn't make my own breakfast/brunch.

name: The Dictionary Hostel, Shoreditch, London
reviewtext: Not for anyone over 21 who doesn't like a party

name: The Dictionary Hostel, Shoreditch, London
reviewtext: NOT RECOMMENDED.We stayed at the Dictionary Hostel for 4 days and 3 nights.It was the most horific experience I've ever had.Everywhere was supper dirty and unkept.We had an exclusive room with a shower and a toilet for our group.Their definition of "clean" is just emptying the trash bins.Everything was covered in dust.Poor ventilation.Noisy from night clubs downstairs.Free breakfast from 7-9am are cheap, lousy and always late.Staff in general were unhelpful and couldn't care less.HORRIBLE!

name: The Dictionary Hostel, Shoreditch, London
reviewtext: Really great value for money. Comfy beds, free breakfast and cool atmosphere.

name: The Dictionary Hostel, Shoreditch, London
reviewtext: This hostel was great for our needs. It was centrally located in a cute area bustling with restaurants, shops, and bars. We particularly loved Shoryu Ramen down the way a bit. The bar next door to the hostel (10% off) was great for drinks and coffee, but we did not get to try the food. Hostel was fairly close to the tube station, which was a plus, but definitely a bit of a walk with luggage. Overall good experienxe, however the hostel was boiling hot and there was only 1 fan for our room of 12.

name: The Dictionary Hostel, Shoreditch, London
reviewtext: When you see the reviews of this being a 'party hostel' they really just mean loud because it's on a main road. There's not a lot of communal places to hang out and meet people. The staff are EXTREMLY rude. I as a customer and someone who works in the service industry have never been so shocked. Receptionist literally yelling at us because she couldnt figure out how much me and my friend separately owed because my friend was staying an extra night. So much mould in the shower, disgusting.

name: The Dictionary Hostel, Shoreditch, London
reviewtext: I love this hostel! I've stayed here once before and will always return. The staff is very friendly and helpful!

name: The Dictionary Hostel, Shoreditch, London
reviewtext: Cool place but a bit too expensive on the weekend and my booking was complicated so I had to pay more.very well located

name: The Dictionary Hostel, Shoreditch, London
reviewtext: You get what you pay for! Quite a good location in an upcoming area that's pretty close to the metro, subway and some tourist attractions. Staff were okay, rooms were okay although quite dusty, bathrooms not very clean. Fairly good price relative to London though.

name: The Dictionary Hostel, Shoreditch, London
reviewtext: Hostel caught fire during the night and we had to be evacuated. We didnt get any sleep as the fire alarm kept going off. We weren't  offered a refund except we were allowed to check out an hour earlier. No real apologies. We kept getting told that we were lucky it wasn't worse. Not having the hostel burn down is a pretty low standard. The room was super hot and there was no aircon aswell. Room was dirty and the sink was leaking in our room. Good location and breakfast included which is a postive

name: The Dictionary Hostel, Shoreditch, London
reviewtext: As far as hostels go, this one is fine! Good atmosphere, helpful staff and great location. Good value for money and has everything you need as a backpacker. Showers a bit grimy looking but clean enough

name: The Dictionary Hostel, Shoreditch, London
reviewtext: Me and my boyfriend stayed here for a few nights whilst going to a festival in London and it fitted our needs perfectly. It was very central and easy to get to by public transport. The bathroom was relatively alright. The staff were lovely and were helpful when checking in and out. We checked out 5 mins late and this wasn't a problem either :). It was very noisy at night however, as it was 30 degrees so the windows were wide open so to be expected. Loved the swing in middle of the room too ðŸ˜‚

name: The Dictionary Hostel, Shoreditch, London
reviewtext: Overall it was good hostel to stay. The room I stayed was 12beds room, has enough space and big window, tho the noise from the street was quite disturbing. One disappointing thing was the bathroom. It had so many moles and wasn't clean enough. And I couldn't find personal power point so that could be bit uncomfortable if you stay more than one night. However, the staffs were really kind and the atmosphere was nice! Also there's a bus stop right in front of it which is really convenient.

name: The Dictionary Hostel, Shoreditch, London
reviewtext: Be wary of the mixed dorms. Had a good experience overall but if you aren't comfortable in over 30 degree weather sleeping next to half naked strangers,..maybe book a hotel.

name: The Dictionary Hostel, Shoreditch, London
reviewtext:
The staff was helpful and the room was clean. 

The fan in the ensuite turned on for 5-10 minutes every time the door was opened and it was very loud and squeaky. The beds don't have built-in charger ports so devices needed to be charged exposed from a wall outlet.

But overall, very smooth and pleasant experience.

name: The Dictionary Hostel, Shoreditch, London
reviewtext: This hostel was in a really great location, but the staff were not very friendly, and the room was not very clean. Please clean up all the dust and put fans in the rooms!!!

name: The Dictionary Hostel, Shoreditch, London
reviewtext: The staff were super friendly and the location was great. However our room was at the front of the building, straight on to the street and the window was broken. This meant it couldn't be closed and it was really loud, making it difficult to sleep. The cleanliness also let it down, there was signs everywhere saying they cleaned everyday but we couldn't even walk across the floor without shoes on it was that dirty. The poor ventilation meant the bathroom and shower constantly smelt of damp.

name: The Dictionary Hostel, Shoreditch, London
reviewtext: Dirty. Overpriced. No air-conditioning. Maybe slept 10 minutes. Never coming back.

name: The Dictionary Hostel, Shoreditch, London
reviewtext: This hostel was beyond filthy, there was no air ventilation in the room, and the showers were 20 people to one and it was not cleaned daily. Hostel is full of residents.  Staff were kind to me, but literally cursed out other tenants who lost their card to their room. This place sucks.

name: The Dictionary Hostel, Shoreditch, London
reviewtext: This place was really dirty in the bathrooms and overall just felt kinda janky. There also wasn't really a good public area to socialize with other travelers in the hostel. That being said, it wasn't terrible. If you want to party in Shoreditch and just need a safe place to lay your drunk head, then this place is fine. There's some cools bars around. However for me, it was not ideal.

name: The Dictionary Hostel, Shoreditch, London
reviewtext: Good location however it was so hot some nights it was impossible to sleep. Was not as easy to meet people as in other hostels. Showers and bathrooms were tiny and pretty grimy. Overall ok stay.

name: The Dictionary Hostel, Shoreditch, London
reviewtext: Get some air conditioning. I was sweating all through the night which made it hard to sleep.

name: The Dictionary Hostel, Shoreditch, London
reviewtext: Everything was going great - the singing receptionist, the room, the kitchen, the location, the price - until I  saw the shower. It's just me, I know, but if it were my place I'd bleach the crap out of that shower (or use clove oil) and remove the mould in there, top to bottom. Again, it was a great place to stay in. :)

name: The Dictionary Hostel, Shoreditch, London
reviewtext: Filthy and overpriced. No fans or air conditioning

name: The Dictionary Hostel, Shoreditch, London
reviewtext: Bathrooms were disgusting and the breakfast area was a mess. Showers were broken and clogged. Air conditioning was ineffective.

name: The Dictionary Hostel, Shoreditch, London
reviewtext: We had a great time at The Dictionary. To begin with we had great roommates, some less fun ones after that. But that's not the hostels fault! Got up early enough for breakfast once over our 5 night stay, would've been great if it had been on for further into the day. The room was extremely warm both during the day and at night. All in all, pretty good hostel in a fantastic location!

name: The Dictionary Hostel, Shoreditch, London
reviewtext: Overcrowded, dirty, rude staff. Go to Clink or Wombats

name: The Dictionary Hostel, Shoreditch, London
reviewtext: The Dictionary Hostel has the potential to be fantastic, as the location and atmosphere was pretty cool. The thing that made this rating go down was the dirtiness of it.

name: The Dictionary Hostel, Shoreditch, London
reviewtext: First thing that strikes you is the room isnt very clean, floors were very dusty the shower (ensuite) had lots of mould in it on the walls on the door frame so smelt terrible the toilet wasn't clean, they also over booked the room so they disturbed everyone at 12:00 at night and then let a person who wasn't staying in the room in at 1 am. And lets hope you don't have a phone on you because there are 4 power outlets for 10 people. Over all not a great stay.

name: The Dictionary Hostel, Shoreditch, London
reviewtext: Was pretty good! Decent place, lots of great common spaces; the rooftop lounge was nice! Giant cage lockers under the beds so being your own locks and it's safe. They also let you store your bags for hours beforehand check in, that was nice and it felt secure too. Free breakfast was boiled eggs, variety of toast with jams, butters and nut butter; also cereals and coffees and teas. I think they had juice too. They let you store stuff in the fridges too. Bathrooms were messy but oh well.

name: The Dictionary Hostel, Shoreditch, London
reviewtext:
The staff were nice, but the place is shoddy and definitely needs a darned good clean from top to bottom. No individual lights for each bed in the dorms nor any curtains. Although there was a sign saying bathroom would be cleaned between 10am to 2pm it wasn't and was pretty yuk. 
There are many other places for the same price far better equipped and organised

name: The Dictionary Hostel, Shoreditch, London
reviewtext: Stayed in a 6 bed dorm with 5 people, the room it self was fine but the bathroom was not. The floors were dirty so make sure you don't walk around bare footed. You could tell the bathroom had not been cleaned properly because there was still razors from previous guests on the shower gel dispenser!! But i suppose you get what you pay for, Â£36 for two nights in London is great but the room not so great.

name: The Dictionary Hostel, Shoreditch, London
reviewtext:
Fine hostel, no fans or AC which means a very sweaty sleep in summer if window is closed. If left open (which is needed not to sweat through the sheets) the overwhelming noise from cars, bikes and emergency vehicles 24/7 is very draining! 

Rooms are well sized and lockers are big enough for the whole bag which is nice. Amazing location in shoreditch, walkable to old street tube station and the local bars.

name: The Dictionary Hostel, Shoreditch, London
reviewtext: We loved our stay here, lots of great people!

name: The Dictionary Hostel, Shoreditch, London
reviewtext: Lovely hostel and great value for money. Everything was clean and the beds were super comfortable. I would definitely stay here again.

name: The Dictionary Hostel, Shoreditch, London
reviewtext: Don't buy a lock before coming here. Locker locks oversized in the room, you have to buy one of their massive locks for one off use.. good location pretty clean rooms, kitchen not in the best condition but everything works. However very good price for a room in London and good location if you're on a night out that side of town

name: The Dictionary Hostel, Shoreditch, London
reviewtext: Beds are pretty uncomfortable but it's what you pay for! Bathrooms were pretty gross but other then that it was a cool hostel in a cool location! Would only stay 1-2 nights max

name: Saint James Backpackers
reviewtext: Clean, private double with shared bathroom and a sink in room. The hostel is in an amazing location, really close to Earl's Court tube. Staff were friendly and atmosphere was warm and hospitable. If you arrive by 4pm you can also get the free evening meal!! All facilities were clean and tidy, a great dining room and lounge plus a fantastic walled garden. A rarity for London! Highly recommend.

name: Saint James Backpackers
reviewtext: Good hostel, it has a clean kitchen, lockers inside bedroom, common areas (bigger is closed at midnight), dinner for free (limited). WiFi doesn't work well.

name: Saint James Backpackers
reviewtext: SJB is a good place to stay if you're a heavy sleeper and not overly fussed by very basic bathrooms (taps broken off, no place to leave soaps etc) Located in a brilliant location right by Earls Court tube however the beds/doors/floor squeak all night from any sort of movement from anyone. There's no real hostel-y atmosphere here, more like a quiet place to recoup (other than while sleeping that is!) however they do offer a basic free dinner every night. Clean, but very basic facilities.

name: Saint James Backpackers
reviewtext: Only thing great about the hostel is the location in relation to value. While I was there they let an elementary camp group there, that slammed doors and screamed throughout the night. Staff did nothing. Stay elsewhere.

name: Saint James Backpackers
reviewtext: As a solo female traveler, I felt it was a very safe location (though they keep the front door open, no lock or key necessary to walk in), fairly sociable (free breakfast/dinners and activities), and pretty clean. Didn't really interact with the staff at all, but I met and spoke with other cool travelers. Sometimes bathroom automatic lights turned off while I was showering and wouldn't turn back on. Manager/owner is very friendly! Location is a bit far from central London so buy an Oyster card!

name: Saint James Backpackers
reviewtext: Good location, nice place, only issue is they can't take US chipped credit cards, you will need to go to nearby atm and withdraw English pounds. Enjoyed our time there.

name: Saint James Backpackers
reviewtext:
Stayed here like a week time while in a resolution of a flat for me so needed a place to crash for a few nights.
Never been in a hostel before, but I was surprised, very good vibes in this hostel, friendly and helpful staff, very good relation quality/price.
Overall a very nice experience, I will recommend ST. James to whoever need a hostel.
Keep up the good work and a big thanks to you all.

Ricardo Fernandes

name: Saint James Backpackers
reviewtext: Had to pay for towels. Staff seemed unprofessional. They charged my card then told me they couldn't use it because of potential fraud even with my passport in staff members hand. That didn't make sense to me and it held my card limit up for 3 days and I had to then pay cash for room which was obnoxious. Environment was okay but I wouldn't go back.

name: Saint James Backpackers
reviewtext: Great place to stay and great people to meet.

name: Saint James Backpackers
reviewtext: Great location 5min walk from a main line (Picadilly) that takes you directly to LHR. Nice/safe neighborhood. Didn't spend time in common area so can't speak to atmosphere, but nice backyard and spacious sitting room w/ TV. // Doesn't take any CC that requires signatures so bring cash (couldn't even use my debit). No AC- very warm room at night. Locker was super small, no way luggage/backpackers backpack would fit (used a lock on my luggage as it was left out). Staff isn't extremely friendly.

name: Saint James Backpackers
reviewtext: We only stayed for one night but I wanted to stay longer because everyone we met there was so kind and welcoming!

name: Saint James Backpackers
reviewtext: I arrived in the evening and only had to stay for 1 night, and had made a reservation for an all-female room (8 bunk beds). When I got to the room, none of my roommates were there. I went to bed and as the night progressed, people started coming back after going out... but they were all men!!! It was already late and I didn't want to get up in the middle of the night so I just tried to fall asleep as fast as possible. Next morning ppl at reception told me they had made a mistake.

name: Saint James Backpackers
reviewtext: Not very good.  Paid a lot of money and was pretty underwhelmed by almost everything.  No A/C, not even any fans in the rooms.  A friend had a security issue that wasn't handled very professionally.  Nice big TV and two comfy couches is the best part.  Nice outdoor patio, but pretty dead.  Would definitely look elsewhere next time I come to London.

name: Saint James Backpackers
reviewtext: It was ridiculously hot the two nights I stayed there. I understand the weather can get quite muggy over the summer, but some sort of AC or even just a fan would have been greatly appreciated in the room. The lockers were also fairly small.  Not enough room to fit a full backpack in, so that just ended up taking space on the floor, along with everyone else's luggage and belongings. Made the room feel crowded and small. Other than that our experience was fairly average for a hostel.

name: Saint James Backpackers
reviewtext: Average hostel but pretty cheap for London. Good location. All female dorm could use some air fresheners or increased ventilation as it smelled terrible when we first entered the room.

name: Saint James Backpackers
reviewtext: The staff and other travelers were all extremely friendly, and the backyard patio was a great place to hang out after a long day of exploring London. The Earl's Court tube station is a five minute walk from the hostel, and there are also a lot of restaurants and pubs within walking distance. The only downside was that our room was extremely hot, especially at night, and there was no fan in the room, so just be aware of that if you're visiting in the summer. Overall, it's a great place to stay!

name: Saint James Backpackers
reviewtext: Really good accommodation for a budget hostel. The communal spaces are amazing, indoor and out with lots of options to hang out. Great staff who kept the whole place very clean.

name: Saint James Backpackers
reviewtext:
This is the worst hostel I've stayed in, especially given the price. It started when they couldn't accept my credit card so I had to go to the ATM to get cash (yay fees). The rooms themselves were awful - no space, dirty, and uncomfortable (thinnest pillows ever). The lockers are small (under bed) and the flimsiest of doors feel like they could easily be broken open.

For the price you can find better hostels in London.

name: Saint James Backpackers
reviewtext: Overall, St. James is a great hostel for a budget traveler. The free breakfast and dinner's are AMAZING and really let you save money to see/do more things in London. The bathroom facilities are often cleaned and the bedrooms have nice big windows that allow for air movement. The staff is made up of young adults from different countries that come to London to work in a hostel setting. They're learning -- so just remember to be patient with them! Great choice for a great trip in London.

name: Saint James Backpackers
reviewtext:
Really good hostel. 
Would definitely stay again 
Just 5 minutes from Earls Court Underground station, which has 3 lines. You can easily get to the city center. 
The hostel was great! Good atmosphere, nice staff and breakfast good!

name: Saint James Backpackers
reviewtext: Great location. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Staff were lazy and not helpful. Good spot if you just need a place to sleep for the night.

name: Saint James Backpackers
reviewtext: We stayed in the private double at St. James, however the living conditions were so poor we had to check out after our first night and find other accommodations. Brief list: ensuite bathroom was the size of an airplane bathroom, shower flooded floor within 5 minutes of use, floors turned feet black, 24/7 noise, no ventilation, rat crawling around, window didn't lock, sheets had hair on them, and more. Thankfully the (very nice) staff got us a refund. Not worth the Â£121/night price.

name: Saint James Backpackers
reviewtext: one of the worst hostels. i chose a mixed 8 bed room, upon arriving i was put into a room with 7 males, being a solo female traveller it made me uncomfortable; turnover for the next 2 days were only male. bathrooms are on another floor so it was annoying to go change/wash up. breakfast was okay but no one refilled (cereal, milk, pancakes) unless were asked to. room was SUPER HOT. location of the hostel is definitely not a party area, on weekends, bars close @ 12am. i would never return.

name: Saint James Backpackers
reviewtext: Having never stayed in a hostel before I didn't quite know what to expect, beside the fact it may be very basic, but I was pleasantly surprised at how much I enjoyed my stay. The staff are absolutely wonderful, down to earth people and really made me feel welcome, the place itself felt very homely and I had no problem feeling relaxed. The addition of free food is always a happy extra, and whilst the menu was basic, I thoroughly enjoyed eating. I look forward to coming back!

name: Astor Kensington
reviewtext: Pepe is the best!

name: Astor Kensington
reviewtext: I really enjoyed my stay here. Although the place was quite small, eating area and kitchen weren't very big and got quite crowded particularly around breakfast time, the place was really nice. Staff were super friendly, along with all the other stayers. The location was great, right next to Hyde park, and 5 min walk to two underground stations. Would definitely stay here again!!

name: Astor Kensington
reviewtext:
The staff definitely made my experience so much better! Super friendly and just plain awesome. 

Besides that, everything was great and had everything that I needed like being able to lock up my things in my room and everything!

name: Astor Kensington
reviewtext: Great location to get to Notting Hill Carnival. Very clean with comfy beds. Nice, modern bathroom. Good breakfast. Friendly staff.

name: Astor Kensington
reviewtext: USB plug ins conveniently located by each bed, friendly staff, clean

name: Astor Kensington
reviewtext: Amazing hostel and athmosphere. It's just 2min away from Hyde Park and 15min walking to Notting Hill. It has a main street near by so everything is super close: supermarkets, ATM, fast food, pubs, pharmacy and more. Pretty direct to Marble Arch. The hostel was super nice, although if you're not in the mood of climbing..maybe you should reconsider ahah It wasn't a problem to me. The staff is super attentive and they give you a hand at any time. If you're looking for something more chill, this is

name: Astor Kensington
reviewtext: The location close to two tube stations and Hyde Park was great and the staff and guests social. They close the kitchen between 10 am - midday which was a bit annoying though.

name: Astor Kensington
reviewtext: This is one of the best hostels I've ever stayed in. Everything is really clean. I loved being across the street from Hyde Park and a lot of sites in walking distance. It wasn't overly noisy and the staff were really nice. Only thing that bothered me was the staff was quite a large clique and sometimes I couldn't go into an area because it was so full of them. Like I said they were super friendly, but I kinda felt like high school and a bit lame when I was around them.

name: Astor Kensington
reviewtext: Awesome location but I found the room to be rather small and cramped. The receptionists were lovely but the rest of the staff is rather cliquey. They advertised a night out with the hostel but it ended up being almost entirely staff and their friends and they weren't the most welcoming to the few hostel guests that came along. It's obviously not their fault more guests didn't come but if it's advertised as a hostel event, the staff that are there can be a bit more accommodating to guests.

name: Astor Kensington
reviewtext: I originally picked this hostel for a night due to its close proximity to where my friend was staying, but decided to stay there again at the end of my trip because I enjoyed it there so much. The staff is incredibly friendly and my four bed room was excellent- I really liked that there was a sink in the room. The nearest tube station is only minutes away and since it's on the central line, it is really easy to get around London. No air conditioning, but I was there during a heat wave.

name: Astor Kensington
reviewtext: The location is amazing. Just a few minutes to Hyde Park and Kensington Palace. It's situated in what seems to be quite a posh neighbourhood. The staff were also nice and willing to answer any questions! In terms of cleanliness, as soon as I walked into the hostel there was a strange smell (resembling that of an old towel). There was water damage nearly everywhere, dust all over the floor, the couches in the lounge were stained. The toilet, shower, and sinks were regularly cleaned.

name: Astor Kensington
reviewtext: The hostel is very well located and the staff is helpful. The rooms could be a bit more clean but for the price I can't really complain. There is a lounge and free breakfast as well. Only downside is the lack of toilets - we stayed on the fourth floor and we had to go down a floor to use the bathroom.

name: Astor Kensington
reviewtext: Location is great, with underground stations, hyde park etc nearby. I stayed in a 4-bed dorm which was ok, as was my bed. Quite hot room even though it wasn't very hot outside. Nice with lockable (with padlock) big drawers under the bed for backpacks etc. There was no reading light, power outlet or shelf by the bed (to place phone, book etc during the night). Decent brekkie for Â£1 (donated to charity!). Not enough toilets/showers and the common areas were more or less non-existent. Great staff!

name: Astor Kensington
reviewtext:
This hostel came well recommended but I'm not exactly sure why. The place is dirty and creaky. The lounge, kitchen, and rooms are not comfortable. The staff was nice but not all that helpful. They seemed to want to mess around more than help. The staff played loud music into the night that made it hard for us to sleep. Tried to find another place to stay my last night just to get away.

The breakfast for charity is nice, shower was hot. So that's neat.

name: Astor Kensington
reviewtext: Stayed at the Astor hostel in very short term notice and they were great about everything!!! Very clean space we stayed in the six bedroom and it was comfortable and quiet and nice! The receptionists were so sweet to us and told us everything we needed to know! Great value!!!

name: Astor Kensington
reviewtext: I absolutely love this hostel. It's great for price, amazing location, relaxed environment, great facilities. I even extended my stay as knew I wouldn't be as happy staying anywhere else. Slight build up of dust in the room I was in, no biggy. I had 2 issues with the guests I had in my room but there is only a small way I can put this at the hostels fault, during my stay a man checked in late, without a prebook, stole my laptop while I was sleeping, I feel locks should be free without a deposit

name: Astor Kensington
reviewtext: Good hostel, clean, friendly staff, good vibes

name: Astor Kensington
reviewtext: Great staff, so welcoming and friendly. Location is amazing, 30 second walk to Queensbury Station on the Central line and right near the park. Rooms were super clean as were the bathrooms. Would definitely recommend and would stay again!

name: Astor Kensington
reviewtext: Loved it. Will definitely be back. Highly recommended.

name: Astor Kensington
reviewtext: This is possibly as good as it gets for a hostel.  Pepe and Tito at reception were incredibly welcoming and helpful during my stay.  I used common sense, brought a lock for my stuff and none of my personal belongings went missing.   I almost thought I has lost my iPhone charger, but the cleaning person actually turned it into the lost & found at reception.  The bathrooms/showers were cleaned as posted on the schedule.

name: Astor Kensington
reviewtext: Astors Kensington is in a good location and the staff for the most part are very friendly and helpful. In terms of the accomodation itself, it is mediocre. The atmosphere is similar to that of a college dorm room and the cleanliness of the rooms isn't always the best. Either way, it is a fairly good place to stay as far as hostel's go.

name: Astor Kensington
reviewtext:
staff was super-friendly and very helpful, room-mates too.
24/7 reception and good advice (free city map, advice where to get good english breakfast in the neighborhood) 
Great breakfast-charitiy-concept: you donate 1 pound for one breakfast.
room was quite warm during the night, but clean and functional. fan available, but noisy.
only a few toilets in the house, but they are very clean.
Glad I stayed here, was very nice!

name: Astor Kensington
reviewtext: The bedrooms were too hot and too small.

name: Astor Kensington
reviewtext:
The staff was super friendly and helpful.
Best things were the location (3 blocks from a metro station and in front of Hyde Park) and the full breakfast for Â£1.
We liked the free blankets and soccer balls to take to the park and the gigant tv screen.
Bad things were that the room was pretty small and crowded, awfully hot (4th floor) and that the bathroom was also too small with no ventilation. 
However, overall, the value for money was ok and we would stay there again.
Thank you!

name: Astor Kensington
reviewtext: Amazing staff so helpful in so many ways . Great location. Ideal position. Great atmosphere about the place. Would certainly stay here again .john ðŸ˜€

name: Astor Kensington
reviewtext: Very friendly people and excellent place to stay, right next to Hyde Park! Would recommend & stay again.

name: Astor Kensington
reviewtext: Best Hostel I have ever been to. It was my second stay there - definitely coming back!

name: Astor Kensington
reviewtext: Really fun hostel to stay in but in terms of the rooms, they can be really small and boiling hot. I was in a 6 dorm the size of harry potters bedroom under the stairs and there was no ventilation in the shower so it was super humid and uncomfortable to use the bathroom. Also the price you pay isn't consistent with what you get because a 10 bedroom is massive and has a proper bathroom and a 6 bedroom is quite small and you are paying more. Also the stairs kill you if you are on the top few floors

name: Astor Kensington
reviewtext: Beautiful location with comfortable, quiet (not creaky) beds!  Either I couldn't find the bathrooms, or there weren't quite enough (I found one shower and one toilet per floor), and while they weren't dirty, they weren't quiet as clean as I would have hoped.  There were a variety of cereals, breads, and things to go on bread for breakfast.  Overall, it was a fine place to stay.

name: Astor Kensington
reviewtext:
Good hostel in a very safe/accessible neighborhood. Easy to travel to from the airports/metro/bus lines. Really nice touches that they offer charging converters, locks, and other useful objects free of charge! Staff is very friendly and helpful, and the rooms are clean, and offer large lockers. 

Great stay!

name: Astor Kensington
reviewtext: Awesome place to stay! It's in such an amazing location and the staff there are all extremely amazing people! My only complaints would be that there is no elevator, though I had no problems with it, I know others that did and the laundry room. There is only one washer and dryer and the laundry room is very messy with other stuff. I would still stay here again because the atmosphere is great, the people are amazing and the location is perfect.

name: Astor Kensington
reviewtext: Loved the staff. Always willing to help me out which was much needed since I was a solo traveler. Only critic I have was that my room did not have good wifi service so I was not able to use it at all and the room was very tight. 8 people in a small room with one shower and toilet. Love the fact that they have a free food basket filled with pastas for travelers to use at their will. Loved the common TV room. Location was right next to Hyde Park and a lot of restaurants and stores which was a plus

name: Astor Kensington
reviewtext:
Room wasnt clean even though we asked for a cleaning on our second day. There was a maintenance (painting and wall plastering) in our room during our stay. All our fabric and shoes was fully covered with white plaster dust and we had to smell the fumes from the paint all night long. 

Staffs were friendly and helpful but unaware of the maintenance hence they couldn't advise us to keep our stuff away, hostel/staffs need more co-ordination in this matter.

name: Astor Kensington
reviewtext: No elevators, which makes climbing seven flights of stairs with luggage tough. Friendly staff. My mixed 8-bed room had a bathroom inside. Cleanliness was questionable, but it's hard to expect anything different from a shower/toilet used by 8 sweaty travelers and cleaned once a day (I hope!).

name: Astor Kensington
reviewtext: Loved my stay here - bed was comfortable and the breakfast was great! Would definitely stay here again :)

name: Astor Kensington
reviewtext: Really enjoyed my stay here. Great vibe, excellent location. Highly recommend it!

name: Astor Kensington
reviewtext: During my first stay in London, I stayed at Astor Hyde Park but I couldn't get in there the second time so I stayed at Astor Kensington. It is a small hostel, but conveniently located near two tube stations. They had some activities going on, but I only stayed a night so I didn't join in any of them.

name: Astor Kensington
reviewtext:
Very nice staff and comfortable bed.
I loved the usb plugs next to each bed for charging phones.

name: Astor Kensington
reviewtext: Very good hostel, with an excellent staff! Would stay there again.

name: YHA London Oxford Street
reviewtext: Perfect location, very clean hostel with great staff. Can't imagine a better place to stay in London.

name: YHA London Oxford Street
reviewtext: The good: I had a private room, which was spartan but nice. Each bunk had an outlet/light, and everything was clean. The bad: Wifi only worked in common areas, which is frustrating when finding a way to airport. It was cool outside but the room was hot, and I was only able to open the window an inch. Most things that are typically free for a hostel (e.g., towel, luggage storage, breakfast) cost extra, and the breakfast was what most hostels offer for free. This was similar to the hostels in LA.

name: YHA London Oxford Street
reviewtext: I loved staying here. It was so convenient to the Oxford Circus tube station and was right in the middle of a very fun part of town, but not noisy at all. Rooms were clean and very comfy! Staff was all very very helpful.

name: YHA London Oxford Street
reviewtext:
Establishment is very clean and the staff are friendly. I'd recommend staying here, but beware it is also family friendly. 

I don't recommend doing the pub crawl, tour/pub guide wasn't interested in getting people involved and picking people up from the hostel which was already paid for.

name: YHA London Oxford Street
reviewtext: The 4 bed female dorm was small, hot and stuffy especially during summer. The beds were comfortable and each had a power outlet. Great location. Very friendly staff. Luggage storage was available for 3 euros. Would recommend.

name: YHA London Oxford Street
reviewtext: Cant beat the location of these place, right in the middle of Soho tons of walkable places to eat, drink, shop and explore from here. The facilities were extremely clean and we had a great sleep in the beds. We will 100% book back in here when we come to London again!

name: YHA London Oxford Street
reviewtext: I have stayed at the YHA London Oxford Street twice, for two very different vacations, and both stays were very good for many reasons. We loved the convenience of the location, for getting around London and for meeting our day-to-day needs. The atmosphere was good for people of all ages, including my teenage granddaughter. It is safe, comfortable, relaxed and well-managed. The staff are wonderfully friendly and helpful. I'm planning to be in London again soon, and will stay with you again.

name: YHA London Oxford Street
reviewtext: Great hostel. Wonderful staff who were very friendly and helpful and kept everything spotlessly clean. I loved staying here. Excellent central location. I will definitely be coming back to stay.

name: YHA London Oxford Street
reviewtext: Excellent Location and facility. Very comfortable and clean. Well equipped kitchen for self catering. Love their Diva Room ! (Powder room) Wish they had free luggage storage after checking out. Food (breakfast and snacks) is also slightly expensive, but one can always self cater. There is a M&S nearby to buy food.

name: YHA London Oxford Street
reviewtext: The location is awesome, exactly at the heart of oxford street and te staff is super helpful. The pantry and the kitchen is really cozy and super organize. But the room itself, its really a dissapoiment and not comfortable at all. Not even a space to open my luggage and the room can get very heaty during summer (only a small fan for all 4 of us in the room). Since the room is really small, it can get very dirty and stuff laying around with 4 people cramming in 1 room.

name: YHA London Oxford Street
reviewtext:
Staff and location were fantastic. Rooms were tiny with no air conditioning which was probably the worst part. 
Not much atmosphere but we weren't there in the evenings. Everyone seemed to keep to themselves.

name: YHA London Oxford Street
reviewtext: The location is good, close to Oxford street. You can walk there to shopping or take bus/subway. The front desk staff is ok, but the housekeeping work doesn't do a good job.  I lived there for 4nights, the hand soap is out for 4 days, housekeeping only throw trash but without changing a new trash bag. It's disgusting.  Still have the bad smell.  The room is extremely small, I guess because it's expensive for rent. But the good thing is everyone has their own bed light, there is lift as well.

name: YHA London Oxford Street
reviewtext:
Very friendly welcoming staff, everything was clean and tidy, the dorm I was in was quite a good size and I liked that there was a sink and mirror in there as well as lockers. The beds and pillows were comfy. Showers were good. The lift was not always reliable and didn't always come when called. It was also incredibly small and a bit scary. Only problem was no air con in the dorms, which was quite tough in this summer heat wave. 

YHA is always my first choice hostel, they're reliably good.

name: YHA London Oxford Street
reviewtext:
Great location. Friendly staff.  Nice breakfast.

Air con needed !!

name: YHA London Oxford Street
reviewtext:
It's pretty good facility generally but there are no elevator from reception office to rooms. so it was so hard to bring my bags to the upstairs.
The staff helped me bring it but i am sorry that it's not useful . 
But great view and the other things is nice. 
Thank you

name: YHA London Oxford Street
reviewtext: It was very nice, but it was to hot.

name: YHA London Oxford Street
reviewtext:
Very professionally ran hostel, facilities are well kept and clean. Staff are very helpful and happy. Good and drinks available to have in a really nice common room. 
Rooms can get very hot though and windows very limited opening.

name: YHA London Oxford Street
reviewtext: Great night spent. Safe and wonderful staff.

name: YHA London Oxford Street
reviewtext: Extremely comfortable stay. The location is brilliant and staff was very helpful and friendly. Stayed in a 4 bedroom female dorm. The hostel was clean and was being cleaned regularly.

name: YHA London Oxford Street
reviewtext: Everything was lovely. Definitely at the higher end that I'm willing to pay but the great location made it even more worth it. Warning that in summer it can get very hot in some of the rooms, I'm good at dealing with heat but wouldn't recommend if you have trouble sleeping through heat.

name: YHA London Oxford Street
reviewtext: Wouldn't recommend as a solo traveller. Nothing is really organised and the rooms were unbelievably hot.

name: YHA London Oxford Street
reviewtext: Loved this hostel. Clean, friendly, and a great location.

name: YHA London Oxford Street
reviewtext: The staff are wonderful but I won't be returning here in the summer ever again. I'm someone that can cope with heat but this place was unbearably hot! The windows barely open an inch so the tiny fan stationed in the room was useless. There's also no lift to the rooms.

name: YHA London Oxford Street
reviewtext: Great central hostel. Perfect room size but only fault was we were on the 5th floor and it was a sweatbox due to the heat. Not the hostels fault but made our stay a little uncomfortable

name: YHA London Oxford Street
reviewtext: Hostel in good central location,easy to get to and the staff very friendly

name: YHA London Oxford Street
reviewtext:
Overall we were fairly pleased with the facility and services provided. The staff was excellent in accommodating us and providing additional information to make our experience in London more enjoyable. 
While we were there temperatures in London were exceptionally warm and there is no air conditioning and the fans that were available provided very little relief. We understand that it is unusual for London to be this warm, but something needs to be in place to allow for better air circulation.

name: YHA London Oxford Street
reviewtext:
This hostel is pretty standard & good - most facilities are as you'd expect.

Only problem is the lack of ventilation / air conditioning. If it's hot when you're there (above 25) the whole building heats up quite considerably - its hotter inside than outside. The windows don't open much, so the room doesn't cool down at night, and there's no air conditioning.

There were two desk fans in the room, and while they helped a little, pushing already sticky and hot air doesn't give you much relief.

name: YHA London Oxford Street
reviewtext: We only had a short stay but we were really impressed by the hostel. We shall definitely be booking with yha again.

name: YHA London Oxford Street
reviewtext: Had a great time at YHA- perfect location, super safe and clean and the staff made you feel at home! It's not a party or even really youth hostel but as a solo female it was the perfect place to be. I recommend the Â£5 breakfast and 10am daily walking tour

name: YHA London Oxford Street
reviewtext: Perfectly nice and well located hostel in central London. It is good to know that the lockers provided require you to have your own padlock. Also, as London was experiencing a heatwave when I was there, it was rather warm in the rooms at night.

name: YHA London Oxford Street
reviewtext: Excellent location to visit all that London has to offer. The place is simple but very clean and comfortable. Staff was very friendly and accommodating, even allowing us to check in early. Only complaints were the lack of AC made for a very hot night in late June, and the price compared to hostel's elsewhere is absurd. However, London is known to be pricey, and few buildings in Europe have AC so overall can't complain.

name: YHA London Oxford Street
reviewtext: The ventilation is very bad and the fan is not doing it job. The room is hotter than out doors air. You need to upgrade the fan system and its ventilation. Otherwise it inhabitable in summer. Worst experience in my 10 years staying in hostel. Surprise it is London.

name: St Christopher's Inn - London Bridge
reviewtext:
Great location, felt very secure. Beds felt fresh and clean, bathrooms were pretty decent. I did notice some mold in the ceiling above one of the shower stalls, but otherwise satisfactory. 

I found the pub below was usually lively, even on weeknights when nearby pubs were quiet. Great for atmosphere, but that also means it's loud in the rooms til 1-2am, so it depends what you are looking for in a hostel.

name: St Christopher's Inn - London Bridge
reviewtext: Pretty good hostel, nice and clean and an amazing location. Literally 2 minute walk away from Borough market and tube stations. The bar downstairs is lively at night which is also a plus. The activities didn't seem to be too well organised however and it could be difficult for solo travelers to meet people, I'd recommend just going out of your way to socialise, don't rely on the hostel to do it for you like some others do. Staff are nice but can be quite busy at times leading to a bit of a wait.

name: St Christopher's Inn - London Bridge
reviewtext: St. Christophers Inn was a really good place to stay at. Great vibe (daily live music), friendly and helpful staff. Always busy and all the guests were easy to connect with. The Inn provided the necessities for a good price and at a perfect location. (2mns away from Burough Market and London Bridge Station)

name: St Christopher's Inn - London Bridge
