reviewtext: It is a good hostel, not many bathrooms and showers, but a great atmosphere, the pub downstairs is good, has nice discounts to guesses and the waitress Kerstin was an absolute legend, took good care of us, provided great service and gave us good tips for London.

name: St Christopher's Inn - London Bridge
reviewtext: Very nice and traditional hostel!! Staff was great. Avoid if you really want to rest. Bar is quite noisy, but so much fun down there. I will come back!! Good deals for guests too.

name: St Christopher's Inn - London Bridge
reviewtext: Great place to stay in the middle of the city

name: St Christopher's Inn - London Bridge
reviewtext: Really enjoyed my stay felt very welcome and all the staff were friendly room was ideal and beds were good I slept well in them would recommend

name: St Christopher's Inn - London Bridge
reviewtext: Room was not big but the people I met there were rly cool. Underground station is very near and the london bridge and the tower bridge are close! Reception was not open 24 hrs but overall I enjoyed my stay.

name: St Christopher's Inn - London Bridge
reviewtext: Great location to base yourself and see all of London. Such friendly staff!!

name: St Christopher's Inn - London Bridge
reviewtext: This was a great and affordable option in London. My partner and I only stayed two days in a 4 bed dorm. There were outlets by every bunk and a fan in the room in case it got hot (no AC). I liked that they had storage lockers under the bunks were we could use our own locks (it costs 5 to buy one). The staff was nice/helpful. Cleaning staff took care of any reported problems quickly. No 24hr reception so if you're stuck, you have to walk down the block to the main hostel.

name: St Christopher's Inn - London Bridge
reviewtext: Very nice traditional hostel. Great live music, nice atmosphere. Went to sleep around 3 am because I had such a great time there!!

name: St Christopher's Inn - London Bridge
reviewtext: Great experience, amazing staff. I will come back guys, really enjoyed it.

name: St Christopher's Inn - London Bridge
reviewtext:
Clean.

The rest? What is there? No common room, no kitchen, tiny rooms, limited showers and toilets for number of rooms, very cheap imported insecure padlocks sold for Â£4, limited luggage space so you need to pay Â£3.50 to store luggage in the hostel down the road, lack of common space (other than the pub downstairs) means zero hostel atmosphere. Might be ok for groups, definitely not for solo travellers. The place needs better management and a better vision.

name: St Christopher's Inn - London Bridge
reviewtext: One of the best hostels I have stayed in!! Rally friendly staff, good food, cheap drinks and amazing atmosphere!  We went down on a wedensday night and it was packed full of locals and travelers, best hostel in London!

name: St Christopher's Inn - London Bridge
reviewtext: THERE IS NO A/C whatsoever. It was so hot and humid throughout my stay. Apart from that the atmosphere was okay! If you're traveling alone you are bound to meet some people. I was there for 2 nights and met people both days. :)  The bar itself does not get to busy either but its decent enough.

name: St Christopher's Inn - London Bridge
reviewtext: It's a really nice place to stay the for the money that we paid for it. Don't really have a knock on it other than the lack of air conditioning in the building when we visited during the heat wave. Things get a little tight as you move up towards the rooms as well. Overall it's worth it if you're on a budget and need a spot to rest your head for a night or two max.

name: St Christopher's Inn - London Bridge
reviewtext: Staff was friendly while checking in and treated us badly when checking out

name: St Christopher's Inn - London Bridge
reviewtext: Realmente muy bueno, buen ambiente, buena musica y con cerveza muy barata para los clientes del hostel. Los empleados genial conmigo. Lo recomiendo totalmente.

name: St Christopher's Inn - London Bridge
reviewtext: Great location

name: St Christopher's Inn - London Bridge
reviewtext: I absolutely loved staying here. The bar was always packed and entertaining, the showers were warm, the bathrooms were clean, and the staff (specifically Jason, Catarina, and Shannon) were all absolutely lovely people. The food and drink discounts were great, and the food all tasted fantastic. The only downside is that the bedrooms don't really have the best venthilation, so they heat up quickly, but I'm sure that's a godsend in the winter.

name: St Christopher's Inn - London Bridge
reviewtext: Nice and traditional hostel. To be honest, staff was great and very helpful since I crossed the door. However, it could improve with better facilities like common room and kitchen. Do not go to this hostel if you want to rest due to live music, which I really enjoyed lol!!

name: St Christopher's Inn - London Bridge
reviewtext: Way too loud, till 2 am.

name: St Christopher's Inn - London Bridge
reviewtext: Had a good time with my stay at the St. Christopher's Inn - good location and accessible to metro stop London Bridge and Borough Market. Kinda tough when reception isn't 24/7, but overall good fit. Fun that the bar downstairs had a live band (and lively crowd) on a Saturday night!

name: St Christopher's Inn - London Bridge
reviewtext: Very nice place.  The cleaning staff were non stop making sure everything was spotless at all times.  The bar is wonderful downstairs & the staff were delightful. I enjoyed the noise of all the fun in the alley patio.  My only issue was the unbearable heat inside the hostel rooms.  Although it was unusually hot in london at the time of my stay, i feel excessive heat during these times needs a solution as our rooms were (estimate) 30C+ all day and night. Despite the temps I really enjoyed my stay

name: St Christopher's Inn - London Bridge
reviewtext: What a great party I had there. Really enoyed deals and live music. Met nice people and staff was great.

name: St Christopher's Inn - London Bridge
reviewtext: Excellent location-right near tube station and Borough markets. Very noisy from bar downstairs. Can't sleep until it closes at 1am/2am. But therefore, good for socializing-with backpackers and locals alike. Pretty good for London prices.

name: St Christopher's Inn - London Bridge
reviewtext: The staff were very cheery, helpful and positive. Room was clean. Awesome free breakfast in the morning with heaps of variety. Late night music didn't bother me, no problem for heavy sleepers in my opinion. Couldn't be more perfectly situated to access the Borough markets and the London Bridge tube station. Would recommend! Only downside is not a backpackers feel downstairs because it is a pub. As a solo traveller, I found it tricky to mingle. Much better than my other London hostel experience

name: St Christopher's Inn - London Bridge
reviewtext: great location, nice staff, noisy evenings

name: St Christopher's Inn - London Bridge
reviewtext: We really liked the place - it has great location, great staff and atmosphere. There are parties every night, but it is all finished by 1 o'clock a.m. so it is ok for those who want to sleep on a quiet place, too. Plus, they give you ear plugs so don't worry :)

name: St Christopher's Inn - London Bridge
reviewtext: Will stay again! Brilliant:)

name: St Christopher's Inn - London Bridge
reviewtext: It is more like a bar with some rooms on it.  Lots of locals at the bar everyday makes it difficult to meet other travellers. Pub food and beer specials are good. Good social atmosphere just difficult to meet other travellers. Yes it's loud but if you are looking for parties and good time this shouldn't bother you

name: St Christopher's Inn - London Bridge
reviewtext:
Staff helpful and accommodating. Facilities new and clean and quiet and safe. Close to Metro and places of interest. 

Les

name: St Christopher's Inn - London Bridge
reviewtext: A great place to stay and good value! The towells and sheets they gave were really clean, and that is much appreciated. Suggestion: a blowdryer in the bathrooms would be much appreciated. I like the way there is plenty of coffee and tea!! I have no complaints about this place at all. However, the staff should know about cabs, the phone numbers of a local and reliable cab service, etc. that is NOT "Uber" or any other fool "cab like" service that is totally unreliable.

name: The Walrus Hostel
reviewtext: The kitchen was really small but overall great hostel. The staff is great and the location is excellent.

name: The Walrus Hostel
reviewtext:
Best staff IÂ´Â´Â´Â´Â´Â´Â´Â´ have ever met in the hostel in my life. They are all so friendly and helpful! I wasnt really happy that my room was on the 4th floor without a lift  but receptionist helped me with my luggage and in the end it was not so bad :). Rooms are comfortable and clean, with enough plugs for everyone to charge the phones. Clean and warm shower is a great plus too.
Bar downstairs is really cosy, with so many drinks to choose from and great prices considering its in the centre!

name: The Walrus Hostel
reviewtext: Of all the hostels I have stayed in so far in the US and abroad, The Walrus is my absolute favorite. The ease of arrival view the underground, the flexibility and warmth of the staff, the old gorgeous building; perfect. THIS IS DEFINITELY A PLACE WHERE EARPLUGS ARE REQUIRED- The Walrus is right underneath an above ground train, no matter where your room is you will hear is loudly and often. About a half hours walk away is all the main sights but I also really enjoyed the Imperial War Museum.

name: The Walrus Hostel
reviewtext: Trains! The location is central but right next to trains so it makes for a challenging sleeping arrangement.  The lounge area is a bar so if you are looking for a spot to relax search elsewhere. The staff was great and helpful though. The breakfast was basic but included. The facilities need some updating but were always clean.

name: The Walrus Hostel
reviewtext: Great atmosphere, good people solid location. Come to this hostel if you wanna have a pint with someone new and are okay with a noisy atmosphere!

name: The Walrus Hostel
reviewtext: The staff were amazing and the location unbeatable. I will definitely be staying here my next time in London

name: The Walrus Hostel
reviewtext: Lovely helpful staff! Great Location - can walk everywhere central and the complimentary breakfast is a nice touch!

name: The Walrus Hostel
reviewtext: A great location, only a short walk from Waterloo station. The atmosphere in the pub was great and staff were friendly and enthusiastic. Although it was quite noisey with the trains frenquently passing, we got a good sleep overall. Also the breakfast in the morning was fantastic, great value for money.

name: The Walrus Hostel
reviewtext: Very helpful staff! Great location.

name: The Walrus Hostel
reviewtext: Super good hostel. Staff was very nice. The building seems a little old but the rooms are very good, big and clean. The bed was comfortable and there are big lockers for your luggage, they can lend you a padlock for free. The breakfast is very good but something salty would be amazing! The ensuite room has only the shower inside so you must share WC (I didn't like that). Perfect location.

name: The Walrus Hostel
reviewtext: Hostel is a fantastic location. Great free Breakfast, nice beds. Amesome staff. Love everything about it. Stayed here about 7 times now and will continue to. As should you.

name: The Walrus Hostel
reviewtext: Had a great stay here, though only for one night. Very good breakfast included, too.  Alex was extremely helpful at the front desk! Will be back again.

name: The Walrus Hostel
reviewtext: You cannot sleep here it's next to a train line where 6 tracks meet together. Enjoy hell

name: The Walrus Hostel
reviewtext: Overall I enjoyed this hostel, it is within walking distance to the city Centre and most tourist attractions, and if not the underground is really close by! The staff were really friendly and helpful and the bar down stairs was good to hangout in! The beds where comfortable and the rooms and bathrooms where pretty clean, only thing is it's quite close to the station so it can be noisy but that didn't bother me at all!

name: The Walrus Hostel
reviewtext: The location was good but very noisy. The facilities could be a little better,  the dorm was very hot but it just happened to be very hot that day. Staff ask to hand in IPads, cameras  to reception when going out. This makes me wonder if there has been problems with theft. However, I got all my belongings back :). The staff seemed trustworthy. This is a relatively good hostel but if you want to sleep really well, I recommend going elsewhere.

name: The Walrus Hostel
reviewtext: Friendly and helpful staff, in a good central location close to the London eye. Very clean with a kitchen, breakfast and pub. Only downside is the great location means traffic and train noise. Thanks for a great stay!

name: The Walrus Hostel
reviewtext: The Walrus was a  really charming hostel with a great location next to the London Eye. The staff is awesome, includes free breakfast and they lend out most items that hostels normally sell which is really awesome. It's a loud location since its directly next to the Waterloo rail lines but, it didn't bother me after a long day exploring London. The facilities are really old, but they were always kept clean and the staff more than makes up for them. One of my favorite hostels.

name: The Walrus Hostel
reviewtext: Wonderful place.  Fantastic staff and location. 20 minutes to walk anywhere, 10-15 by public transit.  Would definitely recommend

name: The Walrus Hostel
reviewtext:
Great location 
Bathroom and kitchen needs improvements

name: The Walrus Hostel
reviewtext: The hostel is in a pretty great location, though since it is directly next to Waterloo station, the trains going by all night are very loud. The beds are pretty comfortable, and it's great that you can get a towel for free from reception. The only downside to having a code for the door instead of a key card is that you have to carry a piece of paper around with you, which could be easily lost.

name: The Walrus Hostel
reviewtext: love the walrus

name: The Walrus Hostel
reviewtext: Only my ever second ever stay at a hostel and the Walrus was unreal. Such a friendly welcome and just a really cool central spot with everything you could need. I'll be back next time im in London. Thanks dudes

name: The Walrus Hostel
reviewtext: My only slight annoyance was that my friend and myself had requested to be in the same room. She had called twice to confirm and I confirmed upon arrival to drop off my bags. Yet when we checked in that evening we were told we could not be in the same room. Considering I had flown from Australia and her Ireland to see each other for one night it was a little sad to not be able to share the room. Other than that everyone was very helpful ðŸ˜€

name: The Walrus Hostel
reviewtext:
So much noise at night from the trains station!
Cold showers on almost every level of the hostel.

name: The Walrus Hostel
reviewtext: Had a real good time at this hostel, nice clean rooms and really good atmosphere plus a location that is impossible to beat, highly recommend this hostel

name: The Walrus Hostel
reviewtext: Only one shower per floor which was kind of annoying but other than that great staff and was overall happy with my stay!

name: The Walrus Hostel
reviewtext: Hostel was decent. No air conditioning and was very hot the first night there. The second night was much more bearable. I thought the breakfast was quite good and was free. The bar downstairs would benefit from staying open later, as it currently closes at 11pm

name: The Walrus Hostel
reviewtext: I loved that it was within walking distance of Westminster and pretty much everything, but I wish I would have know that it was located underneath railroad tracka..the trains literally never stopped. Also, my shower only had cold water. I did enjoy the bar downstairs, though.

name: The Walrus Hostel
reviewtext: Really enjoyed my stay - amazing spot, great staff, really good breakfast for a hostel and was still small enough to have some personality when it came to the actual hostel. Despite being above the bar and next to the train station it wasn't even that loud.

name: The Walrus Hostel
reviewtext: Good location near to lots of the sights in London. The staff were really helpful and welcoming too - but a 22-bed dorm is a little overwhelming for a first time traveler like myself. Perhaps my only other complaint is that the shower water was really cold for some reason. But overall it was a good stay for 1 night (:

name: The Walrus Hostel
reviewtext: Bar downstairs was awesome, staff were all really really cool and I loved just having a chat to them. I couldn't figure out the shower but that's on me hahaha. Beds were really comfy and my room had 2 fans in it to get all 8 beds. The only downside was the train line right next to the room and was really loud all night. And the stairs were not fun but that's just me being lazy/unfit hahha

name: The Walrus Hostel
reviewtext: Safe hostel, however if you are a light sleeper, don't go there. They are right next to the train tracks, and they pass from 6am to 12am. The free breakfast (cold but all you need) is great. No ambiance because it's also a bar, so it's best for solo travelers staying for one night. It's also quite far from everything.

name: The Walrus Hostel
reviewtext: This place was definitely satisfactory, but it felt more like a bar that happened to have rooms above it, rather than the other way around. There was little to no common room space outside of the bar downstairs, which isn't accessible at all times, so I found the lack of space outside of the bedroom a little annoying! But the facilities were fine (bathrooms were small, little vanity space) and the staff seemed nice. Very close to many public transit options, restaurants, and grocery stores.

name: The Walrus Hostel
reviewtext: If you're visiting London you have to stay here! The staff is incredibly nice and the hostel offers a lot of free events to get to know other people and the location better. You are within walking distance to so many sites and public transportation. The free breakfast is great and having a bar right there is so convenient. They had fans to cool the rooms down and the room was so clean. Such a great value for your money. I will definitely stay here again when I come back to London.

name: The Walrus Hostel
reviewtext: It's an awesome place, near to the center of London and the staff is really cool. Hope to return soon

name: The Walrus Hostel
reviewtext: The staff were friendly and helpful. I arrived early, and storing my bag for the day prior to check in was not a problem at all. The bed was comfy, but the rooms stuffy as there was no aircon and only one small fan. The rooms were a little noisy (as expected due to the close proximity to Waterloo station), but not so bad that you couldn't sleep. The lockers were too small to store a suitcase, but security was fine otherwise. The only slight annoyance was there being no toilet in the ensuite.

name: The Walrus Hostel
reviewtext: Getting to the point, my 4-bed mixed room was literally inches from the train railway which produced a highly screechy and terrible noise all night long. I would of closed the only window but it was 28 C (82 F), no ventilation in the room and a small fan that only reached the bottom level (I was top bed). I couldn't sleep all night and when I did get a little sleep, I woke up drenched in sweat. An Argentine guy who worked there was rude and did nothing about the problem. Overall,never again.

name: The Walrus Hostel
reviewtext: Great location, very friendly staff, a decent bar on the first floor.  Close to the subway and small grocery store across the street.

name: The Walrus Hostel
reviewtext: Perfect stay in London!

name: The Walrus Hostel
reviewtext: Pretty much next to the London Eye. Good spot, nice staff, room was pretty large and good security along with lockers. Shower was crazy small but no issue really.

name: The Walrus Hostel
reviewtext: In terms of ambiance, those place is a 10.  The common areas and bar are super cool. Breakfast is decent: cereal and toast with nut butter and jams with milks, juices, teas and coffee. The rooms are basic, lacking outlets by the bunks.  The neighborhood is fantastic: tons of cool nearby bars and restaurants, walkable to everything and close to the trains.  But therein lies the problem: the noise from the station is horrendous. They don't make earplugs for those decibels. You've been warned.

name: The Walrus Hostel
reviewtext:
You couldn't ask for a better location for a hostel. We never stepped foot on a bus or train, since we were able to walk to the London Eye, Big Ben, Tower Bridge, Theatre District, etc. The rooms were immaculately clean, bathrooms too. The downstairs pub (although quite expensive) has  a good selection of beers on tap.  
The ONLY thing is that it's a bit loud with the train being right by the window.  I had no issues sleeping (I'm sure the beer helped) but my buddy said he kept waking up.

name: The Walrus Hostel
reviewtext: Great location, and a nice pub downstairs. I ended up extending my stay from two to four nights, so I had to switch rooms a couple of times, but the staff was helpful. Simple but nice breakfast.

name: The Walrus Hostel
reviewtext:
The location is great - London Eye, Big Ben, but also pubs, restaurants, and groceries.
I could never get hot water in the shower - I feel that a hostel should be able to provide enough hot water for everyone to shower.
I rate the location as less-than-perfect because of the overground right outside my window (on the 4th floor) screeching all day - starting early in the morning and ending late at night. Not much the Walrus can do about this, but be warned - bring earplugs.

name: The Walrus Hostel
reviewtext: I loved the location of The Walrus. Such a quick walk over to the London Eye and Buckingham Palace. They had a wonderful breakfast spread and catered to vegans/vegetarians too which was a plus. I think my biggest complaint, or warning, for future guests would be the bathroom situation. There are very few bathrooms for the amount of people staying at the hostel, and no bathroom with a shower has a toilet so you have to use two separate facilities. I'd definitely stay again though!

name: The Walrus Hostel
reviewtext: Awesome stay, despite the fact that it was during the world cup.

name: The Walrus Hostel
reviewtext:
The best part of the hostel was its prime location in London.  It is only a bridge away from Westminster and East London, the places I was most interested in seeing.

There's a bar area downstairs for breakfast and a small kitchen upstairs.  The bar gets busy at night so unfortunately, if you want a quiet place to lounge, it doesn't quite exist here in the evenings.  Overall though, it was a great value for the cost and I definitely recommend it if you're on a budget.

name: The Walrus Hostel
reviewtext: Great staff, great location, only thing is that the train is right there so thats pretty noisy, bring a fan! It gets pretty hot as well, but all in all great eviroment....I would come stay again!

name: The Walrus Hostel
reviewtext:
The hostel was in an excellent location not far from Waterloo station and from other touristic sights. Unfortunately the room was hot and there was no AC, room was noisy as it was next to train station, and the showers were too small to accommodate an avg size individual.
Hostel lobby has a cool pub for drinks. Unfortunately the breakfast offered in pub was not as great as the drinks.

name: The Walrus Hostel
reviewtext: Great location and price point for budget travelers with a short walk to London Eye. Breakfast was simple but good. However, I stayed in the 22 bed dorm and it was very hot and the fans didn't work. Needs some updating.

name: The Walrus Hostel
reviewtext:
Great value for your money. Very good location, though as the train passes right next to the windows it can get really noisy. 
Good facilities in general. My only comment would be that there are not any plugs next to the beds, so if you don't mind leaving your electronics far away from you at night, it shouldn't be an issue.

name: The Walrus Hostel
reviewtext: The staff and the atmosphere here was amazing and with ear plugs the sound of the trains and pub wasn't bothersome. The location being so central was great. Security was probably the biggest let down here, there also was no plug for my devices near my bed so I couldn't set an alarm for checkout. The doors lock was broken plus there was no lock on the bar entrance so anyone could enter. Lockers weren't assigned to a bed so I ended up storing my stuff under my bed as there were no lockers free.

name: The Walrus Hostel
reviewtext:
First hostel experience, it was great
The only negatives is it is right next to the train line, which isn't an issue for me being from a big city with lots of noise, but if you're a light sleeper this may be an issue - take ear plugs and a mask or ask staff. Also the water in the shower on the top level never got hot, this was a welcome experience given it was a "heatwave" while we were there, and there's showers on the other floors for use anyway.
Overall great experience, would recommend.

name: The Walrus Hostel
reviewtext: Terribly noisy as it is next to the train tracks going into Waterloo station! Customers need to be warned about this. Staff very good. Facilities clean, Breakfast also good.

name: The Walrus Hostel
reviewtext:
Staff were friendly, professional and couldn't ask for more.

The location is right next to an elevated train night, with trains going past every hour of the night. Noise from the street including police is very distracting and loud. The location otherwise is great.

The pub downstairs, while nice, is filled with locals at night, which isn't great for solo travellers looking to meet other travellers.

Beds were very uncomfortable, and were sagging so much you could feel the supports underneath.

name: The Walrus Hostel
reviewtext: Hostel was good and staff were great. The beds could definitely use a refreshing though. The mattress I was on was caving in. Other than that the place was pretty good. Location is great too!

name: The Walrus Hostel
reviewtext: Free breakfast, great atmosphere, would definitely stay here again

name: The Walrus Hostel
reviewtext: It was good however they don't have lift facility ðŸ˜‚ need to carry heavy luggages to 3rd floorðŸ˜­.

name: The Walrus Hostel
reviewtext: Very nice hostel above a bar. Was loud from the trains though

name: The Walrus Hostel
reviewtext: Next to Waterloo train station, with train operation 24 hours a day, it is extremely noisy.

name: Via Limehouse
reviewtext: I am not English, I am Scottish it would be nice if I had that option to choose.

name: Via Limehouse
reviewtext: Good, only real criticism was staff intrusion into room - electricians doing work in corridor must have entered room 10-12 times one day, sometimes they knocked, sometimes just opened door7

name: Via Limehouse
reviewtext: Friendly staff, clean and comfy bunk beds, well equipped kitchen area. The shower in 005 (room we were staying in) looked extremely neglected, dirty and had hot water just for a brief moment. Showers on other floors were clean and tidy though.

name: Via Limehouse
reviewtext: The facilities, atmosphere and staff were of good standard. However, the rooms are very cramped. After booking a bed in the 4 person dorm room expecting some space, I found it to be very tight . Almost unable to stand up in the room between the beds.

name: Via Limehouse
reviewtext: Recommended for Staff, price and location. My shared room was very basic,  2 bunks and a hand basin, with toilets and showers down the hallway.  Because  I arrived late Saturday evening and left early the following morning I cannot comment on the facilities, such as breakfast in the large communal area that has a large screen.  The staff are very friendly, eager to help, and if you forget them, there are towels (rented) and toiletries (purchased).

name: Via Limehouse
reviewtext: Great staff Who was Very helpful and friendly. Beds were good to sleep in and the rooms were clean.

name: Via Limehouse
reviewtext: Bed very comfortable, everywhere very clean. Felt safe and welcomed. thank you :)

name: Via Limehouse
reviewtext: You get what you pay for. It was cramped in a 4 bed dorm and really hot due to weather. Had clean bedding and breakfast was simple.  It's great if all u need is a bed and wash facilities.  I would use them again. Staff were helpful and moved people around so we could have only females in a mixed dorm . All in all it was good. Could for with some kind of aircon in rooms and more toilet paper. Also a mat in the shower room.

name: Via Limehouse
reviewtext: Excellent value for money especially within London. Perfect location and facilities for somewhere to sleep as I was out most of the days that I was in London for. Would recommend staying here!

name: Via Limehouse
reviewtext: East for transport, friendly and approachable staff and simple clean rooms suitable for the on the go people! The rooms were secure and I was comfortable leaving my belongings in there throughout the day!

name: Via Limehouse
reviewtext: Staff were lovely! very helpful and kind. However rooms were not secure- door would not lock half the time. Shower and bathrooms were disgusting. Common area was ok. Baggage area was a nightmare to get to.

name: Via Limehouse
reviewtext: We stayed here the past couple days and we didn't really like it. The location was fine, not very central but still easy to access everything by the tube. The directions on the page are spot on. However, the kitchen and bathrooms were not clean at all, had a very grungy feel. And the kitchen had minimal supplies-I wouldn't plan on cooking here unless you carry your own dishes and cutlery. Lastly, we've paid less for hostels that were much better than this, so the value for money isn't good.

name: Via Limehouse
reviewtext: Ok if you just need a bed. Check in took 1 hour, no lockers where available, luggage room is not secure, place was a quite dirty too. I was woken up multiple times by people shouting in the middle of the night.

name: Via Limehouse
reviewtext: Todo muy bien!!

name: Via Limehouse
reviewtext: Do not stay here particularly if you are a young female traveller!! My friend and I arrived and were made to wait an hour before we could go to our room, which was incredibly small, dark and dingy. It appeared as though people lived there and were not travellers. The bathroom had mould and hair everywhere. No lockers to store luggage or valuables. We felt very unsafe and did not even stay one night as we were that dissatisfied and concerned. Staff were okay.

name: Via Limehouse
reviewtext: Place was clean and tidy as was the room, bed was also comfortable with clean linen and there was also plenty of usb chargers. The bad was the main corridor door slammed shut very loudly, the keep noise down after 1030 was not enforced there was lots of door banging and noise till about 0300hrs and finally not hot water so had to have a cold shower in the morning. Overall ok for what we paid.

name: Via Limehouse
reviewtext: Location was fine, rooms were very small but luckily I was staying in a room just with friends. Washrooms were not very clean and sometimes no hot water

name: Via Limehouse
reviewtext: The rooms are extremely small (even for a hostel) in the sense that there is almost no space to move in the room. In case of an accident, it would be difficult to move. The beds are really uncomfortable. There are lockers but they are few in comparison with the hostel capacity so you have to leave your stuff without any kind of security. The staff is quite dry. The bathrooms were also dirty and the toilet was broken. Disappointing and totally not recommended.

name: MEININGER London Hyde Park
reviewtext: The staff and location were amazing! Very close to the tube and many tourist attractions. However, security was not great. You had a keycard to get into your room but beyond that the locks on the lockers were mostly broken or would still open with a padlock in them. And it felt more like a large hotel than a hostel, not very social. And the bathrooms are tiny!

name: MEININGER London Hyde Park
reviewtext: The air conditioner works well, the bathroom is fine as well. This is a well-managed hostel.

name: MEININGER London Hyde Park
reviewtext: Very good hostel. I only stayed for one night so didn't use many of the facilities, but the location was perfect, security was good, and staff were very friendly. Breakfast is optional - you can pay for a full continental of good quality. Rooms were small but good, with lockers for storage and a good bathroom with shower. Value for money was excellent.

name: MEININGER London Hyde Park
reviewtext: The location is amazing and everything pretty new, but the room was too small for 8 girls...

name: MEININGER London Hyde Park
reviewtext: Really great location close to two major train stations and Kensington Palace and the Natural History Museum. We stayed in a 4 person room and it was a little cramped for space - the rooms have big tables in them that take up a lot of room. Room was clean and beds were reasonably comfy.

name: MEININGER London Hyde Park
reviewtext: This was our ( my boyfriend and I) first time staying in a hostel. We were very skeptical and nervous about the experience. I was shocked that this hostel was more like a hotel. Our "roommate" wasn't bad. We were just a little uncomfortable and felt we couldn't talk at night at all. Besides that this hostel is a 10/10 and I would recckmend to anyone. Only concern was the bathroom showers not feeling the cleanest but not bad at all. Also be sure to bring a lock for the little cubby.

name: MEININGER London Hyde Park
reviewtext: Very little atmosphere here and no facilities for cooking own meals. Felt like more of a hotel type setup. Decent value and location is adequate.

name: MEININGER London Hyde Park
reviewtext: The facilities and room are clean. I was staying in a 12-person room and there are 2 bathroom inside which is quite nice. But the location is actually quite far away from hyde park (~10-15mins walk)

name: MEININGER London Hyde Park
reviewtext: Great hotel staff  were very professional and welcoming and made me feel very valued as a guest. The room was immaculate and cleaned daily by paid employees while I was there. The lift made getting a heavy suitcase around much easier and the atmosphere was calm and relaxed. Thank you so much,

name: MEININGER London Hyde Park
reviewtext: The room itself is fine and the bathroom is big and clean. The price is also quite good for London. The main issue is the location - it is kind of far from the centre of London and it is on a main road so is very noisy even in the middle of the night. Staff were friendly. There was not much of a social atmosphere so not good for solo travellers.

name: MEININGER London Hyde Park
reviewtext: I have stayed at several hostels in London whilst completing a University course at the weekends. I have stayed at Meininger 3 times now with next weekend booked in also. This is my favourite (for location and for value for money)!

name: MEININGER London Hyde Park
reviewtext: The location was great, not too far from the train station. Although it is a short commute from the center of London, it's still near a few attractions and it compensates location by being located in a reasonably quiet and attractive part of town. The staff were equally friendly and eager to help when asking for advice on transportation and places to go. Overall, my experience at Meininger was very pleasant and I would definitely consider staying again.

name: MEININGER London Hyde Park
reviewtext: Everything was great, one of my favorite hostels. The only downside is that maybe they can be more flexible with the check-in time.

name: MEININGER London Hyde Park
reviewtext: I've stayed at the hostel before, which must be a good sign. The beds are nice, staff are friendly and I feel like you get what you pay for. This time I was on the 6th floor, which meant I had no WiFi in my room. In the lobby the WiFi was fine. The bathrooms were a bit dirty every now and then, but not so much that you couldn't clean yourself anymore. Overall I would definitely come back if I am in Lodon again.

name: MEININGER London Hyde Park
reviewtext: Everything was perfect!, also the weather ;0â‚¬

name: MEININGER London Hyde Park
reviewtext:
Booked this hostel since it claimed to have AC. Turns out there is none on the floor we were assigned. Which in turn lead to mosquito bites. 
Other than that, a fine hostel.

name: MEININGER London Hyde Park
reviewtext: Perfect location for the museums and the hidden gems of London. However maybe an option for same sex rooms would have made me, a first time hostel stayer, a little more safe. Floor was a little dusty and shower not the cleanest. Apart from that I had the best time!

name: MEININGER London Hyde Park
reviewtext: The air conditioning is only in the lobby.

name: MEININGER London Hyde Park
reviewtext: This place was more like a hotel than hostel. It was extremely clean and the location was great. WiFi was fantasticâ€”the best in any of the places I stayed in Europe. Check-in isn't until 3pm, but you can hang out in the cafe area until then. Definitely recommend if you want to stay in the heart of London without breaking the bank.

name: MEININGER London Hyde Park
reviewtext: It's a hostel for Scouts, so if you're there to meet people and connect with others you probably won't get it. Location is good, being next to Hyde park. Bathrooms were pretty disgusting and the overall water pressure was lacking

name: MEININGER London Hyde Park
reviewtext: I don't know if there AC was broken or they just did not have it on high enough but the room was unbearably hot.  I woke up multiple times during the night from heat and woke up in the morning with a ring of sweat around my neckline.  We opened all the windows that we could and tried a circulating fan but nothing really helped.  It made getting ready in the room a pain and sleeping quite miserable.

name: MEININGER London Hyde Park
reviewtext: Great value for money with the place operating like a hotel but with dorms. Very helpful staff and a good location too right next to Glouster station.

name: MEININGER London Hyde Park
reviewtext: Needed a place to stay in transit before flying home from Gatwick. Good location and value for money. Served its purpose well. Not sure about the atmosphere/night life but was a nice bed to stay in for the night.

name: MEININGER London Hyde Park
reviewtext: It was a great hostel! The staff is extremely nice, it's 10 minutes walk from hyde park and 5 minutes walk from the tube. I wan in the doorms and it was very clean and roomy. The AC worked great (hottest summer ever!).

name: MEININGER London Hyde Park
reviewtext: This place was convenient for me and my husband for a one night stay while in transit. We thought we had booked a dorm room but were pleased when we ended up with a room with just 1 bunk bed for more privacy. The bathrooms were quite dirty, and the toilets on our floor didn't flush very well. The atmosphere was somewhere in between a hostel and a hotel. The location is great, near some awesome museums and sights.

name: MEININGER London Hyde Park
reviewtext: Location is great. Staff are helpful. No wifi in my room on the 6th floor. Not a very social atmosphere in the lobby.

name: MEININGER London Hyde Park
reviewtext:
Overall I enjoyed my stay. 
There were a LOT of school groups there which meant that the lounge areas could get crowded and loud very quickly.

name: MEININGER London Hyde Park
reviewtext: Worst hostel, room was tiny, couldnt open my suitcase in the room cause it was so small!! The Bathroom was always dirty and the floor was wet, its really expensive for this kind of place.

name: MEININGER London Hyde Park
reviewtext:
Fantastic hostel, nice clean rooms with brilliant service from the front desk staff! Location was fantastic, with food, a supermarket and public transport all within a 5min walk from the hostel! I felt facilities were rather lacking, especially since i came from there Amsterdam (Amstel) location which had a full kitchen and such.
My only gripe is that the showers are just way too small, i can't tell you how many times i bumped my head on the faucet just bending down to soap my legs!

name: MEININGER London Hyde Park
reviewtext:
This is a nice place well located, the staff are frendly and helpfull.
Bring your own padlocks,for security. The one thing that let's it down is the lack of charging points. There was only one socket in the dorm I stayed in.

name: MEININGER London Hyde Park
reviewtext: Sssshhhhh!  Don't tell anyone what a great place this is, or it will be forever booked!

name: MEININGER London Hyde Park
reviewtext:
This was great for one night before my morning flight. Great location for tube station and in a nice area of London. The staff on check in were really unhelpful and quite unfriendly, but the one i checked out with was much nicer.  

The dorms are modern and clean.

name: MEININGER London Hyde Park
reviewtext: bedroom was cramped, didn't get put into the correct room that i booked. no chargers available on the bunk beds. faulty showers (broken faucet, mould). cramped bathrooms all round.

name: MEININGER London Hyde Park
reviewtext:
We had a great stay! Our room was decent sized and very clean; every single bed had its own lamp and power outlet; and we had a private bathroom that was always extremely clean. I really have nothing bad to say, except 2 minor comments - the lock on the drawers under the bed did not work and I felt the breakfast was a bit pricey for what was being offered. 
Definitely the best hostel I've ever stayed in London and would definitely stay here again!

name: MEININGER London Hyde Park
reviewtext: No hostel feel, rooms quite small, not very clean, staff need to explain bed allocating mire clearly as one night I returned to the hostel to find someone asleep in my bed. Felt more like a cheap hotel. Wouldn't stay again.

name: MEININGER London Hyde Park
reviewtext: Does not have the "hostel" feel to it, but otherwise it's nice.

name: MEININGER London Hyde Park
reviewtext: The hostel is in a good location and the place looks nice when you enter, almost hotel like but when I entered my room it wasn't what I expected. There were barely any plugs for a room of 12 people and only 2 small bathrooms, which was not ideal. My backpack also didn't fit in the locker, which was odd because I did not have an overly large backpack, and I was uncomfortable leaving it on my bed so I had to use luggage storage instead, a little inconvenient.

name: MEININGER London Hyde Park
reviewtext:
London's best kept secret
Booked a 12 bed ensuite, all rooms accept basic rooms have aircon which is great at this time of the year. Management and staff are great and accommodating. Hostel is spotlessly clean and you would think it was a hotel. Great for weekends away or business trips to London.

name: MEININGER London Hyde Park
reviewtext: Great, friendly staff. Prime location- directly across from natural history museum, less than 5 minute walk to the V & A, and an easy stroll to Hyde Park. A 20 minute walk to Harris's (or a short tube ride) and only 2 blocks to the stop for the circle, district, and Piccadilly Lines. The area is quiet at night. The place was very clean and had ample bathroom facilities. Will stay here again.

name: MEININGER London Hyde Park
reviewtext: Great place to stay at. I stayed here before and will stay again.

name: MEININGER London Hyde Park
reviewtext: We were four girls (all 24) and stayed for 3 nighs in July. The ho(s)tel is more a hotel than a hostel which would have been nice to know. Not a party hostel. Location is great, close to Metro station and South Kensington is very pretty. Hotel is clean and the rooms are cleaned every day. There is AC in the room but is only turned on in the morning, which makes the room very hot at night. Rooms are also very small. Staff was friendly. Great place ifyou like it a little fancier.

name: MEININGER London Hyde Park
reviewtext: Hostel is a little far but easily accessed by metro. Great atmosphere, helpful staff, and friendly guests. Worth the journey out of downtown.

name: MEININGER London Hyde Park
reviewtext: As always excellent in all regards, I stay there regularly for this reason.

name: MEININGER London Hyde Park
reviewtext: My favourite hostel in London, this was my second stay in Meininger Hyde Park. Clean, nice, good for the price. Buffet breakfast worth its price, we were very satisfied. We only had problems with the bathroom's door handle in our room, was difficult to open and close, should be fixed. Other than that, great experience.

name: MEININGER London Hyde Park
reviewtext: Decent hostel. Cleans rooms, beds already made (a nice touch), clean bathrooms (albeit small), and very easy to reach via tube. Only docked for lack of plugs and lights by the beds. People have devices to charge and it's unnerving to leave them out in the open away from you while you're sleeping.

name: MEININGER London Hyde Park
reviewtext:
It should be noted that, even in the 12 person mixed dorms, individual customers at this location have the ability to turn off Air Conditioning.

This was a pretty significant factor in my stay, and it can potentially be in yours. I did not know this when booking the reservation and management was unhelpful and not at all understanding of my situation when I attempted to point out the issue with this. Rather than argue with management, I checked out 3 days early and booked a hotel.

name: MEININGER London Hyde Park
reviewtext:
I expected more for the price I paid.
1) Wifi didn't work on the bedroom.  
2) The drain of the shower was clogged for the 4 days I stayed there. So, the bathroom flooded at a 30 second shower. Horrible. 
3) It was quite warm when I was in London, and even though the room had AC, for some reason they only turned it on in the morning, when everyone was ready to go out. I woke up sweating every night there.
One last thing is that the staff could smile a little bit more.

name: MEININGER London Hyde Park
reviewtext: more like a hotel then a hostel but you can take that as good or bad yourself. great location right near the natural history museum and a really great area. rooms were great and clean. all the facilities you need (though i couldn't find a kitchen) but has a microwave and cutlery

name: MEININGER London Hyde Park
reviewtext: Very clean and has a bathroom in each room. They offered free luggage storage as well, which was very convenient. There is a metro stop 5 minutes away and overall is in a great location. It was not a very social hostel, but was clean, quiet, and secure.

name: MEININGER London Hyde Park
reviewtext: Excellent. I've stayed in many hostels all over the world. Meinegger London is one of my favorites.

name: MEININGER London Hyde Park
reviewtext:
Good location. Convenient. 

Booked into dorm room. Was given a camp bed on the floor of a full four bunk room. Camp bed very short - had to sleep with feet and ankles over the edge of the bed (I'm average height). No access to power point. No access to locker for baggage. Not able to change room when asked staff, who were otherwise useful. 

Not a hostel atmosphere. More like staying in the cramped spare rooms of a hotel and conference centre. 

Would not recommend. Book elsewhere.

name: No.8 Seven Sisters
reviewtext: This hostel was disappointing. I have been travelling & living in hostels around the world for 16 months & I have not experienced this standard of accomodation. Security was an issue, as there was none. Wifi was not working, staff were rude & unhelpful, & the atmosphere was unpleasant. The beds were incredibly squeaky & charging ports did not work. There was only one bathroom per floor which was totally impractical for the amount of beds per level. Cheap stay but still overpriced for what it is!

name: No.8 Seven Sisters
reviewtext: Amazing value for money, friendly staff and 15 min metro ride to London centre! Facilities are okay, but bed is super noisy!!! Otherwise, can totally recommend

name: No.8 Seven Sisters
reviewtext: Get what you pay for. Be mindful that cheap hostels do attract interesting characters. One shower was broken. However, the place was surprisingly clean considering its price range.

name: No.8 Seven Sisters
reviewtext: RUDE STAFF not very helpfull, the rooms have onky two outlets and if you are in the top bed you cant reach the outlet, the lower bed is in front of the outlet so if someone is sleeping you cant reach it, door with out handle for the room, IF ITS ONLY FOR SLEEP ONE NIGHT ITS OK!

name: No.8 Seven Sisters
reviewtext:
Always appreciate staying here. Good vibes, amazing value, great staff, kitchen to cook!
Thankyou x

name: No.8 Seven Sisters
reviewtext: I'll come back again.

name: No.8 Seven Sisters
reviewtext: Info said it was close to London. Not at all. It's a 12 min walk through a really rough neighborhood and a very expensive train ride to anything worth seeing. Not their fault but still horrible. It felt like they opened a bar with a ton of rooms above it and didn't know what to use those rooms for so they made it a hostel. Rooms were horribly upkept with old paint and no electrical outlets. We had 6 beds in our room and 2 plugs!!!!!! Poor ventilation in the rooms made them unbearably hot.

name: No.8 Seven Sisters
reviewtext: Probably won't stay there again. Had to pay with cash but I think they said it on the website. Just annoying when you've used your cash during the day. Honestly wouldn't have taken a shower in any of the bathrooms I went in. But its cheap & not bad for the price. If your looking to stay more than a night I would look for somewhere else.

name: No.8 Seven Sisters
reviewtext: Don't stay there if you don't have to. You can see any kind of insects such as spiders. Beds are not well and clean. It's not a traveller hostel. You'll see people came from other countries and working and trying to live in London. No plugs for beds. I don't suggest you to leave your phone away. No AC. 8 people and small window. It's close to the central london. It's a cheap place makes you not a homeless but don't come here for holidays guys. Don't stay there if you don't have to.

name: No.8 Seven Sisters
reviewtext:
Good value for money. Staff was nice.
My food was kept dissapearing from the kitchen. Poor quality of beds, place is rather dirty and area is not very nice.
There isn't any communal area rather than some space in the kitchen or pub downstairs. Plug sockets not in a conviniet place.
I won't stay there again.

name: No.8 Seven Sisters
reviewtext: There is no security of your belongings, one person theft my iPhone and money. And the staff didn't help you. Not recommended to guests.

name: No.8 Seven Sisters
reviewtext: The level of unprofessionalism is outstanding! After staying for two weeks without incident, I was informed that I was banned from all No.8 hostels due to a incident that occurred last summer. The incident in question? "Insulting staff" I forget how criminal of a offense it is for a mistreated guest to call you a racist for your inappropriate behavior. My emails have gone unanswered. African-Americans traveling through London, beware of this establishment!

name: No.8 Seven Sisters
reviewtext: Pretty far from London, and in an area where I didn't feel safe walking alone from the train to the hostel. The bar was filled with old men and not at all what I had been expecting. I didn't come to party and thought the bar would be a cool way to meet other travelers, but almost everyone at this place had been there for awhile and weren't leaving anytime soon. The bathrooms were always kinda gross and it was just not what I was looking for in a hostel.

name: No.8 Seven Sisters
reviewtext: Excellent

name: No.8 Seven Sisters
reviewtext: Good value, cool people.

name: No.8 Seven Sisters
reviewtext: Brilliant place for a quick cheap but friendly stay in London. Lovely staff, a friendly atmosphere 24/7 and very close tot he Victoria line that takes you to the centre in 20min max. Perfect for those that like communal living and don't need too much privacy for their travels.

name: No.8 Seven Sisters
reviewtext:
Great price...sketchy environment. 
Clean beds, bathrooms are a little scary. Neighborhood is intimidating if you're a woman traveling alone. Rooms can get hot in the summer. All and all, for the price, no major complaints.

name: No.8 Seven Sisters
reviewtext: It was worst experience to stay in this hostel.  There were no charging plugs besides bed and even in mro no plug was working. The hostel staff was so kon professional. When I complaint about Wifi  and charging plugs issues they denied and claimed it's working fine. Interent was not working in room and cleanses was zero. will never suggest anyone to choose this hostel.

name: No.8 Seven Sisters
reviewtext:
Security - emergency exit doors were left open as well as dorm room doors. Staff were not present over night. 
Atmosphere - not sociable.
Facilities - we were in an 8 bed dorm. There were 4 plugs, 1 of which was in use for the fan. No multiplier extension leads were provided. The pillow was like sleeping on a sack of potatoes it was so lumpy. 
Staff - checkout is 8:30-10. We waited until 9 for staff to appear to check us out. We couldn't drop key off and leave as they take Â£20 deposit for key

name: No.8 Seven Sisters
reviewtext: It was filthy, cash only which is very inconvenient, and loud very late into the night.

name: No.8 Seven Sisters
reviewtext:
Excellent Costumer Service, from Receptionists to Houskeepers, to Managers. Highly recommended.
Birmingham is a fun city.

name: No.8 Seven Sisters
reviewtext:
Not that clean.. not enough bathrooms and not feeling safe
The beds are good and the people are nice

name: No.8 Seven Sisters
reviewtext:
Best value!
Considering how cheap this place is it's very clean and comfortable!
Six bed dorm was big light and airy. 
Mostly a long term worker population, people are friendly in the communal area but quiet and respectful in the dorms

name: No.8 Seven Sisters
reviewtext:
Their prices are really good especially for a spot in London but guys...
The hostel was the dirtiest place I've ever been to. There are spiders everywhere, dead cockroaches and everything is dirty. There's also this weird smell all over the place. I was feeling sick the whole time and slept horribly. If you need a place to stay at for a night, you might do it, but it's still the worst thing you are ever going to experience. I really don't get why no one in there is cleaning up. It's disgusting!

name: No.8 Seven Sisters
reviewtext: This hostel is very good at low price. I well received Wifi (and it was powerful) in my bedroom (22 bed dormitory). The atmosphere in the kitchen is very good to meet new people. At bar you have a pool (1 pound), 2 free chess game and you can put your laptop or smartphone anywhere you want (plug included). This hostel is also very well situated: manor house station is in zone 2 and 3 (10 minutes by bus or 15 minutes on foot), so you can visit all london at a bargain price with your oyster card.

name: No.8 Seven Sisters
reviewtext: Second time I've stayed at seven sisters. Absolutely love it. Everyone is so nice and genuine. Have made so many lovely new friends from all around the world. If there is an issue, the staff sort it out

name: No.8 Seven Sisters
reviewtext: Worst hostel I have ever stayed in. It was filthy, stank of sewage as we walked up the stairs, tiny locker so had to leave most of my stuff out, stifling hot rooms (I know it is the UK and didn't expect air con, but fans!) where I slept about 1.5 hours in total, no charger or light by the beds, pretty sure the beds weren't changed before we got there and we had one bathroom per floor - MANY people sharing them. I could go on but I have no characters left! Never again.

name: No.8 Seven Sisters
reviewtext: No circulation of air, wifi doesnt work in rooms, 10 quid for a towel.

name: No.8 Seven Sisters
reviewtext:
Awesome people!!! Always someone to talk too. Great kitchen. Lack of dish washing enforcement and paper towels.
Great communal area. Enough fridge space and washrooms and showers to accommodate haven't had to wait in line for a shower in the morning.
Reminder that you have to pay cash only when you arrive to pay the rest of the fee.
Great location. Situated between Manor House and Seven sister station. Bus stops are near by. 

Thanks for the stay :)

name: No.8 Seven Sisters
reviewtext: Located above a pub on a main road about 5-10 minute walk from Seven Sisters station. Staff were nice enough but not entirely knowledgeable - I was told free parking on the side street (no name provided) and ended up with a Â£130+ fine! Given it was my error, however, had I known I would have moved my car. Rooms were very large but basic with small lockers (BYO lock). Bathrooms were decent with some having combined toilet and shower leading to a small queue in the morning. WiFi signal very poor.

name: No.8 Seven Sisters
reviewtext: The staff is amazing: Luigi, Rima, Sarah, Kinga and Cristina make you feel at home. Kind and extraordinary people all of them.

name: No.8 Seven Sisters
reviewtext: Nice hostel. There is everything You need

name: No.8 Seven Sisters
reviewtext: Worst sleep ever. Room looking onto main road and as there was no aircon/ fan, but 35 degrees, window had to be kept open all night, so incredibly noisy - AND still very hot. Bunk bed very wobbly too. Kitchen was rather disgusting, though better than nothing...if you just need a roof over your head, its OK, but for anything more - go find someplace else.

name: No.8 Seven Sisters
reviewtext: I had to change hostels after a night. Other reviews are correct in that the rooms sort of stink. The location is too far from anything interesting and the neighbourhood feels a bit off. Ontop of that, other guests appeared to not want to be social - while I can't fault the hostel for it, the environment doesn't scream friendly. I will avoid this hostel in the future.

name: No.8 Seven Sisters
reviewtext: Good and clean. A little bit far away from the center, but there is a subway line direct (Victoria Line). The unique problem: you have to pay by cash!

name: No.8 Seven Sisters
reviewtext: Excellent value for money! I was worried that the low prices would mean disgusting facilities and bedbugs, but I was pleasantly surprised. While the location may seem a bit out of the way, transport connections are really handy and frequent (inc. night tube) and there are places to eat etc. very close by. Also e.g. supermarkets and Stoke Newington (a trendy area with lots of restaurants and shops) are a walking distance away.

name: No.8 Seven Sisters
reviewtext:
The atmosphere was one of a kind. Great location next to city center London. Just a short subway away.

Receptionists/Bartenders were very helpful in working around me. The actual place was very secure, and the facilities were very nice. I even appreciated it convenience for grabbing a drink.

The one thing I would say is that the location around it is not preferable. I never had any problems, but being alone at the time was a bit uncomfortable.

name: No.8 Seven Sisters
reviewtext: Excellent location, friendly and helpful staff. I was able check out the night before leaving since reception opens from 8:30 am. Awesome.

name: No.8 Seven Sisters
reviewtext: This is a rathole. They only take cash but don't tell you in advance. There is only one employee who takes care both of the bar AND the Â«Â hostelÂ Â». They change your reservation once you're there (I had booked for two people in a 4 poeple room and they put us in a 22 people room??). There are no windows and no ventilation in the 22 people room. Only security is a card door outside, bedroom is not secure. No place to lock your backpack?? This place is a big no-no. 10/10 would recommend GOING ELSEW

name: No.8 Seven Sisters
reviewtext: They made a big fuss about my age I realised after booking that the hostel is only for 18-38s. Claimed that old people (like me) complain alot and live bad comments) and asked me not to come again! Also said that area isnt safe! 4 old people!  Is was only â‚¤7, a steal. You get what you pay for but it was not too bad.. There was only 1 bathroom and toilet on the floor for 7rooms most  plugs didnt work in the room but it was clean and  kitchen was a big bonus. Bed was the most comfi of hostel bed.

name: No.8 Seven Sisters
reviewtext: Can't complain for that price and the bed was surprisingly conferable too.

name: No.8 Seven Sisters
reviewtext: I liked my stay in this hostel very much! The only problem I had was with the ventilation in the rooms. Most windows are shut down and it becomes really warm when the weather is hot. Everything else was fine. I would definitely consider coming back the next time I am in London. Many thanks to the great staff :)

name: No.8 Seven Sisters
reviewtext: Hostel have Age limit!

name: No.8 Seven Sisters
reviewtext: I stayed in this Hostel in early July and it was not a good experience. There were not enough showers and toilets to cope with the amount of guests and we had to wait 30 minutes or more to use them each time. The beds were really old and not very comfortable and the kitchen facilities were cramped and not built for more than two people to use at a time. The staff were reasonably friendly, but I would not say that this was value for money as it is also quite a train journey in to the city.

name: No.8 Seven Sisters
reviewtext: Definitely a good deal for the money you pay. Could benefit from a common room area.

name: No.8 Seven Sisters
reviewtext: Staff were friendly, Bathrooms need upgrading, beds were really noisy and kitchen facility needed upgrade as well.

name: No.8 Seven Sisters
reviewtext: You get what you pay for. But overall I would recommend the hostel to others. Staff is really nice and the bathroom is big and private

name: No.8 Seven Sisters
reviewtext: Good experience. I will book again.

name: No.8 Seven Sisters
reviewtext: Nice place e to stay.

name: No.8 Seven Sisters
reviewtext: Staff are super friendly and helpful! Location isn't the best, but if you are just staying to fly out the next day is perfect as train line to airport is close. Big kitchen to cook!

name: No.8 Seven Sisters
reviewtext: Cheap bed, no frills. Have stayed in better and worse places throughout London. Would consider staying here again next time I'm in London.

name: No.8 Seven Sisters
reviewtext: Really doesn't need to have a DJ playing until 3AM - but can't really complain as the price is fantastic. Will probably return.

name: No.8 Seven Sisters
reviewtext:
Good bits:

-nice staff
-good location, short walk to tube station
-cheap rooms
-clean room, ok bed. 

Bad bits:
-cash only!? In 2018?!
-loud crappy music til 3am
-expensive drinks, lecherous men in bar. Bouncers turn a blind eye.
-tiny lockers, no place to store big bags.
-noisy beds
-MICE in the kitchen with droppings on the floor
-one shared toilet between a whole floor of people

name: No.8 Seven Sisters
reviewtext: Good music venue with a couple of bunk beds, all that's needed for a gig at Finsbury Park

name: No.8 Seven Sisters
reviewtext:
I enjoyed my stay at the hostel.
However, it is a pitty that there is no common area with kitchen facilities available to the hostel guests.

Thanks to the the staff who is always available to help with questions and never stop smiling, even during the busiest moments.

name: No.8 Seven Sisters
reviewtext: Great for the price.

name: No.8 Seven Sisters
reviewtext: If you want to stay some place cheap in London then this might be the place for you. However, I will warn you that it is VERY HOT in the room you will be sleeping. There isn't any air flow. So, if you can't sleep in a hot environment, this place is not for you.

name: St Christopher's Camden
reviewtext: Really nice staff, great location and fairly clean rooms. Great chilled area downstairs with couches, TV and lots of DVDs to hang out and meet other travellers, along with a fridge to store some food and a microwave but no other cooking facilities. Only main downside was that there was only one shower per 9 person dorm, which was tiny and most of the time the water was freezing cold.

name: St Christopher's Camden
reviewtext:
Not a bad dig. We did have a cockroach in the shower which we called Bryan. Once we killed Bryan we didn't see another. 

Bedding clean, building was clean (stairs due a paint soon) rooms were very sound proof. 

Downstairs they always seemed to run out of plates and bowls for breakfast easily. It was wasn't the best hostel breakfast I've had. 

The shower was a bit tight, like a caravan shower. The water would shoot out onto the floor leaving a puddle. Good having an ensuite toilet.

name: St Christopher's Camden
reviewtext: Security is not a big problem--they have lockers for keeping goods; location is great, very near to a subway station; staffs there are so nice that I believe this advantage can overcome all other problems; atmosphere is nice,very suitable to meet new friends; cleanliness is fine, I am sure that they change sheets and so on for each customer;  the facilities function well-- bathroom; laundry; micro-wave...  I therefore recommend this hostel as one of the best with limited budgets.

name: St Christopher's Camden
reviewtext: Great Place, and the staff were great, there were able to manage us Aussie's

name: St Christopher's Camden
reviewtext: Good place. Clean and laid back. Good security and friendly staff. A good location, too, near trains.

name: St Christopher's Camden
reviewtext: Very good accommodation, warm room, comfortable beds, nice staff

name: St Christopher's Camden
reviewtext: Since my arrival, I have felt thoroughly at home at this hostel.  all the staff provide a great atmosphere, and they make sure everyone has a great time. If anyone is looking for a hostel to stay in London, make this number 1 on your list.

name: St Christopher's Camden
reviewtext: The staff were always wiling to help out, comfy beds and clean bathrooms.

name: St Christopher's Camden
reviewtext: Great location, and a great pub right under the hostel making the weekend even more enjoyable. The beds are comfortable and clean. The staff is very warm and welcoming too.

name: St Christopher's Camden
reviewtext: good location. staff very friendly. hostel is dirty (at least for my standard). common area is gross, dark and smelly. let's say that it does not encourage you to use it and therefore socialise with others. If you are taller than me(which is not hard seen that i am only 5.3 ft!) avoid getting the 12 bed doom. the bed space was so tiny I couldn't sit down on the bed to get dress etc. breakfast is alright. you get what you get for paying Â£3. overal was ok seen the location, the staff and the price

name: St Christopher's Camden
reviewtext:
It is a very good Hostel. Good price, good personal, good location, good breakfast, comfy rooms. The only cons is that there were cockroaches in my room.
The staff was very friendly. The tattooed girl working there (I don't remember her name) helped me a lot giving recommendations about places to go and explained how to get to the airport, thank you so much!

name: St Christopher's Camden
reviewtext: Everything was great overall. There was a weird old man staying in my room though so it would have been nice for them to have an age limit.

name: St Christopher's Camden
reviewtext: Very good place. Location is fantastic

name: St Christopher's Camden
reviewtext: Great hostel bit pricey but the location is perfect. They have the best breakfast I never had in an hostel. Recommended.

name: St Christopher's Camden
reviewtext: Awesome location, super comfy beds, really good food available at the convenient bar, friendly staff. I found it a bit tough to meet people unless you stick around the bar in the evening and the bathrooms were pretty rough, but I'd definitely stay there again.

name: St Christopher's Camden
reviewtext: My place! Amazing roommates and environment.

name: St Christopher's Camden
reviewtext: If you are looking for one place where to stay around Camden. That;s definitely the one. Great location, nice staff and a lovely bar downstairs with very good food made my stay as great as it could have been.

name: St Christopher's Camden
reviewtext: Amazing staff and very nice place with great location. very happy

name: St Christopher's Camden
reviewtext: Sadly because of circumstances i didn't end up staying the night here, but the staff did help me to sort my issue by letting me use their laptop to contact friends etc. Was a shame i couldn't stay as the bar had a really good backpacker atmosphere and the rooms were clean and comfortable.

name: St Christopher's Camden
reviewtext:
Facilities are small but clean enough.
Staff is friendly and helpful. 
Breakfast is unlimited in quantity and it is classic continental, good enough.Beds are comfy.
Oh I really liked a "console" of plugs at every bed. EU, UK, USB and a night lamp. 
It's an alright place to stay if you don't mind too loud music down in the bad and hearing beats in the rooms upstairs to about 2AM.
Overall I think it is ok place to stay for a couple of nights, its a hostel so keep your expectations in check.

name: St Christopher's Camden
reviewtext: Staff couldn't do more to help me. fantastic location!

name: St Christopher's Camden
reviewtext: Very Nice!

name: St Christopher's Camden
reviewtext: Good hostel. This was my second stay here. I stayed in a 10 bed this time instead of a 12 bed and it was much nicer. More bathrooms to people than the larger room. Great location! Friendly staff. The only issue is the lounge area is absolutely tiny! But this wasn't really an issue as we never needed to use any lounge space. Would recommend.

name: St Christopher's Camden
reviewtext: The 'bar' downstairs turns into a borderline nightclub resulting in the shaking of the beds due to the music thud. We were almost overcharged on check in in addition to almost paying for breakfast without our consent. One of the two toilets was flooded meaning it couldn't be used. One of the staff members removed the benches while we were sitting on them outside the pub/club with still 2 hours till closing. We should've spent the extra Â£10 for a hotel

name: St Christopher's Camden
reviewtext: Everything was great, especially the staff and the good selection of nic cage movies in the downstairs lounge. But the lack of air-conditioning in our really hot top floor room made the sleep miserable. Surely for the price we paid they could afford some dam aircon..?

name: St Christopher's Camden
reviewtext: Party hostel. I did not realize we booked a party hostel, so that was annoying. But the facilities are great and Steve, a senior member of staff, is absolutely phenomenal and abundantly kind.

name: St Christopher's Camden
reviewtext: Pretty poor accom for the money, not overly happy

name: St Christopher's Camden
reviewtext: Manager and staff were very helpful. Bar was great, food was great. Room was good, although there was no light in the toilet and the toilets outside the room were a little messy. Other than that, I really enjoyed my stay. I would definitely stay there again.

name: St Christopher's Camden
reviewtext: Location is good depending on what you want, the common area was decent and the bar is massive so much of a hostel atmosphere. Still a good option

name: St Christopher's Camden
reviewtext: The staff was great and the bar had a great atmosphere to watch the game. Unfortunately, the room was extremely crammed and there wasn't a lot of space to place your items. My main concern was the heat in the room. While there were some floor fans, anyone above the bottom bunk was miserably hot. Not sure if there's any AC in the room but I spent three hours sweating trying to fall asleep in the hot room.

name: St Christopher's Camden
reviewtext:
good afternoon,
I'm requesting a chargeback of my credit card for improper charges.

my daughter stayed at the hostel on 06/21/2018 and as soon as we arrived at the property made the cancellation on 06/25/2018.

to my surprise not covering on the credit card. attached photo.

you can check in the hostel that we used the stays of 06/23/2018 and 06/24/2018, we canceled the 06/25/2018 and paid the difference that was missing in the place in cash. no proof of payment was provided.

please verify it

name: St Christopher's Camden
reviewtext: Had an amazing time there! The bar is buzzing and the food in there is great! Legit couldn't hear a thing upstairs though so well sound proofed! Could have maybe used an extra fan in the room but aside from that can't complain! Brilliant location for Camden too! In the middle of two tube stops and under 5 minutes walk to the best pubs and clubs! Will defo stay again!

name: The Hurdwick
reviewtext: 8bed- doors open to private patio, good mattress , 2bathrooms attached to the room including showers. Very clean, carpet throughout room. Common room- no kitchen, small couch with tv. More hotel feel than hostel (free towels, vanity in room, free soap) great for 2+ groups but not much for solo other than sleeping. Might charge for holding bags.(?)  Awesome staff tho!

name: The Hurdwick
reviewtext: It a really expensive hostel with no kitchen. They did not properly display pricing, unorganized as well, they assigned a bed to us that someone else was sleeping in. Overpriced in my opinion... might as well Airbnb or hotel... Other than the great location and easy access to the tube "train" as well as walking distance to Camden market.

name: The Hurdwick
reviewtext:
Unfortunately the facilities listed when I booked were completely wrong. I booked because 24 hour reception and self catering facilities were listed however neither were true. I arrived at 7am with packed groceries to cook and there was no reception. Hence I couldn't get in to leave my bags and I carried groceries that I couldn't cook...  
The actual place is lovely, beautiful bathrooms and living area and comfy beds but I wouldn't have paid this much without self catering facilities.

name: The Hurdwick
reviewtext: Despite formerly stating on the website that they have a refrigerator and self catering facilities, (claims that have since been removed) the Hurdwick does NOT provide any such facilities. There is a washing machine but no clothes dryer. The beds were comfortable and the dorm and bathrooms very clean. Pia, who arranges check-ins, was very friendly and helpful.  If you are looking for a nice dorm style room in a great location the Hurdwick is a good choice, just don't expect a 'hostel'.

name: The Hurdwick
reviewtext: Very cute, hotel-like feeling--they even give you mini bottles of shampoo and shower gel. The hostal seems to just be an all-female 8 bed dorm on the ground floor, but there are two bathrooms inside the room (no getting locked out when you go to the bathroom), and you're provided with towels which is really nice. Staff seemed to only be there for a few hours every day, but they were very accessible and helpful by phone. The only bad thing was that there was no air conditioning

name: The Hurdwick
reviewtext: Pia was amazingly accomodating, a lot had started badly about my trip to London, but Pia got me checked in, even though I was running late and accomodated my bags til my departure so I could explore London a little bit more. She gave me lots of tips, and messaged me on WhatsApp with all my little needs. If I ever come to London again I would definitely try book here and will recommending it to anyone traveling here. Thank you for everything Pia!!

name: The Hurdwick
reviewtext: It's a lovely, boutique and cosy hotel. I stayed in the 8 bed all female dorm rooms, the beds and room is very modern and light and has a nice feel to it. The bathrooms are very modern and clean, you are also offered towels, shower gels etc which is great if you forget anything! Tea and coffee facilities at all times is fantastic and included in the price, I would recommend this hotel! The only bad thing about it is it's so close to the tube you can sometimes hear the tubes at night underground.

name: The Hurdwick
reviewtext: An incredible find for the price. The location is convenient, sitting right next to Mornington Crescent station and a short walk from King's Cross. The interior is well furnished, clean and quiet. Pia and Mark were helpful and responsive - be aware that communication may be through WhatsApp. If I ever revisit London alone, I know where I will be staying.

name: The Hurdwick
reviewtext: Staying in this hostel was a pleasant surprise! It was very very clean and especially since we were staying with 8 girls, the downstairs dorm was very nice. The bathrooms were very clean and we had access to two separate bathrooms with 8 of us, which was definitely good! I would like to advise the owners to be a bit more mindful of security, for example I don't know how often they change the front door code. A big plus is the location and perfect for a city trip on a budget.

name: The Hurdwick
reviewtext: Best hostel in London by far! Brand new facilities, everything is spotless. Free towels, shampoo conditioner and body wash. The staff are so helpful and friendly and the location is fabulous. Next door to the tube station and in the heart of Camden. Really recommend!!

name: The Hurdwick
reviewtext: This place was like finding a hidden treasure in Camden. The neighbourhood is vibrant and full of life. Great location right next to a tube station and a 15-minute walk from King's Cross. Pia and Mark were extra kind, they even store our luggage after check-out and helped me print our train tickets. The room is neat and so clean, everything looks new and the beds are really comfortable. I will certainly stay there again when I come back to London.

name: No.8 Willesden Hostel London
reviewtext: Amazing staff!

name: No.8 Willesden Hostel London
reviewtext: Yeah it was chill pretty quiet just what the doctor ordered ha ha.

name: No.8 Willesden Hostel London
reviewtext: Loved every minute I spent here and I'll be back again soon. The staff are top notch They are all lovely, friendly and so helpful. I cannot rate them enough

name: No.8 Willesden Hostel London
reviewtext: I enjoyed my stay with lovely people and overall the fantastic,smiling faces and hard working staff, the staff are very helpful and with  full patience.

name: No.8 Willesden Hostel London
reviewtext: Felt right at home here. Everyone is laid back, and if you are a sociable person you'll love it; totally a local vibe. Thanks DANI!

name: No.8 Willesden Hostel London
reviewtext: Very cosy hostel. Friendly staff.

name: No.8 Willesden Hostel London
reviewtext: I would definitely recommend staying in No.8 Willesden. Staff are amazing and the atmosphere is great. Fantastic location if you are looking to meet new people as the pub has great entertainment. I had booked in for one week and ended up staying for two, can't wait to return again :D

name: No.8 Willesden Hostel London
