reviewtext: Really, this is the best value you can get for the price. Amazing staff, really good atmosphere. It's a bit far from the main tourist areas, but if you don't mind being on the tube for half an hour this is the best.

name: No.8 Willesden Hostel London
reviewtext: The Location is away from everything, I like the gritty part of the London but the Hostel itself was dark, dirty and had no character. It had a broken fan in the room, the beds were broken and it was run down and dirty in the rooms. The only redeeming thing about this place is there is. Pub attached and you can have a pint and hang out with people. Besides that I'd never stay here again. I actually canceled my last three nights here. Wouldn't recommended it to anyone.

name: No.8 Willesden Hostel London
reviewtext: Unpolite staffs, building smells bad and very dirty, shower don t work properly.

name: No.8 Willesden Hostel London
reviewtext:
Outside we don't feel in full security. I saw a group of rebels who  were blocking the entrance of a store (just several feet from the hostel). The seller told them to yield to customers when a customer arrived. The police was also really present in that area. There are not a lot of small shops in that area, the hostel is a little in the middle of nowhere.
Inside the building, the bedroom was too hot in august (no fan). The facilities are good.

name: No.8 Willesden Hostel London
reviewtext: This place is a toilet. Loud all the time, rude staff, hot rooms, very squeaky beds, filthy toilets and showers covered in vomit, untidy and dirty common areas, with randoms loitering the hallways being loud all the time. The area is not much better. They only take cash... yeah that's not suss at all. Happy to say I would never stay here again or visit Willesden for the rest of my life! Worst hostel.

name: No.8 Willesden Hostel London
reviewtext: My bedroom didn't smell well so I had to sleep with the door open, and the steets as the Hostel were very noisy. Also some people live there so it's kind of weird, cause they act like they are in there home (example people going in underwear and scratching their parts in the share bathroom). Is not really bad but if you can go somewhere better situated I wouldn't recommend this place

name: No.8 Willesden Hostel London
reviewtext: So this hostel was a weird one. There are a few people staying here long term, we made friends with them in the bar but it lacked a real hostel feel. But we did have a good time, it was fun. But there needs to be more bathrooms/showers and more plug sockets in the bathrooms, there was also a really funny smell from the kitchen. Staff were nice, especially Dani and we paid Â£9 a night in the height of summer so value for money is good. Wouldn't come here if travelling solo though

name: No.8 Willesden Hostel London
reviewtext: Great friendly place

name: No.8 Willesden Hostel London
reviewtext:
The rooms were always clean, kitchen was tidy, fairly close to the tube and bus station.
The only issue I had was with the showers, it got very hot in there very quickly with no ventilation, the shower head was broken in one of them, and there was always water everywhere, the cleanliness of it was okay but could be better

name: No.8 Willesden Hostel London
reviewtext: Great value considering the price! Staff are friendly so that's a big plus, kitchen is spacious and bar and beer gardens are alright too. Roasting hot in the summer though, room only has one window the size of a small painting so it's really hard for those who crave for bit of air ventilation. Room doors are always open as a result for ventilation so security is not best. Bit of hassle having to check-out the night before since reception is not 24 hrs. Comfy place if it is not so run down.

name: No.8 Willesden Hostel London
reviewtext: It's a great place to sleep considering it's the cheapest too in the whole of london

name: No.8 Willesden Hostel London
reviewtext:
Having only paid slightly under Â£10 per night for my stay, I went in expecting it to be pretty vile and slightly dodgy in comparison to other hostels. However, the manager was incredibly friendly, the other visitors were also really really friendly. The room was completely clean and the bed was very comfortable.  The bathroom and kitchen were kept immaculately and were cleaned daily, one thing I noticed was the showers water pressure was brilliant!
Would 100% recommend to anyone!

name: No.8 Willesden Hostel London
reviewtext: The worst, I know the saying you get what you pay for however I thought it would be better than what was offered at this hostel. Didn't feel safe and happy it was only a night

name: No.8 Willesden Hostel London
reviewtext: Good hostep, but horrible smell from the fridges in the kitchen.

name: No.8 Willesden Hostel London
reviewtext:
The stuffs at reception are great, there are security guarding outside the hostel at the night.
people are friendly as well.

bed and others are fairly clean.

great hostel in total.

name: No.8 Willesden Hostel London
reviewtext: It's a nice place. People who works there were very kind and friendly to me and even they helped me with some complications that I had. I would say that the only thing that was not very good, is the wifi. I just only had it in the pub, but not in my room.

name: No.8 Willesden Hostel London
reviewtext: The staff at the hostel were very friendly, however when showed to our room at around half 2 in the afternoon, we found the lights off and people were sleeping. A very awkward position to be in. We turned around and got ready in the car. We returned to get some sleep at around 2am. Very difficult as the pillow provided was really thin and uncomfortable. I ended up sleeping without my quilt and using that as a pillow. Luckily enough the room was warm enough to do this. You yet what you pay for.

name: YHA London Central
reviewtext: Very friendly staff, wonderful location that is well connected by local transport at a short distance. Great Portland Street, a tube/ subway station is just a 3 minutes walk. There are grocery stores nearby, eg. Tesco Express where one can buy watables, veggies, groceries and some electronic items as well. There is a self catering kitchen and a lift too that makes the visitors or hostellers very happy.

name: YHA London Central
reviewtext: Pretty good. I liked the tours and pub crawls that were advertised there. Great location. Shower could use a proper base and a better head.

name: YHA London Central
reviewtext: Central location. Felt very safe. Clean facilities. Have never stayed in a YHA with my family - will definitely be doing it again, hopefully very soon.

name: YHA London Central
reviewtext:
5N, ensuite 6b F dorm (but got 4b!)
Good location and 24h staff, fast WIFI (but only avail in common areas), personal plug at each bedside, lockers. Large self-cater kitchen and a separate common area where they also serve food. Events held, but most people did their own thing (lots of families) so not much of a social atmosphere. Comfy beds. Cleanish... need to empty garbages more frequently.  Fixed shower heads had lime buildup and sprayed inconsistently in random directions - please fix this!

name: YHA London Central
reviewtext: The location was really good, close to the tube and Oxford Circus. The people at the reception were very helpful. However it was not very clean, which was very sad.  Especially the bath. I asked them several times to clean the sink which they didn't. Not even the bin was emptied, it kept getting fuller and fuller. Thankfully i was in a room with girls who were considerate and tried to keep the room clean. And there is no wifi in the rooms and no usb ports so you have to buy an adapter.

name: YHA London Central
reviewtext: This is an excellent hostel for those who are happy with dormitory accommodation. Its central location allows easy exploration of inner London with easy bus and tube connections and hire bicycles nearby. The staff are excellent, always keen to help and many there on hand all the time. The breakfast makes a good start to the day and the facilities are what is required with laundry, kitchen and lounge. The only slight negative is the poor wi-fi.

name: YHA London Central
reviewtext: Really great value for such a perfect location in London. Staff were all super friendly and cheerful. My 6 bed female dorm was spotless, spacious and quiet. Having separated shower and toilet rooms inside the dorm was very handy, plus there are extra bathrooms on the floor. Only downside was the wifi was only available in the reception area, but it was fast and free. They have a good activities schedule as well, and the guests there were all really friendly!

name: YHA London Central
reviewtext:
The location was perfect. 5 minute walk to the underground and 8 minute walk to shopping on Oxford street. 

The hostel itself was mediocre. The bathroom was awful (and I'm not picky about cleanliness). Location of power outlets were inconvenient (only on the bedpost - so if you needed to use anything while it was charging, you had to sit on your top bunk to do so) 
Also, zero common rooms to socialize and meet people from outside your room.

name: YHA London Central
reviewtext: The hostel has no air conditioning in the rooms especially the private room that we booked. Temperatures were unbearable as London had temperatures of about 31 degrees. We did not enjoy our stay although the location was good and close to many attractions

name: YHA London Central
reviewtext: I love YHA hostels. They're so chill and every one I've visited has had flawlessly friendly staff. They're secure and unlike many hostels where I've stayed, I always get a solid night's rest. I wish there were more YHAs around the world because I never want to stay at another hostel again! I highly recommend them for comfort, safety, and their general atmosphere of cheerful helpfulness.

name: YHA London Central
reviewtext: The staff was very friendly and the amenities were very good as was the safe feeling.  However, during hot weather as we had, it was like staying in a sauna room as we faced the sunny side of the building and were on the 5th floor. I would have checked out if I could. There was a fan provided which was the only thing that made it bareable, but it was still just pushing hot air around.  I would not stay there during hot weather unless you can get a room on the shady side or don't mind hot rooms.

name: YHA London Central
reviewtext: All around a great place to stay! It was very hot in London while we were visiting so it was pretty hot in the room especially at night. But everything else was superb - would recommend to anyone!

name: YHA London Central
reviewtext: You can always rely on YHAs to be relatively clean and to have female dorms, something I find frustratingly difficult in the UK. While they're usually isn't a whole lot of cutesy decor in YHAs, they are comfortable and always have tons of amenities. This one is in a great location with really nice staff. It's a huge hostel but not noisy. Very close to two subway stations. The bathroom availability is a bit poor. The one next to our room was supposed to only be us but others were using it.

name: YHA London Central
reviewtext: So impressed with the staff at this hostel. You pay more for the central location but it's worth it. I messed up my booking (didn't book enough nights) but the staff were really helpful and got me sorted. I enjoyed having a cold beer after a long day of sightseeing in the reception area. The only improvement for me would be AC - the dorm was a sauna during the heatwave!

name: Gallery Hyde Park
reviewtext: I asked to rent a towel and was told to go buy one as they didnt have any. Was not happy.

name: Gallery Hyde Park
reviewtext: It's quite a climb to some of the rooms. And it's not the cleanest. One of our beds didn't come with a duvet but after climbing all the stairs we decided we didn't care. People in the room were loud. Not a ton of outlets and are in covered places. It was okay and close to train stations.

name: Gallery Hyde Park
reviewtext: Spacious converted townhouse, spacious and calm. A little rough around the edges

name: Gallery Hyde Park
reviewtext: 24 hour reception is nice, cool aussie chick to check us in, bathroom small but clean. Nice and easy stay!

name: Gallery Hyde Park
reviewtext: The location was in a nice part of town, right next to the park and super close to the tube. The place itself was pretty bad. It wasn't very clean, the one bathroom on the floor was pretty gross, and we saw a mouse in the kitchen - which happens, I guess. One of the staff members was extremely nice. The night staff though were super loud though and it made it difficult to sleep before 3am. If you want to party late then this place is fine, if you want a decent sleep then I don't recommend.

name: Gallery Hyde Park
reviewtext: Wouldn't recommend for more than a night or 2. Location was great to explore Notting Hill and was in close proximity to a lot of other sights. Facilities list security lockers but these are not actually individual security lockers in the room, there is just one small set of security lockers in the common room - not enough for all guests. The ensuite was very dirty. One of few hostels in London that provides free breakfast.

name: Gallery Hyde Park
reviewtext: Great location with quick access to the metro, next to a great park and a few attractions that can be reached on foot. Very accessible and nice staff. Places to shop and food very close.

name: Gallery Hyde Park
reviewtext: Shops and places to eat close. Other guests were nice but this hostel was weird... doesn't look as nice as the photos (inc. communal areas). No soap or place to hang your stuff for shower in communal bathroom. Vender empty, no juice at breakfast (usually standard). Never seen so much water on bathroom floors in a hostel before! Fan broken in room so was really hot at night. Keycard repeatedly kept not working. No in-room storage. Ok it you want somewhere to stay cheap but I wouldn't stay again.

name: Gallery Hyde Park
reviewtext: chill vibes, good breakfast and clean bathrooms. Good location, next to the Bayswater and Queensway tube. Hyde park is so chill and the staff here were very helpful. I would highly recommend this place for night or multiple nights

name: Gallery Hyde Park
reviewtext: Beautiful people, cheerful staff, amazing location.

name: Gallery Hyde Park
reviewtext: Very overcrowded and stuffy in the rooms in summer. Sheets don't seem the cleanest. The location and breakfast included is convinent. Has all the necessary basics working showers, Wi-Fi and secure rooms.

name: Gallery Hyde Park
reviewtext: Awesome place, super well located (access to 3 lines within 4 mins walk), next to hyde park - walking distance to buckingham etc. GREAT STAFF. Hostel perks are great too - amazing continental breakfast offering, kitchen is always kept super clean, towel is just a 5Â£ deposit!, 4 beds have ensuite toilets, good fans installed for summer. WOULD RECOMMEND.  Only recommendation would be to lock the luggage room and get some new washing machines.

name: Gallery Hyde Park
reviewtext: Clean place with friendly and helpful staffs.

name: Gallery Hyde Park
reviewtext: Could do with a lock on the luggage room and maybe something in roo. To lock your belongings away

name: Gallery Hyde Park
reviewtext: Great staff good location

name: Gallery Hyde Park
reviewtext: Great location and hard to beat price! Right by Hyde Park and around the corner from various restaurants and stores. Not all of the beds have outlets super close to them and the bathrooms get dirty quickly with so many people but they clean them pretty often and overall a killer place to stay. Good vibes and chill staff.

name: Gallery Hyde Park
reviewtext: The best hostel in London!!!! I hate leaving but love returning!!

name: Gallery Hyde Park
reviewtext: Very crowdy rooms, but good value for the money

name: Gallery Hyde Park
reviewtext:
The new bathroom the one on left you can't regulate water either you shower with cold water or very hot wster6
Any one can walk in get into luggage storage room is lock

name: Gallery Hyde Park
reviewtext: Breakfast needed a little more consistence. Everything else was fine

name: Gallery Hyde Park
reviewtext: I really liked the diverse staff, had a nice Kiwi recommend a great burger place upon arrival and an Italian recommend museums. The free breakfast wasn't bad, just toast, oatmeal, instant coffee, juice and jam. wish there had been a better outside patio to meet people and relax. No smoking allowed. I am a female who stayed in the 24 mixed bed, which wasn't bad, just a bit hot at times. The bathroom situation was a bit strange. The one closet to my room was both female and male, had no hand soap.

name: Gallery Hyde Park
reviewtext: The location is amazing, but the other guests never cleaned up behind them which made the bathrooms pretty gross. Good thing I had my flipflops for when I took a shower. Luggage room is not enough secured, lockers aren't big enough for our luggage so we were worried about it all the time. They say breakfast is included but it wasn't good. But all in all, it was a great location for the amount we paid.

name: Phoenix Hostel
reviewtext: A cheaper option for London, and it's very close to the train. However, because I arrived in the late afternoon, I was forced into the top bunk of a triple bunk bed. I'm limber and fit, but this top bunk felt unsafe for even me in the dark. I honestly don't think these beds should be legal. Plus, there's no outlet near the top bunk, so you need to charge your phone before bed by sitting on the floor or going to a coffee shop. I think the hostel should provide a locked box for charging.

name: Phoenix Hostel
reviewtext: During the week this hostel was one of the cheapest in London and was great for the price(9Â£). Location was right by an underground station so easily can get anywhere. The staff were awesome and definitely made the hostel. Breakfast wasnt anything special but for 2Â£ it included cereal, toast (with so many spreads), fruit, coffee and tea which is really all I could want. The showers are tiny and not the cleanest (older house) but depends on what you're looking for.

name: Phoenix Hostel
reviewtext: Had a great stay at The Phoenix, only stayed two night as my trip was cut short but its a lot of fun and the staff are good sorts. Big shout out to Tom the night guy, friendly cat and as smart as an octopus.

name: Phoenix Hostel
reviewtext:
Only really stayed for a night due to last minute change of plans.
Cozy atmosphere and approachable staff.
I just feel as though the dorms were a little cramped and somehow I managed to get mosquito bites at night.

name: Phoenix Hostel
reviewtext: It was the cheapest accommodation I could find in the heart of London, & I wanna go back! Duncan was cool as beans when he checked me in after I arrived from Italy 6 hours late & no luggage. We even went out and kicked an Aussie footy around. Becky was great fun, both as a check-out chick and a close friend while I was there. Only setback for me was the showers. Some are better than others in terms of functionality. One even set off the fire alarm at about 9am one morning.

name: Phoenix Hostel
reviewtext: A nice little hostel for an affordable price. However, it can be quite packed and there are just few toilets/showers per floor, so you might have to queue a bit from time to time.

name: Phoenix Hostel
reviewtext: Loved unsuccessful John, great location and great value for money

name: Phoenix Hostel
reviewtext: Nice place for short stay while touring London , staff is friendly and helpful. Morning breakfast is nice just 2Â£ eat as much u want lol

name: Phoenix Hostel
reviewtext:
Couldn't think of a better place to be when stuck in London waiting on a pal. 
Crackin staff
And more importantly cheap beer
Cheers guys

name: Phoenix Hostel
reviewtext: Great place! awesome staff and perfect location. Lacks a bit in cleanliness but really good place for the price!

name: Phoenix Hostel
reviewtext:
Uncomfortable three story bunker beds, still have neck pain from pillow; the beds move when you do, giving you the idea that they are going to fall; the rooms are too small and stuffy, couldn't sleep at all; in a room of six, only had five available lockers (one was broken); floor 1 only had one toilet; it gave off a feeling of uncleanness. For an award winning hostel, this facility was lacking quite a lot.
Though, the staff was nice, so was the lounge and the drinks. But that's about it.

name: Phoenix Hostel
reviewtext: Awesome hostel! Good location in central London, good prices for rooms and beer and awesome staff. Highly recommend for backpackers and the like.

name: Phoenix Hostel
reviewtext:
It's fairly city center, but great hostel to meet other people and also beds were quite comfortable, I really liked the pillows.

Only downside was the bed frames themselves aren't that great and creak and squeak a lot.

Brekky is love and shout out to Duncan and Tom for the lovely conversations and warm welcomes â¤ï¸

name: Phoenix Hostel
reviewtext: Lovely staff and vibe, everyones really friendly and inclusive. Great way to meet new people and make friends.

name: Phoenix Hostel
reviewtext:
You get alot for the price!
Nice hostel with charakter !

name: Phoenix Hostel
reviewtext: You had better to sleep in a sleeping bag on a street. Don't stay this place. whole reviews are lie.

name: Phoenix Hostel
reviewtext: I would not stay here as a solo female traveler. The bathrooms were run down, with tiny sinks and paint peeling off the walls. It felt dingy and not very comfortable. Their kitchen consists of a microwave and... nope just that... The common area is just some old couches in a corner of the bar downstairs. The staff were super friendly but that is all this place has going for it. There are triple bunk beds and no extra space in the rooms. It was not a great experience...

name: Phoenix Hostel
reviewtext: Good bar on the main floor with cheap beer. Close to one of the main underground lines, close to a tesco and close to a decent fish and chips place. Perfect London hostel!

name: Phoenix Hostel
reviewtext: So my friend and I were charged Â£20 (Â£10 each deposit) for checking out 20 min late. We thought the deposit was for handling the key card back. We were really gutted. That was our second time there but we won't come back. That was a thief move. We like the previous front desk guy better. He was more comprehensive and helpful!

name: Phoenix Hostel
reviewtext: The morning guy was extremely nice

name: Phoenix Hostel
reviewtext: Go here often mainly because the convenient location near Marylebon, Baker Street and Edgware Road. Hostel has a bar and common area but usually I find it hard to socialize with other travellers. The building and facilities are mostly clean, but very old and small. Bunk beds with 3 beds on top of each other which is not so nice. I guess for a city hostel it's still a good place.

name: Phoenix Hostel
reviewtext: the best people ever, wouldn't go anywhere else

name: Phoenix Hostel
reviewtext: Really enjoyed my time at the Hostel.

name: Phoenix Hostel
reviewtext: Truly amazing staff, great location (10 mins walk to Baker street, 2-3 mins to Edgware road), comfy and clean beds and one of the cheapest hostels I've ever stayed in London. The only downside is that you have to pay extra for everything (eg. breakfast / leaving your bags there after check out) and that the showers are tiny and as there's no window in the shower, a bit moldy (at least it was in our room).

name: Phoenix Hostel
reviewtext: That was my first time in a hostel and I'm so happy I've made the choice to stay in this one! Amazing staff, amazing people, amazing everything~ I kept extended my stay and would have liked to stay more... will definitively come back as it became my 2nd home ;)

name: Phoenix Hostel
reviewtext: Phoenix Hostel is dope. It's a good spot to chill and close to the metro station. Good security for your gear and a chill atmosphere to socialize, drink or hang solo dolo. The staff is cool and friendly. I would stay here again!

name: Phoenix Hostel
reviewtext: Phoenix hostel was great! The staff were great and atmosphere was welcoming and chill so was easy to meet other travellers and feel comfortable.

name: Phoenix Hostel
reviewtext: Was there for only one night so cant say much but seemed like a really nice hostel! Not too far from the Kings Cross

name: Phoenix Hostel
reviewtext: Best hostel I stayed at during my trip around Europe, Shout out to Duncan for creating an awesome atmosphere around the hostel as well as being helpful with directions and for ideas on what to do while I was in London. If you are ever in London and need a place to stay, please, don't pass up this hostel, it's awesome and sells cheap drinks

name: Phoenix Hostel
reviewtext: Super friendly staff and sociable patrons - really easy to make friends in the downstairs bar, which doubles as the lounge. The showers are a bit old and the upper level rooms were incredibly hot during the summer, making it hard to sleep at night.

name: Phoenix Hostel
reviewtext: Had to book this pretty last minute and couldn't have been more pleased. Great location and really helpful staff. The manager Jonny was full of great recommendations and good for more than a few laughs. I know where I'll be staying when I come back to London.

name: Phoenix Hostel
reviewtext: Been there only for a few hours because I needed a place to rest. The staff was really nice, the guy that was there when I checked in was really funny. The room was nice, not the best but I liked the bed. The bathrooms were awful on the other side. The worst I've seen. That really put me off because it wasn't clean and hey looked quite old. I wouldn't stay there for more than I did this time. But If you want a place to sleep that is close to the center and at a good price then this is good.

name: Phoenix Hostel
reviewtext:
First hostel experience for me and my partner. Didn't know what to expect but such a good place. 

Long live the king 

P.s. we accidentally left some vegan pizza on top of the microwave

name: Phoenix Hostel
reviewtext: We have been waiting for like 20 minutes till someone came to reception, the guy was nice and all but took him too long to just come and all receptionist n was abandoned till that. They have lockers but I need your own lock or u Can buy one at the reception which is imo not good lock for the price they offer. It was too damn hot in the hostel , in the lobby and in rooms as well, no AC no fans.they ask money for everything additional in this hostel, but I guess u get what u pay for.

name: Phoenix Hostel
reviewtext: The first hostel I stayed at with such a good atmosphere. The staff is amazing and makes you feel at home, happy to just have a chat with you or help you out with stupid questions. Good bar with cheap drinks too. Would def recommend.

name: Phoenix Hostel
reviewtext: Had a great day with Jonny and the team. Fantastic location close to tubes and buses. My favourite was the cheap beer prices though

name: Phoenix Hostel
reviewtext: Good location. Good staff. Dirty old building. There was garbage in the room when we checked in. Very warm inside. The bed in our private room was awful, and as apparently they didn't have double bed linen, they used 2 single ones, very uncomfortable. Moldy bathrooms. It's what you get when you pay cheap in an expensive city like London

name: Phoenix Hostel
reviewtext: Greeted by a particularly lovely member of staff from Adelaide. Mattress had a dip in the middle so v uncomfortable. Also, guy cleaning room at 7pm and then came back at 10pm to sqirt cleaning products on top of lockers, seems like a weird time to clean a room and not something I wanted to breathe in while going to sleep. Showers looked grubby, whole place could do with a really good clean tbh. Lovely vibe in the place, v laid back, great music. Mixed bag really.

name: Phoenix Hostel
reviewtext: This place was great. The only complaint I have is how hot it can get but the atmosphere was fantastic. Everyone chills in a small area and the staff were awesome. Especially Becky, she really made the trip. It really felt like she went out of her way to make you feel welcome. Overall, this place was a great place to chill. Ended up extending several times just because it felt like home.

name: Phoenix Hostel
reviewtext: The Phoenix was absolutely great. This was our first hostel experience and Johnny (not Gavin) made us feel so welcome. All of the staff was super friendly and made it a seamless experience. It is extremely easy to get to from Edgware road station and is close enough to city center to make everything convenient.

name: Phoenix Hostel
reviewtext: The Phoenix is a pretty cool place. I would say that if you're looking to have a night out in London this isn't the place. If you're looking to have a chill night with a couple drinks from the bar and watch a movie this is the place for you. The staff is wonderful and nice.

name: Phoenix Hostel
reviewtext: Could need more cleanliness in the bathroom

name: Phoenix Hostel
reviewtext: Great location right beside 2 tube stations, being able to get the Bakerloo, District, Hammersmith and Circle lines in less than a 5 minute walk was great.  Transport links in general were very good, Paddington is walking distance and all other major train stations a few tube stops away. Staff were great, shout out to Jonny and Duncan who were amazing and made my stay incredible with their recommendations, beers at the bar and general banter!

name: Phoenix Hostel
reviewtext: The rooms are dirty but the staff and price is good.

name: Phoenix Hostel
reviewtext: Room key always did not work, had to ask staff to open door or the door was left open, that means everyone in the pub can come in the room. Hostel does not have a kitchen, only a microwave to heat food.

name: Phoenix Hostel
reviewtext: Great location, great hosts! Will definitely return.

name: Phoenix Hostel
reviewtext: Lovely little place with very friendly staff and a laid-back atmosphere. I felt immediately at home.

name: Phoenix Hostel
reviewtext: Loved the atmosphere and people. Really super chilled and laid back. Johnny (I know I've spelt this wrong, bite me) you rock. Lukan and Duncan, you guys are also number 1. The facilities aren't state of the art but then again Reader, you want to go to a hostel and not a hotel so honestly you know what to expect. Loved chilling in the common area and hanging with the other people that were around. Next time I go to London, I'll be at the Phoenix again, enough said

name: Phoenix Hostel
reviewtext: Not a good value for money. The cleanliness could be a lot better in my opinion. The staff was friendly and the location was ok.

name: Phoenix Hostel
reviewtext: Staff are absolute legends, they really made my stay super great. Chris especially, made me feel so included and gave me great travelling tips. Johnny was super funny and really brought the vibe up as well as being very knowledgable about travel. Love the couches and the constant music. The only downside was the bathrooms were especially small and some didn't work properly.

name: Phoenix Hostel
reviewtext: Nice place and nice location!

name: Phoenix Hostel
reviewtext: All toilets combined with showers. FOUND ONLY 3 TOILETS IN THE ENTIRE BUILDING. Very inefficient when everyone tries to shower in the morning and you need to use the toilet.

name: Phoenix Hostel
reviewtext: Nice place, great location. The staff, especially Duncan & Chris were very helpful. The place also operates as a bar so its nice to have a drink with all the other guests.

name: Phoenix Hostel
reviewtext: I love the Phoenix Hostel. The staff are fantastic and make you feel at home. Duncan is very helpful and will take you to do drunk laundry once a week hahaðŸ˜‚ðŸ˜‚. Loved the location, it was easy to get to places ðŸ˜ðŸ˜

name: Phoenix Hostel
reviewtext: Best London hostel - best staff - best location!

name: Phoenix Hostel
reviewtext:
A great hostel for those travelling on a more modest budget, those looking for some familiar accents (run by aussies/kiwi), or those looking for a friendly base hostel. 
The staff went above and beyond, and were always helpful. The facilities were kept clean (Thanks Mia and Elvis) and the bar/reception was always staffed by a friendly face. 
Wifi was good, lockers were big enough for valuables, dorm doors locked with swipe cards. Great hostel - see y'all again in August.

name: Phoenix Hostel
reviewtext:
Phoenix Hostel was an awesome stay! The location is great for access to underground and national rail stations, as well as to Central London. 

Aside from excellent access to London, the time I spent in the hostel was so much fun. The vibe is awesome and the staff created a really social atmosphere in the common area/bar so it was super easy to meet other guests.

Special shout out to Mia for being from my hometown!

name: Phoenix Hostel
reviewtext: Great place and great people.. the staff are amazing as well. Jonny make a everyone feel at home..

name: Phoenix Hostel
reviewtext:
Perfectoo !
Surely comming back... amazing staff... nice roomates.. clean bathrooms.. breakfast was really really nice !

name: Phoenix Hostel
reviewtext: Great Location in London (3 min walk to the tube)and well priced. Jonny and the team made me feel very welcome and a very social place in comparison to chain hostels. Will be returning in the future. Highly recommend!

name: Phoenix Hostel
reviewtext: Don't get me wrong, it's really really good value in London. However, there's things you have to close one eye towards.

name: Phoenix Hostel
reviewtext: Great place to stay. Staff is super friendly!! Johnny helped us out so much, you could tell he really enjoyed meeting travelers and being an excellent host.

name: Phoenix Hostel
reviewtext: My sister and I spent 2 nights at the Phoenix Hostel and it was a nice stay. We were in a room with a lot of people but it was nice. The cleanliness of the hostel is good though we did end up in a room with not very clean people... The staff was nice and very helpful. My sister and I didn't spend much time in the hostel per se as we mostly were hanging out in London but it served its purpose and the price and location (close to Baker St Station - great to go to Wembley Stadium!) were good.

name: St Christopher's Hammersmith
reviewtext:
The hostel has a great location just next to Subway station and on the Piccadilly Line that goes to Heathrow. Pub has a great atmosphere. 
Most of the rooms are on the 3rd floor which is difficult for a guest with a luggage like me as there are no elevators and you can't go directly up. My room had 3 triple bunk beds in a fairly small area. There is no chair or anything in the room, and it's hard to change clothes or sit on a tripple bunk bed. Finally for what I paid, it's  a good London hostel.

name: St Christopher's Hammersmith
reviewtext:
And again St. Christophers inn Hammersmith has been a perfect getaway. Awesome location, an easy access to public transport, comfy beds, friendly and helpful staff members. 10 out of 10.

As well the discounted drinks at Belushis pub and banging tunes from DJ made my Wednesday night extra fun.

Cheers team!

name: St Christopher's Hammersmith
reviewtext: Cheap hostel to stay at, which is nice. It's very hot in the rooms, as you usually find in London. The rooms are all up steep flights of steps, which is tiring after a day of exploring. The big lockers are roll cages underneath the bunks that generate lots of noise in the morning. Most of the people there during my stay seemed to be locals using it as shelter, rather than actual travellers, so the vibe was very anti-party. Especially in my room where lights out seemed to be at 8:00 every night.

name: St Christopher's Hammersmith
reviewtext: I had a great stay here. The beds were good and the staffmembers are very friendly. Big thanks to Mark for helping me out at the reception. I would deffinitely recommend this place!

name: St Christopher's Hammersmith
reviewtext: Great place to stay. Located just across the road from 2 underground stations and a large bus stop means accessing the city is super easy. Short walk from the Thames and gardens which are nice to visit. Staff are friendly. Mark the manager went out of his way to make me feel welcome.

name: St Christopher's Hammersmith
reviewtext:
I only stayed in this hostel for a short time...but its one of the best ive stayed in while in London.

The bed itself was really cheap which is amazing considering its location and i even got breakfast included

The reception staff were really helpful especially mark and amy and the bar staff friendly and bubbly and there were plenty of events for hostel guests throughout the week

All in all i had an amazing time and will definitely stay here next time im  in london

name: St Christopher's Hammersmith
reviewtext: this hotel is too hot...they've 1 stand fan but not enough...i'm stay this hotel for 4 night...the toilets is cleans so far...other else i think ok...by the way if you're not lucky...you will gets your roommate so badly and very selfish...

name: St Christopher's Hammersmith
reviewtext: This place is awesome.. perfect location, close to the tube station, awesome bar/restaurant downstairs with loads of specials for hostel guests.  Fast WiFi, clean showers/toilets, small free lockers.  Large lockers cost Â£2.5 /day.  Great party hostel.  Happy hour has really cheap drinks!  Shout out to Amy M. for being awesome and always hooking it up with the strong drinks! Cheers :)

name: St Christopher's Hammersmith
reviewtext: The hostel is great and its fun if you want to have drinks in the bar downstairs and then go straight up to your room, but..... the room was too hot and the fans did not help. The hostel needs to have another plan for hot weather, ie better fans, air con

name: St Christopher's Hammersmith
reviewtext: The hostel is in a pretty decent location and is easy to get to via the tube from Heathrow.  If you are looking for a party atmosphere, this is the place for you.  If you want to go to sleep before 2 am, however, I do not recommend this place since it is above a bar/club and the music can be heard crystal clear until it stops.

name: St Christopher's Hammersmith
reviewtext: Close to transport

name: St Christopher's Hammersmith
reviewtext: Very helpful staff in a great location. Also left a bottle of water for each night of the stay due to the heat.

name: St Christopher's Hammersmith
reviewtext: Great hostel! Had an absolute ripper of a time. Great value for money. The bar down stairs has cheap drinks and discount on food. Shouts out to Matt on reception! Absolute legend! Helped us in anyway he could. Highly recommend this hostel if your staying in London and wanna have a good time.

name: St Christopher's Hammersmith
reviewtext: Being in female dorm on the top floor was very hot but had 3 fans to help. Slept well bed very comfortable. Shower abd toilet facilities are nice and clean. Lovely breakfast. Would definitely stay again!

name: St Christopher's Hammersmith
reviewtext: I've got a room just above the kitchen, so we always had food smell (it is not nice to wake up smelling like fries). A lot of the bathrooms were not working. The one in my room didn't had a shower door. The staff was nowhere to be seen, as they also worked at the bar downstairs (an obvious source of noise, beware). I only choose the hostel for its location, but I don't think I'll be back.

name: St Christopher's Hammersmith
reviewtext: Hotel staff and location were great! Only thing was that having no air con it was incredibly hot in the rooms!

name: St Christopher's Hammersmith
reviewtext: Hostel itself is nice, but I woke up covered in sweat multiple times. Other roommates said the same. As soon as you get out of the shower you are sweating. Bar is hot too. I would not stay again because I could not sleep. Loud at night as well from the bar. Staff is great though!!

name: St Christopher's Hammersmith
reviewtext: Pub blaring downstairs and busking musicians all playing until midnight >:( shower wasnt great either

name: St Christopher's Hammersmith
reviewtext: Second hostel of this brand I have stayed at and pretty much same as each other. Okay rooms, but main thing about them is being attached to Belushis bars downstairs. Here you get good food at discounts for staying and a great place to drink and meet people. Great location in Hammersmith and right across from the station which was great.

name: St Christopher's Hammersmith
reviewtext: Excellent location and facilities, however the summer heat combined with the noise from the bar downstairs made it difficult to sleep.

name: St Christopher's Hammersmith
reviewtext: It's a really convenient location: the line it's on takes you to many major places in London, and it's also next to many bus routes. When I came back in the evening I was somewhat worried about the noise from the bar, but none of it reached to the hostel itself and other guests respected others sleeping. It'd be nice if they offered a way to lock the lockers (usually hostels use keys?). Guests seemed to use their own padlocks.

name: St Christopher's Hammersmith
reviewtext: Quite a noisy location, probably because my window faced right onto the main road. But decent toilets/showers, big enough rooms, Belushi bars are always decent, and right by Hammersmith underground too.

name: St Christopher's Hammersmith
reviewtext: I was traveling alone and got very weird vibes. Bathroom is not split by male and female in the large dorm, which i have never seen. There was no Air conditionin! Breakfast is only included if you book directly on their website.

name: St Christopher's Hammersmith
reviewtext: Great location, but I didn't sleep the entire week because it was so hot. No way to get the room to cool off.

name: St Christopher's Hammersmith
reviewtext: Stuffy,small and crowded rooms. There was not enough area for the quests to rest.

name: St Christopher's Hammersmith
reviewtext: Great staff, nice people and brilliant location. Couldn't ask for more really. Top class.

name: St Christopher's Hammersmith
reviewtext: Great location opposite the tube station with super friendly and helpful staff

name: St Christopher's Hammersmith
reviewtext: It is a nice place, very good atmosphere.

name: St Christopher's Hammersmith
reviewtext: Decent hostel. Comfy bed, right by the tibe station. Good security into hostel and dorms. Only downside for me was broken lockers in the dorms

name: St Christopher's Hammersmith
reviewtext: Had a lovely stay. Amy U who was on reception when I arrived at night was extremely helpful in helping me when I had a problem to deal with. This kind of service is exceptional and much appreciated!

name: YHA London St Pancras
reviewtext: Location and cleanliness are key!

name: YHA London St Pancras
reviewtext: Really cool place with extremely gentle employees! The ladies from the front desk were extremely kind to me! Will definitely come back!

name: YHA London St Pancras
reviewtext: . Getting an upper bunk was not great, as having to go often at night made it a chore getting up and down as well as fumbling in the dark, not wanting to put a light on so not to disturb others, then having to wake early especially with a couple of others still having a conversation when you really want to sleep. Again , pacing and repacking in the dark wasn't helpful also losing sunglasses in their case, not being able to see it fall out while it was dark. loss of them made stay costly.

name: YHA London St Pancras
reviewtext: Unless you have a specific reason for wanting to be near Oxford St or Marylebone, I'd definitely recommend this YHA over the other central London YHAs, and most other central London hostels I've stayed in. Best hostel location (in this price range, at least) if you have a late night or early morning train or flight, because it's literally right in front of King's Cross/St Pancras. The dorm rooms are surprisingly spacious, light and open too. NOT a vibe-y hostel, more 'corporate'/staid.

name: YHA London St Pancras
reviewtext: GREAT HOSTEL,GREAT COMMUNICATION,GREAT EFFICIENCY,GREAT LOCATION

name: YHA London St Pancras
reviewtext: Super clean, helpful staff that are extremely knowledgeable, delicious food in the lobby, and the location right across the street from King's Cross and St. Pancras, and the British Library, is PERFECT!

name: YHA London St Pancras
reviewtext: Clean and did the job for one night but staff were not very clear when I checked in about how to get to the locker room, my room or tell me a time I needed to check out. Been to a few hostels and wish the bed had a curtain as I stayed in a dorm room.

name: YHA London St Pancras
reviewtext: Great location next To London st pancras friendly staff Breakfast is definitely Worth its money

name: YHA London St Pancras
reviewtext: I have used St Pancras Youth Hostel on several occasions, and rate it highly.  I sometimes wish an evening meal could be supplied.  Other than that, I'm satisfied with all aspects of the hostel.

name: YHA London St Pancras
reviewtext: Everything is fine except for the fact there was no AC. In summer, on a high floor in the top bed of a bunk you will struggle to sleep let alone stay in the room. Recommend bringing your own USB fan (not a joke).

name: YHA London St Pancras
reviewtext: It would be good if the WiFi connection is strong throughout the whole building.

name: YHA London St Pancras
reviewtext:
Very friendly staff. Facilities all good.
I stayed at the front of the building so there was a lot of noise from traffic and sirens in the night.
I would recommend it to others.

name: YHA London St Pancras
reviewtext: Really hot inside. Really loud next door to major street in London.

name: YHA London St Pancras
reviewtext: Very convenient location. The rooms were spacious and clean. It was quite warm in July but the portable fan was a nice touch. There was pleanty of storage space. A downside was that there was no self catering kitchen.

name: YHA London St Pancras
reviewtext: During summer be prepared to be hot. Especially if your roommates don't like fans. Lift also didn't work while I was there. Lots of stairs.

name: YHA London St Pancras
reviewtext: Nice location and comfortable bed! Staff are all friendly and willing to help. The cafe has good offer for snack too! However, the bathroom is very tiny and no enough storage space for everyone in the room ( e.g. 6ppl room with only 4 lockers) it will be a lot better if everyone has their little own space.

name: YHA London St Pancras
reviewtext: Good hostel in a central location, excellent facilities such as en suite bathroom and bar downstairs. Was ideal for a night's stay before travelling on from King's Cross station.

name: YHA London St Pancras
reviewtext: Great hostel

name: YHA London St Pancras
reviewtext: Amazing staff! I thought i've lost my phone and they helped me look fot it and at the time of my departure they lended me a scale to weigh my luggage and helped me find the best route  to the airport. CanÂ´ t say much about the hostel itself because i stayed just for one night but as far as i can tell, the staff was the best part of it!

name: YHA London St Pancras
reviewtext:
Good place to stay. good value for money. Very clean
If you are staying for two nights , Double Double make sure the message is passed onto other staff members.

name: YHA London St Pancras
reviewtext: Everything was fine except the room was SO hot! Also it would be nice to have WiFi in the rooms and not just the common areas. There was only one shower working for a whole hall, but I didn't run into any trouble.

name: YHA London St Pancras
reviewtext: The room was very warm , because the air conditioner was not working , so this made it difficult to get to sleep  . Otherwise ok .

name: YHA London St Pancras
reviewtext: Convenient location, good enough to to spend the night. Nothing extra exciting..bathrooms were normal clean, bed was comfortable..there are better hostels in central London that offer breakfast in the same price or less, are cooler hangout spots and have a great hostel vibe..

name: YHA London St Pancras
reviewtext: Often stay here when I have to be in town. Good location opposite Kings Cross. Not a social place but a decent place for the money. Recommended.

name: YHA London St Pancras
reviewtext: Comfortable bed, the room.was clean

name: Central Hostel
reviewtext:
There is no washing machine.
The receptionists are nice.
One particular person  (not receptionist) - not very nice.

name: Central Hostel
reviewtext: Great location, bedsheets were clean, but everything else was horrible.The whole place smells like dust (the carpet - everywhere - smells the most), there is mold on walls and ceilling, only 5 toilets for 15 rooms (60ppl or +), 3 showers with no locks, no lockers in the room, furniture old and dusty, there were 3 plugs in my room (again-7 beds!) and 1 was broken (quite dangerous), and no ladders for bunkbeds.

name: Central Hostel
reviewtext: Absolutely not recommendable to stay in this hostel!Our room was completely run down and dirty,just like the rest of the hostel.Kitchen not useable.Not a single toilet which would flush properly;using the toilet nearly drowned the entire bathroom every time which was disgusting.Group showers without a sign designating the gender.Had a problem with loud people at night which was ignored by the (inconsiderate up to outright unfriendly) staff.If you're not French the staff makes you feel unwelcome.

name: Central Hostel
reviewtext: Caught the cleaner in the act of stealing from my room lost my bank card and about 90 pounds. Made a police report but could do nothing as there are no cctv available. This hostel employs thieves!

name: Central Hostel
reviewtext: Really laid back and great location

name: Central Hostel
reviewtext: This hostel is extremely dirty and smells really bad in the room. The showers and bathrooms were also not very clean

name: Central Hostel
reviewtext: I booked this hostel stay for my friend and myself out of necessity, because the hostel we would have preferred was full when we needed it. This hostel is essentially worth what you pay for it, and though we were pleased that there were a couple of girls' only rooms, the rest of the hostel was, to be quite honest, appalling at best. That being said, it seems as though, with the change of management Central Hostel is undergoing, change of facility may also (hopefully).

name: Central Hostel
reviewtext: The place is cheap and in Notting Hill, in a nice Victorian house. Still I had a terrible experience at Central Hostel mainly because of the unbearable heat (all windows open, it must have been 35Â°C and 100% humidity). Then, I was on the 4th floor with no elevator, the room and the bathroom were filthy, there is no privacy at all (in the bathroom there are 3 showers with no possibility to get dressed in the cabin, or to lock the main door). I've seen better in London even at this price.

name: Central Hostel
reviewtext: Great location right near Bayswater Tube Stop.  Quick, no-hassle check, very clean private room and bathroom facilities.  Individuals rooms are very clean and basic but common area is a bit grungy and had a smell of old socks. I didn't care because I didn't spend time in the common area but something to be aware of.

name: Central Hostel
reviewtext: Wouldn't recommend this place... Th location is really cool but  everything else is just horrible

name: Central Hostel
reviewtext: Good for short break.

name: Central Hostel
reviewtext:
Stayed here a night. Didn't seem too bad at first. Location is fab. The staff at the counter seemed fine and I had no issues.
The hostel itself was very run down, it was dirty, dusty and empty of guests for most of the day. Slept fine, just had to keep the door to the balcony open otherwise it would have been too hot, this in turn could allow others to enter through it from a neighbouring room. The beds were very shaky and the mattresses seemed very thin. Only had 2 cupboards for 6 people.

name: Central Hostel
reviewtext: This was the worst hostel I've ever seen, dirty, unsafe, rude staff, toilets didnt flush at all and bathrooms were atrocious. The low price isnt worth it!! Stay somewhere else!!

name: Central Hostel
reviewtext: as I expected. Som eimprovements since last visit. Kitchen has been refurbed.

name: Central Hostel
reviewtext: Excellent especially for the price . Would definitely stay again

name: Central Hostel
reviewtext: It didnt feel safe and I was roomed together with a mentally ill woman who sat in the room with too many things, three bottles of the same shampoo and read the news all day long.

name: Central Hostel
reviewtext: We stayed here on a very warm weekend, which made sleeping unbareable in a room of 12 with a window that didn't open and no fan etc. The place didn't feel like it had ever been cleaned, the toilets were blocked and the shower trays were yellow. We left a night early and moved to a hotel so that we could sleep and shower.

name: Central Hostel
reviewtext: It was an ok hostel for short stay in London

name: Central Hostel
reviewtext: This was one of the worst hostels I've stayed at. Very unhygienic, the toilets always clogged and you always had to use to plunger to unclog the toilet. Stains on the bed and pillows, uncomfortable bed, springs hanging out of the bed, paint pealing of the walls. Reception spoke very little English, they don't organise tours and were not helpful with information to and from the area. Beds not numbered so you would pick a bed and then someone could come in and move your stuff and have that bed.

name: Central Hostel
reviewtext: Pretty dirty. I might stay here again by myself but wouldn't bring my family. Didn't take card for check in, though I didn't know that until I got there so I had to leave to get cash. Hard to find, needs a better sign. Charges for many things like storing your bags after check out as you walk around the city, per bag, but the guy was kind to only charge me for one of my four bags. Shower rooms were unisex, and give no privacy when changing. WiFi only works in the lobby, not in any rooms.

name: Central Hostel
reviewtext:
A couple of words..sh!t hole!!

Enough said.

name: Central Hostel
reviewtext:
It was okay. Not bad for a short 3 nights getaway. Property/atmosphere seemed dark & scary, & hostel seemed old, but the bed was cleaned well when i checked in, as well as comfortable.

Location wise- good. It's near to Hyde Park to walk to the very central of London, or Tube (Zone 1).

TIPS: Make sure to bring locks for your luggage because other guests during my stay didn't seem trustable. Also, make sure to keep the Â£10 key deposit receipt to claim it back when you check out.

name: Central Hostel
reviewtext: Scruffy rooms, surly staff, filthy bathrooms - no soap anywhere. Linen smells bad. Tatty mattress-  did not fit the bed. Haphazard assigning of beds. My 2nd night I found someone in the bed I was using. Only sleep here if desperate. Awful.

name: Central Hostel
reviewtext: Very dirty. The beds were very bad.

name: Central Hostel
reviewtext: It's just ok, not very safe, the location is only ok (not very close to any atraction), but it's the least expensive you can get

name: No.8 at The White Horse
reviewtext: The Hostel was OK for what I payed

name: No.8 at The White Horse
reviewtext: The very basic conditions were acceptable for the price but the incompetence of the staff was not. The receptionist told me incorrect opening times (!) which meant I was unable to retrieve my laptop and deposit (fortunately an ex-employee was around and came to the rescue), and stuck inside the following morning. DO NOT STAY HERE if you want to stay out past 10:30pm or leave before 9:30am. Also, you need your own padlock for the lockers.

name: No.8 at The White Horse
reviewtext:
Although the staff were reasonably friendly, they were uninformative and too busy chatting to each other. At the front desk I was waiting for a gap in their conversation (about what music they liked) before I could ask for help. When I did get their attention I asked where I could park my car which was met with a blank look and an, 'I don't know.' 
The whole vibe of the place is very unfriendly. I felt very unsafe both walking around outside and inside the hostel.

name: No.8 at The White Horse
reviewtext: The place was ok, but I think, that the overall rating on hostel world is a bit misleading (in my opinion far too high). If you wanna stay somewhere cheap where you will just sleep the place is all right, however if you're expecting more than that (place to chill or meet people) - look for a different place.

name: No.8 at The White Horse
reviewtext: Nice place in a good location. Book direct for a free breakfast! Breakfast is more and daytime baggage storage is more. The bathrooms are very small but clean! Beds a super comfortable work e curtain too :)

name: No.8 at The White Horse
reviewtext: My experience was bad in this hostel with staff as I called one of my friend from outside the hostel to my room for some time. After that, I got an email from reception saying it's against the hostel policy to call guests on the room. I checked all the terms and conditions after that but didn't find anything like this. I replied to them saying that this is not mentioned in the T&C (rules) but still they were rude and denying this. Also after 12 pm, you can't go out as all the doors get locked.

name: No.8 at The White Horse
reviewtext: Comparing to other cheap hostel I can say tha one is one of the best for its price. Sometimes internet connection was poor and also we had to wait a whole week until we can connect to the internet again. I would have been happier if those guys could keep the toilets cleaner.

name: No.8 at The White Horse
reviewtext:
What an horrible place !
The location is far from town centre. 
You can see 10 ants near the shower and WC the evening plus cracks on the ground. IT IS NOT ACCEPTABLE TO LEAVE THE TOILETS OPEN !
Moreover, me and others couldn't receive the WIFI in the bedroom, I was obliged to take a seat near bar. The bedroom was also noisy due to cars on the street.
With an empty bar and a kitchen very small, it didn't allow me to meet new people and to stay longer to chat after my lunch.

name: No.8 at The White Horse
reviewtext: Booked for two days, but decided to leave after one. Even though I was still checked in for two and paid for two nights, they wouldn't give me back my key deposit since they said I was checking out late after the first night. Only reason to stay at this hostel is if you are catching a Tottenham game and looking for a cheap bed. Seeing as how the new stadium will never be finished, look to stay closer to London.

name: No.8 at The White Horse
reviewtext: The no. 8 at the white horse is an excellent place for meeting new people and drop for some days, their facilities are complete, although we missed a microwave,the location is pretty good even though it is a little far from the center of London it easy to get there and they are right in front of the bus stop, the staff is really nice and you can count on having a pint at the most classic London way, in a pub, so you can get in the best of the moods for your trip.

name: No.8 at The White Horse
reviewtext: Essentially, you get what you pay for. It's a bed, just not much else. The staff is cool and helpful. The location isn't great. Quite far away from London City and in a rough part of town. Assorted crew of folks, as it's not tourists/students only.

name: No.8 at The White Horse
reviewtext: Amazing staff, 10/10. The hostel... you get what your pay for. I wouldn't stay for more than one night.

name: No.8 at The White Horse
reviewtext: Friendly staff willing to help and go above and beyond. Rooms are basic with the larger dorms actually being subdivided into smaller rooms without a door. Toilets and showers separate. Perhaps not the safest area at night (as told by staff) but I did not experience any issues.

name: No.8 at The White Horse
reviewtext: This hostel is pretty out of the way and the kitchen and bathroom facilities are pretty limited. But for London accomodation still great value for money.

name: No.8 at The White Horse
reviewtext:
Not the ritz Carlton but get what you pay for!
Walking up and down the street 20 metres from the hostel near the tesco express people keep trying to sell me drugs. Not my cup of tea but whatever you are into.

name: No.8 at The White Horse
reviewtext: The location really is very far out. You'll have to change 2 to 3 times on public transport to reach it. And keep in mind how expensive London public transport is. A bed may be 10 pounds, but add 10 pounds per day for transport.The bathrooms are cleaned in the morning around 9-10 AM and there are only three small bathrooms for about 30 guests. So it makes no sense to clean the only bathrooms when everyone is trying to use them. I would look for a different place next time.

name: No.8 at The White Horse
reviewtext:
The staff were very friendly and professional.
I would definitely recommend staying here and I will most certainly be returning home

name: No.8 at The White Horse
reviewtext: You get what you pay for .

name: No.8 at The White Horse
reviewtext: For price it is the best hostel I have staying in very friendly staff and people stayed on much worse for a lot more would deffo recommend ðŸ’¯

name: Via London
reviewtext: Excellent value for money.

name: Via London
reviewtext: Good, clean hostel and very cheap as a last minute booking cost us Â£20 per bed. The hostel was full of foreign students, although I suppose this is to be expected in the summer. The place seemed to be doubling up as a language school, but it didn't really bother us. Beds were metal framed bunks, with not much headroom. Facilities very clean. Didn't stay for breakfast, but it saw posters advertising a continental breakfast for a couple of quid.

name: Via London
reviewtext:
Toilets are very stinky most of the time
Worst thing is kitchen...never seen such a dirt kitchen and fridge I think issue with a cleaning staffs so recon replace cleaning team is most ideal thing lol
It's really dirty and messy. Probably haven't clean for months.

And one more thing that's 3 store bunk bed, it's really scary and difficult to get in and down.
So Kitchen 
Toilet and Beds
Rest alright with me

name: Via London
reviewtext:
Checking in took ages, people queuing constantly between 21:30 when I arrived and still long que at 00:30 when I went to bed and only one person in reception. Staff were kind  friendly. Very big and lots of corridors and steps up and down. 15 min walk from Hither Green Station to the hostel and once there easy to get to any part of the city.
In future I would choose a hostel that has separate male and female dorms.

name: Via London
reviewtext: Please don't stay here. I could deal with the poor location and facilities, but the place is absurdly understaffed. This is a large place and there was only one person working at the reception desk, so I waited over 40 minutes just to check in. It was like that all night. Please don't patronize a facility that shows such contempt for it's guests! Life is too short!

name: Via London
reviewtext: Dirty, someone else was in our beds when we arrived. Not helpful staff and dirty rooms.

name: Via London
reviewtext: I cannot give ratings on this hostel as we did not end up staying. Our reservations were confirmed but they didn't end up having a bed for me. They put my son and I in an all female dorm room, that didn't have any beds left. They end up finding a bed for my 18 yr. old son but no bed for me. I end up having to stay at a hotel for 125 pounds a night. We were just flying in from Canada and veery jet lagged. It kind of blew our budget for a 2 month trip to Europe and the Uk. Very unorganized hostel!

name: Via London
reviewtext:
The hostel is really far away from anywhere Central. While I was staying there I encountered a few weird guests which seemed to be staying there long term. They also had a bunch of school kids staying there which I found annoying as they closed the outside area off to everyone there. 

Overall I wouldn't recommend it unless you're desperate, there's not a lot to do in the area besides some pubs which closed early. I only stayed there because I was desperate and everywhere was already booked.

name: Via London
reviewtext: Cramped, small rooms, tiny bathrooms overpriced accommodation, breakfast is average, inconvenient location, nothing to do onsite. Functioning as a hostel seems to be something of an afterthought as a large set of school groups were onsite too, which limited the overall availability of facilities (ie: outdoor area shut down after 10pm).

name: Via London
reviewtext: Would NEVER stay here again. Kitchen was disgusting, the floor hadn't been cleaned in a while and there were smelly dirty dishes. Showers and bathroom both weren't clean and smelt weird. The rooms were hot and there were three bunk beds crammed into a tiny room with no space for our stuff. There were no lockers. Staff sucked, didn't know what they were doing. Just a weird vibe in general. Would not recommend.

name: Via London
reviewtext: This is not a hostel for solo travellers, least of all females. I stayed in a 4 bed dorm with 3 males - and there were no female only dorms to choose from. The hostel feels very clinical and i felt like i was sleeping in a shared room at the psych ward. The shower in the ensuite was clogged. There was no atmosphere, and it seemed as though there were multiple schools here on some kind of excursion - which meant that there was abundance of noise until around 10:30pm. Would it stay here again...

name: Via London
reviewtext:
I arrived at 11.50 and waited 30 minutes to check in! As soon as I got to the front of the reception queue the manager pointed at somebody who seemingly had just joined the queue and said them next. Okay fair enough I smiled and went with it. Upon checking in myself however the person dealing with me turns to somebody else who obviously works there and starts having a conversation in another language.
Lights in shower and toilet go off after about 5 seconds and beds aren't very spacious or comfy

name: London Backpackers
reviewtext: Rooms not as messy as previous reviews had mentioned, but I noticed the bins filled up quickly and I don't think they were changed daily (it was literally overflowing). The middle bunk was awful - you could feel every time someone went up or down the ladder for the top bunk. Also not the greatest headspace; the top bunk is probably the best overall. There was not enough floor room for everyone to put their suitcases, and I had to organize my stuff in the hallway.

name: London Backpackers
reviewtext: Nice hostel in Hendon Central. The staff is super nice, the place is clean. It is located about 10 min metro from all the activities and then gives yoi the chance to visit a charming, less touristic surrounding of London.

name: London Backpackers
reviewtext: You get what you pay for - but it's value for money! It's basic, and far out from Central London, but it's directly on the Northern Line and even if you add in the tube fare there and back if you want to head into the city for the day, it's still MUCH less than you'd pay for any other London hostel. Would highly recommend if you're looking for no frills, standard, quality accommodation and don't mind staying a bit outside of the centre.

name: London Backpackers
reviewtext:
Bathrooms are super clean. Loved the privacy provided by the bed curtains. The safe underneath the bed was perfect (get your own padlock though). 
It was a very comfortable stay. Definitely recommend it

name: London Backpackers
reviewtext: We didn't realize when we booked that some backpackers live here (some for a year or more). When we got to our room there was stuff everywhere. Clothes, suitcases, the girl on the top bunk above us had clothes falling down to the floor all night. The common room areas are used by the people living there and there was no real comraderie around being new to a city. We were woken up on our last night by some um... bed shaking above us. But it was cheap!

name: London Backpackers
reviewtext: Great time here. A lot of long-term residents. Really cool folks. Staff is nice. Not a party hostel but you can definitely start one in the pool room in the basement with your own music hooked up to the speaker. Nifty 24/7 convenience store around the corner for snacks, booze and toiletry. Right across the street from the tube  and there's a huge park next door.

name: London Backpackers
reviewtext: Very nice place to stay, with a very good price, if you only want a bed to sleep and a shower! Staff was very kind and helped us all the time. The location is all you can ask, you leave the tube station and only has to croos the street! Everything is really clean and the bathrooms were cleaned every morning before people start to wake up! The only thing to improve is in the rooms, that were to hot!

name: London Backpackers
reviewtext: The rooms were incredibly crowded and poorly up kept. The common areas were small and crowded as well. The hostel was right across a tube station but there wasn't much around, very residently area way out of the city center.

name: London Backpackers
reviewtext:
Really lovely desk staff !
Kitchen was pretty dirty though, I wanted to buy them a new dish sponge. Don't know how I feel about the triple bunk beds , I hit my head 4 times in a space of 1 minute being in the middle one. Also, this is not the hostels fault, but the room I was in had bags and shoes and clothes EVERYWHERE! Staff should tell patrons to be more tidy.
Location right next to train station so it was super easy to go back into central London :)

name: London Backpackers
reviewtext: Very close to underground station. 3 tier beds are sturdy. But they let ppl stay for a long time, so their stuffs is everywhere in the dorms. Breakfast was basic but you can help yourselves to the toasts and cereals. Shower is clean. Staff is great and friendly. They even let us had breakfast for the first day before check on since we'll be missing breakfast for the last day before check out. Easy check in and check out, even at wee hours

name: London Backpackers
reviewtext: All I wanted was a bed, a door that locked, and a comfortable shower- no complaints!

name: London Backpackers
reviewtext: Don't expect a great breakfast, fluffy pillow or a working fan to cool the room and it's perfect! Honestly 2 minutes from the station and lots of restaurants and a superstore around for late night munchies.

name: London Backpackers
reviewtext:
Walked through the door and was invited to a party by the long-term residents. Would absolutely recommend. 

Literally around the corner from the tube station, ATMs and supermarkets. Dorms were alright, very hot this time of year though. The privacy curtains were a nice touch, but having triple-decker metal bunks was difficult and creaky. For the price, a fantastic experience.

name: London Backpackers
reviewtext: Had a great stay at London Backpackers. The staff is amazing and the vibe is awesome.

name: London Backpackers
reviewtext: It was a good  place to stay, quite cosy.

name: London Backpackers
reviewtext: Excellent value for London, the offering is no-frills but everything is thought-out, clean and kept in order.

name: London Backpackers
reviewtext: Staying here was convenient and mostly comfortable. Checking in and out are simple. Most staff are really really kind and easy to talk to. My biggest issue was the lack of AC which made is blazing hot at night (aka difficult to sleep in). It's wicked safe though and I never worried about myself or my belongings. I would stay there again.

name: London Backpackers
reviewtext: Please refer to my email that i will be sending in response to my "lower than expected" service we received. Thank you.

name: London Backpackers
reviewtext: I think overall I had a nice stay. The staff was nice and helpful, which I appreciated. I also greatly, greatly appreciated the informational email they sent me after making my reservation. That was a huge help in planning my trip (how to get there from the airport, general travel information, etc.) That part I was especially grateful for. They also had continental breakfast, which was pretty good! The only thing that kind of annoyed me was the showers (they had push buttons).

name: London Backpackers
reviewtext: Loved it here, will definitely return. The only downside is that breakfast is only available untill 9 am.

name: London Backpackers
reviewtext: Good experience

name: London Backpackers
reviewtext: Had a brilliant time. Would recommend it. Funny I booked it quick and I thought it was central london. No, the address was Hendon Central, London. But any regrets soon evaporated in the hot sun of the day as I arrived. Loved the energy of the place, the cool attitude of the manager, and staff. Friendly place. Walls and rooms decked out imaginatively inside. Two quick tube stops to Golders Green means you can book your coach to Golders Green on NE coaches. A Good plan for a northerner.

name: London Backpackers
reviewtext: The rooms were disgustingly hot, cramped, and several other individuals staying at the hostel were inconsiderate of the other people in the room. There was no one at the front desk when we came to check in and had to wait approximately 20 minutes for a staff member to check us in. The staff was friendly and the atmosphere was great, but I probably would not pick this as my number one place to stay in London. Good, but not great.

name: London Backpackers
reviewtext: I spent a week here and it was fantastic. The people were so welcoming and friendly and it was just overall a place I would definitely stay again.

name: London Backpackers
reviewtext: It was good, exactly what I wanted ...

name: London Backpackers
reviewtext: Great value for your money, friendly staff, and very clean bathrooms with lots of hot water every time I showered! Beds had charging ports and were plenty comfortable. I'd definitely stay here again :)

name: London Backpackers
reviewtext: Absolutely amazing place, fully recommend this as an easy and affordable place to stay! The people are lovely and made us feel so welcome, will definitely be staying here again whenever I visit London, thanks guys!!

name: London Backpackers
reviewtext: Great hostel with really friendly and helpful staff. It's right next to a tube station so very easy access, I would definitely stay at London Backpackers again.

name: London Backpackers
reviewtext:
For my first hostel I had a great experience! 
The staff were awesome, friendly, and gave good advice about local things to do in London and where to go next on my Euro trip. The hostel is pretty much across the road from the tube, and the bathrooms were modern and spotless. Really couldn't ask for a better hostel experience...Thanks guys!

name: London Backpackers
reviewtext: Showers were clean, but the repeated button pushing got a bit tedious

name: London Backpackers
reviewtext: People - brilliant. Very helpful and cheery staff. Location - not so good being miles from anywhere and expensive to get to anywhere on tube or bus. Cleanliness - excellent. Good clean toilets, dorm and sheets. Good breakfast. Toilets a floor above the dorm - a bit of a toil to get to. Curtain around bed - good but not complete. Excellent light and sockets in the bedvery good value.. Good locker beneath the bed.

name: London Backpackers
reviewtext: SUPER DUPER GREAT HOSTEL!!!

name: London Backpackers
reviewtext: Great location, friendly staff, wish we could've stayed longer. :)

name: London Backpackers
reviewtext: Loved the place! Staff were friendly and always up for a chat, great vibe in the common areas and was full of great people all week. Really enjoyed my stay and will definitely be returned on my next adventure :)

name: London Backpackers
reviewtext:
This is one of my favorite hostels that I've stayed at! Great staff, great people! Everyone was really helpful and it was easy to get around. 

Thank you so much guys! We will be back!

name: Abercorn House
reviewtext: Friendly and helpful

name: Abercorn House
reviewtext: Clean rooms, good location near train station

name: Abercorn House
reviewtext:
Toilet door was broken and there was often no toilet roll in any of the cubicles. 
Room was basic but clean and tidy.

name: Abercorn House
reviewtext: The toilets weren't very clean other than that it's a fantastic place and great value for money

name: Abercorn House
reviewtext:
Located near Hammersmith U station for Piccadilly and District line, this hostel assure a quick connection for any London tourist objectives.
I have no idea how is looking a big room but the smaller one for 2 persons has super clean private bathroom, (shampoo, towels) wardrobe and tableware - all that you need.

name: Abercorn House
reviewtext: Really lovely staff and space. Excellent value for money considering the location. We will definitely be staying again. I think the bed frames in our room could use some attention but otherwise it was great.

name: Abercorn House
reviewtext: Not very clean in the bathrooms, facilities are very basic and should be cleaned more frequently, wear footwear to toilet and shower rooms. It's extremely noisy with banging doors, and guests - as to be expected for a cheap hostel enjoyed by young adults. If you're after a pit stop perfect, if you need a good nights sleep go elsewhere.

name: Abercorn House
reviewtext:
SQUEAKY BEDS!!  We booked a private twin but were given a 4 bed bunk room which was very small. It was kept to just us 2 but there was barely room to move much less unpack bags. Can't imagine how 4 people could tolerate sharing that space.

The beds were cheap and horribly squeaky. Any movement at all could wake your neighbor.  Showers: no shelf or hooks for toiletries, clothes or towels.  Comes across as doing the minimum overall.  Good location and friendly staff helped to up the score.

name: Abercorn House
reviewtext:
Abercorn delivers again. Keep it up.

Oh and the place is clean, affordable and worth staying at.

name: Abercorn House
reviewtext: I had been in this hostel before, and had very good experience. However, this time  the person on reception for the check in was very rude, the room assigned wasn't clean, and the wifi connection was quite poor.

name: Abercorn House
reviewtext: No free wifi

name: Abercorn House
reviewtext: Great location. Close to the underground so easy to travel around perfect for us! The toilet could have been kept cleaner but in fairness that was late at night and often cant be helped. Room itself was nice, mini fridge and closet. Really comfortable bed!

name: Abercorn House
reviewtext: Fantastic hostel located in Hammersmith, near the tube station. Big room, good shower, comfortable bed. What more could you want? Actually, the only thing that could have been better would have been a bigger sink for shaving, but that's a minor issue compared with the advantages of this excellent value-for-money hostel in central London.

name: Abercorn House
reviewtext: Thank you.

name: Abercorn House
