reviewtext: Was perfectly fine for the price paid was very clean was a good location only thing was shared bathrooms but deff stay again

name: Abercorn House
reviewtext:
The room was extremely hot with no air conditioning or fan, the walls had stains and smears on them, the doors slammed all night and morning keeping us awake, and one of the staff was extremely rude and would not even get up to get us food from the snack bar which was open and his job and had a bad attitude.

That being said, the place was cheap, not too dirty, and good for the price. The only thing would be to clean the walls, fix the doors from slamming so loudly, and fire rude staff member.

name: Abercorn House
reviewtext: Staff was rude during the night shift. Bathrooms were dirty and not working, and there were bugs in the rooms.

name: Abercorn House
reviewtext:
Pros: right by Hammersmith tube and bus stations, 24 hour reception, clean bathrooms and kitchens on every floor, our private room had a mini fridge, on a quiet street. 

Cons: loads of loud fire doors all over that will wake you up whenever someone leaves or comes back or goes to the bathroom, no fan/ventilation/AC so our room was hot and stuffy at night even when it was cool out.

name: Abercorn House
reviewtext: Booked a 4 bed private room and it was just 2 bunk beds... When we arrived the staff were quite inattentive and disinterested also. Only good side of this place is the quiet neighbourhood, cheap price and the close proximity to Hammersmith. On the downside was the small lift and lack of bathroom facilities.. 3 toilets for an entire floor. Just spend a bit more and go somewhere nicer, I would not stay here again and only recommend it if you're looking for the good points highlighted above.

name: Abercorn House
reviewtext: Great stay for 3 of us in a private room - on arrival they didn't have a 3 bed room but placed a mattress on the floor in a 2 bed room instead.  This worked for us as we were only staying for two nights for a festival, and they charged us less for the room, but not sure what they would have done if we'd said this wasn't acceptable!

name: Abercorn House
reviewtext: Abercorn was exactly what we were expected and needed. The location is excellent really close to multiple tube lines as well as a bus station. We went when it was pretty warm, and there was no air conditioning so keep that in mind!

name: Abercorn House
reviewtext: Booked for 3 nights had  to leave after two! Room smelt terrible and there was very little ventilation with no fan which made it extremely hot. No sleep for two nights  due to level of noise from other residents all night! Asked for a refund for last night... they declined. Very disappointing.

name: Abercorn House
reviewtext: Easy check in despite late hour, lovely room and spotless ensuite bathroom. Perfect for what we needed and fabtasuoc location close to Hammersmith tube but on a quiet street!

name: Abercorn House
reviewtext: We Were really surprised when we got to the hostel as it beat our low expectations due to how cheap the room was. Actually we were pleasantly surprised and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. It felt safe, it was quiet the beds were comfortable showers, toilets and kitchen were very clean and the staff were friendly. We will definitely stay here again .

name: Abercorn House
reviewtext:
The place is OK if you just need a crash pad, there is not much atmosphere or local suggestions from staff. I was disappointed that the communal kitchens have no equipment in them- I.e bring your own knife, board, pots and pans as there is nothing supplied. 
Good showers though.

name: Abercorn House
reviewtext: This hostel was super dirty, with none of the toilets working, all leaky taps, and when I arrived, my bed was messy for the last person who had been there. The place also has no lockers and nowhere safe to keep your bags, so I had to keep my passport with me all day. There are no closely available outlets or bedside lights in the rooms, and you have to pay for wifi, which is not normal in 2018, and at a pound/hour, it's not a completely reasonable price. I would definitely not stay here again.

name: Abercorn House
reviewtext: Overall the hostel was great for what we needed - just a one night stay. We had a private double room which was clean and comfortable, although there was no air con so it was fairly stuffy. The hostel in general was clean, in a great location, and the staff were friendly. The only real issue was the toilets, some of the communal ones did not flush and needed some maintenance, but this is to be expected with a large city hostel so wasn't too much of an inconvenience!

name: Barmy Badger Backpackers
reviewtext: 4bed mix-in the basement, 2 outlets per mattress, wooden bunks attached to the wall which was great- no squeaking or waking up the other person above/under. Only a shower and sink attached to room. Lockers very large  with security box-bring own lock. Can hold bags prior to check-in. Could use more social events to bring people together other than a kitchen/TV/garden- at least do a game night or something.

name: Barmy Badger Backpackers
reviewtext: Friendly hostel in a quiet neighbourhood very close to Earl's Court underground station. Staff are terrific. Very little headroom on the bottom bunks, and mattresses a little firm. But a pleasant and friendly place to stay as a solo traveller for a few nights while in London.

name: Barmy Badger Backpackers
reviewtext: My favourite hostel that I've stayed in yet!!

name: Barmy Badger Backpackers
reviewtext: This hostel was one of the most comfortable I've stayed in. The dorm room was small but the bed was very good and the ensuite shower had reliable hot water and good pressure. The provided breakfast was more than you could want and the kitchen space was very useful. Close to a main train line making it very easy to reach any part of the city and return to the hostel at any time of day.

name: Barmy Badger Backpackers
reviewtext: The staff really make this place. They go out of their way to make sure you feel comfortable, safe, and organised. It's got your basic essentials and everything is clean... at this great price it's really all you need!

name: Barmy Badger Backpackers
reviewtext: Amazing place, excellent location near underground and a lot of beautiful parks. Incredible stuff.

name: Barmy Badger Backpackers
reviewtext:
The Badger was a lovely place to stay at. It was very close to the conference which was the reason why we went to London, and also close to the tube. There is both a local Sainsbury's and a huge Tesco nearby.

The reception staff was very friendly and helpful, especially when we arrived around midnight. The facilities in the room were great and the kitchen was stocked with a lot of pots and pans. 

There was a free breakfast provided every morning, which was maybe simple, but still lovely.

name: Barmy Badger Backpackers
reviewtext:
Staff were very friendly and helpful. My room had a locker with a safe inside, unserved storage and an ensuite bathroom which was so good. Unfortunately no fans or aircon which made sleep very hard when it's so hot. 
Free breakfast! Really close to tube station, which is on the line to Heathrow

name: Barmy Badger Backpackers
reviewtext: Clean, secure, and in great location to set up a home base. The staff was kind and very helpful. When I stayed there was a large number of long term guests who seemed to have there own clique. Overall still a good place to meet people but very easy to keep to yourself.

name: Barmy Badger Backpackers
reviewtext: The staff were lovely, but the actual hostel and rooms were very old and dated. The location was good being so close to Earl's Court station, making it easy to get to all the sights. There was a barbecue on the night I arrived  which was a good way to meet people. The lack of air conditioning or fans was a huge problem though, as the rooms became ridiculously hot which made it very hard to sleep. I would therefore not recomend this hotel during the summer time.

name: Barmy Badger Backpackers
reviewtext: Best hostel ever. Not only did they accept me despite having previously stayed at a hostel with bed bugs; their friendly staff also did everything they could to help me exterminate any bugs or eggs from my belongings by helping me with washing and drying my clothes for free and spraying my backpack. The kitchen and garden areas were the perfect place to meet and trade stories with other travelers. Bit far from city attractions but conveniently close to the tube. Highly recommend!

name: Barmy Badger Backpackers
reviewtext:
Had a great time. The location is perfect to move around the city with the tube so close.
You also have restaurants and plenty of things to do nearby.
The staff is great (Australian girl at the reception), and I met some great people here.
Great memories of London, and I'll hopefully be back someday

name: Barmy Badger Backpackers
reviewtext: Decent hostel in central London on a quiet residential street close to Earl's Court tube and plenty of bus links. Very clean and tidy with spacious lockers. Well equipped and clean kitchen. I stayed on a Friday night and there wasn't really a social atmosphere that I was aware of. However, this will now be my hostel of choice when staying in London in the future, highly recommended.

name: Barmy Badger Backpackers
reviewtext: Great hostel, good location very close to Earls Court station. The staff were extremely friendly and the people there were very welcoming. The rooms were cleanly and I didn't even lock up my stuff in the lockers provided because the people I was staying with seemed trustworthy. I very much recommend this place.

name: Barmy Badger Backpackers
reviewtext: Excellent hostel. Friendly staff, nice outdoor area and comfortable beds.

name: Barmy Badger Backpackers
reviewtext: Had a great time staying here. I traveled alone and felt completely safe. The location was close to an underground station, which made traveling around the city easy. The staff was very nice and gave wonderful suggestions for places to visit or places to eat. It was a nice place that I could either have a bit of quiet time to myself when I needed it and could socialize with the other guest when I wanted to. Great experience for my first hostel.

name: Barmy Badger Backpackers
reviewtext: Excellent people, fantastic location, great planning, solid built-in bunkbeds. All in all, an A+ experience

name: Barmy Badger Backpackers
reviewtext: Great location near Earl's Court and lot's of restaurants and markets. Big lockers for our stuff. I loved it! The only thing I would add are fans in the rooms cause it was so hot in there with the warm weather.

name: Barmy Badger Backpackers
reviewtext: The location is in a safe and quiet neighborhood. The location is convenient, it's a 5min walk to the metro and many restaurants/bars/grocery store. Also, it is a 15min walk to museums, wholefoods, hyde park, and shopping area(High Kensington). When I first walked in I wasn't very impressed, but I think it's just the color choices of the facility. Once I lived here, I appreciate the cleanliness and comfort of the hostel. Everyone I spoke too were friendly and helpful.

name: Barmy Badger Backpackers
reviewtext: Fantastic stay at The Barmy Badger. The staff were great, the location was awesome, and the rooms were very comfortable. Quite possibly the best hostel I've ever stayed in. My only slight issue was the smell; I think the cleaning team uses a vinegar based cleaning solution so the stairways and bathrooms smelled quite a bit like vinegar. For how clean everything was though, I can't really complain.

name: Barmy Badger Backpackers
reviewtext: Very different from the typical hostels in London, much more of a homey, welcoming environment. Fantastic location, literally two minutes walk from Earls Court station and plenty of shops, banks and pubs. Have a huge kitchen so you can cook your own food and you also get your own locker with plenty of room to fit a backpack or suit case and you get your own safe which you can set your own code. Staff are incredibly friendly and helpful and make you feel welcome straight away

name: Destinations at The Rose & Crown
reviewtext: Great free breakfast and the staff were very nice. No common areas or hostel specific events (pub crawl, game night, etc.) so theres no real easy way to meet other people. Was a short walk to the tube if you wanted to see other parts of London but was a short walk to other restaurants and bars. Flat Iron Square was awesome and really close by. Had USB outlets which was helpful if you didn't have a charger that converted to the right outlet.

name: Destinations at The Rose & Crown
reviewtext: Good hostel for 1 night, right next to London tower and London eye for a good walk around the city center. The stuff didn't know much about what to do in the city, but the breakfast was amazing

name: Destinations at The Rose & Crown
reviewtext: Nice location near the borough market, London bridge station, and the iron square. Bathrooms and rooms appear to be newly renovated.

name: Destinations at The Rose & Crown
reviewtext: Highly recommend! I wish I stayed here the entire time I was in London. A great location--five minute walk to Borough Market, tube stations, great sights. The atmosphere is great and the free breakfast was a nice touch. Not a party hostel but still social and easy to meet people.

name: Destinations at The Rose & Crown
reviewtext: If you are a budget traveller like me this is your spot! We had a private room for 2 nights and it was great and I have stayed at other hostels in different countries. For a private room you get a double bed, kettle, filtered water, tea, TV with on demand movies and shows, and large closet. It was a quiet stay rarely bumped into other people but you are right across from an outdoor food and drinks park, lots of food, drinks, people, and live music. You're a 6 minute walk from Borough Market too!

name: Destinations at The Rose & Crown
reviewtext: Favourite hostel so far. Good location and good outdoor area. Would recommend

name: Destinations at The Rose & Crown
reviewtext: Excellent stay, wonderful roommates, would book again and recommend to all!

name: Destinations at The Rose & Crown
reviewtext: First hostel of my trip and it was really nice! Felt super safe and everything was clean!

name: Destinations at The Rose & Crown
reviewtext: Traveled here with a friend and had a very great stay. Staff was super nice and the hostel was an easy walking distance to rental bikes, tube stations, the bridge, etc. Breakfast wasn't awesome but it was ok. It had cereal, bread, coffee, tea, juice, etc. The bar area downstairs has a pool table and darts with plenty of seating. Also just across the street from other pub options. However, even with all this going on downstairs the room was quiet. Each bed had privacy curtains. Check in was easy.

name: Destinations at The Rose & Crown
reviewtext: Very clean, comfortable, and good location. The staff was so friendly and helpful! I had decided to leave a day early- simply for my own schedule, not anything to do with the hostel! - they gave me money back for that day even though they absolutely did NOT have to.  Loved having the pub downstairs to hang out in, and found the entire place cozy. Thank you so much!

name: Destinations at The Rose & Crown
reviewtext: 1st trip to London and we were very happy with our experience. Very close to the London Bridge station. Close to the Borough Market and Flat Iron Square. Very friendly staff. The free breakfast was a nice touch, not extravagant but enough for us. Would stay again.

name: Destinations at The Rose & Crown
reviewtext:
Stayed for a couple of nights to see one of my favourite bands. Place was tidy, the room had everything I needed, they did a decent breakfast, they are ideally located and no complaints at all.
They even sell Trooper beer! ðŸ»ðŸ˜

name: Destinations at The Rose & Crown
reviewtext: It was a little strange getting there because there is no official check in area. You need to go to the actual bar to check in but aside from that my entire stay was great. Staff was incredibly friendly, rooms and bathrooms were clean, hostel was safe and the environment was alive! Also, just so everyone knows, I'm a woman and this was my first solo travel using a hostel for my stay and I felt very at ease. Overall, awesome experience!!

name: Destinations at The Rose & Crown
reviewtext: Loved the place. Friendly staff, great selection for breakfast and great location (about 3 tube stops located near you). Would definitely stay here again!

name: Destinations at The Rose & Crown
reviewtext: Great location and nice staff! Clean, nice usb charging station by the bed and lockable storage space. GREAT free breakfast, as well as free coffee and tea in the room. Overall pretty good experience!

name: Destinations at The Rose & Crown
reviewtext: Fantastic hostel in the heart of London. Rooms were quite hot but beds were comfortable, atmosphere was good and facilities amazing with computer, fridge and TV in room

name: Destinations at The Rose & Crown
reviewtext: Very poor hostel vibe; feels more like a bar with a hotel above it where you share rooms with other patrons.

name: Destinations at The Rose & Crown
reviewtext: Destinations at the Rose and Crown was our first hostel and we were not disappointed! The rooms were clean and the showers were very good! The breakfast provided was more extravagant than the ones we would usually eat at home, and the location was great, within walking distance of multiple train stations. We had already booked a different hostel in London before arriving but we are definitely missing this one!!

name: Destinations at The Rose & Crown
reviewtext: Dorms are on the second level above the bar, hence at night time it can be loud and hard to sleep, especially if the windows are opened for ventilation. There's no aircon so can get warm in summer.  It's a small hostel and had a quiet atmosphere during the time I stayed, not very sociable but I did meet some cool people from other countries. Bunk beds are comfortable and sturdy, each has its own curtains, light and charger outlet. Small storage with lock under bed for each person.

name: Destinations at The Rose & Crown
reviewtext: Lo Ãºnico que no me gustÃ³ fue que durante la noche (a partir de las 11 aproximadamente) no habÃ­a seguridad ni persona alguna del hostel. Contabas con un cÃ³digo para ingresar al hostel, por lo que sÃ­ por alguna razÃ³n olvidabas la clave o perdÃ­as el papel, no habÃ­a forma de ingresar.

name: Destinations at The Rose & Crown
reviewtext: Out of the 3 hostels I stayed at in London, this was by far my favorite! Fabulous location, plenty of restaurants and coffee shops close by, also very close to Borough Market and bus/train lines. Rooms and bathrooms were clean. Sturdy bunks with curtains. TV, computer, and mini fridge in the room with coffee and tea provided. Breakfast is included every AM. Cool pub downstairs. I stayed during Mon-Tue so it was pretty quiet. I'm sure it's a fun atmosphere during the later part of the week/end.

name: Destinations at The Rose & Crown
reviewtext: Great location! Between 2 tube stations - Southwark and London Bridge. Staff were great! Arrived on a super busy night (World Cup!) - Owner was super friendly! Beds were good with privacy curtain. It can be loud if you're facing toward the street, but I didn't have a problem with it and sound died down after midnight. Was a bit warm in the room, again out of their control! They do have fans. Would definitely stay here again!

name: Destinations at The Rose & Crown
reviewtext: Love staying here! The beds are super comfy, they offer privacy curtains, there are multiple USB and power ports on every bed with access to a reading light also. There is security lockers under the bed where you can lock your stuff away (BYO lock as per usual). The hostel is one of the better-located hostels I've stayed in in London; being about a 10-minute walk to Borough markets and beyond. There are multiple train/underground stations nearby too! Nice big showers and great breakfast options

name: Destinations at The Rose & Crown
reviewtext: I really enjoyed my stay here! I always felt safe, the people were nice, facilities were clean, and the location is awesome! Only about a three minute walk to borough market. I would recommend this place to anyone.

name: Destinations at The Rose & Crown
reviewtext: Honestly the only complaints I could think of were about my roommates, and their personalities aren't the hostel's fault. Great location, great atmosphere, things were clean and security was tight. 10/10 would stay again.

name: Destinations at The Rose & Crown
reviewtext: The Rose & Crown was perfect! It was cozy and clean, with a welcoming and warm atmosphere. Easy walking to tube station and the best parts of London. It would be a good environment for families for sure. If you are looking for a party hostel, this is not it, even though it is above a pub. It is calm and quiet. However, we had a wonderful stay and found plenty of fun in London. We definitely hope to be back!

name: Destinations at The Rose & Crown
reviewtext: Clean, comfortable with great facilities.

name: Destinations at The Rose & Crown
reviewtext: The place is very dirty me and one of my friends went out to the little terrace that they have and as I was sitting down in one of the couches my friend saw a huge rat that was right next to where I was sitting. Not only that happened, the curtains in the shower smelled horrible, they do not clean them. The cleaning lady was rude, she would come in the room in the morning not caring if there's people inside. We had a fridge in the room that also smelled horrible.

name: Destinations at The Rose & Crown
reviewtext: The Rose and Crown is a great hostel choice if you're looking for clean, reasonably priced accommodation in a great location. The hostel is just a few minutes walk away from Borough Market and the London Bridge underground station - definitely one of it's best points. If you're looking for a hostel where it's easy to meet other travelers, perhaps this isn't the best spot for you as the only 'lounge' area is the pub downstairs. All the same, the pub is a nice place to have a couple drinks.

name: Destinations at The Rose & Crown
reviewtext: Great location. Great atmosphere. Met amazing people. Would recommend.

name: Destinations at The Rose & Crown
reviewtext: It was okay.Room was super hot in start of July so that sucked.There's only 2toilets and 2showers for the whole hostel.Great location as it's close to the tube and in a super cool area.Wifi was good and there was a useful mini fridge.If you're not looking for a fancy place it's a good place to sleep at night.Staff are working at the pub downstairs so don't expect much interaction with them.Only 1flight of stairs! No keycards had to use 3 annoying codes for 3 doors. Lots of space for bags in room

name: Destinations at The Rose & Crown
reviewtext:
Excellent location, friendly staff, good atmosphere. Make sure to check out Borough Market, which is very close. I was here during the FIFA World Cup, which was quite an experience!

It's a bit small, and can definitely get a bit warm in the summer, but that's England for you. There's a small fridge in the room (handy.)
Make sure you leave your stuff in a locked footlocker. London is an amazing place, but hostels (ALL hostels, not this one in particular) occasionally have problems with thieves.

name: Destinations at The Rose & Crown
reviewtext:
I really enjoyed this hostel and the staff were very accommodating. I booked the private room with the double bed.
Pros: the hostel itself is very nice and generally quiet.
-staff are very welcoming
-facilities seemed to be cleaned on a daily basis.
-wifi is super fast
-bed was comfy and the sheets were clean.

Cons: the only con I have is that the private room was facing the street and so was very noisy with trucks early in the morning. Windows were paper thin.

name: Destinations at The Rose & Crown
reviewtext: Really loved the stay here!! Would highly recommend, plus it was very close to everything

name: Destinations at The Rose & Crown
reviewtext: The staff here were very friendly! The room had a mini fridge, computer and cable. Each bed had a privacy curtain and there was also a kettle with tea and coffee for each person. I felt very safe with my kids here. Even though we were on top of a pub, we had to use an access code to get to the stairs going up and codes for our rooms. Only drawback was water in our room had mold and showers needed more ventilation

name: Destinations at The Rose & Crown
reviewtext: Great place to stay! The staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and so were the toilets/showers. The hostel was within walking distances to most places, including the London Eye so the location was great! There was a discount on food but not alcohol at the pub, but still it was nice to come back and have a drink and not have to leave to walk home. Overall a great place!

name: Park Villa
reviewtext: One of the nicest hostels in London. Will recommend 100%.

name: Park Villa
reviewtext:
This wonderful hostel is very close to the main attractions of the city. It has very convenient connections with several tube and bus lines.
The staff was super friendly and helpful. The rooms are spacious and clean.
Can definitely recommend this hostel to everyone!

name: Park Villa
reviewtext: I always love staying at this hostel! The people are friendly, the facilities are clean, and there is public transit close by. I highly recommend for solo female travelers!

name: Park Villa
reviewtext: This is my second stay at this hostel, my first being back in 2015. It was perfect then, and it's perfect now. Only now I see certificates and awards in the reception area for being such a great hostel. You would be silly not to make a reservation here.

name: Park Villa
reviewtext: I had a great time at this hostel and can't wait to go back when I spend time in London. I would highly recommend staying here!

name: Park Villa
reviewtext: Don't generally leave reviews but this was a great place to stay for a couple of days. Chilled out, quiet and peaceful place with good facilities. The staff is friendly; Nathan was very kind. Wonderful place if you want to actually sleep and relax.

name: Park Villa
reviewtext: Very helpful staff, very cool hostel that attracts a good crowd of people located in a great area. Would highly recommend!

name: Park Villa
reviewtext: The staff were very helpful, pleasant and attentive. They gave me a guided tour of the premises. All facilities including kitchen and lounge were kept very clean and in full working order. The bed was comfortable and there was no loud noise in the dorm vicinity. Very convenient location as I needed to get my early morning coach to Stansted Airport from Stratford. Buses run 24 hours between Mile End and Stratford. I found it a bit costly for a nights stay in Park Villa dorm.

name: Park Villa
reviewtext: Loved every minute of my stay at Park Villa. The staff were very helpful and the other guests were friendly and respectful. Beds were very comfortable and the bathrooms had plenty of hot water and even complimentary soap! The hostel was nice and quiet in a quiet part of London as well. A great tranquil place to get away from the hustle and bustle of busy London. Nice and close to Mile End tube station which has great tube links to central London and all the places you could want to go.

name: Park Villa
reviewtext: Amazing hostel in good location close to the tube station. Not the place you want to stay if you want to party but it was friendly and the beds were comfortable and I loved having the privacy curtain!

name: Park Villa
reviewtext: Really impressed with this hostel. Needed somewhere to stay in between moving house whilst working long hours in a bar and this place was perfect. Curtains on the bed and really comfy beds, plus free ear plugs meant that I could sleep late into the morning and not be disturbed after my shift. Everything super clean, staff cannot do enough for you and facilities on point. Ideal location for night tube into central.

name: Park Villa
reviewtext: I was in London for two days and needed a cheap hostel to stay for a night. I managed to find this hostel via the website as ideally, I wanted to stay fairly central. Luckily, I booked a bed (shared dorm of eight) only an hour before making my way to the hostel and it was very easy to locate (it is only a five-minute walk from Mile End Tube Station.) I was welcomed by a very friendly member of staff that talked me through all the services and took me to my dorm.

name: Park Villa
reviewtext: A great hostel! Exceptionally clean and tidy, free tea and coffee, and approachable staff. This is a super team!

name: Park Villa
reviewtext:
Really good experience, I would like to draw attention to the staff who were brilliant, very welcoming.

Rooms and amenities were spotless and a good offering for breakfast.

Thank you very much.

name: Park Villa
reviewtext: Great hostel! Amazing staff, great environment and installations. Great beds and overall cleanness. Located in Mile End, excellent transports.

name: Park Villa
reviewtext: Nathan was the best host. He was very informative and helpful on local eateries and sights. Felt right at home soon as I walked in. Definitely coming back here on my next trip to London

name: Park Villa
reviewtext: Beautiful hostel, helpful and friendly staff!

name: Park Villa
reviewtext: Clean, comfortable and friendly! Consistently meets my expectations - I have stayed with them a number of times over the last 3-4 years.

name: Park Villa
reviewtext: Always a good stay here such a clean and friendly hostel with good facilities and great location

name: Park Villa
reviewtext: The best hostel I've ever been!

name: Park Villa
reviewtext: Great place! I stayed 15 nights there and I would have stay longer. New, clean, great staff, free Netflix, free prints, free locks...

name: Park Villa
reviewtext: I arrived a little late and it felt a little sketchy walking from the underground. But it's not far and feels loads safer to cross to the other side right outside the station. Otherwise, the whole experience was WONDERFUL! I was here during the "heat wave of 2018", and while other places had been unprepared for the heat, I was surprised and sooooo grateful that they had our room stocked with TWO oscillating stand fans, and personal bed fans! I love the bedside tables and the privacy curtains!

name: Park Villa
reviewtext: Easily one of the best hostels I've stayed in. Lots of free stuff, nice and helpful staff. Clean rooms, loved the en-suite shower/WC, and the curtains around the bed gave enough privacy. One criticism though, the boxes around the charging station over each bed may look cute but are a bit of a safety hazard, as you can potentially injure yourself on them while sleeping.

name: Park Villa
reviewtext: Clean and comfortable place to stay that's not too far out of the way. Beds were extremely comfortable and rooms spacious.

name: Park Villa
reviewtext: I loved my stay at Park Villa Hostel! It was a little ways out of city center, but it was very easy to make your way to all of the major tourist areas of London. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. The room was clean and the bed was the most comfortable hostel bed I have ever slept in. I especially loved all of the free items you could borrow from the front desk, the best of which was the bed fan. I was very comfortable staying at Park Villa and would recommend it to anyone!

name: Park Villa
reviewtext:
Great tube links. Ideal location for our trip to a gig at The London stadium.
Some great places to eat locally.
Accommodation was basic but more importantly clean, safe and secure with a lot of extra bits that you would expect to pay for included, such as padlocks, ear plugs and tea/coffee making facilities.
Our whole group were very impressed!

name: Park Villa
reviewtext: Excellent staff, great atmosphere. Everything is well organised and thought out but there are a couple a minor issues. A lot of the interior looks a bit tired and some parts look like they need a really thorough clean. The only other negative is that the blinds in the rooms were rubbish. Let so much light in that we were awake at 5.30am! Needs some proper curtains. Hard to stay mad with the brilliant staff who try their hardest to look after you.

name: St Christopher's Inn - Liverpool Street
reviewtext: Nice, small hostel with friendly staff in a great part of London. Would use again

name: St Christopher's Inn - Liverpool Street
reviewtext:
The hostel had lovely, helpful staff. Restrooms and showers were clean and comfortable. The beds were very comfortable, especially the thick, soft blankets.
I thought I would like it being above a pub but it was so busy that it was challenging to hang out there. I didn't find it to House an environment of socialization for the folks staying in the hostel, though. Overall, a nice place to stay but not for the money spent.

name: St Christopher's Inn - Liverpool Street
reviewtext: Great hostel! LOVED that the beds had curtains, made every bed feel like a private room. The containers under each bed were large, and felt secure when locked. The individual showers and individual toilets with sinks were also quite nice. The shower curtains could have been cleaned more frequently, but other than that it was very clean. Breakfast is included if you book directly (not through hostelworld). It's yogurt, toast, cereal, butter, etc.

name: St Christopher's Inn - Liverpool Street
reviewtext: Great hostel. I stayed at several along my trip abroad and this was the best.

name: St Christopher's Inn - Liverpool Street
reviewtext: Really nice location. Friendly staff & quite clean. Gets a bit loud at night from people at the pub downstairs when they're outside, but wasn't a problem for me. Would stay again.

name: St Christopher's Inn - Liverpool Street
reviewtext: No elevator so if you have a larg bag, I'd see if you could stay on the lower floors. I enjoyed my stay it was only my second stay in a hostel. Everything went well and staff were great and friendly, great location, easy walk to locations, tube, pubs or something to eat at a restaurant. I would recommend this hostel and would stay again.

name: St Christopher's Inn - Liverpool Street
reviewtext: Decent location. Prices for food were a little expensive around the area. The hostel promotes 25% off food at the bar downstairs, but the kitchen was closed every time we wanted to get food. The rooms were dirty with dust and hair and the air conditioner leaked.

name: St Christopher's Inn - Liverpool Street
reviewtext: Clean and neat, nice staff, facilities are well designed, but I only stay for a night, haven't explored everything

name: St Christopher's Inn - Liverpool Street
reviewtext: Fun place. Bar closes early. Food is limited. Clean and nice staff.

name: St Christopher's Inn - Liverpool Street
reviewtext: Very close to the Liverpool station! The area seems safe. There is a park nearby to enjoy lunch outside. Mainly business workers all around the area. Very modern part of town. Beds and showers were clean! I liked the place the only thing was construction going on outside and you could hear it in the morning. I went to bed early though so I didn't mind having to wake up early.

name: St Christopher's Inn - Liverpool Street
reviewtext: Facilities are fairly new and well maintained. Beds have privacy curtains, which I really like, with USB-A power plugs and lamp. The downside are they have very narrow hallways and staircases, cramped shower area, and  the worst part is they don't have a lift! So goodluck to guests that'll bring huge and heavy suitcases! But overall, it's an okay hostel.  Not gonna stay here again though.

name: St Christopher's Inn - Liverpool Street
reviewtext: Brilliant, clean and safe!!! Usually I try to stay in places with female dorms but this time I went mixed and I still felt safe. The showers and toilets were the best and cleanest I have ever seen in a hostel. Highly recommend this particular one and its chains if they are the same

name: St Christopher's Inn - Liverpool Street
reviewtext:
Pros: the location. quite easy to get to from King's Cross or Heathrow. Bus 214 goes from KC to almost right to the hostel. The staff are nice. The beds are fairly comfortable and come with privacy curtains. 
Cons: 
The rooms are not equal so if you book a 4 bed, request rm 32. There is no elevator and there are a lot steep stairs. The staff do not communicate changes and I think they overbook intentionally, because my 3 mo old res got messed up. 
To be fair, they did fix it nicely tho.

name: St Christopher's Inn - Liverpool Street
reviewtext:
Good stuff: great location next to Liverpool Street Station. It was perfect for us since we needed to take a bus really early in the morning. Staff was helpful and attentive.
Bad stuff: the shower was really dirty and I felt it was expensive.

name: St Christopher's Inn - Liverpool Street
reviewtext: The location is very central while in a quite neighborhood. It's in 15mins walk distance to St Paul's Cathedral and  more mins to London Bridge. Everyone has a bed curtain with a panel of light and sockets. I went there to apply for visa and it's under 5 mins walk to VFS Global. I'd like to stay there again if I visit London.

name: St Christopher's Greenwich
reviewtext: The floors are a little squeaky and that's the ONLY drawback to this place! Cheap food (with an added discount!) The staff is incredible (especially Mya!) and they have events on every night of the week so this is definitely the place to be in Greenwich!

name: St Christopher's Greenwich
reviewtext: chill out room could be better;)

name: St Christopher's Greenwich
reviewtext: The staff was very friendly and helpful, bathrooms and rooms were very clean and I had an awesome time in the bar!

name: St Christopher's Greenwich
reviewtext: I really enjoyed my stay in Greenwich a very nice place to stay. The hostel was very clean, bathrooms maintained and the staff were very helpful especially Kinga and Sophie in reception, helped making checking in a breeze.

name: St Christopher's Greenwich
reviewtext: The music from the "pub" was blasting until 2:30am. The facilities were gross! There were 2 toilets and 2 showers for about 30 beds. I was there 3 days and the toilets smelled like urine the whole time. At one point one stall had no toilet paper. When I came back someone did put a roll in but left if on top of the  feminine napkin trash cans it never made it into the toilet paper holder. Upon arrival they gave me an already occupied bed. I've travelled all over Europe this is the grossest one.

name: St Christopher's Greenwich
reviewtext: Website had told us 8 left in an 8 specific 8 bed dorm so we booked all 8 (for seven of us). We arrive and they tell us we are split (4 & 4). I ask for a refund for 1 and fair enough, they said no. However, as we return from our nightout, our booked bed in one of the rooms had been taken. Due to there now being someone booked in our bed, the next morning I asked for a refund and they declined, even though they had booked someone in the bed. They knew we had seven and knew that bed was free. ðŸ‘ŽðŸ»

name: St Christopher's Greenwich
reviewtext: A group of 5 of us got a room for under Â£30/night each with a bar downstairs, a lovely cafe across the road and close to train and tube station. What's not to like?

name: St Christopher's Greenwich
reviewtext: Ungodly hot in the room at night. Bar was nice and short walk to nice little area and right beside the train station so pretty good access. The bar was ok.

name: St Christopher's Greenwich
reviewtext: Very dirty, staff are un friendly, far away from London and feral area!

name: St Christopher's Greenwich
reviewtext: This place was great and the area is also pretty cool. The only problem is that it is far from the city and you need to take a few different lines to get to the city centre. Breakfast was decent, atmosphere at night is fun but it is too bad they close early on weekdays. The staff is great and helpful and I would def return. The only negative is that there is no aircon in the Hostel rooms and it is quite hot at night. In the bar and chill out room there is aircon.

name: St Christopher's Greenwich
reviewtext: Absolutely loved this hostel! Had the best time and met so many people, definitely coming back! The stuff were super friendly and welcoming. Saturday night the bar offered free drinks for everyone staying at the hostel, the atmosphere at this hostel was amazing. The only downside to this hostel is the kitchen facilities, which was very basic consisting of a microwave and kettle. It also smelt a little funny downstairs in the chill out room. Overall definitely coming back!

name: St Christopher's Greenwich
reviewtext: Ridiculously, unbearably hot.  I had to leave because it was impossible to sleep.

name: St Christopher's Greenwich
reviewtext: A little out of the way and rooms need another fan but otherwise great. Good atmosphere at the bar below, small kitchen area downstairs. Friendly staff!

name: St Christopher's Greenwich
reviewtext: Location is slightly far, but okay if you wanna go to GMT location for sightseeing. Security is okay. Staffs are mostly indifferent, but the German girl (the blonde one) was trying to be more helpful and I appreciate that. The common room is a small airless and windowless room in the basement which is hardly comfy. Windows opened you can feel the vibration and sound of the vehicles passing which makes you wonder whats the difference between you and the hobo out there. Weekends are terribly loud.

name: St Christopher's Greenwich
reviewtext: Everyone was super nice, chill staff, but location is far from downtown London and involves significant changeovers - from tube to light rail and lots of walking in between. I had a morning flight and public transit didn't start early enough to get me there on time, so I had to check out before midnight to get to the airport, and didn't get my money back for that night (spent fitfully in the airport). It is what it is, but the description about ease of transport was VERY misleading.

name: St Christopher's Greenwich
reviewtext: We visited during one of the hottest times of the summer, however the room was inhumanely hot and I didn't sleep the whole time I was there (which kind of diffeats the purpose of staying at a hostel). Half of the time the toilets wouldn't flush. The first time I showered the water was cold and it kept going in and out. There would be water with no water pressure then no water at all. The second time I took a shower, the water heater was broken so the water was cold. The hostel was fun though.

name: St Christopher's Greenwich
reviewtext: Great hostel! St Christopher's Greenwich was a really fun hostel to stay at and we met some really cool people. It was a really hot in London and was a little hot in the rooms at night, but I'm sure with the normal weather it would be totally fine. The staff was helpful and very friendly. Maya was awesome! She helped us out a lot with recommendations and how to get around to places. Get an oyster card to use the tube nearby. Overall, SC Greenwich was a great place to stay!

name: St Christopher's Greenwich
reviewtext: Great hostel. Great staff and good value for money, but air conditioning must be installed in all rooms for future recommendation.

name: St Christopher's Greenwich
reviewtext: Right by the DLR line and offers breakfast.  The privacy curtains are great.  The bar can be a bit loud but the staff are great and the facilities are regularly cleaned.

name: St Christopher's Greenwich
reviewtext:
Great hostel with minimum complaints. My only issues are that 1) you can book an all female/male room, but all bathrooms are gender neutral - so guaranteed you will sit/step in urine at some point 2) there's only one washing machine (but it is free) 3) it becomes a club on weekends, so it is extremely loud in the rooms when you're trying to sleep. 
The staff are great though, and it's right next to the train station so you get the convenience of central London without the noise nor the cost.

name: London Waterloo Hostel
reviewtext: Hostel was in a good location, cleaned daily. What I didnt like was triple bed (it was a nighmare to climb that uncomfortable ladder at night)!, and absence of lockers in the rooms. Breakfast was a nice extra. Showers were okay and clean, but maybe there could be more bathroom facilities on the floor (long waiting time sometimes).

name: London Waterloo Hostel
reviewtext: The most horrible hostel I ever stayed... An outfit got stolen from my bed during the day time. Asked the front desk and he was just careless. Bathrooms so grossed. Beds uncomfortable. Good luck if u decided to stay here!

name: London Waterloo Hostel
reviewtext: Compared to other hostels I've stayed at in Europe, this one was pretty mediocre in terms of facilities. Amazing location and decent price made up for that though. Bed was clean and already made. It was a triple bunk bed which made me feel a little claustrophobic... Free toast and jam/butter was nice in the morning. The people working the front desk were friendly. Bathrooms were a little dingy. No lockers in room, just downstairs. Overall, I would stay here again for the location and the cost.

name: London Waterloo Hostel
reviewtext: Exactly what was expected. Price was great for those just looking for a convenient locations and a bed to sleep in. Breakfast was toast and cereal, towels provided on the front desk, bathrooms cleaned and maintained frequently. What more could you ask for?

name: London Waterloo Hostel
reviewtext: Very nice stay with this hostel. Good facilities and good food. Perfect location.

name: London Waterloo Hostel
reviewtext: This hostel was decent. They do have free breakfast, but don't expect much (Toast and Cereal). Also beware that in the large rooms, the beds are triple-deckers, so you might get stuck on the top of that. Each bed has two plugs and two USBs. Also, the hostel is in a great location, and is very clean.

name: London Waterloo Hostel
reviewtext: Not a bad hostel, staff are friendly people are friendly. Beds where comfy

name: London Waterloo Hostel
reviewtext:
The beds were comfortable - lights and outlets are provided by each bed. Breakfast was an average hostel breakfast with bread/spreads, coffee, and cereal/milk.

There were only two toilets/showers on our floor. With our room that could hold 15 people plus the other rooms on the floor, this was not enough. The showers could be cleaner but were tolerable.

The staff was very hit/miss. The man who checked us in was not friendly or helpful and gave us a bad impression of the hostel.

name: London Waterloo Hostel
reviewtext: Fantastic Hostel. Great location, great staff, good kitchen. I can't think of any negatives about this stay. In fact, I ended up staying an extra three days for the convenience. Solid Wi-Fi, outlets bedside and a few good things for breakfast.

name: London Waterloo Hostel
reviewtext: At first the stay was horrible because London was just too hot and the room only had a window blowing in more hot air! Then someone started smoking in the room! I'm glad I spoke to Marris or Morris at reception he was super helpful with helping us investigate the smoke smell and moved us immediately to a new room. I understand London in general has never received such hot weather so it's understandable their was no A/C in the room. Would book again maybe on less hot days.

name: London Waterloo Hostel
reviewtext:
Staff at the hostel were friendly & welcoming. The kitchen was equipped with a double hob, kettle, fridges & freezers. The bed was comfortable though it was not possible to sit upright on it as I was in a 3 bunk dorm. Free towels were provided at reception & the showers/toilets were enough to accommodate the number of guests on each level. Cleaning was daily.
Good location for central London, near to Lambeth North tube station.
I would stay here again.

name: London Waterloo Hostel
reviewtext: You get what you pay for. The staff was okay, there was not much of a social atmosphere. My floor had at least 5 rooms and only 2 showers and one toilet...not sure how busy it can get, but I could imagine that this could cause dissatisfaction. The location is pretty busy with a community house at the end of the street, that had a party hence it was pretty loud at night.

name: London Waterloo Hostel
reviewtext: Good hostel, not the most comfortable (rooms are very hot during summer, you may have to queue for the bathroom, ...) but has everything you need from a hostel. Would stay again. If you are looking for extra comfort this may not be your best option

name: London Waterloo Hostel
reviewtext: Muy cerca de London eye, el desayuno es rico y el staff amable.

name: London Waterloo Hostel
reviewtext: Rooms hot. Filthy bathrooms. One toilet between 5 rooms which was broken and the sink didn't drain. Worst hostel I've stayed in in 4 months. Stay away! Would not go back!!

name: London Waterloo Hostel
reviewtext: Excellent location wirh excellent staff! I was travelling with an injury and staff went above and beyond to assist me. Excellent location and facilities cover all the basic needs. Yes the property is not super shiny modern, but it is good value and clean with excellent staff. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay and will be back. THANK YOU!

name: London Waterloo Hostel
reviewtext: The staff is amazing. Very kind and helpfull. The atmosfere is really friendly. The stairs re really dirty. Beds re full of dust and the floors were dirty too. Windows should be cleaned too. You should pay more attention to the cleaning in general. Also the light in my bed is broken. I turned it on and i thought it would explode. Once again i would like to thank the reception for being so kind.

name: London Waterloo Hostel
reviewtext: Nice place to stay at. The rooms are quite big but the bunk beds are not that spacious, although, they do have a lamp, 2 charging ports and 2 outlets. The toilets and showers are cleaned regularly and are better than most hostels. Has a nice area downstairs for watching TV and eating food. They also have a pretty great luggage storage policy that saved me a lot of hassle and the staff are extremely helpful. The locations is not the best, but you can easily take a bus to the city center.

name: London Waterloo Hostel
reviewtext: Overall good experience, good location close to Westminster and the rooms are okay

name: London Waterloo Hostel
reviewtext: It was very nice because it's near from center.very well.thank you

name: London Waterloo Hostel
reviewtext: This hostel is exactly what I want from a hostel. It was cheap, had a great location, but be warned it is a true hostel in that it is not a soft cushy environment. It is meant for travelers on the cheap and is a little rough around the edges, but for a college student with a tight budget, it was perfect.

name: London Waterloo Hostel
reviewtext: While the location was great, I would not advise staying here if you want to meet others traveling. Great value for your money but a weird vibe.

name: London Waterloo Hostel
reviewtext: The location is great if you want to stay close to the london eye/big ben area, however, I did find it the surrounding neighborhood kind of sketchy. I definitely felt worried about walking alone at night. The beds are a bit uncomfortable and cleanliness could be better. I don't think I would stay here again to be honest.

name: London Waterloo Hostel
reviewtext: Friendly staff however shower, restrooms, and kitchen were dirty. Shower had accumulated water on tile floor when stepped out and was very, very small. I believe there was only one shower for everyone  Towels were old (thread coming off the ends). Kitchen smelled as well as the rooms. Beds were too small between bunks. I'm 5"7 and could not sit on the bed without being huntched over. Poor experience, I'm not picky however do not stay here.

name: Safestay London Kensington Holland Park
reviewtext: Very nice, spacious hostel in the beautiful Kensington area.

name: Safestay London Kensington Holland Park
reviewtext: Tiny rooms, really noisy. Every door slams, people outside talking/yelling all night and morning. Not enough showers. Average staff, overpriced breakfast. Not able to get a good sleep, a good showers or a good breakfast. Would not recommend.

name: Safestay London Kensington Holland Park
reviewtext: Really nice hostel, good location. Not a lot in the way of facilities, check in staff were rude but process was quick. Not a lot of atmosphere but good for a quiet stay.

name: Safestay London Kensington Holland Park
reviewtext:
The electricity was off all night on our first night, we were told there was problem in the area, but other parts of the hostel had electricity. 

The shower leaked water onto the floor causing water to pool.

Despite the above, the staff were attentive and the location superb.

name: Safestay London Kensington Holland Park
reviewtext:
Overall nice hostel. The curtains around the beds were great for privacy.
A fridge for guest use would be a good addition, even without a kitchen for self catering. Also, a strict lights out quiet time policy would be good as we had several nights when guests came in well after midnight and turned on the dorm lights and woke us up.
Overall we had a great stay and I would recommend this hostel.

name: Safestay London Kensington Holland Park
reviewtext: Absolutely thrilled with our stay. Staff so helpful and accommodating.  Totally excellent experience. Thank you.

name: Safestay London Kensington Holland Park
reviewtext: Stayed in a 9 bed dorm ..room was kind of stuffy .very small space to put in 9 beds ..and the washbasin was clogged .. we were to stay for only one day so it was okay but would not recommend for long

name: Safestay London Kensington Holland Park
reviewtext: Having never stayed in a hostel before, my expectations were low. I was please try surprised by the location and the room we stayed in. However, I had to switch beds because of bug bites on my legs, the staff was accommodating and understanding. I stayed in an all girls room and I felt very safe being there. The bathroom was clean to an extent but I had to ask a few times for the toilet paper rolls to be replaced before it was actually done. Overall I was happy with my stay.

name: Safestay London Kensington Holland Park
reviewtext: The walk back at night was the creepiest walk ever. There are a lot of older middle aged people, no atmosphere. The staff was noisy at nights after their shifts ended but they quieted down after one of the people in my room complained at 1 am. One of the staff ripped me off the first day, charging me 5 pounds for a water bottle. I stayed in a 10 person dorm. For a 10 person dorm, it was clean and bed was comfy. Wifi sucked and location was very far and bad.

name: Safestay London Kensington Holland Park
reviewtext: Impossible to get a good night's sleep on a squeeky 3 story bunk of a 15 person dorm. One bathroom for 15 people?! The rooms smelled weird. The courtyard is nice but there's always tons of noisy children ruining it. For this price there are definitely better hostel options.

name: Safestay London Kensington Holland Park
reviewtext: This hostel is located in Holland Park -- a great part of west London, but as a young woman I did not always feel comfortable walking through the park in the evenings alone to get back to the room. The staff was kind but not always knowledgeable or helpful. I was surprised by the number of older individuals staying at this "youth" hostel, and that added an element of discomfort to the mixed-gender rooms. The bathrooms are clean, but I will stay elsewhere if I return to London.

name: Safestay London Kensington Holland Park
reviewtext: We stayed in a very comfortable private,ensuite room. A kettle was provided which was great. The continental buffet breakfast was basic, but good value. Our only real complaint is that fellow guests socialized throughout the night in the courtyard, directly outside our room, even until 5am.

name: Safestay London Kensington Holland Park
reviewtext: amazing location-loved being in the peaceful park yet close to the city centre

name: Safestay London Kensington Holland Park
reviewtext: Nice place. I have stayed here quite a few times. The curtains around bunks are a very nice touch!

name: Safestay London Kensington Holland Park
reviewtext: I stayed in the 15 bed dorm. Overall happy with the accommodation. Great location, and the bunks had curtains for privacy. There is also a large social area which was nice so if you were staying there for a few days there was somewhere to hang out other than just in your bunk. However there was only 1 bathroom in the dorm which included both the shower and toilet for a 15 bed room which was the only thing I was not happy with.

name: Safestay London Kensington Holland Park
reviewtext: Situated right next to an opera house. Beautiful music until late at night but some may not enjoy this as much as I did!

name: Safestay London Kensington Holland Park
reviewtext:
No drinking water!!! Either pay stupid money for a vending machine or try to fit your bottle under a bathroom tap. Appalling....

(They try to charge stupid amounts extra for everything.)

Staff very slow and not especially helpful.

Cheap and comfortable enough place to crash.

name: Safestay London Kensington Holland Park
reviewtext: Facilities and hostel were great - Atmosphere was very bad. The whole stay there was several influxes of young, loud, annoying children. The staff in the restaurant, not accomodating.

name: Safestay London Kensington Holland Park
reviewtext: One of the best hostels I have ever stayed at. It was newly refurbished and clean. The only downside is that the light attached to each bed is very strong and  penetrates to other beds.

name: Safestay London Kensington Holland Park
reviewtext:
Beautiful location - inside a huge park, a gated compound close to the underground entrance. The park is very peaceful, lots of activities going on inside. The staff are very friendly. 

My partner and I booked together but got placed in separate rooms which was frustrating. The rooms are very small, lots of beds crammed together (three bunks high). I appreciate the curtains around each bunk for sure. The rooms were very loud, very difficult to sleep. You can hear rooms around you making noise

name: Safestay London Kensington Holland Park
reviewtext: Loved staying here! It was in a nice location, the staff was very helpful and the security was great! I would definitely stay here again.

name: Safestay London Kensington Holland Park
reviewtext: By far one of the best hostels I've stayed in for a long time. Great hidden place, lovely garden area and a very comfortable bed to sleep on too.

name: Safestay London Kensington Holland Park
reviewtext: Generally is good ,but the room of 4 beds too bad because the space is very small.l can not sleep because of snoring and fart (bad smell)to some customers

name: Safestay London Kensington Holland Park
reviewtext: Beautiful hostel and gardens in holland park but at night as a solo female traveller it's a bit unnerving walking via the lane way back to the hostel. The 9 bed dorm was very cramped with little room for storage. The lack of kitchen is also an issue too.

name: Safestay London Kensington Holland Park
reviewtext: The best hostel I've ever stayed at.

name: Safestay London Kensington Holland Park
reviewtext: Good value for money, but very little showers and toilets for a whole hallway! Great location close to Holland Park!

name: Safestay London Kensington Holland Park
reviewtext: We had a great stay! Location is beautiful. Bedrooms were quiet, clean and had useful things such as personal bed curtains, outlet, reading light, security locker. There is a Â£2 daily bike hire right next to it. Would like to see some lounging chairs to spend more time outside. Breakfast closed too early for me as well (I think 11am would be better). Seemed quite secure but a guest reported their bag was stolen from the main luggage storage and the staff didn't seem to be helpful to them.

name: Safestay London Kensington Holland Park
reviewtext:
It was a great hostel, we had a family room as we had our 3 &5 yr olds with us. We were lucky to have the top room with a roof terrace so the boys had a private space out of the room. The grounds are beautiful and the local park was great. 

We did however have to called reception at 23:40 as the lower rooms were really loud & stamping around. The staff responded neutrally & swiftly. 

We did also unfortunately have neighbouring guests who liked to just let their & the shared bathroom door.

name: Safestay London Kensington Holland Park
reviewtext: Very nice. Beds had individual curtains. Showers and toliets were clean. If the toliet is separated from shower would be alot better, as I stayed in 10 bed ensuite.

name: Safestay London Kensington Holland Park
reviewtext: Good hostel I would definitely stay in again. Downsides were someone was in my bed assigned to me and so I had to go back to the front desk to get a new bed, and it was very difficult to find at night. I had to take the side entrance because the park was closed, and the sign at the side entrance was for Youth Hostel not Safestay. This needs to be updated. Also the directions given to the hostel could be more clear. Just makes for unneeded frustration late at night when you just want to get sleep

name: Safestay London Kensington Holland Park
reviewtext: Really nice place where to pass a couple of night if u just have a bed, lot more whit a private!

name: Safestay London Kensington Holland Park
reviewtext:
Safe stay is in a wonderful location, Holland Park is gorgeous and the area is quite nice, good food to be found. 

My stay was quite lack luster however. Upon arrival I was told that the key card system was not working and I would have to be let in to my room when I would return from outings or having to go to the bathroom. Very inconvenient.

The showers water pressure was non existent, and I kept having to turn it on over and over again. Nice place but I probably won't stay there again.

name: Safestay London Kensington Holland Park
reviewtext: One of the nicer hostels I've stayed in, put myself out there and made some great memories! I loved the atmosphere and it's in a great location surrounded by Holland Park and 10/15 easy walk from South Kensington Underground Station. Clean comfy beds with curtains all around and bathrooms were cleaned regularly - no complains from me :-)

name: Safestay London Kensington Holland Park
reviewtext: Nice place

name: Safestay London Kensington Holland Park
reviewtext: Security is the issue, someone lost her laptop in the storage room,  otherwise everything is good. Saw strange people hanging out in the hostel.

name: Smart Russell Square Hostel
reviewtext: One of the most hilariously terrible hostels I've ever stayed at. I wasn't even mad, I just found it surreal. Cramped, humid and filthy. Three-layered bunk beds made of metal that are arguably dangerous to climb up if you're on the top. Squeezed together in 18 bed rooms. Photos are misleading to say the least. Seems to be a lot of a homeless practically living in these beds as well.

name: Smart Russell Square Hostel
reviewtext: It's ok apart from noise from shower pipes and not very sound proof walls and floors . Apart from that good location friendly staff and clean sheets .

name: Smart Russell Square Hostel
reviewtext: It was a great place to stay for one night and just have a quite evening. Great location, just down from russel square park, but wouldn't stay for more than one or two nights if you're looking for a social atmosphere. Brand new bathroom in my six bed room was very nice to enjoy!!

name: Smart Russell Square Hostel
reviewtext:
Nice and very helpful staff. 
But not easy to talk with the guests like most of the hostels and.
Sometimes guest were even rude and especially inside the little kitchen.

name: Smart Russell Square Hostel
reviewtext: If you're 6ft or over, you won't fit in these beds - I'm 6'1" and had to sleep with my feet outside of the bed just so that I could fit! But apart from that, the place was well located, had a generally friendly atmosphere and powerful (although not always reliable) showers.

name: Smart Russell Square Hostel
reviewtext: They are very organized here! The facilities were great even for 8 people to a room. There are plenty of public bathrooms around if you private one is busy. The location is perfect! I would come back again!

name: Smart Russell Square Hostel
reviewtext: Me and a friend spend one night in this hostel. The location is very good. The room had firmly inlaid carpet which saw already a few years of hostel life, and was thus not the cleanest. The size of the beds were very small. My friend couldn't lie straight (1.85m) on the back and since on both ends of the bed were wall, he couldn't stretch his leg outside either. Thus he had not the best night there and could barely sleep. The breakfast were the minimum you can think of.

name: Smart Russell Square Hostel
reviewtext: Very small, stuffy room. The room gets very hot and smells quite bad. They also charge you Â£2.5 for a towel and Â£1 a night for an small drawer for you're things. Overall, the place was okay but I wont be staying there again.

name: Smart Russell Square Hostel
reviewtext: Great location and value for money, but I would not recommend this hostel. I stayed in a room in the basement which is scary as almost no sunlight reach in the room. Some rooms I walked pass were really smelly. Every tap on sink and shower is like a 2-second running tap and you will have to keep pressing. Cheap price stay for cheapest material possible. It was very hot in summer night with no air con and crowded room too. Invest a little bit more for a better accommodation!

name: Smart Russell Square Hostel
reviewtext:
The room is a little bit smelly, and it seems like the quilt is never cleaned. 
Otherwise great! Convenient.

name: Smart Russell Square Hostel
reviewtext: I went to find a bed, and there were no clean ones. I had to sleep in a bed that was used because they did not get it ready for me, even when I came later than expected. Security lockers were there but you had to pay for them and they were not in the rooms. Very strange environment and felt very cramped. The room was extremely narrow, with only the bed and space for one person to walk, and harder when theres a ton of luggage on the floor. I was only here for one night, so it wasn't the worst.

name: Smart Russell Square Hostel
reviewtext: We stayed here for one night in a room for three with bathroom. The location is great -  the room was clean  with adequate space for bags. Staff are helpful. This is a perfectly reasonable place with good basic facilities to stop off for a short trip or overnight stay. Only downside is that the obviously large number and positioning of bathrooms means that the consequent noise of pipes and fans in the night could be disturbing for light sleepers.

name: Smart Russell Square Hostel
reviewtext:
Close to the tube, but not much else. Good cleanliness of rooms and common areas.
One shower/toilet for a 12 bed dorm so too bad if you want to use the lavatory whilst someone else is showering.
Reasonably priced for what you get. I'd stay again!

name: Smart Russell Square Hostel
reviewtext:
I went to check in at 2.pm on the 24/7/18. I was unable to check in due to a computer fault. 
As I would be returning to the hostel at around 3 am after work I asked to see my room so I could familiarise myself with the facilities and layout so as not to disturb other guests and I would know where I was going in case no receptionist available at 3am.  I was told this was not possible as there were no staff to escort me to the room. I did not return .

name: Smart Russell Square Hostel
reviewtext: I stayed during summer and the female dorm was very hot and stuffy, made it difficult to sleep. Rooms and shared bathroom were small. Each bunk had a curtain for privacy. Atmosphere was good depending on who's in the dorm. Good location near the station, easy to get to. Big lounge/ dining area.

name: Smart Russell Square Hostel
reviewtext: The bedrooms which had nine bunks in them were very overcrowded and extremely hot an uncomfortable with only one fan . Totally unacceptable. It was awful . The bunks were three high !!! You have to be kidding me

name: Smart Russell Square Hostel
reviewtext: The rooms can get a bit crowded and ther is no much room for your lugagge but other than that, great experiemce

name: Smart Russell Square Hostel
reviewtext:
Hostel is pretty old and the staff is not helpfull at all. Shared rooms are to small and really dirty! The ensuit dorm has even a smaller bathroom: when you take a shower the whole bathroom gets wet. The worst part was that was a hot night and they don't have any kind of air conditioning.

The hostel has many floors and they don't have a lift, so you have to carry on your bags through a narrow stair.

name: Smart Russell Square Hostel
reviewtext: The stay was pretty good but I had cancelled 2 of my beds through emailing the hostel but they hadn't communicated this to the website so I was still charged for the extra deposits. The staff went that helpful and told me to just contact the website to sort it out

name: Smart Russell Square Hostel
reviewtext: The location is great and the place is very clean with enough toilet facilities that you don't have to wait. Though like a lot of hostels the staff look like they'd rather be anywhere else and the breakfast is a miserable cop out of nothing more than toast, cereal and some dirty diah water they labled as 'coffee'. The key card lockers in the room also did not work.

name: Smart Russell Square Hostel
reviewtext: Very nice place to stay, good transport access, only issues were heat, which I can't blame on the hostel and cleanliness of the communal shower block. That being said the ensuite shower was spotless and worked fine.

name: Smart Russell Square Hostel
reviewtext: The staff were rude or at best surly - overall the hostel was fine - clean as it could be but not a lot of atmosphere

name: Smart Russell Square Hostel
reviewtext: Worst stay I've had at a hostel. The bunk beds are crammed into the rooms 3 high. It was so hot on the top level that I literally couldn't sleep and had to go outside for air. Only stayed one night. Got my money back and checked out. No atmosphere whatsoever. Hundreds of people staying here and no place to associate except for a sterile common room where everyone sits at different tables on their phones. Staff don't care. It's just a job to them. Don't stay here

name: Smart Russell Square Hostel
reviewtext: Packed with people. My room was filled with a like of partying 20-somethings. The bed, blanket, and pillow were good with a privacy curtain. The bathroom and showers were clean. There were also a field trip of kids there, which surprised me. They have a key card that also was paired with your in room locker, which was a nice add-on. All in all, it was cheap and what I expected.

name: Smart Russell Square Hostel
reviewtext: The person that checked me in was not very agile and I had little time. I asked for a locker and besides having to pay for it, when I went to the room the locker I was given didn't open with the key, then I was given another one, and it was broken, then I was given another one in a common area and the password was wrong. In the end, I had to leave my stuff in the broken locker and pray nothing happened. Furthermore, the room smelled awful, not enough air flow, bathroom uncomfortable and dirty

name: Smart Russell Square Hostel
reviewtext:
Awesome location, typical hostel experience in the heart of London. In the mixed dorm room the beds are 3 high so it can be a bit of a climb. 
The showers are also incredibly tiny so if you are a taller or larger person it may be hard to shower.  Otherwise it was fine, we really enjoyed our stay.

name: Smart Russell Square Hostel
reviewtext: The bathrooms were absolutely disgusting with the shower temperature not being able to be controlled one shower was scorching i felt it was burning and couldnt shower and then another shower was freezing, worst thing i have ever experienced. Next the room i was in was disgusting it smelt so bad i was gagging the heat was ridiculous i could barely sleep with the heat and the smell. Smelt like a dead animal had been left in the room. Worst hostel ive ever been to

name: Smart Russell Square Hostel
reviewtext: The under bed locker could be opened without a key but there was security on the door at night.

name: Smart Russell Square Hostel
reviewtext:
Great value for money, efficient service and very pleasant staff. Within walking distance to Finsbury and Kings Cross train stations.
Comfy sleep, clean sheets. Bit of a walk to the bathroom down 2 flights of stairs in the middle of the night, but plenty of toilets to choose from once there!

Slightly concerned that I was able to walk into someone else's room using the wrong key and therefor felt we had to take our belongings out to a festival with us. Otherwise, pleasant stay, 10 out of 10.

name: Smart Russell Square Hostel
reviewtext: Bathroom was frustrating to use. All of the shower and sink faucets automatically shut off after just a few seconds, which is annoying. Lots of leftover stuff from previous guests scattered about. Would not stay at again.

name: Smart Russell Square Hostel
reviewtext:
The hostel just has a relatively uncomfortable atmosphere. It's just a place to sleep and not spend time. My room had strange metallic and water flowing sounds all through the night which made it difficult to sleep. The bunks I stayed in were triple bunk beds, and I couldn't sit up to drink water without bumping my head on the bunk above me. 

the staff were kind, and the breakfast was average (muesli, cornflakes, toast, juice and coffee). Though not a big deal, the lighting was really bad.

name: Smart Russell Square Hostel
reviewtext:
Atmosphere was dead, the beds didn't fit me and I'm not overly tall, staff seemed alright to communicate with but didn't seem to have any enthusiasm. 
Facilities are very out dated. Laundry machines from the 70s and showers that facilitate only one being warm at any one time. 
It serves it purpose yet It's not worth saving the extra 10 pounds.

name: Smart Russell Square Hostel
reviewtext: Though they assign you to a room, they don't always assign you to a bed which was problematic because I heard two seperate occasions of people complaining others were in their bed or had moved their stuff. The majority of the people staying were older men which made me feel a bit uncomfortable as a 19 year old female traveling alone. The bathrooms aren't great, you essentially have to be naked in front of a lot of others, and the outlet on my bed was broken which made my trip very hard.

name: Smart Russell Square Hostel
reviewtext: The sheets I received had stains on them and cut outs in them. They were not clean. The bathroom was not cleaned and the room was extremely hot and stuffy. There was only one small window that was cracked for a room of 10 women. I was surprised since this place has good ratings. I wouldn't go back

name: Venture Hostel
reviewtext: Value for money, great location and friendly staff. I would recommend Venture Hostel for everyone who is traveling on a budget or just staying one night in London.

name: Venture Hostel
reviewtext:
I would say, not too bad
I been paid for a week stay and I just paid for a extra week 
There is still a lil bit work to to (toilets, showers and the common room) but could be worst so I definitely recommend

name: Venture Hostel
reviewtext: I had no idea what to expect before I my stay but was pleasantly surprised by everything! It was modern, clean and very secure AND the staff were super friendly ... and the location is perfect! No need to consider any other places for my next visits, I've found my favorite spot.

name: Venture Hostel
reviewtext: The hostel is comfortable and easy going, staff is super nice and rooms are spacious, clean toilets and showers. Would definetely recommend!

name: Venture Hostel
reviewtext:
I stayed here at the last minute because of a cancelled flight. The staff were amazing and the place so friendly and clean. It helped me feel a lot more cheerful in the circumstances. A warm welcome and a very comfortable place to stay
Easy to find as well. Thank you.

name: Venture Hostel
reviewtext: Very comfortable and welcoming hostel, slightly out of town

name: Venture Hostel
reviewtext: The atmosphere is the best of this hostel, lots of fun, in the evening too. The hostel is near a vibrant local market and shops, so real people real life. The little curtain that a person can pull in the bunk bed, it's a nice little added feature for your privacy. The facilities are a bit small, but the big common room helps. Go there and meet the manager he will tell you a good story you will remember.

name: Venture Hostel
reviewtext: I was only there for a night but it was pretty good. Immediately the staff introduced me to the other backpackers. Free beer upon entry. Fairly clean.

name: Venture Hostel
reviewtext: Very friendly and helpful staff

name: St Christopher's Shepherds Bush
reviewtext: Great hostel made my Carnival adventure that much easier

name: St Christopher's Shepherds Bush
reviewtext: Basic facilities..Great value for money if you're only staying for a couple of nights.

name: St Christopher's Shepherds Bush
reviewtext: They treat with a five star service,very friendly.

name: St Christopher's Shepherds Bush
reviewtext:
Honestly the worst hostel I've stayed in. The room smelt really bad, the toilets and showers were disgusting. The towel we hired was grim, there was no hairdryer because it had apparently broken the day before.

Lots of creepy guys, didn't feel safe at all. Would not recommend. The only reason I picked this one was its proximity to Bush Hall but would never go back, would rather travel and stay at previous hostels in London which were miles better.

name: St Christopher's Shepherds Bush
reviewtext:
Staff were great and helpful; It is nice to have a laundry facility that you can use free of charge; The location is not amazing, but it is handy as it is just opposite to a subway station.

Fridge was very small and we couldn't fit our stuff; The room and toilets were not very clean; In the shower area there was no place to hang clothes and towel (very annoying).

name: St Christopher's Shepherds Bush
reviewtext: Great location but small rooms with no air conditioning in the middle of a uk heatwave!

name: St Christopher's Shepherds Bush
reviewtext: The place was filthy, staff was rude, did not feel safe and was afraid someone would either hurt myself or wife and they put us in different rooms. My belongings were attempted to be messed with. It was not a good experience.

name: St Christopher's Shepherds Bush
reviewtext: Really clean, homely lil hostel in a great location. Me and my boyfriend came for a gig at hammersmith Apollo so was perfect distance away. Great stay!

name: The London Home Hostel
