reviewtext:
Scapegoated, assaulted then blamed, as usual.  Sustained damages physically, emotionally, psychologically, financially, as usual.  Temporarily impaired my day to day ability to function, as usual.

Property manager and staff very helpful, patient, understanding and fair.

name: The London Home Hostel
reviewtext: Nice to stay here.

name: Dover Castle Hostel and Bar
reviewtext:
This hostel might not be the prettiest, but the value for money is great.

PROS:
-Super close from a Metro station, and bus stations.
-Breakfast included, cereal and toast plus warm beverages and orange juice.
-The bar has some pretty good promos for guests.

CONS:
-The rooms are not well ventilated, the smell was terrible.
-There was only 3 showers working.
-The wifi never work.

If your planning on spending most of your time in the city and are in a tight budget, I would recommend it.

name: Dover Castle Hostel and Bar
reviewtext: Enjoyed my stay at the hostel. The staff were very helpful, especially Marcis.

name: Dover Castle Hostel and Bar
reviewtext: Definitely a hostel to note: highly convenient location, good facilities, I enjoyed my time there.

name: Dover Castle Hostel and Bar
reviewtext: Being attached to a bar, it was noisy until about 1 am, but that was not unexpected. Aside from that, this hostel was an excellent place to stay. Not only did they have showers and toilets on every floor, they provided free continental breakfast in the pub. The staff were friendly and polite, giving us all the information we needed.  In addition, it was only a block away from the underground.

name: Dover Castle Hostel and Bar
reviewtext: Loved my stay here. Staff was great, and there's a pub attached to the hostel, which is clutch. It's nearby an ATM, a deli, and not too far from the London Bridge and Tower of London. They also had outlet converters to rent! Would definitely stay here again. Great experience.

name: Dover Castle Hostel and Bar
reviewtext: The rooms are really warm, and mine smelled of BO. A nice little kitchen though. Not a very social hostel either.

name: Dover Castle Hostel and Bar
reviewtext:
Reasonably priced accommodation in a convenient central location. 
Very basic facilities, limited number of toilets/showers, no lockers in the room, bedrooms are warm with no ventilation and definitely won a spot in the top3 of the most uncomfortable mattresses I've ever slept on

name: Dover Castle Hostel and Bar
reviewtext: Everything was ok but the unusually top floor hot room (it was not even a really hot day) ruined it. You cannot open the windows???

name: Dover Castle Hostel and Bar
reviewtext: i know the closed window gig is for security reasons but on a hot summer day with 7 other people it can get pretty disgusting. felt sick and could hardly breathe - get what you paid for, i guess. i probably just had a bad experience. comfy beds but the sleep was dreadful due to the lack of air. you wake up and people would hog the single fan that couldn't even reach every person anyway and basically did nothing to cool the room down. also. Â£25 to reserve a space? joke.

name: Dover Castle Hostel and Bar
reviewtext: This place is everything a hostel should be.  Friendly and helpful staff, very clean, convenient location close to the underground, and decent common areas.  Rooms are a bit small and don't have lockers or much space for your stuff, but I really have no complaints about this place.  Highly recommend :)

name: Dover Castle Hostel and Bar
reviewtext: Stayed in a cramped 8 bed mixed room for 3 nights. There are no lockers in rooms and poor ventilation in both the rooms and common areas. Showers have a very inconvenient layout so that only 1 person on that floor can shower at a time. Also lots of stairs so if you have heavy luggage, be aware of this. Free breakfast is always a bonus. Wifi is horrible though. It is slow and will cut out all the time. Used eduroam for wifi during our stay as the wifi was not usable.

name: Dover Castle Hostel and Bar
reviewtext: Don't bother with this hostel, just find somewhere else unless you're incredibly non-picky and are on a very tight budget. The whole hostel smells weird. The rooms are about 30 degrees inside with windows that don't open and just a fan which does nearly nothing to help. It was incredibly hard to sleep, nearly unbearable. A lot of the guests are men by themselves aged 30+ so it's not the usual backpacker vibe. Only thing good would be the free breakfast, but even that is very basic and only serve

name: Dover Castle Hostel and Bar
reviewtext:
Great to have such a reasonably priced place to stay in London, including breakfast. Plenty of space in the bedroom- crisp clean bedding. 
If need accommodation in that area again would have no hesitation in staying there.

name: Dover Castle Hostel and Bar
reviewtext: Wouldn't recommend this hostel unless you're quite a tolerant person. Stayed at the top floor and it is very warm in sumer. Facilities are very very basic and not the cleanest. There is a funny smell in the hostel and in the showers especially, which seems to come from the water. If you were to stay here in summer, I would recommend the 6-bed rooms instead of the bigger ones.

name: Dover Castle Hostel and Bar
reviewtext:
L'ambiente Ã¨ accogliente, in generale molto pulito per quanto riguarda le camere e i sanitari (che vengono puliti piÃ¹ volte al giorno su eventuale richiesta). Alla reception sono molto disponibili, peccato per il cattivo odore nelle zone comuni, per non parlare dell'entrata.
In sostanza, consigliato!

name: Dover Castle Hostel and Bar
reviewtext: Awesome place with a dope vibe. The staff is friendly and accommodating. The bar is a great touch. Downside is there's no AC and it can get hot. Also had a bad experience where some random guy fell asleep in our bed and wouldn't move although I asked nicely (when I didn't have to be). When I reported it to the staff they didn't bother to at least tell the guy to move. They simply said "pick another bed" which to me was frustrating. Aside from that the experience was great.

name: Dover Castle Hostel and Bar
reviewtext: It was worst hostel in my traveling life in Europe. The receptionist was so rude. I had to pay for locker everyday one pound. There was no locker in the room. My room was 1st floor. My locker was 3rd floor. I had to go everytime 1st floor to 3rd floor. There was only one toilet in my floor and very small. Ground floor was to noisy because of pub. I didn't sleep all night properly. The location was nice near centre. Free breakfast was not bad. Who serve breakfast everyday morning  they are good.

name: Dover Castle Hostel and Bar
reviewtext:
Security: Nothing missing when leaving items in the bedrooms or the storage room. Seems good and safe enough.

1st Floor: Not great for trying to get to sleep from the bar noise. Other floors are much better for this, just typical traffic noise. 

Washrooms: Toilets and showers are good enough. Probably have to wait at points though

People: Friendly enough staff and amicable roommates. People generally keep to themselves. 

Overall: Worth the money, would use again.

name: Dover Castle Hostel and Bar
reviewtext: The beds were super uncomfortable. You can feel all the wires under neither. There was a severe lack of plugs for charging things. They had two charging holes per 4 beds so only two people could charge things and the other two couldn't. Also the place was in a very old building. Made it feel very dirty and unclean.

name: Dover Castle Hostel and Bar
reviewtext: Location was excellent, 2 min walk to station and 15 min walk to London Bridge. Most staff were friendly and helpful but not all. Facilities were clean but not of great quality eg couldn't adjust shower temperature it was preset and had to keep turning on every 30 seconds. Mattresses were uncomfortable and springy. Beds squeaked at the slightest movement. Reception was always "back in 5 mins" for 30+mins at a time. Poor atmosphere, lots of permanent residents in bed all day, shared kitchen messy

name: Dover Castle Hostel and Bar
reviewtext: Really good.

name: Pickwick Hall
reviewtext: Staff was super friendly. They have a nice continental breakfast and you had usage to the kitchen. Wife and I enjoyed our stay. We got an ensuite. Only downfall was no air circulation in our room, shower is extremely small and water leaked all over the floors not to mention the floor felt wet the entire time ( not in the bathroom, the whole rooms floors).. They did have a fan in the room so that was nice. All and all great little hostel. I would definitely come again.

name: Pickwick Hall
reviewtext:
Booked the twin private room. The good things: decent bed with fridge and sink available in the room. Staff was friendly and location was superb, all highlights of London are within walking distance. 
The bad things: we wanted to help the staff and remove the sheets from the bed and place them on a pile to bring away. Upon doing so, we uncovered the quilt and matress were dirty and torn. Also the carpet was very worn and at places just bare. Breakfast was fine for 2 days but not for long stays.

name: Pickwick Hall
reviewtext: Helpful staff and great location, but poor breakfast and rooms don't seem to be the cleanest.

name: Pickwick Hall
reviewtext: The location is hard to beat, but unless you like finding mushrooms growing in the carpet I wouldn't recommend this hostel. Our room smelled like damp dirt/potatoes and, yes, there were literally 2 mushrooms growing out of the carpet /baseboards.

name: Pickwick Hall
reviewtext: My first choice among hostels in London. Pickwick Hall is clean, comfortable, really well located, and not that expensive.

name: Pickwick Hall
reviewtext: My husband and I enjoyed very much our stay at the Pickwick Hostel. We had a lovely room with a comfortable bed and large window.  The location is great and the staff and facilities very good. I hope to stay there again in the future

name: Pickwick Hall
reviewtext: Super location, room clean & bed comfortable. There's no a/c & it was during a heatwave, so a bit warm at night but the staff helpfully provided a fan, which helped a lot - and this would not be a problem in normal weather. Definitely recommended. I will return.

name: Pickwick Hall
reviewtext: The room was spacious and the bed was fine, but it was so hot in London during my stay that I was pretty miserable. This isn't the hostel's fault as that kind of weather is pretty rare, but something to keep in mind. They did provide a fan on my second night, but this didn't do much to help. The bathroom was a bit dingy but served its purpose. I went down near the end of breakfast and no staff were there, but I did manage to make myself a bowl of cereal.

name: Pickwick Hall
reviewtext:
Overall we had a great stay at Pickwick Hall. It was, however, almost unbearably hot in the room (especially in the bathroom and toilet room) even though they were nice to put up an air fan. The window didn't open much, so we got very little wind from outside. The heatvawes insane temperatures are no fault of the owners though ðŸ˜‰.
The breakfast was fine and location absolutely perfect, right next to the British museum. It was nice and clean. See you next time we're in London ðŸ‘

name: Pickwick Hall
reviewtext: My first stay at Pickwick Hall. But my roommate had been there many times this year!  I can see why. Very nice in every way

name: Pickwick Hall
reviewtext: Everything is in perfect condition.

name: Pickwick Hall
reviewtext: We had a great stay, very kind and friendly staff, a really good environment for my 4 year old.

name: Pickwick Hall
reviewtext:
Pros:
- private rooms
- big common space
- never had to wait for bathroom or shower

Cons:
- one of the showers was broken
- this is only a hostel only in the sense that you share a bathroom.  It's really just a hotel.  Nothing community about it.
- guy who I presumed was the owner was pretty standoffish, definitely didn't feel homey at all

name: Pickwick Hall
reviewtext: Such a wonderful place to stay!! Everyone was so nice, the rooms and facilities were great and the location was perfect! I felt like a local taking the tube short distances around London. PERFECT spot! I'll definitely stay here again!!

name: Pickwick Hall
reviewtext: Mine was a very short stay, but all was good. My only complaint is the check-out process. This is more like a B&B than a hostel and does not have 24/7 staff to check out as you please. Other than that, everything was great!

name: Pickwick Hall
reviewtext: It's a quiet place, well located. I recommend it.

name: Pickwick Hall
reviewtext: Great location,  lovely proprietor,  clean but a wee bit shabby.  Would go back!

name: Pickwick Hall
reviewtext: Perfect location and lovely hosts

name: Pickwick Hall
reviewtext: It was fine for a bed in the city near an underground stop. The outside is not clearly obvious from the street and the room itself was pretty dingy. The wallpaper was literally peeling off because it was so humid and the bathroom didn't have sufficient ventilation so there was mildew. The beds were comfy and they were able to check me in at 1 am so it wasn't a bad experience, just disappointing.

name: Pickwick Hall
reviewtext: Nice quiet hostel in a great location. Carpet was a little dirty and shower wouldn't drain quickly. Also it was very hot on the third level with poor air circulation and the fan did not work - however it was July during my visit so I'm sure it would be fine other times of the year.  Overall decent place to stay. Staff was very friendly.

name: Pickwick Hall
reviewtext: Excellent position, very quiet. Room is very celeb too. Quite hot, but probably it's not just this hostel. Overall, will visit again and highly recommend.

name: Pickwick Hall
reviewtext: My room was too hot and I had to check out after the first night. Pickwick Hall said that they would refund me the remaining two nights but that was a month ago. The room had a large window in direct sunlight and there was no air conditioning and only a tiny fan which was ineffective. I asked the manager for another fan but he said therewere none to spare. The room was obviously not fit to let to the public.

name: Pickwick Hall
reviewtext: Great location and a nice and quiet hostel but during the heat wave the rooms got unbearably hot and one fan in a room for 4 is not enough. Standard breakfast but with a nicely made table which adds charm. It's cheap for being London and you get what you pay for.

name: Pickwick Hall
reviewtext: If what you are looking for is a budget place to stay in London that is in a safe area, but close to the city center, you should consider this hostel. Bathrooms need remodeling and breakfast could have included some protein. The rooms had a cold fridge, a sink, and a desk. We stayed here during a heat wave and the temperature in the room was unbarable. I imagine that the room temp would be nice other times of the year but it was so hot, it was hard to sleep most nights.

name: Pickwick Hall
reviewtext: We were in the basement which was a little disappointing but I suppose someone has to be in that room. The room was on the small side, with no room to place and open our 2 large suitcases. Cleanliness was ok, not exceptional. However the location was top notch and the price was good value. The bed was reasonably comfortable, but the mattress will need replacing soon. One recommendation would be that the place needs some money spent on it to brighten up the decor. It is looking very tired.

name: Pickwick Hall
reviewtext: I stayed during the heat wave and it was very hot.   It is excellent location in Bloomsbury and in a quiet street.   Owner is real nice.   I was lucky I had room to self in two bed room.   Breakfast is great.   You could keep your luggage here after checkout.

name: Pickwick Hall
reviewtext: Cheap hostel in a great location. Everything for a basic stay in London from free breakfast, hot water, towels, and comfortable bed. Although it looks a little run down, all the facilities still run well. Also, very close to the British Museum.

name: Queen Elizabeth Chelsea
reviewtext: DONT BOOK!! DIRTIEST HOSTEL I'VE EVER BEEN TO IN MY LIFE. The beds are old and they make a noise with every little move. Toiles are disgusting, some didnt even have toilet paper. The shower is older than my great grandfather and very rusty. The whole building smells like old sucks and pee. Almost all the staff was sick or carried some sort of STDs. If your hygienic, this is not your place.: I DO NOT NOT NOT RECOMMEND THIS HOSTEL AT ALL.

name: Queen Elizabeth Chelsea
reviewtext: Hats off to Aengus for running a tight ship,.loved the place ! If in London stay here!

name: Queen Elizabeth Chelsea
reviewtext:
The staff is very nice and welcoming !  The underground is not far from the hostel !
The WiFi access if FREE ! 
 For the facilities I would say that there is not enough showers and toilets ! Though  I would recommend it for the staff , the price and the location.

name: Queen Elizabeth Chelsea
reviewtext: Especially good because of the friendly staff, Matt ( from Ireland) and Peter (from Australia)! Well done guys...

name: Queen Elizabeth Chelsea
reviewtext:
I have stayed at a handful of hostels around Europe and have never encountered a greater atmosphere or a better community of staff. The staff are an undeniably fun group that really seem to enjoy each other as people, not just coworkers. This feeling was totally extended over to me as a guest.

 I'll give a shoutout to Matt who spun many plates during my stay (pleasantly) and didn't feel the need to drip with courtesy. I appreciated the spine and there not being a need to bend over backwards.

name: Queen Elizabeth Chelsea
reviewtext: Extremely dirty place. Please don't come to this place. There are piles of empty pints, coat-hangers and rubbish in the corners. It looks like a prison. It is disgusting, I didn't even slept there. I ended up booking another hostel to sleep that night.

name: Queen Elizabeth Chelsea
reviewtext: Loved this place - did not want to leave. Atmosphere is second to none. The Irish girl is a pleasure to talk to and a great laugh.

name: Queen Elizabeth Chelsea
reviewtext: Awsome place with awsome people. Tunes are always cranking and the beer is always flowing ( untill 11:30pm ofc) Special shoutout to Matt and Pete top blokes ðŸ‘Œ

name: Queen Elizabeth Chelsea
reviewtext: Definitely my favorite hostel I've stayed at, I recommend this place to anyone that wants to have a good time in London. And, Peter behind the bar is the most helpful and friendly. He know all the great places in London and makes a great drink.

name: Queen Elizabeth Chelsea
reviewtext: This is possibly the worst hostel I have ever stayed at, the showers and bathrooms were beyond filthy and the smell was borderline unbareable.  I rarely review hostels afterwards but I felt like I had to for this place mainly due to the bed bug problem. I stayed here for 6 nights and should have left sooner, all over my body is covered in bites and I had to throw out half my clothes in fear of them spreading. Spend the extra money and stay somewhere which wont completely ruin a week of your life

name: Queen Elizabeth Chelsea
reviewtext: Had a super time. Great atmosphere created by the Irish girl with the curls (Niamh). She was very helpful and even more fun. Good value bar prices too.

name: Queen Elizabeth Chelsea
reviewtext:
Very well located and cheap hostel.
+ Great wi-fi, decent beddings, reception open 24h
- lack of warm water

name: Queen Elizabeth Chelsea
reviewtext: Good, clean hostel with amazing staff

name: Queen Elizabeth Chelsea
reviewtext:
Stay away! The guy was more interested in smoking fags outside then checking me in, the rooms where too small for 6 beds, 3 high bunk beds. The bathrooms where disgusting & stunk & held water on the ground.
I saw a group of Asian tourists walk in and a couple of drunk Irish guys starting abusing them for no reason & the staff did absolutely nothing.

name: Queen Elizabeth Chelsea
reviewtext: Staff was amazing could not recommend this place more! Matt was a delightful host full of energy and extremely welcoming to all guests. He really made me feel at home. For what you're paying you get a great deal PLUS they've got breakfast for only 2 pounds! The hostel is only a 5-10 minute walk from Fulham Broadway station which will take you into the city in about 30ish minutes. Lots of great restaurants and a huge Sainsbury's nearby if you need a quick cheap eat.

name: Queen Elizabeth Chelsea
reviewtext: Had a great time. Pints very cheap & had sky sports. Atmosphere is brilliant - the Irish girl at the bar is a great laugh. Will be back for sure.

name: Queen Elizabeth Chelsea
reviewtext: Extremely friendly staff. Really looked after me met cool people too! Matt behind bar is really nice too.

name: Queen Elizabeth Chelsea
reviewtext: I had such a great time here. The staff are very friendly and a good laugh - especially Niamh. A very relaxed, homely atmosphere. Can't wait to come back.

name: Queen Elizabeth Chelsea
reviewtext:
First time Ive seen such a wonderful group of people working together.
Rooms are cleaned daily.
Very good location.
Amazing friendly staffs.

Highly recommended to travelers looking for a good place to stay with such a wonderful atmosphere.

name: Queen Elizabeth Chelsea
reviewtext: Lovely stay here in nice surroundings made much better by the lovely niamh marron who made me feel right at home at all times during my stay

name: Queen Elizabeth Chelsea
reviewtext: Staff were so lovely. Matt and Pete will take good care of you.

name: Queen Elizabeth Chelsea
reviewtext: It's a cool place for one night or two.My room was outside it wasn't secured, because the door can't lock or close completely, and it was cold and it was raining all day so I didn't enjoy my room but I enjoyed the atmosphere the neighbors comes throughout the day and night to buy drinks  have fun and  interact with us ,that's unique I didn't find this in other hostel and that make you feel more connected to the city and I love the all you can eat 2Â£ breakfast, that truly help me save some money

name: Queen Elizabeth Chelsea
reviewtext: We stayed in the big room with many bunk beds. Be forewarned that you have to go outside of the pub to access this main room & you have to go outside to go back to the restroom. Also, the lockers are small & located in the main area of the bar which was all inconvenient. The staff was nice, open to giving suggestions for things to do. There's no AC, we did get a little hot when sleeping (only fitted sheet and comforter given to you). Showers weren't great, hard to control temp,  wear flip flops.

name: Queen Elizabeth Chelsea
reviewtext: Had an excellent stay. Would definitely recommend! Enjoyed a couple pints with the relaxed bar staff, who make everyone feel very welcome. Peter and Matt are legends, I'll be back.

name: Queen Elizabeth Chelsea
reviewtext: This hostel is located in central London and truly amazing! You'll meet anazing people that change your life x

name: Queen Elizabeth Chelsea
reviewtext: Peter, was the BEST! I was traveling alone and he took it upon himself to show me around. I had the very best time with him! From a full English breakfast to going to the Camden Market, to going out/nightlife; London may be an amazing city all by itself, but Peter became my favorite part of my trip! He made sure I had a great time. I highly recommend staying at this Hostel because the people working there made it special and fun. Added bonus, the hostel is located on top of a Pub! Love that!

name: Queen Elizabeth Chelsea
reviewtext: Not bad, clean enough and staff are very helpful

name: Queen Elizabeth Chelsea
reviewtext: Its not the best hostel to stay in but probably because of its price. The rooms are small, the halls and stairs are very tiny. Only two or three showers exist so you have to get up early if you want to start your day early.

name: Queen Elizabeth Chelsea
reviewtext:
The bunkbeds in the rooms were 3 beds on top of each other with a very unstable frame that wobbled and squeaked every time I rolled over. There were no screens in the windows (I got a few bug bites) and the showers smelled bad. The Wi-Fi only worked downstairs in the pub, not in any of the rooms. The room I was in only had 3 lockers even though there were 6 beds in the room. I asked to rent a towel and they said they were out. 
That being said, it was a very good price and I didn't get bedbugs.

name: Queen Elizabeth Chelsea
reviewtext: Extremely overpriced for effectively a half way house horrible uncomfortable and dirty accomadation would give 0 out of 10 if hostel world would allow

name: Queen Elizabeth Chelsea
reviewtext: Super sound guys. Very welcoming people as soon as you walk in, you feel as if your a local. Great storage space for your belongings and proper locks! Regarding beds they are great did the job, not to small either. To top it all off if your yourself round them and have good chat you may get a free pint or two. Have fun!!!! Also thanks a lot guys!!!!!

name: Queen Elizabeth Chelsea
reviewtext: The only positive thing I could say is the staff are really welcoming and friendly....but other than that...room was disgusting, filthy, toilet horrible, shower disgusting and dirty. It's not hard to sweep the bedroom floor, clean the toilets or give the shower room the once over!!!! But looked like they'd not been done in months!!!

name: Queen Elizabeth Chelsea
reviewtext: Nice place to stay

name: Queen Elizabeth Chelsea
reviewtext: This hostel that's situated in a pub was a lovely place to stay. While upstairs in the rooms you mostly keep to yourself, when you come down to the bar you can be social and meet some cool people to adventure with. The tube station is about 10 minutes walking, making for relatively easy connection to the rest of the city where things actually are. My staff were very friendly and helpful, and even allowed me to stay longer than anticipated for free when my passport was stolen, which I appreciated

name: Queen Elizabeth Chelsea
reviewtext: Only stayed one night between cities, it wasn't close to anything and the dorm I was in seemed to be a shed with a load of bunk beds. The staff were pretty cool and happy to help, there's basically no security in the room. People staying all seemed chill and fun though

name: Queen Elizabeth Chelsea
reviewtext: Not the most conveniently located, and security was pretty lacking (if one knew where to go, you could get straight from outside to the rooms without needing any sort of key). That being said, you get what you pay for, and this was one of the cheapest places in London, so I can't bash it too much. Go here if you need to save a buck and just want a place to lie your head at night.

name: Queen Elizabeth Chelsea
reviewtext: Cleanliness and comfort Could have been better but location was great and the pub was a nice spot to relax and meet new people! Shoutout to Peter for being helpful with directions!

name: Queen Elizabeth Chelsea
reviewtext:
Needs a kitchen, or at least a sink near food area!!!
Great staff, especially Pete, the Aussie who checked me in!

name: Queen Elizabeth Chelsea
reviewtext: Only problem was a compressor in the building that was very load all throughout the building, which was going off all day and night and affected my sleep

name: Queen Elizabeth Chelsea
reviewtext: I know this hostel from the past. It does not have any hole/oven to cook, and internet is not working continuously. It is perfect if you like socialization - very large space an nice bar to sit and to talk.  And very clean sheets.

name: Queen Elizabeth Chelsea
reviewtext:
Conditions in this hostel was terrible. Staff is rough all the time. I left this hostel and change with another. Where is people more polite. 
I would like to complain and to apply for refund.

name: Queen Elizabeth Chelsea
reviewtext: Great staff. Always helpful and accommodating. Fun intimate environment. Thanks Ash & Peter! Will be returning

name: Queen Elizabeth Chelsea
reviewtext: No plugs by the beds. Room was kinda dirty

name: Queen Elizabeth Chelsea
reviewtext: The bathrooms were dirty, the staff was unhappy, the "no refunds" sign on the wall was tacky. It was a sad experience.

name: Queen Elizabeth Chelsea
reviewtext: The place is filthy. I didn't even spend the night. I went to a different hostel.

name: Queen Elizabeth Chelsea
reviewtext: I only stayed for 1 night. The hostel is not the cleanest - also the toilets are constantly dirty and lacking toilet paper and hand soap. This place could be easily improved.

name: Queen Elizabeth Chelsea
reviewtext: This place is a dump. Everything is so worn down that I am surprised they allow people to stay here. I stayed in the big room out back that's not even attached to the building. They squeezed as many bunk beds in that room. The sheets were ripped and the pillows were so flat. There was a big crew that came and they didn't even have the beds organized for them and when they asked for new sheets the female worker gave her attitude and said no. Then another girl got her coins stolen from her.... ðŸ˜¡

name: Queen Elizabeth Chelsea
reviewtext: It's a quaint little hostel which also serves as the local pub to many residents in the area. Peter who was part of the staff was super friendly and was willing to help me out. 24hr reception was really nice for a weary traveller.

name: Queen Elizabeth Chelsea
reviewtext: The location is great, super close to the bus and amazing restaurants, beds were pretty comfy.  Peter and Ashley were total sweetheart too and helped out with all our questions. It's a very welcoming place, only con is the washroom lay out, but we got by just fine.

name: The Horse and Stables
reviewtext: A simple place but with everything you need, very good location, nice enviroment and for a cheap price, would recommend to anyone who wants to meet the city.

name: The Horse and Stables
reviewtext: The hostel is located very centrally and the stuff is very friendly and helpful. What i didn't like too much was the cleanliness... there were no lockers in the room, so i out my stuff under my bed. once i took them out they were full of dust. Also the toilets were always dirty and smelly. Other than that everything was okay

name: The Horse and Stables
reviewtext: Amazing location and good staffs.

name: The Horse and Stables
reviewtext: Great location and friendly staff. The beds were a little uncomfortable but it was bearable.  Can't beat the location, close to a station, Big Ben, The Eye etc.

name: The Horse and Stables
reviewtext: Great hostel awesome location. Breakfast was the best. Beds were a bit worn in ðŸ˜

name: The Horse and Stables
reviewtext: Overall, I did enjoy my stay. It is rarely close to London Eye at a walking distance and near the underground train station. The only thing I would say is the showers were small I washed half my body inside of the shower while the other half was outside of the shower. The water temperature was either way too hot or ice cold. But I will say security was major, there are locked door with codes I order to get into the hostel and it to the bedrooms. breakfast was good and simple, staff was friendly!

name: The Horse and Stables
reviewtext:
Good: Fruit provided for breakfast 

Bad: Only 4 showers and 3 toilets (1 shower has no lock; some are so small you can hardly turn inside)

name: The Horse and Stables
reviewtext: Great staff, excellent location, 5 min walk to the London Eye.  Great food and guests get a 15% discount.  Thanks for having us ðŸ˜€ðŸ˜€ðŸ˜€

name: The Horse and Stables
reviewtext: Very small all around but fantastic staff and location. Hospital close by so expect a decent amount of sirens but they stopped after 11 from my experience.

name: The Horse and Stables
reviewtext: I enjoyed The Horse and Stables and probably will go back. Friendly staff, excellent music and atmosphere at the bar, good location. Thank you!

name: The Horse and Stables
reviewtext: Super friendly and helpful staff, it's a nice pub in a great location

name: The Horse and Stables
reviewtext:

The reception members are really kind.
If i visit in London again i will stay in hereâ¤ï¸

name: The Horse and Stables
reviewtext: Amazing location! Friendly staff. Rooms very noisy and showers quite dirty/mouldy so be prepared!

name: The Horse and Stables
reviewtext: Beds were terrible, room was boiling hot even though the outside temperature wasn't that bad. I felt dirtier after my shower than before. Staff was polite but not super quick to help you, as they are also working the bar at the same time. Security is numerical passcode as opposed to a key. If you're just looking for a good location and not any quality for one night, I'd say it's worth it. The beer prices downstairs aren't too bad!

name: The Horse and Stables
reviewtext: Staff were really nice and the breakfast was decent and the beds were really comfy. The location was perfect and near to everything you would want to see and the tube station was only a minute walk away. The only downside was the sound of traffic was really loud inside the rooms and the WiFi was slow or not working.

name: Prime Backpackers Angel
reviewtext: Thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the hostel. The staff and guests were very friendly and helpful. It's close to the underground,  bus stops and shops.  Thank you to you all for making my experience in London a great one. SlÃ¡inte! ðŸ˜Š

name: Prime Backpackers Angel
reviewtext: A great night with some lovely people

name: Prime Backpackers Angel
reviewtext: Clean hostel at a nice location for a very fair price. I only stayed here for one night but the staff was really friendly and even changed my booking from a bigger mixed bedroom to a smaller female bedroom free of charge because they had a bed available for the night.

name: Prime Backpackers Angel
reviewtext: Only stayed here 2 nights in between flights, but loved this place! Great atmosphere and energy, super friendly staff. Felt welcome the second we walked through the door.

name: Prime Backpackers Angel
reviewtext: Great hostel, spacious common area, easy location to get around London right by the tube station and with buses headed to central. My only complaint would be that there were no cubbies that one could lock your valuables in in the dorm rooms! I had to move my stuff to my friend's private room when we went out.

name: Prime Backpackers Angel
reviewtext: We missed a more comfortable and pleasant living room.

name: Prime Backpackers Angel
reviewtext:
secure, old fashioned, slightly worn down hostel
friendly staff
average to good cleanliness
next bus stop, underground station and supermarket within walking distance (5-10 minutes); public transport stops are on major service lines
Wi-Fi with great coverage and good speed
big kitchen
lockers (bring your own padlock, none for rent)
fresh linen and towels provided
fast e-mail response

name: Prime Backpackers Angel
reviewtext: Came here to try an alternate hostel to those around Kings Cross. A bit out but plenty of amenities around Angel (just one tube stop). Found this to be a bit more quirky and relaxed to suit a truer backpacker audience. Lots of traveler\staff interaction and a general relaxed vibe. 9 bed room was fine with just 4 guests but would be less comfortable if full especially with the three tier bunks. Cool common areas and kitchen. Suit travelers who like to get a lot from their hostel when on a trip.

name: Prime Backpackers Angel
reviewtext: Great, cant fault it - does exactly what it says on the tin! Thank you for a great stay - will be back!

name: Prime Backpackers Angel
reviewtext: Baggies Angel was a wonderful place for a short stay! Upon arrival, you'll get your keys (entry to the hostel only, the doors are unlocked), sheets/pillow cases and a nice little tour of the place. In the 12 person room I stayed, beds were super comfortable and roommates quiet & clean. The only reservation I have is the beds can be creaky and tend to move if you move, disturbing everyone in your 3-person bunk. Other than that, a lovely stay!

name: Prime Backpackers Angel
reviewtext: I had an overall good experience at this hostel. The staff are nice and the facilities are clean. The bedrooms are a little tight,  but have lockers and shelves. The location isn't very central but there are metro and bus stops nearby.

name: Prime Backpackers Angel
reviewtext: The location is great and the staff very nice and helpful, however the room I stayed in was way too small for 9 beds (3x triple bunks) and it was very hot in the room, so really hard to sleep as we had to keep the window open and it was noisy outside.

name: Prime Backpackers Angel
reviewtext:
Good location in Islington - close to public transport options. Check in process was good and staff were lovely. 

Communal bathrooms were a bit grim and no lights worked, so having a shower super early in the morning was a challenge.

name: Prime Backpackers Angel
reviewtext: Super friendly staff. Great vibe. Angel is a tucked away suburb but still has pubs and great shopping centre up the road.

name: Prime Backpackers Angel
reviewtext: Great common room and kitchen; helpful and friendly staff; rooms are crowd and really hot!

name: Prime Backpackers Angel
reviewtext: Despite its incipient name change, the erstwhile Baggies at the Angel, soon to be Prime evidently, remains one of my favorite boltholes for a couple of days in London. Good things: Location; staff; the magnificent kitchen and lounging areas. Bad things: Inconvenient siting of, and too few, bathrooms and toilets; cleaning down with a lick and a promise; too many long-stayers; and -- my pet peeve -- three-decker bunks. All of that said, it is, warts and all, a pretty decent place.

name: Prime Backpackers Angel
reviewtext: The type of hostel that makes people feel at home.  Very cozy and friendly atmosphere, clean, secure, and the price can't be beat.  I will definitely be staying again on my next visit to London.

name: Prime Backpackers Angel
reviewtext: Photos make the place look a lot cleaner and newer than it actually is. Our trash was never emptied in our room and the day I left I noticed a lot of the trash cans were overflowing. I didn't feel there was good communal space other than the kitchen, which I didn't really eat there and use other than one or two times. I basically left early in the morning and came home really late and just slept and showered there because I didn't enjoy the space.

name: Prime Backpackers Angel
reviewtext: I got in late and left early the next day, but it was a good hostel in a good location!

name: St Christopher's Oasis-Female Only
reviewtext: Got my money's worth! Staff was very helpful and kept the place very secure.  The only issue was the bathroom's were not the cleanest and always smelled bad.  But overall I had a very great experience and the location was awesome! (close to London Bridge, tube stations, and Borough Market!)

name: St Christopher's Oasis-Female Only
reviewtext: Got here and upon check-in was upgraded from a 14 bed female dorm to a private room, on the all-female floor. Other than that great surprise, the room was clean upon entering with cute treats and hygiene essentials on the bed. The room also came in with ample amounts of plugs, and a kettle to brew tea/coffee. Was very impressed with the setup, and had such a good night's sleep for the three nights I was there. If I ever come back to London this is definitely where I would stay!

name: St Christopher's Oasis-Female Only
reviewtext:
Location is very central, but it is above a pub so if you can't sleep with noise, then no. I spent my night here just to catch a train. 

A couple of items or facilities were out of order during my stay.

Staircase smelled like puke and packed bed linen piles waiting to be washed were visible everywhere.

Squeaky beds.

name: St Christopher's Oasis-Female Only
reviewtext: It's a nice hostel I appreciated he curtains on the bed...but you guys HAVE to do something about how loud the fire doors slam in the hallway, it's excessive. Insulate the inside of the frame with rubber, dobsinehing, because anytime someone walks through the many doors in her hallway the bang echoes throughout ALL the rooms.

name: St Christopher's Oasis-Female Only
reviewtext:
Free washer and dryer was an amazing plus
Privacy curtains were great
Main downside was no real kitchen space and the common area was quite small
Overall a really nice place to stay though

name: St Christopher's Oasis-Female Only
reviewtext: My stay at this hostel was good - I liked the female only section. Check in took a long time, but this has been the case at every single St Christopher's I've ever used so I know it isn't the individual staff's fault at this branch. There is lots of space downstairs to sit and the locations is really good. My only small critique is that if you're in room 210, whenever anyone uses the hand dryers in the bathroom next door the noise blasts through the wall like a claxon day or night.

name: St Christopher's Oasis-Female Only
reviewtext: The location is great and the staff is super friendly! The beds are comfortable and they have  curtains for privacy and outlets by each bed making it easy to charge your phone. The breakfast was good considering how cheap it was. The downstairs restaurant had good prices and the atmosphere was great making it easy to find new friends, I definitely recommend this hostel!

name: St Christopher's Oasis-Female Only
reviewtext: Very close to London Bridge, easy check in, room fine and clean, only one shower it seemed for the Women's corridor, however was never busy when I needed it. Quiet, no street noise, only noise is the door that is opened and closed when people leave and come back. Other than that, you pretty much get what you pay for. Would stay again.

name: St Christopher's Oasis-Female Only
reviewtext:
Perfect location, rooms clean and each bed has charging sockets, curtain for privacy and a cage under the bed to lock away personal items. Communal laundry facilities and microwave etc avaIlable. 
In future I'd take my own padlock for locking items in the cage and washing powder for the machine as adding these items on at the hostel becomes more price than needed.
Second time I've stayed here and would definitely recommend and return :)

name: St Christopher's Oasis-Female Only
reviewtext: Horrible experience here. Was in an all girls 14 person dorm arrived late at night to find girl above me brought a guy in the room and continued to sleep with him on top of me. Complained to staff as they wouldn't stop and staff said they would do nothing about it. Left the next morning. Bathrooms are gross. Also if you are sleeping anywhere near a window good luck trying to sleep

name: St Christopher's Oasis-Female Only
reviewtext:
This was a great hostel to come to and crash after a long day out. The bunks have privacy curtains, individual lights and charging ports (including two USB slots). The bed was comfortable, they provided a towel, and the shower had hot water and space for my things to place out of the water's way.

The kitchen is very sparse, but there is a fridge, and a lovely terrace connected to it.

There are no closets, just cages under the bottom bed. Bring your own lock.

name: St Christopher's Oasis-Female Only
reviewtext: Overall, this hostel is an excellent choice. It's super affordable, located right next to grocery/convenience stores, restaurants, and a few big London attractions, and also in between the London Bridge (major) station and another metro station. The facilities are clean and well kept, and they have the amenities a hostel really needs: a locker room to stash your bags before/after checkin, laundry facilities, a bar/restaurant/general hangout on the first floor, a 24-hour desk of helpful staff.

name: St Christopher's Oasis-Female Only
reviewtext:
I stayed on the second floor and found it cool, spacious and quiet. 
Perhaps could do with another shower or private wash basin area 
The staff were friendly and quick to help with any problems. 
Access to transport around London, places to eat was excellent.

name: 247london Hostel and Private Rooms
reviewtext: The Italian girl don't give me the rest of the money

name: 247london Hostel and Private Rooms
reviewtext:
I have stayed at 247 London Hostel many times over the past few years and it's about time i wrote a review. it's now my go-to budget accomodation in London! ;-)
Great central location, very near Kilburn Underground Stn, Kilburn High Rd, shops, supermarkets, pubs, restaurants etc. On a quiet residential street.  With large comfortable lounge/dinning area, very good for socialising. There's also a large well equipped kitchen and garden. Good security, dorms have locks and lockers.

name: 247london Hostel and Private Rooms
reviewtext: a great place to stay. They own several buildings on a quiet street right by Kilburn station, so, for one, they offer a variety of accommodations: dorm rooms, private rooms, long term, and etc. next time I am in London, I'll try to book them again

name: 247london Hostel and Private Rooms
reviewtext: Really enjoyable stay, good location 5 minute walk from the tube which allows 30 minute access across most of London. Allowed to come and go as you please at any time day or night which is ideal.

name: 247london Hostel and Private Rooms
reviewtext: We booked this hostel very last minute and expected crazy prices for London. This ended up costing under Â£20 a night which I think is brilliant but we assumed the place would be a bit grotty for such a bargain - wrong! The nightcaretaker of 39 Chatsworth (Ador) is incredibly welcoming, there are plenty of bathrooms and 3 kitchens, and the little garden was lovely in the hot weather! Would definitely come again

name: 247london Hostel and Private Rooms
reviewtext: Little expensive for mixed dorm beds for what you get, but nice building and good facilities

name: Home London
reviewtext: Felt like a prison

name: Home London
reviewtext: Do not bother. Rude staff and BED BUGS, lots of bed bugs. I was in the room for about ten minutes until I saw them all over the wall and floor next to the bed. One night is not worth 2 months of fumigating and parasites diseases. Just awesful.

name: Home London
reviewtext: Its an old place so its not squeeky clean and the facilities aren't amazing but it's pretty chill. The people are wonderful so it helps a lot! :)

name: Home London
reviewtext:
BED BUGS, LOTS OF THEM!!!!!
Very trashi overall. Probably the WORST hostel I have EVER stayed at.

Booked 3 nights, but after sleeping for one, found another hostel.
When asking for a refund they wanted me jump through bureaucratic loopholes so I just walked away.

name: Home London
reviewtext: Exceptional hostel with great facilities, beds are comfy and in very spacious rooms. Lots of places to hang out and meet new people â€” I got to know almost everyone on my first night in the hostel and I ended up going out with some people. Very good for travellers would recommend

name: Home London
reviewtext: They had huge bed bugs. Instead of  quarantining the room (or even the entire place!) The guy just said 'it's London' wrong answer! I was there long enough to shower in their crappy shower and as soon as I saw a couple, I noped out of there.

name: Home London
reviewtext:
Smelly room. Filthy bathrooms. People loitering   around the entrance of hostel. 
The staff member was lovely upon checking in, but the one we got when checking out, did not even speak a word.
Location is great, but doesn't make it worth it for such an uncomfortable stay.
My boyfriend and I got up especially early just to leave the place.

name: Home London
reviewtext: Me fockin love it!

name: Home London
reviewtext: I booked a 2-week stay at Home London and stayed only a night. After arrival, I left my items in the teeny tiny, smelly room and left immediately for work- staying late to avoid coming back to the hostel. The toilet was small and dirty and I couldn't bring myself to even check what the showers looked like. I checked out the next morning and even the receptionist was sympathetic and said he'd send an internal email asking for a refund. I have sent emails and received no response or refund

name: Home London
reviewtext:
I stayed here 4 years previously (different name). It was interesting to see that the cleanliness, or lack of, hadn't changed. The cost of the private rooms had gone up and yet poor quality stayed the same. The unisex toilets were filthy and smelt badly of urine. 
Free breakfast is always good, the staff were lovely and the showers were of a good temp and good pressure. Had I stayed in a dorm- I wouldn't have mind the cost& cleanliness- you pay for what you get. Not great for a private room.

name: Home London
reviewtext:
BED BUGS!

Absolutely feral. There are bed bugs everywhere. I have bites all over my body from them. The walls next to the bunk beds are covered in squished and bloody bed bugs from people squishing them against the wall. Will never go back there.

Everything else is irrelevant, I would never sleep there again.

name: Home London
reviewtext: There is bed bugs in that hostel. My friend and I didn't stop scratching ourselves for couple of days after staying there. Plus the polish cleaning lady is very rude. I understood now why the British voted brexit.

name: Home London
reviewtext: I woke up covered in dozens of bed bug bites. STAY AWAY.

name: Home London
reviewtext: This hostel was okay. About a 5 minute walk from St Pancras so great location if you have an early morning Eurostar. I read plenty of reviews regarding the bed bugs and managed to get my room upgraded to a room that has never had a problem so thanks to the staff for that. Speaking of the staff, they were friendly and helpful. I used the showers and they were honestly disgusting. One thing this hostel lacks is cleanliness and would be my only complaint.

name: Home London
reviewtext: A friend and I booked a private double for 3 nights, it is was a convenient location, the bassement bar serves the cheapest pint probably in London and the free breakfast is a bonus, unfortunately what really lets it down is the hostel is really dirty and all the bathrooms smell strongly of urine , only 2 showers out of the 3 female showers were in working order and the TV in the room was not working. I would be embarrassed to  recommend this as a place to stay to anyone I know

name: Home London
reviewtext: I didn't see anywhere where it stated that children under the age of 12 were not allowed to stay with adult supervisionðŸ˜¡ so as I arrived to the location, as I made the reservation an hour prior, and was told by the receptionist that I would not be able to check in with my wife and 9 year old son, was denied and told that a refund is also not going to happen due to a 24 hr process.  From there I was told to try the lodge in down the street.

name: Home London
reviewtext: rooms need a good clean, showers need to have an option of cold, need to be ladders to the upper bed and more fans.

name: Home London
reviewtext: Brilliant hostel, really friendly vibe, great staff and location. Well worth the money.

name: Home London
reviewtext:
Hygiene and security problems

After severely bitten all over my body by bedbugs, I had to go to A&E for the itchness and my fever. Someone told me they sprayed sonething.
But on the second night bedbugs still attacked my skin. In the same room, one lady had the same situation.

If I sleep on the same mattess, I get another bites. Thus I had to spend outside this place 

On my third day, one man had his EU ID, wallet and valuables stolen, even his bag was tied by a thin wire to his bed.

name: Home London
reviewtext: Imagine sleeping in the basement in a single room packed up with 9 beds, in the heat of summer, with no window, no fan or air-conditioning. Everyone was boiling hot and almost suffocating. What an experience!!!!

name: Green Rooms
reviewtext: I had an issue during my stay at the hostel that was management's fault. The staff handled it great, took responsibility, and issued me a refund. Overall, a great experience.

name: Pride of Paddington
reviewtext: This was an average hostel that could really use some updates. The bathroom facilities were very frustrating. There were no outlets, and only one had a hairdryer available that cost a pound per minute to use. Ridiculous. The only option for most people was to use a hairdryer in the room, which disturbed everyone sleeping. The bar/restaurant downstairs was very nice and seemed to be a neighborhood favorite. I enjoyed the free breakfast and the discounted meals from the vouchers they gave.

name: Pride of Paddington
reviewtext: The room absolutely stank of damp and mould. The room lock didn't work. There was no practical way to use any of the lockers. It was fine otherwise

name: Pride of Paddington
reviewtext: Perfect hostel near Paddington Station.

name: Pride of Paddington
reviewtext: Good value and great location. Room was tidy and spacious, with kitchen facilities. Staff were very friendly and let us check in early and store our heavy bags. Free breakfast every day (with great variety) and they give you a page full of coupons to use at their bar & restaurant. Overall I had a great stay, would definitely recommend to a friend.

name: Pride of Paddington
reviewtext:
+ great location, nice rooms, breakfast was really good, friendly and helpful staff 
- it could get a bit loud at night, not only because of the pub, but due to busses passing right next to our window; the bathrooms always flooded when showering
Overall good hostel, we'd stay here again.

name: Pride of Paddington
reviewtext: Need some upgrades to compare to other hostels for the same price

name: Pride of Paddington
reviewtext: The location is fantastic! Paddington station is just across the street. The food was excellent and I was also impressed with the selection of choices for the included breakfast. We had their full English breakfast one morning and pancakes with bacon and syrup the next, both were great. Our room was clean and we didn't get a lot of the noise from the street which was nice. The bathroom could have been a little cleaner as there was some mould. Overall, would stay here again!

name: Pride of Paddington
reviewtext:
I stayed in Paddington Pride and had a good time. It seems it's just a restaurant, but there is quite a big hostel above it. If you want to meet other travellers it might not be the place to go. If it's just to stay for the night it's a really nice place. 

I did have a little issue with the manager because she told me I had to check out early what wasn't agreed upon. But the service in the restaurant was excellent. Fast, very friendly and good food. Special compliments to the waitress Yanella.

name: Pride of Paddington
reviewtext:
Just next to the bus stop and tube station. The entrance is difficult to find as I did not expect it is a restaurant.
The room is big. It was a little bit noisy outside at night and even in the morning since there was construction outside. The pillow is too soft. 
The shower room was stopped for service for a night, there was no lights after 10pm and no hot water.
No common area for chatting or having own meals.
Staffs are nice expect for a middle age woman who was not patient on me.

name: Pride of Paddington
reviewtext: Free breakfast was awesome

name: Pride of Paddington
reviewtext:
It is a nice place to stay if you want to visit most of London's sightseeings.
However because of its place it has very noise from the street and it is very hot especually the summer.
Overall, it is a fair place to stay.

name: Pride of Paddington
reviewtext: The room was nice but it smelled badly. Clean bathrooms. Good breakfast. No common areas, or tea/coffee facilities. Quite noisy but not a problem to sleep

name: Pride of Paddington
reviewtext: Our stay at Pride of Paddington was great. The  location was easy to access. The customer service was wonderful.  I will recommend to someone else.

name: Pride of Paddington
reviewtext:
I was generally very unimpressed by this outdated hostel. There was mold covering the ceiling of one of the shower rooms.

The dorm I was staying in got really hot and the street noise and smoke coming up from the pub downstairs was bothersome. I was staying in a woman's only room and one morning when I woke up (around 9/9:30) there was a man standing in the middle of the room changing over the beds.  Not a huge issue but at first glance, kind of creepy.

name: Pride of Paddington
reviewtext: If all you need is a place to lay your head for the night this place will do the job and is a good price. There was no common area or shared kitchen. Pub downstairs serves good (free) breakfast but is very loud at night. The location was good and is about a minute walk away from Paddington station. The biggest downfall of this hostel was the bathrooms. The showers were dirty and the ceilings were VERY mouldy.

name: Pride of Paddington
reviewtext: The location is perfect, only 1 minute away from the Paddington station. The hostel charge includes a good breakfast with coffee. I wish they begin the breakfast slightly earlier i.e around 7 : 30 AM instead of 8 am. The staff were friendly and helpful.  The room was okay though charging points for mobiles was not easily accessible from the upper berth. Though the street is slightly noisy but that is because of its location close to station. Overall, I found this to be a  good location .

name: Pride of Paddington
reviewtext: The stay was great for me. I had a bad to sleep in, a shower for using, and a place to lock away my things. The staff was fantastic and they supply a free breakfast with coffee/juice.  I had an all around good stay.

name: Pride of Paddington
reviewtext: The place was very noisy , I liked its location very close to the tube and bus stations. But the environment was very hostile and the staff was useless. I felt unwanted!

name: Pride of Paddington
reviewtext: It was good overall. However, the room that we were in was right in the corner and it was rather noisy from the intersection. The facilities were as we expected, about the quality of a college dorm, but with 7 other people. Free breakfast was nice and we felt secure when we were in the dorms. Great location in London. It was right next to the metro and Paddington station, which made it convent to travel around London and to surrounding areas.

name: Pride of Paddington
reviewtext: I really enjoyed my stay! I would go back again :)

name: Pride of Paddington
reviewtext: The bar downstairs was great but as far as I saw the only place to hang out. If there was a communal space/kitchen/ or living room, I didn't find it.  I chose that location because it was super close to train station and I needed the Heathrow express super early in the AM. Was at heathrow within 20 minutes from when I left the hostel. Staff was very kind!

name: Pride of Paddington
reviewtext: I never write reviews but I legitimately hated my time staying at this facility. Bathrooms were disgusting, deteriorating, and occasionally non-functional. Beds were incredibly uncomfortable. So stiff that a manufacturer would've had to intentionally design them to target and agitate a users pressure points. The rooms were incredibly hot and the windows did not have screens so either you cook the whole night in your own sweat or you cook the whole nightâ€”with flies around. Staff was very friendly

name: Pride of Paddington
reviewtext: Other than the breakfast, this hostel wasn't the greatest. Had to open the windows as there was no AC, and a lot of cigarette smoke from the streets/bar downstairs came into the room. We were also right above the pub, so it was very noisy outside. The bathrooms were pretty disgusting... black mould in the shower cracks and I saw a cockroach and mouse while in the washroom.. The staff was very friendly though.

name: Pride of Paddington
reviewtext: Location is perfect

name: Pride of Paddington
reviewtext: Spent only 1 nigh but decent place

name: Pride of Paddington
reviewtext: Super close to Paddington Station which is really convenient. Good staff who are helpful and friendly.  Because it's so close to a busy area, it's noisy but that's to be expected. The beds are not great and the bathrooms are a bit moldy and not in the best shape. There are also no shelves for top bunks or personal lighting so that you don't disturb other people in your room if you come in a bit late. Overall, it's not the best hostel but not the worst either.

name: Pride of Paddington
reviewtext: Great location, with good breakfast choice. It's not their entire menu but it has anything that you would want.

name: Atlas Hostels
reviewtext: I really enjoyed my two night stay here in a cosy private room. The hosts are so friendly, accomodating and caring. It's a very short walk (2 mins or so) from Paddington Station and thus a great base to explore the city. If you are wanting to meet other travellers this may not be the best place for you, it was however perfect for a quiet, peaceful stay. Thanks so much - will definitely be back!

name: Smart Hyde Park View Hostel
reviewtext: I booked for 3 nights, ended up leaving after the first night. The receptionists were nice and bathroom pretty clean, plus the location is very convenient but that's where the positive aspects end for me. Absolutely tiny rooms! I was on the top of a THREE tier bunk bed in a room of six - I could barely fit my suitcase in the room. The vibe wasn't very friendly - not one person said hello. I felt like my belongings were unsafe. Breakfast was average. After travelling for over 2 months in Europe

name: Smart Hyde Park View Hostel
reviewtext:
+ Location was quite good, breakfast was included, our room hat it's own bathroom, free wifi
- the rooms were quite small
It was an alright hostel, but for it's price, and if you don't care about how spacious your room is I'd recommend it

name: Smart Hyde Park View Hostel
reviewtext: The rooms are really small and so is the ensuite shower/toilet. Three beds on top of one another isn't the best. Luckily, the room wasn't full so we didn't have problems. The location is great, 10 minutes walk from Paddington Station.

name: Smart Hyde Park View Hostel
reviewtext: Amazing stay at the hostel! My girlfriend and I booked a 4 bed ensuite for a weekend and it was perfect. Lovely and attentive staff, room was clean, shower worked well and was hot. Close to a couple of tube stations to get around easy. The panels and curtain were a nice touch to have some privacy and our room had a fan which was much needed in the hot weather. Would definitely stay again

name: Smart Hyde Park View Hostel
reviewtext: I stayed in the mixed 4 bed room with ensuite. I liked that there were curtains for each bed and as it was really hot the fan in the room was really appreciated. The bed was ok comfort. The location is good, it's near Kensington gardens and Hyde Park and an easy walk to the tube station and shops.

name: Smart Hyde Park View Hostel
reviewtext: A great hostel buzzing with life with exceptionally friendly and helpful staff. the rooms are TINY and they squish in as many customers as possible, but once you;re asleep it doesn't matter.

name: Smart Hyde Park View Hostel
reviewtext: A Bit too compact in a 8 mixed dorm, especially when there is no window access for air circulation (fan doesn't help much). Also the showers being on a timer are not well appreciated.

name: Smart Hyde Park View Hostel
reviewtext: Don't stay here if you have other options. The location was pretty good but the rooms were so hot it was miserable to sleep in them. If you're over 6'1" you probably won't fit in the bunk beds. I'm 6'3" and I had to hang my legs off the side. Overall a very mediocre place to stay.

name: Smart Hyde Park View Hostel
reviewtext: Shocking, try to fit 6 people and their bags into a room that should sleep 2 at most, uncomfortable and the bathrooms weren't the cleanest. Absolutely wouldn't recommend

name: Smart Hyde Park View Hostel
reviewtext: Nice place to stay. Staff really friendly and helpful. Great location, close walk to Kensington Gardens and public transport. Plenty of places to eat and drink near by. No issues with security, good lockers in the room. Only complaint is they seemed to have a lot of different school groups staying there so was full of kids and got a bit loud at night with them running around the halls. Other than that minor problem it was great. Would stay again.

name: Smart Hyde Park View Hostel
reviewtext: Pro's & Con's for this place. Location is great, staff was friendly, there is a common room to eat and hang out in both in entrance and downstairs. The big problem is the room for 6 people cannot fit 6 people. The bathroom is an ensuit and just doesn't work. The privacy shade on the bed is nice though, but if six people are in this room at the same time trying to get ready. It doesn't work!!!! I was lucky that it was never a full room and I was able to use the ensuit without others waiting.

name: YHA London St Pauls
reviewtext: A lot can be said about location, location, location. It's across from St Paul's Cathedral and very conveniently located for public transportation. The staff at the front desk were welcoming and pleasant. The room I stayed in (17) had four bunks that were well equipped with two USB plugs each (one of mine wasn't working) and a reading light. The room was quiet and the sheets were clean. It was located above the restaurant which meant every morning we were all awaken with breakfast smells.

name: YHA London St Pauls
reviewtext: The hostel is in the perfect location, so easy to get to as it's just a few minutes walk from Blackfriars and St Paul's underground stations. The staff were really friendly and helpful. The room was basic but clean and the beds were comfy so we slept very well. I will definetly be staying here again.

name: YHA London St Pauls
reviewtext:
Hostel is wonderfully located in the center of the city, just by St Paul Cathedral, near the tube and plenty of buses going all around the place.
Staff is very friendly and helpful, common areas are very clean and comfy. 
My room was small but well equiped, and when the bed plugs did not work, they fixed it the same day.
Only regret: the hostel is quite big and it is difficult to meet with other travellers to organise activities for solo travellers.

name: YHA London St Pauls
reviewtext: Hostel is located in a great location. However at night the bells of St Paul's chime every 15 mins so recommend ear plugs if light sleeper. Also make sure you take a lock with you as it is Â£3 for one in the hostel.

name: YHA London St Pauls
reviewtext: Leaves door open at night, in the common area a homeless person walked in twice and started to talk to people, not ok, otherwise hostel was good, clean, good facilities and bedrooms

name: YHA London St Pauls
reviewtext: Dorms were of good size and they included large locker spaces within the room. Beds seemed clean and offered charging stations and lights for each bunk. The staff was very nice and helpful and the common areas looked cozy. Location decent. Be forewarned that you will hear the bells from St. Paul's tolling regularly even throughout the night (I liked this). Building/facilities quite old which is fine, especially for the fair price. Bathrooms/showers left much to be desired. Not very clean.

name: YHA London St Pauls
reviewtext: Great environment, great staff and very good location! Definitely would stay again! Very clean bedrooms and bathrooms!

name: YHA London St Pauls
reviewtext: Close to St. Paul cathedral, this hostel is well located, the staff is helpful and polite, this isn't at average hostel, worth staying here. I'd definitely be back.

name: YHA London St Pauls
reviewtext: I had a single room for one night so didn't get to use all of the facilities but my stay was good and the hostel is in an excellent location only a short walk to the tube station or to the river. A great value place to stay in London.

name: International Students  House
reviewtext: Lovely staff!! This hostel has the perfect location close to the Regent's park

name: International Students  House
reviewtext: I felt very safe, facilities were clean, staff were friendly, and the free breakfast was definitely a bonus

name: International Students  House
reviewtext:
The accomodation was basic but clean with plenty of space in the rooms.
I found the staff to be quite unfriendly and I felt like any interactions with them were rushed, they also weren't able to supply me with a VAT reciept upon checkout - I was just handed a card with some contact details and an excuse 'we're closed at weekends' - I was staying there Saturday night with a party of 5 across 2 rooms so this didn't make any sense...
Breakfast was included in the price which was a nice bonus.

name: International Students  House
reviewtext:
Great location, friendly staff.

The facilities themselves were quite nice, but currently in construction; everything covered in plastic, lots of people going back and forth, and noise during the day (although, not overwhelming from my room).
The room was nothing like in the picture, which is fine but surprising to find two bunk beds instead of one bed! Biggest problem was the lack of A/C when it was so hot, and it caused the humidity to spread in the room and caused a smell. Otherwise nice!

name: International Students  House
reviewtext: My room smelled disgusting.

name: International Students  House
reviewtext: Staff weren't overly helpful but it was super easy to navigate since it's close to a lot of train stations! Would stay again!

name: International Students  House
reviewtext: Pretty old fashioned building. Extremely hot weather meant rooms were too. Small fan and restricted windows did not help.

name: International Students  House
reviewtext: This was just an Okay place. Staff are super discriminatory and the whole time I was there my room was never cleaned! Such a sheer shame!!! It is perfectly located but this would be my last result for my next stay. Avoid this place at all costs!!!

name: International Students  House
reviewtext: I attended a scientific congress of computer science known as SAI-IEEE-Computing Conference-2018.

name: International Students  House
reviewtext: The location is great, very close to the tube station - however that is as far as I'd go on positives. We arrived too early to check in and there was a lot of confusion around leaving our luggage with staff trying to charge us for this at first. The private room was what was expected of a hostel however had no air con so was unbearably hot (on the hottest weekend of the year) leading to a VERY uncomfortable night with little sleep and my friend and I woke up covered in bites! Very disappointing!

name: International Students  House
reviewtext: Location and breakfast are very good, but the room was extremely hot, even when the temperature outside was quite cold, and ventilation is terrible, so wouldn't recommend during the Summer, as I could barely sleep. The showers are also not so good, water flows too disperse and you need to convince the lights you're still in there all the time. Maybe during the winter is ok overall, but for the Summer it's a no for me, especially given the price paid, if I happen to go to London again.

name: International Students  House
reviewtext: I got a private at the 5th floor. Worst idea during the summer! The room was so hot that i cant stand being inside! The location is great for regent's park and soho, bit dir the turistic London. Breakfast was fullfilling. Hard to find a spot to seat, however

name: International Students  House
reviewtext: I shall 100% stay again in International Students House the next time I return to London, the hostel is so clean and tidy and our room had an en suite which is virtually unheard of in hostels. Great price for what we got and the staff were very accommodating. The included breakfast was the highlight with hot food and pastries and everything you could need to start your day of adventuring! Right beside the underground and Regent's Park meaning you have the best of both worlds!

name: International Students  House
reviewtext: I paid Â£10 less to stay in a nearby YHA the night before and the experience was much better, I'd suggest going to them instead. This hostel is fine if there's nothing else available but it is overall very tired, grubby and poorly ventilated making the extremely cramped 4 bed dorms VERY hot all day and night. Also when I arrived both lifts were out of order meaning I had to walk up 4 flights of stairs to my dorm, not easy with a disability. The staff were mostly friendly but it's a crap hostel.

name: International Students  House
reviewtext: Needs to have good common kitchen

name: International Students  House
reviewtext:
Easy to get to 
Bathrooms are weird because they're split up. Sometimes there's just a toilet in a closet with no sink. Sometimes there's two showers no toilet. Only one bathroom on my floor was a complete bathroom with everything in it.

name: PubLove @ The Crown, Battersea
reviewtext: The showers could do with a bench to stop belongings from getting soaked. The room was extremely hot and stuffy and bathroom lacked power sockets.

name: PubLove @ The Crown, Battersea
reviewtext: No kitchen, microwave, or even hot water. Expensive for not having any accommodations

name: PubLove @ The Crown, Battersea
reviewtext: There was not service of the staff at all. For the money you pay I think we deserve more

name: PubLove @ The Crown, Battersea
reviewtext: We have already stayed at this hotel twice. Everytime it was a great choice, the hotel is very close to the centre, the atmosphere there is great, all stuff members are friendly and very helpful. This time we had a little bit noisy and uncleanly room-mates, but we enjoyed our stay there very much! Thank you!

name: PubLove @ The Crown, Battersea
reviewtext: Only problem was the rooms get very hot and the fans they use to keep the rooms cool are unbelievably load for me anyway so couldn't sllep very well

name: PubLove @ The Crown, Battersea
reviewtext: Really nice friendly hostel with a great pub on the ground floor. Zero ventilation in the bathrooms means that everything stays wet and stale all day. The rooms get very hot at night, and especially uncomfortable from the top of a triple bunk bed. Although there's no proper kitchen the staff are all happy to keep any food (i.e. milk etc) in a fridge to keep it fresh. Easily accessible by train and bus.

name: PubLove @ The Crown, Battersea
reviewtext: It's a really cool place to stay; downstairs is the pub and the staff was always friendly and willing to help. The dorms have a modern look and mine was big, with enough space to leave your luggage, even if I had to share it with several people (three bunk beds with 3 beds each- mixed room). The beds are sturdy enough to not listen to every movement from the anybody staying on the upper beds; the bathrooms are mostly clean and are also remodeled. I will certainly come back.

name: PubLove @ The Crown, Battersea
reviewtext: The room was really hot, but if you kept the windows open the breeze helped. The staff was amazing and the people we met were equally amazing. Every morning we had great conversation with people down in the pub. Food is great and you get a discount for staying there! I would recommend this hostel to anyone!

name: PubLove @ The Crown, Battersea
reviewtext: Great Hostelâ€”would forsure stay again. Floors of the dorms could be cleaner. The staff is overworked and has way too much to do, but despite this they were always helpful and so nice to all guests. The location is a bit out of city center but the metro/busses were very easy to manage once you get a pass for the days of your stay. We stayed in a 15 personâ€”which was loud at any and all times. This big dorm is a hit or miss since it really depends on the people staying in your room.

name: PubLove @ The Crown, Battersea
reviewtext: It was really hot when I stayed here but I asked the staff to do something about it and the girl came back with two fans! She was really helpful the whole time I stayed. The bathrooms are nice and kept tidy but the only downside was they ran out of toilet paper a couple of times. The only crappy part about this hostel is there is no kitchen to make your own food but they do give a discount at the pub. They pub has great food! I would definitely stay here again because it was well worth the money

name: PubLove @ The Crown, Battersea
reviewtext: The pub downstairs is beautiful and the food is amazing. It does however appear short staffed, there is one person manning the bar, pouring drinks and taking orders AND doing all the hostel check ins and dealing with customers. Also the wifi wasn't working the entire first day. However that being said the rooms were clean, bathrooms abundant and the staff very helpful when you did get time to talk to them!

name: Budget London Apartments
reviewtext: Myself and my friend stayed at the Buget London Apartments for 3 nights for Wireless Festival In London and I can truely say that it was perfect for us because we knew we wouldn't be spending much time in the rooms, it was good value for money and basic facilities like showers, fridges etc were up to good standard.

name: Budget London Apartments
reviewtext: The rooms were terribly dirty and unkept.  No one knew which beds where occupied and which were not.  It appeared that the bedding had not been changed on the beds for quite some time.  We had no hot water for our showers for the duration of our stay.   One evening we had no lights in the room, bathroom, or hallway.   There was no clear way to contact maintenance.  The manager came through with a new tenant (he tried to give him my bed), and said there was nothing he could do.

name: Strand Continental
reviewtext: It's a good deal for London. Main concern for me was that I got a room without Wifi which is a really basic thing nowadays

name: Strand Continental
reviewtext: The location is what sells this place! I was able to see and do so many things just by walking. The security was good, and for old the building was the cleanliness was decent. However at one point the water was so hot in the shower I couldn't even shower as it was scalding hot! I didn't have very much interaction with the staff. I would stay here again.

name: Strand Continental
reviewtext: No WiFi in the rooms- just in main dining area and wifi still sucked there.

name: Strand Continental
reviewtext: Showers were terrible either so boiling hot it was painful or freezing cold and the shower screen was broken so wouldn't stay closed. Also didn't seem as though they were being cleaned regularly. As a whole did not enjoy the stay and would not stay again or recommend to anyone, which is unfortunate as the location is fantastic.

name: Strand Continental
reviewtext: This is pretty dire. If all you want is a bed to sleep in, very well located and for an OK price, then this hostel would suit. That said, it felt somewhere between a halfway house and a hospital ward, with not enough room in the 4 bed dorm to swing a cat. No common room, no facilities, staff just there to check you in and out. All about location!

name: Strand Continental
