reviewtext: Amazing location, perfect for theatres and walking to mainline stations.  More air in rooms would have been a relief as windows can only open a fraction for security but light good.  There was a prob with only hot water in shower on our floor but hope thats to be resolved.   Room 31 single bed mattress needs replacing - springs gone.  Altogether it was all about location.  Kids could climb into bed after the Lion King!

name: Strand Continental
reviewtext: Great location! The showers could have used a little stool to put your clothes, but they worked fine otherwise. My room was on the 6th floor, so be aware that you might be climbing a lot of stairs. The door to get into the staircase was locked, but our individual room was not locked and there were no lockers, but my stuff was not stolen so that was not a problem. They have free luggage storage (before and after your stay), which was really helpful!

name: Strand Continental
reviewtext: If you want a place on the cheaper end then this is fine. Wifi only avail in the common area. Room verrrry small, but quiet so that was good.

name: Strand Continental
reviewtext: I needed somewhere to stay at short notice and this place was great. Brilliant location and very secure and clean

name: Strand Continental
reviewtext: Ideal location and very welcoming staff.  It's a very basic setup, but all I could ask for given the combination of a great price and great location.

name: Strand Continental
reviewtext: Staff was extremely friendly, especially the night clerk! If you're looking for a cheap place to spend the night in a good, central location I would suggest this.

name: Strand Continental
reviewtext:
The rooms were small and cramped. Overheated, no air flow whatsoever. Need more charging points. Humid and disgusting toilets and bathrooms. Disappointing breakfast. No lift. 
The only good thing about this Hostel was its location.

name: Strand Continental
reviewtext: Great place to stay if you only want the basics. Very clean, quiet. Excellent location. Wonderfully historic building.

name: Strand Continental
reviewtext: Good location but a bit expensive for what you get. Breakfast was pretty basic but the worst part was that I was put on the 5th floor with no elevator and I had a ton of heavy luggage. They do have a storage room on the first floor which helped but there was a massive heat wave and with no AC and just a small window that didn't provide any airflow, it felt like a sauna every night and must have been 30C in our room. Sure it would be much better in the winter or a cooler summer.

name: Strand Continental
reviewtext:
Good points
- Lovation is great!
- not a party hostel
- cheap stay
- staff were ok

Bad points
- no lockers in room, only a passport size locker at reception
- no fans/ ac and in the summer to hot to sleep
- very dated and low quality 
- no WiFi in rooms, only in common area

This hostel has so much potential!

A little bit of work and it would be a great great hostel!

But you get what you pay for! 

If you need a central place to crash in London for a night, then this is it!

name: Strand Continental
reviewtext: The cleanliness, comfort and staff were OK - definitely good value for money considering the location. Security wasn't great but the staff offered help to store more valuable belongings. I was staying in a dorm of 6, in which there were exactly 6 electrical sockets - 1 was visibly burnt and 2 were warped beyond usability. There was one top bunk bed without a guard rail, and it was not against a wall - I'm not sure this conforms to safety standards.

name: Strand Continental
reviewtext: It's fairly basic, but cheap and clean. The staff is friendly, there's a free breakfast, and the location is as central as you can get. Excellent value for money.

name: Strand Continental
reviewtext:
Great location, close to the West End and the theatres! Our room was tiny, but clean with toilets and showers just over the floor. The breakfast was perfectly fine for what we paid, especially since the room had a really nice atmosphere.
I'd only criticise the lack of wifi in the rooms and the lack of an elevator, but it's a perfect place for a short stay.

name: Strand Continental
reviewtext: Great location! room very hot (is summer time) as the window only able to open for few inches gap (for security reason?). motion detect sensor in the shower room need to be adjust as light gone off every 20sec

name: Strand Continental
reviewtext: I was able to book a private room so my stay was quite enjoyable The hostel is well situated and had all the usual facilities. I would stay again.

name: Strand Continental
reviewtext:
- lady at reception helpful
- Very cheap and central with many restaurants and thigs to do
- Extremely hot in rooms with no aircon
- Shower door didnt close properly so water went everywhere
- No sink to wash or dry hands after going to toilet only on the lobby level
- Beds are old but linen is given
- Very noisy from the street at all hours of the night

name: The Backpackshack
reviewtext: Very clean and quite ! Nice Pub with lots of shops around ! Close to subway .

name: The Backpackshack
reviewtext: Really expensive place to sleep for what it offers. Small room with a regular bed in an old building in a bad state. Difficult to sleep if you can get annoyed with a machine sound. Not sure about what it was, something like a big electric generator constantly running on. Room that feels old, shared bathroom without any possible lock and as it is inside a pub, at night you are there on your own, alone with the rest of the guest, no reception. It is just ok for a quick sleep and get out of there!!

name: The Backpackshack
reviewtext: If you want a simple nights stay within half an hour of the centre of London, this place is great. The room was spacious, The bed was comfy and the landlady very nice and helpful. Only issue would be the facilities; one bathroom the door didnt lock (due to the door swelling in the heat), in the other bathroom the shower didn't work, and the WiFi was really patchy. there wasn't any travellers atmosphere either, Maybe because it's a small hostel and the communal area is a pub. But overall enjoyed.

name: The Backpackshack
reviewtext: A very comfortable stay at the backpack shack. Host was very helpful would highly recommend.

name: The Backpackshack
reviewtext: Very welcoming and extremely helpful with everything you need. Great value for money. Short walk to underground and really easy to get into the city.

name: The Backpackshack
reviewtext: We had a wonderful time! Mags was very accommodating and so very welcoming. We had the pleasure of meeting a few locals who frequent the pub and they were all very nice an willing to chat with us. It is conveniently located near the underground and the neighborhood is great. Good places to eat, a grocery store and a post office just up the road. I can't wait to come back again.

name: The Backpackshack
reviewtext: Everything was fine with the exception of my room being too warm in the evening! As it was a rather sunny day when i checked in,the sun was shining onto the private 4-bed room. It stayed warm througout the night. It was more than 30 degrees and my family found it very hard to sleep.

name: The Backpackshack
reviewtext: Only stayed one night but price vs location for London was great. It was quiet and the room was clean and bigger than I expected. The shower pressure could have been better. Overall i would definitely stay again when I'm in the city.

name: Smart Hyde Park Inn Hostel
reviewtext: Good staying.

name: Smart Hyde Park Inn Hostel
reviewtext: the 20-bed bunk room was surprisingly private; beds were in stacked cubicles with curtains and personal power outlets. Breakfast was kind of shabby and the kitchen workers were strict with ending exactly at 10:00 pm. The common areas were great and I met a few other adventurers and swapped stories. Location is right by Hyde Park, which has a ton of sightseeing.

name: Smart Hyde Park Inn Hostel
reviewtext: We stayed on the last floor; it was too hot so all guests slept with open Doors.   We asked at reception to open roof window and although they said "yes off course ", it was not done. We could not breath - so hot it was all night. Same the near guests. And water in shower was very hot too. Some stuff were very kind, some not very profesional. Everything was perfectly clean  and location is great. But only because of heat I would not come again.

name: Smart Hyde Park Inn Hostel
reviewtext: Staff were slow, no one had cleaned our bed when we arrived, lockers damaged and could of easily been broken in to, and the heat in the room was unbearable, physically couldn't sleep due to the lack of air conditioning, this place needs work and staff that care more about their jobs.

name: Smart Hyde Park Inn Hostel
reviewtext: Terrible. Very small rooms with luggage everywhere. No living room, no games, no atmosphere. The only good thing is the location, really close to Hyde Park...

name: Smart Hyde Park Inn Hostel
reviewtext:
Need Cleanliness in the hostel, the bedding was very dirty. 
Limited washrooms, long queues .

name: The Lodge at Crystal Palace
reviewtext:
Very basic hostel accommodation but very close to Crystal Palace stadium for sports like beach volleyball. 
Ensuite good. Triple rooms. Clean enough. Basic continental breakfast so overall good value for money. In the grand scheme of things it all needs knocked down and a new Crystal Palace complex.

name: The Lodge at Crystal Palace
reviewtext:
Pretty basic and no frills! Whilst the staff were great, the breakfast good and the price very cheap for the location, the rooms are very basic and dated and definitely the cheapest/most uncomfortable mattress I have ever ''tried' to sleep on. As we were off cycling to Paris I decided I didn't need to risk the shower.
But, it's a hostel in London and very cheap - so maybe you get what you pay for.

name: The Lodge at Crystal Palace
reviewtext: Lovely views from the 9th floor of this tower! Breakfast very good. Shops are a bit of a walk but you are in the middle of a huge park. Free laundry, peaceful, great value. Will be going back.

name: The Lodge at Crystal Palace
reviewtext: Great setting, in the middle of the park. Simple and good value. Friendly staff.

name: The Lodge at Crystal Palace
reviewtext:
Hi, When we arrived from a long drive, the man on reception said that there was no public toilets and my partner really wanted to use a toilet.
Then when i went to pay, he said to me athat it was cash only and that he had no card machine.He tole me that i could go to an ATM outside the park. I was going to do this as we had a bicycle and a lot of luggage and a chile asleep in the car, so it did not suit. No cash machine in this day and age is crazy.Toilets were poor also.

name: The Lodge at Crystal Palace
reviewtext: Excellent location , Wonderful staff, basic facilities but clean and value for the price

name: The Lodge at Crystal Palace
reviewtext: Very nice staff. Bed linen and towels very clean. Comfortable mattress. Shared toilet ok, and clean. Breakfast all right. Location, in the middle of the park. Our door could not be locked from the inside, and we saw many things that should be repaired. Excellent reception! We slept very well there, had a wonderful night sleep. Appropriated for a short trip, not romantic trip, not for families with children.

name: The Lodge at Crystal Palace
reviewtext: Out of the way hostel. Seemed rather creepy to me overall. Plus I didn't get any sleep because there was a mouse that kept coming into my room whenever I turned the lights out. Wasn't able to get the shower to work in the morning either before checkout which is a bit early (9). Didn't have a locker in the room which was fine for me because only I stayed there that night. There was also a sink in my room but no soap. Front desk was very nice though.

name: The Lodge at Crystal Palace
reviewtext: Very convenient place to stay and well located! Staff were lovely and friendly, would recommend this hostel if you plan to be at a festival/event in Central London because it is easy to get to!

name: The Lodge at Crystal Palace
reviewtext: Great location. Good value for the price.

name: The Lodge at Crystal Palace
reviewtext: Cheap, clean and slap bang in the middle of Crystal Palace park.  Did the job perfectly.  But be warned that this place is seriously run down, with rotting walls in bathrooms and a generally tired institutional feel.  It feels as though they are doing the minimum upkeep as a preclude to knocking this place down.  In summary, perfectly fine as clean, simple place to sleep and great to be able to walk out into the park.  But decaying atmosphere that would grate for more than one or two nights.

name: Chelsea House Hotel
reviewtext: Expecting a traditional hostel I was pleasantly surprised to show up and see that it's a hotel. Great value for the price, close to the subway and in a good area. We would definitely stay here again.

name: Chelsea House Hotel
reviewtext: Decent enough and clean. 5 minute walk from Earls Court tube station. A few bars and restaurants near to hotel. Clean with comfortable bed and shower was big but could do with a bit more power. All in all, a good stay and I would definitely stay here again and I recommend this hotel.

name: Chelsea House Hotel
reviewtext: Terrible rooms, windows didn't open during a heat wave, staff never around, extremely rude owner. Booked to stay 5 days but barely made it 3 before the heat in the room made my mother sick so we had to leave. Good location, but nothing else positive to say about this place. I do not recommend to stay here.

name: Chelsea House Hotel
reviewtext: Breakfast was supposedly served from 7.30 Sat and from 8am Sun. But each day we went down for breakfast, the lady who does it only turned up at 7.30 and 8am, so on Sunday we had to miss it altogether as we had to be at a conference by 9 and it wasnt even being started till just after 8. (Sat, the cheese was curled up at the edges and looked like it had been in and out a few times!) Certainly not the best we've had for the money and we stay regularly in Earls Court.

name: PubLove @ The Green Man, Paddington
reviewtext: There was not breakfast as they advetise in the web.

name: PubLove @ The Green Man, Paddington
reviewtext: Great value hostel. Next door to the tube so very convenient also. Discounts for guests at the pub downstairs too (which had a good selection of beers and burgers). Only slight is the staff were as warm and friendly as a chest infection - but so be it.

name: PubLove @ The Green Man, Paddington
reviewtext: Never go back again,staff is so bad , service is extremely unprofessional. Not recommended only good thing is very close to tube station.

name: PubLove @ The Green Man, Paddington
reviewtext: Good although it was really really hot in the bedrooms. The best part of the hostel the bathrooms. The showers are amazing and very clean.

name: PubLove @ The Green Man, Paddington
reviewtext: I stayed in the 9 bed hostel room. The showers and bathrooms were good, however the hot water did not want to work for me while showering. I didn't mind it that bad as the room I stayed in was extremely hot. I visited in July and it was hot with no air conditioning. Everyone in the room complained about how hot it was. The lady that worked downstairs didn't seem too friendly, not sure if that is just how her personality is. Everyone else seemed fairly nice.

name: PubLove @ The Green Man, Paddington
reviewtext: Place was nice and cheap! Toilet and shower facilities are good, beds are nice and comfy. Room is very hot but still worth it for the cheap price!

name: PubLove @ The Green Man, Paddington
reviewtext: Good location and okay room that had no air conditioning, we ended up sleeping on the floor as it was the only way of staying cool ! Also the woman on duty was appalling rude on multiple occasions. She obviously doesn't enjoy her job and that was apparent in her customer service. I would understand if we were awkward, loud and annoying however we were considerbaly accommodating considering the service we received. I definitely wouldn't stay here again and would advise anyone to look elsewhere !!

name: PubLove @ The Green Man, Paddington
reviewtext:
An OK option if you've been to London before, or don't need much assistance from staff. Very much just a bed to crash in, literally metres from Edgware Rd tube station. 

However, make sure you don't visit in summer. My room was so hot I was literally dripping in sweat, despite it being 20 degrees C outside. The only help staff could provide was "leave the door open". I'd read reviews and figured it would be fine but i got no more than a few hours of sleep. Overall, a very average hostel.

name: PubLove @ The Green Man, Paddington
reviewtext:
Although we did enjoy our stay there were a few things which were disappointing. 
The bedrooms at night were extremely hot as there was no air conditioning and therefore we needed to leave the windows open which was extremely loud as the hostel is located on a main road. 
The staff overall were not friendly and there were a few instances which we felt we were an inconvenience when asking for help. 
Also we stayed in a room for 9 people and there were only 4 large lockers.

name: PubLove @ The Green Man, Paddington
reviewtext: We stayed during the hottest days in London. That said, it was very disappointing not to have air conditioning or a fan. Windows didn't work properly and we blocked them so air could enter. Besides that, everything was fine. Staff was super friendly and helpful, bathrooms and rooms were cleaned daily (even dough people let WCs very nasty). Room had 3 triple-bunk-beds (9 persons) and we would appreciate more big lockers for suitcases (only 4 and without a lock). 25% discount brunch is great!

name: PubLove @ The Green Man, Paddington
reviewtext: I must say that it takes quite a bit for me to be compelled to write a review. Over the last ten years I've stayed at dozens of hostels, and experienced both highs and lows.This hostel unquestionably takes the cake for the  absolute worst I've  experienced.The staff was rude and detached.The facilities-well, there are none aside from a sub-par pub.Worse, the beds cramped and noisy, lockers too small, and window only opens an inch!Be prepared for a hellish night of unbearable heat and body odor

name: PubLove @ The Green Man, Paddington
reviewtext: The hostel is lovely, the location is quite central. Beds are comfortable enough for a shared room.

name: PubLove @ The Green Man, Paddington
reviewtext: Location was great as it is walking distance to Paddington which is where I arrived after catching the heathrow express, and departed from to journey elsewhere. Staff really friendly and made it easy for me to extend my stay by a night. Rooms looked and felt new, which meant my bathroom was super clean and spacious. The pub downstairs is really nice and has great selection of drinks and food, all contributing to a good vibe :)

name: PubLove @ The Green Man, Paddington
reviewtext: The Pub attached was nice and the rooms very very cozy. I only stayed one night and the next morning I was covered in bites from what look to be spiders. Besides the that this was a decent hostel if you want the pub vibe close to where your staying.

name: New Cross Inn Hostel
reviewtext: Fantastic

name: New Cross Inn Hostel
reviewtext: The main problem I had was with the cleanliness. My bed had stains on it and the window in my room was busted and replaced with cardboard. Otherwise it was a pleasant stay.

name: New Cross Inn Hostel
reviewtext:
The hostel is great!
The price includes free breakfast, which is just awesome! My friend and I were staying in Female Room for 4 and it was great! It was spacious, clean and we had our own bathroom. The location is good as well, the nearest tube station is the New Cross Overground line and it's a 5 minute walk from the hostel.
People are nice and friendly. There's also a luggage room, which is cool if you need to leave your belongings there and explore the city.
Definitely recommend it!

name: New Cross Inn Hostel
reviewtext: The 24hrs front desk is really useful if you're arriving late. Free breakfast and close to the station are a plus.

name: New Cross Inn Hostel
reviewtext: Location didn't feel very safe. Many dodgy people hanging around the street at night shouting and screaming. Bed bugs.

name: New Cross Inn Hostel
reviewtext: Had a great stay here! Shout out to Kyle for making me feel so welcome ðŸ˜Š

name: New Cross Inn Hostel
reviewtext:
I did not like staying at this hostel, for many reasons. First, if you want to sleep at night, you can't, because the hostel is next to a concert bar and they play/make noise until late (one evening they stopped at 2). The hostel is old, not so clean â€”my linens were dirty before I could sleep inâ€” and it generally smells bad. The bathrooms are not comfortable. The breakfast is ridiculous. Also, there's not room enough for all the guests, especially in the communal area.
Sorry but never again.

name: New Cross Inn Hostel
reviewtext: Had a great stay here, especially the staff was very nice. I only wish they would put different bins for recycling.

name: New Cross Inn Hostel
reviewtext: Amazing Hostel! The manager Kyle is the best!

name: New Cross Inn Hostel
reviewtext: This was my first time ever in a hostel and I had a great time experience..Ultra friendly staff!!!! Lots of shops for everything you may need..My only complaint is the pub next store which has live music daily and very loud.. however the music stops by 11:00 pm.. I would recommend this hostel, lots of diversity of Nations and very friendly people..

name: New Cross Inn Hostel
reviewtext: My stay at this hostel was ruined by the unprofessionalism I experienced at checkout. She accused me of lying and trying to steal money from the hostel when I said I didn't remember if I put down a deposit for my room key. I understand that I should've known if I put down a deposit, but WHY WASN'T THERE A RECORD OF IT IN MY FILE. I have never experienced this level of unorganization at other hostels. I will not be returning here, nor do I  recommend this place. Please train the staff better.

name: New Cross Inn Hostel
reviewtext: the only one thing i can remark was the temperature at the rooms, really hot.  besides that an excelent stay.

name: Smart Camden Inn Hostel
reviewtext: Everything you need from a basic hostel, especially for the price (considering how expensive London is!). Camden is a great borough of London and a perfect base to get around without needing to be in the centre all the time.

name: Smart Camden Inn Hostel
reviewtext:
Tiny rooms with so little space my bag had to be on top of someone else's. 8 beds is too much for a 5x5 metres room with no ventilation other than a tiny window half of wich was covered.
 Reception staff was really friendly but of the 2 cleaning staff one of them was extremely rude all the time, to everyone.
 My advise is to just look for something else.

name: Smart Camden Inn Hostel
reviewtext: You get what you pay for with this place. It's so basic and pretty damn claustrophobic. Don't go here during the summer cause it's so hot inside, you won't sleep and the fan in our room didn't even work. Also they say check in is at one on here but when we got there, they said check in is at two which messed up our day a bit cause we had to be somewhere at two.

name: Smart Camden Inn Hostel
reviewtext: Clean and friendly hostel with a decent free breakfast. 6 share room was pretty pokey and was hard to find space to put a bag. Had to hire a locker which was a bit annoying. Overall decent enough accommodation for a bed to sleep in, in a very good London location.

name: Smart Camden Inn Hostel
reviewtext: Good place to stay if your needs are basic. Rooms can get hot, but there isn't much to do about that. Nice community area downstairs with kitchen, TV room, and outside area.

name: Smart Camden Inn Hostel
reviewtext:
Great value!
Just to be clear - This is a hostel not a hotel.
I arrived extremely late at night and was welcomed by a nice, efficient staff member.
Fresh sheets, comfy beds, shower, large lockers in each dorm, electric plug beside each bunk. Lovely patio out the back, washing machine, lounge area and free WiFi. Nice staff and clean premises. Breakfast included and all for Â£16 a night in the centre of Camden Town!!!
Will definitely be staying there again!

name: Smart Camden Inn Hostel
reviewtext: Very basic, but perfectly fine for what I needed - a bed for a few hours sleep and a shower in the morning.

name: Smart Camden Inn Hostel
reviewtext: Rooms were really hot and no air with the window open was coming in. Environment felt awkward no one talks and specifically my room no one had some respect towards you trying to sleep or having some quite time. If this is your only option you will be fine here but if there are others I would recommend staying at another place.

name: YHA London Thameside
reviewtext: This a great hostel. Staff are friendly and helpful. Room are nice and clean. Will recommend 100%.

name: YHA London Thameside
reviewtext: Great stay at this hostel! The location was not close to attractions and you had to take the overground/underground, the bus or walk about 30/40 minutes to get to locations. The overall hostel was very clean and the staff was nice and helpful! Many families with younger children here as well but still a nice atmosphere!

name: YHA London Thameside
reviewtext: Decent hostel. Lots of children present in travel groups. Kind of felt like a YMCA. Rooms get quite toasty at night with no AC and restricted window opening.

name: YHA London Thameside
reviewtext: I booked a private 4-bed room for my family who were visiting London, and it turned out to be a good experience. The room was very clean, with a lamp and USB charging outlet next to every bed, and had its own bathroom. Good common area downstairs, and an outside areas with some tables.

name: YHA London Thameside
reviewtext:
The location is fairly distant from London attractions, but offers a quietness if that's what you want. This hostel accommodates a lot of student groups so if loud middle schoolers aren't your thing, it's best to look elsewhere.

I  was surprised to find there's no aircon in the whole building. The rooms were bearable with windows open but the common area downstairs was miserable. Definitely not a place to hangout in the day if it's hot.

name: YHA London Thameside
reviewtext: good security and staff. rooms were a good size and very clean.

name: YHA London Thameside
reviewtext: Very nice and clean. Good atmosphere and friendly stuff. Nice security arrangements like separate keys for the rooms + cards providing access only to the areas/floors you're living. There could be more lockers though (I arrived late and found no locker left for me in the room). Comfortable beds with lights and sockets. En-suite bathroom in each bedroom which is very convenient. Lots of school children at the time I was staying there. Generally positive experience.

name: YHA London Thameside
reviewtext: The hostel was great the staff were great. The atmosphere was a bit dead and also there were alot of school children.

name: YHA London Thameside
reviewtext: Amazing place. Bed was very comfortable, and the staff extremely helpful. Only downside was how far it was from all the sites.

name: PubLove @ The White Ferry, Victoria
reviewtext: Nothing to write home about. Maybe it was the night I was there but there was not much of a social scene. The rooms were sparse and the lockers too small to fit any bags in them. It was in a quiet, residential neighborhood that was far from the tube station. I would not recommend this to someone looking to enjoy London's nightlife or the ability to get to the touristy areas easily.

name: PubLove @ The White Ferry, Victoria
reviewtext: Hostel was good. Nice location and 5 kind walk to Victoria coach station. The only issue I saw was bathrooms, were not clean.

name: PubLove @ The White Ferry, Victoria
reviewtext: The staff was very friendly and helpful. My only issue was the actual room. You could hear everyone out in the hallway and the beds were so close together that you could were almost right next to other people. This wouldn't have been a problem except the guy next to me would grind his teeth every 15 minutes and wake everyone up. I guess that's more of a personal experience than the hostel's fault, but still figured I'd mention it. Other than that, it seemed ok.

name: PubLove @ The White Ferry, Victoria
reviewtext: We  had a great time staying here! The staff were all very friendly and lovely and once we arrived here, we were a bit reluctant to leave because of the brilliant atmosphere! The beds were very comfy, and we got a nice breakfast in the morning. If I were to go to London again I would choose this place again.

name: PubLove @ The White Ferry, Victoria
reviewtext:
No kitchen, no utensils, just rooms with beds over pub.
But the location is great, staff is helpful and the continental breakfast is good

name: PubLove @ The White Ferry, Victoria
reviewtext: showerss a bit shoddy, floors constantly flooded, could do  with refurbishing, some rooms with larger beds better than others

name: PubLove @ The White Ferry, Victoria
reviewtext: Could have been a even a little cleaner. There was no hot water or towels available for a shower. The staff were nice.

name: PubLove @ The White Ferry, Victoria
reviewtext: Staff is really nice. Location is very good. But they don't know what hygiene is.

name: PubLove @ The White Ferry, Victoria
reviewtext: If you want cheap and excellent location this is the place. However, it wasn't cleanest place and in the morning all of the toilets where blocked and overflowing

name: PubLove @ The White Ferry, Victoria
reviewtext: The facility was very nice and central location! The rooms  had AC and curtains for privacy. Differently recommend this hostel ðŸ‘

name: PubLove @ The White Ferry, Victoria
reviewtext:
Great location being close to the bus station and city centre, but to get to the closest shop would require at least 10-15 mins walk. Pub is nice but the beverages are expensive. Staffs are alright and the place is clean. 

Though the bunkbeds are very narrow and there is not much space in the room. It's very cramped. Alright for those to stay for a night or two in London, especially if you are changing transport but anything more than that there are better options in town I am sure.

name: PubLove @ The White Ferry, Victoria
reviewtext: Just like to say the staff were so helpful and friendly. Would gladly stay here again.

name: PubLove @ The White Ferry, Victoria
reviewtext: This hostel is conveniently located near Victoria Station and the staff were helpful, but it was sorely lacking in terms of cleanliness. It must be difficult to maintain a clean environment when there are 24 people to a room, but the bathroom floors had lots of standing water, the toilets were frequently not flushed or clogged, and the shower had lots of visible mold. I ended up deciding not to spend my second night in this hostel, but the price is hard to beat if you can stomach the conditions.

name: PubLove @ The White Ferry, Victoria
reviewtext:
Apart from being well located (easy to get to Victoria train and bus stations), this place was atrocious. Staff frequently gave out incorrect information such as kitchen usage (you will not be able to use any kitchen facilities!) and their supposed 24 hour reception was perhaps better advertised as 'maybe someone is here but they're asleep'. More than one person encountered bedbugs. The showers were the grossest I've come across - hair clogged drains for days on end.

DO NOT BOOK HERE.

name: PubLove @ The White Ferry, Victoria
reviewtext:
+++ Bedbugs Alert +++

It's been a week since I have stayed at this hostel and I am still having marks from my bed bug's bites. I have only picked this hostel because of its close proximity to Victoria Station. However, next time I will rather read the reviews first and make my decision afterwards. Location is top though! Showers are simply disgusting, bring flipflops!

name: PubLove @ The White Ferry, Victoria
reviewtext: People that worked there were super friendly and helpful! Was a great location as well, easy walking distance to Hyde park, Buckingham Palace, and Westminster Abbey. However, one of the bathrooms didn't work the whole time and 1 of the showers had visible mold in them. Obviously that shower didn't smell great either. No room in the room to put your things, my bag was always packed for fear of it getting mixed up with someone else's things.

name: PubLove @ The White Ferry, Victoria
reviewtext: ì—¬í–‰ì¤‘ ì²˜ìŒì´ë‚˜ ë§ˆì§€ë§‰ì— ìž ê¹ ìžˆê¸°ì—ëŠ” ë‚˜ì˜ì§€ ì•Šì€ê±° ê°™ì•„ìš”.

name: PubLove @ The White Ferry, Victoria
reviewtext:
Worst hostel I've ever stayed in!!
Couldn't check in until staff finished  her cigarette. After I got to my room, turns out the door doesn't lock. I asked if it would be fixed, the same woman assured me it would that evening.. it wasn't. Only one shower worked and was broken and leaking. Broken toilets. Man came into the room at midnight to shine torch in my face!! Maybe he was staff or ex resident?
Very unsafe filthy place and was getting bitten during the night.
Place should be shut down!!

name: PubLove @ The White Ferry, Victoria
reviewtext: To anyone who reads this, please be careful!! Any good aspects of this hostel are completely negated by the fact that the whole building is absolutely 100% infested with bed bugs. Please take this as a warning and stay away! I've stayed at many hostels some of them very dirty with cleanliness issues but none of them have been infested with bedbugs especially to the extent that this one was with them literally crawling on the pillows.

name: PubLove @ The White Ferry, Victoria
reviewtext: Staff weren't friendly. I was overcharged for the room. The bathrooms were filthy and flooded.

name: PubLove @ The White Ferry, Victoria
reviewtext:
The room was packed with people 
Felt suffocating with 24 people in a room with no fan / AC 
But the location was great

name: PubLove @ The White Ferry, Victoria
reviewtext:
The hostel lacked organization. My bed have been assigned to other persons, most of the beds are broken, I found little cockroaches under my pillow (and walking over my body at night), someone opened my luggage during the night, the toilets are usually dirt and coggled, there was dirt water dropping from the ceiling, and the floor smell like beer.
Besides that, the place is in a very good location and two guys from the staff (only these two) were very polite.

name: PubLove @ The White Ferry, Victoria
reviewtext: Overall very good value for money. One small observation, when I paid my deposit it was in euros, the bill was in pounds sterling and I paid the balance in pounds sterling. I reckon you can charge Irish customers in sterling for the deposit. Easier to keep everything in the same currency.  I may have opted to pay deposit in euro, I can't remember but if I did them the bill and balance should be in euro as well. It really doesn't matter euro or sterling but not both.  Overall good experience.

name: PubLove @ The White Ferry, Victoria
reviewtext: I mean, we showed up and put our bags to the assigned beds after having gone to the wrong "publove" and only arriving at 9pm. However it was soon discovered that they had double booked beds and we had no where to stay that night . Although it was an inconvenience the owner was very helpful

name: PubLove @ The White Ferry, Victoria
reviewtext: Decent breakfast, easy sleep, good location, great staff and good prices at the bar ðŸ˜ŽâœŒï¸

name: The Finnish Church in London
reviewtext:
I was going to an event at Excel for the weekend so this was a very convenient place to stay. The sheets, rooms, shower and toilet facilities were all very clean. The staff were very kind and were happy to answer any questions you had.

I was woken up in the early hours of the morning due to someone turning the light on while they were packing their bags but this was not the hostel's fault.

If I needed to stay in a similar location I would be likely to return to this hostel.

name: The Finnish Church in London
reviewtext: Small, clean and modern hostel about a 5 minute walk from Canada Water tube station. As this is truly a church, you will have to walk past the the altar to get to the rooms. Tough my room had tea making facilities, it had no cups!

name: The Finnish Church in London
reviewtext:
Lovely building, not too far from Canada Works tube station (about 5-10 min walk).  Staff were really friendly, explained how everything worked, and showed me around.  The room was a mixed 4 bed, that had 2 bunk beds with a bathroom en suite.  
I stayed with my teenage daughter.  It was her first time in a hostel and, even though she was a bit apprehensive about it initially she did like it as it was such a nice place.
Breakfast was a bit basic but more than adequate

name: The Finnish Church in London
reviewtext: A sedate hostel - very clean and comfortable. Reasonably priced for London. In a good location - short walk to Tube and right near a park on the Thames (can see Southbank). The staff were very friendly and accommodating, and there were even vegan pastries for sale. Breakfast was included, which was nice. The bathrooms were clean. The shower could do with some ventilation but that could be said for a lot of places in the UK. Very secure building with swipe card access. I'd stay again if in LDN.

name: PubLove @ The Exmouth Arms, Euston
reviewtext:
The room (6 bed mixed) was quite spacious. Toilets and showers were clean and well-kept.
After the pub has closed guests must knock on the door and show a card in order to enter. I was allowed to sit in the closed pub after hours.
Door codes are used rather than keys or keycards.
A towel can be bought (not rented) for 5 pounds.
Late checkout is claimed but that's not true. Checkout is at 10am, which is earlier than normal. However, it's possible the staff do not strictly enforce this.

name: PubLove @ The Exmouth Arms, Euston
reviewtext: Lovely room, great location next to the Eustion Station. Discount in the pub - however would give the breakfast a miss, not well cooked. I would go and find breakfast else where.

name: PubLove @ The Exmouth Arms, Euston
reviewtext: My bf & I were in a 8 bedroom. Good location- I think Euston Square St is a 4 min walk. The pub was cool- great vibe, burgers, drinks & staff. Downside was we stayed during the heat wave & there was no aircon or fans. We booked 5 nights but stayed 2. Only reason we left was bcos I came back early one morn & some jackass was sleeping in my bed w my eye mask, neck pillow & jacket that I'd left on the bed. Staff understood how uncomfortable I was & gave a full refund (thanks again) Would stay again

name: PubLove @ The Exmouth Arms, Euston
reviewtext: Booked this hostel last minute after my cousin (who'd booked our hotel!) dropped out of a hen weekend and I was left having to rebook everything. Ideally situated for Euston station, the underground and being "touristy". First day I walked down to Trafalgar Square last all the theatres and felt completely safe at all times - including at night. The hostel itself could do with a bit of a spruce up - repainting rooms etc but otherwise perfect place to stay for a weekend!

name: PubLove @ The Exmouth Arms, Euston
reviewtext:
I just stayed one night but it was really nice, the atmosphere downstairs is super cool and the staff was amazing!!
Thanks Becky for this great evening!!!
Will be back for sure and highly recommend!!!

name: PubLove @ The Exmouth Arms, Euston
reviewtext: Hostel is a realy dirty place. Rooms are way to hot in summer, not possible to sleep, was like a sauna, no ventilation possible. Bathroom is a disaster, realy extreemly dirty. Pub is nice and OK. Would not recommend to sleep.

name: PubLove @ The Exmouth Arms, Euston
reviewtext: Filthy, badly maintained but super convenient location. There was dust all over the floor, the garbage bin was overflowing. Some hours after we checked in the room had had been half heartedly swept, but was still dirty. Some of the bathrooms were very smelly, some showers did not have a handle for the shower head or hooks for clothes. I would only suggest staying here if you just need a place to sleep before getting on a train at Euston station early the next day. It was an unpleasant experience

name: PubLove @ The Exmouth Arms, Euston
reviewtext: Absolutely terrible stay. The room was ridiculously hot and there was no air flow at all. I didn't sleep throughout the night and resorted to sitting in the bar all night. Staff were incompetent and unfriendly. Door lock was broken so anyone could get in. This place should get a 0 rating. Absolutely terrible do not go here.

name: PubLove @ The Exmouth Arms, Euston
reviewtext:
Dirty dirty rooms. So much dust on the floor it actually covered it all. Couldn't walk bare foot due to dirt. A left over towel on my bed. 

The window opened a fraction and it was so hot none of us slept. The ''mattress' was plastic which caused even more issues. It was baking. 

The bathroom was disgusting. Dirty floor, overflowing bins, toilet flush broken. 

I have stayed in hostels all over the world and many in London and this was one of the worst. Regardless of price.

name: PubLove @ The Exmouth Arms, Euston
reviewtext: Arrived to find someone in my bed and "walked in on" the same naked guy five times in one day. They were short staffed, so service was also slow.

name: Aquarius Hotel
reviewtext: Staff unpleasant, cleanliness to improve and breakfast really cheap, the good location of the hostel is his only good point

name: PubLove @ The Steam Engine, Waterloo
reviewtext: This was a decent hostel - however the lockers are small and can't fit a big bag and the bathrooms need a little sprucing- great for a one night stay though as fairly convenient!

name: PubLove @ The Steam Engine, Waterloo
reviewtext: Pictures used to advertise are misleading! The rooms looked nothing like the clean pics posted online. The walls were filthy with grime and dust that looked like it had been there for years. There were multiple plumbing issues in the bathrooms, toilets that wouldn't flush properly and sinks out of order. Would not have booked here had I known this ahead of time. Cramped dorms and bedrooms. Friendly, helpful staff and great location.

name: PubLove @ The Steam Engine, Waterloo
reviewtext:
Just a good place to sleep that's decently close to pretty much everything. 

Pros: cheap, had shampoo available, hot shower, food and drinks downstairs

Cons: bathrooms flooded after showers, gets hot in the summer with no AC, 12 person rooms can be crowded, had to pay for lockers (which no one does

name: PubLove @ The Steam Engine, Waterloo
reviewtext: Perfect for what I needed! It was cheap, easy to find, friendly staff - particularly the night watch bar staff (good luck with your comedy gigs!!).

name: PubLove @ The Steam Engine, Waterloo
reviewtext: Hostel definitely needs to be updated, the rooms literally had nothing except for the bunk beds (triple bunks I might add) with no where to sit down. The bathrooms were mouldy and very old, only one shower was working at the time so you would often have to wait to shower. The bathroom floors were also constantly wet as I don't think there were floor drains, and the plumbing in the sinks wasn't great either as the sink would fill right up every time you washed your hands. Wouldn't stay here again

name: PubLove @ The Steam Engine, Waterloo
reviewtext: DO NOT STAY HERE! This place is AWFUL! The "reception" is a pub, so you have to lug all your luggage through the pub, behind some tiny ally way, up one tiny creaky staircase to you get the only level. It was so dirty. There are 4 rooms with 9 beds each. And 2 showers and 2 toilets. FOR ALL 36 GUESTS! Not to mention NEITHER SHOWER WORKED and the state of them were DISGUSTING. we booked 3 nights and left the first night and found an apartment for just double the price. Would NOT RECOMMEND!

name: PubLove @ The Steam Engine, Waterloo
reviewtext: The staff here is awesome! The hostel is above a cute little Pub that is open 24 hours for guests! There was a good mix of people and I enjoyed my stay here. Only thing to note is that the dorms are quite 'cozy'...they were three high bunks with 12 in a room. It was fine for me and the price was good, but if you need a little space this might be too packed for you. I loved this spot though!

name: PubLove @ The Steam Engine, Waterloo
reviewtext: If you're looking for a place in the heart of London for convenience to all the tourist destinations, this is the place to be. If you're looking for comfort and cleanliness, look elsewhere. The amount of dust bunnies I collected when picking my backpack off the floor was horrendous. There are only 2 showers and 2 toilets for about 50 people, and only one of the showers has running hot water. Both flood the floor around it. Food in the pub is decent, but nothing to turn heads over. Staff did job.

name: PubLove @ The Steam Engine, Waterloo
reviewtext: It was not a great hostel in my opinion. It was only two showers and bathrooms for 42 people. The bar on the ground floor is nice and a good place to hangout but that was probably the only positive. There also was only 4 outlets in a room for 12 people which is not nearly as many as was needed.

name: PubLove @ The Steam Engine, Waterloo
reviewtext: Hostel changed our booking and split our group into two separate rooms without telling us. No reply to email on the matter.

name: PubLove @ The Steam Engine, Waterloo
reviewtext:
We loved the atmosphere and the staff at the Steam Engine. They were friendly, funny, welcoming, all that you can ask for! The beds were comfy and the rooms pretty quiet considering there was a bar under us and the street just outside. The hostel is also extremely well located. 
Our only issue would be the bathrooms. While they were clean for the most part, the floors were often flooded from shower water. We think the bathrooms could use a little update to make this place even greater!

name: PubLove @ The Steam Engine, Waterloo
reviewtext: Stayed here for 2 nights. Atmosphere was great and everyone was lovely. So convenient having the pub right downstairs for drinks and food (also a bonus 25% of brunch menu for guests.. that includes smashed avo). Lockers are provided, and you require a code to enter hostel and your room. Location is ideal. Right next to a tube station and a short walk to the London Eye. The cleaner comes daily and cleans all bathrooms and bedrooms, very friendly and does a great job. Will definitely be back!!

name: London365 Hostel
reviewtext: We're were told we were going to get an upgrade, on arrival this didn't happen. The room was uncomfortably hot and windows only opened a crack so impossible to get any air in. At one stage we were standing near the open fridge trying to cool down. We left the door open to let a breeze in the first day, but after that there was men in the room next to use smoking what I assume was marijuana and the pungent aroma meant that we had to suffer in the boiling heat again. No staff on arrival.

name: London365 Hostel
reviewtext: The shared bathrooms are cleaned only twice a week, there are three kitchen but as many pots, the beds were mattresses on some underconstruction (nevertherless, quite confortable). All of that could be expected by the cheap price. The part that leads to our bad review was mainly that we could not lock our room. The caretaker told us twice that he filed a repport and that it will be fixed the next day - nothing happend on our 5 night stay! Not acceptable and impossible treatment! Never again

name: Antigallican Hotel
reviewtext: So dirty, mouldy and damp that we couldn't stay.  I sat on the bed and got my trousers wet from the sheets. Everything broken and run down. Looked like a c***k den.

name: Antigallican Hotel
reviewtext: Nice stuff, nice price, nice location....

name: Antigallican Hotel
reviewtext: Stayed 3 nights with family at the Antigallican in two rooms. Safe and and clean with helpful staff, but about 45-60 min from downtown London. Victorian-era building on a busy road, with some issues using the hot water/shower, but fine overall and very affordable. No A/C and no breakfast, but large common kitchen with fridge. Train from Charleton Station is 1 block away, but takes about same time as bus/tube on Jubilee line downtown.

name: Antigallican Hotel
reviewtext: Excellent value for money, rooms ideal for showering and sleeping, and easy to find and access.

name: Antigallican Hotel
reviewtext: pretty easy to get here.  The staff I interacted with were nice and helpful.  The room was slightly closterphobic for me with one window very high.  I did spot ants on my table with the coffee machine so I made sure to keep all my stuff zipped.  Next to a very noisy street but I became prepared with a white noise machine, ear plugs and an eye mask.  Pretty decent shower for a hostel too.

name: Hootananny Hostel
reviewtext: Overall, the best hostel in London for me. The Hoot is quite unique, the vibe is more like a big house and it has that communal and positive feel to it. The living room and kitchen are great and really spacious (such a rare thing amongst London hostels), security is excellent and it's above a lively pub and in the heart of Brixton/Herne Hill, with great rail and bus connections, food and nightlife all around and even a lovely park two minutes away. Great staff, interesting people. Recommended!

name: Hootananny Hostel
reviewtext: I was stolen 300 euros last week. Hostel is cool but be careful.

name: Hootananny Hostel
reviewtext: Loved this place. Best time I've had in London. Good vibes and excellent company

name: Hootananny Hostel
reviewtext:
Quite small and simple hostel and very hot in hot weather. No air conditioning. 

The atmosphere could have been better. Lot of noise from downstairs. 

Someone stole my food from the fridge which was not nice.

name: Hootananny Hostel
reviewtext: More of a half way house than a hostel. Many of the people there permanent residents with what seemed to look like substance problems. The staff member who collected me from the entrance brought me into the pitch black pub and locked the door behind me, without explaining he was taking me to the hostel. I felt incredibly unsafe as a solo female traveler, and lasted 3 hours before cancelling my stay. They did give me 50% of my money back though. I don't like writing bad reviews but needed to warn

name: Kensal Green Backpackers
reviewtext: Our room wasn't ready, they eventually moved us in to an alternative room which was VERY dirty, discarded cigarette on the floor, visible grime on the floor the room was full of flies and stunk of smoke. We complained but were told they had no alternative rooms. Luckily we were only there one night. The only positive was the location which is good & it's quite cheap for London. Wouldn't stay there again.

name: Kensal Green Backpackers
reviewtext:
The atmosphere is DIRE, the staff give off an air that they don't care, you have to pay for a towel AND for bowls to eat out of. 
The door to my room could only open a quarter of the way meaning every time someone wanted to come in with bags, they got stuck- this is a FIRE hazard.

The whole hostel has the feel of a c***k den with shady characters and less than adequate ventilation. I wouldn't stay here again if you paid me!

name: Kensal Green Backpackers
reviewtext:
I booked a shared room and the first night I was in there with 3 men who were probably about 45+. I'm a lone 22 year old female so it was a little awkward. There was a massive rainstorm while I was there and the kitchen flooded so they couldn't cook food. There were buckets all over the staircase. 
But the cafe downstairs was good and wifi worked reasonably well. Also super close to the underground

name: Kensal Green Backpackers
reviewtext: DO NOT STAY HERE. This was the worst hostel I have ever stayed at. I was in a private room by myself and at 2am in the morning, while I was sleeping, some guy who worked at the hostel CAME INTO MY ROOM. He claimed to be "checking to see if the previous guests had left", but at 2am in the morning after I had already checked in? WTF? As a young, solo female traveler this was my worst nightmare. I was refunded the money for the night but then my shoes were stolen from my room while I was away.

name: Kensal Green Backpackers
reviewtext:
The toileta weren't working and the shower was broken. 
Good atmosphere

name: Kensal Green Backpackers
reviewtext: I didn't enjoy my stay here, I felt uncomfortable the whole time and the facilities weren't amazing. The wifi only worked in the common area and there was no aircon. While the shared toilets were clean, there was a tiny shower squished into the room giving you no privacy at all. The rooms were tiny with too many beds, and there was no security - no one locked the doors and there were no lockers provided. The common area only opened at 9am, which wasn't helpful if you needed to get up earlier.

name: Jaeger Acton Hostel
reviewtext: I so enjoyed my recent stay at Jaeger Acton! As a lot of other reviewers have commented, Jaeger Acton is not your traditional hostel (or maybe its the most traditional kind?) because its actually a few rooms above a local pub. It's off of High Street- kind of a main road through Acton- so there are a lot of nearby shops, restaurants, and cafes. The best part about it though is that its truly an authentic experience. Rooming above a local pub within a laid back suburb of London was awesome!

name: Barkston Rooms
reviewtext: 4 Private Bedroom Bathroom shared booked, but there was 4 bunk beds and one was taken and no plugs (room under construction) We asked a staff member and he tried his best to find a PRIVATE ROOM and apologized (booking system issue). He found a private room but with the bathroom at the end of a long corridor (which smell weed) . Toilets and showers  were DISGUSTING (pee smell in the shower) and in the room the sink was blocked and we couldn't locked the window. Wouldn't recommend this place.

name: Barkston Rooms
reviewtext: This was the worst hostel I've stayed in. Do not stay here. It is a construction site and the staff are very rude. Filthy facilities and open wires next to beds. This place shouldn't be allowed to be listed and advertised the way it is. A total rip off.

name: Barkston Rooms
reviewtext: It's o.k  but nothing special about this hostel apart from its location.

name: Barkston Rooms
reviewtext: Toilets stunk of p**s and s**t same as the shower , the staff was slow with the check in , bed was unstable ðŸ˜‚ felt like it was going to collapse but they were really comfy

name: Barkston Rooms
reviewtext: Very few small lockers on first floor but over all clean and nice place

name: Barkston Rooms
reviewtext: This is not a hostel, it's a construction site. Everything was dirty. The hostel double booked my room. I was left with NO ACCOMMODATION in the early hours of the morning when I returned from my day in London. No apology from the staff. DO NOT STAY HERE!

name: Barkston Rooms
reviewtext: Unorganised but great location

name: Barkston Rooms
reviewtext: Don't be fooled by the modern entrance, the rooms are sub par in comparison. Kitchen/breakfast under maintenance, couldn't even fill up a water bottle. Had to change rooms because of the noise from maintenance, not to mention the dust everywhere. What a hassle. Value for money is not great and not up to standard of other hostels around these days. Look elsewhere.

name: Barkston Rooms
reviewtext:
It's the shittiest place I've ever been. In every aspect.
Unorganized, unfriendly, not clean.
I had to move every day from one room to another, because they couldn't figure out their own system.
At the second day I came to my room and all my stuff was gone! They took all my stuff and put it away in the basement.
I had to get my stuff and go to another room, which was already full. Then they sent me to another room, which was full
as well and the male staff member waked the four girls at 2am

name: Barkston Rooms
reviewtext: Sadly no lockers in the room! No Wi-Fi either.

name: Barkston Rooms
reviewtext: Great location. Hostel lacked energy and atmosphere

name: Blue Skies Hostel
reviewtext: This was only a short overnight stay for me, however, I would not hesitate to return again one day. Staff were friendly and very helpful. Location was great, literally right next to the train station. I loved the atmosphere of the pub (below the hostel)! Would defiantly recommend the Railway Tavern to my friends and family who find themselves in south London.

name: Blue Skies Hostel
reviewtext: This is only better than sleeping outside. Well, it's more noisy (ground floor is a bar until 2 AM) and not cleaner. There's a strong humidity smell on the whole floor and many bug traps inside the bedroom on the carpet floor. Flies will greet you when you arrive. It's not more secure either since there are no locked doors (that's right, anybody can get upstairs and into your room at any time) and no staff for security. homemade lockers to lock stuff are OK. Go there if nothing else is available

name: Blue Skies Hostel
reviewtext:
It's over a pub so on the weekends is very noisy, specially on the weekends. I didn't have any problems with security but when I arrived a roomate was complaining with the staff because customers from the bar went upstairs (where the rooms are) and were disturbing. 
They have a small kitchen and provide some things for the community like toast and coffee, but generally is a little messy.
You get what you pay for. It's a lil bit far but right next to the train station, so it's easy to get there.

name: Blue Skies Hostel
reviewtext: Very cool location, friendly staff, public transport right outside the door! Cleanliness should be improved (check and clean rooms daily!) to make it one of the top value for money hostels in London.

name: Blue Skies Hostel
reviewtext: The staff are amazing and they provide for breakfast and snacks. Anytime you feel hungry, the is something in the kitchen to eat.

name: Blue Skies Hostel
reviewtext: To say the true, stuff sometimes is rood. But location is good, and place is very social. It is for tourists who love parties - hostel is on the bar with alive and all types of cool musics until 2-3am. There are many nice parks around, one is large with open air swimming pool . Shower is good : hot and cold. Internet is good.

name: Le Junction Hostel - Pub & Garden
reviewtext: Better than sleeping in the street. Had hot water. Did not rain inside.

name: Le Junction Hostel - Pub & Garden
reviewtext: Disgusting, but the cheapest option on this area , a little bit better than rouge sleep

name: Le Junction Hostel - Pub & Garden
reviewtext: Really pleasant surprise. Place was really clean and my room looked fresh. Thank you to the receptionist for good advice what to see and where to go.

name: Le Junction Hostel - Pub & Garden
reviewtext:
Hell.

I was in that hostel only for one day.
In short, I would be staying again.

Thank you

name: Le Junction Hostel - Pub & Garden
reviewtext: Fantastic Hostel. would recommend to anyone of my LGBT friends. Trans friendly and inclusive. Staff are helpful and respectful.

name: Le Junction Hostel - Pub & Garden
reviewtext: When I got in at 8pm, my room was not ready yet and they needed to wash the sheets to make the bed (not sure why this wasn't done in the morning or afternoon). They told me to come back three times for a towel and they never had one available before check-out. It's far from the center of London but it is one of the cheapest hostels in London. There was a strange smell and was not very clean. The kitchen was a mess and the sink was leaking. I would not recommend anyone to stay in this hostel.

name: Le Junction Hostel - Pub & Garden
reviewtext: I knew that hostel is quite cheap but I didn't expect something like that. Staff was not helpful, and they didn't really care about customers. Hostel was dirty and smelled bad, room was really small with 3 bunk beds, so it was really hot during the night. No lockers. No fan in the room. Really dirty toilet. When we came to the room at 21:00 beds were not ready, with old dirty sheets and I had to ask to make beds for us. Disaster...

name: Le Junction Hostel - Pub & Garden
reviewtext: It's even better and saver to sleep on the street than to sleep here!

name: Le Junction Hostel - Pub & Garden
reviewtext: Disgusting. Feels unsafe and so unclean. We had someone else's stuff in our room on arrival, food laying around, dirty sheets room hadn't been cleaned. We are students and we are pretty chill about going anywhere but all I can say is don't go here. As soon as we got there we decided to find elsewhere to stay because we just didn't feel safe there.

name: Le Junction Hostel - Pub & Garden
reviewtext: Dirtiest hostel in london with no facilities not even lockers in rooms, shady location and overall terrible. Not recommended!

name: Le Junction Hostel - Pub & Garden
reviewtext: Mateeeeeee!! Worst hostel in the world!! Don't put yourself through that horror. Trust me

name: Chester Hotel Victoria
reviewtext: I believe that a member of staff working there was breaching confidentiality by communicating with third parties about me.

name: Chester Hotel Victoria
reviewtext: Double-check you know what your reservation is

name: Chester Hotel Victoria
reviewtext: This hostel was fine for a one night stay. The room was cramped, and even though we had our own bathroom it was very small and the toilet water ran continuously. The bed was comfortable. The staff were efficient but not very helpful or welcoming. The hostel is located close to underground stations which is very convenient for getting around London.

name: Chester Hotel Victoria
reviewtext:
I stayed in the private single with the ensuite. Small, but clean. No soap at the sink, luckily I had my own.

Alright location to the bus station and train station (10 minute walk).

Staff were excellent

name: Chester Hotel Victoria
reviewtext: Good stay if you want to explore greater London. Not really close to Victoria station but you have to struggle to find the place if you are the first timer.

name: Chester Hotel Victoria
reviewtext: Rooms were very small for the 3 of us. Felt like another bed had been added to a one bedroom room

name: Holland House
reviewtext: Holland house location is very convenient. Every day rooms were cleaned. I would definitely go back.

name: Holland House
reviewtext: Lovely welcome - thank you!  The room was fine, the price was amazing for Central London.

name: Holland House
reviewtext:
I would recommend HostelWorld to friends !

The only incovenience was that the lockers for the wardrobe didn't work. So I was anxious about my stuff in the 3-bed dormitory.

name: Holland House
reviewtext: This hostel has a perfect location - right beside Victoria london train station and about 10-min walk from Westminster Palace! Showers and toilets were not the best, but they do the job. Staff are lovely. Breakfast is provided which is handy!

name: YHA London Earls Court
reviewtext: Room much better than previous stay. Had room to put out toileteries etc. As per above ratings overall excellent

name: YHA London Earls Court
reviewtext:
I found it a good hostel. The facilities were clean and the atmosphere was nice, quite tranquil, but it wasn't the typical hostel sphere, it was more of a familiar hostel (I don't think I'd choose it if I was backpacking and wanted to meet new people). Everyone minded their own business and didn't quite care about other people. 
It's near Earl's Court tube station, which is extremely handy, and it's a nice neighbourhood.

name: YHA London Earls Court
reviewtext: We enjoyed our stay at the YHA London Earls Court. The facilities were nice and the location was perfect: on a nice quiet street, but just a few blocks from the underground. Easy access to Heathrow. The only issue was that the WIFI was down the whole time we were there (from evening to the next morning), which was problematic as I was needing to make travel plans and let my family know that I had arrived safe at my destination.

name: Heathrow Hostel
reviewtext: I booked this hostel with low expections comparing to other hostels. But I didn t expect it would annoyed me like this. I booked this room because the hostel was closed to the Heathrow airport, because my flight was at 6am. The Heathrow Hostel was loud, because of the bar downstairs. They turned on the music till 3am in the morning. So I didn t sleep, plus I have seen bedbucks on my bed which was the most disgusting thing I have seen so far. It would worth more to sleep at the airport!!!

name: Heathrow Hostel
reviewtext: I am just writing this review to make sure that if someone is wanting to have a good night rest before their flight out this is not the place. No fans or aircons and not the cleanist. People fighting outside till all hours of the morning. Went to the bar to get a drink and one of the ladies behind the bar was too busy having shots with customers and talking to them to serve me. Overall bad experience.

name: Heathrow Hostel
reviewtext: Rooms are very small. Hostel is very dirty and dingy .no lockers. No ventilation. I would suggest sleep in the airport than spending money in this hostel . I would never ever go to this place again .

name: Heathrow Hostel
reviewtext: i would like if management spoke with their male staff to insure that there will be no men in the female only rooms before check out.  ESPECIALLY the men that work there.

name: Heathrow Hostel
reviewtext: As a woman traveling I would not recommend staying here alone. If you do, please request an all girls dorm. The hostel was extremely filthy, the staff were unprofessional and there were SEVERAL creepy men.  While I stayed here I did not feel safe or comfortable however the women in my dorm were very nice. For one night it should be fine, but longer than that I would not recommend it.

name: Heathrow Hostel
reviewtext:
Booked for somewhere to stay for the eminem concert with low expectations based on price. Were purely there for somewhere to lay our heads.  

Was pleasantly surprised, staff were accomodating and extremely helpful - we made a mistake with our booking and had booked one less person than needed but they sorted us out with no extra charge as they had a free bed.  If we hadnt they were fine with top and tail or sleep on floor with mattress.  

Recommended and great value for money!

name: Heathrow Hostel
reviewtext: I read the reviews of this hostel and was kind of worried. The negative was there was no AC in the room. The  staff said something about the windows open but if you have people in there you might not be able to feel the breeze. It was hot in there though and hard to get to sleep.  Good thing though is the beds have a flash drive to plug into as well as a plug. The food downstairs and the pub where excellent and fun. If you looking for a fast place to get a place to stay then that is the place.

name: Heathrow Hostel
reviewtext: I wasn't aware it was going to be over a bar or that there would be no AC in the 30 degree weather. Also the wifi was very poor and only worked outside in one spot.

name: Heathrow Hostel
reviewtext: It was not very clean. Some of the bathrooms were not stocked with toilet paper or soap to wash your hands.

name: Heathrow Hostel
reviewtext: Upstairs of a loud bar with loud people outside the bar when the windows are open. Dirty facilities, but guy at desk was kind. Would not come here again if I had other options.

name: PubLove @ The Great Eastern, Greenwich
reviewtext: I've stayed here before and I will certainly be staying again. This is a superb no frills hostel at an extremely reasonable price in a lovely and overlooked part of London. What's not to like? Highly recommended for anyone who likes something just a little different.

name: PubLove @ The Great Eastern, Greenwich
reviewtext: Overall the hostel was safe, very quiet, and tame. The staff were amicable and gracious enough to let us keep our bags in the luggage room for about 12 hrs after our stay. The pub was quite decent. Craft options and locals kept us stopping in for a night cap before bed. You do sacrifice on beds and showers. We rarely got warm water and it was a confusing system for an ignorant American. Good for a few nights but not great for an extended stay. Thanks for playing Pink Floyd

name: PubLove @ The Great Eastern, Greenwich
reviewtext: Staff were fantastic. Lovely bunch of people.

name: PubLove @ The Great Eastern, Greenwich
reviewtext: The hostel was disgustingly dirty, toilets needed to be cleaned and the shower was cold. It was so bad I didn't even stay I went and got a hotel elsewhere. My friends who did stay only did so because they couldn't afford to go elsewhere. This place needs to be closed and deep cleaned maybe even have the bathroom referbished before reopening. Reports from friends said the mattresses were old and uncomfortable so much so you could feel the springs digging into your back.

name: PubLove @ The Great Eastern, Greenwich
reviewtext: Kind staff but mold in the bathroom,  dust in the bed rooms, wholes in the bedsheets and the mattresses from the 80's - you could feel every spring in these old spring-beds - it was very affordable though....

name: PubLove @ The Great Eastern, Greenwich
reviewtext: This is by far the most disgusting hostel I have ever stayed at, and I've travelled a lot.  The building is absolutely filthy and the back hallway (entrance to the hostel) stinks like urine.  The bathrooms themselves were filthy as well with urine all over the floor as well as water from the showers.  The two toilets in the main floor bathroom did not work for the entirety of my stay, and were often filled with vomit and over flowing.  The bathroom has the largest nest of cobwebs I've ever seen

name: PubLove @ The Great Eastern, Greenwich
reviewtext: I would strongly recommend against this hostel. The staff are friendly and the location is pretty good, but beyond that it's an incredibly unpleasant place. Unhygienic bathrooms (unflushed toilets sometimes literally overflowing), incredibly uncomfortable beds, stained threadbare carpeting in the hallway, and lingering unpleasant smells in the dorms and the stairwell. A Dickensian, dilapidated wreck.

name: Acacia Hostel
reviewtext: You get every get way more than you pay for

name: Metro Hotel
reviewtext:
The room had no curtain/blinds which made it incredibly hard to sleep and to have any privacy.

I was promised that the blind would be fixed the second day, that the manager/owner had been asked multiple times. Didnt happen.

Mattress desperately needs to be changed, worn out and very uncomfortable.

Staff member Freddy was very friendly and helpful. Unfortunately he couldnt solve the issues as there needs to better a higher level of property maintenance.

name: Metro Hotel
reviewtext: When booking online, I requested an early check-in. On arrival, I was told that they didn't accept early check-ins despite the website's saying otherwise. All g, I could leave my bags in a corridor with the staff. After returning at 2pm, I was told that there was an issue with my room and needed to be moved to a different hotel a few blocks away. The receptionists helped carry my bags which was nice. The new hotel was old and only one toilet in the complex, but it was a lovely vintage vibe.

name: Northfields Hostel
reviewtext: Not what expected, but it was nice. Toalets on different floors, and someone was always slapping their doors, but stuff was really nice. ~30min from center.

name: Northfields Hostel
reviewtext: It's a very cheap hostel for London and for booking very last minute. Aside for that, the place is pretty dirty (aside for clean duvet sheets)- bathroom, kitchens and corridors are not the cleanest, there were loads of flies when we were there. There is someone at the reception but they don't ask for your room number when entering and there is no swipe key so virtually anyone can enter the place any time.

name: Northfields Hostel
reviewtext: I stayed here one night because of an overnight layover at Heathrow. For a one night layover stay, this hostel was cheap and accessible, which I appreciated. However, it was not very clean and there was no toilet paper in the bathrooms. For a longer stay in London, I would not recommend it.

name: Northfields Hostel
reviewtext: fab place for the money you get a  very soft bed  we  would say bring your own cup plates and cutlery as there is not a lot in the kitchen .  the showers are loo sink shower all in one and there 3  for the ladies only and 3 for the men there are men only in basement and there was 2 showers on our floor that was shower only .  we sat out in landing and every one was lovely . around 10 room are people that live there .  looks like a old office block on the outside but ok for what we payed

name: Northfields Hostel
reviewtext:
I needed to stay at this place for one night.
Right in front of the station, this place is located.

The reception staff was reluctant to give me Â£10 cash back in return of the security card key on my departure.
As I did not handover my photo ID, Â£10 should be automatically returned.

name: Heathrow Lodge
reviewtext: I did not stay there I tried to counsel with Heathrow lunch they told me they would cancel and not charge me but they have charged me and I did not stay there this is disgusting please put money back into my credit card

name: Heathrow Lodge
reviewtext: The Only good thing about this place is the location. As a solo female traveller, I did not feel safe.

name: St George Hotel
reviewtext: Very close from Paddington Station and lots of tourist attractions..  and I liked the shower room and the toilet.. ^^

name: St George Hotel
reviewtext: WiFi didn't work. The room is extremely small.

name: St George Hotel
reviewtext: The single was quite small but excellently priced.  There was a sink in the room and the toilet was close by.  I only had a short stay so I didn't use the showing facilities.  Breakfast was more than sufficient and delivered to the room.  Amenities included a kettle and tea supplies, television with remote (Freeview, I think), hair dryer, safe, shower gel.  The room was very quiet and because this is a heat wave there were two desktop fans which kept the temperature down.

name: Enrico Hotel
reviewtext: The single room is so small that it's not liveable . The bed almost fell apart beneath me.  The walls were paper thin and you could hear every single sound. The shower is tiny!!!!!!!  And three floors up the stairs!!!!  No ac or any type of fanning . The window wouldn't open more than an inch. The rug was dirty and the minute I got there, I packed my things and left.  It was impossible to stay a solid 5 hours there, let alone a full night.  Overall,  terrible experience and very expensive.

name: Enrico Hotel
reviewtext: Bathroom door was Broken. No where to place soap and shampoo in shower; had to put stuff on top of toilet and open shower door each time I needed it. Good location. Very friendly staff.

name: Hotel Bluebells
reviewtext: I know this is a budget hotel, but I have been to budget hotels in great London locations with better facilities than this. The room safe didn't work. The toilet would sometimes not flush. Breakfast was terrible. There were no door signs to indicate if I wanted privacy - so if I wanted to sleep in I'd be bothered by staff. Some guests got locked out after midnight and tried to call the number posted on the door but couldn't get through, so started making a racket and woke up the whole buildin.

name: Hotel Bluebells
reviewtext: The hotel was very nice! We had an amazing trip and stay in london, I would recommend this hotel not necessarily to a family but to a couple. It's small but very familiar, you feel like your at home. The staff was very friendly!

name: Hotel Bluebells
reviewtext: Lovely little hotel in an amazingly beautiful neighbourhood. I think location is the best attribute of this b&b. The breakfast isn't the best. It has no lift and no AC but apart from this, the rooms and cleanliness are of higher quality than I expected.

name: Marble Arch Inn
reviewtext: We had a private room on the 2nd floor. WOW WAS THIS ROOM HOT!! The first night we were there, we had to wet our towels to put on our bed because we couldnt sleep nor breath, it was that humid. The room was far too small that we were tripping over our beds & had no where to put our luggage. The window only opened 5cm. The staff were reasonable when voicing our concerns. They managed to unscrew the window to open & let air in, by this time it was a little too late. Not worth the price tag.

name: Marble Arch Inn
reviewtext: Had a fantastic stay! Would definitely return. Restaurants near by, walking distance to Hyde park and a short taxi to all of the wonderful sights. Will stay here again when we return.

name: The Ambassador Heathrow Hotel
reviewtext: About a 3 min walk from Feltham train/bus station so that's a huge plus for anyone coming in from Heathrow airport. The hostel was also one of the quietest places I've stayed in- didn't meet any fellow travelers but then again I only stayed here one day. Optional breakfast and dinner were offered at an additional cost. Overall, the place had a cute and comfy layout.

name: The Ambassador Heathrow Hotel
reviewtext: The room I stayed in was a tad on the small side (the hideaway), but the bed was clean and comfortable and the bathroom was very nice, albeit also on the small side. For one person with two pieces of luggage for none night, it was the perfect size. The decor had a very refined and cozy feel. The staff was very friendly and the full English breakfast was delicious and hardy. The proximity to the Heathrow airport makes the price worthwhile. Overall, I say this was a very good experience.

name: Sandeman Allen
reviewtext: You get what you pay for. It was a place to sleep, which was really all I needed. But it was pretty noisy, no towels are provided, and the breakfast was not worth it at all.

name: Sandeman Allen
reviewtext: Very friendly staff, fantastic location near Bayswater underground and Kensington Gardens.  Absolute value for money which included breakfast.  Will be staying there again.

name: Sandeman Allen
reviewtext: The place feels a bit old.

name: Sandeman Allen
reviewtext: The building is an old apartment. There was a mountain of garbage in the room. I sweep and collected a full big black garbage bag of rubbish. The showers are like the size of a one liter carton; I constantly hit my elbows. The sinks were about 9 by 7 inches (very small). The street (area) has many hostels; There were altercations outside nightly. Please review the other "Reviews". Had ring to get staff. I only chose this place because of the gym and the cost of logging. I was on a tight budget.

name: Sandeman Allen
reviewtext: Great location in a lovely row of buildings

name: Dean Court
reviewtext: Stayed with my brother in a two bed room for Notting Hill Carnival. The room was clean even so that it was tiny and you could see that there would be time to do some renewals.
