In the end our main concern was the price and therefore it was fine to have no toilet and shower ensuite. For a few days and only for sleeping there it was definitely fine.

name: Dean Court
reviewtext: Good place but be wary. Security is the worst thing about this place. No lockers or place to secure your valuables. My laptop and another person Gear was stolen on my first day. Very misfortunate and I'm sure it rarely happens but it did. Other than that, the place is chill. Bathrooms clean and run nice cold and hot water. Breakfast is fulfilling and good! Bed is okay but WiFi does not reach to the last floor. When connected though, WiFi is strong. The location is great and close to subway/tube

name: Dean Court
reviewtext: This 4.6 rating would be even lower if the location wasn't so good, but it is a good location near Hyde Park. Pros:  Great location, nice staff, clean showers, nice breakfast with sausage, bacon, two eggs, baked beans, and 4 slices of toast. Cons: No wi fi in the rooms, no fans, no screens on the windows (mosquitos) no lockers in the rooms. Unacceptable. This is not 2007. A guy in my room (first time in a hostel) had his expensive camera and new Apple laptop stolen. Management could do nothing.

name: Central Park Hotel
reviewtext: We were in room 608 which had a noisy fan outside the window which kept us awake during the night.  |The room was scruffy and needed a good make over and was not particularly.  The kettle wire when plugged in only just  reached and the plug was not adjacent to the fixed unit that the kettle was on so was to my mind dangerous.  The window in the bathroom was cloudy and moldy.  TV Ariel kept falling out of the socket and needed replacing every time someone walked across the room as it came out.

name: Tony's House Hotel
reviewtext: this hotel needs much improvement! I was horrified with the room . Wallpaper peeled off the walls mould behind wallpaper damp smell. I complained and instead of giving me another room they charged me more for another room. Don't book this place it's a complete let down !!

name: Barry House
reviewtext: No air conditioning in the whole hotel. Shower curtain had mold on it. The beds were horrible. And you felt the old springs in the mattresses. Do not use the laundry service!!! I had a new shirt with a bleach stain on it. Worst hotel I have ever been in!!

name: Hyde Park Court Hotel
reviewtext: The front desk staff was great and very welcoming and pleasant! They even upgraded my room for a few nights for free! The kitchen staff was rude and not welcoming, breakfast was pretty uncomfortable. The place is a bit dated in decor which put me off at first, but it was very clean and and to enjoy the retro charm. Great water pressure for showers and great wifi. I would go back!

name: The W14 Hotel & Bar
reviewtext:
By far, THE best we stayed at during our 7 country, 14 day honeymoon backing through Europe!  I expected more from breakfast, but there was plenty of food.  I think this was just due to the quality of everything else about this property.

The gentleman who checked us in, and who happened to be there to say goodbye, really gets it. Though I don't recall his name, this guy understands the value of good attitude and service in the hospitality industry. Kudos to you and your team, Sir!

name: Euro Hotel Hammersmith
reviewtext: A very handy location to both Hammersmith & Shepherds Bush underground stations. Breakfast was buffet with cooked options. Small breakfast room so a bit squeezie. The rooms are ensuite, tv, kettle & tea making facilities, nice towel & toiletries. Hot weather meant windows open, not air conditioned but comfortable nevertheless. I was very comfortable & felt it perfectly adequate & good value for money. I would come again.

name: Arinza Hotel
reviewtext:
Booked a twin room, got a double. Not our problem as the mistake happened in the conversion from hostelworld to our system, was the reply from the staff. If you don't like it you can book somewhere else. 

Mold in the room. 

Glad we only needed to stay for one night. 

Bed was good though.

name: Beaconsfield
reviewtext: Afternoon. 1st of all. My booking wasn't at the hotel. No name r booking reference number. I demand a full refund.  I tried to call . No ans. Called the hotel. They were fully booked with out my name present. Outrageous. Please call me. R I'm going to make a full complaint against this Site.

name: Beaconsfield
reviewtext: I booked this hotel due to its proximity to Finsbury park where me and a friend were seeing a gig.  We arrived at the hotel and paid for the room, were then told the key to the room was broken (why they didn't have a spare key I have no idea!) We were told to wait 15 minutes, we assumed for a spare key to be brought to us but the employee had booked us a taxi and a room in a separate hotel in a not very friendly looking area 40 minutes walk away from the gig venue. Bad experience.. very bad....

name: Leinster House
reviewtext: There was not a clean toilet or working shower room. Non of the locks in the room worked

name: Surtees
reviewtext: Unpleasant stay and no extras. Charged 1â‚¬ to print boarding pass! Breakfast only served for 1 hour in the morning, so we only had 2 of 6 that we were entitled to as our flight out was before that. Really silly- it was basically toast and fruit. We had a family room... in the basement, and it felt like it.  I'm not certain the carpet, thrown over the cement floor, was clean or even dry. Ick! Morning staff complained loudly & bitterly about their jobs the entire time we were there. Terrible vibe!

name: Hanover Hotel
reviewtext: Place was a little pricey for the size of he room in my opinion. Area was quiet and lovely.

name: Royal Hyde Park Hotel
reviewtext:
It was grand as we say in Ireland. The room would have been a bit tight if there had been 4 or us.....but never mind. The staff on duty kind too and very helpful with a taxi etc. Ideal situation for us between Queensway and Bayswater underground stations wch is one of the reasons why I booked with u.

Many thanks,

John Kirwan.
